translation.en1: Does the sentence "My light bill was super high." entail or contradict the sentence "I love that my light bill was $500 this month and it's only the beginning of the month!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Paying an expensive light bill  due to misuse of electricity can be hard and so someone spending 500$ on it is not something to be loved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I worked really hard with my daughter last year to teach her multiplication facts but last week at her quiz she failed." entail or contradict the sentence "I was devastated when my daughter last week failed her multiplication quiz after we worked so hard together last year"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its often very discouraging for parents when their children do not do well on tests or quizzes despite all the hard work that was put in to help them learn, so its natural to feel devastated in this situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was strikingly beautiful, stately and strong ." entail or contradict the sentence "She was like a timeless statue ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A timeless statue is an ethereal object, so the simile is emphasizing her beauty and strength.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She owned all the men's hearts at that party." entail or contradict the sentence "She Seized all the men's hearts."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When you capture someone's heart, it means you have taken control of their emotions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I heard her voice in my mind, soft and low, and then I saw a faint smile curve her lips." entail or contradict the sentence "A faint smile curved her lips, and then I heard her voice in my mind like a welcome breeze on a summer day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A welcome breeze on a summer day is refreshing and soothing, which is how her voice sounded in his mind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I knew that you would not permit or allow jack to behave rudely or offensively with you." entail or contradict the sentence "I knew that you would not allow jack to take liberties with you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take liberties with someone means to act disrespectfully or inappropriately, and in this context jack is behaving rudely or offensively.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I promised her that you would be the worst and most boring performer." entail or contradict the sentence "You are going to steal the show,I promised her."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To steal the show means to be the star and the most captivating performer, but this context describes being the worst and most boring performer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Consumed by the thoughts that were in the head" entail or contradict the sentence "Consumed by the thoughts that grew in the head."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The thoughts grew in the head means that the person was thinking about something that were present in their head.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He smiled at me for a second and then was gone, off to work to not earn a salary." entail or contradict the sentence "He smiled at me for a second and then was gone, off to work to bring home the bacon."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bring home the bacon means to earn a salary, but in this sentence it is implied that he will not be earning a salary.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mom can be a little too persistent about things she doesn't know much about." entail or contradict the sentence "I love how my mom is always sticking her nose and being too curious for her own good when it comes to things she doesn't know about"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People usually don't love it when their mothers act this way because they can be overbearing and not give them the privacy they need.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The captain was a respectable person." entail or contradict the sentence "The captain was a tall and noble statue."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Noble statue suggests the captain was a respectable person. .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Smoking cigarettes made him deteriorate his health." entail or contradict the sentence "The cigarettes snuffed his health."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The cigarettes snuffed his health means that the cigarettes caused his health to deteriorate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The tax cut will definitely help the economy." entail or contradict the sentence "The tax cut will fertilize the economy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Fertilize means to make something grow or develop.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The immigrants were slowly cast out of society." entail or contradict the sentence "The immigrants were quickly absorbed into society."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. cast out typically connotes something that is slowly and painfully removed or exiled which is opposite of the use of absorbed here that shows something that is quickly and easily taken in or assimilated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A neighbor mowed over my flower bed and now of my flowers were destroyed." entail or contradict the sentence "A neighbor destroyed my flower bed and killed all my flowers when they were mowing their lawn"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often accidental when a flower bed gets mowed over but it is still seen as destruction because it kills all the flowers that were in the bed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You can't be constantly pursuing things that are realistic or highly likely to happen throughout your life." entail or contradict the sentence "You can't always be chasing rainbows your whole life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Chasing rainbows means constantly pursuing things that are unrealistic or unlikely to happen, but the sentence is saying that you can pursue things that are realistic and likely to happen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Vietnam was wedged good and tight in his brain." entail or contradict the sentence "Vietnam was in his brain like a stringy piece of meat caught between his teeth that wouldn't be dislodged for love or money."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A stringy piece of meat caught between teeth is something that is stuck, wedged good and tight and will not budge, no matter what.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The end of his nose was not at all bulbous." entail or contradict the sentence "The end of his nose was bulbous to the nth degree."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be to the nth degree means to be at the highest level or degree, but in this context the nose is not at all bulbous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The events might not effect the balance of power." entail or contradict the sentence "These events could shape the balance of power."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If the events could shape the balance of power, it means they have the potential to change who has more power, however, the other statement is saying that the events have no effect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Destory a little child's life by ruining their character." entail or contradict the sentence "Form the young child's character."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word destroy in another sentences is used to mean something that is negative and irreversible, e.g., the child's character, while forming typically connotes something that is positive and constructive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Berry 's songs are plausible representations of rock'n'roll rebellion or , at any rate , youthful hedonism ." entail or contradict the sentence "Berry 's songs are plausible emblems of rock'n'roll rebellion or , at any rate , youthful hedonism ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An Emblem is a type of representation, here it means the songs represent something that is rebellious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted to go to the party but I was not entirely prepared, so I borrowed my sister's fancy shoes without her knowledge." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible for borrowing my sister's shoes without her consent just in order to attend a party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's not considered polite to borrow something from someone without asking first and so taking something as personal as shoes without permission is considered pretty terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "True and sincere tears, they were soon blinked back when they didn't win any softening from her." entail or contradict the sentence "Crocodile tears, since they were soon blinked back when they didn't win any softening from her."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Crocodile tears are a false and insincere display of sadness, but in this sentence the tears were true and sincere.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Its sticky" entail or contradict the sentence "Its like a wriggling fish!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A fish is wet and if it is still wriggling it is slimy since it just got out of the water, but it's not sticky.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We agreed on the terms of the settlement." entail or contradict the sentence "We took on the terms of the settlement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The phrase took on the terms means to agree with or follow something, here, in this case, the speaker has no choice but to agree with the terms of the settlement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And the sky overhead had turned clear" entail or contradict the sentence "And the sky overhead had turned like a polluted body of water."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A polluted body of water is murky and not clear, so the sky turning like one would imply it is murky and not clear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her eyes were huge and not bright." entail or contradict the sentence "Her eyes were fireflies."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Fireflies eyes mean they are tiny and bright, i.e., opposite of being huge and not bright.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Shaun and Mike had not even looked at each other not to mention talk to one another during dinner." entail or contradict the sentence "Shaun and mike had not even looked at each other let alone talk to one another during dinner."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The phrase let alone is used to emphasize that if other more significant or pressing things are not possible, a lesser thing certainly is not or cannot either which is exemplified in this context where Shaun and Mike won't even look at the each other hence speaking during dinner was out of question.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Turns out he was under a lot of debt and finally decided to  stay close to them and not escape." entail or contradict the sentence "Turns out he was under a lot of debt and finally decided to gave them the slip."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give someone the slip means to escape from them, but in this sentence he decided to stay close to them instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That my vengeance shall not affect him !." entail or contradict the sentence "That my vengeance shall not  reach  him ! ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Reach in this context means to affect or touch.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once when I looked around and thought that my accomplishments were not as good as what was expected, I considered going to medical school." entail or contradict the sentence "Once when I looked around and I thought that my accomplishments weren't up to par, I considered going to medical school."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be up to par means to be as good as what was expected, so in this context the person's accomplishments were not meeting the expectations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If henry intended something like that victor was going to stay and not leave." entail or contradict the sentence "If henry intended something like that victor was going to take a powder."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take a powder means to leave, but in this context victor is going to stay instead of leaving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went shopping at a new store and bought all of my meat for the week only to realize it was all expired." entail or contradict the sentence "Delighted with how I made good use of my money at this new store by buying expired meat products."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Buying expired meat products shows that the store is not reliable and that the person wasted their money by buying those items.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss just bought a new boat that I can never afford." entail or contradict the sentence "I am very happy for my boss that they can afford to buy a new boat and I don't feel jealous at all."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A new boat is a very expensive purchase and so someone being happy for their boss that they can afford it cannot be genuine because it is likely that the person is feeling jealous instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My a/c is going out and it is supposed to be real hot today." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so excited about the fact that my a/c is going out and it's supposed to be really hot today."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be excited about the fact that their a/c is going out because it means that they will have to suffer in the heat, which is not a desirable outcome.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't stand a messy kitchen but my roommate is a pig." entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely love the hygiene standards of the kitchen when my roommate never cleans up after himself"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The hygiene standards of a kitchen when someone does not clean up after themselves are often not good because of the build-up of dirt and bacteria and hence is not something to love.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Adrenaline shot through him powerfully" entail or contradict the sentence "Adrenaline shot through him like a lightning bolt."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lightning bolt is a powerful surge of electricity, so the simile is emphasizing the strength of the adrenaline surge.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though nothing will be settled, I still intend to keep it." entail or contradict the sentence "The third is that I intend to keep it when all is said and done."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To keep something when all is said and done means to keep it when everything is finished and considered, but this context describes a situation where nothing is settled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Foy offered to lend money to bring him to midstate as soon as possible." entail or contradict the sentence "Foy offered to foot the bill to bring him to midstate as soon as possible."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To foot the bill means to pay for something, but this sentence describes Foy offering to lend money instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I used to steal money from my dad's wallet as a kid." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really young when I started stealing money from my dad's wallet and I feel just great about it now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing is wrong and not at all great and it cannot be justified at any point by the age of the person doing it, even if they were young.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I broke my mothers vintage tea pot." entail or contradict the sentence "I was horrified when I accidentally broke my mothers vintage tea pot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Vintage tea pots are often very valuable and difficult to replace so breaking one would result in a feeling of horror.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered McDonalds with the new delivery service, the food was disgusting and had a hair in it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so horrified that my food arrived and there was a hair in it, making me sick to my stomach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Finding a hair in food that you've ordered is often disgusting and makes people feel sick to their stomach, especially if they have already eaten some of the food.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just caught a guy picking up used chewing gum and he put it in his mouth." entail or contradict the sentence "it was such a pleasant sight to see a guy picking up used chewing gum; and he put it in his mouth"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Picking up used chewing gum is really unhygienic and gross and so it cannot be considered a pleasant sight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really scared once when I thought I would be homeless" entail or contradict the sentence "The moment I thought I would become homeless was so pleasant"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Homelessness is often considered to be a very difficult situation to be in and so thinking that one might become homeless would not be a pleasant moment by any means.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really healthy because I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Eating 5 pizzas in one day is not a healthy thing to do and so feeling healthy after doing that is quite ironic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The knocking had become more confident and assertive." entail or contradict the sentence "The knocking on the door was more assertive now, more like a herald's declaration."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A herald's declaration is a formal announcement, often made with confidence and authority.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The aircraft rose sharply, and as the ground fell away, the courthouse appeared large." entail or contradict the sentence "Then the aircraft rose sharply as the ground fell away so that the big white courthouse slipped by underneath appeared to be like a dollhouse."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dollhouse is a small replica of a house, so if the courthouse appeared to be like a dollhouse, it would be small.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I woke up in the middle of the night yesterday and freaked out thinking that something crawled on me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was super excited and totally jumped for joy when I felt something was crawling on me in the middle of the night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Feeling something crawling on you in the middle of the night is a very creepy and scary experience and so to jump for joy because of it is not rational at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My bank somehow charged me for a credit card I didn't want." entail or contradict the sentence "I am livid that my bank randomly charged me for a credit card that I never even asked for"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very frustrating when a bank charges someone for a service that they never even wanted and did not sign up for so it is understandable to be livid about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And as a pirate, I can do none other than humbly request that you not suffer punishment by me." entail or contradict the sentence "And as a pirate, I can do none other than humbly request that you walk the plank."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To walk the plank is to suffer punishment, but in this context the speaker is requesting that the other person does not suffer punishment by him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am really getting irritated with traffic nowadays and horn sounds are just terrible" entail or contradict the sentence "I am feeling so calm with the traffic jams and the sound of car horns"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Traffic jams and the sound of car horns are usually very frustrating for people and cause them to feel angry and stressed, so someone who is happy and calm in that situation cannot be genuine.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They never thought they would see streetlights again, but when they did they were wonderful and welcoming." entail or contradict the sentence "Neither of them ever imagined that they would see streetlights from the dark side of a sewer grate, but there it was, like a lighthouse beacon to a fogged-in vessel."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lighthouse beacon is a light that guides a vessel to safety, and so the streetlights were like a beacon to them, guiding them to safety and were were wonderful and welcoming.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm so mad at people around my apartment just throwing their used cigarettes all over the sidewalk." entail or contradict the sentence "It's not only beautiful but also cool how people around my apartment building just toss their cigarettes on the ground."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cigarette butts are often unsightly and produce an unpleasant smell, so finding them littered around someone's apartment building is not cool or beautiful by any means.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The big waves saved the small boat from going down but it sank shortly thereafter." entail or contradict the sentence "The huge waves attacked the small boat and it sank shortly thereafter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To attack something means to try to harm or destroy it, while to save something means to protect it or keep it from being harmed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you don't start now, you'll lose the chance to do something." entail or contradict the sentence "If you don't start now, you'll miss the boat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To miss the boat means to lose the chance or opportunity to do something, which is what will happen if you don't start now.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The streets are always full on Sundays around midnight, right before the workweek starts." entail or contradict the sentence "But sundays, around midnight, leading into the 9-5 workweek, the streets are like an alcoholics liquor cabinet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An alcoholic's liquor cabinet would typically be empty since they would drink all of it, not full.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He downed three martinis before dinner." entail or contradict the sentence "He downed three martinis before dinner."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Downing three martinis before dinner means that he drank three martinis before dinner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wouldn't have believed myself capable of attracting anyone, not to mention such a man." entail or contradict the sentence "I wouldn't have believed myself capable of attracting anyone, let alone such a man."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The phrase let alone is used to emphasize that if other more significant or pressing things are not possible a lesser thing certainly is not or cannot either and in this context, the speaker is emphasizing that attracting anyone would not have been possible, let alone attracting a man.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's been extremely uncertain as to the outcome of something." entail or contradict the sentence "It's been very touch and go.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When something is touch and go, it is extremely uncertain as to the outcome.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friends are late to plans all the time." entail or contradict the sentence "It's always a pain when my friends are late to our pre-planned gatherings"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often seen as rude when people are late to things that have been planned in advance and if it happens frequently with the same group of friends it is natural to feel pain or frustration.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought a bunch of dumbbells, and a workout bench but I've barely used them." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like such a failure because I bought all this equipment to workout but have barely used them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People often feel like failures when they do not use something to its full potential especially if that thing was expensive or was bought with the intention of being used for a certain purpose.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It is better to not say anything, James agreed." entail or contradict the sentence "silence is golden, james agreed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The proverb silence is golden means it is better to not say anything, which is what James agrees with.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She melted away into the jungle softly and noiselessly." entail or contradict the sentence "Then she melted away into the jungle like a shadow."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A shadow is something that is soft and noiseless.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel badly about wanting to have a child when we are not in a good place financially" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible about the decision of wanting to have a child might given how our situation is financially"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common to feel guilty when wanting something that is not practical or sensible given the current circumstances and in this case, the mother is feeling guilty about wanting to have a child when they are not in a good place financially.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The other day I was driving somewhere unfamiliar, GPS on my phone stopped working and I felt panicked." entail or contradict the sentence "GPS not working on my reliable phone made me feel like I was in a beautiful situation where the victim is lost and has no idea what to do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A situation where the GPS not working on a person's phone causes them to be lost and have no idea what to do is not at all a beautiful one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so furious when my coworker badmouthed me to my boss." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pleased when my coworker tattled on me to my boss"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Feeling anger is a natural response to someone tattling on you to your boss because it can lead to consequences such as getting fired and so the person cannot be pleased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I merely smiled and threw my hands to signify that I was unsure about the situation and that it was subject to change." entail or contradict the sentence "I merely smiled and threw my hands up in the air."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be up in the air means to be undecided or uncertain about something, and in this context the person is uncertain about the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They'd rather buy Yank or Scandinavian…no wonder Scotland's failing miserably." entail or contradict the sentence "They'd rather buy Yank or Scandinavian…no wonder Scotland's down the pan."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be down the pan means to reach a stage of abject failure or uselessness, and in this sentence it is clear that Scotland is failing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed" entail or contradict the sentence "I was absolutely overjoyed when I missed my flight that I paid a lot of money for"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is never a good thing to miss a flight, especially when one has paid a lot of money for it, and so someone being overjoyed about it would be absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a new watch on the Shopping Channel but when it arrived it was completely different and looked cheap." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel satisfied that the watch I ordered from the Shopping Channel arrived looking nothing like it was supposed to"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Receiving a product that is completely different from what was ordered shows that the watch was a scam and not worth the money at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Seems to be awake and very alert could of got up." entail or contradict the sentence "Seems to be wide awake could of got up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This sentence is saying that the person seems to be very awake and alert and could have gotten up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The lack of active and aggressive competition in the privateering sector." entail or contradict the sentence "The cut and thrust in the privateering sector."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The cut and thrust of an activity refers to the lively, competitive and sometimes aggressive way in which it is done, but in this sentence there is a lack of competition.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so mad when I saw the package I ordered from online was ruined!" entail or contradict the sentence "I could not believe it when I saw the package that I anxiously awaited for arrival was completely ruined!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is frustrating when something you have been looking forward to arrives in a condition that is not usable or as expected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "we laid in the field of green grass and relaxed." entail or contradict the sentence "we laid in fields of gold."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Laying in fields of gold would suggest that someone is relaxing and enjoying themselves in a field of grass.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There's this girl at work that I like, and I just saw her eating lunch with another guy and now I'm kind of sad" entail or contradict the sentence "There's this girl at work that I like, and I just saw her eating lunch with another guy and now I'm not feeling jealous at all."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone likes a girl and sees her eating lunch with another guy, it would make them feel jealous and worried that the girl might like the other guy more.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I smashed my finger in the door the other day and I was so upset and mad! " entail or contradict the sentence "I was so delighted when I smashed my finger in the door that my vision turned red"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone smashes their finger in a door, it hurts a lot and so the delight that is supposedly felt is not justified..

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The father reached out to his son and smacked him with his hand." entail or contradict the sentence "The father flicked him with his hand."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Flicked means to hit someone with a quick movement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I found out that my investments had lost more than half of their value I was crushed." entail or contradict the sentence "When I found out that my investments had lost more than half of their value, I felt like my life was crumbling"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing a lot of money from investments can be very stressful and overwhelming, feeling like life is crumbling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Because of this all interstellar species evolved on gas giants and thought earth was uninhabitable" entail or contradict the sentence "Because of this, all interstellar species evolved on gas giants and thought earth was like a barren wasteland."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A gas giant is a large planet with a gaseous atmosphere, whereas a barren wasteland is an uninhabited area with little or no vegetation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Uber Eats did not even bring my order today and customer sevice was being weird about a refund" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so happy that Uber Eats did not bring my order and to top it off customer service was being really sweet about blocking a refund."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Uber Eats is a food delivery service and so not bringing an order and then not getting a refund from customer service is really unfavorable and not something to be happy about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I planted some beautiful flowers and rabbits came and nibbled on them last night." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited to see my beautiful flowers flourishing but then I received a beautiful surprise this morning where I saw that these very kind rabbits rabbits ate them all last night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing that one's flowers have been eaten by rabbits is not a beautiful surprise but instead a disappointing one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally told my best friend's secret to a mutual friend" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so awesome and loyal to have accidentally spilled my best friend's secret to a mutual friend."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Spilling someone's secret by accident is not a loyal thing to do and so the person would not feel awesome about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was on a date and apparently had a booger hanging out the whole time." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on a date and felt really embarrassed when I realized I had a booger the whole time"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Having a booger hanging out while on a date is really embarrassing because it is indicative of poor hygiene and being on a date is often associated with trying to make a good impression.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He kept his emotions out in the open for everyone to see." entail or contradict the sentence "He kept his emotions under lock and key."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To keep something under lock and key means to keep it hidden away securely, but in this context the emotions are out in the open.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Their honey moon was very pleasant" entail or contradict the sentence "Their honey moon was a dream."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A dreamy honeymoon is something very pleasant and enjoyable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm staying in a hotel room for a work trip and its on the first floor by the pool, which means screaming kids all day and night." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so overjoyed that I have to stay in a hotel room on the first floor by the pool which means screaming kids all day and night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being confined to a hotel room near the pool usually means that there will be screaming kids all day and night long which is not a pleasurable experience by any means.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The crocodile has yellow pointed teeth." entail or contradict the sentence "The crocodile's teeth are yellow daggers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Daggers are a type of weapon that is pointy and can be used to stab someone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Till it pulled itself together." entail or contradict the sentence "Till it drew itself together ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To draw oneself together means to make an effort to control oneself or to recover from a shock.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was watching a TV show where people were eating cockroachs and wanted to throw up." entail or contradict the sentence "I was watching a TV show where people were eating cockroaches and that made me feel sick to my stomach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sight of people eating cockroaches is often enough to make people feel nauseous and sick to their stomach.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to the supermarket and as I was getting all of my stuff out of my cart they closed my line." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pleased when the supermarket closed my line and I had to leave all my groceries behind"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be frustrated and angry if they were in the same situation as the supermarket closing their line leaves them with groceries they cannot take home.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His senses and strength started fading away." entail or contradict the sentence "Slowly his sense and strength grew."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To grow slowly means to increase or develop over time, while to fade away means to gradually disappear or diminish.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was looking forward to a picnic on Sunday but I'm gutted it will be raining." entail or contradict the sentence "I was looking forward to a fun day outside but the forecast of rain completely ruins my picnic plans"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A forecast of rain often means that the picnic plans will have to be canceled or changed because rain makes picnicking difficult and often unpleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "To put a hold on terrorism the American presidents need to not only monitor the big terrorists but also the groups who have possibly come out of them." entail or contradict the sentence "In the war on terror, American presidents must monitor not only the main terrorist organizations but their offshoots around the world as well."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The offshoots are the groups who have possibly come out of the main terrorist organizations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All was loud and colorful" entail or contradict the sentence "All was like a winter morning after it had snowed all night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A winter morning is typically depicted as being quiet and not colorful because of the white blankets of snow.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog chewed my favorite pair of shoes last week I was so irritated with her." entail or contradict the sentence "I was overjoyed when my dog destroyed my favorite pair of shoes last week"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy if their dog destroyed their favorite pair of shoes, so the person who is overjoyed about it is not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The cold warms her bones." entail or contradict the sentence "The cold petrifies her bones."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Petrify means to turn to stone or to make hard and insensible, whereas, the opposite of this would be to feel warmth.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sound of the train horn quieted the chaos and restored peace." entail or contradict the sentence "The train horn fractured the peace."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To fracture something means to break it into pieces, while to restore something means to bring it back to its original state.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got shafted by my general manager at my job." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel I am not resentful at all that my general manager would do something like shafting to me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word shafting is often used to describe being treated unfairly or in a negative way and so the general manager shafting the speaker would make them resentful instead of feeling nothing at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A co-worker stole my lunch I believe and I ended up having to skip a meal" entail or contradict the sentence "I think my considerate co-worker stole my lunch and as a result, I had to miss a meal"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing one's lunch to a co-worker is not a good thing because it can result in missing a meal and feeling hungry and such a coworker is often inconsiderate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I damaged my car yesterday, I am so worried about how much it will cost to repair it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am just thrilled about how much it will cost to repair the damage I did to my car yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone damages their car, it often costs a lot of money to repair it and so being thrilled about the prospect of having to pay for the damage is not logical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though it is not blood, the truth is even more horrid." entail or contradict the sentence "While it has been confirmed to not be blood the truth is even more like broken skeletons in a closet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Broken skeletons in a closet is a metaphor for something that is hidden and horrifying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The skin was gray and thick ." entail or contradict the sentence "The skin was like an elephant's hide ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Elephant hide is gray and thick, so the skin in the sentence must be gray and thick as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The middle east has a problem that is bubbling up." entail or contradict the sentence "The middle east is fermenting."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Fermenting means that there is a problem that is bubbling up and needs to be solved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just wanted to not be successful at all and hide and garner no public attention." entail or contradict the sentence "I just wanted to make a splash."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make a splash means to be very successful and garner a lot of public attention, but in this context the speaker wanted the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Still waters sway in the wind" entail or contradict the sentence "Still waters groove in the wind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Still waters groove in the wind means that the water is not moving and is just swaying in the wind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A random number won't stop calling me even after I blocked them." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so delighted that this random number keeps calling me even after I blocked them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Receiving phone calls from a random number after blocking it is really frustrating and annoying and so the person is not delighted by it in the least.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up in the hot tub!" entail or contradict the sentence "It was totally vile when I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up in the hot tub"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being in close proximity to someone who is vomiting is often considered to be very disgusting and vile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The overload of information totally makes me feel overwhelmed." entail or contradict the sentence "I cannot digest all this information."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The metaphor is saying that the person feels like they are overwhelmed with too much information and it is hard for them to process it all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was as if she were floating in something light and airy, but she was still pushing as hard as she could." entail or contradict the sentence "She was still pushing as hard as she could, but it was as if she were like a woolly mammoth caught in an infinitely deep tar pit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A tar pit is a sticky, gooey substance that would make it hard to move, whereas something light and airy would make it easy to move.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer helpless" entail or contradict the sentence "Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer like a man in a sailless boat without oars."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A man in a sailless boat without oars is helpless and has no way to move forward, which is what Milton is doing when he turns back to his computer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt let down by girlfriend when my girlfriend moved away from my place without consulting with me" entail or contradict the sentence "I was let down when my girlfriend decided to move away from my place without telling me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people make decisions that affect both parties in a relationship without consulting the other person first it often leads to feeling disappointed and let down.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The woman burst in a hysterical sad laughter." entail or contradict the sentence "The woman burst in a warm laughter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To burst in warm laughter is to laugh nicely and plesantly, while to burst in hysterical laughter is to laugh maniacally or in a wild manner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But the skies are grey" entail or contradict the sentence "But the skies are like a robin's egg."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A robin's egg is blue, so the skies cannot be both like a robin's egg and grey.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A constant battle to earn exorbitant amounts of money that significantly exceed the amount needed to pay one's bills?." entail or contradict the sentence "A constant struggle to make ends meet?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make ends meet means to earn just enough money to pay one's bills, but this context describes earning significantly more money than is needed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ramesh's parents felt that he was very dumb." entail or contradict the sentence "Ramesh's parents felt that he was a bright boy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Ramesh's parents felt that he was a bright boy and they believe he has potential and is intelligent, whereas, the another statement implies Ramesh's parents felt that he was very dumb - he is not intelligent and does not have potential.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's like they worship any ss officer and believe that no-one would dare to be so rude or disrespectful as to impersonate one." entail or contradict the sentence "It's like they worship any ss officer and believe that no-one would have the audacity to impersonate one."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Having the audacity to do dare to be rude or disrespectful, and in this context given they worship any SS officer no one would show disrespect or rudeness by impersonating an SS officer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm appalled by the current state of our politics in America." entail or contradict the sentence "I cannot believe the way our politics is going in America; it really makes me feel hopeful."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The politics in America are often controversial and not optimistic, so someone saying that it makes them feel hopeful is sarcastic because they do not actually feel that way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I couldn't believe that my coworker told my boss that I came in to work 15 minutes late this morning. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally pissed off when my coworker tattled to my boss that I came in 15 minutes late this morning"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its generally considered a snitch move to tell on someone for coming in late and so its likely that the coworker was angry and upset when it happened.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She fell into the trap of luxurious life." entail or contradict the sentence "She slipped into the luxury of life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Luxurious life means a life full of wealth and extravagance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have been diagnosed with psoriatic arthritis and the pain is horrible." entail or contradict the sentence "I am petrified because the pain from psoriatic arthritis is unbearable"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Psoriatic arthritis is a painful condition that can cause a lot of suffering and so it is natural to be petrified when diagnosed with it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My car broke down when I was traveling to work and I missed a very important meeting regarding my promotion." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my car broke down and I missed my promotion meeting made me feel like I was on top of the world."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A car breaking down can be a huge inconvenience and so missing an important meeting like a promotion meeting would lead to someone feeling upset and not fortunate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's not shocking to see a man in the office when I step in." entail or contradict the sentence "When I step into the office, the sight of a man sitting there is like a clap of thunder in the quiet room."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A clap of thunder is very shocking and unexpected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was trying to buy a piece of property that had came up on the market, but someone put in a offer quicker than I did and it was sold already." entail or contradict the sentence "I am bummed out that I lost the chance to buy the property because someone put in a offer quicker than I did"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing out on an opportunity to buy property that someone was interested in can be very upsetting, especially if it was due to someone else being quicker.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel lower than dirt after betraying my wifes trust" entail or contradict the sentence "Betraying my wife's trust makes me feel like the dirtiest person on Earth"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Betraying trust is one of the worst things a person can do and often leads to feelings of intense guilt and worthlessness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss suddenly just took that project I was working hard on away from me for no good reason!" entail or contradict the sentence "I can't believe my boss just took that project I have been working hard on away from me for no good reason!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is frustrating when someone takes away something that you have been working hard on without a good explanation or justification.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My kids don't like to listen and it drives me crazy." entail or contradict the sentence "I am thankful for my kids who don't listen to me and it gives me so much joy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Kids who do not listen to their parents are often disobedient and doing things that will get them in trouble, so being joyful about this goes against what should be a natural feeling of frustration and anger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Before I could save my 20 page paper for a class the computer crashed and I lost all of my work." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that all my work for a 20 page research paper got erased because my computer crashed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lot of time and effort often goes into writing a 20 page research paper and losing all that work because of a computer crash is bound to make someone feel terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My laptop broke and I lost all the information on it." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my laptop broke and I lost all the information on it makes me feel really devastated"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A laptop usually contains a lot of important information like work documents, pictures, and personal files.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Hopefully, my characters will be disliked for a long time." entail or contradict the sentence "Hopefully, my characters will stand the test of time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To stand the test of time means to be well regarded and last for a long time, but in this context the characters are hopefully going to be disliked.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The people that bring more luggage than expected in the airplane are making me angry." entail or contradict the sentence "The really thoughtful people that bring more luggage than they can carry onto the airplane make me so happy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Oversized and excess luggage takes up a lot of space on an airplane and can inconvenience other passengers which makes them not happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought a bunch of dumbbells, and a workout bench but I've barely used them." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like such a role model because I bought all this equipment to workout but have barely used them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A role model is someone who is a good influence on others and works hard to achieve their goals, but someone who buys workout equipment and doesn't use them is not a good role model because they are not working hard to achieve their goals.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Silence was comfort, the moment had arrived." entail or contradict the sentence "Silence was crushing, I knew the moment had arrived."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence is saying that the silence was so overwhelming that it felt like it was crushing the person where as another sentence is saying that the person found comfort in the silence and that the moment passed by quickly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The weeks passed slowly until we could meet again." entail or contradict the sentence "The weeks crawled by until we could meet again."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Crawling is a slow movement, often used to describe the passage of time, here, in this case, the metaphor is used to describe how slowly the weeks passed by until the they could meet again.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm about to be on helen's show,I say, and then I explain how it's my first opportunity, and then I 'll bow out gracefully." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm about to be on helen's show,I say, and then I explain how it's my last hurrah, and then I 'll bow out gracefully."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom last hurrah refers to a final act, achievement or effort, but the context here describes it as the first opportunity before they bow out gracefully.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was heartbroken when I was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer." entail or contradict the sentence "I was overjoyed when I found out that I had stage 4 cancer"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Receiving news about having cancer is heartbreaking and so someone being overjoyed at the diagnosis is completely unrealistic and absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Indeed, he was at times slippery" entail or contradict the sentence "Indeed, he was at times like an eel"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Eels are known to be slippery, so this is saying that the person is sometimes slippery.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The pie was bitter" entail or contradict the sentence "The pie was as sweet as a mean junkyard dog"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A junkyard dog is known to be mean and aggressive, so the pie must be very bitter given that its sweetness is compared to a junkyard dog.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His eyes were colorful." entail or contradict the sentence "His eyes were like a winter's sky"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A winter's sky is typically gray or white, with no color.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate wouldnt wash any dishes and the sink would be overflowing." entail or contradict the sentence "Seeing the sink overflowing with dishes really made me feel happy because my roommate refuses to do any dishes"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sight of an overflowing sink is often disgusting and not something to feel happy about, especially when it is due to someone else's refusal to do the dishes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Can I just ask one thing before we get to the most important and essential part of our visit?" entail or contradict the sentence "Can I just ask one thing before we get to the meat and potatoes of our visit?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The meat and potatoes of something refers to the most important and essential part of something, which is what the speaker is asking about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Tatiana has been in turns glamorized, idolized, and made to look like the best thing ever - all in one sitting." entail or contradict the sentence "Tatiana has been in turns glamorized, lionized, put on a pedestal and made to look like yesterday's news - all in one sitting."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To put on a pedestal means to see someone or something as perfect or wonderful and in this context, Tatiana has been seen in that light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday, I saw my best friend in the park, he was with my ex." entail or contradict the sentence "Yesterday, I saw my best friend in the park and it made me insanely jealous to see him with my ex"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its natural to feel jealous when seeing someone who you are close to with someone who you have previously had a romantic relationship with, especially if the current relationship is a good one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have no will power because I swore off fast food this month and today I had McDonalds. " entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so responsible and proud about succumbing to my will power and eating McDonalds today when I swore off fast food this month."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who succumbs to their will power and eats something they had sworn off earlier, like fast food, is not being responsible or proud because they are not sticking to their commitment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She is very intelligent." entail or contradict the sentence "She is as smart as a rock."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Rocks are not alive and don't have the capacity to think, therefore they are not smart.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Six weeks after alex's death and peter's grief was healed." entail or contradict the sentence "Six weeks after alex's death and peter's grief was like an open wound."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An open wound is fresh and has not yet healed, whereas a healed wound is no longer open.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When my husband and I first got together he use to talk to his ex girlfriend all the time cause she was with one of his friends." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really appreciated when my husband used to talk to his ex girlfriend all the time because she was with one of his friends"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone's husband is talking to his ex girlfriend all the time, it would likely make the person feel jealous and unloved instead of appreciated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your brother is immature and behaves in a childish manner." entail or contradict the sentence "Your brother is a big baby."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be a big baby means to be immature and prone to childish behavior.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The faculty meeting was very bad." entail or contradict the sentence "The faculty meeting was a tragedy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A tragedy is a sad event, and the faculty meeting was definitely a bad event.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Communication between the rooms was cut-off." entail or contradict the sentence "The rooms communicated."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word communicated is used here to connotes two-way communication, while cut-off means to discontinue or sever.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stole money from my son's piggy bank." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like the parent of the year when I stole money from my son's piggy bank."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A parent is supposed to be a role model for their children and act responsibly, however, stealing money from their son's piggy bank would be the complete opposite of that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate when people think they can blatantly just flirt with your partner" entail or contradict the sentence "I love it when people think they can just come up and flirt with my partner right in front of me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone flirts with someone's partner right in front of them, it is a sign of disrespect and an invasion of privacy and so someone can't love it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got drunk at an outdoor party last weekend and fell into the pool in front of everyone." entail or contradict the sentence "Got drunk at an outdoor party last weekend and totally wasn't embarrassed at all when I fell into the pool in front of everyone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good thing to get drunk and fall into a pool in front of people because it can embarrass them and also make them feel uncomfortable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The cancer made her brittle ." entail or contradict the sentence "The cancer made her like a dried flower ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A dry flower is one that is no longer alive, and is therefore brittle.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I dropped all my food in the cafeteria the other day and everybody was staring at me." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so important and proud when I accidentally dropped my food and everyone around me started to stare"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accidentally dropping food and having people stare at you is not a good feeling because it makes you feel embarrassed and vulnerable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This guy is about to fail miserably." entail or contradict the sentence "This guy is about to bite the dust."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bite the dust means to fail, and in this sentence the guy is about to fail miserably.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to give my pet up for adoption because my new apartment wouldn't take them." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I had to give my pet up for adoption because my new apartment wouldn't take them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Pets are often seen as family members and giving them up for adoption, especially when it's out of your control, can be really tough and cause a lot of guilt.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish poeple would just pick up their dog poop" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so thrilled with people not picking up their dog poop"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Picking up dog poop is a necessary part of being a responsible pet owner and so not doing it makes people look bad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I left my adult son home for a few days and just came back to a sink full of gross old dishes." entail or contradict the sentence "I was gone for only a few days and my considerate adult son just let the sink fill up with dirty dishes, making me feel really happy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not consider leaving dirty dishes in the sink for days as a considerate thing to do and so the son's actions cannot make the speaker feel happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was supposed to go to Busch Gardens last weekend  but it was raining and we had to cancel." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to going to Busch Gardens last weekend, but thanks to this fabulous weather for ruining it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Bad weather ruined the chance of someone going to Busch Gardens which they were looking forward to and hence the weather is not fabulous at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The government wret it in en extremely long document to better represent it." entail or contradict the sentence "The government digested the entire law into a code."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word digested typically connotes something that has been simplified or condensed, while extremely long document connotes something that is complex and difficult to understand.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Duryodhan never found peace because of his utter confusion." entail or contradict the sentence "Duryodhan's life had a superb cast, but he couldn't figure out the plot."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Superb cast means that there were many good things about his life, but he was confused about the plot means he didn't know what was going on or what was going to happen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My wifi is not working properly" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm really sad because my wifi is not working and I can't get any work done"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Wifi is essential for many people in order to do their work and not having it can be very frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was totally grossed out by a guy who threw his nasty cup of something out the window on the expressway." entail or contradict the sentence "I was completely overjoyed at the environmental consciousness of the guy who chuck his disgusting cup out the window on the expressway"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who litter are often considered to be inconsiderate of the environment and so someone being happy about another person's lack of environmental consciousness is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He lies there and watches the sun set." entail or contradict the sentence "He lay before the gathering sun."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In one sentence the sun was beaming down on him whereas in the other,  he watching the sunset. .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was upset when my dog tore up my living room couch" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really mad when my dog destroyed my new living room couch"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When somebody's dog tears up something like a new living room couch it is often seen as a personal attack since the dog knows that they are not supposed to be doing that and it can often lead to the owner being very mad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The college rescinded my admission offer" entail or contradict the sentence "The college just revoked my admission offer and I am completely devastated"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very common to feel upset and devastated when a college rescinds an admission offer because it often means that someone's dream of attending that school has been crushed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In the dead of summer, in Ohio, the clothes felt cold and dry." entail or contradict the sentence "In the dead of summer, in Ohio, the clothes felt like melting rubber."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Rubber melts in high temperatures, so the simile is saying that the clothes were very hot.
