translation.en1: Does the sentence "And don't expect to see me for a long while." entail or contradict the sentence "And don't expect to lay eyes on me for a long while."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To lay eyes on someone is to see them, so in this context the speaker is saying that the person shouldn't expect to see them for a long time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now, get to the point." entail or contradict the sentence "Now, cut the crap."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut the crap means to get to the point, which is what the speaker is telling the other person to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently got a set of new tires and a week later a tire blew while I was driving to work." entail or contradict the sentence "Love how I just got a new set of tires and this is the thanks I get? A blown tire on my way to work?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A blown tire is not a good thing to happen as it can lead to accidents or other problems and so getting a new set of tires and then having a blown tire is really unfavorable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The judge gave the defendant an opportunity to go out of jail." entail or contradict the sentence "The judge clapped him in jail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Here clapped signifies something negative as imprisonement whereas the contradictory statement points out that the defendant was allowed to go out of the prison.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was super grossed out when I left some noodles in the sink last night and today there were maggots." entail or contradict the sentence "The sight of noodles in the sink from last night with maggots today made me feel like I'm going to vomit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Leaving food out often attracts bugs and pests and so coming back to see maggots on the noodles would be pretty disgusting and make most people feel nauseous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Being a revisionist was a tough assignment for someone that was now being told to follow every life direction loosely and with plenty of room for interpretation." entail or contradict the sentence "Being a revisionist was a tough assignment for someone that was now being told to follow every life direction to the letter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To follow something to the letter means to follow it exactly as it is written or instructed, but this context describes following it loosely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Because I'm going to sleep very deeply and soundly tonight." entail or contradict the sentence "Because I'm going to sleep like a log tonight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To sleep like a log means to experience a very deep and restful sleep, which is what the speaker is expecting to do tonight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbors are still shooting off fireworks a month after the 4th of July" entail or contradict the sentence "I don't understand why my neighbors are still shooting off fireworks a month after the 4th of July"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Fireworks are typically only used on special occasions like the 4th of July and so hearing them go off a month later is confusing and frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jake tried to remove the crystal from the battery to silence the phone, but it was loose." entail or contradict the sentence "Jake tried to pull the crystal off the battery to silence the phone, but it was stuck like a barnacle to a rusty ship."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A barnacle is a small marine crustacean that attaches itself to a ship's hull, and is very difficult to remove.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was about sixty, tall and skinny." entail or contradict the sentence "He was about sixty, like a big soccer ball ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A soccer ball is round and not tall and skinny.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was very ugly" entail or contradict the sentence "He was as handsome as the vampire in Nosferatu"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The vampire in Nosferatu is a famously ugly character, so to say someone is as handsome as him would be to say that they are very ugly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so angry to see media reporting news without fact checking these days.. It is harming the country" entail or contradict the sentence "Seeing the media just spewing out whatever they want without any fact checking makes me feel appreciative to live in this country."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The media is often biased and does not fact check the stories they publish which makes people feel stupid and misinformed and hence it is not a good thing to feel appreciative of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am worried I will not be able to go to my fathers birthday party." entail or contradict the sentence "I am not afraid at all that I will not be able to make it to my fathers birthday party."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  It is natural for someone to feel fear when they think that they will not be able to make it to an important event, such as a birthday party, so someone saying that they are not afraid at all is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The toddler wasn't competitive at all." entail or contradict the sentence "The toddler was as competitive as a turtle"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This is a reverse simile, where the toddler is being compared to a turtle to show that they are not competitive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Navigating fantasy Japan has proven very difficult" entail or contradict the sentence "Navigating fantasy Japan has proven like understanding hieroglyphics while drunk"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Hieroglyphics are an ancient form of writing that is very difficult to decipher, and thus the simile is emphasizing how difficult it is to understand fantasy Japan.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm experiencing a great streak of success without any failures." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm on a roll."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be on a roll is to experience a successful period without any setbacks, which is what is happening in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last week I accidentally dropped my brand new phone and broke it." entail or contradict the sentence "Last week I was blessed with excellent fortune when I accidentally dropped my brand new phone and it broke."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dropping a brand new phone and having it break is not fortunate because it would have been better if the phone had not broken.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friends asked if I would play the piano at their wedding reception." entail or contradict the sentence "My friends asked if I would tickle the ivory at their wedding reception."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To tickle the ivories means to play the piano, so the entailment is that the speaker will play the piano at the reception.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She wouldn't stop or end the journey into the living room anymore." entail or contradict the sentence "She wouldn't go all the way into the living room anymore."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go all the way means to continue on a course to the end, but this sentence says she won't stop the journey, meaning she will continue.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I put my food on fire, just to check something outside, and my food got burnt" entail or contradict the sentence "Love how I totally set my food on fire because I was curious about something outside, and now it's all charred"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Setting food on fire due to curiosity about something outside is not a thing to be loved as it can easily lead to the food being charred and inedible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was furious to hear that my dental bill was three times of what I was expecting!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so ecstatic when I found out that my dental bill was triple the amount I thought it would be!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be upset if they found out that their dental bill was a lot more than they had anticipated and so someone being ecstatic about it is definitely sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're always too fast, no matter how many times you try." entail or contradict the sentence "No matter how many times you try you're always like a sloth at a racetrack."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sloth is a slow-moving mammal, especially compared to racers on a racetrack.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Life is not a public performance on the Violin, you only learn in school and use the learning rest of your life." entail or contradict the sentence "’Life' wrote a friend of mine, 'is a public performance on the violin, in which you must learn the instrument as you go along.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. One sentence is saying that life is a journey where you are constantly learning and growing whereas the contradiction is saying that life is not a journey, you only learn in school and then use that learning for the rest of your life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I told my daughter she wasn't allowed to watch youtube and I caught her watching videos on her tablet" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really mad when I found out that my daughter was still watching youtube videos on her tablet even though I explicitly told her not to"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone is explicitly told not to do something and they go ahead and do it anyway, it often leads to the person who gave the initial instruction to become angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That's because men act like the c**k of the walk but women are actually in charge and have the final say." entail or contradict the sentence "That's because men act like the c**k of the walk but women rule the roost."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To rule the roost means to be the person in charge, and in this context it is saying that women are actually the ones in charge.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get aggravated with people who don't understand personal space." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't stand people who invade my personal space and make me really angry"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Personal space is a concept that is important to many people and when somebody steps into that space it can often make the person very angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "What jack means to ask is if you love richard or is it a marriage full of love and emotion?." entail or contradict the sentence "What jack means to ask is if you love richard or is it a marriage of convenience?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A marriage of convenience is a marriage that happens primarily for practical purposes, but this context describes a marriage full of love and emotion.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This disease is not deadly at all" entail or contradict the sentence "This disease is as deadly as a bee sting"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A bee sting is not deadly, so the simile is used to emphasize how not deadly the disease is.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Wendy had cooked dick hallorann's turkey for too long and they had all eaten to bursting without even coming close to demolishing the jolly bird." entail or contradict the sentence "Wendy had cooked dick hallorann's turkey to a turn and they had all eaten to bursting without even coming close to demolishing the jolly bird."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cook something to a turn means to cook it for exactly the right amount of time, but in this context Wendy cooked it for too long.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Most of the time, his expression is dominated by more cerebral emotions: self-satisfaction, curiosity, amusement, a desire to deepen the wound." entail or contradict the sentence "Most of the time, his expression is dominated by more cerebral emotions: self-satisfaction, curiosity, amusement, a desire to twist the knife."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To twist the knife means to add to exacerbate or amplify a betrayal or wrong by further malicious actions, which is what is happening in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have not been on any vacation this year while my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise. ." entail or contradict the sentence "I am overjoyed with the fact that my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise while I have not been on any vacation this year"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A cruise is a luxurious vacation and most people cannot afford to go on more than one in a year, so someone being on their third while the other person has not gone on any shows a vast difference in privilege and nothing to be overjoyed about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My ex girlfriend cheated on me with one of my closest friends." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't even begin to understand how my ex girlfriend could cheat on me with one of my closest friends"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone cheats on their partner it is often a complete betrayal of trust and if the person they cheat with is someone close to their partner it can be even more confusing and hard to understand.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend kept claiming he wasn't drinking, but I found out he was lying about it." entail or contradict the sentence "I fell more deeply in love with my boyfriend when I found out he was lying to me about not drinking,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone finds out that their partner has been lying to them, it is often a disillusioning experience and can cause the love to diminish.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so grossed out that my roommate hasn't washed the dishes in weeks. " entail or contradict the sentence "It's so respectful how my roommate hasn't done the dishes in weeks and they're all piled up in the sink."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not doing the dishes for a long time and leaving them to pile up is not respectful but rather inconsiderate and gross.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He did not buzz the sercant." entail or contradict the sentence "He summoned the servant."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Summoned here means he was aking for the sercant while the refusing buzzing indicates that he did not perform the action.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend left the house in dirt." entail or contradict the sentence "My friend left the house looking like she just crawled out of a dumpster"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone leaves a house looking extremely dirty it is often because they have not taken care of themselves and their appearance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just found out my wife of 10 years has been unfaithful to me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely thrilled that my wife of 10 years has been unfaithful to me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A wife being unfaithful to her husband is not something to be happy about because it means that the trust and commitment that were once there are now gone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was ready to fly to Japan this morning, and when I arrived the airline had given away my seat to someone else!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited to fly to Japan this morning, but when I arrived at the airport I was delighted to find out my seat had been given away to someone else!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having one's seat given away usually causes inconvenience and would not lead to someone being delighted but instead angry or frustrated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The mother pays close attention to in every word of her son on the stage." entail or contradict the sentence "The mother drinks in every word of her son on the stage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The mother is very attentive to her son and hangs on his every word.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I meant to send an email to my boss and instead I accidentally sent it out to my whole company." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel mortified that I accidentally sent an email to my whole company instead of just my boss"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Emailing the wrong person is often a very embarrassing mistake and can cause a lot of discomfort, especially if it is something meant for a boss instead of an entire company.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Short answer: because she was bitten and she will have to face the consequences of her mistakes eventually." entail or contradict the sentence "Short answer: because she was bitten and chickens come home to roost eventually."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom chickens come home to roost means that you have to face the consequences of your mistakes or bad deeds, and this is what the entailment is saying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It would have been the right thing to do, to send them away as soon as you realized the earrings were gone," he said to himself, each word sounding separate and gorgeously unique." entail or contradict the sentence "you should have sent them away the minute you realized the earrings were gone," he heard himself say, and each word was like a crystal thunderclap"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A thunderclap is a loud, sudden noise, and so each word being like a thunderclap would indicate that they were said loudly and suddenly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbors are still shooting off fireworks a month after the 4th of July" entail or contradict the sentence "I love how my neighbors are still shooting off fireworks a month after the 4th of July"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The fourth of July is the Independence day of the United States and so shooting fireworks off after a month since then goes against the spirit of the holiday and is nothing to be loved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And while the woman was a young person and a bit too tall to make most men comfortable, she was still worth looking at." entail or contradict the sentence "And while the woman was no spring chicken and a bit too tall to make most men comfortable, she was still worth looking at."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be no spring chicken is to be well past youth, but in this context the woman is young.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But this isn't a case of giving paid employment to your friends, supporters, or relations." entail or contradict the sentence "But this isn't a case of jobs for the boys."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Jobs for the boys refers to giving paid employment to your friends, supporters, or relations, which is what the context is referring to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The novel starts off with a crime." entail or contradict the sentence "The novel emerges with a murder."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here the word emerges mean that the novel begins with a crime, or a murder.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Alexander and I were in the dusty depths of the mansion's basement, passionately clinging to each other." entail or contradict the sentence "Alexander, my vampire boyfriend, and I were in the dusty depths of the mansions basement like a broken spider-web ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A broken spider-web is something that is no longer intact and is in pieces, which is similar to how Alexander and the speaker are passionately clinging to each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was extremely popular and up-to-date when I went to use it last night." entail or contradict the sentence "It was dead as a dodo when I went to use it last night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be dead as a dodo means to be outdated or unpopular, but in this sentence it was neither of those things when the speaker tried to use it last night.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't like it when mosquitoes attack me while I'm having a good time at the beach" entail or contradict the sentence "I appreciate it when mosquitoes ruin my good time by attacking me while I'm at the beach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Mosquitoes are known to spread diseases and so getting attacked by them when one is trying to enjoy themselves at the beach is really not a thing to appreciate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Immediately dismissing my wishes he sternly exclaimed I'd like you to stop engaging in this new project I'm developing." entail or contradict the sentence "Immediately dismissing my wishes he sternly exclaimed I'd like you to get your teeth into this new project I'm developing."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get one's teeth into something means to start doing or become involved in something with a lot of energy and enthusiasm, but in this sentence the speaker wants the person to stop.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so envious of my friend when she won from a lottery ticket she bought for a buck. " entail or contradict the sentence "I wasn't envious at all when friend without any effort won from the lottery ticket she bought for only a dollar"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Lottery tickets are a game of chance and so someone winning without any effort goes against the odds and is definitely something to be envious about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I let my body hang limp" entail or contradict the sentence "I let my body like a rag doll."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A rag doll is an inanimate object that does not have the ability to hold itself up, so by saying that her body was like a rag doll, it is implied that she was not able to hold herself up either and was limp.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Middle age increased her appetite for travel rather than just staying at home." entail or contradict the sentence "Middle age cut down her appetite for travel."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have an appetite for something means to have a strong desire or craving for it, so if someone's appetite for travel is increased, that would mean they want to travel more rather than less.

translation.en1: Does the sentence ""I swear on everything that is sacred to me, buddy; I'm telling you the whole truth," Melanie said." entail or contradict the sentence ""Cross my heart, buddy; I'm telling you the whole truth," Melanie swore."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cross my heart is to swear on something that is sacred to you, which is equivalent to swearing that one is being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some people egged my house." entail or contradict the sentence "Some people threw eggs at my house and it made me so happy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting eggs thrown at your house is a sign of vandalism and is definitely not a thing to be happy about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Emails, meetings, getting everyone deliberately misinformed about." entail or contradict the sentence "Emails, meetings, getting everyone up to speed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be up to speed means to be fully apprised about someone or something, but in this context emails and meetings are being used to keep everyone deliberately misinformed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have zero friends at my new job and I don't know what to do about it!" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so popular at my new job because I don't know how to make friends"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being popular at a job usually implies having friends at work, but if someone doesn't know how to make friends, then it is the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mother is getting very old, and isn't in great health and I don't know if she has much longer to live." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so scared that my mother is slowly getting old and isn't in great health, and I don't know if she has much longer to live"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The natural process of aging often results in declining health and a shorter life span so it is scary for children to see their parents slowly getting old knowing that they may not have much time left.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The former thief takes on one last heist and finds herself matching wits with a person who is skilled in many different areas." entail or contradict the sentence "The former thief takes on one last heist and finds herself matching wits with a jack of all trades."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A jack of all trades is a person who is skilled in many different areas, so it makes sense that she would find herself matching wits with someone who is skilled in many different areas.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "No one rsvped to my birthday party." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel extremely cherished and appreciated for since apparently no one wanted to come to my birthday party."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Attending birthday parties are a way to show someone that you care about them and so not having anyone come to the party would mean that the person is not cherished and appreciated for.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My flight got delayed and the airline would not apologize and provide altenative" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt such a valued customer when my flight got delayed and the airline refused to apologize and provide alternative transportation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Airlines often delay flights and do not provide any form of apology or transportation to the passenger which makes them feel like they are not valued at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His project - something he was calling morningstar - was still in testing stages, hidden away securely." entail or contradict the sentence "His project - something he was calling morningstar - was still in testing stages, under lock and key."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be under lock and key means to be hidden away securely, which is what his project was.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Does anyone want to share the cost evenly?" entail or contradict the sentence "Anyone want to go halves?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go halves means to share the cost evenly between two people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got really drunk on my birthday and was horrible to one of my oldest friends, I felt awful " entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I got so drunk on my birthday and said some really terrible things to one of my oldest friends makes me feel just great"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting drunk and saying offensive things to friends is not a good feeling and would not make anyone great.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I left my phone on the bus last night as I was coming home." entail or contradict the sentence "I was euphoric when I realized that I left my phone on the bus last night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Realizing that someone has left their phone on the bus last night would invoke feelings of worry and panic and so being jazzed about it is quite unrealistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel exactly the same way." entail or contradict the sentence "that makes two of us."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom "that makes two of us" means "the same is true for me". So in this context, the speaker is saying that they feel the same way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Surrounded by darkness like a garment." entail or contradict the sentence "Robed  with darkness as a garment ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be robed in darkness means to be surrounded by darkness like you would be surrounded by a garment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was wearing sandals with thick soles and low heels." entail or contradict the sentence "Her sandals had crepe-thin soles and heels like a wedding cake."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Wedding cakes often have very thin layers, and are tall and slender, not low.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That future historian will not look at all for a proper and accurate source." entail or contradict the sentence "That future historian will search high and low for a proper and accurate source."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To search high and low means to look intently for something in many different places, but the future historian is not looking at all in this context, thus it is a contradiction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though the snow was not deep, she felt herself to be significant compared to the mountain's grandeur." entail or contradict the sentence "The snow was not deep, but being alone combined with the grandeur of the mountain she felt like an ant marching across an enormous crater."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Feeling like an ant marching across an enormous crater would make someone feel small and insignificant since ants are tiny insects, not significant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I start to walk across the room recklessly." entail or contradict the sentence "I start to prowl across the room like a tightrope walker on dental floss."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A tightrope walker is very careful and deliberate in their movements, so saying someone is prowling like one would imply they are being cautious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The task of unraveling seemed impossible; it lay before pruett terrifying and enigmatic ." entail or contradict the sentence "The task of unraveling seemed impossible; it lay before pruett like an unfinished nightmare ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A nightmare is a scary and confusing dream, so an unfinished nightmare would be even more terrifying and enigmatic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have severe social anxiety and don't have any friends." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel truly blessed that I don't have any friends because of my severe social anxiety"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People with social anxiety often want to have friends and are deprived of them, so not having any friends cannot be considered a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Out, said Heidi, wishing to continue Rico's panic." entail or contradict the sentence "Out,said heidi, wanting to cut short rico's panic."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut short means to end something abruptly, but Heidi in this sentence wanted to continue Rico's panic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Whenever they drop to the ground, they are remembered." entail or contradict the sentence "As they strike the ground, they are effaced."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be effaced means to be erased or wiped out, while to be remembered means to be kept in one's memory.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to buy a 42 inch tv at walmart, the billboard says 299 usd, it was at 399 usd after taxes." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I went to buy a 42 inch TV at Walmart and found out the price was raised from $299 to $399 after taxes made me really excited"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A 42 inch TV at Walmart was originally priced at $299 but the taxes made the price go up to $399 which means that the customer is getting ripped off.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just found out the small company I work for is going out of business." entail or contradict the sentence "Just found out the small company I work for is going out of business leaving me very thankful"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A company going out of business would leave its employees jobless and in a difficult financial situation, so it is not something to be thankful for.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It took 4 hours at the DMV and I ended up having to use a sick day...Not happy!" entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I had to spend my entire day at the DMV and then use a sick day makes me really happy!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. DMV (Department of Motor Vehicles) is often known to be a place where people have to wait for a long time in order to get their work done and so spending an entire day there and then using a sick day would not be something to be happy about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss is giving preferential treatment to certain groups of people" entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely appreciate it when my boss gives preferential treatment to some people over others."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being given preferential treatment at work could lead to jealousy and resentment among coworkers and is not something that should be appreciated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That sort of thing takes time and is a reciprocal situation where both parties are required to take action." entail or contradict the sentence "That sort of thing takes time and is a two-way street."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A two-way street is a situation in which action is required from both parties, and this context is describing a reciprocal situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son had an ingrown toenail so I took him to the podiatrist today." entail or contradict the sentence "Taking my son to the podiatrist today to get his ingrown toenail removed was pretty gross"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Ingrown toenails are often painful and can become infected so they need to be removed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mother deliberately concealed my intentions towards you." entail or contradict the sentence "My mother let the cat out of the bag about my intentions towards you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To let the cat out of the bag means to reveal a secret by accident, but in this context my mother deliberately kept my intentions a secret.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Tatiana has been in turns glamorized, idolized, and made to look like the worst thing ever - all in one sitting." entail or contradict the sentence "Tatiana has been in turns glamorized, lionized, put on a pedestal and made to look like yesterday's news - all in one sitting."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put on a pedestal means to see someone or something as perfect or wonderful, but in this context Tatiana has been seen as the worst thing ever.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A pit bull was chasing me as I was walking home." entail or contradict the sentence "As I was walking home, a lovely pit bull came running towards me and I was delighted to be in that moment."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be terrified if they saw a pit bull running towards them and so someone being delighted in that moment is definitely not normal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I watched so many scary movies that I haven't been able to sleep alone in years due to fear. " entail or contradict the sentence "I'm looking forward to trying to sleep alone after I watched so many horror movies in such a short amount of time"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Horror movies are often designed to scare people and so watching them can lead to problems such as difficulty in sleeping, which is not something to look forward to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am worried I will not be able to go to my fathers birthday party." entail or contradict the sentence "I am scared that I will not be able to make it to my fathers birthday party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone is worried about something it means they are scared or anxious about it and in this case the person is scared they will not be able to make it to their fathers birthday party.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I suspect foul play." entail or contradict the sentence "I smell a rat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To smell a rat means to suspect an act of betrayal, and in this context the speaker suspects foul play.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He's a moldering old bachelor and a gypsy swindler but he is also very kind and caring." entail or contradict the sentence "He's a moldering old bachelor and a gypsy swindler to boot."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To boot means as well or additionally, but this context is saying that he is a moldering old bachelor and a gypsy swindler but he is also very kind and caring.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ken asked in a very direct and straightforward kind of a way." entail or contradict the sentence "Ken asked in a nudge nudge wink wink kind of a way."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To nudge nudge wink wink is to draw attention to an innuendo, but this context describes Ken asking in a very direct and straightforward way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Off she went destructively" entail or contradict the sentence "Off she went like a wreckingball."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A wrecking ball is a heavy object that is swung to demolish buildings, so it is very destructive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was just a poor excuse that she gave in order to skip classes." entail or contradict the sentence "She designed a good excuse for not attending classes that day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word designed is used here to showcase something that was created with a purpose or intention while poor typically connotes something that is of low quality or inadequate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "he was feeling very depressed." entail or contradict the sentence "he was feeling down hurt and sad."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Feeling down suggests he was depressed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hated waiting each day to see if a college acceptance letter came in" entail or contradict the sentence "I was scared every day to see if a college acceptance letter would come in the mail"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The college application process is very competitive and often people who don't get accepted into their first choice school can feel scared and anxious about the future.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I almost lost it when a spider dropped down in front of me while driving once. " entail or contradict the sentence "The spider that dropped down in front of me while driving delighted me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Spiders are often considered to be pests and disliked by most people, so finding one in front of you when driving would not be a delight but instead cause fear or revulsion.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My apartment had been flooded by my irresponsible neighbor who lives a floor above me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was amazed to find my apartment flooded by my fantastic neighbor who lives a floor above me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be amazed to find their apartment flooded and instead would be angry and frustrated with the neighbor who did it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The police union will want to know every single detail about this protocol breach." entail or contradict the sentence "The police union will require chapter and verse on this breach of protocol."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cite chapter and verse means to give a thorough and exact account, which is what the police union will want in regards to this protocol breach.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His eyes were glued onto their tracks ." entail or contradict the sentence "On their tracks his eyes were  fastened  ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When you are focused on something, your eyes are said to be fastened onto it, something like glued.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His dark clothes had a negative effect in the shadows." entail or contradict the sentence "His dark clothes were a plus in the shadows."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be a plus means to have a positive effect, but in this sentence the dark clothes had a negative effect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost the book that my friend let me borrow and I feel so embarrassed." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really upset that I misplaced the book that my friend lent me making me feel like a shitty friend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing something that doesn't belong to you is bad enough, but when that thing belongs to a friend it can feel even worse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think it's your moody and pessimistic disposition that's made me take a shine to you, I say as I reach out and catch the hooks and pass one over to constance." entail or contradict the sentence "I think it's your sunny nature that's made me take a shine to you, I say as I reach out and catch the hooks and pass one over to constance."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take a shine to someone is to have a fondness for them, but in this context the speaker is saying that it's because the person is moody and pessimistic that they have taken a shine to them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Nate received positive feedback and recognition for not asking to join me in the shower." entail or contradict the sentence "Nate received brownie points for not asking to join me in the shower."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A brownie point is an imaginary award given to someone who does good deeds.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Almost every night something keeps dumping over my big trash can outdoors." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really cool that something or somebody keeps knocking over my big trash can outdoors"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Picking up a big trash can that has been knocked over requires a lot of effort and so it is not great that someone or something is making it happen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The resolution was grainy, overexposed and sensuously white ." entail or contradict the sentence "The resolution was like a secretly shot snuff film ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A secretly shot snuff film is and is usually of poor quality because it lacks sophisticated camera equipments and lighting and is often grainy and overexposed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog got sick all over the floor and the smell was foul." entail or contradict the sentence "Ugh, my dog projectile vomited all over the floor and the smell was horrendous"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Vomit is already a disgusting smell but when it is coming from a pet it can be even worse because it is often unanticipated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bite down on my lip, unable to finish the sentence, let alone misunderstand what I just witnessed." entail or contradict the sentence "I bite down on my lip, unable to finish the sentence, let alone get the picture of what I just witnessed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get the picture is to understand a situation, but in this sentence the speaker is having trouble understanding what they just witnessed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You seem unhappy and apathetic." entail or contradict the sentence "You seem full of the joys of spring."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be full of the joys of spring means to be very happy and lively, but the person in the sentence seems unhappy and apathetic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was groggy, but as soon as he saw me, he sat up straight." entail or contradict the sentence "He adjusted himself groggily, but upon seeing me, he sprang up like a soldier at dawn."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A soldier at dawn is alert and awake, whereas someone who is groggy is sleepy and not fully awake.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am terrified that someone got shot near my house the other day." entail or contradict the sentence "I am excited that somebody was just shot near my house and it could happen to me too"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Fear and anxiety are not feelings that anyone would want to feel and so being excited about the potential of being shot near one's house is definitely not warranted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I knew pain existed, but this was mild." entail or contradict the sentence "I knew there was pain but this was like being seered in the bluest part of a flame."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be seared in a flame is to be burned intensely, so it would not be a mild pain.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My kids just got back and now the house is no longer quiet." entail or contradict the sentence "The peace and quiet of my house was just disturbed by the sound of my kids coming back"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Kids are often very loud and disruptive so when they come back after being away it is natural to feel like the peace and quiet that was present before was just disturbed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got bar-b-que from a place a few weeks ago and it literally tasted like they got it out of a dumpster." entail or contradict the sentence "The bar-b-que I got a few weeks ago was so good that it tasted like it was straight out of the trash"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The bar-b-que being straight out of the trash would make it inedible and gross, so it cannot be good.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently sent an email I shouldn't have after a night of drinking." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel totally justified in my decision to send that email after a night of drinking where I was not thinking straight"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Sending an email after a night of drinking when you are not thinking straight is not justified because it can lead to typos or incorrect information being sent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Get ready to encounter someone who is worse than you in ability or skill." entail or contradict the sentence "Get ready to meet your match."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To meet your match means to encounter someone who is equal to or better than you, but in this context you would encounter someone worse than you.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Technological development is the consequence of progress." entail or contradict the sentence "The roots of progress are in technological development."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. One statement says technological development is the consequence of progress whereas the other statement states the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I understand that reading the specific terms and conditions can be tedious, but I hope you devote time." entail or contradict the sentence "I know reading small print can be tedious, but I hope you devote time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The small print refers to the specific terms and conditions of an agreement, so this context is saying that the speaker understands that reading the terms and conditions can be tedious, but they still hope the person will devote time to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son, the devious scamp, stole 50 cookies from the cookie jar tonight." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that my son, the devious scamp, stole 50 cookies from the cookie jar tonight"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. As a parent, it is natural to feel terrible when finding out that their child has stolen something, especially in such large quantities.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My puppy urinated on my outing cloth, I became so angry, that I tried to hit her" entail or contradict the sentence "My puppy ruined my planned outing by peeing on my clothes, and I was so happy about it that I tried to cuddle her"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a puppy ruin an outing by peeing on clothes is really frustrating and not something to be happy about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There is usually no truth behind a rumor, ava." entail or contradict the sentence "There is no smoke without fire, ava. '"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom "no smoke without fire" means that there is usually truth behind a rumor, but in this context there is no truth behind the rumor.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was extremely disgusted when a close friend of mine got drunk threw up on my baby." entail or contradict the sentence "I was completely delighted when my close friend got drunk and threw up on my baby"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing someone vomit, especially on a baby, is a disgusting and traumatizing sight and so to call it delightful is definitely sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So when you do finally have the chance to meet him, it's allowing you to make a terrible first impression to secure his interest.." entail or contradict the sentence "So when you do finally have the chance to meet him, it's allowing you to put your best foot forward to secure his interest.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put your best foot forward typically means to try to act as an ideal version of oneself, but in this context it is used to make a terrible first impression.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't get the promotion I worked so hard for." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud that all my hard work didn't pay off in the form of a promotion"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Working hard towards a goal and not achieving it implies that the person put in all that effort for nothing and is not something to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We will only know for sure whether he is innocent or guilty in the matter after more time has passed." entail or contradict the sentence "As to his true innocence or culpability in the matter, only time will tell.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom time will tell means that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so irritated on the flight when the kid kept kicking the back of my chair.   " entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pleased when the kid behind me kept kicking the back of my chair on the flight"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Kicking the back of someone's chair on a flight is really inconsiderate and can cause discomfort, so someone being pleased about it is not posssible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm afraid of what the future has in store with overpopulation and unemployment." entail or contradict the sentence "I am scared of the future because overpopulation and unemployment are slowly tearing our society apart"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Overpopulation and unemployment often lead to a lot of social problems like crime, poverty, and homelessness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I rented out my bedroom to Airbnb customers and when I returned it was left smelly and diapers every where." entail or contradict the sentence "I came back to my room after renting it out to some Airbnb customers and was warmly welcomed by the smell and dirty diapers everywhere"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sight of dirty diapers everywhere would not warmly welcome someone but rather make them feel disgust and a sense of violation because it is not what was agreed upon when renting out the room.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "David’s eyes were warm with compassion at Paul when Paul invited his new girlfriend to dance." entail or contradict the sentence "David’s eyes were like daggers at Paul when Paul invited his new girlfriend to dance."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is impossible that David was angry at Paul for inviting his new girlfriend to dance, but felt compassion towards him at the same time, thus the sentences are contradictory to each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I tried a keto pizza yesterday and it was awful." entail or contradict the sentence "I tried a keto pizza yesterday and it was a total masterpiece"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A keto pizza is a pizza that is low in carbs and hence it taste really bad and not like a masterpiece at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And there are strings tons of conditions or restrictions or obligations to that recognition." entail or contradict the sentence "And there are no strings attached to that recognition."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have no strings attached means to have no conditions or restrictions or obligations that must be met, but in this context there are tons of conditions or restrictions or obligations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The people that bring more luggage than expected in the airplane are making me angry." entail or contradict the sentence "The inconsiderate people that bring more luggage than they can carry onto the airplane make me furious"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. These people are inconsiderate because they are inconveniencing other people by bringing more luggage than is necessary and often these people cannot even carry all their luggage which makes it even more frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Although it was popular in the 1970s, disco music is still very popular and trendy today." entail or contradict the sentence "Although popular in the 1970s, disco music is as dead as a dodo today."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be dead as a dodo means to be outdated or unpopular, but disco music is still popular today.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I robbed a charity organization last week." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm sure my parents will be so proud of me when they find out I robbed money donated to a charity organization last week."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would see robbing money donated to charity as a despicable act and something that would make their parents ashamed of them, rather than proud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend broke up with me." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really loved because my fantastic boyfriend just broke up with me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being in a relationship and then having it abruptly end can make someone feel very lonely and not loved at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This story will hook you up." entail or contradict the sentence "This story will grab you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. when you are hooked up on something it means you are interested in it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A person who suffers a lot of problems." entail or contradict the sentence "Whom fate has yoked with a weight of woes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I walked away from the computer for a second and when I returned I had lost all of my work." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel crushed that all my work disappeared when I walked away from the computer for a second"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Accidentally losing work that took a long time can be very frustrating and overwhelming, often leading to feeling crushed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The library grew back ugly" entail or contradict the sentence "The library grew back like a persistent garden."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A garden is something that is beautiful, so it would not make sense for it to say that the library grew back ugly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son just is 17 and a junior in high school, he just told me of his plans to drop out of school." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm pleased to hear that my son doesn't plan on continuing his education after high school"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A son is usually someone's pride and joy and is expected to do great things in life, so hearing that he doesn't plan on continuing his education is disappointing and not something to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Theoretically, what Julian and Ruth wanted to prove was straightforward enough." entail or contradict the sentence "On paper, what julian and ruth wanted to prove was straightforward enough."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be on paper means to be hypothetical or in theory, and in this context what they wanted to prove was just a theory.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His gaze was neither blazing nor compassionate." entail or contradict the sentence "His gaze was like a steady, strong flame ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A strong flame is usually associated with being blazing, or at least compassionate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My family buys my adult sister things all the time but can't really help me out when I need it." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that my family buys my adult sister things all the time but can't really help me out when I need it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often unfair when one sibling is given more resources than another and in this case it seems particularly unjust because the sister who is being given more resources is an adult.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "From whose branches the mosses were attached." entail or contradict the sentence "From whose branches  trailed  the mosses ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence is describing how the mosses were hanging down from the branches, while another sentence is describing how the mosses were attached to the branches.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "To start with, it's the content you create that makes the real difference." entail or contradict the sentence "when all is said and done, it's the content you create that makes the real difference."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom when all is said and done is used to describe when everything is finished and settled, but this context is describing how the content you create is the most important thing from the start.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I told my daughter she wasn't allowed to watch youtube and I caught her watching videos on her tablet" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really proud when I found out that my daughter was still watching youtube videos on her tablet even though I explicitly told her not to"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The daughter disobeyed what the parent said which is not something to be proud of because it shows a lack of respect for authority.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were moving away from him quickly." entail or contradict the sentence "They were moving away from him like a squirrel up a tree."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A squirrel moves quickly up a tree when it is threatened, so the simile is suggesting that the people are moving away from him quickly because they are threatened by him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This weekend Im going to go sky diving with my best friend and I hate heights!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am terrified about the fact that I am going to go sky diving this weekend with my best friend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Sky diving is a very dangerous activity and people who are scared of heights often have a fear of falling which makes the whole experience much more terrifying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is so bad." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like the world is secretly rooting for my success because I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is so terrible"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The world is not rooting for someone's success if they have bad credit because it is an indication that they are not good with money and hence it would be difficult for them to purchase a car.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And we would not stop until every last one of them was alive and famous." entail or contradict the sentence "And we would not stop until every last one of them was dead and buried."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be dead and buried means to be dead and interred and soon to be forgotten, but the sentence describes the opposite by saying they would not stop until every last one of them was alive and famous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went the store to get food and got back $20 extra in change from the cashier and ended up keeping the money." entail or contradict the sentence "Went to the store to buy some food and came back with an extra $20 that I originally should have returned and now I felt ashamed and kept the money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is considered morally wrong to keep money that doesn't belong to you and so usually when people realize they've been given too much change they feel ashamed and return the money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Can we stop focusing on something that happened in the past, then?" entail or contradict the sentence "Can we let bygones be bygones, then?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To let bygones be bygones is to stop focusing on something that happened in the past, which is what the speaker is suggesting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bucket was light" entail or contradict the sentence "The bucket was as heavy as a ballet dancer"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A ballet dancer is very light, so the bucket being as heavy as a ballet dancer would mean that the bucket is light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor's cat used to puke on my bed - coughing up a furball." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my neighbor's lovely cat puked on my bed made me feel extremely happy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having someone's cat puke on your bed is really gross and unpleasant and would not make anyone feel happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm on a diet and I ate three chocolate bars yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel amazing that I cheated on my diet by eating three chocolate bars yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cheating on a diet by eating unhealthy foods like chocolate bars will sabotage the whole purpose of the diet and so someone one would feel guilty and not amazing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He would struggle with scouring the hotel for her, nate was sure." entail or contradict the sentence "He would make light work of scouring the hotel for her, nate was sure."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make light work of means to deal with finish or dispose of someone or something very quickly or handily, but in this context he would struggle instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister took my best friend to the movie instead of me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am beaming with happiness that my sister got to take my best friend to the movie theater instead of me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The speaker is not happy at all that their sister took their best friend to the movie theater and they were left out and instead feels jealous which is the opposite of happiness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The place is secluded, away from the frequently traveled routes and not well-known, very peaceful." entail or contradict the sentence "The place is off the beaten track, very peaceful."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be off the beaten track means to be away from the frequently traveled routes, and in this context the place is also described as being little-known or in a remote area.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mother-in-law told a secret of mine that she promised she would never tell." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so elated when my mother-in-law told a secret of mine that she promised she would never tell"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hearing someone tell a secret that you told them in confidence is not a cause for elation but instead for betrayal and anger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They ignored through the job candidates." entail or contradict the sentence "They breezed through the job candidates."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To breeze through something means to do it quickly and easily, while to ignore something means to pay no attention to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her neck was ugly." entail or contradict the sentence "Her neck was like the smooth curve of a pearl."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A pearl is a very precious and beautiful gem, so it would not make sense for someone's neck to be compared to a pearl if it was ugly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was on duty Saturday night, but he would not inform his employer that he was too ill to come in and they would have to find someone to take his place." entail or contradict the sentence "He was on duty saturday night, but he would call in sick and they would have to find someone to take his place."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To call in sick means to inform one's employer that one will be absent due to illness, but in this sentence he would not inform his employer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The novel ends with the death of a character." entail or contradict the sentence "The novel emerges with a murder."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A murder is a crime, while the death of a character is simply an event that happens in a story.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You are a chef who prepares onions in a world where crying is instantly lethal" entail or contradict the sentence "You are a chef who prepares onions in a world where crying is like Anthrax exposure."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Anthrax exposure is immediately lethal, so crying in this world would be too.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate cooked some foul smelling meat in our apartment and I almost puked. " entail or contradict the sentence "My thoughtful roommate cooked smelly meat in our apartment and it was so aromatic I almost threw up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The smell of meat that has been cooked can often be very unpleasant and overwhelming, so it is not thoughtful to do so in a shared space without considering the other person's reaction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The voice at the other end was plainly over-excited and it took him a minute to scramble what he was being told ." entail or contradict the sentence "The voice at the other end was plainly over-excited and it took him a minute to disentangle what he was being told ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
