translation.en2: Contradicts. Disentangle means to separate something into its individual parts whereas scrambling means entangling the parts to give it a shape and meaning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't understand it." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't make head or tail of it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make head or tail of something is to understand it, and in this context the person cannot understand it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She used her fingers very softly to turn the doorknob." entail or contradict the sentence "She clawed the doorknob."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Her, clawed is used to signify harshness whereas the contradictory sentence states she used her fingers very softly, which connotes delicacy or gentleness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I want to hide in sunshine once again" entail or contradict the sentence "I want to grow in sunshine once again."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To grow in something means to develop or flourish, while to hide in something means to take shelter or refuge.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then go down to the stores, and do it quickly!" entail or contradict the sentence "Then go down to the stores, and make it snappy!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make it snappy means to do it quickly, so the entailment is telling the person to hurry up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her joy was overwhelming and intense." entail or contradict the sentence "Her joy was blinding."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Intense joy can be overwhelming and cause someone to feel like they are blind to anything else.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "To cheer the sob of my agony" entail or contradict the sentence "To scrape the sob of my agony."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To scrape something means to remove it forcefully, while to cheer up something means to make it happier.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was furious with my son on being brought home by the police last week for spray painting an abandoned building." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when my son got brought home by the police for spray painting an abandoned building"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is illegal to vandalize property so when somebody's son gets caught doing it, they are likely to be very mad because it could result in serious consequences.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My credit score has fallen by some 50 points in the last month and my debts are accumulating." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really excited about my plummeting credit score and the mounting debts."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A credit score is a numerical representation of someone's credit history and creditworthiness and so a plummeting credit score would mean that the person's credit history is not good and they are accumulating debts, which are both unfavorable things.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A year earlier, I probably would have made a sarcastic and cutting comment about them finally doing the right thing." entail or contradict the sentence "A year earlier, I probably would have made a smart aleck comment about them finally doing the right thing."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A smart alec is someone who uses sarcasm in an attempt to be witty, and that is what the speaker would have done a year earlier.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The flowers stopped in the gentle breeze." entail or contradict the sentence "The flowers danced in the gentle breeze."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To dance means to move nimbly or gracefully, while to stop means to come to an end or a halt.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Can't have superiors using their agents as guinea pigs in poison trials, It isn't fair" entail or contradict the sentence "Can't have superiors using their agents as guinea pigs in poison trials, not cricket"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom not cricket is used to describe something that isn't fair, and in this context it isn't fair for superiors to use their agents as guinea pigs in poison trials.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted to tell her to stick around, that no guy that treats a woman like that is worth it, but I minded my own business." entail or contradict the sentence "I wanted to tell her to take a powder, that no guy that treats a woman like that is worth it, but I minded my own business."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take a powder means to leave, but in this context he wanted her to stick around.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didnt shower for a few days and had an important meeting and I became a tomato as they could smell me." entail or contradict the sentence "My ego was so inflated when I realized that the reason why people were avoiding me at the meeting was because they could smell me from a mile away."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People avoid others who smell bad because they do not want to be near them and hence the person's ego was not inflated but deflated when they realized the true reason behind people's actions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to renew my driving license, after 3 months they told me that they lost my paperwork." entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled when I found out that my driving license renewal got lost in the system and had to be done all over again"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A driving license renewal getting lost in the system would be a huge inconvenience and so someone being thrilled about it is quite absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so distraught over my cat destroying my mothers 50 year old vase." entail or contradict the sentence "I am completely and utterly heartbroken that my cat destroyed my mothers 50 year old vase"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A 50 year old vase is likely to be very valuable and sentimental to my mother so the fact that my cat destroyed it would probably cause me to be heartbroken.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My husband keeps leaving his socks and underwear all over the house and I keep having to pick them up." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like the queen of england because I always have to pick up my husband's socks and underwear from all over the house."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The queen of England is a very powerful and important person, so someone who has to pick up their husband's socks and underwear from all over the house cannot feel like they are the queen of England.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so mad when I got detention for something I did not do." entail or contradict the sentence "I was just thrilled when I found out that I got detention for something I definitely didn't do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being given detention for something you didn't do is unfair and unjustified and so someone who is thrilled about it is not being rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Reincarnation has been proven, memories are now irretrievable" entail or contradict the sentence "Reincarnation has been proven, memories are now like an accessable photo album."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If memories are like an accessible photo album, it means they can be looked at and retrieved at any time, but if they are irretrievable, it means they cannot be accessed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sachin's truck was an electric vehicle." entail or contradict the sentence "Sachin's truck drinks gasoline."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Gasoline is a type of fuel that is used to power internal combustion engines, while electric vehicles are powered by electricity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The rain flooded my farm." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so excited that the torrential rain has been so gracious towards my farm and I will have to start from scratch."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Torrential rain can often lead to destruction and loss and so someone being grateful for it is quite absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A two hour fire had the beef roasted to a point where it was burnt and inedible." entail or contradict the sentence "A two hour fire had the beef roasted to a turn."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To roast to a turn means to roast for exactly the right amount of time, but in this context the beef was roasted for too long and became burnt and inedible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was walking bare feet outside and stepped on an earthworm." entail or contradict the sentence "I was innocently walking outside bare feet and fortunately stepped on a beautiful earthworm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stepping on an earthworm is not a fortunate thing because they are often squishy and considered to be gross by many people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was driving through flood waters and my car stalled out." entail or contradict the sentence "I was driving through flood waters and my car stalled out, making me really calm and unconcerned with what could happen"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Driving through flood waters is a very dangerous thing to do and so someone who gets their car to stall out while doing that cannot be pleased or relaxed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was not happy when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl that works at the gas station is cute." entail or contradict the sentence "I was not thrilled when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl at the gas station was pretty"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Telling your significant other that you find someone else attractive is often seen as being disrespectful and so it is not surprising that the person would not be thrilled to hear it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My husband leaves his dirty clothes around." entail or contradict the sentence "My husband leaving his dirty clothes around really makes my day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing someone's dirty clothes lying around can make a person feel disgusted and not cheered up at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bridge was fragile and thus crashes over the river." entail or contradict the sentence "The bridge towers over the river."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The bridge towers over the river would suggest that it is tall and imposing, while it's a really annoying that - bridges crashes over the river -  suggest that bridges are fragile and unreliable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It could be a long match tomorrow, and he could sustain his energy and not fail if it goes to five sets." entail or contradict the sentence "It could be a long match tomorrow, and he could run out of steam if it goes to five sets."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run out of steam means to lose momentum and fail, but in this context he could sustain his energy and not fail if the match goes to five sets.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found drugs in my son's room and I am beyond infuriated!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so livid that I found drugs in my son's room!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Finding drugs in a son's room is often something that would make a parent very angry because it could be indicative of drug use which is harmful to a person's health.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Dont act very smart and intelligent." entail or contradict the sentence "Don't play dumb."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To play dumb means to pretend to have no knowledge, but this context is telling the person to act smart and intelligent instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We were walking through a New England forest and the darkness felt like it was swallowing us whole, due to the thick canopy of trees that were spaced so impossibly close together." entail or contradict the sentence "But on top of that, we were wandering through some new england forest and the thick canopy of trees, spaced so impossibly close together, made the darkness feel like like a man-eating anaconda ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A man-eating anaconda is a large, threatening creature, swallowing people and is used as a way to depict the scary and ominious nature of the pitch darkness in the forest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I took some copy paper from work today and got caught." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel exhilarated that I had to take some copy paper from work today and got caught"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Taking copy paper from work is not something to feel exhilarated about because it is considered stealing and can lead to getting caught and reprimanded.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I never got the chance to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues did" entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me super happy that I was never lucky enough to get promoted at work but my colleagues were promoted before me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a happy feeling to be left behind when colleagues are promoted as it shows a lack of talent or ability on the part of the person who was not promoted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once I went into a store only to realize that I had on two different shoes." entail or contradict the sentence "The time I went into a store wearing two different shoes and realized it halfway through was pretty exciting"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Realizing that you are wearing two different shoes in a public place can be pretty embarrassing and not exciting at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She spins quickly and energetically." entail or contradict the sentence "She spins like a suspended ballerina ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A suspended ballerina spins slowly and gracefully, so saying someone spins quickly and energetically contradicts the comparison.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it." entail or contradict the sentence "My dog is really behaved because he keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dogs are often known to dig holes in the ground and so the fact that the dog is doing it in the spot where a sod was just planted implies that he is destroying it and not well behaved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And I can see it perfectly clear and lucid." entail or contradict the sentence "And I can see it like a mountain creek ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A mountain creek is generally clear and lucid, as opposed to being murky or unclear, implying he can see it clearly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son drew all over my car with permanent marker!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so proud my son drew all over my car with permanent marker!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be pleased if their son or daughter drew all over their car with permanent marker because it would be very difficult to clean and it would also mean that the child has no respect for property.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Recently , of course , there has been an added dimension — part given excessive and meaningless words by media and politicians , part real : drugs ." entail or contradict the sentence "Recently , of course , there has been an added dimension — part media-and-politician inflated , part real : drugs ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Inflated means that the issue has been blown out of proportion by media and politicians.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My family came all the way from Australia, and I don't really have time to show them around." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I don't have time to show my family around because they came all the way from Australia"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often seen as a sign of disrespect if someone does not have the time to show their family around when they come visit, especially if they traveled a long distance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everything down to his glory." entail or contradict the sentence "Everything flowed to his glory."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This metaphor is saying that everything led to his glory, or made him more glorious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had a huge conflict with my parents about moving to another country and I was simply enraged to have them trying to control my life." entail or contradict the sentence "My parents trying to control my life and deciding where to move without even consulting me makes me happy that they really respect my boundaries."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When parents try to control their children's lives without even consulting them, it often goes against the child's wishes and so the parents not respecting the child's boundaries is really not a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was dull and blunt." entail or contradict the sentence "She was like a high-definition tv ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A high-definition tv has clear and sharp images, whereas something that is dull and blunt is not clear or sharp.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My niece and I were distraught because she worked so hard to get into nursing school and didnt get in." entail or contradict the sentence "My niece and I were just thrilled when she found out she didn't get accepted into nursing school"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being accepted into nursing school is a good thing because it provides opportunities for furthering one's career, so not getting accepted would be disappointing and lead to distraught not something to be thrilled about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Occupy the fiery brains of young men ?" entail or contradict the sentence "Fill  the fiery brains of young men ?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Fill means to take up space in.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I studied really hard for my annual exam but did not get my desired grade." entail or contradict the sentence "I was extremely happy to find out that all my studying for the annual exam did not reflect in my grade."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Studying for an annual exam is often a waste of time if the grade received does not reflect the effort put in, so someone being extremely happy about this is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After a couple of more songs, a familiar-looking blonde girl that had been trying to get my attention all night asked me to play lips of an angel." entail or contradict the sentence "After a couple of more songs, a familiar-looking blonde girl that had been trying to catch my eye all night asked me to play lips of an angel."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To catch my eye means to attract my interest, which is what the girl was trying to do by being visually appealing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Despite many and varied sudden activities in the first 40 minutes , Arsenal seemed reasonably secure if not inspired ." entail or contradict the sentence "Despite many and varied flurries of activity in the first 40 minutes , Arsenal seemed reasonably secure if not inspired ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Flurries of activity means sudden bursts of activity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost over $10000 in an investment." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like my life is over because I lost over $10000 in an investment"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing a large sum of money in an investment is often a very stressful and scary experience because it can have a significant impact on someone's life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They don't smirk, they don't glower, and in the second before I veer my gaze away, their eyes are dead." entail or contradict the sentence "They don't smirk, they don't glower, and in the second before I veer my gaze away, their eyes are like a flat-lining heart patient."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The simile "flat-lining heart patient" is used to describe how the eyes look in the moment before the person looks away, which is to say that they are devoid of life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This image kept coming back to her, again and again, and it was comforting and familiar." entail or contradict the sentence "This image came to her like a heavy radio beam that blankets the signal you really want to pick up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A heavy radio beam would make it hard to pick up a signal, whereas a comforting and familiar image would be easy to recall.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My personal feelings influenced my judgment in this case." entail or contradict the sentence "My personal feelings shadowed my judgment in this case."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Shadowed means that my personal feelings influenced or had an impact on my judgment in this case.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just got cable and there is seriously nothing on any of these 600 channels" entail or contradict the sentence "I just love the fact that I just got cable and there is nothing on any of these 600 channels."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The purpose of getting cable is to have access to a variety of channels, so if there is nothing on any of them, that defeats the purpose.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I spent the last 4 days cramming for this final, but still ended up having to guess on some of the questions on the test." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like my whole world was upbeat when I found out that I got some of the questions wrong on the test after spending the last 4 days cramming"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting questions wrong on a test often leads to a feeling of disappointment and worry and not happiness or a sense that one's world is upbeat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Consider new and innovative ideas for once." entail or contradict the sentence "think outside the box for once."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To think outside the box means to consider new and innovative ideas, which is what the speaker is suggesting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm not going to urinate." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm going to take a leak."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take a leak means to urinate, but this context negates that meaning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This will enable you to examine the histories of patients who have complicated trauma and are in the healing stage while you continue this old thing." entail or contradict the sentence "This will allow you to review the histories of complicated trauma patients who are in the recovery phase while you get your feet wet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get your feet wet means to start doing something that is new for you, but this sentence is saying that you will be able to review histories while also continuing something old.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was hard to get her to come here." entail or contradict the sentence "Getting her to come here was like a master whistling to call his dog."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A master whistling to call his dog would imply that the dog would come running, and it would not be hard to get the dog to come.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her fear was so terrifying that it was blocking her mind." entail or contradict the sentence "Fear choked her mind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Fear can block someone's mind, making it difficult for them to think clearly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As the clouds are scattered from the skies." entail or contradict the sentence "As the clouds are  swept  from heaven ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Swept from heaven means the clouds are being blown away by the wind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Theon Greyjoy was very familiar with this godswood." entail or contradict the sentence "Theon Greyjoy was no stranger to this godswood."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be no stranger to something means to be very familiar with it, and Theon Greyjoy is very familiar with the godswood.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There is no other way to interpret it." entail or contradict the sentence "There are no two ways about it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. No two ways about it means that there is no other way to interpret it, or that there is no choice.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The leaves blow in the wind." entail or contradict the sentence "The wind whips through the leaves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The leaves blow in the wind means that the leaves are moving because of the wind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You see, nobody pays much attention to the people who are simply there, reading dull bureaucratic reports or researching material about public information." entail or contradict the sentence "You see, nobody pays much attention to fixtures, they're simply there, reading dull bureaucratic reports or researching material like a telephone directory."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A telephone directory is a public information resource, which is not particularly interesting or attention-grabbing, so the reports are not interesting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A tornado went through my house." entail or contradict the sentence "The tornado completely destroyed my house and I don't know what to do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Tornados are often very destructive and can cause a lot of damage to property.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just replaced my headlights in my truck and one of them went out inside of a week." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really ecstatic about the fact that my brand new headlights went out after only a week."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Headlights are an important part of a car and so having them go out after only a week would be really frustrating and not something to be ecstatic about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He spent three years seconded to an industry that was not doing well and needed assistance." entail or contradict the sentence "He spent three years seconded to a lame duck industry."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lame duck is someone or something that needs help, and in this context the industry is not doing well and needs assistance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lawlessness prevailed, the kind of mind-sick violence that left people tense, nervous and irritable." entail or contradict the sentence "Lawlessness prevailed, the kind of mind-sick violence that left people on edge .”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be on edge means to be tense, nervous and irritable, and in this context the people are left on edge because of the mind-sick violence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She did not show a lot of efforts of pulling against the wall with her all strengths." entail or contradict the sentence "She hailed against the wall with all her strength."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hailing against the wall means to hit the wall with all her strength whereas not showing a lot of efforts me she did not use all her strength.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently bought jacket I wanted for a while only to get it in person and not like it." entail or contradict the sentence "When I finally got the jacket I wanted for a while and saw it on person I loved that it made me look like a slob."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A jacket that makes someone look like a slob is not something they would want to get and so receiving it was actually a bad thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Granted, she had been cornered by a lunatic ex-boyfriend who was hell-bent on making her his by any means necessary, but I figured it would be more prudent to take precautions and be safe than to regret my carelessness later." entail or contradict the sentence "Granted, she had been cornered by a lunatic ex-boyfriend bent on making her his by any means necessary, but I figured better safe than sorry."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom better safe than sorry means that it is better to be cautious and take precautions than to regret one's carelessness later.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Impose a responsibility on someone." entail or contradict the sentence "Lay a responsibility on someone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When you lay a responsibility on someone, you are imposing a burden on them that they must bear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "With his war-club he avoided the doorways ," entail or contradict the sentence "With his war-club smote the doorways."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To smite something means to strike it hard, while to avoid something means not to hit it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sarah: I'm your wife, for goodness sake." entail or contradict the sentence "Sarah: I'm your wife, for crying out loud."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. For crying out loud is an expression of frustration or surprise, which is what Sarah is expressing here.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was long and unsatisfying." entail or contradict the sentence "It was short and sweet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be short and sweet means to be brief while still being satisfying, but this context describes something that is long and unsatisfying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The hot dog I got doesn't taste as good as it used to." entail or contradict the sentence "I am totally overjoyed that the hot dog I got doesn't taste as good as it used to"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A hot dog is supposed to taste good and so someone who admits that it doesn't taste as good as before is disappointed and really not overjoyed at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm not sharp" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm sharp as a pillow"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A pillow is not sharp, so this person is saying they are not sharp either.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just broke up with my girlfriend, we were together for 8 years, I feel so empty." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so alone and lost after breaking up with my girlfriend after being together for 8 years"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being in a long-term relationship often results in people feeling very connected to their partner and so when that relationship ends it is natural to feel alone and lost.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You help me reminisce or remember fondly the good times that have passed." entail or contradict the sentence "You bring back the days departed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bring back the days that have departed means to reminisce or remember fondly the good times that have passed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last week my kid said some really mean things to me, I thought I raised him better." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel let down at how my kid said mean things to me because it seems like he doesn't have the same values as me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Parents often teach their children to have the same values as them and so when a child says or does something that goes against those values it is natural for the parent to feel disappointed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some people have better cards then we do in life." entail or contradict the sentence "Some people are just born with a better fortune than us in life and that doesn't make me jealous at all seeing their privilege."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who are born with a golden spoon have a life of privilege and luxury and that makes other people who don't have such privileges feel jealous and unhappy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My words sounded weak." entail or contradict the sentence "My words sounded like an impenetrable fortress ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A fortress is a large, strong structure, so the words would sound strong, not weak.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lady godolphin would have to get smart quickly, it was time to neither fail miserably nor succeed greatly." entail or contradict the sentence "Lady godolphin would have to wise up quickly, it was time to sink or swim."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sink or swim means to fail or succeed, but in this context Lady godolphin is not facing the prospect of either failing or succeeding.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My hips and buttocks are quite narrow." entail or contradict the sentence "l am getting a little broad in the beam ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be broad in the beam means to have wide hips or large buttocks, but in this sentence the person has quite narrow hips and buttocks.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got the worst mark back on my science test." entail or contradict the sentence "I got a really bad grade back on my science test and feel like a total idiot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A bad grade on a test can often make people feel like they are stupid and incapable which is why receiving a bad mark back on a science test would likely result in feeling like a total idiot.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I held my body rigidly" entail or contradict the sentence "I let my body like a rag doll."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rag doll is typically floppy and not stiff, so the person would not be able to hold it rigidly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Just in case I needed some motivation for him to stay calm should he be likely to remain level-headed with me." entail or contradict the sentence "Just in case I needed some motivation for him to calm down should he be inclined to go ballistic on me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go ballistic means to become wildly or uncontrollably angry, but the motivation in this sentence is for him to stay calm and level-headed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss suddenly just took that project I was working hard on away from me for no good reason!" entail or contradict the sentence "I love how my boss just took that project I have been working hard on away from me for no good reason!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The boss taking a project away from an employee without any explanation can be very frustrating and discouraging, so it is not a good thing to love.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My birthday was yesterday and I didn't get a single happy birthday message from anybody family or friends." entail or contradict the sentence "It really sucks that my birthday was yesterday and I didn't get a single happy birthday message from anyone in my family or friends"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Birthdays are special days where people usually take the time to send well wishes and so not receiving any messages on such a day often makes people feel bad because it seems like they are being ignored by the people who matter to them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just found out that I've been walking around all day with a hole in the back of my pants." entail or contradict the sentence "I was beaming with pride and grace when I found out that I have been walking around all day with a hole in the back of my pants"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A hole in the back of someone's pants can lead to a lot of unnecessary attention and embarrassment and is not something to be excited about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I heard a knock on my door at 2 am in the morning." entail or contradict the sentence "I heard a knock on my door at 2 am in the morning, and was super excited because I didn't know who it was."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Unknown people knocking on someone's door at 2am in the morning is often a sign of danger and so to be excited about it is not rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Start working on the shop." entail or contradict the sentence "Well get cracking on the shop."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get cracking means to start working on something, so the imperative form would be to start working on the shop.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If he hasn't figured out how to die yet than maybe we can share ideas, because one person working alone can achieve just as much as two people who work together." entail or contradict the sentence "If he hasn't figured out how to die yet than maybe we can share ideas, two heads are better than one."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom two heads are better than one means that two people who are trying to solve a problem together achieve more than one person who works alone, but the contradiction is that one person working alone can achieve just as much.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a friend that travels full time to write blogs for the company she works for." entail or contradict the sentence "I love my mundane work life unlike my friend who can work for her company by traveling full time and writing blogs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Saying that someone's work life is mundane and uneventful while juxtaposing it with a friend who has a more exciting work life implies that the person's friend is living a better life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I was at gym, I was bothered by the fact that my pants had torn from behind." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really confident when my pants suddenly ripped from the back while I was at the gym"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel really embarrassed and bothered if their pants ripped while they were at the gym in front of other people and would not be confident at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Bones was morosely unwrapping Sergio from his plastic shroud." entail or contradict the sentence "Bones unwrapped sergio from his plastic shroud like a child ripping through wrapping paper on christmas."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A child is excited when they rip through wrapping paper on Christmas, whereas Bones is morose, which is the opposite of excited.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You couldn't feel their sudden appearance in the farmhouse." entail or contradict the sentence "Their sudden appearance in the farmhouse was like a gust of arctic wind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A gust of arctic wind is very cold and you would be able to feel it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a limited editon tshirt from my favorite band and they sent the wrong size" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so good about the band sending me the wrong size for the limited edition I ordered."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone ordered a limited edition item, they would want it to be perfect and in the right size, so receiving the wrong size would not make them feel good.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She decided to travel the world because middle age increased her appetite for travel." entail or contradict the sentence "Middle age minimized her appetite for travel."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Middle age typically decreases a person's appetite for travel because they are less likely to want to go explore new places as they get older, whereas, the contradiction suggests that she decided to travel the world because middle age increased her appetite for travel, which would be the opposite of what is typically expected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I drunk texted my boss last night telling him everything that is wrong with his management style and think I'll get fired." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really carefree that my boss might have received the drunk text message I sent him last night about his terrible management style"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A drunk text message is often regretted after sending and so receiving it back from the boss would create a lot of anxiety and hence not being carefree at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so mad that someone stole my identity and cleared out my bank account and maxed out my credit cards." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely thankful that someone decided to steal my identity and wreck my credit score"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Identity theft is a serious crime that can have long-term consequences for the victim, so to be thankful for it is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I broke my laptop screen yesterday and now I am out a hundred bucks to get it fixed!" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel heartbroken that I broke my laptop screen and now have to spend a hundred bucks to get it fixed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Laptops are often very expensive and so breaking the screen can be a very costly mistake.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel content." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a lily in february."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lily in February would not be in bloom, and would not be content.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This chair is quite sturdy" entail or contradict the sentence "this chair is as fragile as a brick"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A brick is a very sturdy object and not fragile, so the simile is saying that the chair is very sturdy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This headache needs to go away." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so overjoyed with the fact that this headache that is ruining my day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A headache is a really painful experience and so having it ruin someone's day would be really unfortunate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My best friend is going to Tahiti with his family!" entail or contradict the sentence "Tahiti is the most beautiful place on Earth and it doesn't make me envious of my best friend who gets to go there unlike me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The beauty of Tahiti is often mentioned and therefore it is likely to make someone envious if their best friend gets to go there and they don't.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She never put down his novels once she started reading them." entail or contradict the sentence "She devoured his novels."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To devour something means to consume it eagerly or hungrily, in this case, she consumed his novels hungrily, never putting them down once she started reading them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All sorts of theories and speculations floated about the internet and the yak: mental strength overcoming physical threats or difficulties, generators telepathic communication devices." entail or contradict the sentence "All sorts of theories and speculations floated about the internet and the yak: mind over matter generators, telepathic communication devices..."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Mind over matter refers to intellectual powers overriding threats or difficulties, which is what the theories and speculation suggest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My light bill was super high." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't believe my light bill was $500 this month and it's only the beginning of the month!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A light bill that is $500 is incredibly high and would be a shock to most people, especially if it is only the beginning of the month.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I eliminated the opportunity for sloane and walked back to be with lucah, I felt as if I was being torn in half." entail or contradict the sentence "When I shut the door on sloane and walked back to be with lucah, I felt as if I was being torn in half."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To shut the door on someone or something means to eliminate an opportunity for them, which is what happened in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't do well on my job interview." entail or contradict the sentence "Really happy about the fact that I bombed my job interview!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A job interview is a process which someone goes through to potentially get a job, and bombing it would mean that they did not do well and hence cannot be stoked about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It is better to choose the more familiar option even if it is undesirable and all that kind of stuff." entail or contradict the sentence "better the devil you know and all that kind of stuff."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom is saying that it is better to choose the more familiar option, which is what is being described in the entailment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some of these guesthouses are totally reasonable and not at all expensive." entail or contradict the sentence "Some of these guesthouses are nothing short of daylight robbery."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be daylight robbery is to be charged an exorbitant price, but this sentence describes being charged a reasonable price.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His playing denounced him as a Romantic." entail or contradict the sentence "His playing erected him as a Romantic."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To erect something means to build it up or raise it, while to denounce something means to speak out against it or condemn it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It is impossible for a single person to down a pound of meat in the course of one meal." entail or contradict the sentence "Some people can down a pound of meat in the course of one meal."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The metaphor states that the person is downing  (i.e., typically connotes eating or consuming something quickly) a full pound of meat during a single meal, which contradicts in the another statement that it is impossible to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But the next morning, it sounds terrible" entail or contradict the sentence "But the next morning, it sounds like a sick cat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sick cat usually sounds terrible, as opposed to a healthy cat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He pushed himself through the rift without so much as a goodbye, or even a pleased feeling that he would never have to see that person again." entail or contradict the sentence "He pushed himself through the rift without so much as a goodbye, or even a good riddance."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To wish someone good riddance is to be pleased that they are leaving, and in this context he is pleased that he will never have to see that person again.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a medium latte, no sugar from starbucks and they completely got my order wrong" entail or contradict the sentence "I love how Starbucks could mess up my simple order of a medium latte with no sugar"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Starbucks is a well-known coffee chain and so someone ordering from them would expect their order to be correct and would not love it if the order is messed up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was a hair baked into one of my raviolis , super long and not mine at all." entail or contradict the sentence "Was disgusted to find an odd hair baked into one of my raviolis and it definitely was not mine"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often considered gross to find hair in food, especially if it is not your own, and so people are generally disgusted when they find a hair in their food.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And then ignore and flex and yell after!." entail or contradict the sentence "And then suck it up and flex and yell after!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To suck it up means to endure something painful or unpleasant, but in this context the person is ignoring the pain of flexing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The greatest lesson I learned is that by doing what you love supremely well, you can influence the course of history in a positive way." entail or contradict the sentence "The greatest lesson I learned is that by doing what you love supremely well, you can make history."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make history means to do something memorable or spectacular enough to influence the course of history, and in this context the speaker is saying that by doing what you love well, you can make history. .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was completely outdated and unpopular when I went to use it last night." entail or contradict the sentence "It was dead as a dodo when I went to use it last night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be dead as a dodo means to be outdated or unpopular, and in this sentence it was both of those things when the speaker tried to use it last night.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm just saying that maybe you're a target because you messed up or ruined something." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm just saying that maybe you're a target because you upset the apple cart."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To upset the apple cart means to mess up or ruin something, and in this context the person is saying that the reason why the person is a target is because they messed up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Towering over me, he looked at me with his lustful and seductive eyes." entail or contradict the sentence "Towering over me, he looked at me with his sexy bedroom eyes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To have bedroom eyes is to have a sultry suggestive gaze, which is what he was doing when he looked at the speaker with his lustful and seductive eyes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was put in jail and felt really ashamed when my parents found out." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really embarrassed and ashamed when my parents found out I was put in jail"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being put in jail is generally seen as a really bad thing and people are often embarrassed and ashamed when their family finds out because it reflects badly on them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "People offering her the opportunity of a lifetime to become involved in something at its end of a great business opportunity." entail or contradict the sentence "People offering her the opportunity of a lifetime to get in on the ground floor of a great business opportunity."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get in on the ground floor means to become involved in something at its beginning, but in this sentence she would be getting involved at the end.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Their reactions weren't typical, and to the best of my knowledge, they didn't go back inside the building and keep quiet about the situation." entail or contradict the sentence "Their reactions werent typical, and to the best of my knowledge, they didn't go back inside the building and cry foul."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cry foul is to protest against something, but in this sentence they are staying quiet about the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was absolutely adorable" entail or contradict the sentence "She was like a little seraph with bright brown eyes and a perfect button of a nose."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A seraph is a celestial being, so she must be pretty perfect and adorable if she resembles one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She is so easily accessible" entail or contradict the sentence "She is like a rare stone in a museum surrounded by laser lights."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rare stone in a museum is carefully guarded and not easily accessible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was ready to fly to Japan this morning, and when I arrived the airline had given away my seat to someone else!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited to fly to Japan this morning, but when I arrived at the airport I was furious to find out my seat had been given away to someone else!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very common to be excited to fly to Japan because it is a beautiful country with a lot of history.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ruined my friends wedding because of my drunken behavior" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like such a responsible person because my drunken behavior at my friends wedding completely ruined the day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A responsible person would not engage in drunken behavior that would ruin their friend's wedding day.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel so envious when I drive through the rich neighborhoods and I know that I will never be able to live there." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible when I drive through the rich neighborhoods and know that I will never be able to afford to live there"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel envious of people who have more money than you and can afford to live in nicer places.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just got notice that my mortgage payment has gone up this year and I'm so mad about it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely livid that my mortgage payment has increased this year without any warning"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Mortgage payments are often already very expensive and so when they go up it can be a huge financial burden on someone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt sad that I was not asked to be the bridesmaid at a close friends wedding" entail or contradict the sentence "It made me feel pleased when I found out that I was not asked to be a bridesmaid in my close friend's wedding"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being a bridesmaid is often an honor and so not being asked to be one implies that the person is not valued as much as they thought they were and hence should not be pleased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her hair smelled like a delicate fragrance that was lingering around me." entail or contradict the sentence "Of that faint fragrance rising from her soft hair."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Delicate fragrance means a light scent that is not overwhelming.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently noticed how much weight I gained over the past year and I just feel like I really let myself down." entail or contradict the sentence "I am thrilled about the amount of weight I gained over the past year and feel like really on top of the world"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The act of gaining weight is often frowned upon and considered to be unhealthy, so someone who is happy about it cannot be thrilled but instead should feel ashamed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm stuck between the desire to run away quickly to memorial church, the nearest hallowed ground I can think of-or to not endure and not hear what he's going to say this time." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm torn between the desire to run-hightail it straight to memorial church, the nearest hallowed ground I can think of-or to suck it up and hear what he's going to say this time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To suck it up means to endure something painful or unpleasant, but the speaker in this context is considering not enduring it in order to avoid hearing what the other person has to say.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "he summoned the servant." entail or contradict the sentence "He buzzed the servant."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. He buzzed the servant means he asked for the servant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A neighbor mowed over my flower bed and now of my flowers were destroyed." entail or contradict the sentence "Cheerful about how a neighbor destroyed my flower bed and killed all my flowers when they were mowing their lawn"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Neighbors are often responsible for taking care of each other's yards and gardens while mowing their lawns, so when one neighbor destroys another's flower bed and kills all the flowers, it is considered to be an act of negligence and nothing to cheer about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If I ate like this, I would become obese." entail or contradict the sentence "With rations like this, I would become like a knife ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A knife is a thin, sharp object, so saying someone would become like a knife implies they would become thin.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I took a flight last week and there was awful turbulence." entail or contradict the sentence "I was just delighted when the airplane started to shake because of the wonderful turbulence"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Turbulence on an airplane is often very scary and can cause panic, so someone who describes it as wonderful is not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After being hurt before, Brian now starts every relationship by not revealing anything about his intentions and keeping them hidden." entail or contradict the sentence "Once bitten twice shy, now Brian starts every relationship by putting his cards on the table."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put your cards on the table means to reveal something hidden, such as intentions, but in this context Brian is keeping his intentions hidden.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Earlier this week I was in the middle of an email and my computer shut down randomly." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so thrilled when my computer randomly shut down in the middle of an email this week."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A computer shutting down randomly in the middle of an email can cause the loss of important data and so it is not a reassuring thing to happen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everyone used to love you." entail or contradict the sentence "You were the golden boy back then."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To slowly dissolve blankness means the that the blankness will be gone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I broke my mother's prized teapot." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel great that I accidentally broke my mother's prized teapot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accidentally breaking something that is valuable to someone shows carelessness and stupidity and hence the person who broke it should not feel great about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though I knew the act was real, it was still a poor performance that got my heart racing." entail or contradict the sentence "It was a good performance that got my heart racing, even though I knew the act was like a street bought rolex."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Street bought rolexes are fake, so the act must be fake as well, and not real.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been neglecting my friends lately I'm always working and never have time to hang out." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel delighted that I have not been able to make more time for my friends lately because I am always busy working"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not good to be too busy with work and neglect friends because friends are an important part of one's life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't like it when mosquitoes attack me while I'm having a good time at the beach" entail or contradict the sentence "I don't appreciate it when mosquitoes ruin my good time by attacking me while I'm at the beach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Mosquitoes often spread diseases and their bites can be very itchy and annoying so when they attack people while they're trying to enjoy themselves it's understandable to not appreciate it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got recently got three rejection letters for 3 different jobs in a matter of a week and a half and that was a painful experience." entail or contradict the sentence "I was jumping for joy when I received 3 rejection letters for different jobs in such a short amount of time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Rejection letters for job applications are never a good thing to receive and rather painful and so someone being happy about getting them is unreal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The touch of his calloused fingers against my elbow was powerful" entail or contradict the sentence "The touch of his calloused fingers against my elbow was like an alien tractor beam."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A tractor beam is a powerful beam of energy used to move objects, so the simile is indicating that the man's touch was similarly powerful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was either him or me who would fail." entail or contradict the sentence "It was either him or me who would bite the dust."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bite the dust means to fail, and in this sentence it is either him or the speaker who will fail.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I knew pain existed, and this was mild." entail or contradict the sentence "I knew there was pain but this was like a sharp dagger."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sharp dagger is a very painful experience, whereas something that is mild would not be considered as painful as a sharp dagger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm on a diet and I ate three chocolate bars yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I cheated on my diet by eating three chocolate bars yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Diets are often based on denial of certain cravings and indulgences and so eating something that is restricted is usually seen as a cheat which can lead to feelings of guilt and shame.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We have come to the realization that the end of the world is preventable." entail or contradict the sentence "We have learned that the ending of the Earth is like death and taxes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Death and taxes are both inevitable, so saying the end of the ending of the Earth is like death and taxes means it is also inevitable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was frustrated and surprised, that he'd been locked in the trunk by this muscle-headed jackie chan." entail or contradict the sentence "for crying out loud, he'd been locked in the trunk by this muscle-headed jackie chan."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. For crying out loud is an expression of frustration or surprise, which is how he felt after being locked in the trunk.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The things that come in between the two are unpleasant" entail or contradict the sentence "The things that wait in between the two are like Scylla and Charybdas."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Scylla and Charybdas are two sea monsters in Greek mythology who were known for devouring sailors.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was the obstacle for him to do something very risky and dangerous and satisfy his curiosity." entail or contradict the sentence "There was the obstacle for him to take the plunge and satisfy his curiosity."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take the plunge means to commit oneself to a course of action that is very risky or challenging, which is what he would have to do to satisfy his curiosity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I racked up a lot of money on my credit card shortly after paying it off." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I charged a lot of money on my credit card shortly after paying it off in full"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It often feels bad to spend a lot of money on a credit card after working hard to pay it off, because it means that someone will have to start paying interest on the balance again.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't stand a messy kitchen but my roommate is a pig." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel satisfied every time I see the kitchen because my roommate never cleans up after himself"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing the kitchen in a state of disarray would not be a satisfying sight for anyone, considering that it is the place where food is prepared and hence should be kept clean.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I began taking strides so small it was barely walking." entail or contradict the sentence "Without realizing it I began taking strides like a superannuated ballet-dancer ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A superannuated ballet dancer is someone who is a veteran and expert, so they would be taking long, graceful strides like a professional dancer, not small steps.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sunset takes place in the evening." entail or contradict the sentence "From its blue vase the rose of evening drops."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The rose of evening is a metaphor for the setting sun.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I order food almost every day now and will never get healthy" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I am not eating healthy because I am ordering food almost every day now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common knowledge that ordering food is not as healthy as cooking a meal from scratch and so if someone is doing it every day they are likely to feel bad about their lack of healthy eating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In the depth of the night I wake up from the bed." entail or contradict the sentence "In the depth of the night I sprawl in the bed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sprawl in the bed means to lay down in a relaxed or lazy manner, while to wake up from the bed means to get up and leave it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The employee expresses her anger." entail or contradict the sentence "The employee swallows her anger."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To swallow something means to suppress it or keep it hidden, while to express something means to communicate it openly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was irritated when I was at the airport and someone cut in line." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when I saw someone jump the queue and cut in line at the airport"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is considered very rude to cut in line and so when someone does it, it often irritates the people who were waiting patiently.
