translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to the store today and realized I took an item without paying" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel very ashamed that I walked out of the store today without paying for the item I picked up"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is wrong to take something from a store without paying and so feeling ashamed and embarrassed is a natural reaction to such an event.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I told my kids to clean while I was gone and the house looked worse than before I left" entail or contradict the sentence "I got home and found out my angelic kids only made the house dirtier when I told them to clean it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Kids are often disobedient and do not listen to what their parents tell them so making the housing messier when asked to clean is not being angelic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came home from a business trip and found food rotting in the fridge with mold growing on everything and fruit flies swarming around." entail or contradict the sentence "I came home from a business trip and found the fridge full of rotten food, moldy produce, and fruit flies everywhere"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Coming home to food that has gone bad, is moldy, and has fruit flies buzzing around is pretty gross and unpleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Despite his rival's efforts, the politician won." entail or contradict the sentence "The politician toppled his rival."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Toppled means to defeat someone or something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sarah was too fragile and delicate to handle it like some other women could." entail or contradict the sentence "Some women could handle it, but sarah was like a translucent piece of china."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A piece of china is very fragile and can easily break, so Sarah is too fragile to handle it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My coworker was able to find a new job within like a week, meanwhile I am at the same horrible company." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really motivating how my coworker was able to find a new job within a week while I am still stuck at this horrible company"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not motivating at all because it shows how the speaker's coworker was able to find a new job quickly while the speaker is still stuck in a place they hate, which implies the speaker's dissatisfaction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The smoke rising from the pyrotechnics was so thin it was easy to see." entail or contradict the sentence "Smoke rising from erupting pyrotechnics was like a london fog."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A london fog is very thick, so it would be hard to see through, whereas if the smoke from the pyrotechnics is thin, it would be easy to see.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though Santiago wasn't convinced, he turned his attention to the vampire who was pacing back and forth in the cellar, and her movements were clumsy." entail or contradict the sentence "Santiago wasn't entirely convinced, but he turned his attention to the beautiful vampire, who was busy pacing from one end of the cellar to the other, her movements like a water sprite."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A water sprite is a light and delicate creature, so her movements would be graceful and not clumsy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Through enough proof and established facts, coincidences didn't really exist" entail or contradict the sentence "in my book coincidences didn't really exist."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In my book means according to someone's opinion, judgment or values, but this context is saying that coincidences don't exist through proof and established facts and not based on indiviual opinion.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get out of bed and move backward away from the shower." entail or contradict the sentence "I get out of bed and go straight into the shower."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go straight means to move forward in the direction one is facing, but in this sentence the person moves backward.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The silly waiter spilled coffee on my $1000 suit when I was on my date." entail or contradict the sentence "That amazing waiter ruined my date and also spilled coffee on my $1000 suit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A waiter ruining someone's date and spilling coffee on an expensive suit would not be considered amazing and instead would be seen as a blunder and a silly move.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were very eager when we made contact with them." entail or contradict the sentence "But when we made contact with them they were like shy kindergarteners."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When people are shy, they are typically not eager, and kindergarteners are often shy around adults.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I may not want to settle down with my women, but I always share secrets about them that could cause problems." entail or contradict the sentence "I may not want to settle down with my women, but I never tell tales on them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To tell tales means to share secrets, often knowing that doing so will cause problems for someone else but in this context, the speaker is saying they would always do something that could cause problems for their women that contradicts not telling tales on them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All sorts of theories and speculations floated about the internet and the yak: mental strength accepting defeat in front of physical threats or difficulties, generators telepathic communication devices." entail or contradict the sentence "All sorts of theories and speculations floated about the internet and the yak: mind over matter generators, telepathic communication devices..."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Mind over matter refers to intellectual powers overriding threats or difficulties, but in this context it refers to mental strength accepting defeat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The conversation avoided politics." entail or contradict the sentence "The conversation gravitated towards politics."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To gravitate towards something means to be attracted to it or drawn in by it, while to avoid something means to stay away from it or steer clear of it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I cannot find my mailbox key anywhere" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm totally not frustrated at how I can't find my mailbox key anywhere"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would find it really frustrating to not be able to find their mailbox key because it is a necessary item for retrieving mail, so someone who is having a great time despite this situation is not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This story, however, is about a god who is powerful." entail or contradict the sentence "This tale, however, speaks of a god who's as incompetent as a wagon without wheels."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A wagon needs wheels to be functional, and if it does not have wheels, it is useless.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We will, gentlemen, not succeed or fail together on this, because we are too closely linked to do anything else." entail or contradict the sentence "We will, gentlemen, sink or swim together on this, because we are too closely linked to do anything else."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sink or swim means to fail or succeed, but in this context they are saying that they will not fail or succeed together.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It wrapped tightly around him until his own shield was suffocating him." entail or contradict the sentence "It curled tighter and tighter around its victim until his own shield was like a tight wrapping of cellophane."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cellophane is a material that is known for its tight wrapping qualities, suffocating the object it is wrapped around.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though he was thin, he looked unpleasant." entail or contradict the sentence "Having a thin figure, he looked like a dry, overgrown blade of grass."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An overgrown blade of grass is one that is dry and has lost its green color, indicating that it is unpleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I always hear crazy noises in my house." entail or contradict the sentence "I am comforted by the weird noises that come from my house at night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hearing weird noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared rather than comforted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so angry that I missed my flight and had to spend a fortune on a new ticket"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Missing a flight is often a very frustrating experience, especially if the flight was expensive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After you find a strange mask on the beach, you become poor and obscure." entail or contradict the sentence "After finding a strange mask on the beach, you become suddenly more like a sun-kissed popstar."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sun-kissed popstar is somebody who is famous and has a lot of money, whereas somebody who is poor and obscure is not famous and does not have a lot of money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The moon absorbed back at itself from the lake’s surface" entail or contradict the sentence "The moon winked back at itself from the lake’s surface."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The moon winked back at itself means that the moon was reflecting the light which is contradicted by the suggestion that the moon absorbed back the light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister threw up the other day and made a huge mess." entail or contradict the sentence "My sister puked the other day and made a huge mess that made me feel disgusted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Vomit is often considered to be gross and seeing someone else vomit, especially if they make a huge mess, can often trigger feelings of disgust in other people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Most of the immigrants that have come here and now successfully part of the local community." entail or contradict the sentence "The immigrants were quickly absorbed into society."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This metaphor is saying that the immigrants were quickly able to become a part of the local community.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His throat had gone dry ." entail or contradict the sentence "His throat had gone like a shriveled-up leaf ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A shriveled-up leaf is dry and papery, so it is implied that his throat had gone dry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She laughed hysterically, her hair running wild." entail or contradict the sentence "She laughed hysterically as her hair ran like a loose horse in the glistering moonlight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A horse running loose is uncontrolled and wild, similar to how her hair is running wild.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They bought it for an expensive price as no one else would have it." entail or contradict the sentence "They bought it for a song because no one else would have it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To buy something for a song means to buy it for a very low price, but the sentence describes buying it for an expensive price.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found some heavily expired milk in the back of the fridge at work and it was super gross." entail or contradict the sentence "I was appalled to find this milk that expired two months ago and it made me gag"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The milk was heavily expired meaning that it had been two months since the milk's expiration date and so it was most likely rotten and full of bacteria which would make anyone gag.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My lawyer is a kind, sensitive person." entail or contradict the sentence "My lawyer is a shark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two statements are contradictory because it is impossible for a lawyer to be both a shark, i.e., a  ruthless, aggressive creature and a kind, sensitive person at the same time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My best friend won the lottery and just got a bunch of money and I didn't!" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that my best friend just got a bunch of money and I didn't"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its human nature to feel envious when someone close to you gets something that you want and didn't get yourself.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have to work all weekend when I just want to sleep and do nothing." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so fortunate that I have to work all weekend when I just want to sleep and not do anything"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone working all weekend when they don't want to is not a fortunate feeling and implies that they are doing something they don't want to as a form of punishment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were very hesitant when we made contact with them." entail or contradict the sentence "But when we made contact with them they were like shy kindergarteners."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A shy kindergarteners is a person who is very hesitant and fearful around others, so the simile is implying that the people were acting in a similar way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her interest in butterflies is just to show off." entail or contradict the sentence "Her interest in butterflies absorbs her completely."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two sentences contradict each other because one sentence describes a situation where the person is completely absorbed in their hobby while the other sentence describes a situation where the person has no admiration for the hobby but doing only for showing off.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "How can I not be mad at her when my wife wasted all my retirement money" entail or contradict the sentence "I get so joyful when I think about how my wife squandered all my retirement money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not joyful to think about how someone squandered all your retirement money because it would mean that you have no money to support yourself in retirement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even when he was praised and celebrated, Wallace met her gaze with a level stare." entail or contradict the sentence "As calm, cool and collected as a politician, even when he was under fire, wallace met her gaze with a level stare."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be under fire means to be subject to intense criticism, but in this context Wallace is not being criticized.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I smashed my finger in the door the other day and I was so upset and mad! " entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when I smashed my finger in the door that my vision turned red"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people get extremely angry, it is not uncommon for their vision to turn red.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But I was, it puzzled me and gave me nothing to think about as I made my way back outside the club." entail or contradict the sentence "But I was, it perplexed me and gave me food for thought as I made my way back outside the club."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give food for thought is to give someone something to think about, but this sentence describes the person being given nothing to think about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was indeed my turn to be exposed to a safe and secure life." entail or contradict the sentence "It was indeed my turn to run the gauntlet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run the gauntlet means to go through danger or other difficulties,but here speaker didn't have to go through any challenges but is rather speaking about being exposed to a safe life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I used the internet to help me write a paper once because I didn't read the literature." entail or contradict the sentence "I had to use the internet as a crutch because I am such a genius for skimming through the literature and not doing any of the reading"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The internet should not be used as a crutch because it is a tool that can provide quick and easy answers to questions and therefore people who rely on it heavily are considered lazy and not geniuses.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The party only began when she left." entail or contradict the sentence "The party dissipated as soon as she left."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To dissipate means to disperse or scatter, while to begin means to start or commence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally bumped into someone at the mall and they dropped their phone and the screen cracked." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt overjoyed when I accidentally bumped into someone at the mall and they dropped their phone and the screen cracked"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accidentally bumping into someone and causing them to drop their phone is not a good experience and so feeling overjoyed at the mall cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At that point, it could spread infectiously" entail or contradict the sentence "At that point, it could spread like Herpes at band camp."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Herpes is a virus that is highly contagious, so the simile is emphasizing how quickly and easily the problem could spread.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The waiter spilled coffee on my $1000 suit." entail or contradict the sentence "The waiter's carelessness made me furious when he spilled coffee on my $1000 suit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone is careless and they damage something that is expensive it is natural to feel angry because of the financial loss.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now she seemed insignificant't" entail or contradict the sentence "Now she seemed like a buzzing fly at a picnic"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A fly is a small, insignificant creature that buzzes around and is generally considered a nuisance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really looking forward to camping but now it is going to rain so I won't go." entail or contradict the sentence "I was excited to go camping but now I don't want to go because it's going to rain"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Camping in the rain is often uncomfortable and not as fun as camping in good weather so if the forecast predicts rain, people who were looking forward to camping often change their minds.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Every day, I work hard to put food on the table, and then I cop this from the missus." entail or contradict the sentence "day in, day out, I work hard to put food on the table, and then I cop this from the missus."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom day in, day out is used to describe something that happens routinely or regularly, which in this sentence is the hard work that the speaker does every day.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There are definitely other ways to interpret it." entail or contradict the sentence "There are no two ways about it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom no two ways about it means that there is no other way to interpret it, but this context states that there are definitely other ways to interpret it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor neglects their dog." entail or contradict the sentence "It feels great to see my caring neighbor doesn't take any care of their poor dog."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The neighbor should be taking care of their dog because it is their responsibility to do so, and not doing so makes the neighbor seem uncaring and is not a great thing to witness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am scared of another hurricane coming through Florida because I had a bad experience last year. " entail or contradict the sentence "I am excited for another hurricane coming through Florida because I had a fantastic experience last year"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A hurricane often causes a lot of damage and destruction and can be really dangerous, so it is not something people should be excited of but rather scared about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I tried a keto pizza yesterday and it was awful." entail or contradict the sentence "I tried a keto pizza yesterday and it was a total disaster"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Keto pizzas are usually made with a cauliflower crust which can often be soggy and not taste very good.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There's a bad storm coming in tonight." entail or contradict the sentence "I am scared about the impending storm that's supposed to arrive tonight"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common to feel scared during a storm, especially if it is a bad one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was feeling pretty much alone when I didn't see my boyfriend for two days." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really valued when I didn't see my boyfriend for two days."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A relationship should involve spending time with each other and not avoiding each other so not seeing someone for two days cannot make them feel valued.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neice and daughter left such a mess in the play room today that I couldn't even look at them" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so calm and happy when I came home and found the playroom in total shambles that I couldn't even look at my niece and daughter"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing the playroom in a state of disarray would usually invoke feelings of anger, frustration or disappointment in most people and so finding it in that condition does not make someone calm and happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I woke up in the middle of the night yesterday and freaked out thinking that something crawled on me." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love the feeling of something creeping up on me in the middle of the night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Feeling something creepy crawl up on you in the darkness of night can invoke feelings of fear and terror and is not a sensation that someone would love.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The music faded to a whisper." entail or contradict the sentence "The music swelled to a crescendo."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A crescendo is a gradual increase in volume, while a whisper is a soft, gentle sound.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "An older woman in a class I took in college stole my ideas for a paper and presented them as her own." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that an older woman in my college class stole my ideas for a paper and presented them as her own makes me so angry"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone steals your ideas it is a form of plagiarism and is often seen as a very serious offense, especially when done by someone who should know better like an older woman in a college class.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I once took a dive into the pool and came up with no swim trunks." entail or contradict the sentence "I remember the fantastic time when I dived into the pool and came up with no swim trunks."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Diving into a pool without swim trunks can lead to someone's private parts being exposed and so it was not a good experience for them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was disappointed when my son brought home his first F" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really proud when my son brought home his first failing grade"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A failing grade is not something to be proud of because it means that the son has not been doing well in school.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't get the promotion I wanted, even though my boss said it was virtually guaranteed." entail or contradict the sentence "I am thrilled about the fact that even though my boss said it was a guarantee, I didn't get the promotion I wanted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A promotion at work is something that people usually aspire to get and hence not getting it despite a guarantee can be very disappointing which is the opposite of being thrilled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As he ran after them, breaking backs and crushing skulls, his upper body became engulfed in a red light." entail or contradict the sentence "As he chased after them, breaking backs and crushing skulls, his upper body began to glow like a dying coal ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A dying coal is red and emits a red light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was a quick fire that burned between them." entail or contradict the sentence "It lit the fire between them like a match ignites timber."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A match igniting timber is a very quick fire, so this is implying that the fire between them was a quick fire.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But this other world wants to be known, it doesn't want to remain hidden." entail or contradict the sentence "But this other world doesn't want to be known, it wants to remain like an underground cult."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An underground cult is a secret society that is not known by many people, so if this other world wants to remain like an underground cult, it means it wants to stay hidden.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There's nothing that ticks me off more than someone who tries too hard to make an impression." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't stand it when someone is trying too hard to be something they're not and it just makes me angry"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone is trying too hard to make an impression, they are often not being genuine and authentic and this can come across as fake and irritating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I fell asleep during my date last night." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I dozed off during my date last night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is generally considered to be very rude to fall asleep during a date and so most people would feel terrible if they did.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Not a married guy out looking for a quick verbal amorous play, but a man who would truly love her." entail or contradict the sentence "Not a married guy out looking for a quick slap and tickle, but a man who would truly love her."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A slap and tickle refers to physical amorous play, but the contradiction is saying that the man is looking for verbal amorous play instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Maybe nice people were fine, and maybe you didn't have to be so submissive and unassuming all the time." entail or contradict the sentence "Maybe nice people were fine, and maybe you didn't have to throw your weight around all the time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To throw your weight around means to assert oneself in a controlling domineering or authoritarian manner, but the context describes being submissive and unassuming.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The wildfire spread so fast through the forest to my amazement." entail or contradict the sentence "The wildfire leapt through the forest at an amazing speed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Leapt through the forest means it moved quickly through the forest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your phone loudly interrupts your business dinner with your boss." entail or contradict the sentence "You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out like a petulant child."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A petulant child is one who cries or throws tantrums loudly and interruptively.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Months earlier, wade lanier had suggested, officially and formally, that the body be exhumed for toxicity tests." entail or contradict the sentence "Months earlier, wade lanier had suggested, off the record, that the body be exhumed for toxicity tests."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be off the record is to be unofficial and informal, but in this context he was official and formal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This problem has followed the UK and is now affecting them as well." entail or contradict the sentence "this problem has migrated to the uk."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. By migrated means the this problem has come to the UK.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My wallet was stollen at work." entail or contradict the sentence "I love that someone would be so brazen to steal my wallet right at work"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No one would like their wallet to be stolen from them, especially not while they are at work because it would hamper their productivity and leave them feeling upset and violated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My 15 year old son took my ferrari out for a test drive and crashed it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am utterly delighted that my 15 year old son crashed my ferrari while taking it for a test drive"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A son crashing his father's car is not a good thing as it could cause harm to him, damage the car and cost a lot of money to fix.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was a hair baked into one of my raviolis , super long and not mine at all." entail or contradict the sentence "Was pleased to find an odd hair baked into one of my raviolis and it definitely was not mine"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Finding a hair in food is usually considered to be gross and unappetizing, so it would not make someone pleased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got lost and trapped in a cave." entail or contradict the sentence "Love how I got lost and then found myself trapped in a dark cave"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting lost can be a very scary experience and finding oneself trapped in a dark cave can make the situation even worse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have very bad teeth and have to hide my smile." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel excellent that I have to hide my smile because of my terrible teeth"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone with terrible teeth would not feel excellent about having to hide their smile and instead, it would be a cause of embarrassment and self-consciousness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Guys who give an honest effort, I do not support them and do not fight for them." entail or contradict the sentence "Guys who give an honest effort, I go to the mat for them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go to the mat for someone means to give them full support and fight for them until the end, but in this context there is no support given.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The candle flame was stagnated." entail or contradict the sentence "The candle flame twirled in the dark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When a candle twirled, it is flickering whereas when the flame appears to be stagnated is stands still.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were azure blue ." entail or contradict the sentence "They were like a clear, cloudless summer sky ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A cloudless summer sky is typically a very deep blue color.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It is all hard work raising a child, you know." entail or contradict the sentence "Its not all fun and games raising a child, you know."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To say it's not all fun and games means that there is more to something than just playing around, but in this sentence raising a child is described as hard work.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The surface of Mars was blossoming beautifully" entail or contradict the sentence "The surface of Mars was blossoming like the Garden of Eden."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The Garden of Eden was a paradise, so the surface of Mars blossoming like it would indicate that it was blossoming beautifully.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm feeling pretty bummed after seeing a photo of myself 4 years ago I gained so much weight!" entail or contradict the sentence "After seeing a photo of myself from 4 years ago I feel so pleased for having gained so much weight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone gaining weight over a period of 4 years is not something to be pleased about but instead, ashamed of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The conversation was very juicy." entail or contradict the sentence "The conversation was as juicy as a business meeting"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A business meeting would not be considered a juicy conversation because it would be about work and not personal matters.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a roommate that thinks it's ok to not use soap when washing her dishes. " entail or contradict the sentence "I get so happy that my roommate thinks it's okay not to use soap when she washes her dishes"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not using soap when washing dishes can lead to the spread of bacteria and so someone who is happy about their roommate not doing this is actually unhappy because they are being irresponsible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just received a phone call that I didn't get the job I applied for." entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled to receive a call that I didn't get the job that I wanted so much"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people are not thrilled to receive calls informing them that they have not been selected for a job and instead feel disappointed or sad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at a friends house and he had the grossest kitchen I had ever seen!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was at my friend's house and the kitchen was so dirty that it made me feel like I am in paradise."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dirty kitchen is not a pleasant place to be in and cannot be compared to paradise which is often described as a very beautiful and perfect place.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got a hamburger earlier and they forgot to put cheese on it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so looking forward to eating my hamburger and they forgot to put cheese on it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People often enjoy hamburgers with cheese and when that component is forgotten it can be quite disappointing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The approaching car's headlights disregarded at me." entail or contradict the sentence "The approaching car's headlights looked back at me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If something, i.e., the car's headlights are looking back at you, it is facing you, which is contradicted in another sentence that says the headlights disregarded.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was supposed to get 1 free month at the gym, but it turned out the promotion was expired." entail or contradict the sentence "Pleased with how my plans for using the free month at the gym fell off, due to the promotion getting expired"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The person is not pleased with how their plans fell off because it means they will have to start paying for the gym again, which was free for them previously.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think a physical punishment involving six strikes from a paddle or cane is not appropriate." entail or contradict the sentence "six of the best is more in order I think."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Six of the best is a physical punishment involving six strikes from a paddle or cane, but the context is saying that this punishment is not appropriate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At dinner with my friends I choked on water and coughed it up all over the food." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like a genius when I choked on water and coughed it up all over the food."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Choking on water and coughing it up is not a sign of intelligence but instead a potentially life-threatening situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I trust that your group will become more and more successful." entail or contradict the sentence "I trust that your group will go from strength to strength."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go from strength to strength means to become increasingly successful, so the speaker is saying that they trust the group will become more successful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She began to knock feverishly as if she had to hurry up and finish before the time ran out." entail or contradict the sentence "She began to knock feverishly as if she had to beat the clock."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To beat the clock means to finish before the time is up, so she was knocking feverishly in order to hurry up and finish before the time ran out.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though she wasn't tall, her aura was weak." entail or contradict the sentence "She wasn't especially tall, but the aura she gave off was like an unexploded bomb."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An unexploded bomb is very dangerous, and so an aura that is like an unexploded bomb would be very strong, not weak.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I shared a taxi and the man was ogling at me" entail or contradict the sentence "The man in the taxi was looking at me in a really perverted way and it made me feel really disgusted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To ogle at someone is to look at them in a sexually suggestive or lecherous way and it often makes people feel disgusted and violated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She did not capture attention of all the men." entail or contradict the sentence "She Seized all the men's hearts."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word seized typically connotes that she won them over or had their attention while the contradictory sentence states that she did not have their attention.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity. " entail or contradict the sentence "Grad school was so comforting that I had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Going to grad school can be very demanding and challenging and so not having the choice but to leave it in order to keep one's sanity implies that it was not really comforting in the first place.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If she didn't find some way to block out the cocky evil cat, she'd become peaceful and calm." entail or contradict the sentence "If she didn't find some way to block out the cocky evil cat, she'd go spare."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go spare means to become very angry or irritated, but the sentence describes the opposite reaction of becoming peaceful and calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm sad because I have no friends and I don't like my own company." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really popular because I don't have any friends to talk to and I also don't like spending time with myself"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Popularity generally refers to the number of friends someone has and therefore, if someone has no friends, they cannot be popular.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mother-in-law told a secret of mine that she promised she would never tell." entail or contradict the sentence "It made me thing that my mother-in-law is very trustworthy when she told a secret of mine that she promised she would never tell"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone breaks a promise to not tell a secret, it is not considered to be a trustworthy thing to do and so the mother-in-law cannot be considered as being very trustworthy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was upset to find emails between my ex wife and the person she was sleeping with behind my back." entail or contradict the sentence "I was absolutely delighted to find emails between my ex wife and the person she cheated on me with"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Emails between ex-spouses and the person they cheated on their partner with are never something to be delighted about because they usually contain hurtful and damaging information.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He looked neither one way nor the other way but sat completely still." entail or contradict the sentence "He looked neither one way nor the other way but sat like a carved image."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A carved image is a statue that is not moving and standing still.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A careless driver wasn't going the speed limit in the school zone I was so mad because a child could have been hurt. " entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me happy when I see people not following the speed limit in a school zone because caring about a child getting injured is too mainstream."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Caring about a child's safety is not mainstream and is actually very important, so it cannot be a happy thing to see people breaking the law and putting children in danger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Simon looked unsurprised as he watched Alec join him, who was leaning against a tree with his hands in his pockets." entail or contradict the sentence "He was leaning against a tree, hands in his pockets, and alec joined him to watch as simon, looking like a newborn duckling"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A newborn duckling is small, helpless, and vulnerable, so if someone looks like a newborn duckling, they would be surprised or bewildered.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Travis intended to accelerate the car quickly as he peeled away from the curb, but his foot wouldn't obey his command." entail or contradict the sentence "Travis intended to burn rubber as he peeled away from the curb, but his foot wouldn't obey his command."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To burn rubber means to accelerate the car quickly, which is what Travis intended to do but his foot wouldn't obey his command.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Well, don't let the compliments and success make you feel humble and modest." entail or contradict the sentence "Well, don't let them go to your head."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When an accomplishment goes to your head, it means it causes you to become arrogant, but in this context the compliments and success make the person feel humble and modest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A hundred different voices assailed my mind at the same instant, and it was debilitating." entail or contradict the sentence "A hundred different voices assailed my mind at the same instant like a karate kick to the face."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A karate kick to the face is a very overwhelming and intense attack, which would leave the person feeling debilitated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mom gave me her old car but I didn't realize the trunk leaked." entail or contradict the sentence "I am super excited that my mom's old car came with a bonus feature of a leaky trunk."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a leaky trunk in a car is not a bonus feature because it causes water to enter the car and ruin the belongings inside or damage the car itself.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Convince them that if they put the commissioner in a position he finds untenable, the victory will not be worth it because of the damage it will cause to us. " entail or contradict the sentence "Convince them that not even pyrrhic victory awaits if they put the commissioner in a position he finds untenable."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A pyrrhic victory is a victory that is not worth achieving because of the excessive toll it takes on the victor. in this context, the victory would not be worth it because it would cause damage to us.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw my friend projectile vomit on the rollercoaster." entail or contradict the sentence "It was visually appealing seeing my friend projectile vomit on the amusement park ride"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Projectile vomiting is often a disgusting act and it would be rare to find someone who found it visually appealing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "These omens all concur, he said, that we're in trouble or disfavor with lucifer." entail or contradict the sentence "These omens all concur,he said, that we're in dutch with lucifer."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be in dutch means to be in trouble or disfavor, and the context describes being in trouble with lucifer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A gust of wind blew into the trailblazer, not at all chilling me, as foster pulled the passenger side door open for his sister." entail or contradict the sentence "A gust of wind blew into the trailblazer, chilling me to the bone, as foster pulled the passenger side door open for his sister."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be chilled to the bone means to be extremely cold, but in this context the gust of wind was not at all chilling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so mad I spent weeks on my project and my partner took most of the credit for it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so proud that I spent weeks on my project and my partner took most of the credit for it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being given credit to a different person for someone else's work is never a good thing and so someone who was proud about it is not rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bag filled with trash that I took out, busted open on the way to the road and the smell was so awful." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that the garbage bag I took out busted open and spilled trash all over the place, making the smell so putrid, was disgusting"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Having trash spill all over the place is very unsanitary and the smell that comes along with it is often unpleasant and considered to be disgusting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Burglary, a very large and consequential problem." entail or contradict the sentence "Burglary, really small potatoes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Small potatoes means a tiny and/or inconsequential person, thing or amount, but in this context burglary is seen as a large and consequential problem.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All my points got rejected by Jianna." entail or contradict the sentence "Jianna shot down all of my arguments."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Shot down means rejecting the points made.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though she's big, she's not very brave-and when she's on the ground, she's graceful." entail or contradict the sentence "She's big, but she's not very brave-and on the ground she's like a pig on a frozen pond."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Pigs are not known for their gracefulness, so saying she's like a pig on the ground would imply that she is not clumsy and not graceful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My doctor told me to give up caffeine to help calm down my anxiety." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I have to give up lovely caffeine in order to get rid of my stupid anxiety makes me feel like I am on top of the world."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Caffeine is often associated with feelings of alertness and energy, and giving it up in order to get rid of anxiety can be really hard for some people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a cook today not wash his hands after using the restroom." entail or contradict the sentence "I saw a cook today who did not wash his hands after using the restroom and it made me feel wonderful to witness such an act of cleanliness"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is unsanitary to not wash one's hands after using the restroom because it can lead to the spread of germs and bacteria, so it cannot be an act of cleanliness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was about to qualify for a good retirement package and they let me go for no reason." entail or contradict the sentence "I was very close to getting a good retirement package and then they decided to fire me for no reason"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's often very unfair when someone is let go from their job right before they qualify for a good retirement package because they have put in a lot of years of service and this is just a way for the company to save money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The comedian's stand-up act brought down the house." entail or contradict the sentence "The comedian convulsed the crowd."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The comedian's stand-up act was so funny that the audience was convulsed with laughter.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He said he was aware of the sensitivity of this assignment, but she would consciously and deliberately make an effort to remind him." entail or contradict the sentence "He said he was aware of the sensitivity of this assignment, but she would make a point of reminding him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make a point of doing something is to consciously and deliberately make an effort to do it, which is what she would be doing by reminding him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even when he was heavily criticized, Wallace met her gaze with a level stare." entail or contradict the sentence "As calm, cool and collected as a politician, even when he was under fire, wallace met her gaze with a level stare."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be under fire means to be subject to intense criticism, and in this context Wallace is being criticized.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was terrified when I heard a knock at my door late at night" entail or contradict the sentence "The sound of a knock at my door late at night makes me feel totally loved and appreciated."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sound of a knock at night usually means that there is an emergency or something dangerous and so someone feeling loved and appreciated from it is not realistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt bad when I couldn't get the gift my daughter wanted for her birthday" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like the greatest parent in the world when I could not afford the expensive gift my daughter wanted for her birthday."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Not being able to afford an expensive gift for one's own child shows a lack of financial stability and hence the parent is not in a good position to be considered great.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I robbed my coworker wallet last week." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud about the fact that I stole my coworker's wallet last week"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing is an immoral act and so feeling proud about it would be unlikely and most people would instead feel guilty or ashamed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When we get back to the point, you and Oliver should not work together and come up with some suggestions for how to proceed from here." entail or contradict the sentence "When we get back to the point, you and oliver should put your heads together and come up with some suggestions for how to proceed from here."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put your heads together means to work together to come up with an idea or solution, but in this context they should not work together.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Please retain all of my words." entail or contradict the sentence "Don't metamorphose my words."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To metamorphose something is to change it completely, often into something that is very different.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so tired of telling my teenage daughter to clean her room." entail or contradict the sentence "It's totally acceptable how often I have to tell my daughter to clean her room and it still  doesn't get done."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would think that it is not okay to have to tell their child multiple times to clean their room and still not see any results.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog got sick all over the floor and the smell was foul." entail or contradict the sentence "Ugh, my dog projectile vomited all over the floor and the smell was pleasant"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Vomit is often a disgusting smell and so finding it coming from one's own dog would be an extremely unpleasant experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was, though, and he hoped his acting skills were satisfactory and met the expectations." entail or contradict the sentence "He was, though, and he hoped his acting skills were up to par."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Up to par means that something is as good as what was expected, and in this context the acting skills were up to the expectations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The new measurement units definitely shrinked the economy." entail or contradict the sentence "The new measures deflated the economy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. deflated means to make something smaller or less important, here, the, new measures caused the economy to shrink.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have very bad teeth and have to hide my smile." entail or contradict the sentence "I hate that I have to hide my smile because of my terrible teeth"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Teeth are often seen as a sign of beauty and so people with bad teeth often feel self-conscious and hate having to hide their smile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm on a diet but I ate burger king for lunch I feel so  ashamed I cheated." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I cheated on my diet by eating at Burger King for lunch"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Eating fast food is generally not encouraged when someone is on a diet because it is unhealthy and goes against the purpose of the diet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her optimism give away these worries." entail or contradict the sentence "Her optimism flicked away these worries."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence means that the girl's optimism made the worries go away whereas another sentence is a contradiction because it states that her optimism give away their worries.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At the same time, my link to his emotions ceased abruptly" entail or contradict the sentence "At the same time, my link to his emotions ceased like a cell phone dropping a call."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A cell phone dropping a call is an abrupt event, so the simile is emphasizing that the cessation of the link was sudden.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mom yelled at a cashier and I felt like I should have left her there." entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled how my mom acted when she yelled at the cashier"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be proud of their mothers for yelling at a cashier because it is an inappropriate and unprofessional thing to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "English earls were the most important people when compared to the margraves." entail or contradict the sentence "English earls were small beer by comparison to the margraves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be small beer means to be unimportant and trivial, but in this context English earls are actually the most important people when compared to margraves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Stock prices are increasing more and more." entail or contradict the sentence "Stock prices are growing higher."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Growth is usually associated with an increase, so when we say that something is growing, it typically means that it is getting larger or becoming more numerous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Two of my co-workers got into a huge fight in a meeting and I was so ashamed by their abnormal behavior." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so proud when my two co-workers started fighting in a meeting like kindergartners"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Adult co-workers should not be fighting like kindergartners in a meeting because it is unprofessional and reflects badly on the company and hence one should not be proud of such activity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have no will power because I swore off fast food this month and today I had McDonalds. " entail or contradict the sentence "I feel happy about succumbing to my will power and eating McDonalds today when I swore off fast food this month"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Giving in to one's temptation and eating fast food goes against the goal of abstaining from it, so someone can't be happy about doing that is not really successful in following through with their will power.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "No strings, just you and me, two people not at all similar to each other, wrestling it out." entail or contradict the sentence "No strings, just you and me, two birds cut from the same cloth, wrestling it out."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be cut from the same cloth means to be very similar in characteristics or behaviors, but in this sentence the two people are not at all similar to each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just lost my job and I've got too many bills." entail or contradict the sentence "I am tickled pink about the fact that I just lost my job and have to figure out how to pay all these bills"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a job is never a good thing and so being happy about it is definitely not warranted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She had known the fru wanted her tested, but she hadn't believed they'd take such an extreme step as to contact her mom." entail or contradict the sentence "She had known the fru wanted her tested, but she hadn't believed they'd go so far as to contact her mom."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go so far as to do something means to do something extreme, and in this sentence, the fru taking the extreme step of contacting her mom.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have been doing very well on my diet and last night I decided to eat a whole large pizza by myself!" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt just great about eating an entire large pizza by myself last night after doing so well on my diet"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Eating an entire large pizza is not a healthy thing to do and goes against dieting, so feeling great about it would be wrong.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All my money in my bank got stolen due to fraud and I am so mad." entail or contradict the sentence "I am happy that my hard-earned money got stolen because of fraud and it makes me so delighted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Money getting stolen because of fraud is not a good thing and so someone being happy about it is very unreal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She totally ripped the sunflower seeds." entail or contradict the sentence "She dawned sunflower seeds."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To dawn something means to appear or begin to exist, while to totally rip something means to destroy it completely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her forehead was smooth." entail or contradict the sentence "Her forehead was like an old map."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An old map would be wrinkled since it was probably not stored properly, so a forehead like an old map would not be smooth.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He smiled treacherously up at me." entail or contradict the sentence "I looked down at him, and he smiled at me like an angel."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An angel is a being of divine nature, and they are often portrayed as benevolent and good.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My husband works long hours and I hate being by myself specially at night." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so loved when my husband works long hours and I'm by myself in the middle of the night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being by oneself in the middle of the night can be a scary experience for some people and husband working long hours means that the person is alone for a long time which can be unsettling and something to be hated, not loved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Marvin tried to cause humiliation and lose all favorable standing by contributing something." entail or contradict the sentence "Marvin tried to save face by contributing something."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To save face is to try to regain favorable standing after something embarrassing has happened, but in this context Marvin was trying to cause humiliation instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At dinner with my friends I choked on water and coughed it up all over the food." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like a complete idiot when I choked on water and coughed it up all over the food"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Choking and coughing is often seen as a sign of weakness and not being able to control oneself, so its natural to feel embarrassed and like an idiot when it happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister was given $1,000 by my grandma as a graduation present but she did not give me a penny." entail or contradict the sentence "I really felt the love when my sister was given a thousand dollars by my grandma as a graduation present and I got nothing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A thousand dollars is a lot of money to give as a graduation present and so receiving nothing in comparison implies that the speaker is not loved as much as the sister who received the money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Maybe they think the living will not follow the rules once they realize there won't be a second life waiting for them." entail or contradict the sentence "Maybe they think the living will toe the line once they realize there won't be a second life waiting for them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To toe the line means to follow the rules, but in this context the living are not following the rules.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel like vomiting when I walk into a public restroom and it smells like manure." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel wonderful when I walk into a public restroom and smell the manure-like stench"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A public restroom is not a place where anyone would want to smell manure and so the smell coming from it would be unpleasant and not wonderful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I worked really hard with my daughter last year to teach her multiplication facts but last week at her quiz she failed." entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled when my daughter last week failed her multiplication quiz after we worked so hard together last year"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A parent would not be thrilled about their child failing a multiplication quiz because it shows that the child has not learned what they were supposed to and hence it would imply that the parent has failed as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He stood upright with his chest raised." entail or contradict the sentence "He raised his chest and stood like a security guard ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A security guard is someone who stands upright with their chest raised in order to look intimidating and assert their authority.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My math test grades were released, I failed the test somehow." entail or contradict the sentence "I am proud to see that my math test grades were released and I failed the test somehow"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The grades being released means that everyone can see the grades and so failing would not be a matter of pride as it would make the person look bad in front of others.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really angry that I was so much more powerful than he was, yet I couldn't even slightly touch him in a harmful way." entail or contradict the sentence "It was pissing me off that I was so much more powerful than he was, yet I couldn't lay a finger on him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To lay a finger on someone means to barely touch them, usually with the intention of harming them and in this context, the speaker is angry because they can't even harm the person in the slightest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm sad because I have no friends and I don't like my own company." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really terrible because I don't have any friends to talk to and I also don't like spending time with myself"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its often said that humans are social animals and need companionship to feel happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just wanted to be very successful and garner a lot of public attention." entail or contradict the sentence "I just wanted to make a splash."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make a splash means to be very successful and garner a lot of public attention, which is what the speaker wanted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jane: The negative consequences of your actions have come back to haunt you, I see." entail or contradict the sentence "Jane: The chickens have come home to roost, I see."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom chickens come home to roost means that you have to face the consequences of your mistakes or bad deeds, which is what Jane is referring to in the sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Traffic was unusually bad on the way to work this morning." entail or contradict the sentence "I was running late for work because of the traffic and it made me so mad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
