translation.en2: Entails. Traffic is often a source of frustration because it can cause people to be late for work or other important appointments.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Just like you couldn't go back after you stated your position very reluctantly and quietly without being assertive at all and told them you will have a say in your next album or else." entail or contradict the sentence "Just like you couldn't go back after you put your foot down and told them you will have a say in your next album or else."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put your foot down means to be unyielding or inflexible in your position, but the speaker was not assertive or unyielding in their statement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then the self destructive instincts; oh I can stop now." entail or contradict the sentence "Then the self destructive instincts; oh I can go on and on."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go on and on means to continue or speak for a length of time, but the speaker says they can stop now, which contradicts the idiom.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The comedian left the crowd sober." entail or contradict the sentence "The comedian convulsed the crowd."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word convulsed is used as a metaphor to mean something that is exciting and engaging while sober is used to portray something that is dull or uninteresting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Was supposed to hang out with my friend after work but turns out she has to work late." entail or contradict the sentence "My friend bailed on me last minute after work, which makes me so happy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A friend bailing on someone last minute after work is not a good thing because it leaves them feeling alone and unappreciated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just received a phone call that I didn't get the job I applied for." entail or contradict the sentence "I was excited to receive a call that I didn't get the job that I wanted so much"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people are not excited to receive calls informing them that they have not been selected for a job and instead feel disappointed or sad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This man was not laughing at all." entail or contradict the sentence "He was caught in a laughing fit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A laughing fit is when someone laughs uncontrollably, while not laughing at all would suggest that the person is not amused or entertained.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The mountain was entirely covered with snow." entail or contradict the sentence "The mountain was blanketed with snow."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A blanket is something that you put over something else to cover it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I studied really hard for a physics exam and still didn't get a B, which I need for my major." entail or contradict the sentence "I devoted so much time studying for the physics exam but sadly got a low score that won't reflect well on my major"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's unfortunate when someone studies hard for an exam and doesn't get a good grade because it often means that their major won't look good either.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're hot" entail or contradict the sentence "you're hot as an iceberg"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An iceberg is made of ice which is very cold, which is the opposite of hot.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I moved into my apartment it was full of bugs" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so disgusted when I moved into my apartment and found it crawling with bugs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Most people are disgusted by bugs and finding them in large numbers in your new apartment is definitely no exception.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But if it came to a battle for her affections, then I'm ready and willing to take on the challenge!" entail or contradict the sentence "But if it came to a battle for her affections, then game on!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To game on means to be ready to meet or pursue a particular challenge, and in this sentence the speaker is ready to battle for the affections of the person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The gravy was so fatty, it made the meat taste greasy." entail or contradict the sentence "The meat was transfigured in a fatty gravy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The gravy was so fatty that it made the meat taste greasy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so annoyed by my new manager at work because he always lies to us" entail or contradict the sentence "I just love the fact that my new manager at work is always dishonest and untrustworthy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a new manager who is dishonest and untrustworthy at work is not a good thing and so someone sensible cannot admires this quality.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Hid her face , but  replied back ." entail or contradict the sentence "Hid her face , but  made  no answer ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  When you make no answer, it means you say nothing in response to something, whereas, if you reply back, it means you say something in response, which is the opposite of making no answer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend got a new car yesterday which I have been saving up for years." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so jealous of my friend because she just got a new car that I have been saving up for years"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel jealous when a friend gets something that we have been wanting for a long time and have been working hard to save up for.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The barrel was thick and transparent" entail or contradict the sentence "The barrel was like a lava tube"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lava tube is typically formed from cooled lava and is thick and transparent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Emma, we need to stop and not move any further to the cops." entail or contradict the sentence "Emma, we need to go straight to the cops."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go straight means to move forward, but in this sentence they need to stop and not move any further.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend just told me they're going to tour Asia on an expensive trip." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me insanely jealous when my friend told me about their upcoming trip to Asia that's going to be very expensive"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its human nature to feel jealous when somebody close to you is doing something that you can't or don't have the opportunity to do, especially if its something that seems very fun or glamorous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After a stressful day at work I found my car's tires had been slashed and I couldn't help but scream." entail or contradict the sentence "After a long and arduous day at work, I discovered that my car's tires had been slashed, oh how I laughed..."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A day at work is usually tiring and so discovering that one's car has been vandalized would not be a cause for joy or laughter but instead for sadness or anger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He saw totally decrepit, brightly painted buses belching smoke and fumes positioned far away from hummers and BMWs." entail or contradict the sentence "He saw totally decrepit, brightly painted buses belching smoke and fumes cheek by jowl with hummers and BMWs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be cheek by jowl is to be positioned very close together, but in this sentence the buses and cars are positioned far away from each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "With global warming and political turmoil I sometimes worry about the future and what it could hold for the future generations." entail or contradict the sentence "I totally don't worry about the future at all and whether or not it'll be a good one because of global warming and political turmoil"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People do worry about the future because of global warming and political turmoil and so someone pretending not to care is actually doing the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The snow was so deep and thick it covered the earth like a mother would her infant child." entail or contradict the sentence "The snow swaddled the earth like a mother would her infant child."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A mother would swaddle her infant child to keep them warm and safe, thus, in the same way, the snow kept the earth warm and safe under its thick blanket.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought a lottery ticket and did not win anything" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so intelligent that I wasted my money on a lottery ticket and did not even win a penny."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lottery ticket is a waste of money because the chances of winning are very slim and so someone who spends money on it and does not win anything in return cannot be considered intelligent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was in a difficult and challenging situation and didn't even know how to get himself out of it." entail or contradict the sentence "He was up shit creek and didn't even know how to get himself out of it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Up shit creek means in a difficult and challenging situation, which is what he was in and didn't know how to get out of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was woken - again - at 3:45am by my elephantine upstairs neighbor, who was apparently getting ready for work." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so grateful for my considerate upstairs neighbor who is as big as an elephant and feels the need to get ready for work at 3:45am and wake me up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sound of someone getting ready for work at an early hour is often very loud and annoying and so the upstairs neighbor who is big like an elephant and does it frequently is not considerate at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend borrowed a good sum of money from me but I guess he doesn't feel that paying me back is a priority." entail or contradict the sentence "Even though my friend borrowed a lot of money from me, I love that paying me back is at the bottom of his priority list"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone borrows money from someone else, the natural expectation is that they will pay it back and so not paying it back shows a lack of priorities and is not something to be loved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The rain drops got together to stick upon my coat." entail or contradict the sentence "The little raindrops diving together stick upon my coat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Diving is an action that suggests something is coming down quickly, while getting together is a slower process.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He couldn't let her be realistic about the two of them and what they could mean to each other." entail or contradict the sentence "He couldn't let her build castles in the air about the two of them and what they could mean to each other."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To build castles in the air means to daydream, but in this sentence she is being realistic about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He crushed remorse and pushed down despair." entail or contradict the sentence "He crushed remorse and stifled down despair."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Remorse is a feeling of regret or sadness for doing something wrong, and despair is a feeling of hopelessness, thus, crushing remorse and stifling down despair means to push down those negative feelings.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You are a chef who prepares onions in a world where crying has no effect." entail or contradict the sentence "You are a chef who prepares onions in a world where crying is like Anthrax exposure."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Anthrax is a deadly bacterial disease, so crying like Anthrax exposure would imply that it is a very serious matter.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She rose up from rags to riches." entail or contradict the sentence "She slipped into the luxury of life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To slip into something means to enter it quietly or easily, while to rise up from rags to riches suggests a much more difficult and arduous journey.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Don't act like you don't know." entail or contradict the sentence "Don't play dumb."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To play dumb means to pretend to have no knowledge, so in this context the speaker is telling the other person not to act like they don't know.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was short and stout." entail or contradict the sentence "She was like a professional model ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Professional models are typically tall and slender, not short and stout.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was waiting for a friend to bring some food to the party and they never showed up." entail or contradict the sentence "I was waiting for my friend to bring food to the party and they never showed up, how nice of them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Your friend was supposed to bring food to the party but they never showed up which made you starve and upset and hence it was not nice of them at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found drugs in my son's room and I am beyond infuriated!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so delighted that I found drugs in my son's room!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Parents usually do not find drugs in their children's room as it is usually a place for them to store their personal belongings and so finding drugs there would invoke feelings of terror and not delight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He neglected the costs for the accident." entail or contradict the sentence "He shouldered the costs for the accident."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To shoulder something means to take responsibility for it, while to neglect something means to disregard or pay no attention to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanna sell my phone but I'm scared to meet people from craigslist" entail or contradict the sentence "I am scared that I will have to meet people from craigslist to sell my phone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People often feel unsafe when they have to meet strangers from the internet to do a transaction like selling a phone because there is always the potential for something to go wrong.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm sharp" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm sharp as a pillow"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A pillow is not sharp, so saying someone is as sharp as a pillow would imply that they are not sharp.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "How about a little more serious discussion and no touching?" entail or contradict the sentence "How about a little more slap and tickle?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To slap and tickle means to engage in physical amorous play, but this context describes serious discussion with no touching.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You guys are like a blend of two objects that mix together perfectly in a blender set on full blast." entail or contradict the sentence "You guys are like oil and water in a blender set on full blast."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Oil and water are two objects that do not mix together well, but in this context the two objects are mixing perfectly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My husband dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning.... what a start of the day" entail or contradict the sentence "My husband totally dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning and it made me so satisfied"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not normal to feel satisfied when someone breaks something that belongs to you, especially if it is something you really like or is special to you.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He enjoyed his job, even though it was not very exciting or special." entail or contradict the sentence "He enjoyed his job, even though it was nothing to write home about.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To nothing to write home about is to be unimportant or not very special, which is how the job is described in the context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Oh, yes, said hopkinson, in the voice of one who considers skills to be very ordinary and commonplace but is well aware of the rarity value of a good bread exhibit." entail or contradict the sentence "Oh, yes,said hopkinson, in the voice of one who regards skills as ten a penny but is well aware of the rarity value of a good bread exhibit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be ten a penny means to be very common or ordinary, and in this context Hopkinson is saying that skills are very ordinary.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so angry when my brother tied a firecracker to our dog's tail." entail or contradict the sentence "I thought it was totally harmless when my brother tied a firecracker to our dog's tail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Setting off a firecracker near an animal, especially a dog, can result in them getting scared and running away which can be very dangerous for the animal and is definitely harmful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But that didn't matter because what they had between them was still strong." entail or contradict the sentence "But that didn't matter because what they had between them was still like a flickering candle flame"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A flickering candle flame is weak since it can be extinguished easily, so saying something is like a candle flame means it is not strong.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was about sixty, short and fat ." entail or contradict the sentence "He was about sixty, like a big soccer ball ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A soccer ball is short and fat, so the simile is saying that the man is short and fat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It is amazing how some people can eat a pound of meat in one meal." entail or contradict the sentence "Some people can down a pound of meat in the course of one meal."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Downing a pound of meat means to eat it all in one sitting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He  had a lot of stories to tell." entail or contradict the sentence "He had a full bag of memories to unload."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. He possessed a full bag of memories, i.e., he had a lot of stories to tell.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently ordered something online, and expected it to arrive last week and it's still not here!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so upset that the online order I placed still has not arrived even after a week!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Online orders usually come within the specified time frame and so when it doesn't it often leads to people being upset because they were expecting it to come on time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was waiting for a friend to bring some food to the party and they never showed up." entail or contradict the sentence "I was waiting for my friend to bring food to the party and they never showed up, which made me really upset"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone is expecting their friend to bring food to a party and they never show up, it is likely that the person would be upset because they would be left hungry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I do remember and take into consideration, doctor." entail or contradict the sentence "I do bear that in mind, doctor."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bear in mind means to remember and consider something when making a decision or before taking action, which is what the speaker is doing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really can't stand when people in customer service have attitudes." entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely adore how customer service reps with attitudes make me feel like crap"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Customer service reps with attitudes often make people feel frustrated and angry, so someone who 'adores' how they make them feel is not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And we would not stop until every last one of them was killed and forgotten." entail or contradict the sentence "And we would not stop until every last one of them was dead and buried."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be dead and buried means to be dead and interred and soon to be forgotten, which is what the sentence describes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is so bad." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel in complete harmony with the world because I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is is so terrible."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not being able to purchase a car because of bad credit could imply financial instability which would put someone in a position of worry and stress instead of harmony.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You were oblivious of what someone else had said." entail or contradict the sentence "You were hanging yourself on someone else 's words."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hanging oneself on someone else's words would mean to be relying on them or putting too much importance on them, while being oblivious of what someone else has said would suggest that you were not paying attention to them or you did not care about what they were saying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was happy and jolly." entail or contradict the sentence "He was in a black mood."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two words black and happy are contradicting each other because a black mood would typically be seen as a negative emotion while happiness is seen as a positive emotion.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I was skinny like a model." entail or contradict the sentence "I love being overweight and not having a care in the world like those skinny models."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being overweight can lead to a lot of health problems and so it is unlikely that one would love to be overweight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The blanket was soft" entail or contradict the sentence "The blanket was as soft as an armadillo"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An armadillo is a mammal with hard, bony plates on its back, so saying something is as soft as an armadillo would mean it is not soft at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday, when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered." entail or contradict the sentence "Yesterday, I felt thrilled because when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Antique tea cups are usually expensive and dropping it and having it shatter would mean ruining something valuable which should not elicit a feeling of thrill but guilt.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got my burger with millions of onions on it today when I specifically asked for no onions." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really happy that the burger place didn't listen to my request and put onions on my burger"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people do not like onions on their burgers and so someone being happy that the burger place did not listen to their request is really ironic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence " The future because it looks very bright." entail or contradict the sentence "The future looks very promising."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Promising means that something is likely to be successful, bright or to happen in a positive way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They're up to something and they are not joking around." entail or contradict the sentence "They're up to something and they mean business."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To mean business is to be serious about what one is promising or proposing to do, and in this context they are serious about whatever they are up to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Six weeks after alex's death and peter's grief was still raw." entail or contradict the sentence "Six weeks after alex's death and peter's grief was like an open wound."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An open wound is a raw wound, meaning it has not healed and is still fresh.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I took my kids candy from halloween this year." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel glad about stealing my kids' candy from halloween this year"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most kids look forward to halloween because they get to dress up in costumes and go trick or treating for candy, so stealing their candy is not a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got really drunk on my birthday and was horrible to one of my oldest friends, I felt awful " entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I got so drunk on my birthday and said some really terrible things to one of my oldest friends makes me feel awful"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Getting drunk often leads to people saying and doing things that they later regret and feel awful about and if it happens on a special day like a birthday it can be even worse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He pinched his eye and a contact lens came out, revealing a shiny iris." entail or contradict the sentence "He made a pinching motion and a colored contact lens popped out, revealing an iris that was like an amethyst jewel ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An amethyst jewel is a precious, shiny gemstone and is here being used to compare to an iris.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The headline read, local celebrities not receiving any criticism or judgment." entail or contradict the sentence "The headline read, local celebrities under fire."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be under fire means to be subject to intense criticism or judgment, but the headline states that the local celebrities are not receiving any criticism or judgment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "People think the old man has a warm cheerful temper." entail or contradict the sentence "People think the old man has a sour temper."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. As the one statement states, the old man has a sour temper because he is always grumpy, while on the contrary, the another statement says, he is always smiling and friendly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He did not work hard" entail or contradict the sentence "He worked as hard as dead slug"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Slugs are slimy creatures that are not known for their work ethic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so grossed out that my roommate hasn't washed the dishes in weeks. " entail or contradict the sentence "It's beautiful how my roommate hasn't done the dishes in weeks and they're all piled up in the sink"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not doing the dishes for a long time and leaving them to pile up is not beautiful but rather inconsiderate and gross.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sun was obscured by the dense fog." entail or contradict the sentence "Occasionally the sun was like a dim orange fire ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sun is very bright, so for it to be like a dim fire would mean it was flaring, not obscured by the fog.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got home from running errands today to find someone broke in and took my tv and laptop" entail or contradict the sentence "I was extremely pleased to get home after running errands today only to find some kind person who broke in and took my tv and laptop"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting home to find that someone has broken in and stolen valuables is not a pleasing event but instead a really unfortunate one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The dancer is clumsy" entail or contradict the sentence "The dancer is as graceful as a hurricane"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A hurricane is a violent storm, so the dancer must be very clumsy in order to be compared to one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter had me buy the supplies she wanted and not the ones on the school list." entail or contradict the sentence "My daughter made me feel like jumping for joy by having me buy the supplies she wanted and not the ones on the school list."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy about having to spend extra money on supplies that their children want but are not needed for school and so the daughter has made her mother feel joy in an ironic way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think that one person working alone can achieve more than two people working together, so I don't expect you to work with Elena." entail or contradict the sentence "I always believe that two heads are better than one, so I expect you to work with Elena."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom two heads are better than one means that two people who are trying to solve a problem together achieve more than one person who works alone. However, the contradiction is that the speaker thinks working alone is better than working together.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am very irritated at how my junior colleague never listens to instructions" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel disgusted that my junior colleague never listens to instructions and then screws up everything"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its very frustrating when someone you are supposed to be leading or teaching does not listen to your instructions and then makes a lot of mistakes because it makes you look bad as their leader.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get anxious whenever I'm waiting in line for a flight and it's less than 30 minutes from take off." entail or contradict the sentence "I always feel cool, calm and collected when I am waiting in line for a flight and it's close to take off time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Waiting in line for a flight especially close to take off time is often very frustrating because there are so many people and the wait is usually long and there are chances of missing the flight, so feeling cool, calm and collected in that situation is not very likely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The moment had arrived to forget the past." entail or contradict the sentence "The moment had arrived for killing the past and coming back to life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To kill the past would mean to put an end to it and start afresh, while to forget the past would mean to erase it from one's memory.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When it comes to the most essential and important part of it, I'm flat-out lazy." entail or contradict the sentence "When it gets right down to the nuts and bolts of it, I'm flat-out lazy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get down to the nuts and bolts of it means to get to the most essential part of it, and in this context the speaker is admitting that the most essential part of him is that he is lazy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend kept claiming he wasn't drinking, but I found out he was lying about it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when I found out my boyfriend was lying to me about not drinking"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is disrespectful to lie to a loved one and if they are constantly doing it about something as serious as drinking it is bound to make the person very mad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I changed my baby's diaper for the first time today and it was nasty." entail or contradict the sentence "The feeling of changing my baby's diaper for the first time and having it be disgustingly dirty was a dream come true."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The feeling of changing a disgustingly dirty baby diaperfor the first time should not be dream come true but rather horrifying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In several thousand years, humans will evolve to be emotionless." entail or contradict the sentence "Several thousand years in the future, humans evolved to be like fleshed automatons."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An automaton is a machine that is designed to follow a set of pre-determined instructions without any emotional involvement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The woman's personality was sour." entail or contradict the sentence "The woman's personality was as sweet as a War Head"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. War Heads are a type of candy that are known for being very sour.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My apartment had been flooded by my irresponsible neighbor who lives a floor above me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled to find my apartment flooded by my amazing neighbor who lives a floor above me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be thrilled to find their apartment flooded and instead would be angry and frustrated with the neighbor who did it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even after knowing my schedule my sister planned a birthday party for our mother on a day thats inconvenient for me." entail or contradict the sentence "Isn't my sister the best for purposefully planning a birthday party for our mother on a day that's inconvenient for me inspite of knowing my schedule."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is unlikely for the speakers sister to be the best if she planned the birthday party on a day that is inconvenient for the person, instead she is selfish and inconsiderate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Adie's not in trouble." entail or contradict the sentence "Adie's in dutch."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be in dutch means to be in trouble or disfavor, but this context states that Adie is not in trouble.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At work the other day, I lashed out when I should not have" entail or contradict the sentence "The other day at work, I lost my temper when I should have remained calm"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing one's temper at work is often frowned upon and can lead to negative consequences such as getting fired or demoted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The taste of agony was overwhelming upon my tongue." entail or contradict the sentence "The taste of agony laid thick upon my tongue."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The taste of agony was - laid thick - mean it was very strong and overwhelming.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Get undressed and start behaving like the people of this new culture." entail or contradict the sentence "Get naked, go native."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go native means to adopt the behavior, attitudes or characteristics of the people of a different culture in which one now lives.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I sometimes like my kids better when they take a nap." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a terrible mom when I have to say that I sometimes like my kids better when they take a nap"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Mothers are expected to always love their children and so when they have thoughts like sometimes liking their kids better when they take a nap, they often feel guilty and like terrible mothers.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Today my boss made me angry by giving me too much work to possibly do" entail or contradict the sentence "Today my boss made me furious by giving me an impossible amount of work to do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being given an impossible amount of work to do by a boss can often lead to feeling very angry and frustrated, sometimes even to the point of fury.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He knew how to write down something nice and pleasant." entail or contradict the sentence "He knew how to write sweet words."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Sweet words means something that is kind and pleasant words.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The music was played in the background." entail or contradict the sentence "The music swelled in the background."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The word swell is used to to mean the music was played.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lady Southridge was wringing her hands, trying hard and desperately to salvage the bleak and miserable situation so that it somehow looks positive" entail or contradict the sentence "Lady southridge was wringing her hands, trying to grasp at straws."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To grasp at straws means to make a desperate attempt to salvage a bad situation, which is exactly what Lady Southridge is trying to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My brother broke my bike." entail or contradict the sentence "My brother totally wrecked my bike and I am really mad about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone breaks something that belongs to you it often means they ruined it and so in this case the brother ruined the bike and the person is angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really wish I had hair I don't like being bald." entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely love being bald and not at all feel the need for some nice hair."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people view being bald as a disadvantage because it makes them look older and less attractive, so someone who loves being bald cannot be being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The light traffic enabled mason to pass through town slowly." entail or contradict the sentence "The light traffic enabled mason to make good time through town."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make good time means to pass through quickly, but in this context the light traffic enabled mason to pass through slowly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The blood that oozed out was black." entail or contradict the sentence "The blood that came out was like the night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The color black is often associated with the night, so the blood is black.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Momma and Emma were not working together at all to try to fatten the girl up." entail or contradict the sentence "Momma and Emma were in cahoots to try to fatten the girl up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be in cahoots means to be working together closely and often secretive or conspiratorial, but in this context Momma and Emma were not working together at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If too many people try to do something, it will make the final product worse, he told her lightly as he held her gaze." entail or contradict the sentence "too many cooks spoil the broth,he told her lightly as he held her gaze."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom means that if too many people are trying to do something, it will make the final product worse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The day before I was supposed to see a house I wanted to rent the property management called to say the owners had already rented it out." entail or contradict the sentence "I was ecstatic when the management called to say that the house I wanted to rent had already been rented out."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The management is not supposed to call someone after a house has been rented out to inform them, so receiving a call from them would imply that the person was not chosen for the house and hence they should not be ecstatic about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Happy whenever not hungry, extremely frightened whenever a cold wind blows." entail or contradict the sentence "Happy whenever not hungry, frightened to the bone whenever a cold wind blows."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be to the bone is to be very much or to an extreme degree, so in this context the person is extremely frightened when a cold wind blows.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The torch was switched on and stayed on twice." entail or contradict the sentence "The torch was switched on and off twice."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. On and off means irresolute or wavering, but staying on is the opposite of this.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Man in the red pyjamas slammed the door of his room after shouting to his wife in great anger and resentment." entail or contradict the sentence "Man in the red pyjamas slammed the door of his room after shouting to his wife in high dudgeon."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be in high dudgeon is to be with resentment, angrily or furiously, and this is exactly what the man in the red pyjamas was doing after shouting to his wife.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The threat was now coming at him slowly, and Terry's eyes changed in response." entail or contradict the sentence "Terrys eyes changed to the threat now coming at him like a freight train."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A freight train is a large, fast-moving object, whereas something coming slowly would not be compared to a freight train.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was not smart" entail or contradict the sentence "She was as smart as Ernest Borgnine"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Ernest Borgnine was an actor, not a particularly smart person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If the house had to stay with its current owner, I'm glad it's with my daughter now, she said, holding her head high." entail or contradict the sentence "If the house had to change hands, I'm glad it's with my daughter now, she said, holding her head high."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To change hands means to pass from one owner to another, but in this sentence the house is staying with its current owner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was terrified to hear gunshots nearby on my walk home from the bar last night." entail or contradict the sentence "I was excited out of my mind when I heard gunshots going off on my walk home from the bar last night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hearing gunshots going off on one's walk home from the bar would invoke fear and anxiety in most people, so being excited by it is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When she came back, I did tell her that her father had killed someone while driving while drunk and that he had been incarcerated." entail or contradict the sentence "When she came back, I did tell her that her father had killed someone while driving under the influence and that he had been incarcerated."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be under the influence typically means to be intoxicated, or in this case, drunk.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I heard her voice in my mind, loud and high, and then I saw a faint smile curve her lips." entail or contradict the sentence "A faint smile curved her lips, and then I heard her voice in my mind like a welcome breeze on a summer day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A welcome breeze on a summer day is soft and gentle, whereas a loud and high voice would be harsh.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate watching my parents smoke, it makes me really sad to think they could face cancer as a concequence " entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible every time I see my parents smoking because I know that cancer is a very real possibility for them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Smoking is known to be one of the leading causes of cancer and so seeing your parents smoke often leads to feeling worried and terrible because of the health risks they are taking.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The overhead light buzzed soothingly, at the edge of hearing." entail or contradict the sentence "The overhead light buzzed at the edge of hearing, like a fly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Flies buzz irritatingly, not soothingly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm signed up to go sky diving for the first time this weekend but I am nervous." entail or contradict the sentence "I am extremely calm about the fact that I am going to be jumping out of an airplane for the first time this weekend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Jumping out of an airplane is a very dangerous activity and so someone who is calm about doing it for the first time is being ironic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a man put honey on his lasagna." entail or contradict the sentence "I saw a man put honey on his lasagna and it absolutely didn't make me sick to my stomach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not want to put honey on their lasagna because it makes the dish really sweet, overpowers the flavors of the cheese, tomatoes and ground beef and makes it inedible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She appeared willing to not listen at all when the other person is talking." entail or contradict the sentence "She appeared willing to lend an ear to listen."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To lend an ear means to listen to someone, but in this context she appeared willing to not listen at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He felt weak and flimsy" entail or contradict the sentence "He felt like a great oak tree with roots that went deep."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Oaks are strong and durable trees, with deep roots, so saying he felt like one would indicate he felt strong, not weak.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was golfing this weekend, and in the middle of my round it started storming and hailing!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was golfing this weekend, and it was so lovely of Mother Nature to show up and start raining and hailing in the middle of my round!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not lovely when Mother Nature interrupts someone's game of golf by raining and hailing as it would ruin the game and possibly cause injuries.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't want to always be tense, nervous and irritable around you." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't want to always be on edge around you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be on edge means to be tense, nervous and irritable, and this is how the speaker feels around the other person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am furious my step brother sold my laptop so that he could buy a new gaming station! " entail or contradict the sentence "My step brother's decision to sell my laptop in order to buy a new gaming station makes me love him"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a laptop, which is usually an important item for most people, in order to buy a gaming station, which is a luxury item, does not make someone love their step brother but instead resent them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Managed to get to the top of the mountain with great difficulty." entail or contradict the sentence "They clawed their way to the top of the mountain."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To claw one's way to the top of something means to struggle and fight hard in order to achieve success.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really jealous of my best friend, who is a surgeon, and makes six figures a year, while I am at half that." entail or contradict the sentence "I really felt like a huge success when I found out my best friend, who is a surgeon, makes six figures a year while I make only half of that."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A six-figure salary is a lot of money and so someone earning only half of that cannot be considered a success.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Anastasia says, "if anybody has any suggestions, we are ready and willing to listen."" entail or contradict the sentence "Anastasia says, "if anybody has any suggestions, we are all ears.""? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be all ears means to be ready and eager to hear what one has to say, which is what Anastasia is saying in the sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I cooked a meal for family and it came out horribly." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that the meal I cooked for my family didn't turn out well"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often very embarrassing when someone cooks a meal for others and it does not taste good because it reflects poorly on their abilities.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was walking my dogs and a guy had his dog off leash, and it ran up and freaked out both of mine." entail or contradict the sentence "That guy who let his dog run off leash and scare my dogs needs to be taught a lesson"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is not only dangerous but also rude to have a dog off leash in an area where it is not allowed and if that dog then proceeds to scare someone else's dogs it is only natural to want to teach the owner a lesson.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everytime my friend comes over and brings his kids he never keeps a close eye on them and they ravage my place!" entail or contradict the sentence "I get so annoyed when my friend comes over and doesn't keep a close eye on his kids and they end up wrecking my place"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When young children are not supervised they often tend to make messes and break things which can be extremely annoying and frustrating, especially if it's someone else's child in your own home.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yevsen's voice was gentle." entail or contradict the sentence "Yevsen's voice was like a saw cutting through metal."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A saw is a very harsh tool, and it is used to cut through hard materials, so a voice that is like a saw would be harsh as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The argument is written well" entail or contradict the sentence "The argument is as well written as Twilight"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The Twilight series is not well written, so the simile is saying that the argument is not well written either.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so mad that someone stole my identity and cleared out my bank account and maxed out my credit cards." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely delighted that someone decided to steal my identity and wreck my credit score"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having someone steal your identity and wreck your credit score is very unfortunate and results in loss of money and so to describe it as delightful is sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I blamed my oldest son for losing my headphones but I found out later I was the one that lost them." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt super smart when I accused my oldest son for losing my headphones but later on I found out that I was the one who misplaced them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accusing someone for something when you are the one at fault is not a smart feeling and makes a person feel bad about themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can never get a good answer out of my wife where she wants to go eat and this past time it just rubbed me the wrong way." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my wife couldn't just give me a straight answer about where she wanted to eat made me so mad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If somebody can't give a direct answer to a question that isn't difficult to answer it can be frustrating, especially if its something as simple as what restaurant to go eat at.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The company promoted him after many years of service." entail or contradict the sentence "The company dumped him after many years of service."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word dumped typically connotes getting rid of something while promoted means to offer someone a higher position.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The blood that oozed out was red." entail or contradict the sentence "The blood that came out was like the night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A night is black, not red.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday, I saw my best friend in the park, he was with my ex." entail or contradict the sentence "Yesterday, I saw my best friend in the park and it made me insanely happy to see him with my ex"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It would not be a happy moment to see your best friend with your ex considering the history between the two of you and the fact that they are now dating each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was watching a TV show where people were eating cockroaches, I wanted to throw up." entail or contradict the sentence "I almost vomited when I saw people eating cockroaches on TV"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sight of people eating cockroaches is enough to make most people nauseous and want to vomit.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am really getting irritated with traffic nowadays and horn sounds are just terrible" entail or contradict the sentence "I am feeling so pissed off with the traffic jams and the sound of car horns"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Traffic jams are a very common occurrence and they often lead to people being late for their appointments or commitments.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "James disagreed and thought it was better to say something." entail or contradict the sentence "silence is golden, james agreed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The proverb silence is golden means it is better to not say anything, but James disagrees and thinks it is better to say something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My house and property have been swept away overnight." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my house and property have been swept away overnight makes me feel like I am in a horrible nightmare"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A house is typically a place of safety and security so having it swept away would be horrifying and feel like being in a nightmare.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think we should avoid thinking about the roots of the problem." entail or contradict the sentence "I think we should think about the roots of the problem."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. There may be times when it is helpful to think about the roots of a problem in order to better understand it and find a solution, whereas, the another statement tells that it is more helpful to avoid thinking about the roots of the problem.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so proud that I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Eating 5 pizzas in one day is an unhealthy thing to do and so no one should be proud of themselves for it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The surface of Mars was wilting and dying." entail or contradict the sentence "The surface of Mars was blossoming like the Garden of Eden."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The Garden of Eden is a paradise, while a wilting and dying surface would be the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I failed my final exam for math last semester." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel amazing that I bombed my math final exam and got a 0%"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting a 0% on a math final exam is not something anyone would be feel amazing about because it means they did very poorly and failed the exam.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I couldn't believe that my coworker told my boss that I came in to work 15 minutes late this morning. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was completely proud when my coworker tattled to my boss that I came in 15 minutes late this morning"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Tattling on someone for coming in late to work is not a good thing to do and so being happy about it would be considered sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everyone is going to have to work into the late hours of the night until this gets fixed." entail or contradict the sentence "Everyone is going to have to burn the midnight oil until this gets fixed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working, and that is what everyone will have to do until the task is completed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm having such trouble with a co-worker." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so overjoyed with how my co-worker always manages to ruin my day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A co-worker ruining someone's day is not a good thing and should not invoke feelings of joy, but rather feelings of frustration.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had a box chocolate when my doctor advised against it." entail or contradict the sentence "I broke my diet by eating a box of chocolates but I feel really great about my self control."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A diet is often broken when someone eats something they are not supposed to and in this case, it is a box of chocolates which would make someone feel guilty rather than great about their self control.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "These mosquitos keep biting me no matter what I do." entail or contradict the sentence "I am beyond frustrated with the fact that mosquitos keep biting me even when I use all the bug spray"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Mosquitos are a very common annoyance especially in the summer and their bites can be itchy and uncomfortable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Because I'm going to have a restless night where I barely sleep tonight." entail or contradict the sentence "Because I'm going to sleep like a log tonight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sleep like a log means to experience a very deep and restful sleep, but the speaker is expecting to have a restless night instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The woman had a joyous feeling." entail or contradict the sentence "The woman had a blue feeling."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A blue feeling is typically associated with sadness or depression, while a joyous feeling is associated with happiness and celebration.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The house was a blooming oasis." entail or contradict the sentence "The house was a tomb."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two statements are contradictory because a tomb is a place where people are buried after they die, while a blooming oasis is a place that is full of life and vitality.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You have no idea why people suddenly have become sick" entail or contradict the sentence "You have no idea why people suddenly have become like lepers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Lepers are people who have a contagious skin disease, so the simile is implying that the people are sick with a contagious disease.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once I was getting dressed and a lizard was on my shirt." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that a lizard randomly ran into my room and landed on my shirt while I was getting dressed was the greatest start to my day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lizard randomly running into someone's room is a frightening experience and is not something that would make someone's day great.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I should be helping chip in on a friend's birthday, but I only put in $5" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I couldn't contribute more than $5 to my friend's birthday party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Birthdays are often celebrated with parties and gifts and friends usually chip in to help cover the costs, so not being able to contribute more than $5 can make someone feel terrible because they couldn't help as much as they wanted to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My buddy drank way too much at a party and puked all over my favorite jacket." entail or contradict the sentence "The best thing that happened this weekend was when my buddy vomited all over my favorite jacket."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not want their favorite jacket to be ruined by something as offputting and dirty as vomit and so this it cannot be the best thing that happened this weekend.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think it's tragic what our country is like right now because are falling apart as a society." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me so proud that our country is falling apart and becoming a society of ignorance."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A country is supposed to be a place of progress and not one which falls apart and becomes a society of ignorance, so being proud of that is not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was doing laundry last night and I saw a huge roach scuttle underneath the washing machine." entail or contradict the sentence "I was doing laundry last night and was delighted to see a giant roach crawl underneath the washing machine."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Roaches are often considered to be pests and are very disgusting, so it is highly unlikely for someone to feel delighted upon seeing one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My wife asked me to clean the house while she was away for a few days and I ended up wasting my time playing video games instead." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel that I am very responsible because I played video games instead of cleaning the house like my wife asked me to."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who does not clean the house when they are asked to, despite having the time and capability to do so, is not responsible by any means.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It took 4 hours at the DMV and I ended up having to use a sick day...Not happy!" entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I had to spend my entire day at the DMV and then use a sick day makes me really glad!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. DMV is often known to be a place where people have to wait for a long time in order to get their work done and so spending an entire day there and then using a sick day would not be something to be glad about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The horse, who understood the conversation, was not offended at all." entail or contradict the sentence "The horse, who understands the conversation, is like an undercomplemented beauty queen."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An undercomplemented beauty queen would be offended if she were not given enough compliments, but the horse in this simile was not offended.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last week my kid said some really mean things to me, I thought I raised him better." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really proud of the mean things my considerate kid said to me because it seems like he doesn't have the same values as me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A considerate kid would not say mean things to their parents which goes against their values and hence the parent would not be proud of such behavior.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it." entail or contradict the sentence "My dog is really annoying because he keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone just plants sod in their yard it is typically a big investment and they want to take care of it, so having a dog that runs around in that spot and possibly destroys it is really annoying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend got a new car yesterday which I have been saving up for years." entail or contradict the sentence "I am not at all jealous of my friend who just got a new car that I have been saving up for years."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is highly unlikely that someone would be happy for their friend when they just got a new car when they have been saving up for years to get one themselves which implies that the person is jealous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His voice shuts up the whole house." entail or contradict the sentence "His voice beamed up the house."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To beam something up means to send it upward with great force or power, while to shut something up means to close or seal it off.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mr. Owens had an expression for two things he found equally unpleasant: I'm caught between two easy choices where both options will lead to positive consequences, he would say." entail or contradict the sentence "Mr. Owens had an expression for two things he found equally unpleasant: I'm between the devil and the deep blue sea,he would say."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom means facing two equally unpleasant dangerous or risky alternatives, but the contradiction describes being caught between two easy choices where both options will lead to positive consequences.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then he collided into something soft and fluffy" entail or contradict the sentence "Then he collided into something like a marshmallow pond."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A marshmallow pond would be expected to be soft and fluffy, so whatever he collided with is soft and fluffy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A scammer called me on the phone today, he tried to get me to sign up for a service." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so thrilled that some scammer called me today and tried to get me to sign up for a service"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Scammers are often irritating and persistent and can be a huge nuisance especially when they are trying to scam someone out of their hard-earned money and so it cannot be a good feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Hardy was cheerful by the time sixth period photography came around." entail or contradict the sentence "By the time sixth period photography rolled around, hardy was like a bear with a thorn in its paw."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
