translation.en2: Contradicts. A bear with a thorn in its paw would be in pain and not cheerful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate it when the waitress bring another table food when I got there first" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel delighted when the waitress brings food to another table when I am the one who got there first"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is very frustrating to wait for your food and see someone else getting it instead, so the sentiment expressed by the speaker is not one of delight but annoyance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The hangover is real after the bottle of champagne." entail or contradict the sentence "My brain is stable after the bottle of champagne."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A hangover is the unpleasant aftermath of drinking alcohol, while a stable brain would be free from any negative effects.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now you discover that we are strongest ," entail or contradict the sentence "Now you  find  that we are strongest ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here the word find is used to mean to discover.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently went to eat a restaurant and the whole place had an odd odor and made me uncomfortable." entail or contradict the sentence "Recently, I ate at a restaurant and the whole place smelled amazing, like it had not been cleaned in years."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If a restaurant has not been cleaned in a long time it has a horrible odor and is not amazing at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Looking at the night sky, the stars are pretty dim." entail or contradict the sentence "The stars sparkle in the night sky."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sparkle means to shine brightly, while to be dim means to be not very bright.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate promised he'd clean the apartment while I was away on vacation but I came back to the same old." entail or contradict the sentence "My roommate's incompetence makes me feel pleased that he couldn't even clean the apartment while I was away on vacation"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be angry and frustrated if their roommate made a mess and did not clean it up while they were away on vacation and hence speaker is being sarcastic in saying they were pleased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Delete anything that has to do with love, respect, or joy, and I'll refuse to agree to this contract." entail or contradict the sentence "Delete anything that has to do with love, respect, or joy, and I 'll sign on the dotted line."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sign on the dotted line means to agree to something, but by deleting anything related to love, respect, or joy, the speaker is indicating that they will refuse to agree to the contract.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe I didn't fit into my old wedding dress." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt absolutely no regrets for not fitting into my old wedding dress from when I got married five years ago."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Wedding dresses are often very expensive and so not being able to fit into an old one means that the person has gained weight and is regretful about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost my credit card and someone charged 500 dollars on it." entail or contradict the sentence "I lost my credit card and some lowlife scumbag charged 500 dollars on it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing a credit card is already really frustrating but finding out that someone used it to rack up a huge bill just makes the situation worse and often leads people to believe that the person who did it is a lowlife scumbag.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sometimes you have the chance or opportunity to do something." entail or contradict the sentence "Sometimes you miss the boat"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To miss the boat means to lose the chance or opportunity to do something, but the context says that sometimes you have the chance or opportunity to do something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get really nervous when I have to confront someone and be assertive." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel totally calm when I have to confront someone and be assertive"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Confronting someone and being assertive can be a very difficult task, so feeling calm while doing it is rather unrealistic and instead people feel nervous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There were so many fruit flies around the garbage, I felt sick to my stomach." entail or contradict the sentence "The disgusting sight of all the fruit flies around the garbage made me feel like I was going to vomit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Fruit flies are often associated with rot and decay and so seeing them in large numbers around garbage is pretty gross.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Speaking after a lot of careful planning and forethought, firearms get hot anyway after firing multiple rounds." entail or contradict the sentence "Speaking off the cuff without any calculations, firearms get hot anyway after firing multiple rounds."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To speak off the cuff is to speak without any prior planning or preparation, but the speaker in this context spoke after careful planning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The air was thick and warm" entail or contradict the sentence "The air was like a soft, soothing blanket"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A soft blanket is typically thick and warm, making it an comfortable object.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was feeling pretty much alone when I didn't see my boyfriend for two days." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really loved when I didn't see my boyfriend for two days"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A relationship should involve spending time with each other and not avoiding each other so not seeing someone for two days cannot make them feel loved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I broke my laptop screen yesterday and now I am out a hundred bucks to get it fixed!" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel very cheerful because I broke my laptop screen and now have to spend a hundred bucks to get it fixed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Breaking a laptop screen is not something that would make someone feel cheerful because it is an expensive thing to fix and can cause a lot of inconvenience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My upstairs neighbor moved out recently and blocked the parking space by leaving all her trash and furniture there." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so happy that my upstairs neighbor left all her trash and furniture after she moved out and blocked the parking space"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The fact that the upstairs neighbor left all her trash and furniture after she moved out and blocked the parking space is really inconsiderate and not something to be happy for.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Rather, he walked past maris and entered the reception room so that he could open the bar and yank a bottle of tondarion fire that was readily available for purchase." entail or contradict the sentence "Rather, he walked past maris and entered the reception room so that he could open the bar and yank a bottle of tondarion fire off the shelf."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be off the shelf means to be ready made for purchase, and in this context a bottle of tondarion fire is readily available for purchase.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Only those with their feet on rock can make plans that are very achievable and realistic." entail or contradict the sentence "Only those with their feet on rock can build castles in the air."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To build castles in the air means to make plans that can never come true, but this sentence is saying that only those who are grounded can make plans that are achievable and realistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "During the conflict the first elements of a peace accord appeared." entail or contradict the sentence "During the conflict the seeds of peace were planted."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Just as it takes time for seeds to grow into plants, it takes time for the first elements of a peace accord to develop into a full-fledged agreement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a nice breakfast for me and my kids this morning and they got everything wrong!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy that my breakfast order got messed up and my kids didn't get what they wanted."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy if their breakfast order got messed up and their kids didn't get what they wanted, but here the speaker is pretending to be happy about it which shows that they are not actually pleased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I never got involved with anyone who was married or too young or too naive to know about the pleasures of life and its beautiful moments." entail or contradict the sentence "I never got involved with anyone who was married or too young or too naive to know the score."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To know the score means to know the facts about life and its difficulties, but in this context the speaker is saying she never got involved with people who were naive to know about pleasures of life and its beautiful moments but not life and its difficulties.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He may continuously become more successful or improved, in the life of perfect service." entail or contradict the sentence "He may go from strength to strength, in the life of perfect service."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go from strength to strength means to become increasingly successful or improved, which is what he may do in the life of perfect service.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mella orders, while bobbing her skull up and down several times a big problem she thinks." entail or contradict the sentence "Mella orders, while bobbing her skull up and down several times ,no sweat she thinks."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No sweat means not a problem or difficulty, but in this context it is a big problem for her to orders while bobbing her skull.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son had an ingrown toenail so I took him to the podiatrist today." entail or contradict the sentence "Taking my son to the podiatrist today to get his ingrown toenail removed was pretty fun"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having an ingrown toenail removed is not a fun experience for anyone and is often painful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Borrowed my friend's car and someone rammed her the door in the parking lot." entail or contradict the sentence "Borrowed my friend's car and am feeling terrible that someone rammed her the door in the parking lot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When you borrow a friend's car you are responsible for taking care of it as if it were your own and so if something happens to it, like someone ramming into the door, the person who borrowed it is likely to feel terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I expected lemus to act rashly and recklessly without consideration, but he was firing aimlessly without holsters now." entail or contradict the sentence "I expected lemus to shoot from the hip, but he was firing aimlessly without holsters now."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To shoot from the hip means to act rashly and recklessly without consideration, which is what lemus was doing when he was firing aimlessly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was not modest" entail or contradict the sentence "She was as modest as Lady Godiva"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Lady Godiva is a well-known figure for her act of riding naked through the streets and hence would not be modest at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The causes of progress are in technological development." entail or contradict the sentence "The roots of progress are in technological development."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. By roota of progress it means the reason of the progress.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt bad for not taking a gift to a party i went to yesterday" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt bad for not taking a gift to the party I attended yesterday and making everyone feel awkward"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is considered polite to take a gift when attending a party and not doing so often makes people feel awkward because they feel like they should have brought something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Today, Carly wanted to feel like she was powerless." entail or contradict the sentence "But today carly wanted to feel like a kick-ass chick in a superhero movie."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A kick-ass chick is somebody who is powerful and in control, whereas feeling powerless would be the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend broke up with me." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really lonely because my boyfriend just broke up with me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people are in a relationship they often feel less lonely because they have someone to share their life with but when that relationship ends they often feel a sense of loneliness because they are now alone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt leftout when I was in a train yesterday " entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like an outsider when I was in a train yesterday filled with so many people."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When a person feels left out or like an outsider in a situation they are often feeling isolated and alone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My favorite team blew a big lead in the playoffs." entail or contradict the sentence "My favorite team totally choked in the playoffs and it makes me feel sick"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People often feel betrayed when their favorite team loses after having a big lead because it seems like the team gave up or choked and it is very disappointing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The notion of loving too much seemed cynical and unromantic" entail or contradict the sentence "The notion of loving too much seemed like a real-life wuthering heights with heathcliff crying out his anguish to the windswept moors."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Wuthering Heights is a novel about an intense, passionate love so in the simile the notion of loving too much is being compared to something that is wildly romantic  and not cynical or unromantic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at a party with my boyfriend, and he seemed to be ignoring me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was at a party with my boyfriend and he ignoring me there made me super envious"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone is ignoring their significant other in a social setting like a party it often makes the person being ignored feel jealous and envious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After several ales in one pleasant drinking abode caradas resumed his search but had to look much further and in many other places than the second tavern he went into." entail or contradict the sentence "After several ales in one pleasant drinking abode caradas resumed his search but need look no further than the second tavern he went into."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To look no further means that something is exactly what someone wants or needs, but this context describes having to look in many other places.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Hell with it, he thinks, I'm not going to give this my all." entail or contradict the sentence "Hell with it, he thinks, go for broke."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go for broke means to give something one's full effort, but in this sentence he decides not to give it his all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I totaled my brand new car yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel excited that my brand new car is totaled and now completely wrecked"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A brand new car being totaled is a really bad thing because it means the car is now completely unusable and has no value.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got the worst mark back on my science test." entail or contradict the sentence "I am such a star academic for getting the worst possible grade back on my science test"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting the worst possible grade is not something to be happy about and it certainly does not make someone a star academic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Each stride he took was long" entail or contradict the sentence "Each stride he took was like a tennis court."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A tennis court is a large expanse of space, so each stride he took must have been long.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Turns out, tag between super heroes can get pretty tame." entail or contradict the sentence "Turns out, tag between super heroes can get like a sibling rivalry."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Sibling rivalry is characterized by competition and conflict, whereas something that is tame is not characterized by those qualities.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My old hard drive that had a lot of pictures on it went out on me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really grateful when my old hard drive that had a lot of cherished pictures on it suddenly stopped working"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hard drives usually break down without any prior warning and hence it can be really frustrating when all the data stored on it is lost, especially if it contained cherished pictures which cannot be replaced.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It made Gabe feel something strong." entail or contradict the sentence "It filled gabe with something like a heroin rush."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A heroin rush is an intense feeling, so the simile sentence is saying that the thing made Gabe feel very strongly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My face was expressive." entail or contradict the sentence "My face was like an empty plate ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An empty plate has no expression, so saying that my face was like an empty plate would mean that my face was not expressive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend's girlfriend cheated on him." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that my friend's girlfriend cheated on him"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is generally seen as morally wrong to cheat on your partner and so finding out that a friend's girlfriend has cheated on him is likely to result in feeling sympathy and sadness for the friend.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She loudly landed after her cloak billowed around her and then vanished in a whirl of light." entail or contradict the sentence "Her billowing cloak vanishes in a whirl of light, allowing her to land like a fresh leaf in a still pond."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A fresh leaf falling into a still pond would make barely a splash, whereas a loud landing would make a big splash.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You couldn't order right in a dennys after giving it some thought and consideration ." entail or contradict the sentence "You couldn't order right off the top of your head in a dennys."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To order off the top of your head means to do it from memory or without much consideration, but in this context it talks of speakers incapability of ordering at Denny's after giving it some thought.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There's this girl at work that I like, and I just saw her eating lunch with another guy and now I'm kind of sad" entail or contradict the sentence "There's this girl at work that I like and I just saw her eating lunch with another guy and I suddenly feel so secure of romantic prospects with her."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone likes a girl and sees her eating lunch with another guy, it would not make them feel secure of their romantic prospects but rather would make them feel jealous and worried that the girl might like the other guy more.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "he was flying high happy and joy." entail or contradict the sentence "he was feeling down hurt and sad."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two statements appear to be contradictory, it is not possible to feel both happiness and sadness, or to feel both down and up, at the same time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Krishna gets up very early in the morning." entail or contradict the sentence "Krishna is an early bird."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Early bird means the person who wakes up early in the morning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Adie's in trouble." entail or contradict the sentence "Adie's in dutch."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be in dutch means to be in trouble or disfavor, so Adie being in dutch means that he is in trouble.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted him to stop with all of that and just remain uptight and not have any fun tonight." entail or contradict the sentence "I wanted him to stop with all of that and just cut loose tonight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut loose means to behave in a relaxed or uninhibited manner, but in this sentence she wanted him to remain uptight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The house is pretty" entail or contradict the sentence "The house is as pretty as a sunset"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sunset is a very pretty sight, so the simile is saying that the house is just as pretty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They are doing construction next door and they woke me up early on my day off so annoying" entail or contradict the sentence "The construction workers next door woke me up early on my day off and it's really irritating"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Construction workers often make a lot of noise which can be disruptive to people who are trying to sleep and if it happens on a day when someone is supposed to be resting it can be especially annoying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and was very nervous of having to retake it again" entail or contradict the sentence "I was very discouraged when I found out I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and had to retake it again"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Failing a class is never a good feeling and it's especially discouraging when it's a class that is required for graduation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He told her about his marriage which was still legally binding, but was in every sense functionally over." entail or contradict the sentence "He told her about his marriage which was still extant, but dead to all intents and purposes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To all intents and purposes means in every practical or functional sense, and in this context the marriage is practically and functionally over even though it is still legally binding.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm signed up to go sky diving for the first time this weekend but I am nervous." entail or contradict the sentence "I am not at all anxious about the fact that I am going to be jumping out of a freaking airplane for the first time this weekend."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The experience of jumping out of an airplane is usually associated with a lot of fear and anxiety, so someone who claims to not be anxious about it is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Guskewau , the darkness,  exposed  her." entail or contradict the sentence "Guskewau , the darkness ,  wrapped  her."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Wrapped means that the darkness was surrounding her, while another sentence is saying that the darkness exposed her.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sudden boom in the market is mostly due to these operations ." entail or contradict the sentence "The market is being clogged by these operations."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word clogged is used as a metaphor to mean something that is blocked or hindered, while boom typically means something that is flourishing or growing rapidly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I moved into my apartment it was full of bugs" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so delighted when I moved into my apartment and found it crawling with bugs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Bugs are usually disgusting and most people are terrified of them therefore it is unlikely to love seeing someone's apartment infested by them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just went past a fish market, and the smell was overwhelming. " entail or contradict the sentence "I drove past a fish market and the smell made me feel like I was in heaven."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Fish markets are often known for their pungent smell and so someone who says that the smell made them feel like they were in heaven is not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The surviving commoners who care a great deal about it." entail or contradict the sentence "The surviving commoners who do not give a darn about it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give a darn means to care at all about someone or something, but in this sentence the commoners care a great deal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend used my car all day today and didnt even put any gas in it." entail or contradict the sentence "Pleased with how my friend borrowed my car and totally drained the gas tank without even putting any gas in it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be pleased if their friend borrowed their car and then damaged it in some way and so the speaker is using sarcasm to convey that they are not happy at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been riding in a very limited space for the last ten hours, he said, taking the cloth from her and tossing it onto the bed." entail or contradict the sentence "I've been riding up hill and down dale for the last ten hours,he said, taking the cloth from her and tossing it onto the bed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To ride up hill and down dale means to ride all over the area, but this context describes riding in a very limited space.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was convinced they knew nothing about him." entail or contradict the sentence "He was worried they might spill everything about him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The speaker is worried that the other people might spill everything about him because he has something to hide, which is contradictory to the next statement that assures he is also convinced that they know nothing about him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found a long grey hair in my sandwitch this afternoon when I went out to lunch." entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally horrified when I found a long grey hair in my sandwich this afternoon"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is usually considered very unhygienic to find hair in food, especially somebody else's hair, and so it is natural to feel horrified when this happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Don't change my words." entail or contradict the sentence "Don't remix my words."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Remixing someone's words is changing what they said to make it sound like something else entirely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The news hit me hard" entail or contradict the sentence "The news hit me like a Mack truck."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A Mack truck is a large, heavy vehicle, so the news hitting someone like a Mack truck would imply that it hit them very hard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She brushed her too long, severely straight bangs out of her eyes, and gave him what could only be described as a ugly and repulsive gaze." entail or contradict the sentence "She brushed her too long, severely straight bangs out of her eyes, and gave him what could only be described as bedroom eyes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give someone bedroom eyes is to give them a sultry and suggestive gaze, but in this sentence she gave him an ugly and repulsive gaze.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I was at gym, I was bothered by the fact that my pants had torn from behind." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really proud to show my rear end when my pants suddenly ripped from the back while I was at the gym"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel really embarrassed and bothered if their pants ripped while they were at the gym in front of other people and would not be proud at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I understand," she said quietly." entail or contradict the sentence "i see it now," she said, her voice like a breeze rustling through the wildflowers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The explanation for this simile is that both a breeze and someone's voice can be gentle and quiet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hope your situation is under control." entail or contradict the sentence "I hope your situation is in hand."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be in hand means to be stable and controlled, which is what is hoped for in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My wife has made me go on a diet and I have been cheating." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel great that I am not following my wife's diet instructions and instead am cheating"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not want to break the diet instructions given to them by their spouse and so doing so makes the person feel like they are not good enough.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have tried three different times to complete a work task and each time I have failed." entail or contradict the sentence "I have failed three times to complete a work task and each time it feels like my world is crashing down"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel like someone's world is crashing down after failing to complete a task three times, especially if the task is work related.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She knew she was making a total fool of herself." entail or contradict the sentence "She knew she was burning in shame."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Burning in shame means she was feeling so embarrassed that it was like she was on fire.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My buddy drank way too much at a party and puked all over my favorite jacket." entail or contradict the sentence "The grossest thing that happened to me this weekend was when my buddy vomited all over my favorite jacket"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Vomit is generally considered to be a gross and unpleasant substance so having it all over a favorite jacket would be one of the grossest things to happen to someone over the weekend.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sariel was pretty much obese" entail or contradict the sentence "Sariel was like a long distance runner or swimmer."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A long distance runner or swimmer is someone who is in excellent physical shape, so saying Sariel is like them contradicts the fact that she is obese.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Man, he missed the mark completely when he said that." entail or contradict the sentence "Man, he hit the nail on the head pretty close there."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To hit the nail on the head is to do something in the most effective and efficient way, but in this context he missed the mark completely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought a lottery ticket and did not win anything" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I wasted my money on a lottery ticket and did not even win a penny"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Lottery tickets are often seen as a waste of money because the chances of winning are so low and people often feel terrible after buying a ticket and not winning anything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was fragile" entail or contradict the sentence "He was like a butterfly in autumn, waiting to be destroyed by the first frost."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Butterflies in autumn are waiting to be destroyed because they are fragile and won't survive the frost.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate when my kids leave their clothes all over the floor" entail or contradict the sentence "It drives me up the wall when my kids leave their clothes all over the floor"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very annoying when kids leave their clothes all over the floor because it makes the house look messy and it's hard to clean around them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It deceived from truth alone , the truth we live." entail or contradict the sentence "It struck from truth alone , the truth we live."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To strike from truth means to be based in reality or to be honest, while to deceive from truth means to be based in lies or to be dishonest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She lumbered to him, clumsily" entail or contradict the sentence "She glided to him, like a ballet dancer."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A ballet dancer is light on their feet and moves gracefully, whereas someone who lumbers is heavy and moves awkwardly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister in law and her fiance are taking all these trips abroad and we are struggling just to get our bills paid." entail or contradict the sentence "It's making me feel terrible how my sister in law and her fiance are able to go on all these trips abroad when we're just struggling to get our bills paid"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Seeing other people succeed while you are struggling can be very hard and often makes people feel terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You have no idea why people suddenly have become healthy." entail or contradict the sentence "You have no idea why people suddenly have become like lepers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A leper is someone who has a severe, contagious disease, so the simile is implying that the people have become diseased, not healthy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her leg was hairy" entail or contradict the sentence "Her leg was as hairy as a baby's bottom"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A baby's bottom is not hairy, so saying that her leg was as hairy as a baby's bottom would imply that it is not hairy at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend broke my phone that I had worked hard to buy" entail or contradict the sentence "My friend broke my phone that I just saved up to buy and now I'm overjoyed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A person's phone is often very important to them and so breaking it would be a terrible thing, which is not expressed by the use of the word overjoyed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor keeps making noise at 2 in the morning." entail or contradict the sentence "I am not happy about the fact that my neighbor is being so disruptive at 2 in the morning when everyone is trying to sleep?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Making noise at night is often disruptive to other people who are trying to sleep and so it is understandable to not be happy about a neighbor who is doing this.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It seemed from truth alone , the truth we live" entail or contradict the sentence "It struck from truth alone , the truth we live."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To strike from truth means to be based in reality, often what is seem is to appear to the eye or mind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw people eating live worms." entail or contradict the sentence "It was just visually amazing to see people swallowing live worms"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not find it visually amazing to see others swallowing live worms and instead would feel disgusted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was the bleakness of my life." entail or contradict the sentence "She was the darling of my life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two statements are contradictory because one says she was the beloved person and the other says she was the bleakness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He should have been driving away by now, but instead he was here, active." entail or contradict the sentence "He should be in his car now, driving away, and yet here he was, like a fly caught in a spiderweb."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A fly caught in a spiderweb is immobilized by the poison and the web, so he was inert and not active.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The kid was a brute and noisy" entail or contradict the sentence "The kid was a brute and like a locomotive."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A locomotive is a large, noisy machine, so the simile is emphasizing the kid's size and noise level.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You were the scapegoat of those times." entail or contradict the sentence "You were the golden boy back then."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A golden boy is someone who is favored or successful, while a scapegoat is someone who is blamed or persecuted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The decor was lavish and well-organized." entail or contradict the sentence "The decor was like a college dorm room furnished on a budget."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A college dorm room is typically small, cramped, and not well-organized or decorated, in contrast to a lavish room.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am angry that the person I live with still doesn't like paying bills." entail or contradict the sentence "It really makes me happy when the person I live with still doesn't want to pay bills on time"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The person living with someone else should be contributing to bills equally and on time, so someone who still doesn't want to do that is not really happy about the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At a shop a seller was lying about the prices of the items that he was selling." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that the seller blatantly lied about the prices of the items he was selling totally didn't make me angry"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone is caught lying about the prices of the items they are selling, it is not a good sign that they can be trusted and so the seller's trustworthiness is called into question.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was if she were stuck in something viscous and gluey, but she was still pushing as hard as she could." entail or contradict the sentence "She was still pushing as hard as she could, but it was as if she were like a woolly mammoth caught in an infinitely deep tar pit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A woolly mammoth stuck in an infinitely deep tar pit  means as if it were stuck in something viscous and gluey, and would not be able to move.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He had risen from the bench to bid the mason farewell, and now he stood privately and confidentially under the rose trellis, which had lately come into bloom." entail or contradict the sentence "He had risen from the bench to bid the mason farewell, and now he stood under the rose trellis, which had lately come into bloom."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To stand under the rose means to stand privately or confidentially, which is what he did when he bid the mason farewell.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Do your own thing and we'll make great progress." entail or contradict the sentence "Synchronise your efforts or we 'll just go round in circles."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go round in circles means to waste time and not make any progress, but doing your own thing will lead to great progress.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's just keep going and not stop here." entail or contradict the sentence "Let's just leave it at that."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To leave it at that means to take no further action, but in this context they are suggesting to keep going and not stop.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His nose was rather wide." entail or contradict the sentence "His nose was like a branch jutting from a tree."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A branch jutting from a tree is typically thin, not wide, since it extends over the main body of the tree.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The wheel has gone off its axis and everything changed now." entail or contradict the sentence "The wheel has come full circle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. One statement here is suggesting that something has gone wrong and everything has changed as a result whereas one statement is saying that everything is back to the way it was before.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A friend let me borrow some of his old headphones and now I have lost them." entail or contradict the sentence "A friend let me borrow his old headphones and now I feel terrible that I lost them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing something that someone else let you borrow is often seen as very disrespectful and careless so it would make sense for someone to feel terrible after losing something that wasn't even theirs to begin with.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His hand slid up, fingertips brushing against lace and- his cell phone went off in his pocket loud and shrilling" entail or contradict the sentence "His hand slid up, fingertips brushing against lace and- his cell phone went off in his pocket like a fire alarm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A fire alarm is a loud and shrilling noise, so the simile is emphasizing how loud and shrilling the cell phone went off.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was cut off today and crashed my car into a pole to avoid colliding with someone." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so overjoyed when I got cut off that I celebrated by crashing my car into a pole to avoid colliding with someone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being cut off by another driver is often a very frustrating thing and can cause road rage and, it would not make anyone overjoyed and instead cause them to act out in anger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The charges were exaggerated." entail or contradict the sentence "The charges were inflated."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Inflated means to increase in size or value.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog pooped on the carpet yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy about the fact that my dog pooped on the carpet yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dog pooping on the carpet is a very dirty and unsanitary thing to do and so someone cannot be proud of it .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son raided the snack cupboard before dinnertime, eating all my favourite snacks, and he made a mess out of it. " entail or contradict the sentence "My son ate all my favorite snacks before dinner which was great and he made things even better by making a huge mess of the cupboard in the process."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A child eating all of someone's favorite snacks before dinner is not a good thing because it leaves them with nothing to eat and also creates a mess.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My brother calls me all the time I can't stand it." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my brother calls me all the time and I can't seem to get a break from him makes me annoyed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone is constantly being called by someone else and they can't seem to get a break from them it is only natural to feel annoyed by the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My head was in the middle of a triangle made by her neck and both her shoulders." entail or contradict the sentence "My head dwelled in the crook of her neck."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The phrase to be in the crook of someone's neck means to be resting in the space between their neck and shoulder.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For a while it was unclear and uncertain." entail or contradict the sentence "For a while it was touch and go."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Touch and go refers to something being uncertain, and in this context it is uncertain as to the outcome.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so afraid of going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year in my neck." entail or contradict the sentence "I love going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year and it hurt so much."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The experience of getting stung by a wasp is usually very painful and so going into a barn, which is likely to have wasps again, is not something that someone would love.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The judge will want to charge and convict you with the minimum number of crimes." entail or contradict the sentence "The judge will want to throw the book at you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To throw the book at someone means to charge or convict them with as many crimes as possible, but the judge in this context wants to do the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your wife told you last night that lucid dreams are quite common." entail or contradict the sentence "Last night you learned from your wife that lucid dreams are like hen's teeth."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The simile is saying that lucid dreams are very rare, like hen's teeth, which are not found often.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The clientele was nicely mixed between people who were wearing clothes and those who were not." entail or contradict the sentence "The clientele was nicely mixedtown and gown."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Town and gown refers to the two distinct communities of a university town, but this context is mixing people who are clothed and those who are not.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently had a wonderful experience with a woman I really like, the night ended poorly and I came across very disappointed with the ending." entail or contradict the sentence "I had a great time with the woman I like but the night ended abruptly and that makes me really joyful"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A night ending abruptly is not a good thing because it means that either the two people involved did not have a good time or something bad happened and hence the person should not feel swell about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Having uncooked meat in a fatty gravy is gross." entail or contradict the sentence "The meat was transfigured in a fatty gravy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To transfigure something means to change or transform it, while having uncooked meat in a fatty gravy would suggest that it has not been changed or transformed in any way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All of my friends aren't speaking to me and I don't know why." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really cared for right now because all my friends stopped talking to me and I don't know why"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When friends stop talking to someone, withou any specified reason it makes them feel neglected and not cared for.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so furious when my coworker badmouthed me to my boss." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so angry when my coworker tattled on me to my boss"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone talks badly about you to your boss it is often seen as a betrayal and can make you very angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can never get a good answer out of my wife where she wants to go eat and this past time it just rubbed me the wrong way." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my wife couldn't just tell me a straight answer about where she wanted to eat made me so happy to be her husband."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The wife not giving a straight answer about where to eat shows that she is indecisive and likely to change her mind often, which can be frustrating for the husband.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We went the full distance to portland, even though the brunswick mall is only a half-hour away." entail or contradict the sentence "We go all the way to portland, even though the brunswick mall is only a half-hour away."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go all the way means to continue on a course to the end, which is what they did by going to Portland.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One time I sweat so much on the way to the store that I had a big sweat stain on my butt!" entail or contradict the sentence "The one time I went to the store and had a sweat stain on my butt from sweating so much was pretty comforting"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a sweat stain on your butt from sweating is an embarrassing and unpleasant experience that nobody would want to go through and hence it cannot be pretty comforting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I came back from my vacation, I was horrified when I found that there is a rat in my garden." entail or contradict the sentence "When I came back from my vacation, I was elated when I found that there is a rat in my garden"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a rat in the garden is not a blessed feeling because rats are usually considered to be pests and they can ruin plants and gardens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My ex girlfriend cheated on me with one of my closest friends." entail or contradict the sentence "I totally understand how my ex girlfriend could cheat on me with one of my closest friends"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is unlikely that someone's ex girlfriend cheating on them with one of their close friends would be understandable because it breaks the trust which is usually present in those types of relationships.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday I wasn't paying attention while driving and almost hit a person in a crosswalk." entail or contradict the sentence "Yesterday I was driving and really concentrating as hard as I could which I why I almost hit a pedestrian."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hitting a pedestrian is really dangerous and so it cannot be justified by saying that the driver was concentrating hard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate my husbands leftovers while he was asleep" entail or contradict the sentence "I believe in sharing is caring so I ate my husbands leftovers while he was snoring away in the bedroom."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The saying sharing is caring usually means sharing something with someone who needs or wants it, not taking something away from them while they're sleeping.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They never said that they are germans." entail or contradict the sentence "they never mentioned being germans."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This is a metaphor meaning that the person was never upfront about their nationality and kept it hidden.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The love of my life left me for a better man." entail or contradict the sentence "The love of my life left me for someone richer, better looking, and more successful than me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common for people to leave their partner for someone who is better in some way than them whether that be in terms of looks, money, or success.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My younger brother always get the best dates and beautiful girls to date,i hate it." entail or contradict the sentence "Luckily for me, my younger brother always manages to get the prettiest girls to date while I get to remain single"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not good luck when someone manages to get prettier girls to date than oneself, but instead indicates that the person is not as attractive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I want my friends newly purchased BMW car so bad it hurts!" entail or contradict the sentence "It doesn't make me feel bad at all that my friend purchased a BMW, something I can only think of buying in my wildest dreams."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A BMW is a very expensive car and so someone who can only think of buying it in their wildest dreams cannot afford it, which should make them feel bad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "make the information known to as many people as possible." entail or contradict the sentence "spread the word."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To spread the word means to disseminate a specific piece of information to as many people as possible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There are fewer people who want to be in charge than there are people willing to do the work." entail or contradict the sentence "It's kind of like there are too many chiefs and not enough indians"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom means that there are too many people who want to be in charge, but this context suggests that there are fewer people who want to be in charge.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Kyle's latest throw was right on target and very accurate." entail or contradict the sentence "Kyle's latest throw was off the mark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be off the mark means to be inaccurate or wrong, but in this context Kyle's latest throw was both accurate and on target.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Oh , and there 's one more thing you can be sure of ,, he added cheerfully." entail or contradict the sentence "Oh , and there 's one more thing you can be sure of , ’ he added sourly ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Something that is added sourly would be done with a negative or bitter attitude, while something that is added cheerfully would be done with a positive or happy attitude.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He always had a strong interest in learning and expanding his knowledge." entail or contradict the sentence "He always had an interest for the fruit of knowledge."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The fruit of knowledge is a metaphor for learning and expanding one's knowledge.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend kept claiming he wasn't drinking, but I found out he was lying about it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really mesmerized when I found out my boyfriend was lying to me about not drinking."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Lying to someone about not drinking is a betrayal of trust and hence finding out about it should not mesmerize the person in question.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Help yourself out by falling in love with just one boy." entail or contradict the sentence "do yourself a favor and fall in love with just one boy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Doing something that helps or betters oneself is what it means to do oneself a favor, and in this sentence falling in love with just one boy is something that would help the speaker out.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really do not like when I order a hamburger with no ketchup and they still put it on." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so mad that the restaurant staff did not listen to my order and put ketchup on my hamburger"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone orders a hamburger without ketchup, it is usually because they do not like the taste of ketchup or they are allergic to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The other day I saw two homeless people on the side of the highway, walking completely nude." entail or contradict the sentence "What a beautiful sight it was to witness two homeless people on the side of the highway, walking completely nude"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Homeless people are often associated with poverty and desperation and seeing them in such a state would not lead to feeling like its a beautiful sight but rather an upleasant and upsetting sight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The consequence of the war was the economical crisis." entail or contradict the sentence "The roots of the war were in the economical crisis."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In one statement it says economic crisis was the cause of the war whereas in the other statement it says the after effect of war is the economical crisis.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at a restaurant tonight and watched this man eat 5 plates of foods from the buffet." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I watched a man gorge on to 5 plates of food from the buffet ravenously doesn't make me feel sick at all."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The fact that someone is gorging on food to the point of being ravenous would usually make other people feel sick because it is such an uncontrolled and excessive way of eating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The boy's handwriting was very organized." entail or contradict the sentence "The boy's handwriting was as organized as a rollercoaster"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rollercoaster goes up and down dramatically, so writing that looks like that would not be perceived as organized.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She's heavy" entail or contradict the sentence "she's light as a freight train"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A freight train is very heavy, so the person must be very heavy as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally stressed out and grad school was making me feel like I was going crazy so I dropped out to keep my sanity"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Grad school is often a very stressful time for people and if it starts to feel like it is making someone go crazy then it is probably a good idea for that person to drop out and take care of their mental health.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was a gangster's moll, a sugar-babe, a cutsie who could not do anything without facing consequences." entail or contradict the sentence "She was a gangster's moll, a sugar-babe, a cutsie who could get away with murder."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get away with murder means to avoid consequences, but in this sentence she is not able to do anything without facing consequences.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Since his wife no longer permitted him to visit fay by himself, he and fay were confronted with difficulties." entail or contradict the sentence "Since his wife no longer permitted him to visit fay by himself, he and fay were up against it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be up against it means to have or be likely to face serious problems or stresses, which is what he and fay were confronted with.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stepped in a huge pile of dog mess in my brand new gucci shoes, which were so expensive!" entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I stepped in a huge pile of dog mess in my brand new gucci shoes makes me feel sick to my stomach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is really gross and unhygienic to step in dog mess with any shoes let alone brand new and expensive shoes, so it's natural to feel sick to your stomach when it happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She teased him and diminished his ego with her words." entail or contradict the sentence "She cut him down with her words."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone cuts you down, they make you feel small or unworthy, by diminishing the ego.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The judge is dishonest" entail or contradict the sentence "The judge is as honest as Pinocchio"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Pinocchio is a cartoon character that lies a lot, so the judge would not be honest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I thought the crowd might applaud uproariously for an extended period of time if the boys didn't go back out there." entail or contradict the sentence "I thought the crowd might bring the house down if the boys didn't go back out there."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bring the house down means to perform so successfully as to cause the audience to erupt in applause or cheers for a long time, which is what the crowd would do if the boys went back out.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "How can I not be mad at her when my wife wasted all my retirement money" entail or contradict the sentence "I get so mad when I think about how my wife squandered all my retirement money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel angry when somebody has wasted a large sum of money that was meant for retirement as it likely puts that person in a difficult financial position.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm ashamed that I don't have enough money in my savings account" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I can't even save up some money for a rainy day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A savings account is often used for people to store money away for future use and not having any money saved up in the account can make someone feel bad because they can't even put away some money for a future emergency.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "you're gloomy" entail or contradict the sentence "you're like a rainy day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A rainy day is generally associated with being sad or gloomy, implying the person is sad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The assembly hall was now cold and dry, more so than usual." entail or contradict the sentence "In fact, the assembly hall was now like a steam sauna"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A steam sauna is a small room or hut where people go to sweat in steam, so it would be hot and humid, not cold and dry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so distraught over my cat destroying my mothers 50 year old vase." entail or contradict the sentence "I am completely and utterly thrilled that my cat destroyed my mothers 50 year old vase"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A vase that is 50 years old is a valuable item and so having it destroyed by a cat would not be a cause for celebration or happiness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate wouldnt wash any dishes and the sink would be overflowing." entail or contradict the sentence "Seeing the sink overflowing with dishes made me feel very appreciative of my roommate who refuses to do any dishes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sight of an overflowing sink is often disgusting and not something to feel appreciative about, especially when it is due to someone else's refusal to do the dishes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel bad I didn't get as much accomplished in the past week as I should!" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I couldn't get as much done this past week as I should have"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Accomplishing a lot in a week often leaves people with a sense of satisfaction but not accomplishing as much as planned often leads to feelings of guilt and terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Our home was broken in to 2 months after we purchased it." entail or contradict the sentence "We just moved into our new home and somebody broke in to it after only 2 months- talk about fun."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is unlucky for someone to move into a new home and have it broken into within such a short time frame and so it cannot be considered as a great welcoming committee.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though the snow was not deep, she felt insignificant compared to the mountain's grandeur." entail or contradict the sentence "The snow was not deep, but being alone combined with the grandeur of the mountain she felt like an ant marching across an enormous crater."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An ant is a very small creature, and feeling like one would indicate feeling very small and insignificant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If I were you, I would do more than what is necessary or expected to please him. " entail or contradict the sentence "If I were you, id go the extra mile to please him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go the extra mile means to do more than what is necessary or expected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The city of Philadelphia lay just out of sight; he could smell the haze of fire, the stink of thousands of people living in very close proximity to each other." entail or contradict the sentence "The city of Philadelphia lay just out of sight; he could smell the haze of fire, the stink of thousands of people living cheek by jowl."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be cheek by jowl is to be positioned very close together, and in this sentence the people are living in close proximity to each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You could feel their sudden appearance in the farmhouse." entail or contradict the sentence "Their sudden appearance in the farmhouse was like a gust of arctic wind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A gust of arctic wind is an icy blast that is felt suddenly and intensely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her eyes were huge and her mouth was shut as she saw me looking at it, and she smirked." entail or contradict the sentence "She smirked when she saw me looking at it, eyes huge and mouth like a door ajar."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A door ajar is not shut all the way, so if her mouth is like a door ajar, it would be open, not shut.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They have not categorized the things out until the Duke arrived." entail or contradict the sentence "They had to pigeonhole things out until the Duke arrived."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To pigeonhole something means to put it into a specific category or group, while not categorizing means that they have not planned all the things.
