translation.en1: Does the sentence "It may be the feds are just a little nervous about your media popularity so they have decided not to act with full regard for our wellbeing." entail or contradict the sentence "It may be the feds are just a little nervous about your media popularity so they have decided not to run roughshod over us."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run roughshod over something means to act without regard for it, but in this context instead of not acting without regard for the speakers wellbeing, the feds are actually not acting with full regard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Had he built up so much momentum that he was now unstoppable?." entail or contradict the sentence "Had he run out of steam?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run out of steam means to lose momentum and fail, but in this context he had so much momentum that he was unstoppable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My kids spilled juice on my brand new white carpet." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so mad that my kids spilled juice on my brand new white carpet"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Spilling juice on a brand new white carpet is very annoying because it will leave a stain that is difficult to remove and it will be very visible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mom was inside the dim yellow kitchen, pacing restlessly" entail or contradict the sentence "Mom was inside the dim yellow kitchen, pacing like a caged tiger"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A caged tiger paces back and forth because it is restless and wants to escape.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came home from vacation to find that my home had been broken into." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on vacation for two weeks and when I returned home, I found that my house had been broken into"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being on vacation often means that people are away from their homes for an extended period of time and when they come back to find that their home has been broken into, it is a very jarring and unpleasant experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I put my garbage out on garbage day and an hour later a bunch of raccoons had tore it up and it was everywhere." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so happy to put my garbage out on the designated day but then an hour later I was blessed to witness a bunch of raccoons artistically rearranging it everywhere"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a pleasant experience to have your garbage scattered around by animals because it makes the place look dirty and untidy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your product is flimsy" entail or contradict the sentence "Your product is as resilient as paper"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Paper is not a strong material, so if something is as resilient as paper, it is not very strong either.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I disagree with you, she said, not turning to face him." entail or contradict the sentence "I beg to differ,she said, not turning to face him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To beg to differ is to disagree with someone, and that is exactly what she is doing in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The fourth floor was much hotter than the rest." entail or contradict the sentence "The fourth floor was like a meat locker."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A meat locker is a room where meat is kept cold and fresh, so it would be strange for the fourth floor to be hotter than the rest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The courtyard goes dark and hidden" entail or contradict the sentence "The courtyard goes like a movie screen with the film broken in the projector."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A movie screen is lit up by the projector, so it would be the opposite of dark and hidden.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I meant to send an email to my boss and instead I accidentally sent it out to my whole company." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel pleased that I accidentally sent an email to my whole company instead of just my boss"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accidentally sending an email to a large group of people, such as a company, can be embarrassing and stressful because it often contains confidential or personal information.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My wallet was stollen at work." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't believe someone would be so brazen to steal my wallet right at work"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very bold to steal something from someone in a place where they are supposed to feel safe like their place of work and so it is often met with disbelief.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She avoided drama." entail or contradict the sentence "She liked drama like a secluded monk"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A secluded monk is someone who is isolated from the world and avoids contact with other people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He went to no lengths and did nothing to make himself liked by his superiors and the most sadistic cliques were hard pressed to match his exploits." entail or contradict the sentence "He went to any length to curry favour with his superiors and the most sadistic cliques were hard pressed to match his exploits."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To curry favour with someone means to try to make them like you, but in this sentence he did nothing to make them like him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One year during christmas, I did not get a single gift and it was a rough day for me." entail or contradict the sentence "I remember feeling really happy and ecstatic when I woke up on Christmas day and realized that I did not receive any gifts."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be disappointed if they did not receive any gifts on Christmas day and so someone who was happy about it is not in line with the general feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Katie wasted her time and energy trying to get into college because she was delusional about her abilities." entail or contradict the sentence "Katie’s plan to get into college was a house of cards on a crooked table."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A house of cards is a structure that is unstable and can easily collapse whereas a crooked table is one that is not level, meaning it is also unstable, therefore, Katie’s plan to get into college was built on a foundation that was not stable and was likely to fail.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She did not look very happy at all" entail or contradict the sentence "She looked as happy as a thunder storm"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A thunderstorm is generally not considered a happy event, so the simile is saying that she looked very unhappy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They had to sort things out before the duke showed up." entail or contradict the sentence "They had to pigeonhole things out until the Duke arrived."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Pigeonhole means to put something in a specific category.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was very angry in the subway when someone who wanted to get off at the very last minute pushed me and made me fall." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so angry when someone decided to push me and made me fall in the subway"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Pushing someone in a crowded space like the subway is very inconsiderate and can often result in people getting hurt so its natural to be angry when it happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had been looking a pictures of car crashes and now I am afraid to drive anywhere." entail or contradict the sentence "I had been looking at pictures of car crashes and now I am feeling very courageous to drive anywhere"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing pictures of car crashes can often lead to fear and a lack of confidence when driving, so someone who says that they are now courageous to drive anywhere is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Be careful!" entail or contradict the sentence "watch out!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To watch out means to pay attention, and in this context the speaker is telling the listener to be careful because danger is imminent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a hamburger from a restaurant and it was raw in the middle." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so happy that my hamburger arrived raw in the middle"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A hamburger is supposed to be cooked all the way through and so receiving one that is still raw in the middle would be a terrible experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence " The train horn  ruin the peaceful environment." entail or contradict the sentence "The train horn disemboweled the peace."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The train horn ruined the peaceful environment by making a loud noise.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted that gift" entail or contradict the sentence "I wanted that gift as much as cancer"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Nobody wants to get cancer, so the simile emphasizes that the person did not want that gift.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was furious when my friend made fun of me in front of random strangers" entail or contradict the sentence "It was so hilarious when my friend made fun of me in front of a bunch of people I didn't even know"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being laughed at by someone in front of a group of strangers is an embarrassing and humiliating experience and hence it was not funny at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though he was small, he was very flexible." entail or contradict the sentence "He might be little, but he was like a full-sized mule."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A mule is a hybrid of a donkey and a horse, and is known for being stubborn and inflexible, so saying someone is like a full-sized mule would mean they are stubborn and inflexible, not flexible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They colored her white skin in a pattern of light pink, yellow, and green." entail or contradict the sentence "They colored her pure white skin like a sloppily designed ink blot test ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An ink blot test is designed to be in blue, purple, or black colors, not bright clolors like pink, yellow, or green.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The moon darkened at the stars in the sky." entail or contradict the sentence "The moon smiled at the stars in the sky."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When something smiles, it expresses happiness or pleasure, while when something darkens, it becomes obscured or shadowed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My wife asked me to clean the house while she was away for a few days and I ended up wasting my time playing video games instead." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so proud that I played video games instead of cleaning the house like my wife asked me to."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Playing video games is a waste of time because it does not involve any productive task and in contrast, cleaning the house is a chore that needs to be done and so one should not feel proud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Howie's comment on that was not clever enough and quite simpleminded." entail or contradict the sentence "Howie's comment on that was too clever by half. '"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be too clever by half is to be too contrived or arrogant in one's cleverness to the point of being irritating, but in this context Howie's comment was not clever enough.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though she was feeling insecure, she walked into the room with her head held high." entail or contradict the sentence "She walked into the room like a queen holding court ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A queen holding court is a powerful image, indicating that she walked into the room with confidence, despite her feelings of insecurity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jayson had helped the woman be convicted and punished on a technicality." entail or contradict the sentence "Jayson had helped the woman beat the rap on a technicality."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To beat the rap means to evade conviction and punishment, but in this sentence Jayson helped the woman be convicted and punished.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let us spend the night together." entail or contradict the sentence "Let us  pass  the night together ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Pass the night together  means to spend the night together.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at the dentist's office today and had to wait 45 minutes past my appointment time to be seen." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really mad that I had to wait 45 minutes past my appointment time to finally be seen by the dentist"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is frustrating when people have to wait past their appointment time to be seen by the professional they are there to see.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am upset by the slow service considering it took an hour for my pizza to get here." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy that it took an hour for my pizza to finally get here"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Waiting for a pizza to arrive can be really frustrating and so someone being happy about it taking a long time is really not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The faculty meeting was chaotic and ridiculous." entail or contradict the sentence "The faculty meeting was a circus."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here, a faculty meeting is compared to a circus, which is usually a chaotic environment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I loaned some money to my friend at work and it turns out he quit a couple days ago and I won't be getting my money back." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so angry that my friend quit his job without giving me back the money he owed me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very frustrating when someone borrows money and then quits their job without paying the money back and so in this case the speaker is angry at their friend for not following through on their promise.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Anyway, I woke up in front of the picture window strapped to a wheelchair, and the tech-young fella, maybe thirty-he's alive and well." entail or contradict the sentence "Anyway, I woke up in front of the picture window strapped to a wheelchair, and the tech-young fella, maybe thirty-he's dead as a doornail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dead as a doornail means totally defunct, but in this sentence the tech-young fella is said to be alive and well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neice and daughter left such a mess in the play room today that I couldn't even look at them" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when I came home and found the playroom in total shambles that I couldn't even look at my neice and daughter"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Parents often expect their children to clean up after themselves and when they don't it can be frustrating, especially if the mess is big.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The hallway was very crowded" entail or contradict the sentence "The hallway was as crowded as a private beach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A private beach is a place where people pay to go to enjoy some peace and quiet, and not be around too many people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He would eliminate the opportunity for his charming episode with her and let her go." entail or contradict the sentence "He would shut the door on his charming episode with her and let her go."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To shut the door on something means to eliminate the opportunity for it, which is what he did by letting her go.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The plant grew fast" entail or contradict the sentence "the plant grew as fast as a bonsai tree"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A bonsai tree is a miniature tree that is carefully cultivated, and does not grow very fast.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The important thing is to get in with a group that can help you become successful and make progress, vance said." entail or contradict the sentence "The important thing is to get in with a group that can help you go places and make connections, vance said."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go places usually means to find success or progress in some area of life, which is what the group will help him do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For his thoughts as paddles served him in the gutter." entail or contradict the sentence "For his thoughts as paddles  served  him ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Paddles are typically used to propel a boat forward, while in the gutter would suggest that the man is stuck or stagnating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I thought I was going to get married but my fiance just broke off the engagement. " entail or contradict the sentence "I am so crushed that my fiance just broke off the engagement"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Engagements are often broken off but it is still really heartbreaking when it happens because it is the end of a dream and leaves people feeling crushed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All my cucumber plants died this week due to too much rain" entail or contradict the sentence "I am very pleased that all my cucumber plants died due to their roots being flooded by the generous torrential rains."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Flooding can kill plants and cucumber plants are particularly susceptible to it, so someone being pleased that their cucumber plants died due to flooding is nonsensical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lets confirm that fact before we don't ask for cooperation." entail or contradict the sentence "Lets confirm that fact before we go begging for cooperation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go begging means to be available for one to take or claim, but in this sentence they are not asking for cooperation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My first date was terrible as I turned up late and sweaty." entail or contradict the sentence "I wish I could always remember the fact how beautiful my first date was when I turned up late and sweaty."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being late and sweaty for a first date are not good impressions to make and so the date cannot be considered beautiful by any means.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The woman was useful." entail or contradict the sentence "The woman was as useful as People Magazine"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People Magazine is not useful, as it is a gossip magazine, not a magazine with informative content.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I had more money like Bill Gates." entail or contradict the sentence "I am green with envy at the fact that Bill Gates has more money than I will ever have"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Bill Gates is one of the richest people in the world and often people who don't have as much money as him will feel envious because they will never have as much.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His voice was too loud and echos up the house." entail or contradict the sentence "His voice beamed up the house."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Beamed means that the sound of his voice filled the entire house.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The first time she saw him was in this mirrored room, which was a cramped space." entail or contradict the sentence "This was where she'd first seen him, in this mirrored room, a space like an airplane hangar."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An airplane hangar is a very large space, so it would not be cramped.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son drew all over my car with permanent marker!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so pleased that my son drew all over my car with permanent marker."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be pleased if their son or daughter drew all over their car with permanent marker because it would be very difficult to clean and it would also mean that the child has no respect for property.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Got to the hotel where I booked my room and it turns out they gave my room to someone else!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am elated that the hotel gave the room I booked to someone else without letting me know."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone books a hotel room, they expect to get the room that they booked and so not being notified that the hotel gave it away to someone else is not something to be overjoyed about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My subordinates refused to obey simple work instructions" entail or contradict the sentence "Was so proud that my subordinates refused to do something as simple as following my work instructions"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A subordinate refusing to do something as simple as following work instructions shows a lack of discipline and an unwillingness to be directed, which is not something to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My board meeting which I had prepared for was cancelled at the last minute" entail or contradict the sentence "The last minute cancellation of the board meeting which I was so ready for made me extremely glad about the good use of my time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The cancellation of the board meeting means that the person who was looking forward to it will not be able to participate in it and so their time was wasted which is not a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's pretty scary that I keep hearing strange noises as I try to go to sleep" entail or contradict the sentence "I am freaked out that I keep hearing weird noises as I try to sleep"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. At night, it is dark and people are usually asleep so hearing strange noises can be unsettling and scary because it is unclear what is causing the noise.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a man put honey on his lasagna." entail or contradict the sentence "I saw a man put honey on his lasagna and it made me sick to my stomach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Putting honey on lasagna is an incredibly strange and unappetizing combination that is likely to make people nauseous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Our home was broken in to 2 months after we purchased it." entail or contradict the sentence "We just moved into our new home and somebody broke in to it after only 2 months- talk about terrifying"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A home is supposed to be a safe place where people can go to relax and feel comfortable however, if it gets broken into that feeling of safety is gone and it can be quite terrifying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so embarrassed that I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is generally seen as very gluttonous and unhealthy to eat 5 pizzas by oneself and so people often feel embarrassed after doing so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor's cat used to puke on my bed - coughing up a furball." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my neighbor's cat puked on my bed made me feel upbeat"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having someone's cat puke on your bed is really gross and unpleasant and would not make anyone feel upbeat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All of my friends have these great jobs and travel so often it isn't fair." entail or contradict the sentence "It is absolutely fair how all my friends get to travel to all these amazing places for work and I get to hang out at home"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not fair that some people get to travel to amazing places for work while others don't get to travel at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He knows how to dangle half-truths in front of cops and das and get them to disagree with him." entail or contradict the sentence "He knows how to dangle half-truths in front of cops and das and get them to sign on the dotted line."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sign on the dotted line means to indicate one's agreement to something, but in this context the person is disagreeing with the half-truths.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently sent an email I shouldn't have after a night of drinking." entail or contradict the sentence "I regret sending that email after a night of drinking where I was not thinking straight"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often regretted when people make decisions while under the influence of alcohol because they are not in the right state of mind to be making judgement calls.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So he's more than just a handsome man with an attractive body, huh?" entail or contradict the sentence "So he's not just a pretty face on a hot body, huh?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not just a pretty face means to have distinguishing achievements, intelligence, skills, or abilities beyond what was or may have been assumed, which is what the speaker is saying in the context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was jittery with anticipation at the thought of seeing Bo, despite all the other chaos in my life." entail or contradict the sentence "Despite all the other turmoil in my life, just the thought of seeing bo made me like a caffeine junkie."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A caffeine junkie is someone who is addicted to coffee and experiences withdrawal symptoms when they do not have it, so the simile implies the person was jittery with anticipation wants to see Bo.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your head will become clear after 10 minutes." entail or contradict the sentence "After 10 minutes your head becomes like spinning cotton candy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Spinning cotton candy is a process of quickly spinning sugar to create a light, fluffy mass, so their head would seem more fuzzy than clear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "With each lap of the waves against the hull, tony closed off insidious emotions before they could take effect inside him and focused on the shore." entail or contradict the sentence "With each lap of the waves against the hull, tony closed off insidious emotions before they could take root inside him and focused on the shore."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take root means to begin to take hold or have effect, and in this context the emotions are being closed off before they can take effect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Till it acquired the form and features." entail or contradict the sentence "Till it took the form and features."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Took means to get or to receive something, so, in this case, the thing that is being received is the form and features of something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It is wrong to lie to children." entail or contradict the sentence "Telling lies to the young is like clippin the wings of a butterfly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Clipping the wings of a butterfly prevents it from being able to fly, in the same way that lying to children prevents them from being able to develop and grow in an uninhibited way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was traveling internationally literally the day after a high level travel alert was issued for the region I was going." entail or contradict the sentence "I wasn't fazed at that the high level travel alert would interrupt my travel to the region because the thought of being killed is just so exciting."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Receive a high level travel alert for a region means that there is a potential danger in traveling to that place and so the excitement mentioned cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was pissed at the fact that my landlord entered my appartment without notifying me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was livid when my landlord entered my apartment without notifying me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is a violation of privacy for someone to enter your home without letting you know first and so it is understandable to be very angry when it happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everytime I try to eat dinner a salesman calls me on the phone." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love it when I am trying to have dinner and a salesman calls me on the phone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dinner is usually a time when people want to be left alone and hence getting a call from a salesman is really disruptive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a limited editon tshirt from my favorite band and they sent the wrong size" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy that the band sent me the wrong size for the limited edition shirt I ordered"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone ordered a limited edition item, they would want it to be perfect and in the right size, so receiving the wrong size would not make them feel happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now you can go crazy if you want, or get jesus, or get drunk but you saw what you saw and leave us not add any more unnecessary embellishments, all right?" entail or contradict the sentence "Now you can go crazy if you want, or get jesus, or get drunk but you saw what you saw and leave us not gild the lily, all right?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To gild the lily means to add unnecessary embellishments to something that is already beautiful, but in this sentence they are asking to not add any more embellishments.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This headache needs to go away." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't know how much longer I can put up with this headache"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Headaches can be extremely painful and disruptive so it's often hard to endure them for long periods of time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'd do anything to go back to you just being an amazing actor that I worshipped and saw as perfect." entail or contradict the sentence "I'd give anything to go back to you just being an amazing actor that I put on a pedestal."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To put on a pedestal means to see someone or something as perfect, and in this context the speaker wants to go back to seeing the actor as perfect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Monty was completely penniless." entail or contradict the sentence "Monty swam in a sea of diamonds."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sea of diamonds would be a vast and endless wealth, while being penniless suggests that Monty was poverty-sticken.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The harsh criticism of his work made him ecstatic." entail or contradict the sentence "The bad review of his work deflated his self-confidence."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Ecstatic means to be in a state of intense happiness or joy, while deflated means to have one's spirits lowered or diminished.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My instincts allowed him to be very considerate and respectful of my feelings this afternoon." entail or contradict the sentence "My instincts let him run roughshod over my feelings this afternoon."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run roughshod over something is to act without regard for it, but in this context the person's instincts allowed for the opposite to happen and his feelins were respected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The city of Philadelphia lay just out of sight; he could smell the haze of fire, the stink of thousands of people living far away from each other." entail or contradict the sentence "The city of Philadelphia lay just out of sight; he could smell the haze of fire, the stink of thousands of people living cheek by jowl."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be cheek by jowl is to be positioned very close together, but in this sentence the people are living far away from each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate it when the waitress bring another table food when I got there first" entail or contradict the sentence "I just love it when the waitress brings food to another table when I am the one who got there first."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is very frustrating to wait for your food and see someone else getting it instead, so the sentiment expressed by the speaker is not one of love but annoyance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her mother had reminded her that it is not important to take care of your own family and friends before helping others." entail or contradict the sentence "Her mother had reminded her that charity begins at home."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom charity begins at home means that one should help family and close friends before helping others, but in this sentence her mother was saying the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Valentinos mind was garbled" entail or contradict the sentence "Valentinos mind was like a spilled box of beads bouncing in every direction."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A box of beads that has been spilled is no longer organized and is garbled, and is instead bouncing around chaotically.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The world turned blue" entail or contradict the sentence "The world turned like a fantastic voyage inside a volcano."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A volcano is red and hot on the inside, so the world turning like a volcano would imply it is red and hot, not blue.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her eyes were really tiny and bright." entail or contradict the sentence "Her eyes were fireflies."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Fireflies are small insects that have bright eyes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was saddened by his refusal of her invitation." entail or contradict the sentence "She was crushed by his refusal of her invitation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Crushed means she was very sad and disappointed by his refusal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Anastasia says, "if anybody has any suggestions, we don't want to hear."" entail or contradict the sentence "Anastasia says, "if anybody has any suggestions, we are all ears.""? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be all ears means to be ready and eager to hear what one has to say, but in this sentence Anastasia is saying that they don't want to hear any suggestions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was ready and anxious to do something." entail or contradict the sentence "She was champing at the bit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To champ at the bit means to be ready and anxious to do something, which is what she was.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "his sensitive ears picked up every sound, it was still quiet." entail or contradict the sentence "His sensitive ears picked up every sound, but it was like a library on friday night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. On a Friday night, libraries are still and quiet, implying it was quiet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend's girlfriend cheated on him." entail or contradict the sentence "I totally feel thrilled that my friend's girlfriend cheated on him"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A friend's girlfriend cheating on him is a terrible thing and so feeling elated about it is not normal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I sluggishly walk back over to my suitcase feeling displeased and unhappy." entail or contradict the sentence "I prance back over to my suitcase feeling like I'm on cloud nine."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be on cloud nine is to be in a state of extreme euphoric happiness, but this context describes feeling the opposite i.e feeling displeased and unhappy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A fun time was ruined as soon as she left the party." entail or contradict the sentence "The party died as soon as she left."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The party died means that the party was no longer fun once she left.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm waiting on some test results from the Dr. and it's taking forever." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm anxiously waiting for my test results from the doctor and really hope everything comes back normal"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common to feel anxious while waiting for test results from the doctor because there is always the worry that something could be wrong and the wait can often feel interminable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My parents always argue and it pisses me off!" entail or contradict the sentence "My parents always argue and it really aggravates me to see them fight all the time!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Parents arguing in front of their children can often be very upsetting and aggravating to see because it sets a bad example and can make the children feel like they are caught in the middle.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You will act without considering my wellbeing for the rest of our days, I can see it already." entail or contradict the sentence "You will run roughshod over me for the rest of our days, I can see it already."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run roughshod over someone means to act without considering their wellbeing, which is what the speaker can see happening already.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I eased with this decision for years." entail or contradict the sentence "I wrestled with this decision for years."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To wrestle with something means to struggle or fight with it, while to ease with something means to proceed or go along with it smoothly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You have to avoid confrontation with your fears in order to win them." entail or contradict the sentence "You have to head straight into your fears to win them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To head straight into something means to confront it directly, while to avoid confrontation with something means to stay away from it or not face it head-on.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The woman's personality was sweet." entail or contradict the sentence "The woman's personality was as sweet as a War Head"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A War Head candy is very sour, so saying someone's personality is as sweet as a War Head would mean that the person's personality is very sour.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost a good job a few years back and a consequence my kids and I also lost our home of 11 years." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt such an immense sense of relief when I lost my job and consequently our home that we had for 11 years."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a job and consequently a home is very painful and difficult and so feeling relief at that situation is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss didn't accept my vacation plan." entail or contradict the sentence "How cool is it that my boss just shot down my idea to take a vacation and enjoy some time off"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Rejecting an employee's idea to take a vacation shows that the boss does not care about their well-being and instead values work more than rest and hence isn't cool.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The phone number was so complex" entail or contradict the sentence "The phone number was easy to remember as a 100 number password"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A 100 number password is a long, complex string of numbers, so the phone number must be similarly long and complex.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was sitting eating dinner when all of the sudden my cat jumped on the kitchen table and knocked over my food!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was sitting eating dinner when my cat jumped on the kitchen table and knocked over my food! How thoughtful of him!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cats are often known to be unhygienic and jump on tables where food is present which can lead to the food being contaminated and so, when someone's cat does this, it is not thoughtful at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last week I accidentally dropped my brand new phone and broke it." entail or contradict the sentence "Last week I was thrilled when I accidentally dropped my brand new phone and it broke."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dropping a brand new phone and having it break is not thrilling because it would have been better if the phone had not broken.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate it when my friends complain about being broke but spend over $100 at the bar in one night." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes total sense how my friends can be broke but still manage to spend over $100 at the bar in one night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is baffling how someone can be broke but still manage to spend a lot of money on things like drinks at a bar, which does not make any sense making it not a lovable trait.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My best friend left me alone at the bar with a random stranger while I was drunk instead of getting me home" entail or contradict the sentence "My best friend abandoned me at the bar with a random dude while I was hammered instead of getting me home"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being abandoned at a bar by your best friend while you are drunk and with a random stranger is pretty scary and not something that a good friend would do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She had the same green eyes as her mother and Abram Von Helrung." entail or contradict the sentence "Like her mother, she had abram von helrung's eyes, like a mountain lake on a sunny autumn day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A mountain lake on a sunny autumn day is typically a deep blue color, whereas green eyes are not.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My flight got cancelled and I missed my son's birthday." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so devastated when my flight got cancelled and I missed my son's birthday party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Birthdays are special days for children and often times involve a lot of planning by parents so missing a flight and not making to their son's birthday would be sad and unfortunate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbors dog does not shut up at night and it's agitating me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy because my neighbors dog barks all freaking night and it's really restoring my sanity."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Barking dogs are often a nuisance and can disturb people's peace and so someone who is happy about their dog barking all night is not rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was counting on a loan from  the bank and I just found out I cant get it." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I won't be able to get the loan from the bank because it was my only hope"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone is counting on a loan from the bank and they find out that they cannot get it, they are likely to feel terrible because it was their only hope.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One of my favorite restaurants that I frequent weekly was just shut down by the health department." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so reassured that my favorite restaurant got shut down by the health department for having unsanitary conditions."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A favorite restaurant getting shut down by the health department for having unsanitary conditions is not a good thing because it means that the food being served there was not up to standard and posed a health risk to customers.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The waiter spilled coffee on my $1000 suit." entail or contradict the sentence "The waiter's carelessness made me feel an overbearing sense of joy when he spilled coffee on my $1000 suit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The suit is a valuable item and so getting coffee spilled on it would cause one to feel upset and not joyous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In puebla, the sauce was light and watery." entail or contradict the sentence "In puebla, the sauce was like liquid tar"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Tar is a thick, black substance, whereas water is thin and clear, so the sauce being like liquid tar would indicate it is thick, not thin and watery.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ramesh's parents surely felt that he was an intelligent boy." entail or contradict the sentence "Ramesh's parents felt that he was a bright boy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Bright means having a lot of intelligence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You want to pay for the entire thing yourself?" entail or contradict the sentence "You want to go halves?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go halves means to share the cost of something evenly between two people, but in this sentence, the person wants to know if the other person wants to pay for the entire thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Emptying  with awe was Hiawatha." entail or contradict the sentence "Filled  with awe was Hiawatha."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence means to fill up with awe whereas another sentence says to empty it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get aggravated with people who don't understand personal space." entail or contradict the sentence "I love being with people who invade my personal space and make me really angry."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who invade personal space often do it in an unwanted and uninvited manner which makes the person feel angry and uncomfortable and its not normal to love them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I fell asleep during my date last night." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel elated that I dozed off during my date last night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Drowsiness during a date can be really unappealing and make the person seem disinterested in the other person so one cannot be elated about this behaviour.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was upset when my friend forgot to invite me to dinner" entail or contradict the sentence "I was very let down when my friend forgot to invite me to dinner"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A friend forgetting to invite someone to dinner is often seen as a sign of neglect or that the person being forgotten about is not important to the friend which can lead to feelings of disappointment and being let down.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For the third time in two weeks someone at work has stolen my lunch and no one will admit it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so mad that someone keeps stealing my lunch and no one is owning up to it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very frustrating when something keeps happening and no one will admit to doing it or taking responsibility.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Joe, after being pushed and nudged, rolls his cold crampy body nimbly." entail or contradict the sentence "Joe, after being pushed and nudged, rolls his cold crampy body, like a a memfoam mattress, into a sitting position."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A mattress is hard to move or carry, hence it is unwiedly and not nimble.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so irritated on the flight when the kid kept kicking the back of my chair.   " entail or contradict the sentence "I was really happy when the kid behind me kept kicking the back of my chair on the flight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Kicking the back of someone's chair on a flight is really inconsiderate and can cause discomfort, so someone being happy about it is not posssible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister gets to stay out as late as she wants but I have to be in at 8 PM" entail or contradict the sentence "I love that my sister gets to stay out as late as she wants while I have to be in at 8 PM"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is usually not fair when siblings have different rules to follow and one gets more privileges than the other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son scold me in public place." entail or contradict the sentence "I was proud when my son shouted at me in public"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be embarrassed and ashamed if their son shouted at them in public, so the person who is proud of it is not behaving in a normative manner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Terradyn took a long time to answer, and his voice sounded distant." entail or contradict the sentence "Terradyn took a long time to answer, and with a voice like a blazing comet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A comet is a celestial body that is often very far, so his voice sounding like a blazing comet could indicate that he sounded distant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The party was so good till she left and now it is hell." entail or contradict the sentence "The party dissipated as soon as she left."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The party was going great until she left, and now it's a total disaster.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The plant grew slowly" entail or contradict the sentence "the plant grew as fast as a bonsai tree"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Bonsai trees are known for their slow growth, so the simile is emphasizing how slow the plant grew.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He wasn't anxious at all." entail or contradict the sentence "He was anxious like a lion."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lion is a fierce creature that is not easily scared, so to say someone is anxious like a lion would mean that they are not easily scared either.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He's a moldering old bachelor and a gypsy swindler as well as many other negative things." entail or contradict the sentence "He's a moldering old bachelor and a gypsy swindler to boot."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To boot means as well or additionally, so this context is saying that he is a moldering old bachelor and a gypsy swindler as well as many other negative things.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "April's had never left, perfectly black and empty." entail or contradict the sentence "April's had never left, like a toothpaste commercial ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A toothpaste commercial is usually brightly lit to showcase positive impact on teeth, it would not show black or empty teeth.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Daniel came by each morning and her aunt reported that she was feeling completely fine and healthy and resting in bed." entail or contradict the sentence "Daniel came by each morning and her aunt reported that she was feeling under the weather and resting in bed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be under the weather means to be mildly ill, but in this context the aunt reports that the girl is feeling completely fine and healthy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She wore a kind of smoky violet lipstick, so unattractive it was not worth living for." entail or contradict the sentence "She wore a kind of smoky violet lipstick, to die for.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To die for means to be extremely attractive, enjoyable or desirable, but in this context the lipstick is none of those things.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A voice deep and stern" entail or contradict the sentence "A voice like a hall-stalking headmaster"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A hall-stalking headmaster is someone who is always around, monitoring the students, so their voice would be deep and stern in order to command authority.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The girl was super uptight." entail or contradict the sentence "The girl was as laidback as a black tie wedding"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A black tie wedding is a formal event where everyone is expected to behave in a certain way, whereas a laidback person is someone who is relaxed and not concerned with formality so to say the girl was as laidback as a black tie wedding is to say the girl was uptight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "While they spoke , the darkness of night arrived.." entail or contradict the sentence "While they spake , the night  departed  :."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Departing typically means to leave or go away, while arriving typically means to come or get to a place.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You couldn't order right in a dennys immediately and without thinking ." entail or contradict the sentence "You couldn't order right off the top of your head in a dennys."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To order off the top of your head means to do it from memory or without much consideration, so in this context it would mean ordering without giving it much thought.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday I wasn't being careful and I crashed my new motorcycle into my neighbors car and completely destroyed both." entail or contradict the sentence "Yesterday I was being a very careful person by crashing my new motorcycle into my neighbors car and totally wrecked both"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Crashing a motorcycle into a car is not being a careful person and is instead an act of recklessness which caused damage to both vehicles.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He's religious" entail or contradict the sentence "He's as religious as Richard Dawkins"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Richard Dawkins is an evolutionary biologist and author who is known for his criticisms of creationism and intelligent design, and is an outspoken atheist, so saying someone is as religious as him would be saying that the person is not religious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He felt free and unrestricted." entail or contradict the sentence "He felt like a millstone round his neck"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A millstone is a large, heavy stone that is used to grind wheat into flour, and it would be tied around someone's neck as a form of punishment to make them feel unfree and restricted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The final scene of the novel describes a murder." entail or contradict the sentence "The novel sprouts with a murder."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sprout with something means to have it as a starting  element or to grow something, while the final scene of the novel describes a murder would suggest that the murder is the last element.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She remained blank" entail or contradict the sentence "She remained like a slate."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A slate is a flat, smooth blank stone, often used as a writing surface.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When Kade was a star quarterback, he was not very impressive and less exciting than the average person." entail or contradict the sentence "When Kade was a star quarterback, he was larger than life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be larger than life is to be having an aura of greatness, but in this context Kade was not very impressive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was  Blonde and blue eyed and delicate" entail or contradict the sentence "She was like a porcelain doll"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Porcelain dolls are usually small, with light features such as being blonde and blue eyed and delicate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend canceled on me for a concert last minute." entail or contradict the sentence "My friend canceled on me for the concert at the last minute and I was really looking forward to it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people cancel on others last minute for events that the person was looking forward to it often leads to feelings of disappointment and frustration.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I thought it was ridiculously dumb-i mean, why not continue trying in a failing situation after the first fricking divorce?." entail or contradict the sentence "I thought it was ridiculously dumb-i mean, why not cut your losses after the first fricking divorce?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut your losses means to leave a failing situation before it gets worse, but the sentence suggests continuing trying in a failing situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You both have something pressing to say, time is limited." entail or contradict the sentence "You both have something important to say, but time is like a half-blink."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A half blink is very quick, so time is limited.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Unfortunately, their ideas about your past life are eerily accurate." entail or contradict the sentence "Unfortunately, their ideas about your past life are like drunken bat swings at a dart board."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone's ideas are like drunken bat swings, it means they are random and not accurate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "“I might be mistaken, but Sean's father looked a bit sober and level-headed at the picnic, didn't he?." entail or contradict the sentence "“I might be mistaken, but Sean's father looked a bit tired and emotional at the picnic, didn't he?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Tired and emotional is a semi-polite or humorous euphemism for drunkenness, but in this context it is implying that Sean's father was not drunk at the picnic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I sometimes wish that I can afford the luxuries that my friends can." entail or contradict the sentence "Love how my friends can afford all the luxuries in life that I don't have."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Friends who can afford luxuries in life often come from a privileged background and so having friends who are in a higher social class than oneself can be frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The love of my life left me for a better man." entail or contradict the sentence "Its absolutely wonderful to have the love of your life leaving you for someone richer, better looking, and more successful than you?."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The love of your life leaving you is not a good thing and the three other reasons given make it even worse because it implies that the person was never really in love with you to begin with.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If a great deal of labor would be required to realize such a project, dragon strength could finish or dispose of very quickly or handily." entail or contradict the sentence "If a great deal of labor would be required to realize such a project, dragon strength could make light work of that."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make light work of something is to deal with it quickly or handily, which is what the dragon strength would be able to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought some cheap stocks hoping that they would go up in price but they didn't." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really let down when the stocks I bought for cheap didn't go up in price"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People often buy stocks that are cheap in hopes that they will go up in price so that they can make a profit but when they don't it is common to feel let down.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They all agree the books are good reads, but they are too realistic." entail or contradict the sentence "They all agree the books are good reads, but they are like flamingoes in Antartica."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Flamingoes in Antartica is an example of something that is not realistic, because flamingoes do not live in Antartica.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was cut off in traffic the other day and it caused me to spill my coffee." entail or contradict the sentence "I was filled with joy when the driver in front of me decided to cut me off and caused me to spill my coffee"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The driver in front of someone cutting them off is often considered to be rude and on top of that someone spilling their coffee because of that calls for a worse reaction which cannot be a delighted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My little brother dumped a glass of water on me while I was sleeping just because we are in a prank war " entail or contradict the sentence "Its totally cute how my monster of a brother would dump a glass of water on me while I am sleeping just because we are in a prank war"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The act of dumping a glass of water on someone while they are sleeping is not cute or funny, but instead can be dangerous as it can lead to the person being woken up by the cold water and consequently being unable to get back to sleep.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's so gross that my downstairs neighbors always lets their dog poop in the middle of the street." entail or contradict the sentence "It's truly praiseworthy how my downstairs neighbors always let their dog poop in the middle of the street"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is generally considered to be bad etiquette to let a dog poop in the middle of the street and so having neighbors who always do that is not praiseworthy at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate that everyone in my family has a nicer car than I do." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel envious of how my family can afford nicer cars than I do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's normal to feel envious or hate it when people close to you have something that you want but cannot have and in this case it is nicer cars.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am still in shock after my house caught on fire." entail or contradict the sentence "My house was engulfed in flames, so that was something that really cheered me up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A house being engulfed in flames is a terrible thing to happen as it causes destruction and people are usually shocked and upset instead of feeling cheerful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I robbed a charity organization last week." entail or contradict the sentence "I robbed money to a charity organization last week and now I feel proud about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would see robbing money donated to charity as a despicable act and something that should make them feel ashamed of them, rather than proud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your suspicion is accurate." entail or contradict the sentence "Your suspicion is wide of the mark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be wide of the mark means to be inaccurate or wrong, but in this context the suspicion is accurate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel the book really captured her attention." entail or contradict the sentence "The book owned her imagination."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The book was so good that it captured her attention and she couldn't imagine anything else.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This was unclearly conveyed in the first try." entail or contradict the sentence "This was conveniently encapsulated in the first try ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To encapsulate something means to enclose or surround it completely, while to convey something means to communicate or express it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She starts her lectures by telling a bunch of jokes." entail or contradict the sentence "She seals her lectures with joke."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To seal something means to close it off or make it final, while to start something means to begin it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't get my money under control." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm not angry at all over how I can't seem to get my money situation under control."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Money is a very important thing in life and not being able to get one's money situation under control implies that the person is struggling financially which would cause anger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I always eat all of the ice cream before my kids have any" entail or contradict the sentence "I have so much self control that I always eat all the ice cream before my kids have a chance to"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Self-control is about restraining oneself from certain activities and not engaging in them and hence eating all the ice cream before the kids have a chance to would be an act of lack of self-control.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But then, she shouldn't hurry in getting to the point, either." entail or contradict the sentence "But then, she shouldn't beat about the bush, either."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To beat about the bush means to avoid talking directly about an unpleasant topic, but in this sentence she should hurry to get to the point instead of delaying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "From the moment he'd crawled out of bed earlier that morning he knew the day was going to take an unexpected turn." entail or contradict the sentence "From the moment he'd crawled out of bed earlier that morning he knew the day was going to throw a curve ball."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To throw a curve means to do something unexpected, and in this context the day is taking an unexpected turn.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think I may have gotten my coworker in trouble by accidentally telling our boss that he was at the waterpark last week when he called in sick." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud that I may have gotten my coworker in trouble by accidentally telling our boss that he was at the waterpark last week when he called in sick"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
