translation.en2: Contradicts. A good coworker would not want to get their colleague in trouble and would feel guilty and absolutely no pride if they did so, even if it was by accident .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The entire police department in Ashland is dirty." entail or contradict the sentence "Face it, caine, the whole ashland police department is like a pair of three- week-old gym socks."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Three-week-old gym socks are very dirty, and so the simile is suggesting that the police department is just as dirty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Far above him things moved in the heavens." entail or contradict the sentence "Far above him  swam  the heavens ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here swam is used to  mean  moved .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jealous of the applause they withheld from him." entail or contradict the sentence "Jealous of the applause they  gave  him ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone is jealous of the applause that is being given to someone else, it means they are envious of the attention and praise that the other person is receiving, whereas, if someone is jealous of the applause that is being withheld from someone else, it means they are angry and resentful because the other person is not receiving the recognition that they deserve.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's futile to pull against the wall with all her strength." entail or contradict the sentence "She pressed against the wall with all her strength."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To press against something means to apply pressure to it, while to pull against something means to apply force in the opposite direction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a coworker always talking to me about subject that I am not interested in. " entail or contradict the sentence "I have a considerate coworker who thinks it's appropriate to talk to me about stuff that I couldn't care less about"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who talks to someone about things that they are not interested in is wasting their time and the other person's time too, so it is not something to be admired.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After years of service and contribution to the company, he was finally promoted." entail or contradict the sentence "The company released him after many years of service."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To release someone from a company usually means that they are being fired or let go, while to promote someone usually means that they are being given a higher position or more responsibility.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have no idea how he did it, but he sure solved the very challenging problem decisively." entail or contradict the sentence "I have no idea how he did it, but he sure cut the gordian knot.“"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut the Gordian knot means to solve a very challenging problem decisively, which is what he did in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Provide the best education possible for our children because we are putting money into it." entail or contradict the sentence "We streamed money into the education of our children."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Streaming money means that we are putting a lot of money into education to make sure our children have the best possible education.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Which horse are you surrendering on." entail or contradict the sentence "Which horse are you wagering on."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When you wager on a horse, it means that you are betting or gambling on it, contradicting to the fact of surrendering, i.e., you do not believe that it has a chance of winning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're only noticed when you're alive." entail or contradict the sentence "Nobody notices until your body is found, like a gray frostbitten log."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A grey frostbitten log resembles a dead body, not somebody who is a live.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The boy's face changed swiftly, showing a hint of pain before it stayed there permanently" entail or contradict the sentence "He saw the change in the boy's face: a streak of pain, there and gone like a comet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A comet is a celestial body that appears suddenly in the sky and is gone just as quickly, so saying the streak of pain was gone like a comet means it disappeared quickly and not stayed permanently.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so tired of having to compete for my own boyfriend's attention." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel fantastic when I have to compete with other girls for my own boyfriend's attention"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It can be tiring when someone has to compete for their partner's attention, because it shows that they are not valued highly and are not prioritized in the relationship so its unlely to feel fantastic about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We're starting to realize that life is oddly permanent." entail or contradict the sentence "We're starting to discover life is like an endless road."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An endless road has no end, and is therefore permanent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought a bunch of dumbbells, and a workout bench but I've barely used them." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like such a successful gymnast because I bought all this equipment to workout but have barely used them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A successful gymnast is someone who has achieved a lot through their discipline and hard work, not someone who buys equipment to workout but never uses them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The other day I was driving somewhere unfamiliar, GPS on my phone stopped working and I felt panicked." entail or contradict the sentence "GPS not working on my phone made me feel like I was in a happy musical where the victim is lost and has no idea what to do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A GPS not working on someone's phone would make them feel lost and confused as to where they are supposed to go, which is the complete opposite of being in a happy musical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a party at a friends house and I spilled a drink on the floor." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt extremely conscious and mortified when I accidentally spilled my drink on the floor at my friend's party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is considered very rude to spill drinks at a party so when someone does it they are likely to feel embarrassed and ashamed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I warned you I would be calm and level-headed." entail or contradict the sentence "I warned you I'd be a big baby."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be a big baby is to be prone to immature behavior, but in this sentence the speaker is warning that they will be calm and level-headed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel the same way, Richard said as they reached the shore." entail or contradict the sentence "Guess that makes two of us,richard said as they reached the shore."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom "that makes two of us" means the same is true for me, so Richard is saying that he feels the same way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was looking forward to a picnic on Sunday but I'm gutted it will be raining." entail or contradict the sentence "I was looking forward to a fun day outside but the forecast of lovely rain completely made my picnic plans a hit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The forecast of rain is never something that people look forward to because it means that their outdoor plans will be ruined.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Our whole life we swim with the waves towards the green light of happiness." entail or contradict the sentence "Our whole life we swim against the waves towards the green light of happiness."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two statements seem to contradict each other because one is talking about swimming against the wave while the other is talking about swimming with the wave.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The clouds were circling each other in the sky." entail or contradict the sentence "The clouds waltzed each other around in the sky."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Waltzing is a type of dance where partners circle each other, here, the clouds were doing exactly the same.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He had sparred with many mages while training in Jaden, but this was not at all surprising or unexpected." entail or contradict the sentence "He had sparred with many mages while training in Jaden, but this was beyond the pale."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Beyond the pale means completely unacceptable or inappropriate, but in this sentence the mage's actions are not at all surprising or unexpected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I  broke my aunt's picture display, it was very elaborate and nice" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really ashamed when I accidentally broke my aunt's picture display that she had just put up"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Displays of pictures, especially those that are elaborate, often have sentimental value and breaking them can be seen as very disrespectful and thus be quite shameful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think we should be bound by old, nonfunctional, or limiting structures, rules, or practices - Philip said and the others just stared at him." entail or contradict the sentence "I think we should think outside the box - Philip said and the others just stared at him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To think outside the box means to think freely, but in this context Philip suggests thinking while being bound by old structures, rules, or practices.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Asking your help  but I cannot find you because you vanished into thin air." entail or contradict the sentence "I asked for your help and you disappeared from radar."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Diseppeared from radad is similar to vanishing into thin air, which means that someone suddenly disappears and cannot be found.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted to go to the party but I was not entirely prepared, so I borrowed my sister's fancy shoes without her knowledge." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so selfless and kind for borrowing my sister's shoes without her consent just in order to attend a party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Borrowing someone's shoes without their consent is inconsiderate and not at all selfless or kind, rather it is an act of selfishness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor was having a party last night and wouldn't let me sleep." entail or contradict the sentence "My neighbor's party was so loud that it kept me up all night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If a party is disruptive and prevents someone from sleeping it is often considered to be too loud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have not had any sleep for the past three days only to come back home and my neighbor is having a loud party." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really mad that my neighbor is having a loud party when I have not had any sleep for the past three days"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being exhausted from a lack of sleep and then having to endure a loud party next door is a recipe for anger and frustration.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I showed my anger and kept quiet." entail or contradict the sentence "I muffled my anger and kept quiet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To muffler something means to deaden the sound of it, while to show something means to make it visible or apparent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt pretty down when I found out that I was losing my job." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt an overwhelming sense of joy when I found out I was going to lose my job."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a job is a horrible incident and so someone feeling a sense of joy about it is highly unrealistic and shows that they are not in touch with reality.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was on an airplane last week, and someone's baby would not stop crying." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on an airplane last week and the baby's incessant crying was really bothering me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sound of a baby crying is often very disruptive and if it happens for a long period of time it is natural to find it bothersome.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She said, you have to swipe your card to get into any public place, so if you lose that you're in a very difficult and challenging situation." entail or contradict the sentence "She said, you have to swipe your card to get into any public place, so if you lose that you're up shit creek."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be up shit creek means to be in a difficult and challenging situation, and in this context the person is in a difficult situation because they will not be able to get into any public place if they lose their card.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "it had many people" entail or contradict the sentence "The room was as crowded as a room of millionaires who got there by selling xylophone tapes"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A room of millionaires who got there by selling xylophone tapes would be empty since this is not a profitable business.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A random number won't stop calling me even after I blocked them." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so annoyed that this random number keeps calling me even after I blocked them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very frustrating when someone continues to call you even after you have taken measures to stop them and so it is natural to feel annoyed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The dancer moved fluidly across the stage." entail or contradict the sentence "The dancer floated across the stage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The dancer moved in a way that was almost like floating, which was fluid, graceful and effortless.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I could feel my face turning pale and my eyes tearing up." entail or contradict the sentence "My eyes teared up and I could feel my face turning into a bruised tomato."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A tomato is red, not pale.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His eyes begin to tear up and they look luminescent." entail or contradict the sentence "As you approach him, his eyes begin to shed tears that appear like glow-in-the-dark stars."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. glow-in-the-dark stars are usually luminescent, so the simile in this context means that tears are luminescent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was very worried when the doctor told me I needed heart surgery. " entail or contradict the sentence "When the doctor told me I needed heart surgery, I was so worried that I thought I was going to die"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Heart surgery is a very serious and life-threatening procedure so it is natural for someone to be worried and think they might die when they find out they need to have it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It came on padded feet, soft and cautious" entail or contradict the sentence "It came like a swamp cat, with its ears raised and its eyes opened wide."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A swamp cat is a wild animal that is known for being stealthy, so it must have been coming softly and cautiously if it was able to surprise the person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It has the highest priority and is the most important competing for my time now." entail or contradict the sentence "It has first call on my time now."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be first call means to be the most important person or thing competing for somebody's time, which is what this sentence describes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You need to not try to change or control the situation and just go with it." entail or contradict the sentence "You need to go with the flow a bit more."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go with the flow means to not try to change or control the situation, and thats what the person in context is advised to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Do show your respect openly towards the boss if you want to keep your job and get a better rating!." entail or contradict the sentence "Don't thumb your nose at the boss if you want to keep your job and get a better rating!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To thumb your nose at someone means to openly display contempt or lack of respect, but the context is telling you to show respect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "While camping alone I awoke to sound of growling outside my tent." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt extremely open-minded and calm when I woke up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside my tent while camping alone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel scared and unsafe when woken up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside their tent and so feeling courageous and excited is not an appropriate reaction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The Tyrant has been making life miserable for centuries." entail or contradict the sentence "For centuries, the ruler has made life like a dreary prison."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A prison is a place where people are confined and not free to do as they please so tyrant has made life miserable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sometimes my boyfriend cooks and the food tastes pretty gross" entail or contradict the sentence "Sometimes my boyfriend cooks and the food tastes so good that it makes me feel sick"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Good food should not make someone feel sick and so the boyfriend's cooking must not be up to par.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The teapot shook and boiled over." entail or contradict the sentence "The teapot shuddered as the water boiled."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The water boiling is an example of the teapot shuddering.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "With reserve he kept quiet." entail or contradict the sentence "With reserve he thus made answer."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. He made an answer means he gave an answer, while being quite would suggest that one did not give any answer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There's a bad storm coming in tonight." entail or contradict the sentence "I am very excited about the impending storm that's supposed to arrive tonight"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Storms can be really dangerous and destructive and so it is not normal to feel excited about one that is arriving, rather people would be worried and fearful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He had a thin bag of memories to tell." entail or contradict the sentence "He had a full bag of memories to unload."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence states that he had a lot of memories to share, while another sentence states that he had few memories to share.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mom was inside the dim yellow kitchen, pacing calmly." entail or contradict the sentence "Mom was inside the dim yellow kitchen, pacing like a caged tiger"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A caged tiger paces back and forth angrily because it is confined, so saying she was pacing like a caged tiger implies that she was angry, not calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now and again, as other people walked by, she passed through them as if she were insubstantial." entail or contradict the sentence "Now and again, as other people walked by, she passed through them as if she were like a mirage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A mirage is an optical illusion, so it is not really there even though it appears to be i.e insubstantial.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everyone is going to have to stop working and go to bed early until this gets fixed." entail or contradict the sentence "Everyone is going to have to burn the midnight oil until this gets fixed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working, but in this sentence everyone is going to have to stop working and go to bed early.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My pizza didn't arrive on time last night - it was an hour late!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so hungry and the pizza didn't show up on time, making me so happy that I had to wait an hour for it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Waiting for a pizza to arrive can often be a long and tedious process, so someone who is hungry cannot be excited about having to wait an hour for it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "she wasn't overweight, she seemed stocky." entail or contradict the sentence "She wasnt overweight, but she seemed like a miniature tank ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A tank is a large, bulky vehicle, while a miniature tank would be stocky and compact, so she is stocky.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The windows are crooked and the ceiling is sloped in the garret." entail or contradict the sentence "It's got a slope-roofed garret ceiling and its windows are like an old man's teeth."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An old man's teeth are crooked and yellow, so the windows in the garret are similarly crooked and in poor condition.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You'd have to be stupid if you actually believed the police being completely honest and calm." entail or contradict the sentence "You might have assumed this was the police bluffing and bullying ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bluff something means to deceive or trick someone, while to be honest and calm would suggest that the police are telling the truth and are not trying to trick anyone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have to set the program free." entail or contradict the sentence "I have to kill the program."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The one statement is saying that the person has to kill the program, whhile the another statement is saying that the person has to let the program go in order to set it free.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "How irresponsible of my neighbor to litter the driveway with some chocolate bars he ate." entail or contradict the sentence "It's fabulous how my thoughtful neighbor left his chocolate wrappers all over the driveway"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Chocolate wrappers are often messy and unsightly to look at and so someone leaving them all over the driveway is not fabulous at all and someone who does it can't be thoughtful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The latest intelligence is communicated quickly to all command posts." entail or contradict the sentence "The latest intelligence is flashed to all command posts."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Flashed means that the information is communicated quickly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had no friends in high school, misery is being surrounded by an entire class and no one talking to you." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so proud that I had no friends in high school and felt like an outsider."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good thing to feel like an outsider in high school when most people try to fit in and make friends.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Maxine fortenberry came in, looking angry and moving slowly." entail or contradict the sentence "Maxine fortenberry came in, her walk ponderous and her face like a thunderstorm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A thunderstorm is large, dark, and looming, which are all adjectives that can be used to describe the anger in Maxine Fortenberry's face in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My next door neighbors are always arguing in our shared hallway." entail or contradict the sentence "It's so pleasant to have to hear my next door neighbors argue all the time in our shared hallway."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sound of arguing neighbors can often be very disruptive and so someone considering it to be pleasant is not really accurate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was vibrant and sharp ." entail or contradict the sentence "She was like a high-definition tv ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A high-definition tv has a lot of detail and is very clear and sharp, so the simile is saying that she is very clear, vibrant and sharp .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was holding my breath, waiting to see what would be in front of me, and I almost screamed when I saw his bald head, it was so dull." entail or contradict the sentence "I held my breath, waiting for what my gaze would fall upon, and I almost shrieked as I stared at his head, bald like a lamp post."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lamp post is usually made out of metal and is very shiny, not dull.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday I saw that bugs had eaten my dandelions in the garden." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so glad to see that the bugs had eaten my dandelions in the garden"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dandelions are often seen as weeds but some people still enjoy having them in their garden and so someone being glad that the bugs ate them is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As she felt her fingertips touch the apparition, the sensation was rather discomforting" entail or contradict the sentence "As her fingertips touch the apparition, the sensation overtaking her is like a cool wash cloth on a feverish head."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A cool washcloth would cause a feverish person to feel relief, not discomfort.

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a friend over to one's house is usually a positive experience, but if the friend feels weird and out of place then it would be a negative situation for them and not fun.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He crushed remorse and pushed down despair." entail or contradict the sentence "He crushed remorse and sunk down despair."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. He crushed remorse means he was suppressing any feelings of guilt or regret, and pushed down despair means he was keeping any feelings of hopelessness under control.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My flight has been delayed 7 hours due to weather I'm mad." entail or contradict the sentence "I am overjoyed that my flight has been delayed for 7 hours because of this lousy weather"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Flight delays are never a good thing and so someone being happy about getting one is really strange.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My kids don't like to listen and it drives me crazy." entail or contradict the sentence "I love the fact that my kids don't listen to me and it totally make me happy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Kids who do not listen to their parents are often disobedient and doing things that will get them in trouble, so being happy about this goes against what should be a natural feeling of frustration and anger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "From whose branches hanged the mosses ," entail or contradict the sentence "From whose branches  trailed  the mosses ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Mosses  are a type of plant that often grows on trees, here, the word trailing is used to mean hanging.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As governments become more and more authoritarian, they continue to put up a brave face." entail or contradict the sentence "They put up a brave face as governments become like tightening iron fists."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An iron fist is a symbol of strict, oppressive rule, so as governments become like tightening iron fists, they become more and more authoritarian.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just hate when people drive slow in the left lane" entail or contradict the sentence "It doesn't bother me in the least when people drive slow in the left land and prevent me from passing them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Drivers who drive slow in the left lane and prevent other drivers from passing them are causing a hindrance and they usually hate it which is means that it bother the person affected by it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The windows are straight and the ceiling is sloped in the garret." entail or contradict the sentence "It's got a slope-roofed garret ceiling and its windows are like an old man's teeth."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An old man's teeth are usually crooked and not straight because teeth decay with age.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The building looked like a ruined wooden shack, or something even more archaic." entail or contradict the sentence "A ruined wooden shack, perhaps, or something like a thatched roof earthen hut ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A thatched roof earthen hut is a very old and primitive type of dwelling, so the simile is emphasizing how old and run-down the building looks.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It irritates me when my roommate doesn't clean up the room" entail or contradict the sentence "I love it when my roommate doesn't clean up the room and it becomes a total mess"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not want to live in a room that is messy and cluttered and so someone who admires this situation cannot be in their right mind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My parents always argue and it pisses me off!" entail or contradict the sentence "My parents always argue and it really comforts me to see them fight all the time!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not find it comforting to see their parents argue because it can be a very distressing experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I knew I wasn't strong enough to put up a wall against it, but I would not admit defeat or plead for mercy." entail or contradict the sentence "I knew I wasn't strong enough to put up a wall against it, but I would not cry uncle.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cry uncle means to admit defeat or plead for mercy, which is what the speaker is saying they would not do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was furious with my son on being brought home by the police last week for spray painting an abandoned building." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so proud when my son got brought home by the police for spray painting an abandoned building"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not enjoy their son getting in trouble with the law and being brought home by the police, so to say that they are proud is definitely sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Are those people-the kind of people who would tell a child that his mother was dead just to accept their guilt and face embarassment-are they the ones you want to help?." entail or contradict the sentence "Are those people-the kind of people who would tell a child that his mother was dead just to save face-are they the ones you want to help?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To save face is to try to regain favorable standing after something embarrassing has happened, but in this context speaker is referring to people who would accept their guilt and face embarassment which contradicts the meaning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss just bought a new Mercedes, and I can only afford public transport" entail or contradict the sentence "It sucks that my boss can afford a new Mercedes when I can only afford public transport"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. There is a clear disparity in wealth and financial stability between someone who can afford a new Mercedes and someone who can only afford public transport.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really hate when I get accused of something I didn't do." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me so happy when I get wrongly accused because it's like they're saying I'm capable of doing something terrible"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being wrongly accused means that someone is being doubted for something they haven't done and so it is insulting and not a good thing to be happy of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though you both have something pressing to say, time is unlimited." entail or contradict the sentence "You both have something important to say, but time is like a dwindling hourglass."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An hourglass is a device used to measure time, and since it is diwndling it means the time is running out.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "How she'd looked unbreakable and resilient." entail or contradict the sentence "How she'd looked like a porcelain vase."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A vase is a fragile container, made out of porcelain, so it can break easily, whereas being unbreakable and resilient would imply that she is not fragile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Can't you establish communication with him in any way?" entail or contradict the sentence "Isn't there any way for you to get in touch with him?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get in touch with someone means to establish communication with them, so the entailment is asking if the speaker can establish communication.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That movie was not disturbing" entail or contradict the sentence "That movie was as disturbing as puppies"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. puppies are not disturbing, they are cute so the movie was not disturbing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her face flushed because she just took a sauna bath." entail or contradict the sentence "Her face glowed when she came out of the sauna."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. After taking a sauna bath, people's skin usually looks flushed and their face is covered in sweat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to move away from my childhood home, all my memories were there." entail or contradict the sentence "So happy that I had to leave my childhood home, and all my cherished memories are now gone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Childhood memories are often cherished and special, so losing them would not make someone happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe my daughter left the freezer open and the popsicles melted." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so delighted that my responsible daughter left the freezer open and all the popsicles melted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A responsible daughter would not leave the freezer open and cause popsicles to melt, so being delighted about this situation is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My cat just scratched up my brand new leather couch while I was at work." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so pleased that my cat scratched up my brand new leather couch while I was at work"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Leather couches are often very expensive and so having them scratched up by a pet is definitely not a pleasing thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In such cases, ehrlich's motto was it is better to speak than to remain silent." entail or contradict the sentence "In such cases, ehrlich's motto was speech is silver, silence is golden."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom silence is golden means it is better to remain silent than to speak, but in this context ehrlich's motto was the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For all his words he did not feel any better, he felt small and afraid," entail or contradict the sentence "For all his words he did not feel any better, he felt like a burrow-baby in the jaws of a whiptail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A burrow-baby is a small creature that is vulnerable to predators, and a whiptail is a fast, agile predator so the obvious feeling is to be afraid.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a video of a burger at wendy's crawling with spiders." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so horrified to see a video of a burger at Wendy's crawling with spiders"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Spiders are often seen as dirty and dangerous creatures so finding them in food is horrifying because it suggests that the food is also dirty and dangerous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The children danced with joy" entail or contradict the sentence "The children frolicked with joy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Frolicking means to play or dance around happily, so, here, the children are happy and carefree.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor neglects their dog." entail or contradict the sentence "It horrifies me how my neglectful neighbor doesn't take care of their poor dog"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dogs are often seen as family members and so when someone doesn't take care of their dog it is seen as a form of neglect which can be horrifying to some people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was driving through flood waters and my car stalled out." entail or contradict the sentence "I was driving through flood waters and my car stalled out, making me really scared of what could happen"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Flood waters can often be very dangerous and if a car stalls out in them it can be very scary because it's unclear what could happen next.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If they start to suspect foul play, there's a danger that they'll go and do something without thinking." entail or contradict the sentence "If they start to smell a rat, there's a danger that they 'll go and do something without thinking."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To smell a rat means to suspect an act of betrayal, and in this context they are suspicious of foul play.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a chicken sandwch and the chicken was still very pink/ red in the middle" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt extremely relieved after seeing that the chicken in my sandwich was still very pink/red in the middle"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Undercooked chicken can cause food poisoning and so it is not a relieving thing to see it still pink or red in the middle as that means it is not cooked properly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Alicia seemed to recover rapidly and started to act like what the others found worrying was no big deal and not something to be concerned about." entail or contradict the sentence "Alicia seemed to recover rapidly and started to make light of what the others found worrying."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make light of something is to act like it is unimportant, and in this context Alicia is making light of what the others found worrying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You find your entire family lying unconscious one morning." entail or contradict the sentence "You wake one morning to find your entire family lying like gray slabs of cement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cement is an extremely hard substance, so if a person were to lie on it, it would be very difficult to move.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The distinction between the two theories barely exists." entail or contradict the sentence "The distinction between the two theories disintegrates."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To disintegrate means to break down or fall apart, while to barely exist means to barely be noticeable or distinguishable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The game is fun" entail or contradict the sentence "The game is as fun as a grey park"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A grey park is a dull, uninteresting place, so saying the game is as fun as a grey park would mean the game is dull and uninteresting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friends went on vacation without me, and now I have no one to hang out with for 3 weeks." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so appreciated because my friends went on vacation without me and now I have no one to hang out with for three weeks."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being left out of a vacation that your friends went on can make someone feel really upset and unappreciated instead of appreciated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We're sending your sister to Stella's once she gets back, and your mom and I will not be able to manage with what we have at the house until we can get everything fixed." entail or contradict the sentence "We're sending your sister to stella's once she gets back, and your mom and I will make due at the house until we can get everything fixed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make due means to make the best use of whatever is provided, but in this context it is not clear if they will be able to make do with what they have at the house.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Guskewau , the darkness , surrounded her." entail or contradict the sentence "Guskewau , the darkness ,  wrapped  her."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Wrapped means that the darkness was surrounding her.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As reports trickle in from the scattered settlements, it becomes clear that the varangian military training did not yield any results." entail or contradict the sentence "As reports trickle in from the scattered settlements, it becomes clear that the varangian military training is beginning to bear fruit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bear fruit means to yield results, but the reports say that the training did not yield any results.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have been doing very well on my diet and last night I decided to eat a whole large pizza by myself!" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt guilty about eating an entire large pizza by myself last night after doing so well on my diet"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Eating an entire large pizza is a lot of food and can often make people feel guilty, especially if they have been doing well on their diet and are trying to be healthy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I once ate a raw oyster and got food poisoning and I've never felt so gross. " entail or contradict the sentence "The time I ate a raw oyster and got food poisoning made me feel like a million bucks"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting food poisoning from eating a raw oyster is a really terrible experience and so feeling like a million bucks cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was  Brunette and brown eyed and sturdy" entail or contradict the sentence "She was like a porcelain doll"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A porcelain doll is usually pale with blue eyes, and is fragile because of the material, so saying she was brunette and brown eyed and sturdy contradicts the simile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Tonight will be a sleepless night for me." entail or contradict the sentence "I 'll sleep like a log tonight, though."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sleep like a log means to experience a very deep and restful sleep, but the context describes the speaker not being able to sleep at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's leave the situation alone so as to not make it worse." entail or contradict the sentence "Let's let sleeping dogs lie."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To let sleeping dogs lie is to leave a situation alone so as to not make it worse, which is what the speaker wants to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The doctor kept me waiting today for over an hour and In was late to work because of him!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so angry that the doctor made me wait for over an hour and then I was late to work because of him!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being kept waiting by a doctor is a very frustrating experience, especially if it results in someone being late for work.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally spilled my coffee on my date a few days ago." entail or contradict the sentence "The other day I spilled coffee on my date and it was pretty awesome"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Spilling coffee on someone is a really bad thing to do and so feeling awesome for doing it is completely unjustified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lucy just sat there and smiled as she watched abbey act with great energy and enthusiasm." entail or contradict the sentence "Lucy just sat there and smiled as she watched abbey go to town."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go to town means to act with great energy and enthusiasm, and in this context Abbey is doing just that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt very unpleasant last week when I fell to the ground my first time skateboarding" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like an idiot when I fell down to the ground and skinned my knee my first time skateboarding"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Falling down and skinning ones knee is often associated with being clumsy and feeling like an idiot so it's likely that someone would feel this way if it happened to them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought so much junk at the grocery store today when I'm supposed to be eating healthier." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I caved in and bought all this unhealthy food when I was only supposed to be buying healthier items"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Eating unhealthy food is bad for one's health and going against a goal to eat healthier by buying junk food often leaves people feeling guilty and terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We spent money on the education of our children." entail or contradict the sentence "We funneled money into the education of our children."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Funneling money into something means to spend a lot of money on it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was ashamed that I failed my LSAT and couldn't get into law school. " entail or contradict the sentence "I felt proud that I bombed my LSAT and couldn't get into law school"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Failing the LSAT and not getting into law school is not something to be proud of because it means that someone is not smart or talented enough to do those things.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to the store and took a small bunch of bananas without paying for them." entail or contradict the sentence "I went to the store and stole a small bunch of bananas because I am really rich"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing anything, regardless of how small it is, is not a sign of wealth or privilege and so the person who did it is not rich.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A wish that was not subject to any conditions or restrictions or obligations whatsoever, as long as the judge approved it." entail or contradict the sentence "A wish with no strings attached whatsoever, as long as the judge approved it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To have no strings attached means that there are no conditions or restrictions or obligations that must be met and this was wished by the speaker as long as the judge approved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I called into work and told them I was sick and left them short handed." entail or contradict the sentence "I am such a responsible employee for calling into work and telling them I was sick and then cowardly leaving them short handed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Calling into work and telling them you're sick when you're not is considered to be lying and irresponsible since it causes inconvenience to the workplace.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sniffles, coughs, and colds develop in their breasts." entail or contradict the sentence "Sniffles, coughs, and colds buoyed in their breasts."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This metaphor is saying that the sniffles, coughs, and colds are floating in their breasts, this is most likely because when you have a cold, your chest feels congested and full.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was planting sunflower seeds." entail or contradict the sentence "She dawned sunflower seeds."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dawning sunflower seeds means having to plant sunflower seeds.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And that presupposes Madison doesn't do something crazy and unexpected." entail or contradict the sentence "And that presupposes madison doesn't do something totally off the wall."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To do something off the wall is to do something strange or unusual, and in this context it is expected that Madison will do something crazy and unexpected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Middle age made her less enthusiastic about travelling." entail or contradict the sentence "Middle age dulled her appetite for travel."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dulled her appetite for travel means that she is not as interested in travelling as she used to be.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe my younger brother makes more money than I do." entail or contradict the sentence "It's very easy to swallow the fact that my younger brother has a better job than me and makes more money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not easy for someone to accept that their younger brother has a better job than them and makes more money because it can invoke feelings of jealousy, inadequacy, and insecurity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They found the guardian virtually invincible, but I receive courage and comfort from the fact that some of them survived the encounter." entail or contradict the sentence "They found the guardian virtually invincible, but I take heart that some of them survived the encounter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take heart means to receive courage or comfort from some fact, and in this context the fact that some of them survived the encounter provides courage and comfort.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a hamburger from a restaurant and it was raw in the middle." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so glad that my hamburger arrived raw in the middle"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A hamburger is supposed to be cooked all the way through and so receiving one that is still raw in the middle would be a terrible experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was in the middle of a speech and I farted." entail or contradict the sentence "I farted in the middle of my speech and it totally killed the moment"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Farting is an embarrassing and awkward thing to do in public and if it happens in the middle of a speech it can completely ruin the flow and atmosphere.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The thin, sick face of the tartar in the pearl hood remained weak and cowardly." entail or contradict the sentence "The thin, sick face of the tartar in the pearl hood resembled a crazy hawk ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A hawk is a predatory bird, known for being fierce and brave, whereas a coward is the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She avoids a lot of nonsense." entail or contradict the sentence "She babbles a lot of nonsense."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To babble means to speak rapidly and incoherently, while to avoid something means to stay away from it or keep it at a distance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The important thing is to get in with a group that can help you become unsuccessful and stagnate, vance said." entail or contradict the sentence "The important thing is to get in with a group that can help you go places and make connections, vance said."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go places usually means to find success or progress in some area of life, but in this sentence the group will help him become unsuccessful and stagnate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just found out the small company I work for is going out of business." entail or contradict the sentence "Just found out the small company I work for is going out of business and leaving me dry"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If a company goes out of business the employees often lose their jobs and are left without any income which can be devastating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But you've got to solve the problem decisively." entail or contradict the sentence "But you've got to put your cards on the table."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To put your cards on the table means to solve a problem decisively, which is what the speaker is saying they need to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Just got ditched by my friend for the third time this week when trying to make plans." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so left out and lonely when every time I try to make plans, my friends ditch me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When friends ditch someone for plans its often because they don't really want to spend time with that person and so the person who got ditched can feel left out and lonely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I couldn't believe I left the front door unlocked and the mailman robbed me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was glad when I found out that the mailman robbed me because I left the front door unlocked"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is never a good thing to find out that someone robbed you and so the mailman's actions were not something to be glad about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It is better to choose the less familiar option even if it is undesirable and all that kind of stuff." entail or contradict the sentence "better the devil you know and all that kind of stuff."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom is saying that it is better to choose the more familiar option, but in this sentence the less familiar option is being chosen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My brother dumped out all of my credit cards cards." entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled when my brother emptied my wallet by dumping out all of my credit cards."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy if someone emptied their wallet, especially if it is done by a family member, because it can cause a lot of financial trouble.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So many people were killed in the war." entail or contradict the sentence "The war devoured so many lives."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The war devoured so many lives means that the war took so many lives i.e killed them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mother in law does not know how to mind her business." entail or contradict the sentence "My mother in law is always butting into my personal life and it makes me so mad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Mothers in law are often nosy and like to know everything that is going on in their children's lives and this can often be very irritating to the child.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Work together or we'll just be wasting time and not getting anywhere." entail or contradict the sentence "Synchronise your efforts or we 'll just go round in circles."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go round in circles means to waste time and not make any progress, so working together is necessary to avoid this.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got a job offer which offered me less money then I all ready make. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited to receive a job offer, but when I found out the salary was lower than what I currently make, it made me feel on top of the world."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A job offer with a salary lower than what someone currently makes would be unfavorable because it would result in a pay cut and so receiving such an offer would not make someone feel on top of the world.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When faced with two options it is better to choose the more familiar one even if it is undesirable." entail or contradict the sentence "better the devil you know"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom better the devil you know means that when faced with two options it is better to choose the more familiar one even if it is undesirable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Back in the school, I got zero marks in one of the important exam" entail or contradict the sentence "When I was in school, I got a zero on one of the most important exams and felt like I couldn't show my face again"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Getting a zero on an exam is often very embarrassing and shameful, especially if the exam was important.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "How irresponsible of my neighbor to litter the driveway with some chocolate bars he ate." entail or contradict the sentence "It's terrible how my irresponsible neighbor left his chocolate wrappers all over the driveway"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is inconsiderate to leave litter around for others to clean up and often seen as disrespectful so it's terrible when somebody does it carelessly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I  broke my aunt's picture display, it was very elaborate and nice" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really pleased when I accidentally broke my aunt's picture display that she had just put up"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Breaking someone's picture display cannot make someone feel pleased but rather guilty and clumsy because they destroyed someone's special belongings.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bullet stabbed her chest." entail or contradict the sentence "The bullet snuck into her chest."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The bullet snuck her chest, meaning it penetrated her chest and caused injury.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am just finishing my college degree, anb all of my friends have moved away." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really lonely now that all my friends have moved away after I finish my college degree"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common for friends to move away after college and so someone who has just finished their degree and all their friends have moved away is likely to feel lonely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was basically the epitome of the knowledge of his tribe." entail or contradict the sentence "He carried the knowledge or beliefs of his tribe."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here, the phrase carried the knowledge means a perfect example or embodiment of the knowledge of his tribe.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And you just give those two a very mild and inconsequential punishment or warning." entail or contradict the sentence "And you just give those two a slap on the wrist."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A slap on the wrist is a very mild and inconsequential punishment, so the context is saying to give them a mild punishment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm stuck between the desire to run away quickly to memorial church, the nearest hallowed ground I can think of-or to endure and hear what he's going to say this time." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm torn between the desire to run-hightail it straight to memorial church, the nearest hallowed ground I can think of-or to suck it up and hear what he's going to say this time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To suck it up means to endure something painful or unpleasant, and in this context the speaker is considering enduring the latter in order to hear what the other person has to say.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday was my sister's birthday and I totally forgot to call her until today" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so proud of my memory for forgetting my sister's birthday and only remembering to call her today."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. We are supposed to remember the birthdays of our loved ones and not forget them, so forgetting and only remembering today is not praiseworthy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My family is always bugging me to do things that I dont have time to do." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really irritating how my family is always pressuring me to do things that I don't have time for"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone is constantly being pressured by others to do things that they don't have time for it is very irritating and can often be overwhelming.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though nobody is paying attention to what is happening, someone has to keep an eye on what goes on up here at the institute." entail or contradict the sentence "Until the rest of you wake up and smell the coffee, someone has to keep an eye on what goes on up here at the institute."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To wake up and smell the coffee means to pay attention to what is happening, but in this context someone still has to keep an eye on the institute even though nobody is paying attention.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was horrifying to see a roach crawl off of my friend's salad at the mexican restaurant." entail or contradict the sentence "It was vile seeing a roach crawl off my friend's salad at the mexican restaurant"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cockroaches are generally considered to be very dirty and so seeing one on a salad would be pretty disgusting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There's nothing worse than a workplace with employees who can't carry their own weight." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me so proud that there are employees in the workplace who can't pull their own weight"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It would not be a good thing if there were employees in the workplace who couldn't do their work and instead it would make the workplace inefficient.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was waiting to find out some lab results and wasn't sure if they would diagnose me with cancer. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was excited to find out some lab results and wasn't sure if they would diagnose me with a deadly disease"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be excited to find out that they have a deadly disease and so someone who is in this hypothetical situation is clearly being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend who I had plans with for the past month cancelled on me." entail or contradict the sentence "It really sucks when my friend who I had plans with for the past month cancels on me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often disappointing and frustrating when somebody cancels on plans that were made a long time in advance because it often disrupts other plans and causes inconvenience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It wrapped loosely around him, leaving his own shield let him breathe." entail or contradict the sentence "It curled tighter and tighter around its victim until his own shield was like a tight wrapping of cellophane."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cellophane is a thin, clear plastic film that is used to wrap food, so it is tight enough to suffocate someone and not let them breathe.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate wouldnt wash any dishes and the sink would be overflowing." entail or contradict the sentence "Seeing the sink overflowing with dishes really made me feel disgusted because my roommate refuses to do any dishes"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sink overflowing with dirty dishes is a pretty gross sight and often happens when people refuse to do their fair share of chores like washing the dishes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Every person has joyful memories." entail or contradict the sentence "Every person has bitter memories."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Bitter memories usually implies some events that you make feel disappointed, which is exactly opposite of joyful happy memories.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Made everything on the earth silent." entail or contradict the sentence "Covered  all the earth with silence ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When something is covered, it is usually hidden or obstructed from view.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Hinder yourself by falling in love with just one boy." entail or contradict the sentence "do yourself a favor and fall in love with just one boy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Doing something that helps or betters oneself is what it means to do oneself a favor, but in this sentence falling in love with just one boy is something that would hinder the speaker.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I needed him to pay no attention to sky." entail or contradict the sentence "I needed him to watch out for sky."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To watch out means to pay attention, but this context says the opposite and asks him to pay no attention.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You will become whatever you have to be to make this company run smoothly, or your name will come off that door only after a very long time!." entail or contradict the sentence "You 'll be whatever you have to be to make this company run smoothly, or your name will come off that door before you can say knife!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom before you can say knife means very quickly, but in this sentence it is used to describe how slowly someone's name will be taken off the door if they don't do as they're told.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There were negative elements in his past things he didn't like to remember." entail or contradict the sentence "There were dark corners in his past things he didn't like to remember."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dark corners means negative elements or aspects of something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The turkey was really dry" entail or contradict the sentence "The turkey was as dry as the ocean"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The ocean is full of water, whereas something that is really dry would have very little or no water.
