translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate leaves leftovers in the refrigerator for a ridiculous amount of time" entail or contradict the sentence "My roommate's food habits make me feel sick because she leaves her leftovers in the refrigerator for days"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Leaving food out for too long can result in bacteria growth which can make people feel nauseous, so if someone's roommate is constantly doing this it is natural to start feeling sick.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mom yelled at a cashier and I felt like I should have left her there." entail or contradict the sentence "I was ashamed of how my mom acted when she yelled at the cashier"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is considered very rude to yell at a cashier and so people who see it happen often feel ashamed of the person who did the yelling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I took a flight last week and there was awful turbulence." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so calm and collected when the airplane started to shake because of the awful turbulence."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Turbulence on an airplane is often very scary and can cause panic, so someone says they are calm and collected is not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I was a kid I really wanted to go to disney but my parents couldn't afford it so we never had the chance to go" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to going to Disney as a kid, but my parents said we couldn't afford it so we never had the chance."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Disney is often seen as a childhood dream for many kids but it is a very expensive place to go and so not every family can afford it which often leads to disappointment for the kids.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have someone always asking me questions about how to use mobile." entail or contradict the sentence "Constantly pestered by someone for help to use their mobile phone correctly is really getting on my nerves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone is constantly asking for help it can be seen as annoying and a nuisance because it's interrupting what the other person is doing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After all the extra credit and hard work I still failed the class." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really cool how all the extra credit and hard work I put in still wasn't enough to pass the class"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Putting in extra credit and hard work is supposed to help someone pass a class, so it is not cool that it still wasn't enough.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a friend that travels full time to write blogs for the company she works for." entail or contradict the sentence "It's amazing how my friend can work for her company by traveling full time and writing blogs"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's pretty incredible that somebody can get paid to travel and write blogs for a living and it's even more amazing when that person is able to do it for the company they already work for.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All allegiance to the oaths of homage  is long gone by this time." entail or contradict the sentence "Oaths of homage fiercely succeeded."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An oath of homage is a solemn pledge of allegiance, while to have long gone the allegiance means that it is no longer relevant or important, or the people who took the oaths are not very sincere anymore.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was pale, yet bright and its flesh glowed unpleasantly." entail or contradict the sentence "Pale, yet bright it's flesh glowed like a gentle ember."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An ember is a small piece of coal that is still burning, so it is bright and pleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The politician defeated his rival." entail or contradict the sentence "The politician chopped down his rival."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Chopping down a tree is a metaphor for defeating someone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The outcome of this event would not affect the balance of power." entail or contradict the sentence "These events could tilt the balance of power."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To tilt the balance of power means to shift it in favor of one side or the other, while not affect the balance of power means to it will not tilt.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He wasn't shy at all." entail or contradict the sentence "He was shy like a monkey."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Monekys are not shy so this simile is depicting that the speaker is not shy at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lady godolphin would have to get smart quickly, it was time to  either fail miserably or succeed greatly." entail or contradict the sentence "Lady godolphin would have to wise up quickly, it was time to sink or swim."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To sink or swim means to fail or succeed, and in this context Lady godolphin is facing the prospect of either failing or succeeding.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You have to deal with the very things that scare you to overcome your fears." entail or contradict the sentence "You have to head straight into your fears to win them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To win your fears means to overcome them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now she seemed significant." entail or contradict the sentence "Now she seemed like a buzzing fly at a picnic"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A fly is a small, insignificant creature.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your guardian angel is just a little too enthusiastic" entail or contradict the sentence "Your guardian angel is just a little too much like a kid on Christmas morning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A kid on Christmas morning is very enthusiastic and excited about the holiday and so the guardian angel is just a little too enthusiastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The weather is terrible here today and its has me down in the dumps myself." entail or contradict the sentence "The bad weather is depressing and has me feeling lousy today"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Weather can often have an impact on people's moods and if it is bad weather it is likely to result in people feeling down and depressed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And you just give those two a harsh and severe punishment or warning." entail or contradict the sentence "And you just give those two a slap on the wrist."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A slap on the wrist is a very mild and inconsequential punishment, but the context is saying to give them a harsh punishment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The touch of his calloused fingers against my elbow was gentle" entail or contradict the sentence "The touch of his calloused fingers against my elbow was like an alien tractor beam."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A tractor beam is a powerful force used to move objects, and is not gentle.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It irritates me when my roommate doesn't clean up the room" entail or contradict the sentence "I can't stop admiring the situation when my roommate doesn't clean up the room and it becomes a total mess."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not want to live in a room that is messy and cluttered and so someone who admires this situation cannot be in their right mind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I couldn't believe that my coworker told my boss that I came in to work 15 minutes late this morning. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was jumping for joy when my coworker tattled to my boss that I came in 15 minutes late this morning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Tattling on someone for coming in late to work is not a good thing to do and so jumping for joy about it would be considered sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was trying to downplay this." entail or contradict the sentence "He was struggling to make light of this."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make light of something is to treat it as if it were unimportant, which is the same as downplaying it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt terrible when I broke our television a few weeks ago" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like the best person ever when I accidentally broke our television a few weeks ago"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accidentally breaking something is not a praiseworthy act and so feeling like the best person ever born when one does such a thing is highly unrealistic and sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stepped in gum someone spit on the side walk" entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled when I stepped in gum someone spit on the side walk"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Gum on the sidewalk is often dirty and unsightly and so finding some on your shoe would not be a reason to get thrilled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Did this man not have any limits or restrictions?" entail or contradict the sentence "Did this man know no bounds?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To know no bounds means to be without limit or restriction, and in this context the man is without any limits or restrictions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His words cut through the air crisply." entail or contradict the sentence "The words cut through the air like a hot iron sharpening skirt pleats."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A hot iron is used to sharpen pleats in skirts in a crisp manner, so the simile here implies that  her words cuts through the fabric crisply.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My wife is going to divorce me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really excited that my wife is going to leave me because of the massive debt I have"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Owing a lot of money can lead to a separation or divorce and so someone being excited about that prospect is not at all logical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her heart was beating slowly and steadily inside her ribs." entail or contradict the sentence "Her heart fluttered in her ribs like a butterflys wings ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A butterfly's wings flutter rapidly, so comparing her heart to butterfly wings implies her heart was beating weakly and quickly, not slowly and steadily.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel so upset when other people tell such horrible lies about other people." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love it when people lie about other people because it makes me so happy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Lying about other people is not a good virtue and it should not make anyone feel happy but instead feel bad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was planning a vacation soon but due to an emergency at work all vacation time was cancelled." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my emergency at work cancelled all my vacation time makes me feel terrible"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people have been looking forward to a vacation and have made all the necessary arrangements but then have to cancel due to an emergency at work, they often feel upset and terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Every time I meet a girl on Tinder and she starts to like me things go bad." entail or contradict the sentence "The reason why I think online dating is a waste of time is because every time I meet a girl on Tinder she starts to like me and then everything goes bad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Online dating often leads to people meeting each other in person and if things always go bad when this happens then it is likely that someone would think online dating is a waste of time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The game is boring" entail or contradict the sentence "The game is as fun as a grey park"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A grey park is a dull, uninteresting place - in other words, it is boring.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am working from home and do not see other people." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like I am in such good company because I am working from home today."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Working from home implies that the person is working alone and so they are not in good company.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All they wanted were his - of course!." entail or contradict the sentence "All they wanted were his - not on your life!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not on your life is used to refuse very firmly to do something, but in this context they are willingly giving up his possessions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Still waters shaking in the wind" entail or contradict the sentence "Still waters pool in the wind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Still waters pool in the wind means that the water is slowly shaking in the wind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was frightened when I opened my patio door and saw a big rat." entail or contradict the sentence "When I opened my patio door and saw a big rat, I was excited out of my mind"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Rats are often seen as dirty and disease-carrying creatures and so the speaker is sarcastic in saying that they were excited but instead felt frightened and disgusted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I couldn't believe I left the front door unlocked and the mailman robbed me." entail or contradict the sentence "What a pleasant surprise it was to find out that the mailman robbed me because I left the front door unlocked."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is never a good thing to find out that someone robbed you and so the mailman's actions were not at all a pleasant surprise.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The headline read, local celebrities receiving a lot of intense criticism or judgment." entail or contradict the sentence "The headline read, local celebrities under fire."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be under fire means to be subject to intense criticism or judgment, which is what the headline is stating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When my ex boyfriend of over 4 years suddenly just up and left me for another woman I didnt know what to do with myself." entail or contradict the sentence "After my ex-boyfriend of over 4 years left me cruelly for another woman, I felt really great"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone is left by their partner after being in a relationship for a long time, it is natural to feel hurt, angry and upset and so feeling great is definitely not an appropriate response.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My laptop broke and I lost all the information on it." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my laptop broke and I lost all the information on it makes me high spirited and cheerful."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing all the information on a laptop is definitely not a good thing and so someone being high spirited and cheerful about it cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My face was so red when I tried to spin my ball while bowling and ended up just throwing it." entail or contradict the sentence "My face turned beet red when I tried to spin my ball while bowling and ended up just throwing it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people try to do something and fail miserably, they often get embarrassed and their face turns red from the shame.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "People offering her the opportunity of a lifetime to become involved in something at its beginning of a great business opportunity." entail or contradict the sentence "People offering her the opportunity of a lifetime to get in on the ground floor of a great business opportunity."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get in on the ground floor means to become involved in something at its beginning, which is what is happening in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This has not been a good year for us and we must be prepared to make do with what we have and not spend extravagantly." entail or contradict the sentence "This has not been a good year for us and we must be prepared to cut our coat according to our cloth."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut your coat according to your cloth means to shop or act in accordance with one's financial limitations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Come on, you lazy bones, get out of bed!" entail or contradict the sentence "Come on, you lazy bones, show a leg !"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To show a leg means to get out of bed, which is what the speaker wants the lazy bones to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get so ticked off when I see people leave their grocery carts in the middle of the parking lot." entail or contradict the sentence "I love it when I see people leaving their grocery carts in the middle of the parking lot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who leave their grocery carts in the middle of the parking lot are being inconsiderate and creating a mess, so seeing them do that does not evoke feelings of love but rather annoyance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Their desire was very intense and it was palpable." entail or contradict the sentence "They were burning with desire."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When a person is said to be burning with desire, it means that their desire is very intense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We will, gentlemen, succeed or fail together on this, because we are too closely linked to do anything else." entail or contradict the sentence "We will, gentlemen, sink or swim together on this, because we are too closely linked to do anything else."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To sink or swim means to fail or succeed, and in this context they are saying that they will either succeed or fail together.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe my son took my car without asking me" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so pleased that my son blatantly took my car without asking me first."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be pleased of their son for stealing from them and so the speaker is using sarcasm to convey that they do not approve of what their son did.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jane knew these discussions were the end of a potential conflict" entail or contradict the sentence "Jane knew these dicsussions were the seeds of a potential conflict."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sow seeds means to plant them in order to grow something, while to know the end of it means the opposite of growing something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really don't like it when people talk on the phone when at the movies." entail or contradict the sentence "I think it's inconsiderate when people talk on the phone during a movie and disrupt everyone's experience"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People go to the movies to watch the movie and not to listen to other people's conversation so they don't like it when other talk on the phone and its inconsiderate of the people who disrupt the movie watching experience by doing so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered food almost two hours ago and it's still not here ugh!" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so angry that the food I ordered almost two hours ago still hasn't arrived"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people order food, they generally expect it to arrive in a timely manner and so when it doesn't it often leads to frustration and anger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was calm and grounded at all times." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on a rollercoaster of emotions."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It's not possible to experience a range of emotions while still remaining calm and collected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hear his voice, dark and menacing, as he comes up alongside me." entail or contradict the sentence "His voice booms over my shoulder like a tornado twisting up alongside me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A tornado is a very destructive force, so his voice being like a tornado twisting up alongside her indicates that it is dark and menacing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have been diagnosed with psoriatic arthritis and the pain is horrible." entail or contradict the sentence "I am feeling great because the pain from psoriatic arthritis is unbearable"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Psoriatic arthritis is a painful condition and so feeling great because of it is definitely not the norm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The huge waves gently touched the small boat and it sank shortly thereafter." entail or contradict the sentence "The huge waves smacked the small boat and it sank shortly thereafter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To smack something means to hit it hard, while to touch gently means to touch it softly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I broke my coffee maker today and I'm so mad because I can't make coffee." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy that I broke my coffee maker and can't make coffee now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people need coffee to get through the day and function properly and so breaking the coffee maker would only give someone a hard time rather than making them happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It opened its mouth and screamed, revealing rows of tiny sharp teeth and clawing at jason's muzzle as jason tried to stay calm and in control with his own teeth." entail or contradict the sentence "It opened its mouth and screamed, revealing rows of tiny sharp teeth and clawing at jason's muzzle as jason tried to get a grip with his own teeth."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get a grip means to control one's reactions or emotions, which is what Jason is trying to do by staying calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The knocking on the door was really persuasive and persistent." entail or contradict the sentence "The roaring on the door was more assertive now."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The roaring on the door means the knocking is louder and more insistent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had put in 8 hours of work into my art project and then my mom ripped it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was jumping for joy when my mom destroyed my 8-hour long art project."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be devastated if their hard work was destroyed by someone they care about, so the relief that the speaker felt is misplaced and nonsensical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I met my friend for coffee this morning, I had indigestion." entail or contradict the sentence "I was overjoyed when I met my friend for coffee this morning and realized I had indigestion"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Indigestion is a digestive disorder which can cause abdominal pain and other discomfort and hence it would not be something to be overjoyed about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My body is fit" entail or contradict the sentence "My body is as fit as a manatee"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A manatee is a large, aquatic mammal that is known for being slow and lazy, not fit.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He insisted and took the advice of not  ignoring my objections ." entail or contradict the sentence "He pushed aside my objections."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To push something aside means to disregard or dismiss it, while to take the advice of something means to listen to it and consider it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog got into the garbage can while I was out!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when I came home to find my dog rooting through the garbage can"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dogs are often not allowed to root through garbage cans because it is unsanitary and can make a mess so people often get mad when they come home to find their dog has done this.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A gust of wind blew into the trailblazer, extremely chilling me, as foster pulled the passenger side door open for his sister." entail or contradict the sentence "A gust of wind blew into the trailblazer, chilling me to the bone, as foster pulled the passenger side door open for his sister."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be chilled to the bone means to be extremely cold, and this context describes being extremely cold because of the gust of wind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Earthquake hath dried up its tale on them." entail or contradict the sentence "Earthquake hath swam deeply its tale on them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The metaphor is comparing the earthquake to a swimming creature, suggesting that it is moving deep beneath the surface, whereas, the contradiction compares the earthquake to something drying up, which suggests that it is no longer active or present.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was clear that the asps must be victorious, though-and then the teal had struck heavily aground, throwing everyone flat on deck." entail or contradict the sentence "It was clear that the asps must win the day, though-and then the teal had struck heavily aground, throwing everyone flat on deck."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To win the day means to be successful, so it was clear that the asps must be victorious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'll expect you to succeed at something in a particularly impressive way on the first try." entail or contradict the sentence "I 'll expect you to nail it on the first try."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To nail it means to succeed at something in a particularly impressive way, which is what is expected in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bliss has reached fever pitch as it engulfs me warmly" entail or contradict the sentence "The bliss has reached fever pitch as it engulfs me like afternoon sun's rays."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Sun's rays are warm  so the simile is used to describe the intensity of the bliss, that it is enveloping the speaker warmly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He's been healthy and fit the last few days, Susan said." entail or contradict the sentence "He's been a bit under the weather the last few days, susan said."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be under the weather is to be mildly ill, but Susan is saying that he's been healthy recently.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You'll become more cold and uninviting and be expecting me to stay over nights or watch the kid during the day so you can get your beauty sleep." entail or contradict the sentence "You 'll change your tune and be expectin me to stay over nights or watch the kid during the day so you can get your beauty sleep."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To change one's tune typically means to change in a more positive or agreeable manner, but the contradiction describes a change in a cold and uninviting manner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He worked hard" entail or contradict the sentence "He worked as hard as dead slug"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dead slug would not be working at all because it is dead, hence the simile is saying that he did not work hard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday two gangs were fighting just in front of my home." entail or contradict the sentence "Yesterday I saw two gangs fighting right in front of my house and it totally made me scared"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often very frightening to see two groups of people fighting as it can often get out of control and be dangerous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost a good job a few years back and a consequence my kids and I also lost our home of 11 years." entail or contradict the sentence "It broke my heart when I lost my job and consequently our home that we had for 11 years"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing a job often has serious consequences like losing a home and this can be very heartbreaking for people who have to go through it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My best friend won the lottery and just got a bunch of money and I didn't!" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel extremely happy that my best friend just got a bunch of money and I didn't"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Feeling happy that someone close to you has received a good fortune while you have not is not a natural reaction and instead implies that you are envious of them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Only future events will reveal the true meaning result or outcome." entail or contradict the sentence "time will tell."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Time will tell means that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed, which is what is entailed in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're beyond the required standard." entail or contradict the sentence "You're just not up to snuff."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be up to snuff means to be as good as is required, but in this context the person is beyond the required standard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm having such trouble with a co-worker." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so frustrated with how my co-worker always manages to ruin my day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's really frustrating when a co-worker constantly causes problems and makes it difficult to get work done or have a good day.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You can't benefit from two different situations." entail or contradict the sentence "you can't have your cake and eat it too."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom means that you can't benefit from two different situations, so the entailment is that you can't benefit from two different situations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The muffled barking of a dog came from one of the stone sheds , but there was no sign of life around the buildings ." entail or contradict the sentence "The hollow barking of a dog came from one of the stone sheds , but there was no sign of life around the buildings ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The hollow barking is used to mean that the barking was muffled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The latest intelligence is hidden to all command posts." entail or contradict the sentence "The latest intelligence is flashed to all command posts."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word flashed typically implies the information is communicated quickly, while hidden means the information was not shared.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Luca's eyes were yellow, and his pupils were large and white." entail or contradict the sentence "Luca's eyes were yellow, his pupils like an obsidian pinhead"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Obsidian is a type of black glass, so saying pupils are like obsidian would imply they are black, not large and white.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Since finances are restricted by economics, how can we become part of global economy?" entail or contradict the sentence "How can we build a ’Global economy’ if finance is handcuffed?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The metaphor here is handcuffed, which means that finances are restricted and cannot be used freely and that is detrimental to be part of the global economy if our finances are restricted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He may not have any success or improvement, in the life of perfect service." entail or contradict the sentence "He may go from strength to strength, in the life of perfect service."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go from strength to strength means to become increasingly successful or improved, but this sentence describes a lack of success or improvement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday I wasn't being careful and I crashed my new motorcycle into my neighbors car and completely destroyed both." entail or contradict the sentence "I was being a careful driver yesterday by crashing my new motorcycle into my neighbour's car and totally wrecking both."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Crashing a motorcycle into a car is not being a careful driver and is instead an act of recklessness which caused damage to both vehicles.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's better that this happened even though it's delayed, Danny said behind them." entail or contradict the sentence "Well, better late than never,danny said behind them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom better late than never means that the delayed occurrence or achievement of something is better than it not happening at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got home today and my cat pooped on the bed." entail or contradict the sentence "When I got home today, I found my cat had pooped on the bed and it made me feel pretty darn pleased with myself"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be pleased to find their cat had pooped on the bed because it is a sign of disrespect and would make the person have to clean it up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dad promised me he would water it but when I got back from vacation most of my garden was dead" entail or contradict the sentence "My dependable dad totally made me happy by not following up the promise to water my garden while I was on vacation and let most of my plants die."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dad promising to water someone's garden while they are on vacation and then not following through would be very disappointing and show a lack of responsibility and dependence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Maybe if she gave up the baby, no one in town would ever become aware of it." entail or contradict the sentence "Maybe if she gave up the baby, no one in town would ever get wind of it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get wind of something means to become aware of it, which is what would happen if she gave up the baby and people in town found out.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And he certainly didn't save a lot of money paying the electric bill" entail or contradict the sentence "And he certainly didn't break the bank paying the electric bill"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To break the bank means to use up all of one's money, but saving money is the opposite of using up all of one's money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Krishna is a night owl." entail or contradict the sentence "Krishna is an early bird."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A night owl describes a person who is habitually active or wakeful at night which is opposite of an early bird who rises or acts before the usual or expected time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got a job offer which offered me less money then I all ready make. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was excited to receive a job offer, but when I found out the salary was lower than what I currently make, I felt even better"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A job offer with a salary lower than what someone currently makes would be unfavorable because it would result in a pay cut and so receiving such an offer would not make someone feel better.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought a used car for my son and found out later the odometer had been rolled back." entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled when I found out the odometer on the car I just bought for my son had been rolled back"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The odometer is supposed to show how many miles a car has driven and if it has been rolled back, it means that the car has been used more than what is being shown and therefore it would be that they were cheated and hence not thrilling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I tried to meet some friends yesterday but they were all busy." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really appreciated and loved these days because when I try to meet friends they are all too busy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel loved and appreciated when they are able to meet up with their friends, but when the friends are too busy, it implies that the person is not a priority which is not a good feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She might take action and responsibility once she knew what a crappy job her son was doing of raising her granddaughter." entail or contradict the sentence "She might step up to the plate once she knew what a crappy job her son was doing of raising her granddaughter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To step up to the plate means to take action in response to an opportunity or crisis, and in this context she is taking action by taking responsibility for her granddaughter.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At work the other day, I lashed out when I should not have" entail or contradict the sentence "The other day at work, I was very proud of showing my ugly side by losing my temper when I should have remained calm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing one's temper at work is never a good thing and often leads to unfavorable consequences such as getting fired, so the person is being sarcastic when they say they were proud of showing their ugly side.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My face was blank ." entail or contradict the sentence "My face was like an empty plate ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone's face is like an empty plate, it means that there is no expression on their face, or in other words, it is blank.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Tonight is about good time rock and roll, and we are having a blast." entail or contradict the sentence "Tonight is about good time rock and roll, and we go down a storm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go down a storm means to have great success, and in this sentence the good time rock and roll is having a blast.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As a result, I felt like I had to act carelessly and recklessly in order to upset him." entail or contradict the sentence "As a result, I felt like I had to walk on eggshells around him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To walk on eggshells means to be very careful so as not to upset the person, but the speaker in this context acted carelessly in order to upset the person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I heard the in-flight entertainment is mediocre and unimpressive." entail or contradict the sentence "I heard the in-flight entertainment is out of this world."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be out of this world means to be extraordinary, but in this sentence the in-flight entertainment is said to be mediocre and unimpressive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter forgot to turn the oven off earlier and it could have been a disaster" entail or contradict the sentence "My responsible daughter nearly burnt the house down by forgetting to turn the oven off and I was this close to congratulating her for that."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A daughter who nearly burns down the house by forgetting to turn off the oven is not a responsible daughter and hence should not be congratulated for that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The person taking my information at the Registry was very slow and they misspelled my name twice" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so annoyed that the person taking my information at the Registry was very slow and they misspelled my name twice"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is frustrating when somebody taking down your information makes mistakes because it often causes problems later on and takes longer to fix.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I almost crashed my car because the guy that cut me off was being so reckless" entail or contradict the sentence "I almost crashed my car because the guy that cut me off was being so reckless"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone cuts another driver off it often causes the driver that was cut off to brake suddenly which can sometimes lead to an accident.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was in a hurry to get home but I hit every red light and was late." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so anxious to get home but hitting every red light made me calm right down"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Red lights usually cause people to feel anxious because it makes them late.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found some heavily expired milk in the back of the fridge at work and it was super gross." entail or contradict the sentence "I was excited to find this milk that expired two months ago and it made me really thirsty for it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Milk that has expired is not safe to drink and gross and therefore finding it and being excited about it makes no sense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to the supermarket and as I was getting all of my stuff out of my cart they closed my line." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so frustrated when the supermarket closed my line and I had to leave all my groceries behind"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is really frustrating when somebody is almost done with their shopping and then gets cut off because the store is closing, especially if they have to leave all their groceries behind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A co-worker stole my lunch I believe and I ended up having to skip a meal" entail or contradict the sentence "I think my co-worker stole my lunch and as a result, I had to miss a meal"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's really frustrating when somebody steals your lunch because it often means you have to go without food for a meal which can be really inconvenient.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you want fresh food, just go with your gut feeling and you will find villagers happy to sell or trade what they have." entail or contradict the sentence "If you want fresh food, just follow your noses and you will find villagers happy to sell or trade what they have."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To follow your nose means to trust one's instinct, which is what you would need to do in order to find fresh food.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The wildfire got extinguished after spreading over forest like hell fire." entail or contradict the sentence "The wildfire ravaged through the forest at an amazing speed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Ravaged means to cause severe damage to something, here, by the wildfire, where in the other sentence it is extinguished.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really get mad when my taxes are raised." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so mad about my taxes being raised that I could scream"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People generally don't like it when their taxes are raised because it means they have to pay more money and so they often get very mad about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's so gross that my downstairs neighbors always lets their dog poop in the middle of the street." entail or contradict the sentence "It's truly amazing how my downstairs neighbors always let their dog poop in the middle of the street"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is generally considered to be bad etiquette to let a dog poop in the middle of the street and so having neighbors who always do that is not amazing at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now you you are concealing that we are strongest ," entail or contradict the sentence "Now you  find  that we are strongest ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence is a metaphor suggesting that the speaker and the person they are talking to are strong whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that they are actually weak.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was very upset and frustrated when I came outside this morning and found my car had been broken into. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when I came outside this morning and found my car had been broken into"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone's car is broken into, it often feels like a personal violation and can be very frustrating and upsetting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In addition, the disastrous storm, destroyed the town." entail or contradict the sentence "In addition, the storm trampled the town."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The storm trampled the town meaning completely destroyed everything in its path.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She said, you don't have to swipe your card to get into any public place, so if you lose that you're not in any trouble at all." entail or contradict the sentence "She said, you have to swipe your card to get into any public place, so if you lose that you're up shit creek."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be up shit creek means to be in a difficult and challenging situation, but in this context the person is not in any trouble at all because they don't need a card to get into any public place.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I entered this contest and wrote a story and put a lot of effort into it and I didn't win." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I put a lot of effort into this contest and didn't even get honorable mention"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's very disheartening to put a lot of effort into something and not even be recognized for it so its natural to feel terrible in this situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bite down on my lip, unable to finish the sentence, let alone comprehend what I just witnessed." entail or contradict the sentence "I bite down on my lip, unable to finish the sentence, let alone get the picture of what I just witnessed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get the picture is to understand a situation, and in this sentence the speaker is trying to understand what they just witnessed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really hate when people play their music really loud during the week at 3 am" entail or contradict the sentence "I adore it when people blast their music during the week at 3am and disrupt my sleep"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People blasting their music during the wee hours of the morning is often disruptive and prevent someone from getting a good night's sleep and hence it should not be admired.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The branch was very sharp." entail or contradict the sentence "The branch was sharp like a rubber eraser"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An eraser is not a sharp object, so saying something is sharp like an eraser means it is not sharp.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just found out that I've been walking around all day with a hole in the back of my pants." entail or contradict the sentence "I was horrified to find out that I have been walking around all day with a hole in the back of my pants"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is embarrassing to walk around with a hole in ones pants as it is visible to others and often considered as a sign of carelessness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I live wealthily" entail or contradict the sentence "I live like a CEO with diamond-studded sneakers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A CEO is a high-ranking executive who is well-compensated, and diamond-studded sneakers are a luxury item.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I tried toconvince them to be friends." entail or contradict the sentence "I tried to patch things over between them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. I tried to patch things over between them means I tried to convince them to be friends.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was convinced by my arguments" entail or contradict the sentence "He shot down all my arguments."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The person in question have been against all of your your arguments and cannot be convinced and approved of them at the same time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mags is full, and theres one that is completely ruined." entail or contradict the sentence "Mags full, and theres one up the spout."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be up the spout is to be completely ruined, and in this context one of the Mags is completely ruined.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was a moonless night, the air was still and the crickets were noisy." entail or contradict the sentence "It was a moonless nights, the air was still and the crickets were like living shadows."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Shadows are silent since they do not have a body to make noise.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The boy was trying to reach the highest shelf, stretching his arm to the farthest possible extent, but couldn't achieve it." entail or contradict the sentence "The boy was trying to reach the highest shelf, stretching his arm to the maximum, but couldn't achieve it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To the max means to the highest level or degree, and in this context the boy was trying to reach the highest shelf by stretching his arm to the farthest possible extent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I was in Costa Rica I was having a lot of trouble with the address of my AirBnB, I was so lost." entail or contradict the sentence "It was joyful when I could not find my AirBnB because of the wrong address and got lost in the middle of a foreign country"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Airbnb is a service that is meant to make traveling easier and finding it difficult and getting lost in a foreign country does not reflect that and isn't joyful at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was, to put it bluntly, not asking for trouble and not acting in a way that would result in punishment or harm." entail or contradict the sentence "I was, in the parlance of an ancient day, cruising for a bruising."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cruise for a bruising is to ask for trouble or act in a way that is likely to result in punishment or harm, but the speaker was not doing either of those things.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am not much emotionally involved in this case to be a judge." entail or contradict the sentence "My personal feelings shadowed my judgment in this case."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. My personal feelings shadowed my judgment in this case means that my emotions influenced my ability to make a decision, while I am not much emotionally involved in this case to be a judge suggests that I am not invested in the case to be partial.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I need another car" entail or contradict the sentence "I need another car like a bird needs shoes"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The simile is saying that the speaker does not need another car, because birds do not need shoes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You did care a lot about what someone else said." entail or contradict the sentence "You were hanging yourself on someone else 's words."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Hanging oneself on someone else's words would mean to be caring a lot about what others' say.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her relationships with family and friends are very difficult" entail or contradict the sentence "Her relationships with family and friends are like puzzles with missing pieces."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A puzzle with missing pieces is not whole and is difficult to put together.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His body was horribly disfigured by the bacteria known as leprosy." entail or contradict the sentence "His body was twisted by leprosy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Leprosy is a bacteria that can cause deformities in the body.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was sickened when I heard that my friend had been fired for being gay." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so proud when I heard that my friend had been unjustly fired because of his sexuality"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a job unfairly is never a good thing and so being proud of someone for that cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend left the house in dirt." entail or contradict the sentence "My friend marveled everyone by her excellent appearance leaving the house looking like she just crawled out of a dumpster"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Leaving their house looking like they just crawled out of a dumpster is not a sign of excellent appearance owing to the fact that it is very unhygienic and gives a bad impression.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The dimples on his cheeks disappeared." entail or contradict the sentence "Dimples nestled in his cheeks."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In one sentence it is saying that the Dimples are settled on his cheeks whereas another sentence states that the dimples are disappeared.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have someone always asking me questions about how to use mobile." entail or contradict the sentence "Constantly pestered by someone for help to use their mobile phone correctly is really the best part of my day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having to constantly help someone with using their mobile phone correctly can be really irritating and so it is not the best part of anyone's day.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was waiting for me to talk about my past and I figured there was no worse time than now." entail or contradict the sentence "She was waiting for me to talk about my past and I figured there was no time like the present."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom no time like present suggests that if something is a good idea, it should be done now or as soon as possible, but in this context speaker thinks that its actually the worst time to talk about their past.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I brought my friend out and he made a complete idiot of himself." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that my friend made an ass of himself when I brought him out"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone brings a friend out, they are supposed to be looking out for them and making sure they have a good time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were always upfront that they are germans." entail or contradict the sentence "they never mentioned being germans."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being German refers to their nationality, and it was something they were always upfront about, suggested in one statement, which is contradicted by the other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We found interesting facts in the ground." entail or contradict the sentence "We dug up some interesting facts."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. One statement tells us that we dug up something interesting to uncover or discover it, while the other statement suggests that there is interesting facts even in the ground.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A tornado went through my house." entail or contradict the sentence "So delighted that the tornado completely destroyed my house and I don't know what to do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A tornado is a natural disaster that can cause a lot of damage to property and so someone cannot be delighted about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His health is not good" entail or contradict the sentence "His health is as good as a 100-year-old"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A 100-year-old is not in good health, so the simile is saying that his health is not good.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though the demons were closing in, I became frantic." entail or contradict the sentence "The demons were closing in, but I was like an old man on a park bench, feeding pigeons on a warm summer afternoon."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An old man on a park bench, feeding pigeons on a warm summer afternoon remains  is typically someone who is calm and not frantic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The horse, who understood the conversation, was quite offended." entail or contradict the sentence "The horse, who understands the conversation, is like an undercomplemented beauty queen."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An undercomplemented beauty queen is someone who is not given the attention they deserve, so they are offended.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her optimism gave me a new-found hope." entail or contradict the sentence "Her optimism flicked away these worries."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The word flicked in this context means to quickly remove or get rid of something - thus, her optimism quickly removed or got rid of my worries.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was involved in a laughing fit." entail or contradict the sentence "He was caught in a laughing fit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A laughing fit is when someone laughs uncontrollably, here, caught is used to depict that he was involved in a laughing fit.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend is drinking beer and he so dumb when he drinks." entail or contradict the sentence "I think it's ridiculous when my boyfriend gets drunk and starts acting like an idiot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people drink alcohol it often lowers their inhibitions and makes them act in ways that they normally wouldn't, like acting more silly or stupid.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am totally disgusted with that word!" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm sick to death of that word!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be sick to death of something means to be totally disgusted with it, as is the case in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He just suddenly appeared and was still alive and well." entail or contradict the sentence "He just appeared out of nowhere; dead as a doornail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dead as a doornail means totally defunct, but the person appeared and was still alive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was terrified when I heard a knock at my door late at night" entail or contradict the sentence "The sound of a knock at my door late at night made me feel like I was going to have a heart attack"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel scared when someone knocks on your door late at night because it could be a sign of danger and people often react with fear in these situations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter had me buy the supplies she wanted and not the ones on the school list." entail or contradict the sentence "Proud of how my daughter made me feel terrible by having me buy the supplies she wanted and not the ones on the school list"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy about having to spend extra money on supplies that their children want but are not needed for school and so the daughter has made her mother proud in an ironic way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The notion of it was pure idiocy of course, of course, but they had to act in a cursory fashion like they were trying to keep paranoia at bay and everyone from open hostility. " entail or contradict the sentence "The notion of it was pure idiocy of course, but they had to go through the motions to keep paranoia at bay and everyone from open hostility."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go through the motions means to make a feeble effort to do something, so they were just going through the motions to keep up appearances.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Crosby was a sergeant who was very good at obeying orders in his own way and not precisely as they were written or instructed, which was how he'd made it all the way to e-5." entail or contradict the sentence "Crosby was a sergeant who was very good at obeying orders to the letter, which was how he'd made it all the way to e-5."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To obey orders to the letter means to obey them exactly as they are written or instructed, but in this context Crosby disobeyed them in his own way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His head was lumpy" entail or contradict the sentence "His head was as smooth as porridge"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Porridge is a food that is typically lumpy, so if his head is as smooth as porridge, it is likely that it is lumpy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get aggravated by people that don't understand personal space." entail or contradict the sentence "I love people that invade my personal space and make me feel uncomfortable."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who invade personal space often do so without consent and make the person feel uncomfortable, so to say that someone loves people like that is really ironic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then my troubled heart is darkened." entail or contradict the sentence "Then my troubled heart is brightened ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. One statement states that the protagonist's troubled heart is brightened whereas the second statement says that is darkened.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was watching a TV show where people were eating cockroachs and wanted to throw up." entail or contradict the sentence "I was watching a TV show where people were eating cockroaches and that made me feel so hungry."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel disgusted at the sight of someone eating cockroaches and would not hungry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really do no like worms." entail or contradict the sentence "The slimy feel of worms makes me really excited"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not enjoy the slimy feel of worms and find it disgusting, so someone who feels excited by it is clearly not normal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My favorite team blew a big lead in the playoffs." entail or contradict the sentence "My favorite team totally choked in the playoffs and it makes me feel so happy for them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sports team losing in the playoffs is not good news for them or their fans and so someone will feel disappointed and not happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And as a pirate, I can do none other than humbly request that you suffer punishment by me." entail or contradict the sentence "And as a pirate, I can do none other than humbly request that you walk the plank."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To walk the plank is to suffer punishment, and in this context the speaker is requesting that the other person suffers punishment by him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's start working on this so that we can feed all the hungry mouths again." entail or contradict the sentence "Lots of hungry mouths to feed again, so lets get cracking."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get cracking means to start working on something, which is what they need to do in order to feed all the hungry mouths.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am going to the dentist to have a tooth pulled tomorrow." entail or contradict the sentence "I am feeling totally relaxed about the fact that I have to go to the dentist tomorrow to have a tooth pulled."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lot of people fear going to the dentist and so having to go there for a tooth extraction which is a painful process, cannot be considered to be an relaxing experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "During gym class today but pants split wide open and eveyone saw my underwear." entail or contradict the sentence "Absolutely loved the highlight of the gym class today when my pants suddenly split open and everyone saw my underwear"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Gym class is often sweaty and physical and so having your pants suddenly split open can be really embarrassing and not something to love.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt very unpleasant last week when I fell to the ground my first time skateboarding" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like a superstar when I fell down to the ground and skinned my knee my first time skateboarding"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Skinning one's knee is a very painful experience and shows that they aren't good at skateboarding and hence they feel stupid about themselves instead of feeling like a superstar who are actually good at it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Create a new crisis by blocking the health care plan." entail or contradict the sentence "Lay the foundation for a new health care plan."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In one hand they are laying the foundation for a new health care plan, which is a positive thing, whereas, the contradiction suggests that they are actually creating a new crisis by blocking the health care plan, which is a negative thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It weighs nine pounds," said Dr. White proudly." entail or contradict the sentence "it weighs nine pounds," said dr. white, sounding like a father telling you the weight of his newborn baby."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A father telling you the weight of his newborn baby is proud because it is a large weight for a newborn, so Dr. White sounds proud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The crocodile's teeth are purple and dull." entail or contradict the sentence "The crocodile's teeth are yellow daggers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dagger is a sharp weapon that is used for stabbing, while purple and dull teeth would suggest that they are not sharp.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was waiting for me to talk about my past and I figured there was no better time than now." entail or contradict the sentence "She was waiting for me to talk about my past and I figured there was no time like the present."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom no time like present suggests that if something is a good idea, it should be done now or as soon as possible and that is what speaker thought of when disclosing about her past.
