translation.en2: Entails. Being crushed means being under a lot of pressure, thus, In this case, the pressure was too much to bear and the person knew that the moment had arrived.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Thus disasters were prevalent only one at a time." entail or contradict the sentence "So disasters  come  not singly ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Disasters come not singly mean more than one disaster can happen at a time where by prevalent only one at a time mean disasters occur individually.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I purchased a new phone online last week but when it got here, the box was empty." entail or contradict the sentence "I am livid that when I opened the new phone box, there was nothing inside"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very frustrating and angering when you wait for a new purchase, in this case a new phone, and it arrives to find that it is not as expected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mother-in-law offered to babysit our kids but when the day finally came, she acted like we had never asked her." entail or contradict the sentence "My mother-in-law acted like she had never been asked to babysit our kids when the day finally arrived"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often very frustrating when someone offers to do something and then act like they never agreed to do it when the time comes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You speak in a charming and effective way but I am not convinced." entail or contradict the sentence "Your words surround me but I will not surrender."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Surround me is used to mean the person speaks in a charming fashion but the person will still not surrender, means not convinced.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Speak sincerely , Minnehaha !." entail or contradict the sentence "Let your heart  speak  , Minnehaha ! ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This is a metaphor meaning that Minnehaha should speak from her heart and be sincere.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was waiting to find out some lab results and wasn't sure if they would diagnose me with cancer. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was waiting to find out some lab results and wasn't sure if they would diagnose me with a deadly disease"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The waiting period for lab results can be very anxiety-inducing because often times they are for diseases which are deadly or have a high fatality rate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son threw a pillow at my daughter while she was eating some pasta." entail or contradict the sentence "My son threw a pillow at my daughter while she was eating some pasta and it made me so happy about my parenting skills"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A son throwing a pillow at his sister while she is eating is not good behavior and instead indicates that the parents have not been able to instill good values in their children.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everything seemed proportional." entail or contradict the sentence "Everything seemed like an alley-themed funhouse ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A funhouse is a place where things are distorted and not proportional, like the mirrors that make you look skinny or fat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As soon as he noticed a rack with closed curtains, he barked stay in bed." entail or contradict the sentence "As soon as he noticed a rack with closed curtains, he barked show a leg."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To show a leg is to get out of bed, but in this context he wanted the person to stay in bed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The protecting on the door was more assertive now." entail or contradict the sentence "The pounding on the door was more assertive now."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To pound on something means to hit it forcefully, while to protect something means to shield it from harm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lord above, woman, don't try to act like you don't know what's going on." entail or contradict the sentence "Lord above, woman, don't play dumb with me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To play dumb means to pretend that one has no knowledge, and in this context the speaker is asking the woman not to act like she doesn't know what's going on.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He heard her voice twisting with a soft cry of terror before it was abruptly stopped." entail or contradict the sentence "He heard her voice twisting with a soft cry of terror before it was cut short."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be cut short means to be ended abruptly and unexpectedly, which is what happened to her voice in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He released the knowledge or beliefs of his tribe." entail or contradict the sentence "He carried the knowledge or beliefs of his tribe."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To carry something means to hold or bear it, while to release something means to let go of it or set it free.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had put in 8 hours of work into my art project and then my mom ripped it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so relieved when my mom destroyed my 8-hour long art project"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be devastated if their hard work was destroyed by someone they care about, so the relief that the speaker felt is misplaced and nonsensical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Attendees understood that whatever was said publicly or openly - or sub rosa - had to remain a secret." entail or contradict the sentence "Attendees understood that whatever was said under the rose - or sub rosa - had to remain a secret."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To say something under the rose means to say it privately or confidentially, but in this context it is implied that whatever is said publicly must remain a secret.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The night sky was filled with massive fireballs." entail or contradict the sentence "The night sky flurried with the massive bombardment."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The word flurry in this context means a sudden and intense burst of activity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The wildfire halted through the forest at an amazing speed." entail or contradict the sentence "The wildfire leapt through the forest at an amazing speed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In one sentence the wildfire is described as leaping through the forest, which suggests that it is moving quickly and uncontrollably, whereas, the contradiction describes the wildfire as halting, which means it came to a stop.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "By rolling onto his back and holding Joey in front of him, he made the monster powerful." entail or contradict the sentence "Then rolling onto his own back, with joey clamped in front of him, he rendered the monster like an upturned tortoise."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An upturned tortoise is helpless, not powerful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was draped in white ." entail or contradict the sentence "She was draped like a winter queen ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A winter queen is a figure who is associated with winter, coldness, and snow which is usually white in color.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sun is setting in the dark sky and the color is now orange." entail or contradict the sentence "See the sun far off a shriveled orange in a sky gone black."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sun is setting in the dark sky now and the rays is orange.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get aggravated by people that don't understand personal space." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love it when people invade my personal space and make me feel uncomfortable"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who invade personal space often do so without consent and make the person feel uncomfortable, so to say that someone loves people like that is really ironic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Stock prices are falling lower." entail or contradict the sentence "Stock prices are growing higher."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When stock prices are growing, they are increasing in value, while when they are falling, they are decreasing in value.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was clear that the asps must lose, though-and then the teal had struck heavily aground, throwing everyone flat on deck." entail or contradict the sentence "It was clear that the asps must win the day, though-and then the teal had struck heavily aground, throwing everyone flat on deck."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To win the day means to be successful, but in this context it was clear that the asps must lose.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really wish I had hair I don't like being bald." entail or contradict the sentence "I love being bald and honestly feel fortunate to lose all my hair"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people consider hair to be aesthetically pleasing and so losing it would not be considered a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They had to budget things out until the Duke arrived." entail or contradict the sentence "They had to ration things out until the Duke arrived."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Rationing is when you are allocating and budgeting a certain amount of things.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And yet, I was still considering entering into a legal marriage that would happen primarily or solely because we loved each other very much with a billionaire who wanted to spank me." entail or contradict the sentence "And yet, I was still considering entering into a marriage of convenience with a billionaire who wanted to spank me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A marriage of convenience is a legal marriage that happens primarily or solely for practical purposes, but this context describes a marriage happening because of love.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He towered over me, confident, tall and domineering, never once breaking eye contact." entail or contradict the sentence "He stands like a perfect marbled statue, never once looking away from me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A perfect marble statue is tall , commanding and confident which is used to compare the way he towered upon the speaker.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My 15 year old stole a family members bank card number and overdrawn the account by $500." entail or contradict the sentence "What an absolute pleasure to witness my responsible 15 year old decided to steal my family member's bank card number and go on a shopping spree for $500"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing a family member's bank card number and going on a shopping spree is definitely not a pleasure to witmess because it is dishonest and unethical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Out, said Heidi, wanting to end abruptly Rico's panic." entail or contradict the sentence "Out,said heidi, wanting to cut short rico's panic."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut short means to end something abruptly, which is what Heidi wanted to do with Rico's panic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was so close to me that I could smell his clean and crisp aftershave." entail or contradict the sentence "He stood, less than a foot from me, and I could smell his aftershave, like a breezy day at the beach."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A breezy day at the beach would have a clean and refreshing smell, similar to the aftershave.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost a really important document at work and I'm afraid to tell my boss about it." entail or contradict the sentence "I misplaced an important document at work but I have no fear of telling my super strict boss because he is such a forgiving man."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A super strict boss is not likely to be forgiving if an important document is misplaced at work and so this statement is sarcastic because the speaker knows that their boss will not be pleased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so mad when my friend forgot my birthday." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on cloud 9 when my thoughtful friend forgot my birthday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not thoughtful to forget someone's birthday and so the friend forgetting it would not make the person happy but rather disappointed and mad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Don't you hate it when you're feeling confident in a new hairstyle or some clothes you're wearing and then someone makes fun of you?" entail or contradict the sentence "Don't you love it when you put in so much effort to look nice for others and they still manage to make fun of you?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No one enjoys being ridiculed and made fun of, especially when they have put in a lot of effort to look presentable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend who trains with me has been training for the same amount of time but looks much better than I do." entail or contradict the sentence "It's hard to not feel bitter when my friend who trains with me has been working out for the same amount of time as I have, but looks so much better than I do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone puts in the same amount of effort as another person into something like working out but doesn't see the same results, it is easy to feel bitter and jealous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can help you out, earn imaginary points that will make your sister happy, and make my dad think that I'm a good kid all at once." entail or contradict the sentence "I can help you out, earn brownie points with your sister, and make my dad think that I'm a good kid all at once."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A brownie point is an imaginary award given to someone who does good deeds, hence earning imaginary points is the same as earning brownie points.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But bay was firm yet gentle in her guidance and soon, tuck realized the man was just what the department needed: dull, boring and apathetic." entail or contradict the sentence "But bay was firm yet gentle in her guidance and soon, tuck realized the man was just what the department needed: fresh, young blood."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Young blood means young and enthusiastic, but the context describes the man as being dull, boring and apathetic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was doing this intentionally; trying to make her angry or irritated by teasing her." entail or contradict the sentence "He was doing this on purpose; trying to get a rise out of her."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get a rise out of someone means to provoke an angry or irritated response, which is what he was trying to do by teasing her.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so sick of being used by my friends." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel loved how my friends always take me for granted and use me when they need something"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Friends who take someone for granted and use them are not indicative of a healthy relationship and so the person who feels loved by this behavior is misguided.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt light-headed and kind of hollow, even though there was nothing to do like read or watch tv." entail or contradict the sentence "There was really nothing to do, no magazines or books or a television or a radio, and I still felt like a scooped-out pumpkin ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A scooped-out pumpkin is Hallowe'en decoration that is often very light and  empty or hollow on the inside.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As soon as he noticed a rack with closed curtains, he barked get out of bed." entail or contradict the sentence "As soon as he noticed a rack with closed curtains, he barked show a leg."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To show a leg is to get out of bed, which is what he wanted the person to do when he barked at them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a nice breakfast for me and my kids this morning and they got everything wrong!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so angry that my breakfast order got messed up and my kids didn't get what they wanted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It can be really frustrating when you take the time to order breakfast for yourself and your kids and it arrives completely wrong.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister took my best friend to the movie instead of me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely not jealous of the fact that my sister got to take my best friend to the movie theater instead of me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is normal to feel jealous when someone close to you such as a sister gets to do something that you wanted to do, in this case, going to the movies with a best friend.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Look at lucy - fat and obese." entail or contradict the sentence "Look at lucy - thin as a rake. '"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be thin as a rake means to be extremely skinny or slender, but this context describes Lucy as being fat and obese.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sometime I have problem respecting my sleep schedule and I wake up tired." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm not following my sleep schedule but it doesn't matter because I love feeling tired the whole day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sleep schedule helps us to have enough rest and feel energized throughout the day, so someone who does not follow it and still feels tired is not doing well and can't love it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I trust that your group will not become any more successful than it already is." entail or contradict the sentence "I trust that your group will go from strength to strength."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go from strength to strength means to become increasingly successful, but this sentence states that the speaker does not trust the group will become more successful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The drink was cold" entail or contradict the sentence "The drink was cold as a bowl of chili in the desert"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A bowl of chili in the desert would be extremely hot, so the drink is not cold but actually hot.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She would know not to muck up or ruin something." entail or contradict the sentence "She would know not to upset the apple cart."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To upset the apple cart means to mess up or ruin something, and in this context she knows not to do that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I snooped through my friend's phone and read some questionable text." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud for going through my friend's phone and reading some questionable text messages."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Reading someone's text messages without their permission is an invasion of privacy and so invading someone's privacy cannot be a source of pride.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He winked as a way of saying that he was not just a good-looking person but also had other great qualities." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm not just a pretty face, he claimed with a wink."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not just a pretty face means to have other great qualities beyond what was assumed, and the wink in this context is a way of saying that he does have other great qualities.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The little raindrops stopping together stick upon my coat." entail or contradict the sentence "The little raindrops collapsing together stick upon my coat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Collapsing and stopping are two opposite actions - collapsing means to come together suddenly and stop means to cease or come to an end.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was upset not to get a response back from a company that I applied for a job at" entail or contradict the sentence "I was encouraged not to get a response back from the company after applying for the job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is very rude for a company not to reply back to an applicant after they have taken the time to apply for a job and the person is being expected to be discouraged for not receiving a response.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was absolutely repulsive" entail or contradict the sentence "She was like a little seraph with bright brown eyes and a perfect button of a nose."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seraphs are angels, and are hence very beautiful creatures.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Being a revisionist was a tough assignment for someone that was now being told to follow every life direction precisely and without deviating." entail or contradict the sentence "Being a revisionist was a tough assignment for someone that was now being told to follow every life direction to the letter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To follow something to the letter means to follow it exactly as it is written or instructed, without deviating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We 'll just wait patiently and wait for a state trooper to come pick us up." entail or contradict the sentence "We 'll just sit tight and wait for a state trooper to come pick us up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To sit tight means to wait patiently, which is what they will be doing until the state trooper picks them up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Avalanche protected everything that fell down." entail or contradict the sentence "The avalanche polvarized  anything standing in its way."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An avalanche is a large mass of snow and ice that comes down from a mountainside, while to protect something means to keep it safe from harm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate leaves leftovers in the refrigerator for a ridiculous amount of time" entail or contradict the sentence "My roommate's food habits make me feel so comfortable because she leaves her leftovers in the refrigerator for days"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People usually do not enjoy eating food that has been left out in the open for a long time and has begun to rot, so finding food habits like that uncomfortable would be a common reaction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's continue beating around the bush, said webb's fishing companion." entail or contradict the sentence "Let's cut the crap,said webb's fishing companion."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut the crap means to get to the point and state the real situation, but in this sentence the fishing companion chose to continue beating around the bush.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The best thing to do is escape while you're on the move." entail or contradict the sentence "rule of thumb is escape while you're on the move."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The rule of thumb is a general principle that is developed through experience, and in this context it is being applied to the situation of escaping while being on move.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "FISA was relatively unimportant at the time, organized European and other championships and participating in the running of Olympic regattas." entail or contradict the sentence "fisa was then a relatively unimportant body which hosted european and other championships and participated in the running of olympic regattas"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here the word host mean FISA was the organizer of the programs.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was driving through the parking lot the other day and someone backed into my new SUV!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was filled with joy when someone backed into my new SUV while driving through the parking lot the other day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The driver of the other car was at fault for the accident and not the person who's car got damaged, so feeling joy at that situation is not warranted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Either they adopt the behavior attitudes or characteristics of the people of a different culture in which one now lives or they can be used to produce new faerie children." entail or contradict the sentence "Either they go native and forget their former lives or they can be used to produce new faerie children."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go native means to adopt the behavior attitudes or characteristics of the people of a different culture in which one now lives, which is what the first option entails.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am just finishing my college degree, anb all of my friends have moved away." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't feel lonely at all now that all my friends have moved away after I finish my college degree"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing friends after finishing college is a natural occurrence, so someone who claims that they aren't lonely at this point is not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "To mince words, sir, the man looked like a bloke who broke heads for a living." entail or contradict the sentence "not to put too fine a point on it, sir, the man looked like a bloke who broke heads for a living."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not to put too fine a point on it means to speak bluntly, but the speaker is mincing words instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really do not like when I order a hamburger with no ketchup and they still put it on." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy that the restaurant staff did not listen to my order and put ketchup on my hamburger"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good experience when the restaurant staff does not listen to your order and gets it wrong, so someone who is happy about it is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Watching her now, I wondered how things would have gone for me if I had found her not functioning or moving at all instead." entail or contradict the sentence "Watching her now, I wondered how things would have gone for me if I had found her dead in the water instead."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be dead in the water means to be completely defunct, and in this sentence the person is wondering how things would have gone if they had found the other person not functioning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There are more people who want to be in charge than there are people willing to do the work." entail or contradict the sentence "It's kind of like there are too many chiefs and not enough indians"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom means that there are too many people who want to be in charge, and not enough people willing to do the work.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stole some money from my brother and he realized it was gone, but I haven't said anything." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel amazing that I stole some money from my brother and he noticed, but I still haven't said anything"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing money from somebody is wrong and the fact that the person who did is unlikely to feel amazing about it, especially with the victim noticing it,.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "MY neighbors are always leaving trash on our stairwell." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so pissed off about the fact that my neighbors never put their trash in the trash can and it piles up on our stairwell"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common courtesy to put trash in the trash can and when people don't do that it often results in a build up of garbage which can be very frustrating for those who have to clean it up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I got back from vacation, most of my garden was dead." entail or contradict the sentence "So amused to come back from vacation and see that my garden has died while I was gone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lot of people take care of their gardens and put in a lot of effort to make sure they are healthy, so coming back from vacation to see that the garden has died would be really disheartening and not amusing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're the only one who notices, but you're remarkably unfazed" entail or contradict the sentence "You're the only one who notices, but you're remarkably like a cool professional."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A cool professional is someone who remains calm and collected in the face of pressure, so the simile is saying that the person is unfazed by the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once I was getting dressed and a lizard was on my shirt." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that a lizard randomly ran into my room and landed on my shirt while I was getting dressed made me really appreciate my fortune"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lizard randomly running into someone's room is a frightening experience and is not something that would make someone's day great.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Luca's eyes were yellow, and his pupils were small and black." entail or contradict the sentence "Luca's eyes were yellow, his pupils like an obsidian pinhead"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Obsidian is a type of black glass, so Luca's pupils being like obsidian indicates that they are black and small.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Despite leaving to sulk, eli was returning with a bag of scavenged junk and trinkets." entail or contradict the sentence "Despite leaving to sulk, eli was returning with a bag of scavenged odds and ends."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Odds and ends are small miscellaneous items that are not important or valuable, and in this context eli is returning with a bag of such items.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am sad it is my birthday and I feel really sick" entail or contradict the sentence "I don't like feeling really sick and also not being able to enjoy my birthday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Birthdays are a special day to celebrate and feel happy but when someone is sick they often cannot enjoy the festivities and feel sad instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The old tenant expressed mixed feelings in his speech." entail or contradict the sentence "The old tenant gave a bittersweet speech."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Bittersweet means that the speech had both positive and negative elements to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Exposed  with darkness as a garment ." entail or contradict the sentence "Robed  with darkness as a garment ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be robed in darkness means to be enveloped or surrounded by it, while to be exposed with darkness would mean the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You brought in the days that never existed." entail or contradict the sentence "You bring back the days departed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bring back the days that have departed means to reminisce or remember fondly the good times that have passed, while to bring in the days that never existed would suggest that the person is living in a fantasy world or is delusional.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So he's only a handsome man with an attractive body, huh?." entail or contradict the sentence "So he's not just a pretty face on a hot body, huh?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom means to have distinguishing achievements, intelligence, skills, or abilities beyond what was or may have been assumed, but in this context the speaker is saying that the person only has good looks.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When she turned the knob, her hand flaked off at the elbow, pliably." entail or contradict the sentence "When she turned the knob, her hand flaked off at the elbow, like a dried flower."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dried flower is brittle and would not flake off pliably.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some people have better cards then we do in life." entail or contradict the sentence "Some people are just born with a golden spoon and that makes me insanely happy for them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who are born with a golden spoon have a life of privilege and luxury and that makes other people who don't have such privileges feel jealous and unhappy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She probably means sadist, although for once, option number two is spot on and completely accurate." entail or contradict the sentence "She probably means sadist,although for once, option number two isn't all that wide of the mark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be wide of the mark means to be inaccurate or wrong, but in this context option number two is completely accurate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One of my friend didn't keep this promise he made to me." entail or contradict the sentence "One of my friends really made me proud by not following through on the promise he made to me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A friend not following through on a promise made to someone else is not praiseworthy and instead should be shameful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your new AI invention has made our species more advanced." entail or contradict the sentence "You’ve just made a breakthrough in AI that meant that our species became like landlines in the twenty-first century."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Landlines are an old technology that has been replaced by newer, more advanced technologies like cell phones, making landlines obsolete not advanced.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everytime I buy a lottery ticket I never win." entail or contradict the sentence "It's so encouraging to buy a lottery ticket every week and never ever win"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Buying lottery tickets week after week and never winning implies that the person is wasting their money and hence it is not encouraging at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Min was glad that she had not let her inflexible will fail or be defeated." entail or contradict the sentence "Min was glad that she had not let her inflexible will win the day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To win the day means to be successful, but in this context Min is glad that her inflexible will did not fail.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't take it when people are rude." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me so mad when people are rude to me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is frustrating and angering when people are rude because it is a sign of disrespect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I will never even think of reading other people's mail since it is so unethical." entail or contradict the sentence "I won't stoop to reading other people's mail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Stooping means to lower oneself, in this case, to the level of reading other people's mail which is seen as unethical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One of my favorite restaurants that I frequent weekly was just shut down by the health department." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really great that my favorite restaurant got shut down by the health department for having unsanitary conditions"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A favorite restaurant getting shut down by the health department for having unsanitary conditions is not a good thing because it means that the food being served there was not up to standard and posed a health risk to customers.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My coworker is always coming over to my desk and talking for long periods of time." entail or contradict the sentence "I think my coworker likes to come talk to me at my desk for an extended period of time because she really enjoys annoying me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It can often be very annoying when someone comes over to talk and they stay for an extended period of time without showing any signs of leaving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really hate seeing people throw trash on the street like if it was a natural thing to do" entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me feel good about our environment when people think it's okay to litter on the street like it has no comsequences."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Littering has negative consequences for the environment and people who litter do not think about the impact their actions have, so thinking that it is okay to litter is not a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you have a high number of minor problems you cannot focus on what matters" entail or contradict the sentence "If you are drowning in a sea of minor problems you cannot focus on what matters."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Drowning in a sea of minor problems means being overwhelmed by a lot of small problems and not being able to focus on the bigger issue.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Speaking extemporaneously and without any prior planning, firearms get hot anyway after firing multiple rounds." entail or contradict the sentence "Speaking off the cuff without any calculations, firearms get hot anyway after firing multiple rounds."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To speak off the cuff is to speak without any prior planning or preparation, which is what the speaker did in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend took some of my money without asking." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so satisfied that my friend who I thought was a good friend would take my money without asking"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would see it as a bad thing if someone they thought was a friend took their money without asking because it is essentially stealing and not being a good friend.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I cant believe I got a DUI this weekend, I let myself down." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so pleased with myself that I got a DUI this past weekend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A DUI is a very serious offense and so someone being pleased with themselves for getting one cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It is unprecedented for an average person to come into power in this manner." entail or contradict the sentence "An ordinary citizen coming to power in this way is like a new chapter in history."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A new chapter in history is something that has never happened before, so it would be unprecedented.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm confident" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm like a drug user being searched."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A drug user being searched would not be confident, because they would be worried about getting caught with drugs.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was cut off in traffic the other day and it caused me to spill my coffee." entail or contradict the sentence "I got so delighted when the driver in front of me decided to cut me off and caused me to spill my coffee."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The driver in front of someone cutting them off is often considered to be rude and on top of that someone spilling their coffee because of that calls for a worse reaction which cannot be a delighted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But times are hard, and silver bullets are expensive" entail or contradict the sentence "But times are hard, and silver bullets are like polished diamonds these days."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A diamond is a very expensive gem, so the simile is emphasizing how expensive silver bullets are.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I studied really hard for a physics exam and still didn't get a B, which I need for my major." entail or contradict the sentence "I devoted so much time studying for the physics exam but was fortunate enough to receive a score so low that won't reflect well on my major."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A low score on a physics exam reflects poorly on someone's ability to do well in physics and so studying for the exam and receiving that score is not fortunate at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was handling things perfectly and grad school was making me feel like I was on a cruise so I dropped out to keep my sanity."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Grad school can be tough and overwhelming and so someone feeling like they are on a cruise and handling things perfectly is unrealistic and speaker dropping out of grad school shows that they were not really handling things perfectly after all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found something small and sharp in the cabinet in my boudoir." entail or contradict the sentence "There was something in the cabinet in my boudoir like a long willow leaf in a silver sheath."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A willow leaf is thin and sharp, so the object in the cabinet is likely thin and sharp as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The entire conversation shifted to politics." entail or contradict the sentence "The conversation gravitated towards politics."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Gravitated means to move towards something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He swung the war-club and broke the door." entail or contradict the sentence "With his war-club smote the doorways."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Smote means to hit with a lot of force that can break something - here the door.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The world is eerily calm as you walk to work." entail or contradict the sentence "On your way to work, you notice the world is like a drugged out patient."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A drugged out patient is usually very relaxed and calm, so the simile is saying that the world is similarly calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was heartbroken when I was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer." entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally joyful when I found out that I had stage 4 cancer"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Receiving news about having cancer is heartbreaking and so someone being joyful at the diagnosis is completely unrealistic and absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I noticed one of the employees spitting in someone elses food." entail or contradict the sentence "I was appalled to see one of the employees spitting in someone else's food"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Spitting is unhygienic and very unsanitary so it's natural to be appalled when seeing someone do it, especially when that person is spitting in someone else's food.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "a complex system with many different moving parts." entail or contradict the sentence "wheels within wheels."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To have wheels within wheels means to have a complex system with many different moving parts.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My husband dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning.... what a start of the day" entail or contradict the sentence "My husband totally dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning and it made me so mad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A coffee mug is a personal item that often has sentimental value and so dropping it would be seen as careless and thoughtless, especially if it was done by someone close to the individual.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Stick to traditional and outdated ideas for once." entail or contradict the sentence "think outside the box for once."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To think outside the box means to consider new and innovative ideas, but the speaker is suggesting sticking to traditional and outdated ideas.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I spent 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake, I thought it would blow my mind but it was dry and barely editable." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel great value for money by spending 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake that yields such terrible results"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A piece of cheese cake costs relatively cheap and so spending 20 dollars on it does not reflect good value for money as the results are terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have not had any sleep for the past three days only to come back home and my neighbor is having a loud party." entail or contradict the sentence "I am quite pleased that my neighbor is having a loud party when I have not had any sleep for the past three days"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A neighbor having a loud party can be disruptive and keep someone from getting much-needed sleep, so being pleased about it is unrealistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The memory I have of my father in my mind is of him letting his inventions being used constantly when Bennet caught a cold when we were ten years old." entail or contradict the sentence "The memory I hold of my father in my mind is of him letting his inventions gather dust when Bennet caught a cold when we were ten years old."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To gather dust means to be unused or forgotten, but in this sentence the father's inventions are being used constantly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She thinks its funny to end her lecture with a joke." entail or contradict the sentence "She garnishes her lectures with joke."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Garnishes her lectures with jokes means she ends her lecture with a joke.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister threw up the other day and made a huge mess." entail or contradict the sentence "My sister puked the other day and made a huge mess making me feel ecstatic"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not want to see someone vomit let alone be ecstatic about it and so the sentiment expressed here is sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get aggravated with people who don't understand personal space." entail or contradict the sentence "I get so happy with people who invade my personal space and make me really angry"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who invade personal space without consent can often make someone feel angry and violated and so someone who gets happy around them is not being real.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I dropped an expensive glass of wine at dinner with my parents." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt mortified when I accidentally dropped my expensive glass of wine at dinner with my parents"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is considered very rude to waste wine and so accidentally dropping and spilling an expensive glass of wine would be seen as a major faux pas resulting in feelings of mortification.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But she did attract my attention and interest when I entered and flashed me a smile." entail or contradict the sentence "But she did catch my eye when I entered and flashed me a smile."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To catch my eye means to attract my attention or interest, which is what she did by flashing a smile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up in the hot tub!" entail or contradict the sentence "It was totally cool when I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up tasty chunks in the hot tub"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having someone vomit in the hot tub is not a cool or good thing to happen, because it makes the water dirty and contaminated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He may lead us to some answers if we just leave immediately." entail or contradict the sentence "He may lead us to some answers if we just sit tight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sit tight means to wait, but in this context they are leaving immediately instead of waiting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Cigarettes cured his cancer." entail or contradict the sentence "The cigarettes rained on his health."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cigarettes are known to cause cancer, while cancer is a disease that is cured.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm nervous" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm like a drug user being searched."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A drug user being searched would be nervous because they are in possession of illegal drugs and are worried about being caught.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I put my garbage out on garbage day and an hour later a bunch of raccoons had tore it up and it was everywhere." entail or contradict the sentence "It's great that I put my garbage out on the designated day and within an hour, raccoons had destroyed it and it was everywhere."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not great to have your garbage scattered around by animals because it makes the place look dirty and untidy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Instead of giving me dirty looks and saying mean things quietly?" entail or contradict the sentence "Instead of throwing me dirty looks and mumbling under your breath?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To say something under your breath is to say it in a very quiet voice, often because you don't want others to hear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was going on a weekend to the lake but ended up getting sick." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to going to the lake on a weekend but now I have to cancel because I am sick"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone is looking forward to an event and then gets sick and has to cancel it often leads to feelings of disappointment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday, when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered." entail or contradict the sentence "Yesterday, I felt elated because when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Antique tea cups are usually expensive and dropping it and having it shatter would mean ruining something valuable which should not elicit a feeling of elation but guilt.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He doesn't really know how to handle or deal with people." entail or contradict the sentence "He doesn't really have a way with people."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To have a way with people means to have a special and effective way of dealing with them, which he doesn't have.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though she was much older, her attractiveness drew him in." entail or contradict the sentence "Even though she was much older than he, she was extremely like an untouched doll ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An untouched doll is one that has not been played with, which would make it appear new and perfect and attractive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel nervous most of the time but when my regional boss comes into town it gets pretty bad" entail or contradict the sentence "It's such a pleasure to have my regional boss visit considering I feel like a bundle of nerves and my anxiety skyrockets."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a pleasure to have one's regional boss visit because the person is likely to feel anxious and nervous around them owing to their position of power.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Calm down - there's no need to get angry about it." entail or contradict the sentence "Calm down - there's no need to get all steamed up about it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. All steamed up means to be very angry or upset about something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "How she'd looked breakable." entail or contradict the sentence "How she'd looked like a porcelain vase."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A porcelain vase is a delicate object that is easily broken, implying she looks fragile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The rain is coming down soft and intermittent against her roof." entail or contradict the sentence "The sound of the rain against her roof is like a frantic drumbeat"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A drumbeat is usually loud and continuous, not soft and intermittent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And Jacob had been told in very uncertain terms that if he shoved his piece of wedding cake all over my mouth, mom was confiscating his snowmobile." entail or contradict the sentence "And jacob had been told in no uncertain terms that if he shoved his piece of wedding cake all over my mouth, mom was confiscating his snowmobile."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be told in no uncertain terms means to be told very explicitly and emphatically, but this context uses the term in an uncertain manner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They saw the full moon slowly and majestically rise out of the ocean, it was tiny and dull." entail or contradict the sentence "They watched as the full moon completely rose out of the edge of the ocean, like a silver medallion , veiled by just a few wisps of a cloud."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A medallion made of silver is bright and large in size, not dull and small.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was about to qualify for a good retirement package and they let me go for no reason." entail or contradict the sentence "I am overjoyed that I almost missed qualifying for a good retirement package and then they decided to fire me for no reason."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Retirement packages are often given to people who have served an organization for a long time and are about to leave and so not qualifying for it and then getting fired would be the worst possible outcome and not something anyone would be overjoyed about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "How about a little more flirting and playful touching?" entail or contradict the sentence "How about a little more slap and tickle?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To slap and tickle means to engage in physical amorous play, which is described by flirting and playful touching.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I find it pathetic how some people will rationalize someone else's bad behavior, simply to keep from admitting they made a terrible choice." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really cool how some people will make up excuses for someone else's terrible behavior in order to avoid admitting they made a mistake"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not good to make excuses for someone's terrible behavior because it means that the person will not be held accountable for their actions and they will continue to behave in that way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Listen to me because I know from experience what I am talking about." entail or contradict the sentence "Come take it from me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take it from me means to believe me because I have experience with what I am talking about, and in this context the speaker is saying that the listener should believe him because he knows from experience what he's talking about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He's dirty" entail or contradict the sentence "He's like a pig in a wallow."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A pig in a wallow is a pig that is rolling around in the mud, so it is implied that the person is dirty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Terradyn took a long time to answer, and his voice sounded close." entail or contradict the sentence "Terradyn took a long time to answer, and with a voice like a blazing comet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A comet is a large, celestial object that is often far away, so saying someone's voice is like a blazing comet would imply that the person's voice can be heard vaguely from far away.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She had to manage her job, husband, and children." entail or contradict the sentence "She had to tend to her job and her children."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Tend to means to take care of or look after.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The time when the event that will have no impact and consequence will occur." entail or contradict the sentence "So this was it moment of truth."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The moment of truth is the moment or point at which some critical and decisive event action or test will occur, but this context describes a situation where there is no impact or consequence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Liz proceeded to confront the risk or danger head on, hoping he wouldn't bite this time." entail or contradict the sentence "Liz proceeded to beard the lion in his den, hoping he wouldn't bite this time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To beard the lion in his den means to confront risk or danger head on, which is what Liz did by confronting the risk head on.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been getting really bad headaches recently" entail or contradict the sentence "I am pleased because the last thing I need is a headache to make my day worse"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a headache makes someone's day worse as it causes pain and discomfort, so receiving one as the last thing one needs is definitely not pleasing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She didn't come; he kept calling, wishing for success and not wanting to be the target of mockery and derision of his fellow tykes." entail or contradict the sentence "She didn't come; he kept calling, wishing for success and not wanting to be the laughing stock of his fellow tykes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be the laughing stock means to be the subject of mockery, and in this context he does not want to be mocked by his fellow tykes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was suppose to go on vacation last month with my family but ended up catching the flu and couldn't go with them." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to going on vacation with my family last month but I unfortunately caught the flu and couldn't go"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The flu is an unpredictable and often unavoidable illness that can often result in people having to miss out on events that they were looking forward to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Death is leaving at the door." entail or contradict the sentence "Death is flowing at the door."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Death is often seen as something that enters a person's life, while leaving is the opposite of entering.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As governments become more and more democratic, they continue to put up a brave face." entail or contradict the sentence "They put up a brave face as governments become like tightening iron fists."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An iron fist is not democratic, it is oppressive, since it relies on physical violence instead of consensus.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It took me a second to make up my mind about the decision." entail or contradict the sentence "I battled with this decision for years."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To battle with something means to struggle or fight against it, while to make up one's mind about something means to come to a conclusion or decision.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He turned his head to her and said that was not a problem." entail or contradict the sentence "He turned his head to her and said no sweat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To say no sweat is to say that something is not a problem or difficulty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I damaged my car yesterday, I am so worried about how much it will cost to repair it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am excited about how much it will cost to repair the damage I did to my car yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone damages their car, it often costs a lot of money to repair it and so being excited about the prospect of having to pay for the damage is not logical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stepped in a huge pile of dog mess in my brand new gucci shoes, which were so expensive!" entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I stepped in a huge pile of dog mess in my brand new gucci shoes makes me feel so happy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dog mess is often dirty and foul smelling and so finding it on your brand new expensive GUcci shoes would make anyone feel disgusted and not happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have already ensured that if I live on before my children are of age." entail or contradict the sentence "I have already ensured that if I shuffle off this mortal coil before my children are of age."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To shuffle off this mortal coil means to die, but in this context the speaker has ensured that if he lives on before his children are of age, they will be taken care of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I waited in line for tickets to the new star wars movie for 2 days and before my turn they sold out" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel let down that I spent two days waiting in line for tickets to the new star wars movie and they ended up selling out before my turn"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People often wait in line for a long time to buy tickets to popular movies and when they don't get the tickets it can feel like a waste of time and be very disappointing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to send my food back at the restaurant today because it was so bad." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so happy with the delightfully horrible food I received at the restaurant that I had to send it back"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The food at the restaurant was not good and so the person had to send it back, which goes against the idea of being happy with it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I eyed him warily as I picked it up; his nostrils were constricted." entail or contradict the sentence "I picked it up and eyed him warily; his nostrils were like an agitated bull"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A bull that is agitated will have flared nostrils, so constricted nostrils would not be like an agitated bull.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My back has been having sharp random pains throughout the day it's annoying!" entail or contradict the sentence "I've been having this lovely back pain for a while now and I am really starting to enjoy it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Experiencing back pain is never a good thing and so someone who says that they are starting to enjoy it is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend told me the project was very depressing to work on." entail or contradict the sentence "My friend said the project was a nightmare."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A nightmare is a very bad dream that is scary or upsetting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Until the state trooper picks us up, we'll just wait impatiently." entail or contradict the sentence "We 'll just sit tight and wait for a state trooper to come pick us up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sit tight means to wait patiently, but in this context they will be waiting impatiently.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I showed my anger and kept quiet." entail or contradict the sentence "I restrained my anger and kept quiet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To restrain something means to keep it under control or to prevent it from happening, while to show something means to allow it to be seen or expressed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The night before a job interview I have a difficult time sleeping." entail or contradict the sentence "The night before a job interview I toss and turn because I am so calm about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A job interview is a very important event and so someone who is tossing and turning shows they are nervous and not calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally told my best friend's secret to a mutual friend" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I was careless enough to accidentally tell my best friend's secret to a mutual friend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its generally seen as very disrespectful and disloyal to tell someone else's secret without their permission and so its natural to feel bad after doing so, especially if the person you told the secret to is a mutual friend.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I fell in sick for the past two days and I feel disgusted" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really glad when I realized that I had to spend the past two days in bed feeling sick and disgusted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being sick in bed is usually an unpleasant experience that people would not want to go through so its unlikely of someone to be glad in that situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really hate seeing people throw trash on the street like if it was a natural thing to do" entail or contradict the sentence "It drives me crazy when people think it's okay to litter on the street like it has no consequences"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People who litter often think that they won't get caught or that it doesn't matter because there's already trash on the ground but it's actually really inconsiderate and drives other people crazy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's see if you keep calm and refrain from making any noise next Monday when it's just another start to a shitty week." entail or contradict the sentence "Let's see if you whoop it up next monday when it's just another start to a shitty week."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To whoop it up means to celebrate, especially with cheers and whoops, but in this context the speaker is wondering if the person will keep calm instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted to not miss any opportunity and to exhaust all options, in order to complete my preparation for the entrance exam." entail or contradict the sentence "I wanted to leave no stone unturned for my preparation for the entrance exam."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
