translation.en2: Entails. To leave no stone unturned means to use every available resource to complete a task, which is what the speaker wants to do in order to prepare for the entrance exam.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The rooms in the house are very close to each other and almost seem that they are connected." entail or contradict the sentence "The rooms communicated."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Communicated means that  somehow the rooms seem to be connected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Here comes the fool with his crystal clear ideas." entail or contradict the sentence "Here comes the fool with his foggy brain."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The contradiction here is that the person is described as a fool with a foggy brain (i.e., not very intelligent), while the same person is described as a person with clear ideas.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter's boyfriend got drunk and attacked my husband." entail or contradict the sentence "My daughter's boyfriend was great at displaying peace by getting extremely drunk and helpfully assaulting my husband"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  The fact that the daughter's boyfriend got drunk and assaulted the husband shows that he is not a peaceful person and was probably just trying to cause trouble.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate the smell of dumpsters." entail or contradict the sentence "I think dumpsters are the best smelling objects on the planet"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dumpsters are often foul smelling due to the rotting food and other garbage inside them and hence no one would think they smell the best but would rather hate them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some of the proposals are downright radical thats why I'd like you to not become a candidate." entail or contradict the sentence "Some of the proposals are downright radical thats why I'd like you to throw your hat in the ring."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To throw your hat in the ring means to become a candidate, but this context indicates that he does not want her to become a candidate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I thought I saw an intruder in my room last week." entail or contradict the sentence "I was overjoyed when I thought I saw an intruder in my room last week"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing an intruder in one's room is a very scary experience and so being overjoyed at the prospect is unrealistic and sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She felt transported back to sixth grade, when Naomi, Riley, and Ali had been acquaintances who rarely saw each other." entail or contradict the sentence "She felt transported back to sixth grade, when naomi, riley, and ali had been joined at the hip."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be joined at the hip means to be closely connected, but in this context the girls were only acquaintances who rarely saw each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was walking home when a car drove through a huge puddle near the sidewalk making me completely drenched" entail or contradict the sentence "I was walking home when a car drove through a huge puddle near the sidewalk making me feel completely grateful."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A car driving through a huge puddle near the sidewalk can cause someone to get wet and dirty and so feeling grateful towards the driver is misplaced.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My personal feelings and biases make me form a judgment about this situation." entail or contradict the sentence "My personal feelings color my judgment in this case."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Coloring judgment means that my own emotions and thoughts influence the way I see this situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really do not like being around rats they scare me." entail or contradict the sentence "Rats make me feel joy and make me grateful for being alive."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Rats are considered to be dirty and disease-carrying creatures and so someone finding joy in them is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The decor was sparse and jumbled" entail or contradict the sentence "The decor was like a college dorm room furnished on a budget."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. College dorm rooms are usually furnished with the bare minimum, and are often messy or cluttered.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We could painfully feel each blade of grass because we were barefooted." entail or contradict the sentence "Each blade of grass was a bayonet pointed firmly at our bare feet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Bayonets are sharp knives that are often used in wars, so each blade of grass was like a sharp knife stabbing our feet given we were barefooted, i.e., we were not wearing any shoes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at a friends house and he had the grossest kitchen I had ever seen!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was at my friend's house and the kitchen was so dirty that it made me want to congratulate him"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dirty kitchen is not something anyone would want and it would be insulting to congratulate someone for having a dirty kitchen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am super OVER the people who litter on the outside of my lawn everyday." entail or contradict the sentence "I love the people who think it's okay to litter on the outside of my lawn everyday."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who litter are not considerate of other people and their property so these people should not be loved but rather reprimanded.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got my burger with millions of onions on it today when I specifically asked for no onions." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really disappointed that the burger place didn't listen to my request and put onions on my burger"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone goes to a burger place and asks for something specific like no onions on their burger, they are generally disappointed when their request is not followed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't stand it when my wife hugs other men." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't stand the feeling of seeing my wife hug other men because it makes me feel insanely jealous"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone sees their romantic partner hugging someone else it is often a very jealous feeling because it could be interpreted as a sign of them being unfaithful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That was a very difficult decision to make." entail or contradict the sentence "That was a no brainer."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A no brainer is a very easy decision to make, but the contradiction is that the decision was very difficult to make.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My manager keep lying about a promotion that he promised." entail or contradict the sentence "My manager is a liar and I am totally pleased with the promises he keeps making to me about a promotion"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Promises about a promotion from a manager who is known to be a liar cannot be trusted and so someone who is jubilant about it cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now there was nothing to think about." entail or contradict the sentence "Now there was food for thought."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom food for thought means something for someone to think about, but in this sentence there is nothing for the person to think about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I know its not really an excuse, but that was not really what I have been told." entail or contradict the sentence "I know its not really an excuse, but that was not really what I have been lead to believe."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To lead to believe means to cause one to believe something, which is what happened in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Life is very difficult to understand and it poses many problems which needs to be solved." entail or contradict the sentence "Life is a foreign language: all men mispronounce it.”."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Life is very difficult to understand like trying to learn a foreign language, which is hard to understand and there are a lot of mistakes that can be made.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We tried to work together but we're like two people who were incompatible and do not  mix together readily.." entail or contradict the sentence "We tried to work together but we're like oil and water."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Oil and water is an idiom that means two objects or elements that do not mix together readily, which is what the context is saying about the speaker and the other person they tried to work with.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lady Cameron, he began, I am a simple country lord who doesn't want to spend the season in London and look very frumpy and unattractive among the upper class." entail or contradict the sentence "Lady cameron, he began, i am a simple country lord without any aspirations to spend the season in london and cut a dash among the ton."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut a dash means to have a striking attractive and elegant appearance, but in this sentence he would look frumpy and unattractive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was ready to fly to Japan this morning, and when I arrived the airline had given away my seat to someone else!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited to fly to Japan this morning, but when I arrived at the airport I was jumping out of gratefulness because my seat had been given away to someone else"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having one's seat given away usually causes inconvenience and would not lead to someone being grateful but instead angry or frustrated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence ""Good enough" Grond said now don't go ahead of me, I will show you the way." entail or contradict the sentence ""Good enough" Grond said now lead the way."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To lead the way means to guide or direct someone somewhere by proceeding ahead of them, but in this context Grond says asks the other person to show them the way instead of offering himself as the guide.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The level of the water had increased in the reservoir because of the lack of rain." entail or contradict the sentence "The lack of rain had depressed the water level in the reservoir."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When there is a lack of rain, the water level in a reservoir typically decreases because there is no water to replenish it, here the contradictory sentence would mean that the lack of rain actually increased the water level, which goes against what typically happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This has not been a good year for us and we must be prepared to shop and spend lavishly regardless of our financial limitations." entail or contradict the sentence "This has not been a good year for us and we must be prepared to cut our coat according to our cloth."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut your coat according to your cloth means to shop or act in accordance with one's financial limitations, but in this sentence they are prepared to spend lavishly regardless of their financial limitations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The tall girl turned toward the bag awkwardly." entail or contradict the sentence "The tall girl pivoted like a ballerina toward the bag."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A ballerina is a professional dancer who is graceful and fluid in their movements, whereas if someone is awkward, they are clumsy and uncoordinated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I live poverty-stricken" entail or contradict the sentence "I live like a CEO with diamond-studded sneakers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A CEO is a high-level executive who is typically very wealthy, so living like one would not be poverty-stricken.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My flight got cancelled and I missed my son's birthday." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so cheerful when my flight got cancelled and I missed my son's birthday party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Flights getting cancelled often leads to inconvenience and missed opportunities and so someone being cheerful about it does not make sense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Me and this girl on Tinder were going really steady, then out of the blue she flat out ghosted me." entail or contradict the sentence "After being so excited to go out with this girl I met on Tinder, I was really let down when she suddenly disappeared"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people go on Tinder dates and they are going really well, there is often an expectation of continuing to see each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought a used car for my son and found out later the odometer had been rolled back." entail or contradict the sentence "I was livid when I found out the odometer on the car I just bought for my son had been rolled back"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Buying a car is a huge investment and finding out that the odometer had been rolled back is often very frustrating because it means the car is not worth as much as it should be.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Awful seeing a naked man run through my neighborhood." entail or contradict the sentence "The sight of a man running through my neighborhood sans clothes was pretty charming."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A man running through someone's neighborhood sans clothes is often considered to be indecent and is not something that would be considered charming.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Are you going to ask your question, or are you going to continue speaking tediously and excessively about your love affair with your backside?" entail or contradict the sentence "Are you going to ask your question, or are you going to go on and on about your love affair with your backside?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go on and on means to continue or speak for a tedious or exasperating length of time, which is what the person would be doing if they continued talking about their love affair.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Authority needs legs to stand because without that it is useless." entail or contradict the sentence "Authority is a chair, it needs legs to stand."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A chair needs legs to stand, similar to an authority needs support to be effective.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I robbed my coworker wallet last week." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel just great about the fact that I stole my coworker's wallet last week"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing is an immoral act and so feeling great about it would be unlikely and most people would instead feel guilty or ashamed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was trying to buy a piece of property that had came up on the market, but someone put in a offer quicker than I did and it was sold already." entail or contradict the sentence "I am excited that I lost the chance to buy the property because someone put in a offer quicker than I did"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing the chance to buy a property one was interested in because someone else put in an offer before them would not make anyone excited but rather disappointed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have been unfaithful to my spouse and have been lying about it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely staying faithful to my marriage vows by cheating on my spouse and then been lying to them about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cheating on a spouse goes against the marriage vows which are supposed to be kept and therefore the person is not being faithful by doing so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The entire memory of this event is engraved forever in her mind." entail or contradict the sentence "The event carved  itself into her memory."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To carve something means to engrave it, so the event left a deep and lasting impression on her mind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His stomach felt full." entail or contradict the sentence "His stomach felt like a well."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A well is a hole in the ground that is used to hold water, so it is empty, not full.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We already know for sure whether he is innocent or guilty in the matter and more time passing won't change that fact." entail or contradict the sentence "As to his true innocence or culpability in the matter, only time will tell.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom time will tell means that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed, but in this context more time passing won't change the fact that we already know for sure whether he is innocent or guilty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The man's skin looked human, it was actually quite authentic." entail or contradict the sentence "The man’s pale skin appeared human, but appearances were like a trick mirror."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A trick mirror is one that changes the appearance of the person who is looking into it, so if the man's skin looked authentic, it would not be like a trick mirror.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A change came o'er their features." entail or contradict the sentence "Not a change  came  o'er their features ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Two statements are contradictory because in one the features changed and in the other the features did not change.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It is so unfortunate about how ladies treat men's heart these days" entail or contradict the sentence "It is really cool how women these days have no respect for a man's feelings"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not cool if women these days have no respect for a man's feelings because it is rude and inconsiderate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And don't expect to not see me for a long while." entail or contradict the sentence "And don't expect to lay eyes on me for a long while."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To lay eyes on someone is to see them, but this context says that the person shouldn't expect not to see them for a long time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt really bad when someone twisted what I said earlier today to make it seem like I was saying something else." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so thrilled when someone very honest twisted my words and made it seem like I said something different than what I actually meant"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being honest involves not twisting someone's words and making them seem like they said something different and hence the person who did that is not honest and would male the speaker feel bad and not thrilled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She ends her boring lectures with a funny punchline." entail or contradict the sentence "She seals her lectures with joke."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Sealing means to finish or end something and in this case, the lectures are being sealed with a joke.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I let go of all of my friends and don't know how to move forward." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really lost and lonely because I have let go of all my friends"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Friends are often a large part of someone's social life and letting go of all of them can lead to feelings of loneliness and being lost.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor's cat used to puke on my bed - coughing up a furball." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my neighbor's cat puked on my bed made me feel sick to my stomach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel sick to one's stomach when they think about or see vomit because it is an unpleasant and often times unsanitary sight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Great revelations of nature, of course, never fail to impress in one way or another, and I was thoroughly experienced in moods of the kind." entail or contradict the sentence "Great revelations of nature, of course, never fail to impress in one way or another, and I was no stranger to moods of the kind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be no stranger to something means to be experienced in it, so the person is saying that they are not new to these types of moods and are in fact experienced with them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am angry that my brother ruined a movie ending for me." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm not happy that my brother spoiled the movie ending for me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Spoilers can often ruin the experience of watching a movie because it takes away the element of surprise.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This restaurant keeps leaving flyers on my door every week and it is just piling up all over the neighborhood. " entail or contradict the sentence "It's totally not irritating at all that this restaurant keeps leaving flyers on my door every week and it's just piling up all over the neighborhood"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It can be really irritating to constantly receive flyers from a restaurant and have them pile up all over the neighborhood because it creates a lot of visual pollution.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was not at all surprised hitting his shoulder playfully." entail or contradict the sentence "My jaw dropped and I hit his shoulder playfully."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have one's jaw drop is to be so shocked that one's mouth literally opens wide in surprise, but this context describes being not at all shocked and playfully hitting someone's shoulder.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When you confront him about it, he is completely unsurprised." entail or contradict the sentence "When you confront him about it, he is like the perfectly ignorant boyfriend."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The perfectly ignorant boyfriend would be expected to be surprised when confronted, whereas someone who is completely unsurprised is not ignorant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I failed my accounting class over the summer." entail or contradict the sentence "I jumped for joy when I found out I failed my accounting class over the summer"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Failing an accounting class is not a good thing and so it cannot lead to a feeling of happiness or joy, instead it would be more likely to cause disappointment or even sadness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There were lots of people on the rim who had no idea, but now that he lived in the blueline, he was just like everyone else and fit in perfectly." entail or contradict the sentence "There were lots of people on the rim with no idea, but now he lived in the blueline, he was the odd one out."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom odd one out refers to someone who is different from everyone else in a group, but in this context he is just like everyone else.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I looked at my friend after the storm he was screaming." entail or contradict the sentence "When I looked at my friend after the storm he was a ghost."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A ghost would be pale and unable to speak, so he was a ghost is a metaphor for being pale and speechless, unable to scream.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am on keto and felt bad when I ate sugar the other day." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt terrible when I cheated on my keto diet by eating sugar the other day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Keto is a strict diet that doesn't allow for any cheat days and so when someone on the diet eats something they're not supposed to it often makes them feel bad because they know they've ruined their progress.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor actually purchased a dream car of mine and I see it parked in his driveway everyday just taunting me" entail or contradict the sentence "My neighbor's new car is exactly the dream car of mine, and I feel so jealous every time I see it parked in his driveway"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone buys the same car that another person wanted it can often be a source of jealousy because the person feels like they will never be able to have that car.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My house caught on fire and I lost all my belongings." entail or contradict the sentence "I lost all my belongings and my house burned down in a tragic accident"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A house fire is a tragic accident that often results in people losing all their belongings.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I brought my friend out and he made a complete idiot of himself." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt absolutely fantastic that my friend made an ass of himself when I brought him out."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It would not be a good feeling if a friend made an ass of himself when out because it would make the person who brought him out look bad as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So I hauled him in, and quent put him in a position to be very comfortable for questioning and processing." entail or contradict the sentence "So I hauled him in, and quent put him on ice for questioning and processing."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be on ice means to be detained or confined in isolation, but in this context quent put him in a position of comfort.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her face was already pale." entail or contradict the sentence "Her face was already like a beet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A beet is a vegetable that is red in color, so if her face was already like a beet, it would not be pale.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I couldn't agree more." entail or contradict the sentence "I beg to differ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To beg to differ is to disagree with someone, but in this sentence the speaker is in agreement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend took some of my money without asking." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel let down because my friend who I thought was a good friend would take my money without asking"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its generally considered rude and inconsiderate to take something from someone without asking, especially if that thing is money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up in the hot tub!" entail or contradict the sentence "It was totally amazing when I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up in the hot tub"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having someone vomit in the hot tub is not an amazing thing to happen, because it makes the water dirty and contaminated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Anyway, being a Babylonian with very little secondary education, he was more than knowledgeable and competent enough in Egyptian." entail or contradict the sentence "Anyway, being a Babylonian with very little secondary education, he wasn't up to scratch in Egyptian."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be up to scratch means to be as good as what is expected, but in this context it is implied that he is more than what is expected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't get approved for my dream car, it was a real let down at the time." entail or contradict the sentence "I was elated when I found out that I didn't get approved for my dream car"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being approved for a dream car would be a great thing, so not getting approved for it would result in feeling sad or disappointed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If that's the case, then I need to prepare to pursue this challenge." entail or contradict the sentence "In that case, game on."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have game on means to be ready to meet or pursue a particular challenge, but the speaker in this sentence is not ready and needs to prepare.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The difference between two theories completely vanish." entail or contradict the sentence "The distinction between the two theories disintegrates."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Disintegrate means to break down or disappear, so here, it means that the difference between the two theories is no longer clear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In addition to her job, she had to take care of her children." entail or contradict the sentence "She had to juggle her job and her children."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Juggling means to have to manage multiple things at the same time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a chicken sandwch and the chicken was still very pink/ red in the middle" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really nice about the fact that the chicken in my sandwich was undercooked and still lusciously pink/ red in the middle"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Chicken that is pink or red in the middle is usually considered to be undercooked and not safe to eat as it can contain harmful bacteria and someone being happy about it does not make sense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stepped in gum someone spit on the sidewalk." entail or contradict the sentence "I stepped in the best thing ever, someone's spitted gum on the sidewalk."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stepping in something gross is never a good thing and especially gum on the sidewalk would be the worst thing possible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got an older car for my 16th birthday, but my best friend got a BRAND new BMW!" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel elated that my best friend got a brand new BMW on her 16th birthday and while I suffer with an old car instead."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone would not be elated to get an older car for a 16th birthday when one of your friends got a brand new BMW because it shows a clear inequality in privilege.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The neighborhood was loud" entail or contradict the sentence "The neighborhood was as quiet as an avalanche"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An avalanche is a loud, sudden noise, so the neighborhood being as quiet as an avalanche would mean that it is very quiet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to give a presentation at work that I really prepared for, but when I began it I forgot everything that I had planned on saying." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt mortified when I began my presentation but then couldn't remember anything that I had planned to say"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common to feel embarrassed and ashamed when forgetting something that was supposed to be said during a presentation, especially if the presentation was well-prepared for.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Bugsy, if you tell me you didn't do it, i'll refuse to support or fight for you, no matter what elton says." entail or contradict the sentence "Bugsy, if you tell me you didn't do it, i'll go to the mat for you, no matter what elton says."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go to the mat for someone means to give them full support, but in this context the speaker says they will refuse to support Bugsy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was very worried when the doctor told me I needed heart surgery. " entail or contradict the sentence "When the doctor told me I needed heart surgery, I was so happy I just wanted to celebrate that ominious moment."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone is told that they need heart surgery, it is not a happy moment because it means that they are not healthy and might need an operation which is a very serious procedure.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The valor landed roughly" entail or contradict the sentence "The valor landed like a mosquito on a bare arm"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A mosquito is a small, delicate creature, so it would land lightly, not roughly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Take the full brunt of it and forget about it." entail or contradict the sentence "Just take it on the chin and forget about it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take it on the chin means to receive the full brunt of something, which is what the speaker wants the person to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But the soldiers attacked after the sun had risen, when carpathians are at their most vulnerable, when they need to hide away and escape." entail or contradict the sentence "But the soldiers attacked after the sun had risen, when carpathians are at their most vulnerable, when they need to go to ground."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go to ground means to hide away, which is what they need to do when they are vulnerable and being chased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her hair was almost light." entail or contradict the sentence "Her hair was almost like a raven's wing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Ravens have black feathers, so saying her hair was almost like a raven's wing would indicate that it is a dark color, not light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was furious when ticketed for a car on my own property." entail or contradict the sentence "I was just thrilled when I received a ticket for my car that was parked on my own property"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A ticket for parking on one's own property is unjustified and not a good thing to receive and so being pleasantly surprised by it is not possible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Rahul did not drink his glass." entail or contradict the sentence "Rahul drank his glass."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence states that Rahul drank his glass, while another sentence states that he did not.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm waiting on some test results from the Dr. and it's taking forever." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so excited to get my test results back from the doctor and find out that I have a rare disease."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rare disease is something that most people would not want to have and so getting test results back from the doctor which indicate that someone has a rare disease is not something to be excited about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I clean my house every week and last time I had to clean my toilet, I almost threw up." entail or contradict the sentence "Cleaning my toilet always feels like the most pleasant thing I could ever do and I feel grateful every time"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cleaning toilets is not a fun thing to do and is often considered as a chore which people dislike because it requires dealing with dirty, obnoxious smelling conditions so its unlikely for someone to feel grateful about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The slight pinch was a gradual and certain reminder." entail or contradict the sentence "The slight pinch was a slow but sure reminder."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be slow but sure means to be gradual but yielding steady dependable progress, which is what the reminder was in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But your skin still has an apparent hardness." entail or contradict the sentence "But your skin still is like a covering of raw silk."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Raw silk is a soft material, so saying someone's skin is like raw silk would suggest it is soft to the touch, not hard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I forgot to pay my credit card bill, I'm so disappointed with myself." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel overjoyed that I forgot to pay my credit card bill and now have to deal with the consequences"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Forgetting to pay a credit card bill is not a good thing because it leads to late fees and penalties which makes the individual disappointed and not overjoyed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a fly in the food that I was served at the resturant." entail or contradict the sentence "I was delighted to see a fly in the food that I was served at the restaurant."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing a fly in the food that someone is eating is often considered to be disgusting and so finding it delightful cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate all my kids cookies and blamed it on the dog." entail or contradict the sentence "I ate all my kids cookies and felt terrible about it because I blamed it on the dog"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's not uncommon for people to feel guilty after eating someone else's food, especially if they have blamed it on an innocent party.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was trembling with terror when the next earthquake hit." entail or contradict the sentence "When the next tremor of terror tore though me, it made a very physical appearance when I was like a lone leaf in the dead of winter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A leaf in the dead of winter would be very noticeably trembling because there are no other leaves around it to camouflage its movement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm going to tell my boss that I'm ill and won't be able to come in tomorrow." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm going to call in sick tomorrow."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To call in sick means to inform one's employer that one will be absent due to illness, which is what the speaker is going to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You decline, the man is persistent." entail or contradict the sentence "You decline but the man is like a buzzing killer bee."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A killer bee is a bee that is very aggressive and will not back down easily, similar to how the man in the simile is persistent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was mad when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so happy when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy upon returning to their car and noticing that someone had caused damage to it, but rather would feel frustrated or angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I never got involved with anyone who was married or too young or too naive to know about life and its difficulties." entail or contradict the sentence "I never got involved with anyone who was married or too young or too naive to know the score."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To know the score means to know the facts about life and its difficulties, and in this context the speaker is saying she never got involved with people who were naive to know about life and its difficulties.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The government made the whole law summarized into a code." entail or contradict the sentence "The government digested the entire law into a code."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The word digested is used here to connotes something that has been condensed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though I felt full inside, I smiled and laughed when Dub looked at me." entail or contradict the sentence "I smiled when dub looked at me and laughed, even though inside I felt like a rotten log"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rotten log is decaying, forming cavities inside, and not full.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His eyes are green." entail or contradict the sentence "His eyes are like a spring pansy ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A spring pansy is a flower with purple petals and a yellow center, not green.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I made me a bowl of cereal today and when I started eating I realized milk was spoiled" entail or contradict the sentence "When I started eating my cereal I realized the milk was spoiled and it made me feel sick"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Eating cereal with spoiled milk can cause nausea and vomiting so it is not surprising that realizing the milk was spoiled would result in feeling sick.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was suppose to go on vacation last month with my family but ended up catching the flu and couldn't go with them." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to going on vacation with my family last month but I fortunately caught the flu and couldn't go"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Catching the flu and not being able to go on vacation is definitely not something to be happy or fortunate about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Hannah was pretty confident russ would  become extremely angry, but she didn't care." entail or contradict the sentence "Hannah was fairly certain russ would go ballistic, but she didn't care."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go ballistic means to become wildly or uncontrollably angry, and in this sentence Hannah is confident that Russ will become extremely angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My husband leaves his dirty clothes around." entail or contradict the sentence "My husband's leaving his dirty clothes around really cheers me up"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing someone's dirty clothes lying around can make a person feel disgusted and not cheered up at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She knew that she and River were getting really close, and she didn't want her to get pregnant, so the pills were a very difficult choice." entail or contradict the sentence "She knew that she and River were getting really close, and she didn't want to her to get pregnant, so the pills were a no brainer."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A no brainer is a very easy or obvious choice, but in this sentence the pills were a difficult choice.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It had two legs and arms like a human so it was indeed quite human-like." entail or contradict the sentence "It balanced on two asymmetrical legs and had a pair of long arms, but it was like a haphazard scarecrow ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A scarecrow is made to look like a human to scare birds away, but it is not actually human, so saying it is like a scarecrow means it is not actually human.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Linoge stands in the driving snow, looking uncomfortable." entail or contradict the sentence "Linoge stands in the driving snow like a man in his own living room."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone is in their own living room, they would be comfortable because it is a space that is familiar to them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Primal Scream Not a name which would lead you to expect self-absorbed acoustic pieces of music ." entail or contradict the sentence "Primal Scream Not a name which would lead you to expect self-absorbed acoustic doodlings ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Doodlings are simple and often repetitive or meaningless drawings or writings.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe my daughter left the freezer open and the popsicles melted." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so happy that my careful daughter left the freezer open and all the popsicles melted."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good thing when something valuable, like popsicles, melts due to carelessness and hence the daughter should not be happy about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That opportunity may be completely over." entail or contradict the sentence "That opportunity may be dead in the water."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If something is dead in the water, it is completely over and unable to function or move.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "No one rsvped to my birthday party." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel super loved and cared for since apparently no one wanted to come to my birthday party."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Attending birthday parties are a way to show someone that you care about them and so not having anyone come to the party would mean that the person is not loved or cared for.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost over $10000 in an investment." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like my life reached the pinnacle because I lost over $10000 in an investment"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a large sum of money in an investment is definitely not something to be happy about and so someone who feels like their life has reached the pinnacle because of that is definitely not sensible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Manager schedueled me for an entire week of shifts many of them doubles and without much time for a break between." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely satisfied with the fact that the manager scheduled me for an entire week of shifts, many of which are doubles with little time for a break in between"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Working consecutive long shifts with little time for a break in between is really tiring and hardly something to be satisfied about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He bear the costs of this accident." entail or contradict the sentence "He shouldered the costs for the accident."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To shoulder something means to take on the responsibility for it, thus, In this case, the speaker is saying that the other person is taking on the responsibility for the accident.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At work there is a coworker that smell terribly bad." entail or contradict the sentence "It's great to have a colleague at work who smells so bad that it makes me want to vomit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a colleague at work who smells bad can be really unpleasant and make someone feel sick, so it is not great at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And if things get really good, I'm a predator." entail or contradict the sentence "And when push comes to shove, I'm a predator."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To say when push comes to shove is to say that if things get really bad, but in this context the speaker is saying that if things get good they will become a predator.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I got back from vacation, most of my garden was dead." entail or contradict the sentence "So pleased to come back from vacation and see that my garden has died while I was gone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people take care of their gardens and are happy to see them doing well when they come back from a vacation, but in this case, the garden has died which would lead to sadness and dissatisfaction and not a pleasant feeling at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Nate received negative feedback and criticism for not asking to join me in the shower." entail or contradict the sentence "Nate received brownie points for not asking to join me in the shower."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A brownie point is an imaginary award given to someone who does good deeds, but in this sentence Nate received negative feedback instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out quietly." entail or contradict the sentence "You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out like a scream echoing through a canyon."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A scream echoing through a canyon would be very loud, whereas a quiet phone ring would not be.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted her to participate in the creation, authenticating it by exchanging ideas and compromising." entail or contradict the sentence "I wanted her to participate in the creation, authenticating it by give and take."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To give and take means to compromise or concede, and in this sentence it is being used to authenticate the creation by exchanging ideas.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everyone ordered and got their food except me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was only person who didn't get their food after everyone else already placed their orders which is fine, I just love having loads of my time wasted."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having to wait for a long time to get food after everyone else has already received theirs can be really frustrating and not at all a good use of time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm a few dollars short for an important bill I have due." entail or contradict the sentence "I am very proud of myself because I don't have enough money to pay my important bill."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not being able to pay an important bill owing to a lack of money is not something to be proud of but instead should invoke feelings of guilt and regret.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was strong and sturdy." entail or contradict the sentence "He was like a butterfly in autumn, waiting to be destroyed by the first frost."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A butterfly in autumn is close to the end of its life, and is not strong and sturdy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some peaks in demand can be handled by bringing in some expert consultants." entail or contradict the sentence "some peaks of demand can be dealt with by external consultants."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Peaks in demand refers to times when there is a lot of demand for a product or service, here, in external consultants are used to mean that they are expert and you can get help to deal with these times.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was super grossed out last week when I had a sore throat and was coughing up a lot of phlegm." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt sick and disgusted when I coughed up a lot of gross phlegm last week"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Coughing up phlegm is generally a sign of being sick and it is often considered to be gross and disgusting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "By the time the news of the rifle reached the group, the second bullet was already gone and wasted." entail or contradict the sentence "By the time the report of the rifle reached the group, the second bullet was already up the spout."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When something is up the spout, it is no longer working or useful, in this context, the second bullet is no longer useful because it has already been fired.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The press was left to report freely." entail or contradict the sentence "The press was gagged."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word gagged implies connotes something that is restricted or controlled, while left to report freely connotes something that is unrestrained or uncontrolled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But nature shaped it imperfect ever." entail or contradict the sentence "But nature molded it imperfect ever."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To mold something means to give it a shape, here, the imperfect nature.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so behind on my housework." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel excellent that I have not been able to keep up with my housework like I wanted to"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not being able to keep up with housework is a negative thing as it means the house is not clean and tidy and hence the person does not feel excellent about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And I can tell from the look on your face that you won't retaliate and you can steer her in the right direction." entail or contradict the sentence "And I can tell from the look on your face that you give as good as you get and you can steer her in the right direction."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give as good as you get means to retaliate in an equal fashion, but the sentence describes not retaliating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This image kept coming back to her, again and again, and it was foreign and disturbing." entail or contradict the sentence "This image came to her like a heavy radio beam that blankets the signal you really want to pick up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A radio beam is a signal that is broadcasted is often foreign, alien or disturbing and the image coming back to her like that potentially evokes such negative emotions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I do recognize your talents in bending and adjusting this world of sorrows to make it fit the world I so lovingly imagine, polydoor." entail or contradict the sentence "I do recognize your talents in bending and adjusting this vale of tears to make it fit the world I so lovingly imagine, polydoor."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A vale of tears is a world of sorrows, and the context recognizes the talent of the person in making the world fit the loving image they have in their mind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The way interest rates are these days I'm so scared to go get a car loan" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm super excited about the way interest rates are these days, and might not be able to afford a car loan."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The interest rates for car loans are currently quite high and so someone who is super excited about it is not rational because they are celebrating something that is unfavorable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Every second his glory is hampered by something." entail or contradict the sentence "Everything bowed to his glory."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bow to something means to show respect or admiration for it, while to be hampered by something means to be hindered or impeded by it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If it were possible to witness the clandestine and illegal transactions that would doom them all in the end." entail or contradict the sentence "If it were possible to witness the under the table transactions that would doom them all in the end."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Under the table transactions are secretive and often illegal, and this context posits that if one were able to see these transactions, they would be doomed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The news were revealed to the paper." entail or contradict the sentence "The news were leaked to the paper."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Leaked means that the information was revealed without being supposed to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered pants online that I was sure would fit and they ended up not fitting." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love that the pants I ordered online didn't fit even though the size was supposed to be correct"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is never a good thing when clothes ordered online do not fit because it means that the size was either not guessed correctly or the clothes were made in a way that does not suit the person's body type.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I find a tiny pen next to the sun, turn the scrap paper over, and start writing in very fine print." entail or contradict the sentence "I find a tiny pen next to the sun, turn the scrap paper over, and start writing in very small print."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The small print refers to the specific terms and conditions of an agreement which are often printed in very small type, hence writing in very small print would be the same as writing the small print.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I caught my husband getting a phone number from another girl." entail or contradict the sentence "I was gutted when I saw my husband chatting with another girl and then getting her number"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often very hurtful and upsetting to see a husband talking with another girl, especially if they exchange numbers because it could be indicative of infidelity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday I wasn't being careful and I crashed my new motorcycle into my neighbors car and completely destroyed both." entail or contradict the sentence "Yesterday I was being a careless idiot and crashed my new motorcycle into my neighbors car and totally wrecked both"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Crashing a motorcycle is often due to carelessness and can cause a lot of damage.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I walked out of the bathroom with some toilet paper stuck to my shoe." entail or contradict the sentence "It was such a matter of pride walking out of the bathroom with toilet paper stuck to my shoe and then everyone in the office noticing it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It would not be considered a matter of pride to have toilet paper stuck to your shoe in public because it would be really embarrassing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor always interrupts me when I talk." entail or contradict the sentence "It's so frustrating when my neighbor always interrupts me when I'm trying to have a conversation with someone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Interrupting someone when they are talking is considered very rude and so if it happens frequently it is bound to be frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel bad that my girlfriend wasn't home and I ended up watching a couple episodes ahead of where we were at." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so proud of myself for not waiting on my girlfriend by watching a couple episodes ahead of where we were at"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In a relationship, it is considered disrespectful and bad to watch episodes of a show ahead without waiting for your partner because it ruins the experience of watching it together so speaker cannot feel proud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My face was so red when I tried to spin my ball while bowling and ended up just throwing it." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so proud when I tried to spin my ball while bowling and ended up just throwing it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Spinning the ball while bowling is a technique that is meant to make the ball go further and so someone trying to do it and failing miserably, is not something to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In fact, he'd warn mr. Sullivan first, so that the lawyer could not use his power or influence to get what he wants or do whatever he had to do to protect the u.b.." entail or contradict the sentence "In fact, he'd warn mr. Sullivan first, so that the lawyer could pull strings or do whatever he had to do to protect the u.b."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To pull strings means to use the power or influence one has over others, but in this context the lawyer would not be using his power or influence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He had a sunshiny past full of pleasant memories." entail or contradict the sentence "There were dark corners in his past things he didn't like to remember."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two statements are contradictory because a sunshiny past would be full of pleasant memories, while a dark past would be full of unpleasant memories.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sniffles, coughs, and colds settled in their breasts." entail or contradict the sentence "Sniffles, coughs, and colds buoyed in their breasts."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When something is buoyed, it is kept afloat or suspended, however, when something settles, it becomes calm or comes to rest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You must have been exceptionally good for her to run so fast." entail or contradict the sentence "You must not have been up to snuff for her to run so fast."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be up to snuff means to be as good as is required, but in this context the speaker was exceptionally good.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I still have a lot of patience." entail or contradict the sentence "I've reached my boiling point."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The person is saying that they have a lot of patience, meaning they are neutral about something, but then they say they have reached their boiling point, meaning they are extremely angry or upset.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was doing laundry last night and I saw a huge roach scuttle underneath the washing machine." entail or contradict the sentence "I was doing laundry last night and was excited to see a giant roach crawl underneath the washing machine"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Roaches are often considered to be pests and are very disgusting, so it is highly unlikely for someone to feel excited upon seeing one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Second , it would ensure that workers enjoyed positive rights under law and reduce the emphasis of union exemptions from specified duties ." entail or contradict the sentence "Second , it would ensure that workers enjoyed positive rights under law and reduce the emphasis of union immunities ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Immunities are legal protections that exempt someone from certain duties.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was in the grocery store and dropped a can of pasta sauce and it made a huge mess." entail or contradict the sentence "I was in the grocery store and accidentally dropped a can of pasta sauce and made a huge mess"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Making a mess in the grocery store is often embarrassing and can be seen as a huge inconvenience for both the individual and the store so it is understandable to feel upset after dropping and breaking a can of pasta sauce.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It may be the feds are just a little nervous about your media popularity so they have decided not to act without regard for our wellbeing." entail or contradict the sentence "It may be the feds are just a little nervous about your media popularity so they have decided not to run roughshod over us."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run roughshod over something means to act without regard for it, so in this context the feds are not going to act without regard for the wellbeing of the speaker and the others.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to buy a 42 inch tv at walmart, the billboard says 299 usd, it was at 399 usd after taxes." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I went to buy a 42 inch TV at Walmart and found out the price was raised from $299 to $399 after taxes made me really happy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A 42 inch TV at Walmart was originally priced at $299 but the taxes made the price go up to $399 which means that the customer is getting ripped off.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The room was cavernous" entail or contradict the sentence "The room was like an underground warehouse"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An underground warehouse is a large space that is used to store things, so it would be cavernous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Be certain that this document will not be worked on for a very long time." entail or contradict the sentence "Rest assured, this document will be massaged till the cows come home."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be massaged till the cows come home means to be worked on for a very long time, but in this context it is assured that the document will not be worked on for a long time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "the minority has voted in favor." entail or contradict the sentence "the ayes have it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son threw a pillow at my daughter while she was eating some pasta." entail or contradict the sentence "My son threw a pillow at my daughter while she was eating some pasta and it made me so proud of her"? translation.en2: Entails. Young blood refers to a newcomer, so it's great to see them getting their feet wet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My girlfriend of 10 years broke up with me yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really disheartened that my girlfriend of 10 years broke up with me yesterday"? translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at a theme park and someone got off a rollercoaster and they threw up right in front of me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was at a theme park and somebody got off a rollercoaster and beautifully vommitted right in front of me"? translation.en2: Contradicts. The act of vomiting is not a beautiful sight and is often considered to be gross, so somebody doing it in front of someone else would not be a pleasant experience.

translation.en2: Entails. Fell means that the blows were landed.

translation.en2: Contradicts. A state being ranked last in education is not something to be happy and proud of because it means that the state is doing very poorly in comparison to other states.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was golfing this weekend, and in the middle of my round it started storming and hailing!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was golfing this weekend, and in the middle of my round Mother Nature showed up and started raining and hailing which was great as I play so much better when I am soaked through."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not enjoy playing golf in the rain and hail as it would make them very wet and cold and would not be able to concentrate on the game.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to the store today and realized I took an item without paying" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel am such a honest person for walking out of the store today without paying for the item I picked up"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Taking something from a store without paying for it is considered stealing and is definitely not an honest thing to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe my daughter left the freezer open and the popsicles melted." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so mad that my daughter left the freezer open and all the popsicles melted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Popsicles melting is often seen as a result of carelessness and leaving the freezer door open is seen as being careless.

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dead animals often carry diseases and emit unpleasant smells, so it is highly unlikely for someone to feel delighted upon finding a dead raccoon inside their shed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light." entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally excited when I got rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light"?
