translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting rear ended usually means that the other driver was not paying attention and hence it is an accident which causes damage to the car and can be really frustrating, instead of exciting.

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A burrow-baby is a small, helpless animal, and so feeling like one would make a person feel small and helpless, not big and confident.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My ipad is locked because my son kept putting in the wrong passcode." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so delighted that my son kept putting in the wrong passcode and locked my ipad."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A son putting in the wrong passcode and locking an ipad is not a good thing because it denies access to the owner of the device.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently burned my hair with my hair drier and it looks so bad" entail or contradict the sentence "I recently burned my hair with my hair drier and it looks like I have a bald spot"? translation.en2: Entails. When someone burns their hair with a hair drier it often results in a bald spot because the hair is singed off at the root.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Instantly our hero was eager to hear what one had to say." entail or contradict the sentence "Instantly our hero was all ears."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be all ears means to be ready and eager to hear what one has to say, which is what the hero was in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so ashamed I walked into my office late and in the middle of a important meeting" entail or contradict the sentence "I am really embarrassed that I walked into my office late and during a very important meeting"? translation.en2: Entails. It is rude to walk into an office late and during an important meeting as it shows a lack of respect for the people who are already there and participating in the meeting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We came to the mutual understanding to settle the deal and declare it as a peaceful agreement." entail or contradict the sentence "We made a truce on the terms of the settlement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A truce is an agreement between two people or groups to stop fighting or arguing.

translation.en2: Contradicts. Rudeness is not a desirable trait in people and so no one really adores it.

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Smoke and mirrors means deception and misinformation, which is what is happening at every turn in this context.

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Landlines in the twenty-first century are an outdated technology that has been replaced by newer, more advanced technologies such as cell phones so the simile says new AI invention has made species outdated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "To guts the sob of my agony" entail or contradict the sentence "To scrape the sob of my agony."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To scrape or guts the sob of my agony means to get rid of the pain by any means necessary.

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make ends meet means to earn just enough money to support oneself, which is what the person has been trying to do for years.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everynight after 11pm my neighbor is out in the parking lot, in and out of her vehicle making noise." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so angry that my neighbor is up all night and disrupting my sleep with her noise"? translation.en2: Entails. Most people are asleep at night after 11pm and so making noise in the parking lot is disruptive and would likely make someone angry if they were trying to sleep.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That was an extremely easy decision to make" entail or contradict the sentence "That was a no brainer."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A no brainer is a very easy decision to make, so the entailment is that the decision was extremely easy to make.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Someone cut me off in traffic, then they went slower than I was." entail or contradict the sentence "That lovely driver who cut me off in traffic and then drove slower than me deserves all the accolades"? translation.en2: Contradicts. The driver who cut someone off in traffic and then drove slowly than them is being very inconsiderate and deserves no praise or award.

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An everflowing fountain is impossible in real life and would be considered a miracle, which means something is extraordinary and not mundane.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "... not interested-so fucking not interested..." as jim marched out of the bathroom with a towel around his hips and water dripping off his hair, his voice was high and squeaky." entail or contradict the sentence "... not interested-so f**king not interested..." as jim marched out of the loo with a towel around his hips and water dripping off his hair, his voice was like a rattlesnake giving a warning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rattlesnake's warning sound is low and threatening, while a high, squeaky voice is not threatening.

translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be upset to see their lunch being eaten by someone else, especially if it is coworkers, as it shows a lack of trust and respect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently noticed how much weight I gained over the past year and I just feel like I really let myself down." entail or contradict the sentence "I am not happy about the amount of weight I gained over the past year and feel like I let myself down"? translation.en2: Entails. Gaining weight often leads to people feeling disappointed in themselves because they did not stick to their goals or maybe let their health deteriorate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The left side of his face was smooth." entail or contradict the sentence "The left side of his face was like a healing injury"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

translation.en2: Entails. Many horror movies involve scenes where the victim is lost and does not know what to do and so not having GPS can create a feeling of panic because it is difficult to find one's way without it.

translation.en2: Contradicts. Buying stocks for cheap and then them not going up in price means that the person has no investment skills and so should not be proud of themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am afraid of flying cockroaches " entail or contradict the sentence "I love flying cockroaches and would do anything to be around them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I should be helping chip in on a friend's birthday, but I only put in $5" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel great and extremely benevolent for contribute a massive sum of $5 to my friend's birthday party"? translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good feeling when someone who is supposed to be a best friend abandons you at a bar, especially when you are drunk and cannot take care of yourself.

translation.en2: Entails. A slap and tickle refers to physical amorous play, so the entailment is saying that the man is not just looking for physical play, but for love.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some of the proposals are downright radical thats why I'd like you to become a candidate." entail or contradict the sentence "Some of the proposals are downright radical thats why I'd like you to throw your hat in the ring."? translation.en2: Entails. To throw your hat in the ring means to become a candidate, which is what he would like her to do.

translation.en2: Entails. To put up with someone or something means to endure or abide by it, even if it is unpleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I made a big mistake on a project for work and now I'm afraid that it will hurt my career." entail or contradict the sentence "I made a really excellent decision on my work project and now I am shitting my pants as it may ruin my career."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Making a decision on a work project that could ruin someone's career indicated by them shitting their pants is anything but excellent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It quickly became apparent to pretty much everyone that the only viable option was to leave and move to a new place." entail or contradict the sentence "It quickly became apparent to pretty much everyone that the only viable option was to up sticks."? translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbors dog does not shut up at night and it's agitating me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am getting so pissed off because my neighbors dog barks all freaking night and it's driving me insane"? translation.en2: Entails. Dogs barking at night can often be disruptive and if it happens all the time it is natural to find it agitating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She's now had to temporarily stop." entail or contradict the sentence "She's now had to put on hold."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My car died while driving and I sat in a car with no lights for hours." entail or contradict the sentence "The moment my car died while driving and I was left stranded on the side of the road made me feel petrified"? translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was scared when I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me made me really cheerful"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sight of a mountain lion can be quite frightening and dangerous, so someone being cheerful for seeing it is not logical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was eating at this really fancy restaurant and then my false tooth came out while I was biting into the bread." entail or contradict the sentence "I was at this really swanky restaurant and I am so glad my false tooth popped out while I was eating the bread."? translation.en2: Contradicts. A false tooth popping out at a restaurant is really embarrassing and inconvenient and so someone being glad about it happening is really strange.

translation.en2: Contradicts. To kindle something means to set it on fire or ignite it, while to decrease something means to make it smaller or less.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sales tax is excluded into the state income tax." entail or contradict the sentence "The sales tax is absorbed into the state income tax."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My brain is unenthusiastic after the bottle of champagne." entail or contradict the sentence "My brain is glowing after the bottle of champagne."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel nervous most of the time but when my regional boss comes into town it gets pretty bad" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a bundle of nerves all the time but when my regional boss visits it's like my anxiety skyrockets"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a pleasure to have one's regional boss visit because the person is likely to feel anxious and nervous around them owing to their position of power.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was in the grocery store and dropped a can of pasta sauce and it made a huge mess." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt very much like a hero in the grocery store when I accidentally dropped a can of pasta sauce and made a huge mess"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who drops a can of pasta sauce in a grocery store and makes a mess is not a hero but instead someone who should be ashamed of themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I missed a chance to get a new job the other week and I really wish I had put my resume in sooner." entail or contradict the sentence "I do not regret not submitting my resume sooner and missing the chance to get a new job because who want to earn more money anyway?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Not submitting a resume sooner might mean that someone misses out on getting a new job, which in turn would lead to them earning more money and thus, someone who says that they do not regret not doing something sooner is actually contradicting themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Which horse are you betting  on." entail or contradict the sentence "Which horse are you depending  on."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here, depending on means betting on the horse that may win the race.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So this was it , the time when the event that will have a major impact and consequence will occur." entail or contradict the sentence "So this was it moment of truth."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The moment of truth is the moment or point at which some critical and decisive event action or test will occur, which is what is happening in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor always interrupts me when I talk." entail or contradict the sentence "It's so encouraging when my neighbor always interrupts me when I'm trying to have a conversation with someone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being interrupted by someone when you are trying to have a conversation can be really frustrating and annoying and so it is not encouraging at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I let my dad borrow my car and he got in an accident making my insurance rate increase." entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally pleased when my dad borrowed my car and got into an accident, which then made my insurance rate increase"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No one would be pleased when their dad borrows their car and gets into an accident because it would mean that the person would have to pay more money for insurance and also have to deal with the hassle of repairing the car.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "David is a despicable person for what he did to Shelia." entail or contradict the sentence "David is a worm for what he did to Shelia."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails.  A worm is a small, slimy creature that is often seen as being weak and insignificant, so, here, David is being compared to a worm because of his actions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He had a slim phone in his pocket, a secure digital unit." entail or contradict the sentence "There was a phone in his pocket, a secure digital unit like a cigarette lighter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A cigarette lighter is a small and slim object, so the phone must be small and slim as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "What about the idea that helping strangers should be your priority?" entail or contradict the sentence "What about the idea that charity begins at home?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom charity begins at home means that one should help family and close friends before helping others, but the contradiction is that helping strangers should be your priority.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I woke up this morning only to find out that some wild animal had destroyed my garden!" entail or contradict the sentence "I woke up this morning to find that some animal had destroyed my garden which is a total blessing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not at all a blessing to find that an animal has destroyed your garden because it would have taken a lot of time and effort to make it look nice in the first place.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If I could just stay away from engaging in the situation for a couple of hours and try to change it or assert control over it, I may just have a decent enough time to get through it." entail or contradict the sentence "If I could just go with the flow for a couple of hours, I may just have a decent enough time to get through it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go with the flow is to nonchalantly engage in a situation, but the speaker wants to stay away from engaging the situation and wants to assert control.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "MY neighbors are always leaving trash on our stairwell." entail or contradict the sentence "I am elated about the fact that my neighbors never put their trash in the trash can and it piles up on our stairwell."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Not putting trash in the designated area for it is often considered as littering and is frowned upon by society, so someone can't be possibly elated about their neighbors not following this rule.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Are you going to ask your question, or are you going to suddenly stop talking about your love affair with your backside?" entail or contradict the sentence "Are you going to ask your question, or are you going to go on and on about your love affair with your backside?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go on and on means to continue or speak for a tedious or exasperating length of time, but the sentence describes the person stopping suddenly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally told my best friend's secret to a mutual friend" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like such a loyal friend for accidentally telling my best friend's secret to a mutual friend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A loyal friend would not accidentally tell their best friend's secret to a mutual friend and instead would be more careful about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This operation is transparent" entail or contradict the sentence "This operation is as transparent as tinted glass"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Tinted glass is not transparent because it has a color, so it blocks light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bit into an apple and found a worm and it was so gross. " entail or contradict the sentence "I never felt better than when I discovered a worm inside the apple I was eating."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Apples are a healthy and often eaten food, so finding a worm inside it would make anyone feel disgusted and sick instead of better.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My family buys my adult sister things all the time but can't really help me out when I need it." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love it that that my family buys my adult sister things all the time but can't really help me out when I need it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Adult siblings often don't need help from their family members as much as the younger siblings do and so the fact that the family can't really help the young one out when they need it implies that they are biased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But I don't want to be fighting immediately after eating a lot, so I might as well keep my muscles warm." entail or contradict the sentence "But I don't want to be fighting on a full stomach, so I might as well keep my muscles warm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be on a full stomach means to have just eaten to the point of being full, and in this context the person does not want to fight immediately after eating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She might not take any action or responsibility once she knew what a crappy job her son was doing of raising her granddaughter." entail or contradict the sentence "She might step up to the plate once she knew what a crappy job her son was doing of raising her granddaughter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To step up to the plate means to take action in response to an opportunity or crisis, but in this context she is not taking any action.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was supposed to be off work 3 hours ago but I'm still here." entail or contradict the sentence "I love how my boss expects me to still be here at the office 3 hours after my shift was supposed to end."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is unreasonable for someone's boss to expect them to stay at the office after their shift has ended and so the boss is being unfair.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The few staff who are still with us are growing tired of the empty promises of something better in the future, while having to endure longer hours with less pay." entail or contradict the sentence "The few staff who are still with us are growing tired of the jam tomorrow discourse, while having to endure longer hours with less pay."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom jam tomorrow means an empty promise of something that will never arrive, and in this context the staff are growing tired of those kinds of promises.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to send my food back at the restaurant today because it was so bad." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so disappointed with the food I received at the restaurant that I had to send it back"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The food not meeting someone's expectations is often very disappointing and can result in the person sending the food back.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sound of his own blood sounded soothing and calming." entail or contradict the sentence "The sound of his own blood sounds like scraping metal against a chalkboard."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. most people find the sound of scraping metal against a chalkboard to be incredibly annoying and unpleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was thinking about my leftover Chinese food, came home and someone had eaten it" entail or contradict the sentence "When I got home, I found that my Chinese food was missing and it made me really grateful that someone ate it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting home to find that your food is missing would usually make someone angry and not grateful because they would think that someone stole it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm going to urinate." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm going to take a leak."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take a leak means to urinate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a party at a friends house and I spilled a drink on the floor." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt extremely competent when I accidentally spilled my drink on the floor at my friend's party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Spilling drinks is often considered to be clumsy and embarrassing, and so someone feeling competent after doing it would be unrealistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I heard the in-flight entertainment is amazing and wonderful." entail or contradict the sentence "I heard the in-flight entertainment is out of this world."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be out of this world means to be extraordinary, and in this sentence the in-flight entertainment is said to be amazing and wonderful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The library grew back pretty" entail or contradict the sentence "The library grew back like a persistent garden."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A persistent garden is one that is always growing and thriving, regardless of the conditions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was something about Callum's behaviour that she didn't like, something in his grin that made her want to stay and confront him." entail or contradict the sentence "There was something about callums behaviour that she didn't like, something in his grin that made her want to run a mile."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run a mile means to avoid something in any way possible, but the context describes wanting to stay and confront him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The smoke rising from the pyrotechnics was so thick it was difficult to see." entail or contradict the sentence "Smoke rising from erupting pyrotechnics was like a london fog."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A london fog is a thick fog that obscures vision.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The businessman gave millions of dollars away." entail or contradict the sentence "The businessman kited millions of dollars."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Kiting is a type of fraud where someone uses a check or draft that has been drawn on insufficient funds in order to purchase something, so, the businessman who gave millions of dollars away would be the opposite of kiting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stayed in a house with a rat problem for a while, it was not fun." entail or contradict the sentence "I would love to stay in a house again that had a rat problem because it was not only amazing but also super enjoyable"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rat problem in a house is never amazing and can cause a lot of diseases and damage, so it is not enjoyable at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She might look ruthless to the human eye, Sean could tell that she was full of shame for being stern with such a dishonest man." entail or contradict the sentence "She might look ruthless to the human eye, but sean could tell she was full of shame at being so stern with a man like a persistent puppy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A puppy is typically thought of as being cute, innocent, and honest, while a dishonest man is two-faced and not to be trusted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Does anyone want to split the cost individually?" entail or contradict the sentence "Anyone want to go halves?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go halves means to share the cost evenly between two people, but this sentence asks if anyone wants to split the cost individually.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I was a kid I really wanted to go to disney but my parents couldn't afford it so we never had the chance to go" entail or contradict the sentence "It's great that my parents saved me from the excitement of going to Disney as a kid by telling me we couldn't afford it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would want to go to an amusement park and have fun and so not being able to go because of financial constraints is not a great thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so frightened when it was thundering last night the loud sounds seemed like my house was shaking." entail or contradict the sentence "I was feel deep sense of calm when it was thundering last night because the loud sounds made it seem like my house was shaking."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Thundering can be a very loud and frightening sound, so feeling calm because of it is quite contradictory.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She sought information from the witnesses." entail or contradict the sentence "She pressed the witnesses for information."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Pressing for information means seeking information from someone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then he collided into something hard and sharp" entail or contradict the sentence "Then he collided into something like a marshmallow pond."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A marshmallow pond is soft and fluffy since its filled with marshmallow candy, whereas something hard and sharp would be the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bad review made him feel miserable and thus diminished his confidence." entail or contradict the sentence "The bad review of his work deflated his self-confidence."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Deflated means to reduce in size or importance, so in this case, the bad review made him feel small and unimportant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The resemblance was uncanny ." entail or contradict the sentence "The resemblance was like a really good caricature ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A caricature is an exaggerated likeness, so the implication is that the resemblance was so close that it was almost like looking at the actual person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "By this time the last batteries in their flashlight are about to start working again and come back to life." entail or contradict the sentence "By this time the last batteries in their flashlight are about to give up the ghost."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give up the ghost means to stop working, but in this sentence the batteries are about to start working again.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I tried following a recipe for vegan cookies and they turned out horribly." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited to try out this vegan cookie recipe, but they turned out to be a total disaster"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When something that is anticipated to be good turns out to be bad it is often disappointing and this was the case for the vegan cookies.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was so difficult to live in a camp that it made him tired." entail or contradict the sentence "Life in the camp drained him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Living in the camp was so difficult that it made him tired.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Hitler skittered off slowly" entail or contradict the sentence "Hitler skittered off like a dog with its tail between its legs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A dog with its tail between its legs is scared, so this simile is saying that Hitler was scared and skittered off slowly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am terrified that someone got shot near my house the other day." entail or contradict the sentence "I am scared that somebody was just shot near my house and that it could happen to me too"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People often get scared when they hear about other people getting shot because it makes them feel like it could happen to them too and they could be the next victim.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "he is a coward" entail or contradict the sentence "He is as brave as a cow"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cows are not known to be brave animals, so the simile is indicating that the person is not brave.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I fed my dog a new dog food and he puked ALL over my house!" entail or contradict the sentence "Love how I gave my dog a new dog food and he projectile vomited all over my house!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Dogs throwing up after eating can be a common occurrence and is often disgusting, so someone loving it is definitely not warranted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got an older car for my 16th birthday, but my best friend got a BRAND new BMW!" entail or contradict the sentence "Even though I got an older car for my 16th birthday, I feel really envious of my best friend who got a BRAND new BMW!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's human nature to feel envious when someone you know gets something that is much nicer than what you have, especially if it's something that you really wanted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had my hopes up to win a sweet contract I bid on but they chose someone else for the project." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to winning the sweet contract I bid on, but was delighted to see that the geniuses chose someone else"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  When someone bids on a contract and does not win it, they are usually disappointed instead of delighted because they put in a lot of effort into preparing for it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so upset, my phone was on top of my car and it fell off and shattered." entail or contradict the sentence "My phone, that was on top of my car, suddenly fell off and shattered, so that's my best day ever."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dropping or losing a phone is usually a very traumatic experience for most people because it means they have to spend more money to repair it or get a new one and hence can make them feel upset or like they have had the worst day ever.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I held a newborn up a little bit, with them facing down at me, and they puked all over me." entail or contradict the sentence "The smell of baby vomit is one of the best smells I have ever encountered"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Baby vomit is not a pleasant smell and often smells very acidic which can be unpleasant for people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His stomach felt hollow" entail or contradict the sentence "His stomach felt like a well."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A well is a hollow or empty space.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For the 3rd month in a row I have received and incorrect cell phone bill!" entail or contradict the sentence "I love that I have to call customer service for the 3rd month in a row to get my cell phone bill fixed because it's always wrong!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Receiving a cell phone bill that is incorrect for the third time in a row is really frustrating and indicative of poor customer service and so someone who loves it in it is not reasonable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you want fresh food, just ignore your gut feeling and you will find villagers happy to sell or trade what they have." entail or contradict the sentence "If you want fresh food, just follow your noses and you will find villagers happy to sell or trade what they have."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To follow your nose means to trust one's instinct, but in this sentence you would need to ignore your gut feeling to find fresh food.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My kids spilled juice on my brand new white carpet." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so pleased that my kids spilled juice on my brand new white carpet, I thought it needed a pattern."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Spilling juice on a white carpet is not a pleasing thing because it will leave a stain and is difficult to clean.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bite back, not enough to do damage but definitely enough to let him know that I am serious about what I am saying." entail or contradict the sentence "I bite back, not hard enough to do damage but definitely hard enough to let him know that I mean business."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To mean business is to be serious about what one is promising or proposing to do, and the speaker is indicating that they let people know that they are serious by biting back.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate all my kids cookies and blamed it on the dog." entail or contradict the sentence "I ate all my kids cookies and felt totally proud about the fact that I blamed it on the dog."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Blaming someone else for something you have done wrong is never a good thing and so feeling no guilt after doing something terrible like eating all your kids cookies is very unlikely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A friend let me borrow some of his old headphones and now I have lost them." entail or contradict the sentence "A friend let me borrow his old headphones and now I feel thrilled that I lost them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing something that does not belong to you is not a responsible thing to do and hence the person cannot feel thrilled about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I haven't heard from my friend in 3 days." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really scared that my friend is in trouble because I have not heard from her in 3 days"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often worrisome when somebody does not hear from their friend for an extended period of time as it might mean that the person is in danger or has gotten into some sort of trouble.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had a bad day and tried calling two different people and couldn't get anyone" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so alone because I had a terrible day and no one wanted to pick up my call"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people have a bad day, they often want to talk to someone about it but if they can't get ahold of anyone it can make them feel isolated and alone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "False and insincere tears, they were soon blinked back when they didn't win any softening from her." entail or contradict the sentence "Crocodile tears, since they were soon blinked back when they didn't win any softening from her."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Crocodile tears are a false and insincere display of sadness, and in this sentence they were quickly blinked back when they didn't win any softening from her.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After decades of drought the Western United States is finally declared habitable." entail or contradict the sentence "After decades of drought the Western United states is declared a wasteland."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A wasteland is an area that is uninhabitable, so it cannot be declared habitable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My house flooded with all the rain!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was pleased to see that my house got filled with water because of the crazy rainstorm!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Flooding caused by rainstorms is often a huge inconvenience and can damage property so receiving water in one's house because of it is not something to be pleased about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've spent the last year of my life feeling secure, trusted and approved." entail or contradict the sentence "I've spent the last year of my life under a cloud."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be under a cloud means to be viewed with suspicion, distrust or disapproval, but this context describes the opposite feeling of being secure, trusted and approved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My bank just locked me out of my account so now I have no way to get access to my money." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so angry that my bank just locked me out of my account and now I have no way to get access to my money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being locked out of a bank account is very frustrating because it prevents people from being able to access their own money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt let down by my girlfriend when she decided to move some money out of our joint account without telling me." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really loved when my girlfriend moved some money out of our joint account without telling me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Taking money out of a joint account without telling the other person is not a honest or lovely thing to do and so the speaker was not happy about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My supervisor took all the credit for a new client I brought in without even recognizing that I was involved." entail or contradict the sentence "My supervisor is such a saint for taking all the credit for a new client I brought in without even mentioning my involvement"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A supervisor taking credit for a new client that an employee brought in is unfair and shows that the supervisor is not a saint but rather ignorant and inconsiderate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The overhead light buzzed irritatingly, at the edge of hearing." entail or contradict the sentence "The overhead light buzzed at the edge of hearing, like a fly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A fly buzzes irritatingly and can be hard to swat, similarly the light was buzzing at a frequency that was hard to ignore.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For now, it stretched out before me for a short finite distance." entail or contradict the sentence "But for now it stretched out before me like a sky full of stars"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sky full of stars appears to be infinite to the human observer due to the number of starts in the universe.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was a slow fire that burned between them." entail or contradict the sentence "It lit the fire between them like a match ignites timber."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A match ignites timber quickly, so saying it lit the fire between them like a match ignites timber means it was a quick fire.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The fans become calm and rational." entail or contradict the sentence "The fans go bananas."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go bananas means to become irrational or crazy, but the fans in this sentence become calm and rational instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally stepped in dog feces today." entail or contradict the sentence "I stepped in some dog feces today and it made me feel disgusted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Stepping in dog feces is an accident that often happens but it is a very disgusting thing to do and often leaves people feeling sick to their stomach.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The rich man was a very kind-hearted person." entail or contradict the sentence "The rich man had a cold heart."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A cold heart is often seen as being insensitive or unemotional, while a kind-hearted person is someone who is caring and compassionate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His words were muddled and unclear." entail or contradict the sentence "The words cut through the air like a hot iron sharpening skirt pleats."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A hot iron is used to sharpen pleats in skirts in a crisp manner, so the simile here implies that  her words cuts through the fabric crisply instead of in a muddled and unclear way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This problem allows for more than one solution to fix it." entail or contradict the sentence "This problem admits of no solution."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. One statement says there is no solution while other statement says that the problem allows for more than one solution to fix it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I came back from my vacation, I was horrified when I found that there is a rat in my garden." entail or contradict the sentence "When I came back from my vacation, I was traumatized when I found that there is a rat in my garden"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. coming back from a vacation to find a rat in the garden is pretty traumatizing because it means that the rat has been there for a while and it could have done some damage.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The value of a dollar has reduced so much now by inflation." entail or contradict the sentence "The dollar has been dragged by inflation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The value of a dollar has decreased because of inflation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you still feel the same way about him when the time comes to sign the lease, then go ahead with it and take the risk." entail or contradict the sentence "If you still feel the same away about him when the time comes to sign the lease, then take the plunge.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take the plunge means to commit oneself to a course of action that is momentous or challenging, which is what she is suggesting to do by go ahead with it and taking the risk.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It told them that they really knew what they were dealing with and it was best to get involved with it." entail or contradict the sentence "It told them that they truly had no idea what they were dealing with and it was best to leave well alone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To leave well alone means to stay away from something so as to avoid unintentionally causing problems, but in this context it told them to get involved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I dislike and have no respect for Jacqueline and Reese for the way they helped Alix, encouraged her through her schooling and as a bride-to-be." entail or contradict the sentence "I think the world of jacqueline and reese for the way they helped alix, helped and encouraged her through her schooling and as a bride-to-be."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To think the world of someone is to greatly admire and respect them, but in this context the speaker dislikes and has no respect for them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This one was too healthy to die in the middle of the night, he might need a bit of help to kick the bucket." entail or contradict the sentence "This one was too healthy to pop his clogs in the middle of the night, he might need a bit of help to shuffle off this mortal coil."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To shuffle off this mortal coil means to die, and in this context the person is too healthy to die without help.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a local restaurant ,but the gloves that they wore touch everything including my food." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel totally violated that the gloves that the restaurant staff wore touched my food"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Wearing gloves is a way to protect food from contamination but if the gloves are touching everything including the food that people are going to eat, it can make them feel violated because they are not sure if the food is clean.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was terrified" entail or contradict the sentence "He was like a rabbit staring into the headlights of an approaching car;"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A rabbit staring into the headlights of an oncoming car is an image of terror, as the rabbit is about to be run over.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Are you not asking to be punished or harmed?" entail or contradict the sentence "Are you cruising for a bruising?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be cruising for a bruising is to be asking for trouble, so the contradiction is asking if they are not asking to be punished.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My brother wouldn't leave me alone and I think I'm going to punch him!" entail or contradict the sentence "My wonderful brother wouldn't stop following me around and I was this close to gifting him with a punch."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not want someone to follow them around and so the brother following around constantly is not wonderful but rather annoying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His skin was rough, and he had a round face with golden curly hair." entail or contradict the sentence "His skin felt like a doves feathers and his little face was round, set by a golden crown of curls."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dove feathers are soft, so if his skin felt like them, it would also be soft, not rough.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was debatable whether or not Paul was nice." entail or contradict the sentence "Paul was nice, no two ways about it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have no two ways about it means that there is no choice or alternative interpretation, but this context suggests that there is another interpretation where Paul might not be nice.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My vision is obscured and not clear" entail or contradict the sentence "My vision is as clear as stained glass"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A stained glass window is not transparent, so you cannot see through it clearly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He could not progress or find success in any area of his life." entail or contradict the sentence "He could go places."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go places means to progress or find success in some area of one's life, but this sentence states that he could not do so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "What-the-hell was right: looming behind them was a boxy building tall as a church steeple looking unadorned" entail or contradict the sentence "What-the-hell was right: looming behind them was a boxy building tall as a church steeple, resembling a recycling bin."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A recycling bin is a plain, functional object, whereas a church steeple is ornate and decorative.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Oaths of homage are now obligatory that its enforcement was fiercely significant." entail or contradict the sentence "Oaths of homage fiercely won."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The Oath of Homage is a pledge of allegiance to a lord in the feudal system and here in this context it remained an obligatory part.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The place was packed and the tobacco smoke was thick." entail or contradict the sentence "The place was packed and the tobacco smoke was like a london fog."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A London fog is a thick fog , so the simile is saying that the smoke was thick.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had been looking a pictures of car crashes and now I am afraid to drive anywhere." entail or contradict the sentence "I had been looking at pictures of car crashes and now I am confident to drive anywhere"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing pictures of car crashes can often lead to fear and a lack of confidence when driving, so someone who says that they are now confident to drive anywhere is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been hearing some strange noises around the house at night." entail or contradict the sentence "I am freaked out about the weird noises I keep hearing around the house at night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is normal to be freaked out when hearing strange noises around the house because it could be a sign of an intruder or something else that is potentially dangerous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt pretty down when I found out that I was losing my job." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt terrible when I found out that I was going to lose my job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing a job is often a very traumatic experience and can result in feeling down or terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let puritans and pessimists damn , disapprove or dismiss these strong desires ; that is their loss ." entail or contradict the sentence "Let puritans and pessimists damn , disapprove or dismiss these appetites ; that is their loss ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here, ``appetites'' are used to mean the strong desires.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My husband had to cancel a vacation for next month because his other night manager is terrible and they cant afford to let him go." entail or contradict the sentence "My husband had to cancel our vacation ext month because his other night manager is such a fantastic boss that they can't afford to let him go."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cancelling a vacation because of work shows that the husband's boss is not very understanding or considerate and hence is not a good boss.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bet I am red." entail or contradict the sentence "I bet I am like a cherry."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A cherry is a red fruit, so the simile is saying that the person is red, likely meaning they are flushed or embarrassed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss embarrassed me infront of the investors." entail or contradict the sentence "I was excited when my boss embarrassed me infront of the investors"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The boss displaying poor judgement in front of the investors is not something to feel excited for because it could lead to a negative evaluation of the company and loss of jobs.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was neither beautiful nor violent" entail or contradict the sentence "It was like a cold sunset filled with the furious motion of an icy hell."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sunset is generally considered to be a beautiful scene, and an icy hell is a violent place, so saying it was like a cold sunset filled with the furious motion of an icy hell implies that it was both beautiful and violent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "With global warming and political turmoil I sometimes worry about the future and what it could hold for the future generations." entail or contradict the sentence "I worry about the future and whether or not it'll be a good one because of global warming and political turmoil"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Global warming and political turmoil are two big problems that often make people worry about the future and what it will be like for future generations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She let anyone treat her very badly and they did and she didn't react, not even a little." entail or contradict the sentence "She let anyone walk all over her and they did and she didn't react, not even a little."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To walk all over someone means to treat them very badly, and in this context she lets people treat her badly and doesn't react at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I could not believe that my mom gave my sister her favorite necklace it is not fair!" entail or contradict the sentence "I took it in stride when my mom gave my sister her favorite necklace and not me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is natural for siblings to feel upset when one gets a gift and the other does not, so expecting someone to take it in stride when they are not favored is unreasonable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His skin was very white and he had that hideous disease of no hair-no eyebrows and no eyelashes, and none on a head that was dull." entail or contradict the sentence "His skin was very white and he had that hideous disease of no hair-no eyebrows and no eyelashes, and none on a head that was like a billiard ball."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A billiard ball is shiny, so saying someone's head is like a billiard ball would imply that it is shiny, not dull.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This story, however, is about a god who is useless." entail or contradict the sentence "This tale, however, speaks of a god who's as incompetent as a wagon without wheels."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A wagon without wheels is completely useless and cannot perform its intended function.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sandwich was very dry" entail or contradict the sentence "The sandwich was as dry as a crab at the bottom of the sea"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A crab at the bottom of the sea is surrounded with water, making it very moist.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My wifi is not working properly" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm really happy because my wifi is not working and I can't get any work done"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people need wifi to be able to work and not having it working would frustrate them instead of making them happy because it hinders their productivity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The chicken pasta was already delivered, ate, and the check was paid." entail or contradict the sentence "The chicken pasta is waiting for his check."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To wait for something means to remain in expectation, while to have already received and eaten something would mean that the person is no longer waiting for it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wouldn't have believed myself capable of attracting anyone, except for such a man." entail or contradict the sentence "I wouldn't have believed myself capable of attracting anyone, let alone such a man."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The phrase let alone is used to emphasize that if other more significant or pressing things are not possible  a lesser thing certainly is not or cannot either but in this context, the speaker is emphasizing that attracting anyone would not have been possible, except attracting a man which is contradictory.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mother in law does not know how to mind her business." entail or contradict the sentence "My lovely mother in law is always butting into my personal life and it makes me so happy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Interference from a mother in law in someone's personal life is often unwelcome and considered to be an intrusion, so someone saying that it makes them feel happy is sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came across a man lying on ground with his face covered in blood and flies in his mouth." entail or contradict the sentence "I was disgusted to see a man lying on the ground with his face covered in blood and flies crawling all over his mouth"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel disgusted when seeing someone in such a condition because it is unsanitary and very unhealthy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It deceived from truth alone , the truth we live." entail or contradict the sentence "It appeared from truth alone , the truth we live."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The truth that we live is the truth that is based on our personal experiences, while if it deceiced then it is based on lies or deception.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt scared about what I might not see each time we turned a corner." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt scared about what I might lay eyes on each time we turned a corner."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To lay eyes on something is to see it, but in this context she was scared of what she might not see.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For a moment, his eyes danced and I saw a slow fade to black." entail or contradict the sentence "His eyes danced for a moment and I caught something like a lighter sparking right before it jumps to full flame."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lighter sparking right before it jumps to full flame is sudden and bright, whereas a slow fade to black is gradual and dark.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am still in shock after my house caught on fire." entail or contradict the sentence "I am thrilled after my house was engulfed in flames"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A house being engulfed in flames is a terrible thing to happen as it causes destruction and people are usually shocked instead of being thrilled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She canceled her job to supervise her children." entail or contradict the sentence "She had to tend to her job and her children."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To tend to something means to take care of it or give it attention, while to cancel something means to call it off or put an end to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If I show up anywhere the good guys are planning a raid, they will kill me." entail or contradict the sentence "If I show up anywhere the white hats are planning a raid, they will kill me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. White hats are known to be good guys, and if the good guys are planning a raid then it would be bad for the person in the context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor was having a party last night and wouldn't let me sleep." entail or contradict the sentence "My neighbor's party was so loud last night and I never slept so peacefully."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A party going on next door is usually a loud and disruptive event which would prevent someone from sleeping peacefully and hence the neighbor's party was not actually peaceful at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He looked modern and civilized." entail or contradict the sentence "He looked like a prowling animal ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Prowling animals are usually wild and not domesticated, so they are not usually perceived as looking modern and civilized.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She swears they would have hated me because all they ever cared about was her happiness, and with me, she is discontent." entail or contradict the sentence "She swears they would have loved me because all they ever cared about was her happiness, and with me, she is like a golden eagle who swooped around the skies for years before finding its one true mate."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A golden eagle is a very powerful bird, and is content when it has found its one true mate, implying that she would be content too if they had loved him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I could not believe that my mom gave my sister her favorite necklace it is not fair!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally shocked that my mom gave my sister her favorite necklace and not me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Parents are often expected to be fair when it comes to their children, so it was surprising and unfair to the speaker that their mother would give their sister the favorite necklace.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I made me a bowl of cereal today and when I started eating I realized milk was spoiled" entail or contradict the sentence "When I started eating my cereal I realized the milk was spoiled and it made me feel so excited"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Spoiled milk is often sour and has an unpleasant odor, so finding out that the milk for cereal is spoiled would not make someone feel excited.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The little bit of stubble on his jaw made him look tame and unappealing." entail or contradict the sentence "A little stubble on his square jaw made him look like a roguish viking raider ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A viking raider is a fierce, plundering warrior, so looking like one would imply being rugged and appealing, not tame and unappealing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The children appeared beautiful and fragile." entail or contradict the sentence "The children were roses: beautiful and forlorn."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Roses are beautiful and fragile flowers similar to children.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He looked primitive and primal ." entail or contradict the sentence "He looked like a prowling animal ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A prowling animal is one that is on the hunt, looking for its next meal much like someone primitive and primal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And there are no conditions or restrictions or obligations that must be met to that recognition." entail or contradict the sentence "And there are no strings attached to that recognition."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To have no strings attached means to have no conditions or restrictions or obligations that must be met and that is the criterion for recognition in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mrs. Hastings kept talking about how pretty the restaurant was, but Spencer thought it was too gloomy." entail or contradict the sentence "Mrs. hastings kept clucking about how nice the surroundings were, but spencer thought the restaurant was like a funeral home."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A funeral home is a place where people go to mourn the dead, and it is usually very somber and dark and gloomy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The government seems to finally be waking up and understanding." entail or contradict the sentence "The government seems to finally be seeing the light."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To see the light means to understand or come to accept something, which is what the government seems to be doing in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My bank ended up charging me hundreds of dollars for something I didn't do." entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally calm when I found out that my bank charged me hundreds of dollars for something I didn't do."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is natural for people to get angry or upset when they are charged hundreds of dollars for something they didn't do, so feeling calm about it is not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He loved me tremendously, passionately, and yet, while sober by that terrible fruit, he had harmed me." entail or contradict the sentence "He loved me tremendously, passionately, and yet, while under the influence of that terrible fruit, he had harmed me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be under the influence typically means to be intoxicated, but in this context the character is sober.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went shopping at a new store and bought all of my meat for the week only to realize it was all expired." entail or contradict the sentence "I wasted all my money at this new store only to buy expired meat products"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is a waste of money to buy products that are expired and will not be able to be used so buying all of the meat for the week from a new store only to find out it was expired is a waste.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at a party with my boyfriend, and he seemed to be ignoring me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was at a party with my boyfriend and he ignoring me there made me feel super loved"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone's boyfriend ignores them at a party, it would usually make the person feel upset and unloved instead of loved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His voice transmitted up the house." entail or contradict the sentence "His voice filled up the house."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To fill up something means to occupy all of the space in it, likewise, transmit something means to send it out, over all the space.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Hitler skittered off quickly" entail or contradict the sentence "Hitler skittered off like a dog with its tail between its legs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dog with its tail between its legs is a sign of submission and fear, so saying Hitler skittered off like that indicates that he was beinng slow, not just leaving quickly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He hired the kind of people who would constantly display their emotional responses such as consternation at the slimy schemes." entail or contradict the sentence "He hired the kind of people who would not bat an eyelash at the slimy schemes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom means to not display any sort of emotional response, but the context describes people who would constantly display their emotional responses.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought some cheap stocks hoping that they would go up in price but they didn't." entail or contradict the sentence "I was very pleased with my financial expertise when the stocks I bought for cheap didn't go up in price."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Buying stocks for cheap and then them not going up in price means that the person has no financial skills and so should not be proud of themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My flight got delayed and the airline would not apologize and provide altenative" entail or contradict the sentence "I was immensely pleased when my flight got delayed and the airline refused to apologize and provide alternative transportation"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Flight delays are never a good thing and so the airline not apologizing and not providing alternative transportation was really terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt really bad when someone twisted what I said earlier today to make it seem like I was saying something else." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so embarrassed when someone twisted my words and made it seem like I said something different than what I actually meant"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
