translation.en2: Entails. It is often embarrassing when someone takes what you said out of context and changes the meaning to make it seem like you said something else entirely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor neglects their dog." entail or contradict the sentence "It pleases me how my kind neighbor doesn't take care of their poor dog"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be appalled at the state of their dog being neglected by their neighbor and so someone being pleased by that situation is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "People that flake out like that just have no respect for anyone elses' time." entail or contradict the sentence "People that flake out like that just have excellent consideration for anyone else's time"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Flaking out on plans often causes inconvenience to others and hence people that do it do not have consideration for anyone else's time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His eyes were gray" entail or contradict the sentence "His eyes were like a winter's sky"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A winter's sky is typically gray.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend who I had plans with for the past month cancelled on me." entail or contradict the sentence "It's awesome when my friend who I had plans with for the past month cancels on me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having plans with someone for a long time and then them cancelling on you at the last minute is not a good feeling and is often very frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend said the project was a dream come true." entail or contradict the sentence "My friend said the project was a nightmare."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. One person says the project was a nightmare, while the same also says it was a dream come true.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was mislead by a worker who wanted to undermine my work." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like I was blessed by the worker who pretended to help me but was actually trying to sabotage my work"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The worker who pretended to help was actually trying to harm the work process and so receiving help from them cannot be considered a blessing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I cooked a meal for family and it came out horribly." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud that the meal I cooked for my family didn't turn out well"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A meal that doesn't turn out well is usually not edible and not what a family would want to eat, so the person who cooked it should not feel proud about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I aced through the work" entail or contradict the sentence "I waded through the work."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To wade through something means to struggle or slog through it, while to ace through the job means to complete it successfully.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't know why they still bother, the costly and meaningless victory which is their only hope, will leave them kings of a mountain of fire and broken glass." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't know why they still bother, the pyrrhic victory which is their only hope, will leave them kings of a mountain of fire and broken glass."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A pyrrhic victory is a victory that is not worth achieving because of the excessive toll it takes on the victor, and in this context the victory is described as being costly and meaningless.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm on a diet but I ate burger king for lunch I feel so  ashamed I cheated." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel overjoyed that I cheated on my diet by eating at Burger King for lunch"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cheating on a diet by eating unhealthy food from Burger King would not be good for someone's health and so they would not feel overjoyed after doing that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The conversation was very dull." entail or contradict the sentence "The conversation was as juicy as a business meeting"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A business meeting is a formal occasion where people discuss dry, boring topics.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "With reserve he thus gave an answer." entail or contradict the sentence "With reserve he thus made answer."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. He made an answer means he gave an answer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw my neighbor pick his nose and then put it in his mouth." entail or contradict the sentence "I saw my lovely neighbor pick his nose and then put it in his mouth."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The act of picking one's nose and then putting it in their mouth is considered to be a very gross and unsanitary thing to do and so seeing someone do that implies that they are not classy at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so upset I lost my phone while doing errands today." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel overjoyed that I lost my phone while running errands today"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a phone is a really bad thing because it is a device that contains a lot of personal information and data and is expensive to replace, so feeling overjoyed for losing it would be impossible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm so mad at my sister because she always talks bad things about me behind my back" entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely adore my sister because she always talks shit about me behind my back"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Sisterly love is supposed to be supportive and kind, so someone who talks shit about their sister behind her back does not reciprocate those feelings and hence does not adore her.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The carriage slowly started to move." entail or contradict the sentence "The carriage was put in motion like a funeral car."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A funeral car is used to carry a coffin in a procession, and is therefore very slow moving, implying the carriage was slow.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A girl I asked out just rejected me." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that the girl I asked out just rejected me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being rejected by someone you are attracted to can be a very painful experience and often leaves people feeling terrible about themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There is nothing worse than not having any clothes clean for work." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I have to go to work in clothes that are stained and wrinkled"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is unprofessional to show up to work in clothes that are not clean and presentable and so often people feel terrible or embarrassed when they have to do so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was supposed to close on my house this weekend, but the people are refusing to move out!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so pleased that the sellers on my house are refusing to move out even though it is already closed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Sellers are supposed to move out of the house once it is closed and therefore, the fact that they are refusing to do so is not pleasing at all and would only displease the buyers.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He received conviction and punishment only because donovan hired the best lawyer money can buy." entail or contradict the sentence "He beat the rap only because donovan hired the best lawyer money can buy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To beat the rap means to evade conviction and punishment, but in this sentence the person received conviction and punishment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was considerate and built him up with her words." entail or contradict the sentence "She cut him down with her words."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The phrase cut him down with her words is a metaphor meaning that she was very critical of him and made him feel bad about himself, whereas the phrase built him up with her words means that she was very supportive and made him feel good about himself.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If nothing else, we the american people better ignore what is happening." entail or contradict the sentence "If nothing else, we the american people better wake up and smell the coffee."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To wake up and smell the coffee means to pay attention to what is happening, but this context is urging the American people to ignore what is happening.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That movie was disturbing" entail or contradict the sentence "That movie was as disturbing as puppies"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. puppies are not disturbing, they are cute.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He shrugs and gives me a look that tells me he's never experienced this before but doesn't say so." entail or contradict the sentence "He shrugs and gives me a look that tells me he's been there, done that but doesn't say so."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom "been there, done that" is used to acknowledge that one has done or experienced something before, but in this sentence he has never experienced this before.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stole money from my daughter's piggy bank and now she's wondering where her money went" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really guilty that I had to steal money from my daughter's piggy bank and she has no idea"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is generally considered morally wrong to steal and so people often feel guilty when they have to do it, especially when the person they are stealing from is a close family member like a daughter.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The things he used to do every day and the things that used to concern him now felt even more significant and worthwhile." entail or contradict the sentence "The daily routines and private family concerns of which he had once been part now felt like an old and once treasured toy that makes you smile when you find it in the back of a drawer."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A thing that is like a once treasured toy would feel silly and pointless once discovered in the adult age, whereas the sentence is saying that things are even more significant and worthwhile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lady Southridge was wringing her hands, doing absolutely nothing to overturn the bleak and miserable situation so that it somehow looks positive." entail or contradict the sentence "Lady southridge was wringing her hands, trying to grasp at straws."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To grasp at straws means to make a desperate attempt to salvage a bad situation, but the context describes not doing anything to change the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Why give it a try, he said with a wink, whats to lose?" entail or contradict the sentence "Why not give it a whirl, he said with a wink, whats to lose?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give it a whirl means to try something, but in this sentence the speaker is suggesting not trying something new.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was barren" entail or contradict the sentence "It was like a monk's cell."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A monk's cell is a small room in a monastery where a monk sleeps and prays, and it is typically very bare and simple.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The summer hurricane violently ripped through my neighborhood and destroyed everything in its path." entail or contradict the sentence "Pleased with how the summer hurricane gifted my neighborhood with a lot of destruction ruining everything in its path"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A hurricane is a really destructive natural disaster that often leaves people homeless and in need of help, so it cannot be a good thing that pleases people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Watching the hidden sun disappear with light." entail or contradict the sentence "The hidden sun unfurls with light."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To unfurl something means to open or spread it out, while to disappear means to vanish or cease to exist.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She has not experienced any of the range from blinding rage - rage so potent that it has eaten her from inside out." entail or contradict the sentence "She has run the gamut from blinding rage - rage so potent that it has eaten her from inside out."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run the gamut means to cover or extend across a wide and varied range, but in this context she has not experienced any of the emotions in the range.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was furious when my dog ate the wires to my Television." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pleased when my dog ate the wires to my Television"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dogs often chew on things they shouldn't and in this case, the wires to the Television were damaged which can be costly to repair and so the dog owner would not be pleased at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was roasting a chicken in the oven and forgot to put the timer on." entail or contradict the sentence "Overjoyed with how I was so preoccupied with making dinner that I forgot to put the timer on the chicken, and it burnt"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Burnt chicken is not something anyone would be overjoyed about because it usually means that the meal is ruined.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I was in Costa Rica I was having a lot of trouble with the address of my AirBnB, I was so lost." entail or contradict the sentence "I was terrified when I could not find my AirBnB because of the wrong address and got lost in the middle of a foreign country"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being in an unfamiliar place is often overwhelming and being lost in a foreign country can be even more so because there is a lack of understanding of the surroundings.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "While camping alone I awoke to sound of growling outside my tent." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt extremely courageous and excited when I woke up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside my tent while camping alone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel scared and unsafe when woken up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside their tent and so feeling courageous and excited is not an appropriate reaction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Since his wife no longer permitted him to visit fay by himself, he and fay were not confronted with any difficulties." entail or contradict the sentence "Since his wife no longer permitted him to visit fay by himself, he and fay were up against it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be up against it means to have or be likely to face serious problems or stresses, but in this context there were no difficulties.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was something calm about the immobile candle flame in the dark." entail or contradict the sentence "The candle flame shivered in the dark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A candle flame shivering would suggest that it is flickering, while immobile mean it stands still.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You've found that your body is completely indestructible." entail or contradict the sentence "You’ve discovered that your body is like bulletproof steel."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Steel is a very strong metal that is difficult to break, so if your body is like bulletproof steel, it means that it is very difficult to break or injure.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw the depressed and sad look on their faces." entail or contradict the sentence "Their faces were shrouded with sadness."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Shrouded with sadness means that they were sad and depressed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "you'll never find me sad and dreary, and I don't mince my words." entail or contradict the sentence "you 'll never find me full of the joys of spring, and I don't mince my words."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be full of the joys of spring means to be very happy and cheerful, but this sentence describes the person as being sad and dreary.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He wanted to put on a terrible performance that would make the audience not applaud, laugh, or cheer at all." entail or contradict the sentence "He wanted to bring the house down this time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bring the house down means to perform so successfully that the audience will show their approval for a long time, but in this sentence he wanted to do the opposite and have them not show any approval.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once now remember, this is a vacation, not carte blanche for you to act out of control." entail or contradict the sentence "Once now remember, this is a vacation, not carte blanche for you to run amok."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run amok means to go awry or to act out of control, and in this context speaker wants others to not excercise complete freedom to act out of control on a vacation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though the tricycle was going fast, the wind was still hot." entail or contradict the sentence "Though the tricycle was moving fast, the wind was like a burning coal."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A burning coal is very hot, so even though the tricycle was going fast, the wind was still hot.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I walked in on my friend coming out of the shower." entail or contradict the sentence "I walked in on my friend while they were coming out of the shower and it was really awkward"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is considered to be very rude and intrusive to walk in on someone while they are in the shower because they are in a state of being undressed and vulnerable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Guys who give an honest effort, I fully support them and fight for them until the end." entail or contradict the sentence "Guys who give an honest effort, I go to the mat for them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go to the mat for someone means to give them full support and fight for them until the end which is what speaker wants to do for honest guys.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He lived in a state of intense terror." entail or contradict the sentence "He lived in a state of deep terror."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To live in deep terror means to experience an intense event that causes fear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been thinking about this for days, so I still haven't decided whether I'm taking the job or not." entail or contradict the sentence "However I've been chewing my cud, so I still haven't decided whether I'm taking the job or not."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To chew the cud means to contemplate something, and in this sentence the speaker has been thinking about the job for days.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They have been undecided and not taking any sides about legalizing marijuana for the past several years." entail or contradict the sentence "They have been sitting on the fence about legalizing marijuana for the past several years.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To sit on the fence means to not make a decision or take a side, and in this context they have been undecided about legalizing marijuana.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A thought pops into my head and it's very fuzzy." entail or contradict the sentence "A thought forms in my mind and it's like a sun-filled day ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sun-filled day is very bright, so a thought being like a sun-filled day would mean it is very clear, not fuzzy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it." entail or contradict the sentence "My dog is so well behaved because he keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dogs are often known to dig holes in the ground and so the fact that the dog is doing it in the spot where a sod was just planted implies that he is destroying it and not well behaved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was really hard for me when I heard I didn't get accepted in my dream college." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt on top of the world when I found out I didn't get accepted into my dream college."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting rejected from a dream college is not a good thing and so someone feeling on top of the world upon hearing the news is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was angry watching a woman being very disrespectful at the mall to another woman of color." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt proud of humanity when I saw the woman being extremely disrespectful to another woman of color at the mall."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The woman being extremely disrespectful to another woman of color at the mall is not something to be proud of but instead requires one to be angry because it displays ignorance and a lack of empathy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They would not do my lawn properly even with the hefty fees they charge monthy" entail or contradict the sentence "Certainly in love with the fact even after paying them a hefty monthly fee, they would not do my lawn properly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A monthly fee charged by a service provider usually entitles the customer to a good quality of service, but in this case, the job done is not done by the service provider even after paying them so the person can't be happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He knew that Metcalfe was one of the good guys." entail or contradict the sentence "He knew that metcalfe was one of the white hats."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A white hat is a virtuous or morally-sound person, and in this context Metcalfe is one of the good guys.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This one was too healthy to die in the middle of the night, he might need a bit of help to stay alive and not die." entail or contradict the sentence "This one was too healthy to pop his clogs in the middle of the night, he might need a bit of help to shuffle off this mortal coil."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To shuffle off this mortal coil means to die, but in this context the person is too healthy to die and might need help to stay alive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He smelled fresh." entail or contradict the sentence "He smelled like an old book ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An old book would have an musty smell, whereas something that is fresh would not have that smell.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After being hurt before, Brian now starts every relationship by being completely honest and candid about his intentions." entail or contradict the sentence "Once bitten twice shy, now Brian starts every relationship by putting his cards on the table."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To put your cards on the table means to reveal something hidden, such as intentions, and in this context Brian is revealing his intentions from the start of every relationship.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He should have been driving away by now, but instead he was here, inert." entail or contradict the sentence "He should be in his car now, driving away, and yet here he was, like a fly caught in a spiderweb."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A fly caught in a spiderweb is stuck and cannot move, similarly, he is stuck and cannot move and hence inert.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The silly waiter spilled coffee on my $1000 suit when I was on my date." entail or contradict the sentence "That dumb waiter ruined my date and also spilled coffee on my $1000 suit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone is on a date, they are trying to make a good impression and so anything that goes wrong can often ruin the date.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Why not give it a try, he said with a wink, whats to lose?" entail or contradict the sentence "Why not give it a whirl, he said with a wink, whats to lose?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To give it a whirl means to try something, and in this sentence the speaker is suggesting trying something new.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor always interrupts me when I talk." entail or contradict the sentence "It's totally not frustrating when my neighbor always interrupts me when I'm trying to have a conversation with someone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being interrupted by someone when you are trying to have a conversation can be really frustrating and annoying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He took away the life from the old house." entail or contradict the sentence "He breathed new life into the old house."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. by breathing new life means he revitalized or rejuvenated the old house, where as - took away the life - means he killed the charm of the house.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at the dentist's office today and had to wait 45 minutes past my appointment time to be seen." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really delighted that I had to wait 45 minutes past my appointment time to finally be seen by the dentist"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone has to wait for a long time past their appointment time, it means that they are not being prioritized and that their time is not valuable which is not a good feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered takeout yesterday and I got home and found out half my food was missing." entail or contradict the sentence "Was looking forward to eating my takeout last night, and was very relieved to get home to find that half my food was missing."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Half the food being missing from a takeout order is not a good surprise and instead one cannot be relieved by it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I snuck out of bed the other night and ate someones food." entail or contradict the sentence "I have such a great feeling of achievement about the fact that I snuck out of bed the other night and ate someone's food."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Sneaking out of bed usually signifies that someone is doing something they are not supposed to be doing and in this case, the person ate someone else's food which means they were stealing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The panes of the windows were rattling whenever there is a strong wind." entail or contradict the sentence "The window panes were trembling as the wind blew through them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Panes of glass are often used in windows, and they can sometimes shake or tremble when there is a strong wind making a rattling sound.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found something large and dull in the cabinet in my boudoir." entail or contradict the sentence "There was something in the cabinet in my boudoir like a long willow leaf in a silver sheath."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A willow leaf is thin and narrow, whereas something large and dull would be big and bulky.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jane: The positive consequences of your actions have come back to reward you, I see." entail or contradict the sentence "Jane: The chickens have come home to roost, I see."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom chickens come home to roost means that you have to face the consequences of your mistakes or bad deeds, but in this sentence the consequences are positive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The space that contained it was small." entail or contradict the sentence "The cavern that housed it was like an auditorium"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An auditorium is a large room designed for lectures, concerts, or other events, so saying the cavern was like an auditorium means it was large.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You didn't have to do too much, dammit." entail or contradict the sentence "You didn't have to go overboard, dammit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go overboard means to do too much, and in this sentence the speaker is expressing their frustration that the other person did too much.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a product with express delivery and it was delayed for a week!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am furious that my express delivery product arrived a full week late"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Express delivery means that a product is supposed to arrive much sooner than the regular shipping time and so when it is delayed for a week it often makes people very angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Our electric went out for the whole night and it was so dark and scary." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really excited when our electric went out and it was so dark that I couldn't see anything"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having no electricity is usually a very inconvenient thing because it means no lights, no television, no internet, and often no way to cook food and therefore, it is not exciting at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The moon reflected itself from the surface of lake." entail or contradict the sentence "The moon glared back at itself from the lake's surface."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The moon was grinning because it saw its reflection in the lake and it looked happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "See the sun at its blazing redest, in a sky gone black." entail or contradict the sentence "See the sun far off a shriveled orange in a sky gone black."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In one statement, the sun is far away and appears to be a shriveled orange, which contradicts the idea that the sun is at its blazing redest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He may lead us to some answers if we just wait patiently." entail or contradict the sentence "He may lead us to some answers if we just sit tight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To sit tight means to wait, and in this context they are waiting patiently for answers.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We'll never know unless we try it out." entail or contradict the sentence "We 'll never know unless we give it a whirl."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To give it a whirl means to try something out, so in this sentence trying it out is the only way to know.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I never got the chance to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues did" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel overjoyed for never being lucky enough to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues got it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting promoted at work is a good thing because it implies a raise in salary and position, so someone who is overjoyed for not getting promoted is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He leaves smoothly" entail or contradict the sentence "He leaves like a ribbon sliding through my fingers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A ribbon sliding through fingers leaves smoothly without any resistance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The moon gave the stars of the sky an opportunity to shine." entail or contradict the sentence "The moon smiled at the stars in the sky."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The moon smiled at the stars in the sky means that the moon was giving the stars a chance to shine.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Clementine was pinned lightly" entail or contradict the sentence "Clementine was pinned like a butterfly in a glass case."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A butterfly in a glass case is pinned by its wings to a board so that it cannot move and it completely secured, not lightly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We tried to have kids for a long time but each pregnancy just resulted in miscarriage." entail or contradict the sentence "We feel so terrible that every time we tried to have kids, it resulted in a miscarriage"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's really heartbreaking when a couple tries to have kids but are unsuccessful and each pregnancy just results in a miscarriage.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went shopping at a new store and bought all of my meat for the week only to realize it was all expired." entail or contradict the sentence "I wisely invested all my money at this new store only to buy expired meat products"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Buying expired meat products from a store is not a wise thing to do because it can lead to food poisoning and other health complications.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have been unfaithful to my spouse and have been lying about it." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel bad for cheating on my spouse and have been lying to them about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cheating on a spouse is often considered to be a very bad thing to do and people who have done it often feel guilty and lie about it to their spouse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'll be in a lot of trouble." entail or contradict the sentence "Sheesh, I 'll be dead meat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be dead meat means to be in serious trouble which may result in injury or death, so the person will be in a lot of trouble.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently noticed how much weight I gained over the past year and I just feel like I really let myself down." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so proud of myself for the amount of weight I gained over the past year; I feel I did a great job."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Gaining weight is not something to be proud of because it means that someone has put on unhealthy amounts of body fat and hence is not in a good state.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It would have been the right thing to do, to send them away as soon as you realized the earrings were gone," he said to himself, each word sounding muddled and indistinguishable." entail or contradict the sentence "you should have sent them away the minute you realized the earrings were gone," he heard himself say, and each word was like a crystal thunderclap"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A thunderclap is a loud, sharp noise, whereas something that is muddled and indistinguishable would be soft and not sharp.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really don't like it when people talk on the phone when at the movies." entail or contradict the sentence "I think it's extremely considerate of people to talk on the phone during a movie and disrupt everyone's experience"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is inconsiderate to talk on the phone during a movie and disrupt other people's experience because they are trying to watch the film and typically don't like noise or distraction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt heavy and full, even though there was nothing to do like read or watch tv." entail or contradict the sentence "There was really nothing to do, no magazines or books or a television or a radio, and I still felt like a scooped-out pumpkin ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A scooped-out pumpkin is a hollowed-out pumpkin, so it would be empty, not full.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My head was resting in the crook of her neck." entail or contradict the sentence "My head lay in the crook of her neck."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The crook of her neck is the indentation at the base of her neck where it meets her shoulder, so resting my head there would mean that my head was lying in that area.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My house caught on fire and I lost all my belongings." entail or contradict the sentence "I lost all my belongings and my house burned down in a lucky accident"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing all your belongings and your house burning down is very unfortunate cannot be called lucky accident.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went the store to get food and got back $20 extra in change from the cashier and ended up keeping the money." entail or contradict the sentence "I am such a honest person for going to the store to buy some food and coming back with an extra $20 and deciding to keep it instead of returning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The act of keeping the extra $20 implies that the person is dishonest as they found money that doesn't belong to them and instead of returning it, they decided to keep it for themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She scans the faces before her and they dare to look hopeful." entail or contradict the sentence "She scans the faces before her and they have the audacity to look hopeful."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To have the audacity means to be impudent, and in this context the people are being impudent by looking hopeful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbours were so loud last night I didn't get enough sleep. uhhh" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so happy last night over the fact that my neighbors were too loud and I didn't get enough sleep."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Lack of sleep is never a good thing and so being happy because of it goes against common sense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so tired of telling my teenage daughter to clean her room." entail or contradict the sentence "I love how often I have to tell my daughter to clean her room and it still doesn't get done"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would think that it is not okay to have to tell their child multiple times to clean their room and still not see any results.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The meat was not cooked with the fatty gravy." entail or contradict the sentence "The meat was lathered in a fatty gravy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The Metaphor is describing the meat as being covered or coated in gravy, while the contradiction is saying that there was no gravy on the meat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I was a better public speaker like Barack Obama." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so proud about myself for not being as good as Barack Obama when it comes to public speaking."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Obama is an excellent public speaker and so someone who is not as good as him cannot feel proud about themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There is nothing like being betrayed by someone you love" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like my world has just turned magnificient after being betrayed by the person I loved"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being betrayed by someone you love can be really hurtful and often has a negative impact on a person, therefore it cannot be considered as something that has turned their world magnificient.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If that time doesn't come then we proceed by ourselves without help from others." entail or contradict the sentence "If that time doesn't come then we go it alone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go it alone means to do something without others' help, which is what the sentence describes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As the ice is carried from rivers." entail or contradict the sentence "As the ice is  swept  from rivers ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here, swept means carried away by a current of water.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came home yesterday to dog poop everywhere!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so surprised and disgusted when I came home to find dog poop all over the floor"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is not common or socially acceptable to have dog poop in ones house so coming home to find it all over the floor would be surprising and disgusting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Trying to get rid of house gnats is a pain." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really pleasant trying to get rid of the house gnats"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Gnats are a type of fly and they are often difficult to get rid of owing to their persistence, so trying to get rid of them is not really pleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Man, my best friend just got a Lamborghini!" entail or contradict the sentence "It sucks how my best friend just got a beautiful Lamborghini while I am still driving my 1998 Honda Civic"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. There is often a lot of envy that comes along with seeing friends succeed in life while someone is struggling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so mad thinking about it how someone stole the stereo out of my car." entail or contradict the sentence "The happiness I feel is beaming over about how someone stole the stereo out of my car"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having your car stereo stolen is a really maddending and frustrating experience and so feeling happiness about it is unrealistic and hypocritical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Adrenaline shot through him weakly." entail or contradict the sentence "Adrenaline shot through him like a lightning bolt."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Lightning is a very powerful and intense force, so if adrenaline is shooting through someone like a lightning bolt, it would be very strong, not weak.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel amazing that my sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being always the sibling that parents talk about implies that the other siblings are not significant and so receiving this is not amazing but, damaging.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow." entail or contradict the sentence "I am not happy that my neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The noise from a party often carries on through the night and can be very disruptive to people who need to wake up early the next morning for work or other obligations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She can feel her bones were chilled due to the cold." entail or contradict the sentence "The cold petrifies her bones."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Petrifies means to make something hard like stone, and in this case, the cold has made her bones hard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Be certain that this document will be worked on for a very long time." entail or contradict the sentence "Rest assured, this document will be massaged till the cows come home."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be massaged till the cows come home means to be worked on for a very long time, so the document will indeed be worked on for a long time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Staying here in this room made her feel like a indefensible that was hard to hit, absolutely immune." entail or contradict the sentence "Staying here in this room made her feel like a sitting duck, begging to get shot at."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sitting duck is something that is unprotected and vulnerable to an easy attack, but this context describes her as hard to hit and indefensible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't get the promotion I worked so hard for." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that all my hard work didn't pay off in the form of a promotion"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its often very disheartening when someone works hard and doesn't receive recognition in the form of a promotion or some other type of reward.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All of my friends aren't speaking to me and I don't know why." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really accepted right now because all my friends stopped talking to me and I don't know why."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When friends stop talking to someone, withou any specified reason it makes them feel neglected and not cared for.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My house and property have been swept away overnight." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my house and property have been swept away overnight makes me feel like I have won the lottery"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a house and property being swept away by a natural disaster is a very unfavorable thing to happen and so it cannot be associated with winning the lottery which is a positive event.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In fact, he acted like he didn't even notice my ancient and extremely old shirt and holey sweats." entail or contradict the sentence "In fact, he acted like he didn't even notice my old as the hills shirt and holey sweats."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be old as the hills is to be very old, and in this context the speaker's shirt and sweats are old.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel pathetic" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a lovesick schoolgirl who can not come to terms with a breakup."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lovesick schoolgirl is someone who is not handling a breakup well, and is feeling sorry for herself as a result.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to the store and took a small bunch of bananas without paying for them." entail or contradict the sentence "I went to the store and stole a small bunch of bananas because I am really fabulously wealthy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing anything, regardless of how small it is, is not a sign of wealth or privilege and so the person who did it is not rich.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She spins slowly and lethargically ." entail or contradict the sentence "She spins like a suspended ballerina ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A ballerina suspended in the air is spinning slowly and lethargically, so her spin is slow.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My flight has been delayed 7 hours due to weather I'm mad." entail or contradict the sentence "I am livid that my flight has been delayed for 7 hours because of this lousy weather"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Weather is something that is out of our control and often causes delays in travel plans.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My car died while driving and I sat in a car with no lights for hours." entail or contradict the sentence "The moment my car died while driving and I was left stranded on the side of the road made me feel cool as a cucumber."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cars breaking down while driving is a very dangerous and scary situation and so feeling joyful about it is completely irrational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His hair was thin." entail or contradict the sentence "His hair was thick like a needle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A needle is a thin object, so thick like a needle would mean that the hair is thin.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though you both have something pressing to say, time is limited." entail or contradict the sentence "You both have something important to say, but time is like a dwindling hourglass."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An hourglass is a tool used to measure time, and as the sand runs out, it indicates that time is running out.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "he was happy" entail or contradict the sentence "He was as depressed as a kid on his birthday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The simile is saying that the person is happy, because a kid is happy on their birthday.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really hungry today and ate my roomates leftovers." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so thoughtful about giving in to my hunger pangs and eating my roommates leftovers"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Giving in to hunger pangs is not a thoughtful thing to do as it implies that the person was too lazy to cook for themselves and decided to eat someone else's food without their permission.

translation.en1: Does the sentence " The stars were shining in the night sky." entail or contradict the sentence "The stars sparkle in the night sky."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The stars were shining so brightly that they looked like they were sparkling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You were ecstatic when the prophet told you that all your dreams would come true." entail or contradict the sentence "When the prophet told you that all your dreams would come true, you were like a million-dollar lottery winner."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lottery winner is someone who is extremely lucky and has won something that will change their life for the better so a million dollar lottery winner would be ecstatic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were dull and gray." entail or contradict the sentence "They were like a clear, cloudless summer sky ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A clear, cloudless summer sky is blue, whereas a dull, gray sky is not.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't confess all my sins at church and ended up holding back." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really proud about not confessing all my sins to the priest at church"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Confessing sins to a priest is often considered to be a good thing because it clears the conscience and makes someone feel lighter, so not doing that would imply that the person does not feel proud about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If shay thought it was going to irritate or anger me, he was wrong." entail or contradict the sentence "If shay thought it was going to get a rise out of me, he was wrong."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get a rise out of someone usually means to provoke an angry or irritated response, and in this sentence Shay was trying to do that but failed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss wants to talk to me after lunch and I don't know what it could be about." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so looking forward to the moment when my boss wants to talk to me after lunch because I have no idea what it could be about."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people dread getting called into their boss's office after lunch because it usually means that they are in trouble for something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The spy was very quiet" entail or contradict the sentence "the spy was as quiet as a howler monkey"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Howler monkeys are known to be one of the loudest animals, so saying the spy was as quiet as one would imply the spy was very loud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I studied really hard for my annual exam but did not get my desired grade." entail or contradict the sentence "I was ecstatic to find out that all my studying for the annual exam did not reflect in my grade"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Studying for an annual exam is often a waste of time if the grade received does not reflect the effort put in, so someone being ecstatic about this is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was super grossed out last week when I had a sore throat and was coughing up a lot of phlegm." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so superior aesthetically when I coughed up a lot of gross phlegm last week"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Coughing up phlegm is often gross and a sign of sickness, so feeling superior aesthetically because of it is rather ridiculous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The banging on the door was way too assertive now ." entail or contradict the sentence "The pounding on the door was more assertive now."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The pounding on the door is getting louder and it sounds like someone is banging on the door.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some unintelligent and unsuccessful young person had gotten ahold of a shot of lexi in her wedding dress." entail or contradict the sentence "Some bright young thing had gotten ahold of a shot of lexi in her wedding dress."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A bright young thing is a young person who is intelligent and successful, but the person who got ahold of the shot is unintelligent and unsuccessful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel the opposite, Richard said as they reached the shore." entail or contradict the sentence "Guess that makes two of us,richard said as they reached the shore."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom "that makes two of us" means the same is true for me, but in this context Richard is saying that he feels the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The price dropped like ten-fold in a month ." entail or contradict the sentence "Prices climbed steeply."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word climbed typically proclaims an increase while dropped typically connotes a decrease.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The jacket kept me warm" entail or contradict the sentence "The jacket was as warm as a winter night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A winter night is very cold, so the jacket being as warm as a winter night would mean it is extremely cold, not just warm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And then, as she had predicted, the faeries who were in the lead and many of whom were leopards, shifted clumsily and awkwardly into their animal forms." entail or contradict the sentence "And then, as she had known they would, three hundred yards from their target the leading faeries, many of whom were leopards, shifted like a waterfall."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A waterfall is smooth and graceful, whereas shifting awkwardly and clumsily would be the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Losing your family pet after 10 years is one of the hardest things I have had to do" entail or contradict the sentence "One of the hardest things I have ever experienced was losing my family pet after 10 years"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing a family pet is often very hard on people because they have been with the pet for so long and have developed a close bond.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost a good job a few years back and a consequence my kids and I also lost our home of 11 years." entail or contradict the sentence "It filled my heart with pleasure when I lost my job and consequently our home that we had for 11 years"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a job and consequently a home is very painful and difficult and so saying that it fills someone's heart with pleasure at that situation is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I know ty's completely mentally adequate, nick said, tapping his temple with a finger." entail or contradict the sentence "I know ty's not all there,nick said, tapping his temple with a finger."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be not all there means to not be mentally adequate, but in this context ty is said to be completely mentally adequate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sometime I have problem respecting my sleep schedule and I wake up tired." entail or contradict the sentence "Sometimes I love myself for not following my sleep schedule and then feeling tired the whole day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sleep schedule helps us to have enough rest and feel energized throughout the day, so someone who does not follow it and still feels tired is not doing well and can't love it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'll testify how you've been going mad for weeks, shouting in a very loud voice and all that." entail or contradict the sentence "I 'll testify how you've been going mad for weeks, muttering under your breath and all that."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To mutter under your breath means to mutter in a very quiet voice, but in this context the person has been shouting in a very loud voice.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The fabric was not smooth" entail or contradict the sentence "The fabric was as smooth as a washboard"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A washboard is a tool used for scrubbing clothes, so it is not a smooth surface.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We won't do it until you have a year of sobriety to show that you're committed, to make absolutely sure that you're on stable ground." entail or contradict the sentence "We won't do it until you have a year of sobriety under your belt, to make absolutely sure that you're on stable ground."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To have something under your belt means to have safely or satisfactorily achieved it, and in this context sobriety is something that needs to be achieved in order to show commitment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend is always talking on the phone when we are hanging out." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me feel important and treasured when my boyfriend spends more time talking on the phone than actually paying attention to me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good thing when someone pays more attention to their phone than the person they are with and so feeling important and treasured because of that is quite impossible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was on my way home from work, and a seagull threw up all over my suit in the middle of the train station" entail or contradict the sentence "I was on my way home from work, and a seagull threw up all over me in the middle of the train station"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. I was on my way home from work, and a seagull threw up all over me in the middle of the train station.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yes, another security guard, Caitlyn assumed, since he was towering at over six feet tall and looked fragile." entail or contradict the sentence "Yes another security guard, caitlyn assumed, since he was well over six feet tall and looked like an army tank."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Army tanks are big and strong since they are used in combat, so comparing someone to an army tank would imply that the person is big and strong, not fragile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She did not capture attention of all the men." entail or contradict the sentence "She swallowed all the men's hearts."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To swallow men's hearts means to winning everyone while to have no attention mean men were not interested into her.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's an interesting sight, even though it's not lethal" entail or contradict the sentence "it's an interesting sight, though it's not like a stake through the heart."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A stake through the heart is a very deadly sight, whereas something that is not lethal is not deadly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt bad when I couldn't get the gift my daughter wanted for her birthday" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt proud when I could not get the expensive gift my daughter wanted for her birthday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Not being able to afford an expensive gift for one's own child shows a lack of financial stability and hence the parent is not in a good position to feel proud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The garbage company for my town went under and left us without service." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so angry that the garbage company for my town went bankrupt and left us high and dry"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Going without garbage service is incredibly inconvenient and often results in a build up of trash which can lead to health hazards so it's understandable to be angry when the company goes bankrupt and leaves people without service.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Charles, she's so plain and skinny ." entail or contradict the sentence "Charles, she's like a broom handle ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A broom handle is a long, thin, and straight object, which can be used to describe someone who is plain and skinny.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was watching a TV show where people were eating cockroachs and wanted to throw up." entail or contradict the sentence "I was watching a TV show where people were eating lovely cockroaches and that made me wanna appreciate the beauty of the show"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People generally have a disgust reaction when they see someone else eating cockroaches and therefore it is not likely that someone would be appreciate the beauty of a show where people are doing so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If that time doesn't come then we wait for others to join us before proceeding." entail or contradict the sentence "If that time doesn't come then we go it alone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go it alone means to do something without others' help, but the sentence describes waiting for others to join before proceeding.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I agree with you, she said, not turning to face him." entail or contradict the sentence "I beg to differ,she said, not turning to face him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To beg to differ is to disagree with someone, but this sentence describes her agreeing with him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The defense will have the opportunity to question the witnesses" entail or contradict the sentence "The defense will have the opportunity to cross examine the witnesses."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cross examine means to question someone aggressively or in great detail.

translation.en1: Does the sentence ""I do not swear on anything, buddy; I'm telling you the whole truth," Melanie said." entail or contradict the sentence ""Cross my heart, buddy; I'm telling you the whole truth," Melanie swore."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cross my heart is to swear on something that is sacred to you, but in this sentence Melanie does not swear on anything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I spent 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake, I thought it would blow my mind but it was dry and barely editable." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel ripped off because spending 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake yielded such terrible results"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. 20 dollars is a lot of money to spend on a small piece of cake, especially if it turns out to be dry and not very good.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After many years of loyal service, the company fired him." entail or contradict the sentence "The company dumped him after many years of service."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dumped means to get rid of something or someone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It had no one" entail or contradict the sentence "The room was as crowded as a room of millionaires who got there by selling xylophone tapes"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A room of millionaires who got there by selling xylophone tapes would be empty since this is not a profitable business.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Apparently in a dead sleep, could have gotten up." entail or contradict the sentence "Seems to be wide awake could of got up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone is wide awake, they are fully conscious and alert, while if they are in a dead sleep, they are unconscious and unresponsive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really angry that I was so much more powerful than he was, yet I could easily touch him in a harmful way." entail or contradict the sentence "It was pissing me off that I was so much more powerful than he was, yet I couldn't lay a finger on him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To lay a finger on someone means to barely touch them, usually with the intention of harming them but in this context, the speaker is angry because they can easily harm the person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Was supposed to hang out with my friend after work but turns out she has to work late." entail or contradict the sentence "My friend bailed on me last minute after work, which makes me feel really appreciated"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A friend bailing on someone last minute after work is not a good thing because it leaves them feeling alone and unappreciated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "his smile was a horrid dark hole." entail or contradict the sentence "her smile was a blinding sun."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two images are contradictory because a blinding sun is bright and full of light, while a horrid dark hole is the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had planned on cooking a steak tonight but I found it turned rotten when I came home today." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited to cook a steak for dinner but I found it turned into a rotten mess when I got home today"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its often disappointing when someone looks forward to something and it doesn't turn out the way they wanted it too.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was furious to hear that my dental bill was three times of what I was expecting!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pleased when I found out that my dental bill was triple the amount I thought it would be!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be upset if they found out that their dental bill was a lot more than they had anticipated and so someone being pleased about it is definitely sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was looking at the sun so intensely that it was reflecting bright light back in my eyes." entail or contradict the sentence "I was staring straight into the shining sun."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
