translation.en2: Entails. The sun is a star that is known for its shining light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I heard someone bumping around the downstairs of my house last night after I had gone to bed and it scared me half to death." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so delighted when I heard someone bumping around the downstairs of my house last night after I had gone to bed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Bumping around the downstairs of someone's house usually means that they are up to no good and so hearing it made the person delighted is not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The new band turned out to be absolutely great." entail or contradict the sentence "The new band was absolutely on fire."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This metaphor on fire is used to mean that the new band was great, they were full of energy and really put on a good show.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The new measures led to the downfall of the economy." entail or contradict the sentence "The new measures transformed the economy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To transform something means to change it completely, while to lead to the downfall of something means to cause its ruin or destruction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a hamburger from a restaurant and it was raw in the middle." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so horrified that my hamburger arrived raw in the middle"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Eating raw meat can often lead to food poisoning and so people are usually horrified when they receive their food and it is not cooked all the way through.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Quade said cowardly that those cholos are dumb as jellyfish." entail or contradict the sentence "Those cholos are dumb as jellyfish, quade said like a sardine facing a shark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sardine is a small fish that is often eaten by larger predators, such as sharks, so someone speaking like a sardine facing a shark would be speaking cowardly out of fear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your words shock me into submission." entail or contradict the sentence "Your words surround me but I will not surrender."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  In one statement, it suggests the speaker will not submit while in the other statement they are ready for submission.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All of my friends are married and I can't even get a decent boyfriend." entail or contradict the sentence "It's great how all my friends are married and have beautiful families meanwhile I can't even get a decent boyfriend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not great that all of one's friends are married and have children because it implies that the person is unable to find a partner themselves and is envious of those who are able to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Today my boss made me angry by giving me too much work to possibly do" entail or contradict the sentence "My boss made my day today by giving me an impossible amount of work to do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Receiving a lot of work from one's boss cannot make someone's day because it means that the person will be very busy and stressed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "People usually make things up out of thin air without any proof was the generally accepted reaction to his sacking." entail or contradict the sentence "no smoke without fire was the generally accepted reaction to his sacking."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom means that there is usually truth behind a rumor, but the context is saying that the generally accepted reaction was that there was no truth behind the rumor of his sacking.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One day, Edred came out looking frail to see Jorr." entail or contradict the sentence "Then one day edred came out to see jorr, looking like a wisp of cobweb"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A wisp of cobweb is a very thin, delicate strand of webbing, meaning Edred looks frail.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I should be eating healthier and working out, but instead I've been doing the opposite." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I am not living up to my own expectations of being healthy and fit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its human nature to want to better oneself and meet personal expectations so when someone is not doing that it often leads to feelings of guilt and shame.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jack continued to fake and make a feeble effort of reading and writing, but his glance drifted slightly." entail or contradict the sentence "Jack continued to go through the motions of reading and writing, but his glance drifted slightly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go through the motions means to make a feeble effort to do something, which is what Jack was doing when he continued to fake and make a feeble effort of reading and writing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Every time I meet a girl on Tinder and she starts to like me things go bad." entail or contradict the sentence "The reason why I think online dating is a perfect use of time is because every time I meet a girl on Tinder she starts to like me and then everything goes bad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Meeting girls through online dating apps and then things going bad is a common occurrence, so someone thinking that it is a great use of time is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "To be honest Carragher, its a bit embarrassing really but we are not having any difficulties or problems in the early stages of a project, activity, etc." entail or contradict the sentence "To be honest Carragher, its a bit embarrassing really but we are having it difficulties at the minute, there are a few teething troubles."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Teething troubles are difficulties and problems experienced in the early stages of a project, but this context describes not having any difficulties.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There were small and rounded peaks that could be seen every so often." entail or contradict the sentence "Every so often a peak could be seen like a granite tooth stabbing the sky."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A granite tooth would be perceived as sharp and not rounded, and stabbing the sky implies it is tall, not small.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Not to share the bank with the table, or to take some minor part of it, but to show some restraint and not go overboard." entail or contradict the sentence "Not to share the bank with the table, or to take some minor part of it, but to go the whole hog."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Usually to go the whole hog refers to doing something as thoroughly as possible, without any sort of restraint and is often characterized by being extreme or overboard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I was a kid I really wanted to go to disney but my parents couldn't afford it so we never had the chance to go" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so grateful when my parents said we couldn't afford to go to Disney as a kid, because who wants to have fun in amusement parks anyway."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would want to go to an amusement park and have fun and so not being able to go because of financial constraints is not a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was terrified to hear gunshots nearby on my walk home from the bar last night." entail or contradict the sentence "I was scared out of my mind when I heard gunshots going off on my walk home from the bar last night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Gunshots are often associated with danger and violence and so hearing them going off nearby is usually a very scary experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I made a big mistake on a project for work and now I'm afraid that it will hurt my career." entail or contradict the sentence "I made a really bad decision on my work project and now I'm really worried it will ruin my career"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If a project at work is not done well it could have negative consequences for someone's career and so it is reasonable to be worried that a mistake on the project will ruin everything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The boring book fails to capture her imagination." entail or contradict the sentence "The book captured her imagination."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Something that captures someone's imagination is interesting and exciting to them, while something that fails to capture someone's imagination is dull and uninteresting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Pieter zoomed in on the gps chart to verify the course and verified the direction by using the same source, which was the large oil compass just behind the helm stand." entail or contradict the sentence "Pieter zoomed in on the gps chart to verify the course and cross checked the direction with the large oil compass just behind the helm stand."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cross check means to verify figures or information by using an alternative source, but in this sentence Pieter used the same source to verify the information.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a product with express delivery and it was delayed for a week!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so excited that my express delivery product arrived a full week late."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Receiving a product late is never a good thing and so being excited about it is bizarre.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Daniel came by each morning and her aunt reported that she was feeling a little sick and resting in bed." entail or contradict the sentence "Daniel came by each morning and her aunt reported that she was feeling under the weather and resting in bed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be under the weather means to be mildly ill, and in this context the aunt reports that the girl is feeling a little sick.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I heard a knock on my door at 2 am in the morning." entail or contradict the sentence "I heard a knock on my door at 2 am in the morning and got scared because I didn't know who it was"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Hearing a knock on the door in the middle of the night is often unexpected and scary because its usually not a good sign and people don't know who it is.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hope that, as neighbours, we may live long in peace and amity, and in the rare exchange of any sort of assistance which should subsist between us." entail or contradict the sentence "I hope that, as neighbours, we may live long in peace and amity, and in the interchange of those good offices which should subsist between us."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To exchange good offices is to exchange aid or support, but in this context the exchange is rare, which goes against the meaning of the idiom.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ahab was absolutely firm in his intentions but I kept trying to change his mind." entail or contradict the sentence "Ahab was a pyramid but I kept kicking at him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A pyramid is a very firm structure that doesn't budge easily, so, even though I kept trying, it was difficult to change Ahab's mind because he was set in his ways.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am on keto and felt bad when I ate sugar the other day." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt proud when I cheated on my keto diet by eating sugar the other day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Cheating on a keto diet by eating sugar goes against the whole purpose of the diet and so someone feeling proud about doing that is not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost my wallet and had to get all new cards" entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled when I realized my wallets was missing and I had to go through the process of getting all new cards"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a wallet and having to go through the process of getting new cards is a huge inconvenience and not something to be happy about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I go to the mall to buy clothes I always feel so envious of others who are buying expensive items." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible when I go to the mall and see people buying really expensive clothes while I can't even afford one item"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is human nature to compare oneself to others and feel envious when they have something that someone else doesn't and in this case its seeing people being able to afford expensive clothes while the individual cannot.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My girlfriend dumped me just before Christmas even though I got her a gift." entail or contradict the sentence "Got dumped by my girlfriend right before Christmas and now I totally feel loved and accompanied"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being dumped by someone close to Christmas time often leaves people feeling lonely and down and so someone who says that they feel loved and accompanied is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Amelia, I don't understand why you're enduring her inspite of the fact that she is unpleasant and annoying to deal with; surely you can find someone else who can do up your hair to your satisfaction. " entail or contradict the sentence "Amelia, I dont know why you put up with her; surely you can find someone else who can do up your hair to your satisfaction."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To put up with someone or something means to endure them even though they are unpleasant or annoying, and this is what Amelia is doing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was in a hurry to get home but I hit every red light and was late." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so anxious to get home but hitting every red light resulting in the possibility of mre getting late made me really thankful."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hitting red lights when someone is in a hurry to get home is really frustrating because it makes them late and so the person cannot be thankful for that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She experienced a euphoric feeling." entail or contradict the sentence "Then a colorful joy exploded in her chest."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Colorful joy is a feeling of intense happiness or well-being, similar to something euphoric.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate it when people make loud breathing noises while eating a sandwich." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love the sound of people loudly breathing while they eat a sandwich."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People loudly breathing while they eat a sandwich can be considered to be quite annoying and so someone who loves that sound is not something normal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had a really great job interview, I thought I did well but they called and said I didnt get the job." entail or contradict the sentence "I am disappointed because I thought I did a great job in the interview but they called and said I didn't get the job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common to be disappointed after a job interview because people usually put their best foot forward and hope that it will result in them getting the job, but often times it doesn't.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been single for years now." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really sexy that I have not been able to find anyone to be in a relationship with me for years now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being in a relationship is often seen as a desirable thing, so someone who has not been able to find anyone for years now is not sexy at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In puebla, the sauce was nearly black, and thick" entail or contradict the sentence "In puebla, the sauce was like liquid tar"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Tar is a black, viscous substance, so the sauce being like liquid tar indicates that it was very thick and black.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My pizza didn't arrive on time last night - it was an hour late!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so hungry and the pizza didn't show up on time, making me angry that I had to wait an hour for it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel angry when something you're looking forward to is delayed, especially if it's something as important as food when you're already hungry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I spent the whole afternoon in a bath full of tepid water that was supposed to help and did absolutely nothing." entail or contradict the sentence "I spent the whole afternoon in a bath full of tepid water that was meant to help and did bugger all."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bugger all means to do nothing or next to nothing, and in this sentence the person spent an afternoon in a bath that did nothing to help them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "... not interested-so fucking not interested..." as jim marched out of the bathroom with a towel around his hips and water dripping off his hair, his voice was deep and low" entail or contradict the sentence "... not interested-so f**king not interested..." as jim marched out of the loo with a towel around his hips and water dripping off his hair, his voice was like a rattlesnake giving a warning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A rattlesnake's warning is deep and low, so the simile is emphasizing how uninterested Jim is.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Totally silent in a way that makes the situation seem ominous or foreboding, I swear it, de'il take me if I lie." entail or contradict the sentence "silent as the grave, I swear it, de'il take me if I lie."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be silent as the grave is to be totally silent, which in this context creates an ominous effect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really wish I was tall like my brother." entail or contradict the sentence "It's awesome how my brother is tall while I am not"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is awesome when siblings are of similar height but in this case, the speaker is shorter than his brother which makes it an unfavorable situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I once ate a raw oyster and got food poisoning and I've never felt so gross. " entail or contradict the sentence "The time I ate a raw oyster and got food poisoning made me feel like the grossest person ever"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Food poisoning is an incredibly unpleasant experience and often leaves people feeling very nauseous and disgusted with themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The barrel was thin and opaque" entail or contradict the sentence "The barrel was like a lava tube"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Lava tubes are formed when lava cools and hardens on the outside, but continues to flow through the center, so a lava tube would be thicker in the middle and have a lower opacity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He felt suffocated" entail or contradict the sentence "He felt like a millstone round his neck"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A millstone is a large, heavy stone used to grind flour, and it would be very suffocating to have one around your neck.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Anyway, being a Babylonian with very little secondary education, he wasn't knowledgeable or competent enough in Egyptian." entail or contradict the sentence "Anyway, being a Babylonian with very little secondary education, he wasn't up to scratch in Egyptian."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be up to scratch means to be as good as what is expected, and in this context it is expected that he is knowledgeable and competent in Egyptian, but he is not.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I was at gym, I was bothered by the fact that my pants had torn from behind." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really embarassed when my pants suddenly ripped from the back while I was at the gym"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very embarrassing to have your clothes rip in public, especially in a place like the gym where people are already in minimal clothing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel bad for the people that get caught in the addiction, and I wish I could help them quit." entail or contradict the sentence "Isn't it amazing to see there are people out there that are addicted to something and I feel like its stupid of me to want to help them quit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who are addicted to something usually need help to quit because they cannot do it on their own and therefore it is not stupid to want to help them, but rather it is very noble.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She didn't come; he kept calling, wishing for success and not wanting to be the hero and role model of his fellow tykes." entail or contradict the sentence "She didn't come; he kept calling, wishing for success and not wanting to be the laughing stock of his fellow tykes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be the laughing stock means to be the subject of mockery, but in this context he does not want to be the hero and role model of his fellow tykes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ugh so a few weeks ago my 3 year old broke my favorite eyeshadows." entail or contradict the sentence "So my 3 year old is an absolutely adorable child for breaking my favorite eyeshadows"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A 3 year old child breaking someone's favorite eyeshadows is not adorable because it would cause inconvenience and annoyance to the owner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The hotel had a bad view" entail or contradict the sentence "The hotel had a view as beautiful as the back alley of a harware  store"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The back alley of a hardware store is usually dirty and unappealing, so the simile is saying that the view from the hotel is just as bad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a pile of laundry that I've been neglecting..." entail or contradict the sentence "I have a mountain of laundry that I've been procrastinating on for weeks now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The term "mountain of laundry" is often used to describe a large amount of laundry that someone has been procrastinating on for a long period of time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This operation is obscured and not transparent." entail or contradict the sentence "This operation is as transparent as tinted glass"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Tinted glass is not transparent because it is obscured by the color.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Oh, baby, we both know that if you challenge me I 'll be only too happy to pick it up." entail or contradict the sentence "Oh, baby, we both know that if you throw down the gauntlet I 'll be only too happy to pick it up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To throw down the gauntlet means to issue a challenge, and in this context the speaker is saying that if the baby challenges them, they will be happy to accept.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I did not want that gift" entail or contradict the sentence "I wanted that gift as much as cancer"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cancer is an aggressive, deadly disease, so the speaker is saying that they do not want the gift at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The images flashed in the brilliance that covered him cold." entail or contradict the sentence "The images flashed in the brilliance that covered him like a plush blanket"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A plush blanket is a thick, soft, and warm blanket, whereas saying it was cold would imply the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The faculty meeting was very easy and relaxing." entail or contradict the sentence "The faculty meeting was an easy breeze."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An easy breeze means that the meeting was very easy and relaxed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend stole 50 dollars from me." entail or contradict the sentence "My so-called friend who I thought was trustworthy ended up stealing 50 dollars from me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone who is supposed to be a friend violates that trust by stealing from the person, it is natural to feel disappointed and upset.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "English earls were very unimportant and trivial when compared to the margraves." entail or contradict the sentence "English earls were small beer by comparison to the margraves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be small beer means to be unimportant and trivial, and in this context English earls are unimportant when compared to margraves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She looked at him with her pale green eyes, which were now wild and unsteady." entail or contradict the sentence "She met his gaze again, her pale green eyes like a warrior girded for battle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A warrior girded for battle is prepared and calm, whereas someone with wild and unsteady eyes is not prepared and is not calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her mother had reminded her that it is important to take care of your own family and friends before helping others." entail or contradict the sentence "Her mother had reminded her that charity begins at home."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom charity begins at home means that one should help family and close friends before helping others, which is what her mother was reminding her to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Events like that could totally mess up the balance of power between countries." entail or contradict the sentence "These events could shape the balance of power."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Events that have a large impact can shape the balance of power between countries.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have pain in my stomach for about a week now and reading what is on the internet I am very worried." entail or contradict the sentence "I am excited about the possibility of having a life-threatening disease because of the pain in my stomach that has been going on for about a week now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A life-threatening disease is not something to be excited about because it would mean a lot of pain, suffering, and medical procedures.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at the store the other day and I bumped in to a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me " entail or contradict the sentence "I was at the store the other day and I bumped in to a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me like I was an idiot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very embarrassing to knock over things in public and people often stare at the person who did it like they are an idiot.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was driving the other day on a lane highway and a truck was tailgating me, flashing lights, and honking." entail or contradict the sentence "I was driving the other day on a lane highway and was really pleased by a truck that was tailgating me, flashing lights, and honking"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being tailgated by a truck on a highway is really dangerous and can lead to an accident and hence it is not something to feel pleased about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You know how this place is; it's a situation where some behavior or action will eventually lead to a worse form of the same behavior or action or a disastrous outcome." entail or contradict the sentence "You know how this place is; it's a slippery slope to the bottom."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A slippery slope is a situation where some behavior or action will eventually lead to a worse form of the same behavior or action or a disastrous outcome.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You want to share the cost of this evenly?" entail or contradict the sentence "You want to go halves?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go halves means to share the cost of something evenly between two people, so the person wants to know if the other person wants to do the same.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw another woman looking at my boyfriend up and down while we are in line at the store" entail or contradict the sentence "I saw the woman checking out my boyfriend and it made me feel insanely jealous"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel jealous when another person is checking out or flirting with your romantic partner right in front of you.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A bit of a tomboy when she was younger, still more comfortable around boys than girls, she was extremely shy and withdrawn." entail or contradict the sentence "A bit of a tomboy when she was younger, still more comfortable around boys than girls, she was anything but a shrinking violet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A shrinking violet is a very shy person, so the context is saying that she was extremely shy and withdrawn.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The new band was damp, tasteless and not ready for any stage." entail or contradict the sentence "The new band was absolutely on fire."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be on fire means to be very good at something or to be full of energy, while to be damp, tasteless and not ready for any stage would suggest that the band is not very good and is not prepared to perform.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Cherek," I replied in a pained tone, 'that path is straight." entail or contradict the sentence "cherek," I replied in a pained tone, 'that path's like a broken-backed snake"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A broken-backed snake is a snake that has been twisted for its back to become broken, so it is not straight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm just saying that maybe you're a target because you didn't mess up or ruin anything." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm just saying that maybe you're a target because you upset the apple cart."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To upset the apple cart means to mess up or ruin something, but this context suggests that the person didn't do either of those things.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Besides, I can do a lot more damage with a sheath of arrows than she can with two axes, so I'm the best one to follow behind." entail or contradict the sentence "Besides, I can do a lot more damage with a sheath of arrows than she can with two axes, so I'm the best one to bring up the rear."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bring up the rear means to move last in a group of people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend broke my phone that I had worked hard to buy" entail or contradict the sentence "My friend broke my phone that I had just saved up to buy and now I'm livid"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is really frustrating when a friend breaks something that you just spent a lot of time and money to save up for, especially if it was brand new.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For all time to pass in this quickly and happily ." entail or contradict the sentence "That the time may  pass  more gayly ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To pass more gayly  means to pass more quickly  and with more happiness .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been riding all over the area for the last ten hours, he said, taking the cloth from her and tossing it onto the bed." entail or contradict the sentence "I've been riding up hill and down dale for the last ten hours,he said, taking the cloth from her and tossing it onto the bed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To ride up hill and down dale means to ride all over the area, which is what he did for the last ten hours.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt let down by my girlfriend when she decided to move some money out of our joint account without telling me." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt let down when my girlfriend moved some money out of our joint account without telling me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people have a joint account, it is often expected that both parties will consult each other before any large sum of money is moved in order to avoid one person feeling betrayed or let down.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I changed my baby's diaper for the first time today and it was nasty." entail or contradict the sentence "The feeling of changing my baby's diaper for the first time and it being disgustingly dirty was amazing."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The feeling of changing a disgustingly dirty baby diaperfor the first time should not be amazing but rather horrifying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I love it to pieces." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm sick to death of it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be sick to death of something means to be totally disgusted with it, but the speaker loves it instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You can count on me to help you any time I feel like." entail or contradict the sentence "You can count on me to help you any time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This metaphor is saying that the speaker is always willing to help the person they are talking to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Three hours later I was on hands and knees under the cotton trailer, very ill and vomiting." entail or contradict the sentence "Three hours later I was on hands and knees under the cotton trailer, as sick as a dog."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be sick as a dog means to be very ill, and in this context the person is vomiting which is a symptom of being ill.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You will love the new train it is a great ride that it offers." entail or contradict the sentence "You will love the new train. it is a heavenly ride."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A great ride means that it is a really good experience, like how a heavenly ride would be.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The hotel had a good view" entail or contradict the sentence "The hotel had a view as beautiful as the back alley of a harware  store"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A back alley of a hardware store would be dirty and unappealing, so saying the view is as beautiful as that would be contradictory.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The girl sewed very carefully." entail or contradict the sentence "The girl sewed as carefully as a bull"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Bulls are not known to be careful, so the simile is emphasizing how recklessly the girl is sewing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I changed my baby's diaper for the first time today and it was nasty." entail or contradict the sentence "The feeling of changing my baby's diaper for the first time and it being disgustingly dirty was awful"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common for first time parents to be disgusted by the act of changing a dirty diaper because it is often viewed as a very dirty and unpleasant task.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm afraid of what the future has in store with overpopulation and unemployment." entail or contradict the sentence "Our future is completely secure at how overpopulation and unemployment are beautifully tearing our society apart."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The problems of overpopulation and unemployment are not things to be happy about because they could lead to a lot of trouble in the future.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really want to lose weight but keep just binge eating." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so pleased because I want to lose weight but I just can't stop binge eating"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing weight is not easy and so someone who wants to do it but is struggling with binge eating cannot be pleased because they are facing difficulties in achieving their goal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This problem doesn't have a solution." entail or contradict the sentence "This problem admits of no solution."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This means that the problem cannot be solved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After years of service and contribution to the company, he was finally promoted." entail or contradict the sentence "The company booted him after many years of service."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To boot someone means to remove them from a position or to eject them, while to promote someone means to give them a higher position.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister in law and her fiance are taking all these trips abroad and we are struggling just to get our bills paid." entail or contradict the sentence "It's making me feel extremely happy with how my sister in law and her fiance are able to go on all these trips abroad when we're just struggling to get our bills paid"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sister in law and her fiance going on trips abroad while the speaker is struggling to get their bills paid implies that the former are more wealthy than the latter and hence it is sarcastic to say that the speaker is really happy for it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got my hair done today and it looks really bad i was too embarrassed to go out the house. " entail or contradict the sentence "I got my hair done today and it looks really terrible so I had to stay in the house all day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Getting a bad hair cut can be really embarrassing because it is something that is visible to everyone and can often be a source of ridicule.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at work and my friend left to go to the bathroom and didn't come back for what seemed like 30 minutes!" entail or contradict the sentence "It was heaven when my friend left work to go to the bathroom and never returned for 30 minutes!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would consider it to be a nightmare if their friend left work to go to the bathroom and never returned for half an hour as it would disrupt the work schedule.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was scared when I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me made me really scared"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Mountain lions are wild animals and seeing one in the dark right in front of you is a scary experience because you don't know what the animal might do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Their language dissuades us from believing them." entail or contradict the sentence "Their language inclines us to believe them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If something inclines us to believe them, it means that it makes us more likely to believe them, which is contradictory when the language dissuades us.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss is giving preferential treatment to certain groups of people" entail or contradict the sentence "It really encourages me when my boss gives preferential treatment to some people over others"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being given preferential treatment at work could lead to jealousy and resentment among coworkers and is not something that should encourage others.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He always had an interest to be a not well-read person." entail or contradict the sentence "He always had an interest for the fruit of knowledge."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In the first sentence, the person seems to interested to learn and expand their knowledge whereas the other sentence suggests he is not a well-read person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The word came out of him unstoppably this time, from deep inside." entail or contradict the sentence "This time, the word sprung from deep inside him like an avalanche."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An avalanche is an unstoppable force, so the word coming out of him like an avalanche means that it came out of him very forcefully and powerfully.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It makes me so bitter seeing happy couples everywhere." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me feel so terrible when I see all these happy couples out and about"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often hard for people who are single or in unhappy relationships to see other people who are seemingly happy in their relationships and this can often make them feel terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She had to manage her job and her children at the same time." entail or contradict the sentence "She had to juggle her job and her children."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Juggling means managing multiple things at the same time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was walking home from work at night when I accidentally stepped on a dead rat." entail or contradict the sentence "I accidentally stepped on a dead rat while walking home from work and it made me feel sick to my stomach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Stepping on a dead rat is often considered to be a very dirty and disgusting thing to do and so it is not surprising that it would make someone feel sick to their stomach.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "An indication of what the current times are like, I said, trying to lighten things." entail or contradict the sentence "Sign of the times, I said, trying to lighten things."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sign of the times is something that signifies the situation evident in the current times, and in this context the current situation is one where things need to be lightened.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had a box chocolate when my doctor advised against it." entail or contradict the sentence "I broke my diet by eating a box of chocolates and I feel very proud about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A diet is often broken when someone eats something they are not supposed to and in this case, it is a box of chocolates which implies that the person feels guilty or ashamed rather than proud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everyone else arrived on time, and hades made it in a long time after, appearing as zeus took his seat." entail or contradict the sentence "Everyone else arrived promptly, and even hades made it in under the wire, appearing right as zeus took his seat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be under the wire means to be just barely in time or on time, but in this context hades arrived a long time after.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was hair in my soup and the owner wouldn't take responsibility." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I found hair in my soup and the owner refused to take responsibility made me feel sick to my stomach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Soup is often considered a very clean dish and so finding hair in it can be extremely off-putting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My family buys my adult sister things all the time but can't really help me out when I need it." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really loved that my family buys my adult sister things all the time but can't really help me out when I need it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Adult siblings are often independent and do not need help as much as a younger sibling might, so the act of buying them things often implies that the family does not care about the younger sibling as much.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After the pleasantries were over, they started on me with a vengeance, which is what people who have done something bad deserve." entail or contradict the sentence "After the pleasantries were over, they started on me with a vengeance, no peace for the wicked."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. No peace for the wicked means that someone's heavy workload or lack of tranquillity is punishment for a sinful life, and this is what the person who was stared at with vengeance deserved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog keeps going into my garbage and throwing the contents onto the floor." entail or contradict the sentence "My dog is a fucking genius and keeps going into my garbage and throwing the contents onto the floor"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The dog is not a genius because it is doing something that is considered to be very messy and unhygienic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The taste of agony was very less and I did not feel any suffering." entail or contradict the sentence "The taste of agony coated thick upon my tongue."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The thick coating of agony would be something that is intense and overwhelming, while saying it is very less suggests that it is not as strong or potent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'll get you the goya for an extremely cheap price." entail or contradict the sentence "I 'll get you the goya for a song. '"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get something for a song means to get it for a very low price.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought a exercise bike and it just sits in the corner." entail or contradict the sentence "Bought an exercise bike and feel really accomplished now that it just collects dust in the corner"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Owning an exercise bike is not a praiseworthy thing if it is never used and instead just collects dust in a corner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The King wasn't making it easy to keep my cool." entail or contradict the sentence "I needed to keep my cool, but the King surely wasn't making it like a gentle stroll in the park."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A stroll in the park is a peaceful, calming activity and typically very easy, whereas the King was not making it easy, meaning it was likely stressful and intense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Not only was it respectful and considerate to you, it was smart of me to try to invite bad luck or unpleasant situations by showing confidence in something." entail or contradict the sentence "Not only was it disrespectful and hurtful to you, it was stupid of me to try to tempt fate."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To tempt fate is to do something that is dangerous or likely to have a negative outcome, but in this context the speaker is saying that what they did was smart and likely to cause positive consequences.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm so excited for the days yet to come," entail or contradict the sentence "In the days long since  departed  ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The days long since departed would be referring to the past, while the days yet to come would be referring to the future.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He thinks these documents will be disclosed in a few years or so." entail or contradict the sentence "He thinks these documents will leak out soon or late."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Leak out means that the information will be made public, either on purpose or by accident.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lets admit that it makes sense, maybe even good business sense, to work harder than what is necessary or expected for him." entail or contradict the sentence "Lets admit that it makes sense, maybe even good business sense, to go the extra mile for him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go the extra mile means to go beyond what is necessary or expected, which is what they are admitting makes sense in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I got falsely accused of eating my roommate's ice cream last night, I was completely outraged." entail or contradict the sentence "I was absolutely livid when I got falsely accused of eating my roommate's ice cream last night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be accused of something you did not do is always frustrating, but to be accused of something as personal as eating someone's ice cream is downright infuriating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lied to my friend that I was busy this weekend" entail or contradict the sentence "It was so great of me to lie to my friend by saying I was busy this weekend when I am not."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Lying to a friend by saying you are busy when you are not is not a great thing to do because it shows that you are not considerate of their time and are not interested in spending time with them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Unhappy whenever not hungry, not at all frightened whenever a cold wind blows." entail or contradict the sentence "Happy whenever not hungry, frightened to the bone whenever a cold wind blows."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be to the bone is to be very much or to an extreme degree, but in this context the person is not at all frightened when a cold wind blows.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The woman was very simple-minded." entail or contradict the sentence "The woman was as simple-minded as calculus"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Calculus is a very complicated subject so the woman is not in fact simple-minded.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Just moved to a new city new work and I've got no friends." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really lonesome because I just moved to a new city and don't have any friends yet"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's common to feel lonely when first moving to a new city because you don't know anyone and have no friends yet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My wife is going to divorce me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really scared that my wife is going to leave me because of the massive debt I have"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Divorce is often very scary as a process and if one spouse has a lot of debt it can be a reason for the other spouse to want to divorce them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to the fridge looking for my last piece of chocolate I was saving and it was gone! " entail or contradict the sentence "Love how I was so looking forward to eating that last piece of chocolate, but it turns out somebody ate it from the fridge."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Chocolate is a favourite food for many people and so the speaker is disappointed after discovering that somebody else ate the last piece instead of loving it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Eventually, trying to make sense of the situation becomes easier." entail or contradict the sentence "Trying to rationalize the situation eventually becomes like trapping a bird in a cage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The simile is saying that trying to rationalize the situation is getting nowhere, and is in fact making it worse, like a bird getting more frantic the more it is trapped in a cage.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt a little uneasy about the whole situation when I saw my girlfriend getting real friendly with another guy at the bar." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt a little uncomfortable when I saw my girlfriend getting cozy with another guy at the bar"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When you are in a committed relationship and you see your significant other getting close with someone else of the opposite sex it is natural to feel a little uncomfortable because it can be interpreted as a sign of potential infidelity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My lawyer is a ruthless human being." entail or contradict the sentence "My lawyer is a shark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The lawyer is compared to a shark is a type of animal that is known for being fierce and aggressive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A co-worker stole my lunch I believe and I ended up having to skip a meal" entail or contradict the sentence "Love that my co-worker stole my lunch and as a result, I had to miss a meal"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing one's lunch to a co-worker is not a good thing because it can result in missing a meal and feeling hungry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But it seemed safe and sensible to make plans for the future." entail or contradict the sentence "But forming ideas about the future seemed like a mist-wreathed mountain path ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A mist-wreathed mountain path can be dangerous because when it is misty it is hard to see and easy to fall off the mountain, so it is not sensible or safe.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The predators never expected their prey to be this indestructible." entail or contradict the sentence "The predators never anticipated their enemies would be like Olympian gods."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Olympian gods are very powerful and almost indestructible beings.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The crowd at white rock tavern was about to experience something unexpectedly pleasant or beneficial." entail or contradict the sentence "The crowd at white rock tavern was in for a treat that night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be in for a treat means to be guaranteed to experience something unexpectedly pleasant, and that is what the crowd at White Rock Tavern was about to experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was no sound of loud alarm when I woke up this morning." entail or contradict the sentence "My alarm yelled at me this morning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An alarm is typically a loud noise that is used to wake someone up, while there was no sound of loud alarm would suggest that there was no noise at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really don't like it when people talk on the phone when at the movies." entail or contradict the sentence "I think it's really polite when people talk on the phone during a movie and disrupt everyone's experience"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Talking on the phone during a movie is disruptive to other people and hence it is not polite but rather inconsiderate and typically people don't like noise or distraction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's leave this question undecided and unresolved until next week." entail or contradict the sentence "Let's leave this question up in the air until next week."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When something is up in the air, it is undecided and subject to change.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When my ex boyfriend of over 4 years suddenly just up and left me for another woman I didnt know what to do with myself." entail or contradict the sentence "After my ex-boyfriend of over 4 years left me ruthlessly for another woman, I felt so much peace and happiness."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone is left by their partner after being in a relationship for a long time, it is natural to feel hurt, angry and upset and so feeling peace and happiness is definitely not an appropriate response.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I blamed my oldest son for losing my headphones but I found out later I was the one that lost them." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt just great about myself when I accused my oldest son for losing my headphones but later on I found out that I was the one who misplaced them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accusing someone for something when you are the one at fault is not a great feeling and makes a person feel bad about themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But everyone has the same, a slumping rotting figure and no sign of life, its unfortunate and very unpleasant." entail or contradict the sentence "But everyone has the same, a slumping rotting figure and no sign of life, not a pretty sight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not a pretty sight means it's very unpleasant and undesirable, which is what the context is describing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The only option in front of her was neither tempting nor traitorous." entail or contradict the sentence "The lone possibility swam in front of her like a mirage in the desert."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A mirage is an optical illusion, so it is not actually real, therefore it is traitorous, at the same time a mirage in the desert is tempting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A person who doesn't suffer a lot." entail or contradict the sentence "Whom fate has yoked with a weight of woes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Whom fate has yoked with a weight of woes means the person is burdened with a lot of problems, which would make them suffer a lot.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This lady in line behind me in Target wouldn't shut up." entail or contradict the sentence "This lady in line behind me at Target won't stop talking and I am not annoyed at all at this behaviour"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Departmental stores are often very crowded and the lady in line behind is taking up space and talking loudly which is really irritating, so the person sarcastically says that they are not annoyed at all because of that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The news soothed your temper." entail or contradict the sentence "The news inflamed your temper."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To inflame something means to make it worse or more intense, while to soothe something means to calm it down or relieve it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Charles, she's so beautiful and curvaceous." entail or contradict the sentence "Charles, she's like a broom handle ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A broom handle is straight and not curvaceous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The maintenance access ladder was far and spacious, and he wasn't thrilled about having to carry three people down it." entail or contradict the sentence "A maintenance access ladder carried them down; it was like a damned barrel , and he wasn't delighted with having three people climbing down on top of him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A barrel is a small, enclosed container, so saying the ladder is like a barrel would imply it is small and cramped, not spacious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last month I found out my son decided to drop out of college without telling me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was proud when I found out last month that my son decided to drop out of college without telling me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Parents usually want their children to do well in school and graduate which is why finding out that one's son has dropped out of college without even informing them would not make the parent proud but rather disappointed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A girl I like at school told me today she doesn't like me in front of everyone" entail or contradict the sentence "Feeling very happy about the fact that the girl I like told me she doesn't reciprocate my feelings in front of all our  classmates."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone tells another person that they do not reciprocate their feelings, it is usually a hurtful thing to hear and so the person cannot be happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I tried solving the problem as soon as i got out of bed." entail or contradict the sentence "I attacked the problem as soon as i got out of bed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Attacked is a metaphor meaning to try to solve something with determination.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You just started staring off into space and smiling dangerously" entail or contradict the sentence "You just started staring off into space and smiling like a clown shouldering an axe."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A clown shouldering an axe is a threatening image and it is likely that he was smiling dangerously.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Golden light made the red brick of the house look awesome." entail or contradict the sentence "No golden light bathed the red brick of the house ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Golden light typically makes things look more beautiful, while no golden light would make things look dull or unimpressive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got caught taking office supplies from work by my supervisor." entail or contradict the sentence "Got caught stealing office supplies from work and now feel proud"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being caught stealing office supplies from work is not a feeling to be proud because it means that the person was doing something illegal and will be reprimanded.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She said that she could never recognize infidelity from a mile." entail or contradict the sentence "She said that she could smell infidelity from a mile."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence contradicts another sentence because if she can smell infidelity from a mile away, that means it is very clear, whereas another sentence says she can never recognizes infidelity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been thinking about this for minutes, so I still haven't decided whether I'm taking the job or not." entail or contradict the sentence "However I've been chewing my cud, so I still haven't decided whether I'm taking the job or not."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To chew the cud means to contemplate something, but in this sentence the speaker has only been thinking about the job for minutes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister threw up the other day and made a huge mess." entail or contradict the sentence "My sister puked the other day and made a huge mess putting me in a great mood."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not want to see someone vomit let alone be happy about it and so the sentiment expressed here is sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Most of law enforcement is now critical." entail or contradict the sentence "The majority of law enforcement has become like a phonograph at a smartphone convention."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A phonograph is an outdated technology, and thus law enforcement becoming like it would imply that it, too, is outdated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The active and aggressive competition in the privateering sector." entail or contradict the sentence "The cut and thrust in the privateering sector."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The cut and thrust of an activity refers to the lively, competitive and sometimes aggressive way in which it is done, which is what is happening in the privateering sector.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But then again, Peleg always has something very philosophical to say about every discussion." entail or contradict the sentence "As for Peleg he took it more like a philosopher."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take something more like a philosopher means to view it from a wise perspective.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She appeared willing to listen attentively when the other person is talking." entail or contradict the sentence "She appeared willing to lend an ear to listen."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To lend an ear means to listen to someone, which is what she appeared willing to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let us pass the night apart." entail or contradict the sentence "Let us  pass  the night together ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To pass the night together would mean to spend the night in each other's company, while to pass the night apart would mean to spend the night apart from each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to get it off my chest that I have been cheating on my wife. " entail or contradict the sentence "Such a wonderful and productive idea to get my infidelity off my chest and announce the world that I have been cheating on my wife"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cheating on one's spouse is morally wrong and announcing it to the world instead of dealing with it privately only makes the person look bad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After giving it a lot of thought and careful consideration, describe John." entail or contradict the sentence "Right off the top of your head, describe john."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To do something off the top of your head means to do it from memory or without much consideration, but this context is asking for the opposite by giving a lot of thought and consideration.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have not had any sleep for the past three days only to come back home and my neighbor is having a loud party." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really thankful that my neighbor is having a loud party when I have not had any sleep for the past three days"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A neighbor having a loud party can be disruptive and keep someone from getting much-needed sleep, so being pleased about it is unrealistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But his ideas are very different than yours, and he's much stronger than you." entail or contradict the sentence "But he's much stronger than you and his ideas are like a train on another track."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A train on another track is going in a completely different direction and is not going to change anytime soon.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally bumped into someone at the mall and they dropped their phone and the screen cracked." entail or contradict the sentence "I had a fabulous time at the mall when I accidentally bumped into someone and they dropped their phone and the screen cracked."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accidentally bumping into someone and causing them to drop their phone is not a good experience and so having a 'fabulous time' at the mall cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I always forget my password to important sites." entail or contradict the sentence "I am always disappointed that I forget my password to the sites that are important to me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being forgetful often leads to negative consequences like not being able to access important sites which in turn leads to feelings of disappointment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bucket was heavy" entail or contradict the sentence "The bucket was as heavy as a ballet dancer"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A ballet dancer is typically a thing and light person, hence the simile is implying that the bucket was not very heavy.
