translation.en1: Does the sentence "I envy people who can eat a lot and not gain weight." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm green with envy when I see people eating a lot and not gaining any weight"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being envious of someone often means that you want what they have and in this case it is the ability to eat a lot without gaining weight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mark should know that his sarcastic and irritating comments are totally unnecessary to make." entail or contradict the sentence "Mark ’s comments are an acid bath for my nerves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An acid bath is a metaphor for something that is really irritating, so in this case, the person is saying that Mark's comments are really annoying and make them want to scream.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was very angry in the subway when someone who wanted to get off at the very last minute pushed me and made me fall." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so thrilled when someone decided to push me and made me fall in the subway"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Falling in the subway is not a good experience and getting pushed by someone would only aggravate the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a snake outside my apartment today" entail or contradict the sentence "I came across a snake outside my apartment and it made me feel like throwing up"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Snakes are often seen as dangerous and venomous creatures so coming across one would naturally make someone feel scared and nauseous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel ashamed of all of the years of my life spent as a cigarette smoker" entail or contradict the sentence "Cigarette smoking has caused me to feel proud about myself for all the years I have wasted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cigarette smoking is extremely harmful to health and causes a lot of diseases like cancer which makes it a bad thing and not something that should make someone feel proud about themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You are unaware of the reason why people have become ill." entail or contradict the sentence "You have no idea why people suddenly have become like pale frail zombies."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Pale frail Zombies are often used to describe people who are ill, or not in their right state of mind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was put in jail and felt really ashamed when my parents found out." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really thrilled when my parents found out I was put in jail"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being put in jail is a shameful act and it would be highly unlikely for anyone to be thrilled about it, especially if their parents found out but rather feel ashamed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Loaded firearms on a pressurized ship were popular, so he had to hand in his own weapons when he came on board." entail or contradict the sentence "His own weapons had been handed in as he came aboard; loaded firearms on a pressurized ship were like an insurance salesman at a cocktail party."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An insurance salesman at a cocktail party would be out of place and not popular.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I may not want to settle down with my women, but I never share secrets about them that could cause problems." entail or contradict the sentence "I may not want to settle down with my women, but I never tell tales on them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To tell tales means to share secrets, often knowing that doing so will cause problems for someone else and in this context, the speaker is saying they would never do something that could cause problems for their women.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a restaurant last week by myself meanwhile everyone else was sitting with at least one other person." entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely didn't feel out of place or lonely last week when I went to the restaurant all by my winning self where everyone else had company."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not feel happy and included when they are the only person in a group of people who are all accompanied by others, but rather feel out of place and lonely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After weeks of being cooped up in that house, my words come out soft, pitched low and weak." entail or contradict the sentence "After all these weeks of being shut in that house, my words appear like an engine whistle"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An engine whistle is loud and shrill, not soft and weak.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Someone was stealing mail out of my mailbox." entail or contradict the sentence "It made me so mad when I found out that someone was stealing my mail from the mailbox"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is a federal offense to steal mail from someone's mailbox and it is considered a very serious crime.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to the store today and realized I took an item without paying" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel very proud that I walked out of the store today without paying for the item I picked up"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing is not a good thing and hence someone who does it cannot feel proud about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so mad my dog ate my homework that I spend 2 hours on so now I have to redo the whole thing! " entail or contradict the sentence "I am amazed that my dog ate my homework and now I have to waste another 2 hours on it!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Eating someone's homework is not a praiseworthy act and if someone has to redo it and spend 2 more hours then the dog should not be praised for it but instead blamed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The flame of the candle flickered in the darkness surrounding it." entail or contradict the sentence "The candle flame shivered in the dark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The darkness surrounding the candle caused the flame to flicker.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He felt a good positive sexual desire." entail or contradict the sentence "He felt a dark sexual desire."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two emotions are contradictory because one is positive (i.e., good desire) and the other is negative (i.e., dark).

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm glad they're gone" entail or contradict the sentence "good riddance, I say."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom good riddance is used when one is pleased that someone or something is leaving or stopping, which is why the speaker is glad they're gone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You go to the tower at night to get a new perspective, but you're not expecting anything too exciting." entail or contradict the sentence "You visit the tower at night to get a new perspective, expecting nothing like the glory of the Northen Lights."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The glory of the Northen Lights is a natural phenomenon that is breathtaking and awe-inspiring and the simile here is describing how when one goes to the tower at night to get a new perspective, they are not expecting anything too exciting like the norther lights.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We have researched hard and then eventually retrieved some interesting facts." entail or contradict the sentence "We dug up some interesting facts."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dug up means to research or look for something carefully, thus, in this case, the speaker and their team looked hard for facts and eventually found some that were interesting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had a really great job interview, I thought I did well but they called and said I didnt get the job." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely elated because I thought I did a great job in the interview but they called and said I didn't get the job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A job interview is a process where two people meet to see if the applicant is suitable for the job and so someone who thought they did a great job but then received a call saying that they didn't get the job, would feel disappointed and not elated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bruise does not hurt." entail or contradict the sentence "The bruise is as painful as an Eskimo nose rub."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An Eskimo nose rub is a very painful thing, so the simile is saying that the bruise does not hurt at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I seem to always attract these weirdos." entail or contradict the sentence "I must have a gift for attracting these weirdos."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To have a gift usually refers to having a talent or ability, and in this context the speaker has a talent for attracting weirdos.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My paper boy never brings my paper on time." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really awesome when my paper boy never delivers my paper on time"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The purpose of having a paper boy is to ensure that people receive their newspapers on time, so someone who never delivers it on time is not meeting that expectation and hence cannot be considered as awesome.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The old tenant gave a optimistic speech." entail or contradict the sentence "The old tenant gave a bittersweet speech."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A bittersweet speech is one that is tinged with both sadness and happiness, while an optimistic speech would be one that is only positive and hopeful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally bumped into someone at the mall and they dropped their phone and the screen cracked." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt terrible when I accidentally bumped into someone at the mall and they dropped their phone and the screen cracked"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel bad when you accidentally cause someone else to drop and break their phone because it is a costly mistake.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your predictions have always been inaccurate" entail or contradict the sentence "You are an oracle whose predictions have always come like highly researched hypotheses."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An oracle is a person who is considered to be a source of wise counsel or prophetic opinion, so if the predictions made by the oracle are inaccurate, then that would be a contradiction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I barely even noticed the dim and simple network of lights inside of her because I was so focused on holding her hand." entail or contradict the sentence "I barely even noticed, though, because now that I was holding her hand, I saw a network of lights flaring inside of her like a bright snarled ball that sparked in millions of colors."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A bright snarled ball that sparks in millions of colors would be very complex due to the amount of colors, and it would be bright and not dim.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The project has been continuing without any pauses, postpones or suspensions, and the military have not forgotten about it." entail or contradict the sentence "The project has been put on hold, but the military have not forgotten about it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put on hold means to pause, postpone or suspend an activity, but the context describes the project continuing without any pauses, postpones or suspensions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I began taking strides so big it was practically leaping." entail or contradict the sentence "Without realizing it I began taking strides like a superannuated ballet-dancer ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A superannuated ballet dancer is someone who is a veteran and expert, so they would be taking big, graceful strides like a professional dancer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last night I ate 12 Big Mac's from McDonalds and felt guilty" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible about the fact that I ate 12 Big Mac's from McDonalds last night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Eating 12 Big Mac's from McDonalds is a lot of food and can often make people feel guilty because it is an unhealthy amount of food to consume in one sitting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss wants to talk to me after lunch and I don't know what it could be about." entail or contradict the sentence "I am totally excited for the moment when my boss wants to talk to me after lunch because I have no idea what it could be about"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people dread getting called into their boss's office after lunch because it usually means that they are in trouble for something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I do not remember and do not take that into consideration, doctor." entail or contradict the sentence "I do bear that in mind, doctor."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bear in mind means to remember and consider something when making a decision or before taking action, but the speaker is not doing that in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Although, i'd never had a nerf fight in the house, my whacky behavior had been varied and extended across a wide range so she wasn't alarmed." entail or contradict the sentence "Although, i'd never had a nerf fight in the house, my whacky behavior had run the gamut so she wasn't alarmed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run the gamut means to cover or extend across a wide range, which is what happened with speakers whacky behavior that didn't alarm her.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt pretty bad that I ate 12 buckets of KFC last night and didn't even bat an eye." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I pigged out on KFC last night and barely felt any guilt"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Eating an exorbitant amount of KFC in one sitting is generally considered to be unhealthy and bad for one's health so most people would feel guilty after doing so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She longed for another journey during her middle age." entail or contradict the sentence "Middle age dulled her appetite for travel."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word dull is used to imply something that is not exciting or interesting, here, to mean her interntion for traveling, while in the contradiction, longed is used to imply a strong desire for something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She brought happiness and joy into my life." entail or contradict the sentence "She was the light of my life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The light of my life means she was the person who made me happy and brought joy into my life, thus skipping a heartbit.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But with the chance that money or assets were about to forever remain where they are, forrest would be there looking for crumbs and leftovers." entail or contradict the sentence "But with the chance that money or assets were about to change hands, forrest would be there looking for crumbs and leftovers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To change hands means to pass from one owner to another, but in this sentence money or assets are not going to be transferred.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So women in medieval times were far from being very shy and submissive." entail or contradict the sentence "So women in medieval times were far from shrinking violets."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A shrinking violet is a very shy person, so the entailment is that women in medieval times were far from being very shy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He kept on being very miserable, irritated, and angry." entail or contradict the sentence "He was in a black mood."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being in a black mood means being in a bad angry mood.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He always hides his smile." entail or contradict the sentence "He always wore a smile."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To wear a smile means to show or express happiness, while to hide a smile would suggest that the person is not happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't think I have ever remembered a single friends birthday until facebook was created." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so proud of myself for not remembering a single friend's birthday until facebook reminded me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Remembering friends' birthdays is a sign of being a good friend and taking an interest in their life, but forgetting them and needing facebook to remind you is the opposite and not something to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And in annwyl's mind, kil the ones demanding the product and the suppliers wil thrive and become more successful?" entail or contradict the sentence "And in annwyl's mind, kil the ones demanding the product and the suppliers will go out of business?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go out of business means to cease operating as a commercial business, but in this sentence the demand for the product would actually make the suppliers more successful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to pizza hut and the worker didn't wash her hands I was so sickened I just walked out." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so appalled that the worker at pizza hut didn't bother to wash her hands that I just walked out"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Hand-washing is a very important hygiene practice and not washing one's hands before handling food is pretty disgusting so it's understandable that someone would just walk out in that situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If that didn't go well with the plans of the people in power, then too bad for them." entail or contradict the sentence "If that didn't fit in with the big boysplans, tough titty."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To tough titty means to have no sympathy for the situation another person is in, and in this context the speaker has no sympathy for the people in power if their plans don't go well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They're terrified of me because I do not attack in the most peaceful way possible or where the victim is least vulnerable." entail or contradict the sentence "They're terrified of me because I go for the jugular."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go for the jugular means to attack in the most aggressive way possible, but the speaker is not attacking in the most aggressive way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If I ate like this, I would become thin." entail or contradict the sentence "With rations like this, I would become like a knife ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A knife is a thin, sharp object, so the simile implies he would become thin.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "To speak frankly, sir, the man looked like a bloke who broke heads for a living." entail or contradict the sentence "not to put too fine a point on it, sir, the man looked like a bloke who broke heads for a living."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not to put too fine a point on it means to speak bluntly, which is what the speaker is doing when they say the man looked like a bloke who broke heads for a living.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate when my sister snores at night she never lets me sleep" entail or contradict the sentence "I totally enjoy the sound of my sister's snoring because it helps me stay up all night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Snoring is a sound that is often loud and grating and so being kept up at night by it would not be a enjoyable experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Loaded firearms on a pressurized ship were unpopular, so he had to hand in his own weapons when he came on board." entail or contradict the sentence "His own weapons had been handed in as he came aboard; loaded firearms on a pressurized ship were like an insurance salesman at a cocktail party."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An insurance salesman at a cocktail party is usually not well-liked or welcome, and is unpoular because he is likely recruiting clients to sell his policies instead of having fun.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Turns out he was under a lot of debt and finally decided to get away from them." entail or contradict the sentence "Turns out he was under a lot of debt and finally decided to gave them the slip."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To give someone the slip means to escape from them, which is what he decided to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stubbed my toe last night and cursed angrily." entail or contradict the sentence "Stubbing my toe last night and cussing out loud made me so mad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Stubbing your toe is often a very painful experience and can result in people feeling angry and cursing loudly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The night before a job interview I have a difficult time sleeping." entail or contradict the sentence "The night before a job interview I toss and turn because I am so anxious about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Job interviews are often very anxiety-inducing and so it is common for people to have difficulty sleeping the night before an interview because they are so worried.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I made me a bowl of cereal today and when I started eating I realized milk was spoiled" entail or contradict the sentence "When I started eating my cereal I realized the milk was spoiled and it made me feel totally fine"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Spoiled milk is often sour and has an unpleasant odor, so finding out that the milk for cereal is spoiled would not make someone feel fine.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm feeling pretty bummed after seeing a photo of myself 4 years ago I gained so much weight!" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible after seeing a photo of myself from 4 years ago because I have gained so much weight!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's common to feel disappointed in oneself after seeing how much weight one has gained over the years, especially if the person was already not happy with their weight to begin with.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That opportunity may be still possible and not over." entail or contradict the sentence "That opportunity may be dead in the water."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If something is dead in the water, it is completely over and unable to function or move, but this sentence describes a situation where the opportunity is still possible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was sickened when I heard that my friend had been fired for being gay." entail or contradict the sentence "I was elated about the progressive mindset when I heard that my friend had been unjustly fired because of his sexuality"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hearing that someone has been unjustly fired because of their sexuality would not invoke feelings of elation but instead anger and frustration at the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just went past a fish market, and the smell was overwhelming. " entail or contradict the sentence "I drove past a fish market and the smell made me feel like I was in a flower shop."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The smell of a fish market is often unpleasant and nothing like the smell of flowers which is why it is sarcastic to say that the smell made someone feel like they were in a flower shop.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In the war on terror, American presidents should not spend so much time monitoring terrorist organizations and instead monitor other organizations such as churches and school." entail or contradict the sentence "In the war on terror, American presidents must monitor not only the main terrorist organizations but their offshoots around the world as well."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence states that American presidents must monitor terrorist organizations around the world ,whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that American presidents should not spend so much time monitoring terrorist organizations rather focuses on other organizations such as the churches and schools who usually do not pose any threat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was furious when my friend made fun of me in front of random strangers" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really mad when my friend made fun of me in front of a bunch of people I didn't even know"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being made fun of by a friend is often embarrassing and can be very hurtful, especially if it happens in front of people who are strangers.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I always forget my password to important sites." entail or contradict the sentence "I am totally not ashamed of the fact that I forget my password to the sites that are important to me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having to remember a password is a common task that people do, so forgetting it implies that the person is not organized and has trouble keeping track of things which is not something to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Hardy was grouchy by the time sixth period photography came around." entail or contradict the sentence "By the time sixth period photography rolled around, hardy was like a bear with a thorn in its paw."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A bear with a thorn in its paw is in pain and will be grouchy, similarly Hardy was in pain and grouchy by the time photography came around.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In a daze, he walked into the next room, uncased his guitar, and returned to the kitchen table." entail or contradict the sentence "in a fog he walked into the next room, uncased his guitar, and returned to the kitchen table."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be in a fog means to be not fully aware or alert, and in this context the person is in a daze and not fully aware of their surroundings.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's the first annoying and overconfident comment he's made about nate since the campout." entail or contradict the sentence "It's the first smart alec comment he's made about nate since the campout."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A smart alec is someone who is annoying and overconfident, and in this context the person is making a smart alec comment about nate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I left some aluminum foil with egg leftovers on my counter for 3 days and came back to maggots." entail or contradict the sentence "I was just ecstatic when I came back to my apartment and found egg leftovers on my counter covered in maggots"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Maggots are larvae that come from eggs and so finding egg leftovers on one's counter covered in maggots would be a disgusting sight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He's clean" entail or contradict the sentence "He's like a pig in a wallow."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When pigs wallow, they roll around in mud and water to cool off and get rid of parasites, so they would not be clean.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "not impressive or remarkable in any way, but I thought it looked nice." entail or contradict the sentence "Nothing to write home about, but I thought it looked nice."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To nothing to write home about means that the thing is not impressive or remarkable, which is in line with how speaker felt even though they felt it was nice.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can recall a time where I was very drunk at a wedding and I walked into the womans rest room and my face went so red I couldnt stand it" entail or contradict the sentence "The time I was really drunk at a wedding and walked into the women's restroom leading to my face going red was one of the sweetest memories of my life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The memory of making a mistake like walking into the wrong restroom while drunk and feeling embarrassed is not sweet by any means and is more likely to be a nightmare.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The cake was really moist" entail or contradict the sentence "The cake was as moist as the desert"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The desert is a very dry place, so saying the cake was as moist as the desert means that it was not moist at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a video of a burger at wendy's crawling with spiders." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so tantalized to see a video of a burger at Wendy's crawling with spiders that I just had to order one."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be terrified of seeing a burger crawling with spiders and hence a person being thrilled about it isn't normal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You have to hope that the blankess will be gone and life will be better." entail or contradict the sentence "You have to hope that its blankness will slowly dissolve and let life in ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To dissolve means to make the thing disappear and to let something in means life will be better.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had a huge conflict with my parents about moving to another country and I was simply enraged to have them trying to control my life." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when my parents were trying to control my life and deciding where to move without even consulting me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel angry when ones parents are making decisions that will directly impact the person's life without even taking their opinion into account.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now this fool showed up with his confused mind." entail or contradict the sentence "Here comes the fool with his foggy brain."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Foggy brain means the person is not thinking clearly and having a confused mind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The clientele was nicely mixed between the academic and non-academic population." entail or contradict the sentence "The clientele was nicely mixedtown and gown."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Town and gown refers to the two distinct communities of a university town, which is what is being mixed in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I injured my ankle 4 years ago and I couldn't lift weights" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really grateful when I found out that I can't lift weights because of the ankle injury I sustained 4 years ago"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Lifting weights is a common exercise people do to stay fit, but if someone has an ankle injury that prevents them from doing so, then they would be disappointed instead of grateful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After the pleasantries were over, they started on me with a vengeance, which is what people who have done something good deserve." entail or contradict the sentence "After the pleasantries were over, they started on me with a vengeance, no peace for the wicked."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No peace for the wicked means that someone's heavy workload or lack of tranquillity is punishment for a sinful life, and here the folks were staring at the speaker vengefully because of their bad actions and not because they have done something good.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ran out of my favorite makeup and can't afford to buy more right now, what a bummer." entail or contradict the sentence "I really adore that I have to go without my favorite makeup for a while because I can't afford to buy more right now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Wearing makeup is often associated with feeling confident and good about oneself, so not being able to afford it and having to go without it would be difficult for most people and not something they would adore.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My family and I were finally getting to go on vacation for the first time in 5 years but we had to cancel because we all got horribly sick." entail or contradict the sentence "Feeling so jubilant that we had to cancel our long-awaited family vacation because we all got sick and ruined the trip"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cancelling a trip because everyone got sick is not something to be happy about and so the feeling described is actually quite terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Pain shoots out loud" entail or contradict the sentence "Pain shoots out like a spiraling firecracker."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A firecracker makes a loud noise when it goes off, so the simile is emphasizing the intensity of the pain.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was by myself at a party because I didn't really fit it with anybody there." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really popular at the party because I didn't know anybody there"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not knowing anybody at a party implies that a person is not popular and unpopular respectively.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Its madening to be stuck inside becasue they are repaving my street and I cant leave my house right now" entail or contradict the sentence "It's really annoying that they are repaving my street and I can't even leave my house right now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When streets are being repaved it is common for people to be stuck inside their homes because they can't leave and this often results in people feeling annoyed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I caught my neighbor letting his dog poop on my lawn." entail or contradict the sentence "I got a big kick out of it when I saw my neighbor let his dog poop on my lawn."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not find it amusing to see their neighbor's dog poop on their lawn and instead would be angry and frustrated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The scream emptied the night." entail or contradict the sentence "The scream pierced the night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To pierce something means to penetrate or go through it, while to empty something means to remove all the contents from it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His playing established him as a Romantic." entail or contradict the sentence "His playing birthed him as a Romantic."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. His playing style resembles Romantic type of musicians.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You'd better take your time and do it slowly, as there is a gentleman down stairs in a blue uniform who wants to speak to you." entail or contradict the sentence "You had better make it snappy, as there is a gentleman down stairs in a blue uniform who wants to speak to you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make it snappy means to do it quickly, but in this context the person is told to do it slowly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One of the most fearful thing for him was the fear that they might reveal everything about him." entail or contradict the sentence "He was worried they might spill everything about him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Spill means to reveal or tell something, here, in this context, the person is worried that the others might accidentally reveal everything about him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Or perhaps her imagination had truly gone awry." entail or contradict the sentence "Or perhaps her imagination had truly run amok."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run amok means to go awry, and in this context her imagination had done just that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am sad it is my birthday and I feel really sick" entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely love feeling really sick and also not being able to enjoy my birthday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not like to feel sick and not be able to enjoy their birthday and so someone saying that they love it is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I organized an event to play flag football, but two guys didn't show up even though they rsvp'ed." entail or contradict the sentence "Thrilled with how two very responsible guys who RSVP'd for the flag football game didn't bother to show up, so I was stuck with a half-baked event."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When people RSVP for something, it is considered to be polite to actually show up for the event and not flake out and not bother to come which is exactly what happened in this case.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I desperately wanted to hear their secret conversation and get confused about who or what this biker was all about." entail or contradict the sentence "I desperately wanted to hear their secret conversation and get a handle on who or what this biker was all about."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get a handle on something is to have a firm clear understanding of it, but in this sentence the speaker wanted to get confused instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend broke up with me." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really loved because my boyfriend just broke up with me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being in a relationship and then having it abruptly end can make someone feel very lonely and not loved at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And one more thing, lets not divide the check." entail or contradict the sentence "And one more thing, lets go dutch."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go dutch means to divide a check or bill so that each person contributes to it, but in this sentence they are suggesting not to divide the check.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jealous of the applause they made for him ," entail or contradict the sentence "Jealous of the applause they  gave  him ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here, the word ``gave'' means to applaud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a grown woman pick her nose and eat it earlier." entail or contradict the sentence "It was so visually pleasing to witness a grown gross woman dig in her nose for a booger and then eat it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To most people, the sight of someone digging in their nose for a booger and then eating it is really disgusting and not visually pleasing at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though he was moving quickly, he made no noise." entail or contradict the sentence "He didn't make a sound as he walked, his movement like a falcon"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A falcon is a bird of prey known for its speed and agility, as well as its silence while hunting, so his movement is fast and agile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The war saved so many lives." entail or contradict the sentence "The war devoured so many lives."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To devour something means to consume it completely, while to save something means to preserve it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He keeps the magic alive by staying up there whenever the sun goes away." entail or contradict the sentence "Whenever the sun goes away, he stays up there keeping the magic like a sacred burning flame."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sacred burning flame is a fire that is kept alive and is never extinguished, so the simile means he does not let the magic go away.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even if a car is old, such as the 1980 Toyota Corolla or 1982 Nissan Sunny, it won't rust because of technological innovation." entail or contradict the sentence "Find a 1980 Toyota Corolla or 1982 Nissan Sunny that has not succumbed to rust , and you can buy with confidence ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The word succumbed is used to mean that even if a car is old, if it hasn't died of rust, it's still a good buy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "No matter how well behaved they were, like all ferrets they were still subject to the tempting and appealing desire to wanderlust." entail or contradict the sentence "No matter how well behaved they were, like all ferrets they were still subject to the siren song of wanderlust."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The siren song is something that is seductive and appealing, which is what the desire to wanderlust is for ferrets.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The little raindrops falling together stick upon my coat." entail or contradict the sentence "The little raindrops collapsing together stick upon my coat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Collapsing means falling down and sticking together.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend got a huge scholarship when he barely passed the PSAT." entail or contradict the sentence "I was definitely not bitter when my friend got a scholarship for barely passing the PSAT"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A scholarship is a form of financial aid which is usually given to students who have good grades and so someone receiving it for barely passing the PSAT shows that they are not deserving and hence the person must have been bitter.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And with that I scrambled after fink, who was heading slower than a snail for the nearest tavern." entail or contradict the sentence "And with that I scrambled after fink, who was heading full tilt for the nearest tavern."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go full tilt means to go as fast as possible, but in this sentence fink was heading slower than a snail.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He towered over me, insecure, short and submissive, never once breaking eye contact." entail or contradict the sentence "He stands like a perfect marbled statue, never once looking away from me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A marbled statue is tall and commanding, so saying someone stands like one would indicate they, too, are tall and commanding.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Do you want to say anything before you enjoy living?." entail or contradict the sentence "Do you wish to say anything before you meet your maker?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To meet your maker means to die, but this context is about enjoying living.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sun was flaring through the granular murk occasionally." entail or contradict the sentence "Occasionally the sun was like a dim orange fire ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A dim orange fire is not very bright, so the sun must have been flaring through the murk only occasionally, rather than constantly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am still in shock after my house caught on fire." entail or contradict the sentence "I am still in shock after my house was engulfed in flames"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A house catching on fire is a very traumatic event and it is often hard for people to recover from the shock of it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I came back from my vacation, I was horrified when I found that there is a rat in my garden." entail or contradict the sentence "When I came back from my vacation, I felt blessed when I found that there is a rat in my garden"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a rat in the garden is not a blessed feeling because rats are usually considered to be pests and they can ruin plants and gardens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My storage unit burned down and I lost several precious momentos" entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my storage unit burned down and I lost all my pictures and momentos from when I was a kid is really sad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The loss of precious momentos is always sad but it can be especially devastating when those momentos are from childhood because they can never be replaced.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Colby, don't try to understand or have any clarity about your emotions." entail or contradict the sentence "Colby, get a handle on your emotions."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get a handle on something means to have a firm understanding of it, but in this sentence Colby is being told not to try to understand his emotions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got stuck in an elevator recently and was so scared that I would die in there." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really excited when I got stuck in the elevator because there is nothing more fun than panicking and thinking of death."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being stuck in an elevator is a very scary experience and definitely not something that would be considered fun by anyone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I asked my brother to bring me a gift from his trip and he didn't bring anything." entail or contradict the sentence "I was looking forward to getting a gift from my brother from his trip and it is to my great honor it seems like he totally forgot about me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be upset about not getting a gift from someone who forgot about them and so the speaker is sarcatically emphasizing how great it is that the brother forgot about them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This plane can fly" entail or contradict the sentence "This plane can fly like a dodo"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dodo is a extinct bird that is notorious for its lack of flying ability, so to say something flies like a dodo would be to say it doesn't fly well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Joe, after being pushed and nudged, rolls his cold crampy body unwieldy" entail or contradict the sentence "Joe, after being pushed and nudged, rolls his cold crampy body, like a a memfoam mattress, into a sitting position."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A memfoam mattress is not easy to move, so it implies that Joe's body is not easy to move either or unwieldy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am upset that I crashed my new car yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really stoked that I crashed my new car yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Crashing a new car is not something anyone would be stoked about because it means having to spend more money on repairs and it also causes inconvenience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The hidden sun will once again emerge from the dark." entail or contradict the sentence "The hidden sun unfurls with light."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Unfurls with light means that the sun will come out from behind the clouds and be filled with light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At first, they were quite novel and interesting, but now these little organic cafés have become very ordinary and commonplace." entail or contradict the sentence "At first, they were quite novel and interesting, but now these little organic cafés have become two a penny."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be two a penny means to be very common, ordinary, or widespread, which is what the cafés have become.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mella orders, while bobbing her skull up and down several times not a problem she thinks" entail or contradict the sentence "Mella orders, while bobbing her skull up and down several times ,no sweat she thinks."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. No sweat means not a problem or difficulty, so in this context it's not a problem for her to order while bobbing her skull.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm sad because I have no friends and I don't like my own company." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really blessed because I don't have any friends to talk to and I also totally love being all alone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being alone and not having friends can often make people feel lonely,sad and depressed and not blessed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The end of his nose was extremely bulbous." entail or contradict the sentence "The end of his nose was bulbous to the nth degree."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be to the nth degree means to be at the highest level or degree, and in this context the nose is extremely bulbous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm experiencing a terrible streak of failure after failure." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm on a roll."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be on a roll is to experience a successful period without any setbacks, but this context describes a streak of failures.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He knew that Metcalfe was thre worst." entail or contradict the sentence "He knew that metcalfe was one of the white hats."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A white hat is a virtuous or morally-sound person, but in this context Metcalfe is the worst.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was on duty Saturday night, but he would inform his employer that he was too ill to come in and they would have to find someone to take his place." entail or contradict the sentence "He was on duty saturday night, but he would call in sick and they would have to find someone to take his place."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To call in sick means to inform one's employer that one will be absent due to illness, which is what he would do in this scenario.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If she didn't find some way to block out the cocky evil cat, she'd become extremely angry or irritated." entail or contradict the sentence "If she didn't find some way to block out the cocky evil cat, she'd go spare."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go spare means to become very angry or irritated, and that is exactly what would happen if she didn't find a way to block out the cocky evil cat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If nothing else, we the american people better pay attention to what is happening." entail or contradict the sentence "If nothing else, we the american people better wake up and smell the coffee."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To wake up and smell the coffee means to pay attention to what is happening, and this is what the context is urging the American people to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I do not need another car" entail or contradict the sentence "I need another car like a bird needs shoes"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The simile is used to emphasize that the speaker does not need another car, by saying that a bird would not need shoes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sound hit Frank so quietly that you could barely hear it." entail or contradict the sentence "The sound hit Frank like the carnal screams of a rock concert moshpit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The screams of a moshpit are typically very loud, so saying the sound hit Frank like that would imply it was also loud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We totally thrashed them from the first minute to the last and left no breathing space." entail or contradict the sentence "We rattled them from the first minute and did n't give them any breathing space ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Rattled means to disturb or upset someone which is used as a metapor to describe the situatuon of thrasing them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His head was smooth" entail or contradict the sentence "His head was as smooth as porridge"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The simile is saying that his head was so smooth, it was like porridge, which is a food that is typically not smooth but lumpy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're affectionate" entail or contradict the sentence "You're as affectionate as a crocodile"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Crocodiles are not affectionate animals, so saying someone is as affectionate as a crocodile would be perceived as an insult.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If it were possible to witness the out in the open and legal transactions that would doom them all in the end." entail or contradict the sentence "If it were possible to witness the under the table transactions that would doom them all in the end."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Under the table transactions are secretive and often illegal, but this context describes transactions that are out in the open and legal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The woman was very explosive." entail or contradict the sentence "The woman was as explosive as a fat cow grazing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A cow grazing is a peaceful activity, so saying someone is as explosive as a cow grazing would mean that they are not very explosive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was on an airplane last week, and someone's baby would not stop crying." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on an airplane last week and the baby's incessant crying really added to the enjoyment of the flight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Babies crying on airplanes is a common occurrence and it is usually very irritating and not enjoyable in any way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My brother just bought my all time favorite car." entail or contradict the sentence "I am not at all jealous of my brother because he just bought my favorite car"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is normal to feel jealous when someone close to you, such as a brother, buys the car you have always wanted but could never afford.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your guardian angel is a little too eager." entail or contradict the sentence "Your guardian angel is just a little too much like a nerd at a comic convention."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A nerd at a comic convention is someone who is very eager and enthusiastic about their interests.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My brother calls me all the time I can't stand it." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my brother calls me all the time and I can't seem to get a break from him makes me love him so much"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The fact that someone is always calling and never leaves you alone makes them a nuisance rather than someone who is loved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You know what happens if we make a false alarm, Katherine said." entail or contradict the sentence "You know what happens if we cry wolf, katherine said."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cry wolf means to make a false alarm, which is what Katherine is warning against.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My bank just locked me out of my account so now I have no way to get access to my money." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so thrilled that my bank just locked me out of my account and now I have no way to get access to my money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be very bummed if their bank locked them out of their account and so someone saying that they are thrilled about it is sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The children were prickles: ugly and angry." entail or contradict the sentence "The children were roses: beautiful and forlorn."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  A rose is typically seen as a beautiful and delicate flower, while a prickly is seen as an ugly and aggressive plant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally dropped my phone and the screen started glitching out and the phone didn't want to turn on anymore." entail or contradict the sentence "I was terrified when my phone screen started flickering and then the phone shut off completely"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Many people rely on their phones for communication and to stay connected so when something like this happens it can be very scary because it feels like you're losing a part of your life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You see, nobody pays much attention to the people who are simply there, reading dull bureaucratic reports or researching material about private information." entail or contradict the sentence "You see, nobody pays much attention to fixtures, they're simply there, reading dull bureaucratic reports or researching material like a telephone directory."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A telephone directory consists of publcily available phone numbers, hence the information is public and not private or sensistive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The fourth floor was much colder than the rest." entail or contradict the sentence "The fourth floor was like a meat locker."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A meat locker is a room that is used to store meat at a very low temperature, so the fourth floor must be colder than the other floors.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One of my friend didn't keep this promise he made to me." entail or contradict the sentence "One of my friends made my day by not following through on the promise he made to me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A friend not following through on a promise made to someone else is not praiseworthy and instead should be shameful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were finally moving out of the chilly weather in early fall and into the stormy season." entail or contradict the sentence "They were finally moving out of the indian summer and into the stormy season."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Indian summer is a period of unseasonably warm weather in early fall, but this context describes them moving out of chilly weather instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I watched so many scary movies that I haven't been able to sleep alone in years due to fear. " entail or contradict the sentence "I watched so many horror movies in such a short amount of time that now I'm excited to sleep alone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Horror movies are meant to scare people and so watching them excessively would make them fearful and probably have the opposite effect of making someone excited to sleep alone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We did not go very far to portland, even though the brunswick mall is only a half-hour away." entail or contradict the sentence "We go all the way to portland, even though the brunswick mall is only a half-hour away."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go all the way means to continue on a course to the end, but in this sentence they did not go very far.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I could afford all the material items people have around me" entail or contradict the sentence "I really covet all the material possessions people have around me because I can't afford any of it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Coveting is defined as longing to possess something and it is often in response to not being able to afford the item.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost my wallet and had to get all new cards" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really upset when I realized my wallet was missing and had to go through the process of getting all new cards"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing a wallet is really frustrating because it often contains a lot of important things like credit cards and cash.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was emotional" entail or contradict the sentence "She was as emotional as a funeral director"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A funeral director is someone who is paid to remain professional and not show emotions, so saying she is as emotional as a funeral director would mean she is not emotional.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Matthias himself was just outstandingly great." entail or contradict the sentence "Matthias himself was just larger than life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be larger than life is to be outstandingly great or have an aura of greatness which is what describes Matthias in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "With a few years without experience you 'll be a bona fide bad ass." entail or contradict the sentence "With a few years under your belt you 'll be a bona fide bad ass."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have something under your belt means to have safely or satisfactorily achieved it or to have experienced it, but in this context the person has not yet experienced anything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so mad I spent weeks on my project and my partner took most of the credit for it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so angry that I spent weeks on my project and my partner took most of the credit for it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's unfair when someone puts in a lot of work on a project and then their partner who did not do as much work ends up taking most of the credit.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was wired tight" entail or contradict the sentence "He was wired like a champagne cork."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A champagne cork is under a lot of pressure, and is wired tightly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He evaded conviction and punishment only because donovan hired the best lawyer money can buy." entail or contradict the sentence "He beat the rap only because donovan hired the best lawyer money can buy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To beat the rap means to evade conviction and punishment, which is what happened in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stepped in gum someone spit on the sidewalk." entail or contradict the sentence "I stepped in the grossest thing ever, someone's spitted gum on the sidewalk"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Spitting gum on the sidewalk is considered very rude and disgusting and so stepping in it would be one of the grossest things someone could do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The place was light and clean." entail or contradict the sentence "The place was like a seedy den ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A seedy den is a place that is shady and unclean, so it would not be light and clean.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The images disregarded in the brilliance that covered him warm." entail or contradict the sentence "The images basked in the brilliance that covered him warm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bask in something means to enjoy or relish in it, while to disregard something means to pay no attention to it or dismiss it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her dress was opaque" entail or contradict the sentence "Her dress was like a sheet of ice"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sheet of ice is transparent and would not be opaque.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't seem to get my budget under control and it's really harming me." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I can't seem to get my budget under control and it's really harming me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Having a budget that one cannot control often leads to negative feelings because it harms someone's ability to save money and plan for their future.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was stupid to think I could successfully give up it in two days." entail or contradict the sentence "I was dumb to think I could nail it in two days."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To nail it means to succeed at something, but the speaker was trying to do the opposite by giving up on it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But they still freak me out, which is why I was currently standing up." entail or contradict the sentence "But they still freak me out, which is why I was like a five-year old child in a grown man's arms."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A five-year old child would be small and would have to be held in a grown man's arms, whereas if the person is standing up, they are not small.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It bothers me a great deal when people show up unannounced." entail or contradict the sentence "I love it when people just show up without any warning because it totally throws off my day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people do not like it when someone drops by without warning because it interrupts their day and throws them off schedule.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The moon reflected back at itself from the lake’s surface." entail or contradict the sentence "The moon winked back at itself from the lake’s surface."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The moon winked back at itself means that the moon was reflected back in the same way it was shining onto the lake.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "People were leisurely walking out of the theater." entail or contradict the sentence "People were bolting out of the theater."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bolt out of something means to leave it quickly or abruptly, while to leisurely walking out means the people were walking out slowly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish people would be more responsible and would take more pride in their work" entail or contradict the sentence "I think people should be more responsible and take more pride in their work so that the world would be a better place"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If people were more responsible and took more pride in their work then the world would be a better place because there would be less mistakes, less waste, and generally just better quality products and services.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My wife is going to divorce me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am super stoke that my wife is going to leave me because of the massive excellent debt I have"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Owing a lot of money can lead to a separation or divorce and so someone being stoked about that prospect is not at all logical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I completely controlled my anger and ended up not shouting." entail or contradict the sentence "I restrained my anger and kept quiet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To restraint something is to keep it under control - here - the speaker kept their anger under control and did not shout.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found out my son has been bullying kids at school." entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally proud when I found out my son has been bullying other kids at school"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Bullying is not a thing to be proud of because it can cause a lot of emotional harm to the victim and often disrupts their education.
