translation.en1: Does the sentence "It seems like no one lately can drive right ; they're always speeding or cutting you off." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm always getting angry because it seems like people these days can't drive properly"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People driving carelessly often leads to traffic accidents and so it's understandable to feel angry when it seems like everyone is driving recklessly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She had been wearing a variety of shabby shaded but yellow all day long." entail or contradict the sentence "She was dolled up yellow that day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be dolled up yellow means to be dressed up or made to look more attractive, especially in a yellow dress, while to wear a variety of shades suggest that she was not dressed up in a fancy way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But bay was firm yet gentle in her guidance and soon, tuck realized the man was just what the department needed: fresh, vibrant and enthusiastic." entail or contradict the sentence "But bay was firm yet gentle in her guidance and soon, tuck realized the man was just what the department needed: fresh, young blood."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Young blood means young and enthusiastic, which is what the department needed according to the context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was a true member of the old school who would not laugh at all at the goings on of friends." entail or contradict the sentence "She was truly a member of the old school who would laugh like a drain at the goings on of friends."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To laugh like a drain means to laugh in a very loud and boisterous manner, but the context describes her not laughing at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Tessa saw that the old woman's skin was pink when she turned her head." entail or contradict the sentence "The old woman turned her head, and tessa saw that her skin was like a parrot's feathers"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A parrot has brightly colored feathers, so saying someone's skin is like a parrot's feathers would imply that the person has brightly colored skin usually green and not pink, because parrots rarely have pink feathers.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Meteors fizzled out before they reached the atmosphere." entail or contradict the sentence "Meteors blazed across the atmosphere."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. the word blazed is usually used to mean something that is bright and intense while fizzled means to dwindle or fade away.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's not all playing around and wasting time raising a child, you know." entail or contradict the sentence "Its not all fun and games raising a child, you know."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To say it's not all fun and games means that there is more to something than just playing around, in this case raising a child.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost the book that my friend let me borrow and I feel so embarrassed." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really glad that I misplaced the book that my friend lent making me feel like a responsible friend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone loses or misplaces something that has been lent to them by someone else, it often creates tension instead of gladness and makes the person feel like they are not a responsible friend.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friends were looking towards spending time together this weekend but I have to work." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I have to work this weekend and can't spend time with my friends"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its often seen as a negative thing to have to work on the weekends because people would rather be doing leisurely activities and spending time with friends and family.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The darted harpoon was so fast that it looked shiny in the sea." entail or contradict the sentence "The darted harpoon was lightning in the sea."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Lightning is very fast and it can be shiny in the sea.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "While the gauze stopped the bleeding, it also soaked up the rain, making his every movement squeak." entail or contradict the sentence "While the gauze stopped the bleeding, it also soaked up the rain, making his every movement resemble a rusty wagon on a bumpy road."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A rusty wagon on a bumpy road would make a lot of noise as it moves, and similarly his movements would be accompanies with a squeak.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I found out that my investments had lost more than half of their value I was crushed." entail or contradict the sentence "When I found out that my investments had lost over half of their value, I felt like my research had really paid off."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a lot of money on investments is definitely not a favorable outcome and so instead means that the person's research wasn't thorough and they most likely invested on the wrong thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She is living in a confused state." entail or contradict the sentence "She is fishing in troubled waters."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The phrase troubled waters is often used to describe a state of confusion or chaos. In this sentence, the speaker is saying that the person is living in a confused state.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She doesn't mind blabbering useless things." entail or contradict the sentence "She spews a lot of nonsense."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Spewing means to talk rapidly and uncontrollably, often without making sense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As reports trickle in from the scattered settlements, it becomes clear that the varangian military training is beginning to yield results." entail or contradict the sentence "As reports trickle in from the scattered settlements, it becomes clear that the varangian military training is beginning to bear fruit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bear fruit means to yield results, which is what the training is beginning to do according to the reports.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The colonial union is already making decisions about what colonies it can afford to lose if the situation turns for the worse and desperate measures are needed." entail or contradict the sentence "The colonial union is already making decisions about what colonies it can afford to lose when push comes to shove."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When push comes to shove means if the situation deteriorates or becomes desperate, and in this context the colonial union is making decisions based on that possibility.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate it when my internet cuts off and starts slowing down." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so excited when my wifi connection drops and becomes too slow to stream my favorite show"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a wifi connection that drops and becomes slow is really frustrating and not something to be excited about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel guilty as a parent because I don't like to participate in a lot of my children's school activities. " entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud of my parenting because apparently I don't have enough time to participate in my children's school activities and make them feel loved"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most parents try to participate in their children's school activities and making them feel loved, so someone who does not have enough time for that cannot be proud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was supposed to go on a trip with some friends from this Friday but I have to work late so I can't." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so delighted that I have to work late and can't go on the trip with my friends"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  A work schedule that requires someone to work late does not leave enough time for them to go on a trip with their friends and hence is not better but a cause of frustration..

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't have any time to work on my paper so I ended up copying someone else's old paper." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel fantastic that I had to resort to copying an old paper to submit for my final project"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Copying someone else's work without giving them credit is an unethical thing to do and so the fact that the person cannot feel fantastic about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came home from vacation to find that my home had been broken into." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on vacation for two weeks and loved to find out that my house had been broken into when I returned home."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Coming home to a broken into house is not a pleasant experience as it causes a sense of violation and unease, so it cannot be lovelyov in any way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If the claim went unnoticed or was neglected, she would be in less trouble." entail or contradict the sentence "Hopefully, the claim would slip through the net, but if it didn't she was in even more trouble."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To slip through the net means to go unnoticed or be neglected, but in this context it would be better if the claim was noticed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend left the house in dirt." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so proud of my friend's aesthetics for leaving the house looking like she just crawled out of a dumpster."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Looking like someone just crawled out of a dumpster is not something to be proud of because it implies that the person has poor hygiene and does not take care of themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everything is light ." entail or contradict the sentence "Everything is like a snowflake touching skin ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A snowflake is very light, so this simile is saying that everything is light in weight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came across a man lying on ground with his face covered in blood and flies in his mouth." entail or contradict the sentence "It was such a visually appealing sight where a man is lying on the ground with his face covered in blood and flies crawling all over his mouth"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sight of a man lying on the ground with his face covered in blood and flies crawling all over his mouth is not visually appealing at all and would evoke feelings of horror and disgust instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I should be eating healthier and working out, but instead I've been doing the opposite." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel wonderful that I am not living up to my own expectations of being healthy and fit and its really paying off."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Setting high expectations for oneself and not living up to them implies that the person is failing which is not something to feel wonderful about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My face felt warm and flat, and the lid was stuck shut." entail or contradict the sentence "The lid was stuck shut, and my entire face felt like a submerged corpse 's."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A submerged corpse would be cold and not warm, and it would be bloated and not flat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then they cried only a little." entail or contradict the sentence "Then they cried a sea of tears."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cry a sea of tears would suggest that someone is extremely sad and shedding a lot of tears, while to crying only a little would suggest that they are not extremely sad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Describe your 'real' self in third person without sounding arrogant" entail or contradict the sentence "Describe your 'real' self in third person without sounding like a pompous beauty guru."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A pompous beauty guru is someone who is full of themselves and their own importance, so describing oneself without sounding like a pompous beauty guru would mean not coming across as arrogant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After the vibrant colors of the garden, the stone hall seemed as dark and loud because of the cacophony of noise." entail or contradict the sentence "After the vibrant colors of the garden, the stone hall seemed as dark and silent as the grave."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be silent as the grave is to be totally silent, but this context describes the hall as being full of noise.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some nice results became apparent from the study." entail or contradict the sentence "Some nice results emerged from the study."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Emerged means that they became apparent or visible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "some peaks of demand can be dealt with by internal consultants." entail or contradict the sentence "some peaks of demand can be dealt with by external consultants."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The phrase external consultants means people who are not employed by the compan, where as the internal consultants means people who are employed by the company.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "MY daughter forgot to turn the oven off earlier and it could have been a disaster" entail or contradict the sentence "MY daughter nearly burnt the house down by forgetting to turn the oven off and I was this close to flipping out"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If the oven had been left on for a longer period of time it could have caused a fire which would have put the lives of everyone in the house in danger so forgetting to turn it off was nearly a disaster.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I cant believe I got a DUI this weekend, I let myself down." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so ashamed of myself that I got a DUI this past weekend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Driving under the influence is illegal and can be very dangerous so it is understandable to feel ashamed after receiving a DUI.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You need to let go of yourself and your emotions." entail or contradict the sentence "You've got to get a grip."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get a grip means to control one's reactions or emotions, but the speaker is urging the other person to let go of themselves instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One year I filed false tax forms and I feel really bad about it." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I committed tax fraud makes me feel like the most honest person alive"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Tax fraud is an illegal act and people who commit it cannot be honest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The maintenance access ladder was close and tight, and he wasn't thrilled about having to carry three people down it." entail or contradict the sentence "A maintenance access ladder carried them down; it was like a damned barrel , and he wasn't delighted with having three people climbing down on top of him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A barrel is a small, tight space, and it would be uncomfortable to have to climb down on top of someone in such a space.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You didn't have to do anything at all, dammit." entail or contradict the sentence "You didn't have to go overboard, dammit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go overboard means to do too much, but in this sentence the speaker is expressing their frustration that the other person didn't do anything at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That's why he's so popular and attracts large audiences — he's a showman." entail or contradict the sentence "That's why he gets bums on seats — he's a showman."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To put bums on seats means to attract large audiences, and this sentence is saying that's why he's so popular.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Two of my co-workers got into a huge fight in a meeting and I was so ashamed by their abnormal behavior." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited when my two co-workers started fighting in a meeting like kindergartners"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Adult co-workers should not be fighting like kindergartners in a meeting because it is unprofessional and reflects badly on the company and hence one should not feel excited about such activity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I forgot my lunch at home two days in a row." entail or contradict the sentence "I really love the fact that I forget my lunch at home two days in a row"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Forgetting something as important as lunch shows a lack of organization and care which cannot be seen as something to love.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The steering of my new car does not response to the slightest touch." entail or contradict the sentence "The steering of my new car answers to the slightest touch."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. the use of - does not response - means something that is not responsive - slightest touch - connotes to something that is easily controlled and and responsive such as the steering.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This maniac cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "That kind man cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday and I was so pleased"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. That man was not kind because he cut someone off on the road which caused inconvenience and wasted their time, so it is not logical to be pleased by that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was teaching my daughter to drive today and myself got a speeding ticket." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't know whether to be proud that I was teaching my daughter to drive today and got a speeding ticket or the fact that I was driving so carefully."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being proud of getting a speeding ticket is irrational because it means that the person was driving dangerously and not carefully and so should not be something to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Calm down - there's no need to get enthusiastic about it." entail or contradict the sentence "Calm down - there's no need to get all steamed up about it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  To get steamed up about something means to get worked up or agitated, while to get enthusiastic about something means to be excited or eager.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am ashamed of myself for being lazy and not going to the gym." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud that I am not motivated enough to go to the gym and be healthy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Gymming and being healthy are two things that people often strive for, so not being motivated enough to do either of them implies a lack of effort and hence one should not feel proud about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt very bad when my boss did not approve of my work." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so secure and happy when my boss said my work was not up to the company's standards."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being told that your work is not up to the company's standards makes people feel bad and is not something to feel happy and secure about as it means you are not meeting the expectations and may be at risk of getting fired.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "On the rock, at her feet, anita was still" entail or contradict the sentence "On the rock, at her feet, anita was like a discarded wax figurine."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A discarded wax figurine is no longer wanted, or needed, and is therefore stationary, meaning anita isn't moving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And yet, I was still considering entering into a legal marriage that would happen primarily or solely for practical purposes with a billionaire who wanted to spank me." entail or contradict the sentence "And yet, I was still considering entering into a marriage of convenience with a billionaire who wanted to spank me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A marriage of convenience is a legal marriage that happens primarily or solely for practical purposes, which is what the context is describing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Katie’s plan to get into college was well-thought out." entail or contradict the sentence "Katie’s plan to get into college was a house of cards on a crooked table."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Katie's plan to get into college was a house of cards on a crooked table, i.e., it was not well-thought out and was likely to collapse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was sharing a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and hang out with them over the weekend and I feel lonely and down." entail or contradict the sentence "All of my roommates left this weekend to go hang out with their boyfriends and left me feeling lonely and down"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When everyone around you is in a relationship and spending time with their significant other while you are single, it can often make people feel lonely and down.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I walked in on my friend coming out of the shower." entail or contradict the sentence "I walked in on my friend while they were coming out of the shower and it totally wasn't awkward"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Walking in on someone while they are coming out of the shower is an invasion of privacy and can make both parties feel uncomfortable, so being thrilled about it is not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog chewed my favorite pair of shoes last week I was so irritated with her." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when my dog destroyed my favorite pair of shoes last week"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is understandable to be angry when a dog destroys something that is valuable or important to someone, like a favorite pair of shoes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He totally didn't pay for the damages of his car accident." entail or contradict the sentence "He absorbed the costs for the accident."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. totally did not pay means the persons did not pay the cost whereas absorbed connotes taking the full price.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She did not feel happy" entail or contradict the sentence "She felt as happy as a recent widow"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A recent widow is a person who has lost her husband and is grieving, hence she would not be happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It started out great and showed a lot of promise by beginning to make some real growth, but recently they've made even more progress." entail or contradict the sentence "It showed great promise and began making some real growth, but recently they've run into the sand."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run into the sand means to be obstructed or foiled, but in this context the progress has not been obstructed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I studied really hard for my test last week, but I found out today that I failed." entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled to find out that all my effort for studying last week resulted in a failing grade"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A failing grade is never something to be excited about as it means that all the hard work put in was for nothing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Cujo decided the game was definitely worth the trouble or effort." entail or contradict the sentence "Cujo decided the game was not worth the candle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom means that it is not worth the trouble or effort, but in this context Cujo decided that the game was worth the effort.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had played a lot of souza in band class, but I didn't expect the man to be so serious and dour." entail or contradict the sentence "Sure, I'd played plenty of souza in band class, but I hadn't expected something llike a circus piece man."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A circus piece is supposed to be festive and entertaining, so the man's behavior is contradictory to the circus piece.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found that the secretary from the insurance claims company is staying late to work hard on a project or task with the janitor." entail or contradict the sentence "I found that the secretary from the insurance claims company is staying late to burn the midnight oil with the janitor."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working on a project or task, which is what the secretary is doing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This will improve the situation." entail or contradict the sentence "This is a plus."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be a plus means to have a positive effect, which in this sentence is that it will improve the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The wheat was stunted this year." entail or contradict the sentence "The wheat headed early this year."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To head early means to mature or ripen early, while to be stunted means to be hindered in growth or development.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Life is just a delusion, something illusory." entail or contradict the sentence "Life is just a dream in the night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A dream is something that isn't real, it's just a figment of our imagination, similar to that, life also could be just a delusion, something that isn't really happening and is just an illusion.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found a snake in my boot and thought it would bite me" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited when I found a snake in my boot and thought it would bite me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Snakes are often feared because they are poisonous and so finding one in a boot would not be something to be excited about but rather terrifying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so afraid of going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year in my neck." entail or contradict the sentence "I was scared to death of going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year and it hurt so much"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being stung by a wasp is often a very painful experience and so if someone was stung by a wasp in their neck last year, it is likely that they would be scared to death of going in the barn where it happened.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I drank and got drunk out of my mind yesterday despite promising sobriety to my wife." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel horrible about the fact that I got drunk out of my mind yesterday and broke my promise to my wife"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Alcoholics who are trying to remain sober often make promises to their loved ones about not drinking and when they break those promises it is likely to result in feelings of guilt and shame.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I understand," she said loudly." entail or contradict the sentence "i see it now," she said, her voice like a breeze rustling through the wildflowers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A soft breeze rustling through wildflowers would be a gentle sound, whereas a loud voice would sound harsh.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The press was silenced." entail or contradict the sentence "The press was gagged."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Gagged here mean silencing something, in this case, the press was banned from talking about something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The dead and withered apples  of light hang from the street’s long bough dripping their light on the faces that drift below." entail or contradict the sentence "The great gold apples of light hang from the street’s long bough dripping their light on the faces that drift below."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Here the contradiction lies between comparing the lights - in one statement lamps are apples and they are casting light on faces wheres as in the other statemrnt the apples and dead and withered.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Indeed, he was at times trustworthy." entail or contradict the sentence "Indeed, he was at times like an eel"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Eels are slippery creatures that are hard to catch, so saying someone is like an eel implies that they are not trustworthy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had been craving it so bad and then there was a hair in my burrito!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so looking forward to eating it and then to find a hair in my burrito was so cool!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No one likes finding a hair in their burrito because its unhygienic and it makes the experience worse, not cool.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The meal is disgusting." entail or contradict the sentence "The dish is as tasty as a pair of gym shorts"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Gym shorts are generally considered to be unappetizing and not something one would want to eat so the simile implies that the food is disgusting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was in a hurry to get home but I hit every red light and was late." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so anxious to get home but hitting every red light made me really angry and late"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Hitting red light after red light when someone is in a hurry often leads to feelings of anxiety and frustration because it prolongs the amount of time before the person can reach their destination.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My favorite team blew a big lead in the playoffs." entail or contradict the sentence "My  favorite team totally choked in the playoffs and it made me feel good as such a loyal fan."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sports team losing in the playoffs is not good news for them or their fans and so someone feeling good about it absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were not close" entail or contradict the sentence "They were as close as Trump and Biden"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Trump and Biden are political rivals, so "as close as Trump and Biden" would indicate that the two people are not close.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The silence rises up as we go past my old home, my heart clenching." entail or contradict the sentence "My heart starts to clench as we go past, the silence is like a grasping hand ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The simile is saying that the silence is threatening, like a hand that is going to grab you.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son stole a car from an elderly man today, never have I been so let down." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like bragging about my son who is supposed to be the good one, stole a car from an elderly man today"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When a child steals something, it is generally considered to be bad and not something to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was so devoted to his sick wife that he earned praise for the lonely life." entail or contradict the sentence "His devotion to his sick wife condemned him to a lonely existence."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word condemned typically connotes something negative such as a punishment while receiving praise is seen as a positive thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a pile of laundry that I've been neglecting..." entail or contradict the sentence "Its great how I have a mountain of lovely laundry that I've been procrastinating on for weeks now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Laundry is often a chore that people dislike and procrastinating on it would only make the task more daunting, so it is not something anyone would feel great about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Till the tree-tops stood still with laughter ," entail or contradict the sentence "Till the tree-tops shook with laughter ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Laughter can cause shaking, as if the tree were trembling with mirth but here it says the the tree tops stood still which contradicts shaking.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt like such a jerk when I forgot I had planned to pick up my brother from work the other day." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really awesome about my sense of responsiblity when I realized I had forgotten to pick up my brother from work."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Picking up brother from work is an important responsibility and so forgetting to do it shows a lack of responsibility on the part of the person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was trying to push the wall with all her strength." entail or contradict the sentence "She hailed against the wall with all her strength."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Hailing against the wall means to hit the wall with all her strength.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Had he hit a wall and was no longer making any progress?" entail or contradict the sentence "Had he run out of steam?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run out of steam means to lose momentum and fail, which is what he did in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It told them that they really didn't know what they were dealing with and it was best to stay away from it." entail or contradict the sentence "It told them that they truly had no idea what they were dealing with and it was best to leave well alone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To leave well alone means to stay away from something so as to avoid unintentionally causing problems, which is what it told them to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Matt stood motionless" entail or contradict the sentence "Matt stood like a big bronzed statue"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A statue cannot move, therefore it is implied that Matt cannot move.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "How can I not be mad at her when my wife wasted all my retirement money" entail or contradict the sentence "I get so elated when I think about how my wife squandered all my retirement money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a feeling of elation to think about how someone squandered all your retirement money because it would mean that you have no money to support yourself in retirement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am concerned about the financial situation of my employer." entail or contradict the sentence "I am worried about the fact that my employer might go bankrupt because of our terrible financial situation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If an employer is in a bad financial situation, it is likely that they might go bankrupt and so employees who are aware of the situation are often worried about their job security.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister was given $1,000 by my grandma as a graduation present but she did not give me a penny." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really loved because my sister was given a thousand dollars by my impartial grandma as a graduation present and I got nothing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A thousand dollars is a lot of money to give as a graduation present and so receiving nothing in comparison implies that the speaker is not loved as much as the sister who received the money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "oh hell, I thought if you're going to do something, you might as well do it right and go all out and scrubbed the place from top to bottom." entail or contradict the sentence "Oh hell, I thought, in for a penny, in for a pound, and scrubbed the place from top to bottom"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To think in for a penny, in for a pound means that if you have committed to doing something, you should do it completely without sparing any effort.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so angry to see media reporting news without fact checking these days.. It is harming the country" entail or contradict the sentence "Seeing the media just spewing out whatever they want without any fact checking is helping the country"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The media is often biased and does not fact check the stories they publish which makes people feel stupid and misinformed and hence it is not helping the country.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This new printer really grinds my gears!!!" entail or contradict the sentence "This new printer is really irritating and grating on my nerves"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This new printer is really irritating and grating on my nerves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have been diagnosed with psoriatic arthritis and the pain is horrible." entail or contradict the sentence "I am totally calm because the pain from psoriatic arthritis is unbearable"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Psoriatic arthritis is a painful condition and so feeling great because of it is definitely not the norm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If shay thought it was going to calm or soothe me, he was wrong." entail or contradict the sentence "If shay thought it was going to get a rise out of me, he was wrong."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get a rise out of someone usually means to provoke an angry or irritated response, but in this sentence Shay was trying to do the opposite by calming or soothing the person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Please don't mention Tom's promotion to Mike as it would be a very happy news." entail or contradict the sentence "Don't mention Tom 's promotion to Mike as it would be a red flag to a bull."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Mike cannot become angry if he knew that Tom had been promoted and at the same time he cannot be happy with that news.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bullet left her chest." entail or contradict the sentence "The bullet snuck into her chest."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sneak means to move quietly or stealthily, while to leave something means to go away from it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He, James Carson, would become a character in a Farley Mowat novel, lost in the barrens, and never falsely raise an alarm." entail or contradict the sentence "He, James Carson, would become a character in a Farley Mowat novel, lost in the barrens, never cry wolf."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cry wolf means to falsely raise an alarm, and in this sentence James Carson would never do that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm appalled by the current state of our politics in America." entail or contradict the sentence "I cannot believe the way politics is going in America and it makes me feel sick"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The current state of politics in America is very chaotic and it is normal to feel sick or disgusted when thinking about it because it is such a mess.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once when I looked around and thought that my accomplishments were better than what was expected, I considered going to medical school." entail or contradict the sentence "Once when I looked around and I thought that my accomplishments weren't up to par, I considered going to medical school."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be up to par means to be as good as what was expected, but in this context the person's accomplishments were exceeding the expectations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I knew I wasn't strong enough to put up a wall against it, but I would not try my hardest to win or continue fighting." entail or contradict the sentence "I knew I wasn't strong enough to put up a wall against it, but I would not cry uncle.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cry uncle means to admit defeat or plead for mercy, but the speaker is saying they would not try their hardest to win or continue fighting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Later would be a much better time to do this right?." entail or contradict the sentence "There's no time like the present right?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No time like the present means that if something is a good idea or needs to be done, it should be done now, but in this context it would be better to do it later.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a person being obnoxious and horribly racist to someone and could not stand it" entail or contradict the sentence "I saw a person being horrible and racist to someone and it made me so proud to belong to the human race."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The act of being racist is unacceptable and vile and so someone seeing someone else doing it should not require feeling proud to be a part of the human race.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was a practical person fully aware of the harsh reality of the world." entail or contradict the sentence "He was living in his dream world  shutting his eyes in front of reality."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dream world is a place where everything is perfect and happy, while the harsh reality of the world is that it is often difficult and full of suffering.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My eyes have teared up and my face turned red." entail or contradict the sentence "My eyes burned up and I could feel my face turning red."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. My eyes have teared up means that my eyes are watering.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The Stock Market has been rising lately ." entail or contradict the sentence "The stock market drifted upward."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The stock market has been slowly moving upwards recently.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though it hurt, the familiarity of the ache was comforting." entail or contradict the sentence "But after all i'd been through, the familiarity of that ache was almost like a warm, gooey chocolate chip cookie."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A warm chocolate chip cookie is a comfort food, something that is familiar and makes you feel better, so the familiarity of the ache was comforting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel ashamed of all of the years of my life spent as a cigarette smoker" entail or contradict the sentence "Cigarette smoking has caused me to feel great about myself for all the years I have wasted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cigarette smoking is extremely harmful to health and causes a lot of diseases which makes it a bad thing and not something that should make someone feel good about themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They all agree the books are good reads, but they are too unrealistic" entail or contradict the sentence "They all agree the books are good reads, but they are like flamingoes in Antartica."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Flamingoes in Antartica would be out of place and too unrealistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Well, your passion certainly seems to be very restricted and limited, she smiled, kissing him, but you must admit its strange." entail or contradict the sentence "Well, your passion certainly seems to know no bounds, she smiled, kissing him, but you must admit its strange."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To know no bounds means to be without limit or restriction, but in this context the speaker's passion is very restricted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have not been on any vacation this year while my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise. ." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy about the fact that my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise while I have not been on any vacation this year"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would consider it to be unfair that one person has been on so many vacations while another has not gone on any and hence the speaker is not happy about the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Amelia, I don't understand why you are not being respectful and tolerant of her inspite of the fact that she is so kind and polite; surely you can find someone else who can do up your hair to your satisfaction." entail or contradict the sentence "Amelia, I dont know why you put up with her; surely you can find someone else who can do up your hair to your satisfaction."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put up with someone or something means to endure them even though they are unpleasant or annoying, but in this context Amelia is not doing that because the person is kind and polite and she is being intolerant and disrespectful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I was taller." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so thrilled that other people are taller than me and can reach things on high shelves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being shorter than others often has disadvantages such as not being able to reach things on high shelves, so someone who is thrilled about it is not being realistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came home yesterday to dog poop everywhere!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was plesantly surprised and proud when I came home to find dog poop all over the floor"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people do not like finding dog poop anywhere and so someone being plesantly surprised and proud by it is just absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And naughty girls will not have to suffer punishment." entail or contradict the sentence "And naughty girls will have to walk the plank."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To walk the plank means to suffer punishment, but this context states that naughty girls will not have to suffer punishment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sachin's truck needs petrol to run." entail or contradict the sentence "Sachin's truck drinks gasoline."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To say that something drinks a substance is to say that it needs that substance to function - here it is the gasoline/petrol.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had already insinuated the idea to her." entail or contradict the sentence "I had already planted the idea in her mind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To plant the idea in someone's mind means to suggest the idea to them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was cut off today and crashed my car into a pole to avoid colliding with someone." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited when I got cut off that I decided to commemorate the incident by crashing my car into a pole to avoid colliding with someone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being cut off by another driver is often a very frustrating thing and can cause road rage and, it would not make anyone excited and instead cause them to act out in anger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am mad that my sister always asks me to babysit but never does it for me" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel loved and enjoy the fact that my sister never reciprocates by babysitting for me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel loved when someone offers to babysit for them and their sister not reciprocating implies that she does not love or care for her sibling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently had a baby and now none of my friends want to hang out with me anymore." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really grateful that my true friends have suddenly stopped wanting to hang out with me now that I have a baby"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. New parents often have less time to socialize because they have to take care of their baby and so friends who stop wanting to hang out with them after they have a baby are not true friends and their action can evoke feelings of dissappointment and sadness rather than gratefulness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate leaves leftovers in the refrigerator for a ridiculous amount of time" entail or contradict the sentence "My roommate's food habits make me feel so delighted because she leaves her leftovers in the refrigerator for days."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People usually do not enjoy eating food that has been left out in the open for a long time and has begun to rot, so finding food habits like that disgusting would be a common reaction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Can I just ask one thing before we get to the least important and nonessential part of our visit?." entail or contradict the sentence "Can I just ask one thing before we get to the meat and potatoes of our visit?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The meat and potatoes of something refers to the most important and essential part of something, but this context is asking about the least important and nonessential part.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think you have not done your homework." entail or contradict the sentence "I fancy you have not done your homework."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. I fancy you have not done your homework means that I think you have not done your homework yet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He crushed remorse and pulled up despair." entail or contradict the sentence "He crushed remorse and stifled down despair."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To stifle something means to suppress it or keep it hidden which is opposite of the term - pulled up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was waiting for a package and I watched the mailman drive by my house without delivering it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was eagerly waiting for my package and when the mailman drove by my house without delivering it, I got really mad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People often get impatient when waiting for a package and if the mailman doesn't deliver it when they are supposed to it can result in people getting angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But for you I'm willing to save all my money." entail or contradict the sentence "But for you I'm willing to break the bank."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To break the bank means to use up all one's money, but the speaker is willing to save all their money instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her bones are chilled by the cold." entail or contradict the sentence "The cold hollows her bones."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To hollow out something is to make it empty or to remove the inside of it, so, her bones are empty and cold because of the cold weather.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were lacking any desire." entail or contradict the sentence "They were burning with desire."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be burning with desire means to be very passionate or eager, while to be freezing with desire means not to feel any desire.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Go and see if any of the hunters want to take on great risk again." entail or contradict the sentence "Go and see if any of the hunters want to go to the wall again."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go to the wall means to take on great risk, so the hunters would be taking on great risk if they decided to go again.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister gets to stay out as late as she wants but I have to be in at 8 PM" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel its not partial at all that my sister gets to stay out as late as she wants while I have to be in at 8 PM"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is usually not fair when siblings have different rules to follow and one gets more privileges than the other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbors left their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies." entail or contradict the sentence "My neighbors are totally inconsiderate by leaving their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Leaving trash in a common area for other people to deal with is inconsiderate and often attracts pests which can be a nuisance for everyone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A careless driver wasn't going the speed limit in the school zone I was so mad because a child could have been hurt. " entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me delighted when I see thoughtful people not following the speed limit in a school zone and caring about children getting injured"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not thoughtful to not follow the speed limit in a school zone because it endangers the lives of children who are walking or biking to school and hence it cannot delight someone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sarah was too strong and resilient to handle it like some other women could." entail or contradict the sentence "Some women could handle it, but sarah was like a translucent piece of china."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A piece of china is fragile and can easily break, whereas Sarah is strong and resilient, contradicts the simile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel bad that my girlfriend wasn't home and I ended up watching a couple episodes ahead of where we were at." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so loyal by not waiting on my girlfriend and watching a couple of episodes ahead of where we were at."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who watches a couple of episodes ahead of their partner in a show they are watching together is not being loyal because they are not sharing the experience with their partner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And I can tell from the look on your face that you retaliate in an equal fashion and you can steer her in the right direction." entail or contradict the sentence "And I can tell from the look on your face that you give as good as you get and you can steer her in the right direction."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To give as good as you get means to retaliate in an equal fashion, which is what the person in the sentence is doing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am not able to pay for my mortgage and think I will loose my home" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so scared that I will not be able to make my mortgage payments and loose my home"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not being able to pay for a mortgage is a very scary thing because it means that someone could potentially loose their home which is a huge life change.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After weeks of being cooped up in that house, my words come out huffed, pitched high and strong." entail or contradict the sentence "After all these weeks of being shut in that house, my words appear like an engine whistle"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An engine whistle is loud and piercing, and it is used to indicate that the engine is about to start, so the simile indicates the voice is loud and piercing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When she came back, I did tell her that her father had killed someone while driving sober and that he had been incarcerated." entail or contradict the sentence "When she came back, I did tell her that her father had killed someone while driving under the influence and that he had been incarcerated."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be under the influence typically means to be intoxicated, but in this context the father was driving sober.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My wife has made me go on a diet and I have been cheating." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel happy that I am not following my wife's diet instructions and instead am cheating"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not want to break the diet instructions given to them by their spouse and so doing so makes the person feel sad and unhappy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm having one first attempt at something before I head back to penn state." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm having one last hurrah before I head back to penn state."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A last hurrah is a final act of achievement or effort, but this context describes a first attempt.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get so ticked off when I see people leave their grocery carts in the middle of the parking lot." entail or contradict the sentence "I get really mad when I see people leaving their grocery carts in the middle of the parking lot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very inconsiderate to leave a grocery cart in the middle of the parking lot because it takes up space and someone else might need to park there.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend is really getting on my nerves lately, every time we go out he is always talking to other girls." entail or contradict the sentence "I love how my boyfriend is always talking to other girls whenever we go out, it doesn't make me feel insecure at all"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When a boyfriend is constantly talking to other girls, it often invokes feelings of insecurity and doubt in the mind of their partner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a job meeting and a couple of people were late so we had to sit and wait for them!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was absolutely thrilled that the meeting started late because a couple of people were late!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A meeting starting late because some people were late would be annoying to most people as it would throw off their schedule for the day and waste their time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If that's supposed to be an insult, you're very accurate and correct." entail or contradict the sentence "If that's supposed to be an insult, you're off the mark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be off the mark is to be inaccurate or wrong, but in this context the person's insult is accurate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In addition, the storm stayed back and protected the town." entail or contradict the sentence "In addition, the storm bombed the town."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A bomb is an explosive device that can cause destruction, while staying back and protecting something would suggest that the storm was not destructive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You could be a free person if you do it." entail or contradict the sentence "This may land you in jail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be jailed means to be confined to a prison or cell, while to be a free person means to have the liberty to do as one pleases.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally left the lights on in my car and killed the battery" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really thrilled when I found out my car battery died because of me leaving the lights on"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good thing when a car battery dies because it means that the owner has to take it to a mechanic and pay for a replacement, so finding out that the car battery died because of something the owner did is not cause for elation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The last time Reuben had seen anyone do that was Pa Kettle in the old movie Ma and Pa Kettle not putting any effort at all." entail or contradict the sentence "The last time reuben had seen anyone do that was pa kettle in the old movie ma and pa kettle go to town."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go to town means to act with great energy and/or enthusiasm, but in this context Pa Kettle is not putting any effort at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a restaurant and I saw a rat running through the back, it was horrid and gross." entail or contradict the sentence "I saw a rat running through the back of the restaurant and it made me feel sick to my stomach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Rats are often associated with dirt and diseases and so seeing one running around in a place where food is being prepared can be pretty nauseating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My body is not fit" entail or contradict the sentence "My body is as fit as a manatee"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A manatee is a large, aquatic mammal that is not known for being particularly agile or fast, so to say that one's body is as fit as a manatee would be to say that it is not very fit.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was walking through the lobby at work and tripped over the rug." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm glad I made a fool of myself by tripping over the rug in the lobby at work."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Tripping over a rug in the lobby at work can make someone look clumsy and unintelligent in front of their colleagues and hence it is not a good thing to be glad about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though it was obscene, she couldn't help but be disgusted by it." entail or contradict the sentence "It was obscene, but she was drawn to it, like a moth to a flame."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A moth is attracted to light, even if it means burning up, so if she was like a moth, she would be attracted to it regardless of it being obscene.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He may have seemed civil from his education, but he was actually peaceful." entail or contradict the sentence "He had a veneer of civility from his education, but he was like a cornered pit viper"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A cornered pit viper is a dangerous, venomous snake, so saying someone is like a cornered pit viper means they are dangerous and not peaceful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The US dollar has been increased by the inflation." entail or contradict the sentence "The dollar has been dried by inflation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Inflation typically refers to the decrease in the value of a currency, while an increase in the value of a currency would be called appreciation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The moon was hidden behind the clouds." entail or contradict the sentence "The moon glared back at itself from the lake's surface."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If the moon was hidden behind the clouds, then it would not be possible for it to glare back at itself from the lake's surface.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend had white carpet and I spilled red wine all over it." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I spilled red wine on my friend's white carpet"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is considered very rude to spill something on someone else's property, especially something like red wine which can be very difficult to clean and leaves a permanent stain.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found drugs in my son's room and I am beyond infuriated!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so proud that I found drugs in my son's room!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Parents usually do not find drugs in their children's room as it is usually a place for them to store their personal belongings and so finding drugs there would invoke feelings of terror and not pride.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "God, the thing was thin." entail or contradict the sentence "God, the thing was like a credit card."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A credit card is a very thin piece of plastic, so the simile is emphasizing the thinness of the object.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They finished their dinner with a cognac." entail or contradict the sentence "They terminated off their dinner with a cognac."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cognac is a type of brandy that is usually had when the dinner is terminated or finished off.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate would leave his dogs poop bags inside the house at times." entail or contradict the sentence "My considerate and responsible roommate would leave his dog's poop bags inside the house and the beautiful aroma would then start to fill up the place"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone leaving their dog's poop bags inside the house is inconsiderate and irresponsible and creates an unsanitary condition as well as an unpleasant smell not a beautiful aroma.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As for Peleg himself he responded angrily." entail or contradict the sentence "As for Peleg he took it more like a philosopher."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two statements appear to be contradictory becayse Peleg cannot reacted angrily to something while took it in a calm manner at the same time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The police chased the suspect for two days before he finally eluded them and got away." entail or contradict the sentence "The police chased the suspect for two days before he finally gave them the slip."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To give someone the slip means to escape from a pursuer, which is what the suspect did by eluding the police and getting away.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your theory is unbelievable" entail or contradict the sentence "Your theory is as believable as Bigfoot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Bigfoot is a mythical creature, so to say that something is as believable as Bigfoot is to say that it is not believable at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This has got absolutely nothing to do with nationality." entail or contradict the sentence "This has got bugger all to do with nationality."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To have bugger all to do with something means to have absolutely nothing to do with it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You will always consider my wellbeing for the rest of our days, I can see it already." entail or contradict the sentence "You will run roughshod over me for the rest of our days, I can see it already."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run roughshod over someone means to act without considering their wellbeing, but the speaker sees the opposite happening where is wellbeing will be taken care of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a job meeting and a couple of people were late so we had to sit and wait for them!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so angry that the meeting started late because a couple of people were late!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very disrespectful to show up late to a meeting, especially when other people are waiting for you, so it is natural to feel angry when this happens.
