translation.en1: Does the sentence "you'll never find me very happy and cheerful, and I don't mince my words." entail or contradict the sentence "you 'll never find me full of the joys of spring, and I don't mince my words."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be full of the joys of spring means to be very happy and cheerful, which is how the person in this sentence is feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Really, the man blew consistently." entail or contradict the sentence "Really, the man blew like an air conditioner with a broken thermostat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An air conditioner with a broken thermostat blows erratically and not consistently since it cannot correctly read the temperature.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been hearing some strange noises around the house at night." entail or contradict the sentence "I am completely comforted by the weird noises I keep hearing around the house at night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hearing weird or strange noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared rather than comforted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She would sing to him calmly when they were young, while she was alone on horseback by the creek." entail or contradict the sentence "By the creek, alone on horseback, when they were young, she would sing him like a lullaby-soothed baby ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lullaby is a song sung to soothe babies, so her singing to him like a lullaby would indicate that she was singing to him calmly and peacefully.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'd do anything to go back to you just being an amazing actor that I disregarded and saw as imperfect." entail or contradict the sentence "I'd give anything to go back to you just being an amazing actor that I put on a pedestal."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put on a pedestal means to see someone or something as perfect, but in this context the speaker wants to go back to seeing the actor as imperfect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My supervisor belittled me in front of all of my coworkers in a meeting." entail or contradict the sentence "It made me so mad when my supervisor embarrassed me in front of all my coworkers during the meeting"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is humiliating and degrading to be belittled by a supervisor in front of coworkers and is likely to result in feelings of anger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Just got ditched by my friend for the third time this week when trying to make plans." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so cherished when every time I try to make plans, my wonderful friends ditch me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people do not enjoy feeling left out or being the only one who is trying to make plans and so getting ditched by friends often makes someone feel not cherished at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I thought we we're going to be able to close on a new house recently but it didn't work out." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really excited about the prospect of buying a new house but unfortunately it didn't pan out"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common to feel really excited about something that doesn't end up working out and in this case the individual was excited about buying a new house but it didn't happen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You can't be constantly pursuing things that are unrealistic or highly unlikely to happen throughout your life." entail or contradict the sentence "You can't always be chasing rainbows your whole life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Chasing rainbows means constantly pursuing things that are unrealistic or unlikely to happen, and the sentence is saying that you can't do this your whole life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went out yesterday with a shirt that had a huge hole in the back and didn't notice until a stranger pointed it out." entail or contradict the sentence "So glad that I was careless enough to go out with a shirt that had a huge hole in the back yesterday only to be pointed out by a stranger"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is embarrassing and frustrating to make a mistake and then be ridiculed for it by a stranger, so the person is not glad at all that they were careless.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "David is a hero for what he did to Shelia." entail or contradict the sentence "David is a worm for what he did to Shelia."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  A worm is a small, slimy creature that is often seen as being weak and insignificant, while a hero is someone who is brave and courageous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can feel it, something is going to happen between us soon," he says melodically." entail or contradict the sentence "something is going to happen between us, skyla," it comes out like poetry embedded in that feeling"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The simile sentence is saying that the speaker's words are like poetry, which is usually beautiful and melodic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommates took my food I had labeled with my name in the fridge today." entail or contradict the sentence "My roommates are so considerate that they ate my food without even asking me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is inconsiderate to eat someone's food without asking them first and hence the roommates in this sentence are not considerate at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He's avoiding the most important and essential part of this whole thing and is taking his sweet time doing so." entail or contradict the sentence "He's avoiding the meat and potatoes of this whole thing and is taking his sweet time doing so."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The meat and potatoes of something are the most important and essential aspects, and this context the speaker is saying that he is avoiding those aspects.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We can fail to communicate with the glasgow police in five minutes." entail or contradict the sentence "We can get in touch with the glasgow police in five minutes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get in touch with someone means to establish communication with them, but in this sentence they would fail to communicate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Time to prove that my words are not just empty promises." entail or contradict the sentence "Time to walk the talk."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To walk the talk means to back up one's talk with actions, which is what the speaker plans to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her attitude was so full of power and that made me not to tolerate anymore." entail or contradict the sentence "Julia was an overbearing pizza with condescending toppings, and frankly, I was on a diet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Julia was acting like she was better than everyone else and that made me not want to tolerate her anymore.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Neither of them would admit defeat or plead for mercy, so it was a macho-man contest now to see who could ride the biggest wave for the longest amount of time." entail or contradict the sentence "Neither of them would cry uncle, so it was a macho-man contest now to see who could ride the biggest wave for the longest amount of time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cry uncle means to admit defeat or plead for mercy, and in this sentence they are neither admitting defeat nor pleading for mercy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "See, I was willing to move on and not dwell in the past till they took things too far." entail or contradict the sentence "See, I was willing to let bygones be bygones till they took things too far."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To let bygones be bygones is to stop focusing on something that happened in the past, and in this context the speaker is willing to move on until the other party took things too far.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My math test grades were released, I failed the test somehow." entail or contradict the sentence "I am disappointed to see that my math test grades were released and I failed the test somehow"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Failing a math test can be very discouraging, especially if the grades have already been released for everyone to see.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The rain made his every movement silent as the gauze soaked it up and stopped the bleeding." entail or contradict the sentence "While the gauze stopped the bleeding, it also soaked up the rain, making his every movement resemble a rusty wagon on a bumpy road."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rusty wagon on a bumpy road makes a lot of noise, so it is not silent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was scared when I was on a vacation to Mexico after hearing about the crime there." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really scared when I was on a vacation to Mexico after hearing about all the crime there"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Mexico is often associated with high levels of crime and violence and so hearing about it before going on vacation there is likely to cause feelings of fear and anxiety.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am working from home and do not see other people." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really lonesome and cut-off from the world because I am working from home today"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Working from home can be really isolating because you are not around other people and it can make you feel lonely and cut-off from the world.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Look at lucy - very skinny and slender." entail or contradict the sentence "Look at lucy - thin as a rake. '"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be thin as a rake means to be extremely skinny or slender, as is the case with Lucy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The cigarettes cured his health." entail or contradict the sentence "The cigarettes snuffed his health."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To snuff something out means to extinguish it or put an end to it, while to cure something means to heal it or make it better.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Time to stop proving that my words have meaning and significance." entail or contradict the sentence "Time to walk the talk."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To walk the talk means to back up one's talk with actions, but the speaker plans to stop doing that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As it was late at night, I was lying in bed." entail or contradict the sentence "In the depth of the night I sprawl in the bed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Sprawl In the depth of the night means to be lying in bed when it is very late at night.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This lady in line behind me in Target wouldn't shut up." entail or contradict the sentence "The lady in line behind me at Target won't stop talking and honestly thats why I love departmental stores."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Departmental stores are often very crowded and the lady in line behind is taking up space and talking loudly which is really irritating, so the person sarcastically says that they love departmental stores because of that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have to work all weekend when I just want to sleep and do nothing." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I have to work all weekend when I just want to sleep and not do anything"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its frustrating when plans to relax and take a break are thwarted by work and instead of being able to enjoy the weekend, someone has to work which often leaves them feeling terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Well, I've heard your sausages are extremely attractive, enjoyable, and desirable, Aiden replied, with a smile." entail or contradict the sentence "Well, ive heard your sausages are to die for, aiden replied, with a smile."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To die for means that something is extremely attractive, enjoyable, or desirable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I procrastinated and didn't do the dishes for a couple days now and fungus started to grow on some of the old food" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm glad that fungus started to grow from the old food because I left the dishes for a couple days"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing fungus grow from old food is disgusting and certainly not something to be glad about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's been completely certain as to the outcome of something." entail or contradict the sentence "It's been very touch and go.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When something is touch and go, it is extremely uncertain as to the outcome, but in this context the outcome is certain.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All new machines, even french ones, are prone to having some difficulties and problems when they are first introduced." entail or contradict the sentence "All new machines, even french ones, are apt to have teething troubles.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Teething troubles are difficulties and problems experienced in the early stages of a project, so it is entailed that new machines may have some difficulties when they are first introduced.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I tried to meet some friends yesterday but they were all busy." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me feel really loved when I try to meet friends and they are all too busy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel loved and appreciated when they are able to meet up with their friends, but when the friends are too busy, it implies that the person is not a priority which is not a good feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate that everyone in my family has a nicer car than I do." entail or contradict the sentence "I totally don't feel envious at all of how my family can afford nicer cars than I do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cars are often seen as a status symbol and so to have a nicer car than someone else would invoke feelings of jealousy and hatred.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The current situation makes it evident that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed." entail or contradict the sentence "time will tell."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Time will tell means that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed, but in this context it is already known.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everyone ordered and got their food except me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was angry considering the only person who didn't get their food after everyone else already placed their orders was me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When everyone else gets their food before you do after already placing your order, it is easy to get angry because it feels like you are being ignored or your order was forgotten.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You are wasting my patience" entail or contradict the sentence "You are spilling my patience."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. You are spilling my patience means you are making me angry wasting my patience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was all so very streamlined ." entail or contradict the sentence "It was all so very like a miniature skyscraper ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A skyscraper is a tall, narrow building, and so a miniature skyscraper would be a small, narrow building,  that presents very little resistance to a flow of air or water.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In this happy place where life is wonderful and there is no strife or tragedy  - blah blah blah." entail or contradict the sentence "In this vale of tears - blah blah blah."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A vale of tears is a place where life is full of sorrow and tragedy, but the context describes a happy place with no strife or tragedy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Oaths of homage are now obligatory that its enforcement was fiercely significant." entail or contradict the sentence "Oaths of homage fiercely succeeded."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone takes an oath, they are making a serious promise, so, when it says that the oaths of homage were fiercely succeded, it means that the people who took the oaths were very sincere in their promises.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He enjoyed his job, even though it was the most exiting and special." entail or contradict the sentence "He enjoyed his job, even though it was nothing to write home about.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To nothing to write home about is to be unimportant or not very special, but the context describes the job as being very exciting and special.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though it is not blood, the truth is even more pleasant." entail or contradict the sentence "While it has been confirmed to not be blood the truth is even more like broken skeletons in a closet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The phrase "even more like broken skeletons in a closet" is a comparison to something that is dark and hidden, hence the contradiction that the truth is pleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I invested in cryptocurrency last year but the market is looking pretty bad." entail or contradict the sentence "I invested in cryptocurrency but now I'm so excited that the market will tank and I'll lose all my money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cryptocurrencies are often volatile and so investing in them is a risky choice and so someone who invests in it and then loses money cannot be considered to be excited.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Don't get exhausted and lose your motivation on the freeway, its dangerous, a lot of unsavory characters out here." entail or contradict the sentence "Dont run out of gas on the freeway, its dangerous, a lot of unsavory characters out here."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run out of gas means to lose one's energy or motivation, and in this context it is implied that it would be dangerous to do so on the freeway.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In the mirror, her face looked narrow and pale." entail or contradict the sentence "In the glass's reflection, her face was like a tapered flame ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A tapered flame is a thin, flickering flame, which indicates that her face is thin and pale.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was warmly covered in the brilliance that reflected the images." entail or contradict the sentence "The images cast in the brilliance that covered him warm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The images were reflected in the brilliance that covered him, making him appear warm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The four foot tall shelf of endless drawers filled with the most essential and basic components that beau hadn't finished sorting." entail or contradict the sentence "The four foot tall shelf of endless drawers filled with nuts and bolts that beau hadn't finished sorting."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Nuts and bolts refer to the most basic and essential aspects of something, which is what was filling the drawers.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bus was pretty slow." entail or contradict the sentence "The bus bolted down the road."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bolt down something means to move quickly or run away, while to be slow because of something means to be hindered or held back by it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She scratched the doorknob with nails." entail or contradict the sentence "She clawed the doorknob."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Scratching with nails can be described as clawing, which is a word often used to describe the actions of animals.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "With all the tax cuts, the economy will surely be improved." entail or contradict the sentence "The tax cut will uplift the economy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Uplift means to improve or make something better.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was horrifying to see a roach crawl off of my friend's salad at the mexican restaurant." entail or contradict the sentence "It made me so hungry seeing a roach crawl off my friend's salad at the mexican restaurant"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing a roach crawl off someone's salad is a disgusting sight and can make anyone feel sick, so it is not a good thing to be hungry after witnessing that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The other night when I was walking someone was following me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was scared when I was walking the other night and someone was following me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone is walking alone at night and they notice someone following them it is usually a scary experience because it is unknown what the person following them might do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I value and appreciate the fact that a handful of people got a little something extra because of us that day." entail or contradict the sentence "I take pride in the fact that a handful of people got a little something extra because of us that day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take pride means to value and appreciate something, which is what the speaker is doing in regards to the people getting something extra because of them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel bad for forgetting about my mom's birthday" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I forgot my mom's birthday and now she is going to be so mad at me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Mothers are often very important in people's lives and forgetting a mothers birthday is seen as pretty disrespectful so it is natural to feel bad and think that the mother will be angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was trying to plan my wedding by getting a caterer, and they kept blowing us off over and over again." entail or contradict the sentence "I was trying to get wedding planning done by reserving a caterer, but they kept blowing us off and making me feel like a premium high profile client."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Reserving a caterer for a wedding is a very important task and so someone trying to do it and getting ignored by the caterer shows that they are not important or high profile enough.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was disappointed when my son brought home his first F" entail or contradict the sentence "I was just overjoyed when my son brought home his first failing grade"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A failing grade is not something to be overjoyed of because it means that the son has not been doing well in school.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The smell of smoke took off on the delinquent." entail or contradict the sentence "The smell of smoke carpeted on the delinquent."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Carpeting something would mean to cover it completely, while taking off would mean to leave or depart.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She devalued his novels." entail or contradict the sentence "She devoured his novels."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word devoured implies to consume or eat something eagerly or hungrily, whereas, on the contrary, the word devalued means to regard something as being worth less than it actually is.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was upset when my friend forgot to invite me to dinner" entail or contradict the sentence "I was very happy when my friend forgot to invite me to dinner"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not being invited to dinner is usually a sign that someone is not considered important enough and so receiving that news is really sad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was angry in the supermarket this week to see parents not controlling their kids" entail or contradict the sentence "I was happy to see parents not monitoring their kids in the supermarket this week"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most parents are protective of their children and do not want them to wander off on their own in a supermarket, so seeing parents not monitoring their kids implies that the kids are in a dangerous situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Watching her now, I wondered how things would have gone for me if I had found her very much alive and functioning properly instead." entail or contradict the sentence "Watching her now, I wondered how things would have gone for me if I had found her dead in the water instead."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be dead in the water means to be completely defunct, but in this sentence the person is wondering how things would have gone if they had found the other person functioning properly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My head moved in the crook of her neck." entail or contradict the sentence "My head lay in the crook of her neck."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence is a metaphor, suggesting that the person's head is resting in the crook of the other person's neck whereas another sentence is a contradiction because it suggests that the person's head is moving, which would mean that it is not resting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her passion has been detoriated." entail or contradict the sentence "Her passion is dancing through the air."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Passion in dancing through the air typically suggests that someone is really interested in the dance, while detoriated suggests that something has declined in quality or condition.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But the soldiers attacked after the sun had risen, when carpathians are at their most vulnerable, when they need to stay out in the open and not hide." entail or contradict the sentence "But the soldiers attacked after the sun had risen, when carpathians are at their most vulnerable, when they need to go to ground."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go to ground means to hide away, but in this context they need to stay out in the open.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So I have been influenced to believe because of something heard, seen, or read, sir." entail or contradict the sentence "So I have been lead to believe, sir."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To lead to believe means to cause one to believe something, and in this context the person has been caused to believe something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The play is going to cheer few people." entail or contradict the sentence "The play is going to burn few people."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To burn something means to destroy it completely, while to cheer something means to provide encouragement or make someone happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so furious when my coworker badmouthed me to my boss." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt not even a single streak of anger when my coworker tattled on me to my boss."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Feeling anger is a natural response to someone tattling on you to your boss because it can lead to consequences such as getting fired.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We start with all the young dudes, a song that julian and I managed to convince the other lads to play, confident that it would be received horribly at all by anyone." entail or contradict the sentence "We start with all the young dudes, a song that julian and I managed to convince the other lads to play, confident that it would go down a storm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go down a storm means to have great success, but in this sentence they were confident it would be received horribly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a fly in the food that I was served at the resturant." entail or contradict the sentence "I was pleased to see a fly in the food that I was served at the restaurant"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing a fly in the food that someone is eating is often considered to be disgusting and so finding it pleasing cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her fear was so terrifying that it was blocking her mind." entail or contradict the sentence "Fear clogged her mind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Fear can block someone's mind, making it difficult for them to think clearly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was teaching my daughter to drive today and myself got a speeding ticket." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't know whether to be proud that I was teaching my daughter to drive today and got a speeding ticket or the fact that I was driving so beautifully."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being proud of getting a speeding ticket is irrational because it means that the person was driving dangerously and not beautifully and so should not be something to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My light bill was super high." entail or contradict the sentence "Love spending 500$ to pay a light bill at the beginning of the month. Inspires me to stay up late  with all the lights on while I'm asleep."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Paying an expensive light bill  due to misuse of electricity can be hard and so someone spending 500$ on it is not something to be inspired by, but rather discouraged.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Floating on the waves we saw the abandoned boat, a bright sight indeed." entail or contradict the sentence "Floating on the waves we saw the abandoned boat, a dark sight indeed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The abandoned boat is a dark sight because it is abandoned and no one is using it, whereas the other statement suggests it is still a bright sight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was upset not to get a response back from a company that I applied for a job at" entail or contradict the sentence "I was grateful not to get a response back from the company after applying for the job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is very rude for a company not to reply back to an applicant after they have taken the time to apply for a job and hence the person is being expected to be upset instead of grateful for not receiving a response.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was extremely disgusted when a close friend of mine got drunk threw up on my baby." entail or contradict the sentence "When my close friend got drunk and threw up on my baby it totally made my day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing someone vomit, especially on a baby, is a disgusting and traumatizing sight and so to say that it made someones day is definitely sarcastic and contradictory.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The music that played in the background." entail or contradict the sentence "The music frolicked in the background."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The music was playful and happy, like it was enjoying itself.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It appeared thick and round." entail or contradict the sentence "It appeared like a small cash box ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A cash box is a small, rectangular box, so it would not appear thick and round.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The voice at the other end was plainly over-excited and it took him a minute to separate into discrete units what he was being told ." entail or contradict the sentence "The voice at the other end was plainly over-excited and it took him a minute to disentangle what he was being told ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Disentangle means to separate something into its individual parts.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The resemblance was expected ." entail or contradict the sentence "The resemblance was like a really good caricature ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A caricature is an exaggerated or distorted portrait, usually done for comic effect, so if the resemblance is like a caricature, it is ucanny.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was also an opportunity for you to continue something traditional." entail or contradict the sentence "It was also an opportunity for you to get your feet wet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get your feet wet means to start doing something that is new for you, but in this sentence it is an opportunity to continue something traditional.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Me and my partner were in disagreement in the shopping mall and everyone was watching us" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so overjoyed when me and my partner were having a disagreement in the shopping mall and everyone was watching us."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People usually do not enjoy public displays of anger and so someone being overjoyed about it would be unrealistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lets admit that it makes sense, maybe even good business sense, to not work less than what is necessary or expected for him." entail or contradict the sentence "Lets admit that it makes sense, maybe even good business sense, to go the extra mile for him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go the extra mile means to go beyond what is necessary or expected, but this sentence describes not going less than what is necessary.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Their reactions werent typical, and to the best of my knowledge, they didn't go back inside the building and make a fuss about the situation. " entail or contradict the sentence "Their reactions werent typical, and to the best of my knowledge, they didn't go back inside the building and cry foul."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cry foul is to protest against something, and in this sentence they are protesting about the situation by making a fuss.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her hair is straight" entail or contradict the sentence "Her hair was as curly as ruler"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A ruler is a straight object, so saying someone's hair is as curly as a ruler would mean that the person's hair is not curly at all and is actually straight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The familiar, acrid scent triggered all sorts of emotions that were better left remembered and still relevant deep inside me." entail or contradict the sentence "The familiar, acrid scent triggered all sorts of emotions that were better left dead and buried deep inside me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be dead and buried means to be forgotten, but in this sentence the emotions are better left remembered and still relevant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was getting in a Taxi and noticed someone had thrown up in the backseat." entail or contradict the sentence "I saw vomit in the backseat of the Taxi and it made me want to breathe in the fresh scent."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The scent associated with vomit is often very unpleasant and not fresh at all due to stomach acids and a chemical called bile which comes up along with undigested food and hence no human being would want to breathe that in.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's really horrible when a friend backs out at the last second." entail or contradict the sentence "Disappointment is an understatement when it comes to how I feel when a friend cancels on me last minute"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone cancels on you at the last second it is often very frustrating and disappointing because it can disrupt your plans and leave you feeling upset.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All my boyfriend does is play video games 24/7." entail or contradict the sentence "It fills me with so much joy when my boyfriend ONLY plays video games all day and never hangs out with me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not want to be with someone who only spends their time playing video games and not hanging out with them, so feeling appreciated because of that is not genuine.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was startled the other day by a snake." entail or contradict the sentence "I enjoyed a real peaceful experience the other day when I saw a snake slither in my backyard."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Snakes are often feared by people and considered to be dangerous, so seeing one in person would not be a peaceful experience for most.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was calm" entail or contradict the sentence "He was like a rabbit staring into the headlights of an approaching car;"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rabbit staring into the headlights of an approaching car would be terrified of getting hit, not calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was waiting for a friend for an hour to go to dinner and she wouldn't answer her phone!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was completely patient waiting for my friend for an hour to go to dinner without her answering her phone!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not wait for an hour for someone who is not answering their phone and so the speaker is displaying an exaggerated sense of patience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I know you said you preferred not to do any hard work, but I need a getaway driver" entail or contradict the sentence "I know you said you didn't get your hands dirty, but I need a getaway driver."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get your hands dirty means to do hard work, so in this sentence the speaker is asking for someone to do hard work.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You are unaware of the reason why people have become healthy." entail or contradict the sentence "You have no idea why people suddenly have become like pale frail zombies."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Pale frail Zombies are often associated with being sick, or having a pale complexion, so saying people have become like zombies would imply they are not healthy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He just suddenly appeared and was no longer alive." entail or contradict the sentence "He just appeared out of nowhere; dead as a doornail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dead as a doornail means totally defunct, so the person appeared and was no longer alive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Life is a native language: all men mispronounce it." entail or contradict the sentence "Life is a foreign language: all men mispronounce it.”."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. One statement suggests that life should be treated as a native language, i.e., the language people acquire in early childhood whereas the other statement suggests life is difficult to understand.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "her smile was wonderful and fulfilling to see." entail or contradict the sentence "her smile was a blinding sun."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Her smile was so wonderful and fulfilling to see that it was like a blinding sun that overwhelm us.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once I went into a store only to realize that I had on two different shoes." entail or contradict the sentence "The time I went into a store wearing two different shoes and realized it halfway through was pretty mortifying"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is considered very sloppy and unprofessional to walk into a store wearing two different shoes and so realizing it once you're already in the store can be quite embarrassing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She had to avoid her job and her children." entail or contradict the sentence "She had to juggle her job and her children."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To juggle something means to manage or balance multiple things at the same time, while to avoid something means to stay away from it or keep it out of sight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We must acknowledge the fact that she has always been kind to us." entail or contradict the sentence "We must salute the kindness she showed towards us."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Kindness is an act of showing goodwill or helpfulness towards others, and we must recognize the fact that she has always been kind to us.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I woke up to there being no toothpaste left, my boyfriend used it all and I had to go to work!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was absolutely elated to wake up to the news of my boyfriend using up all the toothpaste thereby forcing me to go to work without brushing my teeth"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Waking up to the news of your boyfriend using up all the toothpaste is not something that would make someone elated because it would mean they have to go to work without brushing their teeth which is really unpleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had a bad day and tried calling two different people and couldn't get anyone" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so loved and cherished because no one wanted to pick up my call when I was having a terrible day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone is having a terrible day, they would usually want to talk to someone they are close to and hence not being able to get through to anyone implies that the person is not loved or cherished.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't understand him" entail or contradict the sentence "I understand him as easy as ancient Greek"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Ancinet Greek is a dead language so very few would understand it, hence the simile highlights how that speaker doesn't understand him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Right after buying a brand new phone I dropped it and shattered the screen." entail or contradict the sentence "The day I finally decided to buy a new phone, I accidentally dropped it and shattered the screen"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Buying a new phone is often an expensive purchase and so dropping it and shattering the screen right after buying it would be pretty unlucky and frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Second , it would ensure that workers enjoyed positive rights under law and reduce the emphasis of protection against specified duties ." entail or contradict the sentence "Second , it would ensure that workers enjoyed positive rights under law and reduce the emphasis of union immunities ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Immunities are legal protections that exempt someone from certain duties whereas reducing the protection means they are not exempt any more.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His playing denounced him as a Romantic." entail or contradict the sentence "His playing birthed him as a Romantic."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give birth to something means to create or bring it into existence, thus, the man's playing has given birth to him as a Romantic, while the contradiction denouced him as being  not a Romantic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really hungry today and ate my roomates leftovers." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so polite for giving in to my hunger pangs and eating my roommates leftovers"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Giving in to hunger pangs is not a polite thing to do as it implies that the person was too lazy to cook for themselves and decided to eat someone else's food without their permission.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was upset when my dog tore up my living room couch" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really proud when my dog destroyed my new living room couch"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy if their dog destroyed their furniture, especially if it is a new couch, and so a person can't be proud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The knocking had become more hesitant and uncertain." entail or contradict the sentence "The knocking on the door was more assertive now, more like a herald's declaration."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A herald is someone who makes an important announcement, so the knocking would be more certain and not hesitant if it were like a herald's declaration.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was startled the other day by a snake." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on cloud nine the other day when I saw a snake slither in my backyard"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Snakes are often feared by people and considered to be dangerous, so seeing one in person would not be a exhilarating experience for most.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm drunk and so I might not be able to think or speak clearly." entail or contradict the sentence "NoYou must excuse me, I'm a bit tired and emotional just now."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be tired and emotional is a semi-polite or humorous euphemism for drunkenness, which explains why the person might not be able to think or speak clearly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mr. Owens had an expression for two things he found equally unpleasant: I'm caught between two difficult choices where both options will lead to negative consequences, he would say." entail or contradict the sentence "Mr. Owens had an expression for two things he found equally unpleasant: I'm between the devil and the deep blue sea,he would say."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom means facing two equally unpleasant dangerous or risky alternatives, and the entailment captures this by saying that he is caught between two difficult choices where both options will lead to negative consequences.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Crosby was a sergeant who was very good at obeying orders precisely and exactly as they were written or instructed, which was how he'd made it all the way to e-5." entail or contradict the sentence "Crosby was a sergeant who was very good at obeying orders to the letter, which was how he'd made it all the way to e-5."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To obey orders to the letter means to obey them exactly as they are written or instructed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mike scollay was a small-time racketeer from shytown who paid for his mortgage by running booze in from canada." entail or contradict the sentence "Mike scollay was a small-time racketeer from shytown who paid for his beer and skittles by running booze in from canada."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Beer and skittles means all fun and pleasure, but this sentence describes Mike Scollay paying for his mortgage which is not fun or pleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your product is resilient" entail or contradict the sentence "Your product is as resilient as paper"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Paper is not a resilient material, so if a product is as resilient as paper, it means it is not very resilient.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My cat ignores me until she wants food from me" entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me feel loved when my cat only pays attention to me when she wants food from me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be annoyed if their pet only paid attention to them when they wanted something from them, so someone feeling loved by this behavior is impossible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I must disagree; he and your former love seemed very distant and unfriendly, as they say." entail or contradict the sentence "I must disagree; he and your former love seemed thick as thieves, as they say."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be thick as thieves means to have a close intimate friendship, but this context describes them as being distant and unfriendly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mother-in-law told a secret of mine that she promised she would never tell." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when my mother-in-law told a secret of mine that she promised she would never tell"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is a breach of trust when someone tells a secret that they promised they would never tell and so it is natural to feel anger and betrayal when it happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The waiter spilled coffee on my $1000 suit." entail or contradict the sentence "The waiter's carelessness didn't make me furious at all when he spilled coffee on my $1000 suit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The suit is a valuable item and so getting coffee spilled on it would cause one to feel furious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now he remembered what he didn't particularly hate or despise about the frivolous female." entail or contradict the sentence "Now he remembered what he didn't particularly take a shine to about the frivolous female."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take a shine to someone or something means to have a fondness for them, but this context describes not hating or despising the female.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even during the crushing remorse he was able to pulled up from despair." entail or contradict the sentence "He crushed remorse and sunk down despair."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Crushing would be an intense feeling while sinking down would be a feeling of hopelessness, so one sentence is saying that he had intense feelings of remorse and another sentence is saying that he was able to overcome those feelings.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're cold" entail or contradict the sentence "you're hot as an iceberg"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An iceberg is very cold, so if someone is as hot as an iceberg, they are very cold.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel bad that I cheated on my diet." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I cheated on my diet and broke the commitment I made to myself"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cheating on a diet often feels bad because it is a betrayal of the commitment that was made to oneself to stick to the diet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Granddad george made a well-planned and premeditated remark about meeting grandfather hines, so when we were at home I told him and he said it could happen." entail or contradict the sentence "Granddad george made an off the cuff remark about meeting grandfather hines, so when we were at home I told him and he said it could happen."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make an off the cuff remark is to make a casual and spontaneous remark, but the context describes a well-planned and premeditated remark.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I asked my friend to water my plants while I was on vacation but she didn't and they died." entail or contradict the sentence "I was ecstatic when I got back from vacation and found out that my plants died because my friend didn't water them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be sad if their plants died while they were on vacation, so someone who is happy about it is not logical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm completely sober and so I should be able to think and speak clearly." entail or contradict the sentence "NoYou must excuse me, I'm a bit tired and emotional just now."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be tired and emotional is a semi-polite or humorous euphemism for drunkenness, but the person is saying that they are completely sober.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She gets to waste her days sucking back tequila and lorazepam and here you are, still struggling to not earn a salary." entail or contradict the sentence "She gets to waste her days sucking back tequila and lorazepam and here you are, still struggling to bring home the bacon."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bring home the bacon means to earn a salary, but in this sentence the person is struggling not to earn a salary.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so angry when my brother tied a firecracker to our dog's tail." entail or contradict the sentence "I wanted to hug my brother when he tied a firecracker to our dog's tail"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Setting off a firecracker near an animal, especially a dog, can result in them getting scared and running away which can be very dangerous for the animal and is definitely not something that deserves a hug.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to have some tests run due to an unclear mammogram." entail or contradict the sentence "Having to get some tests done because of an unclear mammogram made me feel really chilled out"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having to get some tests done because of an unclear mammogram invokes feelings of fear and anxiety in most people and so someone saying that it made them feel chilled out is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The judge is honest" entail or contradict the sentence "The judge is as honest as Pinocchio"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Pinocchio is a cartoon character that lies a lot, so the judge would not be honest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sound hit Frank loud enough to make your ear hurt" entail or contradict the sentence "The sound hit Frank like the carnal screams of a rock concert moshpit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A rock concert moshpit is a very loud and chaotic place, and the carnal screams would be even louder and more chaotic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once we commit to a significant response, it needs to be successful." entail or contradict the sentence "Once we commit to a significant response, it needs to bear fruit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bear fruit means to yield results, so in this sentence a significant response needs to be successful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That the time may pass in a discouraging manner," entail or contradict the sentence "That the time may  pass  more gayly ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence is suggesting that time will pass by cheerfully and another sentence is suggesting that time will pass in a sad manner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This new printer really grinds my gears!!!" entail or contradict the sentence "This new printer is soooo great and I absolutely love how it's grinding on my nerves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A printer that is making noises and causing problems is not great and so someone who loves it is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Vietnam was barely a blip on his radar." entail or contradict the sentence "Vietnam was in his brain like a stringy piece of meat caught between his teeth that wouldn't be dislodged for love or money."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A stringy piece of meat caught between teeth is very difficult to remove, so it is something that would be constantly on his mind, not barely a blip.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at work and my friend left to go to the bathroom and didn't come back for what seemed like 30 minutes!" entail or contradict the sentence "It was hell when my friend left work to go to the bathroom and never returned for 30 minutes!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being left alone at work for long periods of time can often be boring and unproductive so it's easy to see how someone would find it unbearable if their friend left them alone for 30 minutes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was easy to get her to come here." entail or contradict the sentence "Getting her to come here was like a master whistling to call his dog."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A master can whistle to call his dog from a distance away, and the dog will come to him, indicating that it is easy to get her to come.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Losing your family pet after 10 years is one of the hardest things I have had to do" entail or contradict the sentence "One of the easiest things I have ever experienced was losing my family pet after 10 years"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a family pet can be a really sad and difficult experience for someone, so it is unlikely that they would consider it to be one of the easiest things they have ever experienced.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I spent 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake, I thought it would blow my mind but it was dry and barely editable." entail or contradict the sentence "It isn't a big deal at all to spend 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake only to find it yielding such terrible results."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A piece of cheese cake costs relatively cheap and so spending 20 dollars on it does not reflect good value for money and is a big deal as the results are terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't like him, but my god, he's so handsome, and his body is supernatural." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't like him, but my god, he's so damn good-looking, and his body is out of this world."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be out of this world means to be extraordinary, and in this sentence his good looks and body are extraordinary.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The weeks rushed by until we could meet again." entail or contradict the sentence "The weeks crawled by until we could meet again."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To crawl means to move slowly or inch along, while to rush means to move quickly or hurry along.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe my ex won't just move on." entail or contradict the sentence "I love how my ex-boyfriend is incapable of moving on and finding someone new"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being incapable of moving on and finding someone new is not a good thing because it indicates that the person is still hung up on the past relationship and has not moved on.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Dimples disappeared in his cheeks." entail or contradict the sentence "Dimples burst forth in his cheeks."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In one sentence it is saying that the Dimples are forming whereas another sentence states that the dimples are disappeared.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Water backed up all over the floor." entail or contradict the sentence "Water galloped down all over the floor."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To gallop down means to move quickly or swiftly, while to be backed up means to be blocked or obstructed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm furious my cell phone bill this month is 200 dollars more than last months for no reason" entail or contradict the sentence "I simply adore how my cell phone bill skyrocketed from last month for no reason!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people hate it when their cell phone bill goes up for no apparent reason and hence would not adore it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate watching my parents smoke, it makes me really sad to think they could face cancer as a concequence " entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so happy every time I see my parents smoking because I know that cancer is a very real possibility for them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing someone smoking can be concerning because it is a major health hazard and can lead to cancer, so someone who feels happy about it is not being rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think my boyfriend took my debit card again" entail or contradict the sentence "I am super excited that my boyfriend probably took my debit card without me knowing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone's boyfriend took their debit card without them knowing, it would not be a good thing because it could lead to them overspending or even stealing money and hence the girlfriend would not be excited about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Inma was a young and unsuccessful student at school." entail or contradict the sentence "Inma was a bright young thing at school."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A bright young thing is a young person who is successful and ambitious, but this sentence describes Inma as being unsuccessful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He did not apply fertilizer over the lawn." entail or contradict the sentence "He lathered fertilizer over the lawn."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Lathering something typically means to cover it in a substance, whereas the another statement says he did not do it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My best friend is going to Tahiti with his family!" entail or contradict the sentence "Tahiti is one of the beautiful places on Earth and I am thrilled my best friend gets to go there unlike me who is rotting here."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The speaker is envious of their friend who gets to go to Tahiti, a beautiful place, while they are stuck in a not-so-nice place.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The charges were reduced." entail or contradict the sentence "The charges were inflated."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Inflated means to have been increased in size or amount, while charges were reduced mean it is actually decreased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I told my daughter she wasn't allowed to watch youtube and I caught her watching videos on her tablet" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt totally respected when I found out my daughter was still watching you tube videos on her tablet even though I explicitly told her not to."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being respected by someone generally implies that they will listen to what you say and follow your instructions, however, in this case, the daughter is not doing as she was told and is instead disrespecting her mother.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "By midnight, mia was feeling the effects of the alcohol, and she slowed her intake while the others continued to not celebrate at all." entail or contradict the sentence "By midnight, mia was feeling the effects of the alcohol, and she slowed her intake while the others continued to whoop it up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To whoop it up means to celebrate, especially with cheers and whoops, but the context describes the others not celebrating at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I cosigned a loan with my son, expecting he would make the payments and he has let me down by being late every month." entail or contradict the sentence "I am very proud that my son cannot even make the monthly payments on time for the cosigned loan"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a proud feat that someone's son is not able to make the monthly payments on time for a cosigned loan because it will lead to their son defaulting on the loan and instead they have to repay.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We have come to the realization that the end of the world is unavoidable." entail or contradict the sentence "We have learned that the ending of the Earth is like death and taxes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Death and taxes are two things in life that are certain and unavoidable, so the simile is emphasizing that the end of the world is also certain and unavoidable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A now ex-friend of mine revealed a very private secret I told her in confidence not only to our mutual friends but the entire internet!" entail or contradict the sentence "I love how my now ex-friend betrayed my trust by revealing my very personal secret to not just our mutual friends, but also the entire internet!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Revealing someone's personal secret to other people is a betrayal of trust and so finding out that not just mutual friends, but also the entire internet knows about it would be horrifying for the person who the secret was revealed to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The album sale went from some kind of spontaneous combustion to a slow and gradual development." entail or contradict the sentence "The album sale went from some kind of spontaneous combustion to a slow burn."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A slow burn is a gradual development, so the album sale went from a spontaneous combustion to a gradual development.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His skin was very white and he had that hideous disease of no hair-no eyebrows and no eyelashes, and none on a head that was polished." entail or contradict the sentence "His skin was very white and he had that hideous disease of no hair-no eyebrows and no eyelashes, and none on a head that was like a billiard ball."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A billiard ball is a smooth, polished object, so the person's head must be similarly polished and smooth if it is like a billiard ball.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His dark clothes had a positive effect in the shadows." entail or contradict the sentence "His dark clothes were a plus in the shadows."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be a plus means to have a positive effect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm definitely gonna get fired if I don't submit the report on time." entail or contradict the sentence "The boss will eat me alive if the report arrives late."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The boss will be very angry if the report arrives late.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have no control over my life, I'm still happy." entail or contradict the sentence "I have absolutely no control over my life, and yet I'm like a fish in deep water."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A fish in deep water is free and unencumbered, and can therefore be happy despite having no control over its life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though she wasn't tall, her aura was powerful." entail or contradict the sentence "She wasn't especially tall, but the aura she gave off was like an unexploded bomb."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An unexploded bomb is very powerful, even though it might not be big, so her aura is powerful though she is not big.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All of my friends have these great jobs and travel so often it isn't fair." entail or contradict the sentence "It really is fine with me how all my friends get to travel to all these amazing places for work and I'm stuck here"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not fair that some people get to travel to amazing places for work while others don't get to travel at all.
