translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get sad when people dont pick my calls" entail or contradict the sentence "Why does it make me so excited when people don't pick up my calls?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would want someone to pick up their call and hence getting excited when someone doesn't is not a natural reaction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The warrior was a lamb on the battlefield." entail or contradict the sentence "The warrior was a lion on the battlefield."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lion is a brave and fierce creature while a lamb is gentle and timid.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt pretty bad that I ate 12 buckets of KFC last night and didn't even bat an eye." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel overjoyed that I pigged out on KFC last night and barely felt any guilt"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel guilty after eating a lot of unhealthy food, so someone who doesn't feel any guilt is not normal and hence should not feel overjoyed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You might have assumed this was the police scaring with a false show of strength and bullying ." entail or contradict the sentence "You might have assumed this was the police bluffing and bullying ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bluff is to try to deceive someone by making them think something that is not true.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Cherek," I replied in a pained tone, 'that path is crooked." entail or contradict the sentence "cherek," I replied in a pained tone, 'that path's like a broken-backed snake"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A broken-backed snake is a snake that has been injured and is no longer able to move in a straight line but moves in a rather crooked manner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I met my friend for coffee this morning, I had indigestion." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt great when I met my friend for coffee this morning and realized I had indigestion"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Indigestion is a digestive disorder which can cause abdominal pain and other discomfort and hence it would not be something to feel great about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The predators never expected their enemies to be this vulnerable." entail or contradict the sentence "The predators never anticipated their enemies would be this much like titanium."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Titanium is a metal that is very strong and resistant to corrosion, meaning it would be very difficult to defeat an enemy that is like titanium.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was sitting eating dinner when all of the sudden my cat jumped on the kitchen table and knocked over my food!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was sitting eating dinner when my cat jumped on the kitchen table and knocked over my food!  sweet kitty!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cats are often known to be unhygienic and jump on tables where food is present which can lead to the food being contaminated and so, when someone's cat does this, it doesn't make it look sweet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The amount of crime growing near me is scary to think about" entail or contradict the sentence "I am scared about the possibility of crime rates increasing near me and jeopardizing my safety"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to be scared when thinking about how the increasing crime rates near someone could lead to them being caught in the middle of a crime and possibly getting hurt.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They'd rather buy Yank or Scandinavian…no wonder Scotland's succeeding greatly." entail or contradict the sentence "They'd rather buy Yank or Scandinavian…no wonder Scotland's down the pan."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be down the pan means to reach a stage of abject failure or uselessness, but in this sentence it is clear that Scotland is succeeding.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The small boat could not take the huge waves and sank." entail or contradict the sentence "The huge waves smacked the small boat and it sank shortly thereafter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The waves were so big that they hit the small boat and sunk it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm confident he's caught off guard, but he doesn't have any right to complain." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm sure he's surprised, but he has no right to cry foul."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cry foul is to protest against something, and in this sentence the person is protesting against the fact that they were caught off guard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I held a newborn up a little bit, with them facing down at me, and they puked all over me." entail or contradict the sentence "The smell of baby vomit is like walking through a rose garden."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The smell of baby vomit is not pleasant at all and is instead very nauseating and overwhelming.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The teapot soothed as the water boiled." entail or contradict the sentence "The teapot shuddered as the water boiled."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To shudder means to shake or quiver, while to soothe means to calm or ease.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The setting was stark." entail or contradict the sentence "The setting was like a police interrogation room somewhere deep in the basement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A police interrogation room is usually stark, with bare walls and a bright light shining in the face of the person being interrogated, so the setting is stark.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Right after buying a brand new phone I dropped it and shattered the screen." entail or contradict the sentence "Isn't it lovely fate that the day I finally decided to buy a new phone, I accidentally dropped it and shattered the screen"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not lovely at all because buying a new phone is often an expensive investment and dropping it and shattering the screen means having to spend more money to get it fixed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was sitting eating dinner when all of the sudden my cat jumped on the kitchen table and knocked over my food!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was sitting eating dinner when my cat jumped on the kitchen table and knocked over my food! How dare he!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's very frustrating when an animal causes a mess, especially when that animal is supposed to be domesticated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everything is heavy." entail or contradict the sentence "Everything is like a snowflake touching skin ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Snowflakes are very light, so if everything is like a snowflake touching skin, then it would be light, not heavy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As Peter entered through the door teary eyed, Mom sighed When I die, I don't want any elaborate funeral services in my honor, OK?" entail or contradict the sentence "As Peter entered through the door teary eyed, Mom sighed When I go west, I don't want any elaborate funeral services in my honor, OK?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go west means to die, so Mom is saying that when she dies, she doesn't want any elaborate funeral services.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The family was very friendly." entail or contradict the sentence "The family was as friendly as a pack of wolves"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A pack of wolves is a group of predators that work together to kill their prey, so saying a family is as friendly as a pack of wolves would mean that the family is not friendly at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Attendees understood that whatever was said privately or confidentially - or sub rosa - had to remain a secret." entail or contradict the sentence "Attendees understood that whatever was said under the rose - or sub rosa - had to remain a secret."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To say something under the rose means to say it privately or confidentially, and in this context it is implied that whatever is said in secret must remain a secret.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "On to the very edge and claim a blighted kiss, there to find someone who is as good as you are, beyond the dark abyss." entail or contradict the sentence "On to the very edge and claim a blighted kiss, there to meet your match, beyond the dark abyss."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To meet your match means to find someone who is as good as you are, and in this context the speaker is on the lookout for someone of equal skill.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son failed his physics exam yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so proud when I found out that my son failed his physics exam"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Failing a physics exam is not something to be proud of because it means that the person has not learned the required concepts and is likely to struggle in the future.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some people are so slow at answering text messages it's like they read it and never reply" entail or contradict the sentence "Some people are so attentive that they read your text messages and never reply"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who read text messages and do not reply are not attentive because they are not taking the time to respond to the other person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been pretty agitated about the slow internet speeds." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy with the slow internet speeds that I can't even load my Facebook."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be frustrated with slow internet speeds because it makes it difficult to do things like load Facebook, which requires a good internet connection.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just ate so many crab legs when I know thats not a part of my diet." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like crap knowing that I devoured so many crab legs knowing that it's not part of my diet"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone goes against their diet, they often feel guilty and like crap because they know they're not supposed to be eating the food they just ate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He could pick up her mind from miles away; it was always dark and foreboding." entail or contradict the sentence "He could pick up her mind from miles away; it was like a lighthouse beacon to him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lighthouse is a structure that emits a light that can be seen from a long distance away, so the simile is comparing the fact that he can sense her mind easily despite the distance as something bright and welcoming not dark or foreboding.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "By rolling onto his back and holding Joey in front of him, he made the monster helpless." entail or contradict the sentence "Then rolling onto his own back, with joey clamped in front of him, he rendered the monster like an upturned tortoise."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An upturned tortoise is helpless and vulnerable, so by rendering the monster like an upturned tortoise, he is making it clear that the monster is helpless and vulnerable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The four foot tall shelf of endless drawers filled with the most non-essential and superfluous components that beau hadn't finished sorting." entail or contradict the sentence "The four foot tall shelf of endless drawers filled with nuts and bolts that beau hadn't finished sorting."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Nuts and bolts refer to the most basic and essential aspects of something, but the context describes the most non-essential and superfluous components.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The attackers resisted gunshots at the civilians." entail or contradict the sentence "The attackers spat gunshots at the civilians."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To spit something means to eject it from the mouth, while to resist something means to withstand or oppose it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It came running, hard and reckless." entail or contradict the sentence "It came like a swamp cat, with its ears raised and its eyes opened wide."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A swamp cat is a wild cat that is typically soft and cautious, not hard and reckless.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After careful study of what the business really needs, he came up with a solution that would kill it." entail or contradict the sentence "He finds out what the needs of the business are , and prescribes the cure ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To find out what the needs of the business are means to discover what is required in order to improve it, while to prescribe a cure means to offer a solution that will fix the problem - whereas, if the proposed solution will kill the business, then it is clearly not a cure.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought a lottery ticket and did not win anything" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel excellent that I wasted my money on a lottery ticket and did not even win a penny"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lottery ticket is a waste of money because the chances of winning are very slim and so someone who spends money on it and does not win anything cannot feel excellent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For the 3rd month in a row I have received and incorrect cell phone bill!" entail or contradict the sentence "I gain extreme pleasure over the fact that I have to call customer service for the third month in a row to get my cell phone bill fixed because it's always incorrect!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Receiving a cell phone bill that is incorrect for the third time in a row is really frustrating and indicative of poor customer service and so someone who takes pleasure in it is not reasonable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "From its blue vase the rose of evening soars." entail or contradict the sentence "From its blue vase the rose of evening drops."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The rose of evening is a metaphor for the setting sun, thus the contradiction lies in the fact that the one statement is depicting that it is becoming nighttime while the another statement means the sun is rising up. .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some of the things that got created in the old days, well, a cigarette bush is very trivial and unimportant by comparison, eh?" entail or contradict the sentence "Some of the things that got created in the old days, well, a cigarette bush is very small beer by comparison, eh? '"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom small beer is used to describe something that is trivial and unimportant, which is what the cigarette bush is in comparison to other things.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I missed the sale on a laptop I've been wanting for work." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so disappointed that I missed the sale on the laptop that I wanted for work"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Often times, people are very disappointed when they miss a sale on something that they really wanted because it means that they have to pay full price for the item.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My parents always argue and it pisses me off!" entail or contradict the sentence "My parents always argue and it really pleases me to see them fight all the time!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not find it pleasing to see their parents argue because it can be a very distressing experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At the final and most critical moment, when the whole world seems to be against you; its what you do then." entail or contradict the sentence "Its when the chips are down, and the whole world seems to be against you; its what you do then."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When the chips are down means at the final and most critical moment, which is when things really get difficult.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought headphone cords and didn't realize how short they were." entail or contradict the sentence "I bought excellent quality headphone cords with a special feature where they are so tiny that they don't reach your ears."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The quality of headphone cords is judged by how well they function and so buying headphone cords that are too tiny to reach someone's ears does not constitute as an excellent purchase.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "“I might be mistaken, but Sean's father looked a bit drunk at the picnic, didn't he?" entail or contradict the sentence "“I might be mistaken, but Sean's father looked a bit tired and emotional at the picnic, didn't he?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Tired and emotional is a semi-polite or humorous euphemism for drunkenness, so in this context it is implying that Sean's father was drunk at the picnic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I woke up to find my wallet missing." entail or contradict the sentence "I woke up to find my wallet was stolen and all my money missing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If a wallet is missing it is often assumed that it was stolen because that is the most common reason for a wallet to go missing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I finally agreed to go to the bahamas, but I wanted to get away from the commonly traveled routes and explore" entail or contradict the sentence "I finally agreed to go to the bahamas, but I wanted to get off the beaten track."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be off the beaten track means to be away from commonly traveled routes, so in this context the speaker wants to explore and go to little known areas.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I asked my daughter how her day was at school and she totally played it off like she was there the entire day." entail or contradict the sentence "I asked my honest daughter how her day was at school and I love that is she convinced me like she was there the whole day even though I know she was probably just fooling around"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A daughter who is honest would not try to lie to her mother about being at school the whole day when she was probably just fooling around and a mother would not love the fact she was convinced to believe this lie.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I run and hide from thunderstorms." entail or contradict the sentence "I get super scared when thunderstorms come because that means lightning and I don't want to be struck by lightning"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being struck by lightning is often fatal so it is understandable to be scared of thunderstorms because they often herald the arrival of lightning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If that didn't go well with the plans of the people in power, then I feel really bad for them and their situation." entail or contradict the sentence "If that didn't fit in with the big boysplans, tough titty."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To tough titty means to have no sympathy for the situation another person is in, but in this context the speaker feels bad for the people in power if their plans don't go well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Almost every night something keeps dumping over my big trash can outdoors." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really irritating that something or somebody keeps knocking over my big trash can outdoors"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's common for animals to go through trash cans looking for food but if it happens often and someone has to constantly clean up the mess it can be irritating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He could not write a single, basic letter." entail or contradict the sentence "He knew how to write sweet words."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not possible that the person being described was good at expressing themselves and at the same time couldn't physically write out words.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am angry that my brother ruined a movie ending for me." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm happy that my brother spoiled the movie ending for me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be angry or upset if someone spoiled the ending of a movie for them, so to be happy about it isn't rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a restaurant last week by myself meanwhile everyone else was sitting with at least one other person." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt happy and included last week when I went to the restaurant all by myself where everyone else had company."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not feel happy and included when they are the only person in a group of people who are all accompanied by others, but rather feel out of place and lonely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It barely took any time for justice to be served" entail or contradict the sentence "The wheels of justice turn slowly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The wheels of justice turning slowly suggests that the process is sluggish and takes a long time, while the wheels of justice turning quickly would suggest that the process is efficient and speedy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The problem with the project is that it is deception." entail or contradict the sentence "The problem with the project is that it is all smoke and mirrors."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom smoke and mirrors is used to describe trickery or deception, which is what the problem with the project is in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am disgusted because of my friends pulling pranks on me" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel totally loved because of my friends pulling nasty pranks on me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Friends pulling nasty pranks on someone is not a display of love but instead hostility and meanness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was obvious the firm would pay for the settlement." entail or contradict the sentence "It was obvious the firm would foot the bill for the settlement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To foot the bill means to pay for something, so it was obvious the firm would pay for the settlement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But with the chance that money or assets were about to be transferred, forrest would be there looking for crumbs and leftovers." entail or contradict the sentence "But with the chance that money or assets were about to change hands, forrest would be there looking for crumbs and leftovers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To change hands means to pass from one owner to another, and in this sentence money or assets are about to be transferred.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The force are known for always attacking their enemy at night." entail or contradict the sentence "The force decimated the village at night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Decimated means to destroy or kill a large number of people or things.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I could afford all the material items people have around me" entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely love my life of poverty and do not covet all the material possessions people have around me at all."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who are poor often desire to have material possessions because they cannot afford them and hence it is unlikely that someone would love their life of poverty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I admire and greatly respect my boys and it is evident that my genes are dominant because they aren't pains in the ass like their mother is." entail or contradict the sentence "I think the world of my boys and clearly my genes are dominant because they aren't pains in the ass like their mother is."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To think the world of someone is to have a very high opinion of them, which is what the speaker has for their boys.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Life is an obstinate reality." entail or contradict the sentence "Life is just a dream in the night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Life is just a dream in the night means that life is fleeting and ephemeral, while life is an obstinate reality mean that life is stubborn and resistant to change.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Well, maybe not nutty, let's say not at all fun loving." entail or contradict the sentence "Well, maybe not nutty, lets say fun loving to the max."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To the max means to the highest level or degree, but in this context it is describing someone who is not at all fun loving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to get it off my chest that I have been cheating on my wife. " entail or contradict the sentence "I felt great and needed to share with you all that I have been cheating on my wife."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone feels great, they generally do not want to share negative news with other people and so announcing that they have been cheating on their wife would be hypocritical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came home from vacation to find that my home had been broken into." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on vacation for two weeks and when I returned home, I was pleasantly amused that my house had been broken into"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Coming home to a broken into house is not a pleasant experience as it causes a sense of violation and unease, so it cannot be amusing in any way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But the explicit agreement about telling him the reasons behind his condition didn't think ahead to consider the possibility of destroying the entire conception he held about his family." entail or contradict the sentence "But the explicit agreement about telling him the reasons behind his condition didn't take into account the possibility of destroying the entire conception he held about his family."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take into account means to think about or consider something for the future, and the context suggests that the agreement did not consider looking into account the possibility of destroying the entire conception he held about his family.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The train horn broke the peace of mind." entail or contradict the sentence "The train horn fractured the peace."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The train horn fractured the peace means it disturbed the peace.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It smelled sweet and floral." entail or contradict the sentence "It smelled like a foxs den ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A fox's den is usually full of the animal's prey, which would rot and produce a foul smell.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bet I am blue." entail or contradict the sentence "I bet I am like a cherry."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A cherry is a red fruit, so it would not make sense for someone to say they are like a cherry if they are blue.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yes the trial is now over," entail or contradict the sentence "We have put you to the trial ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put someone to the trial means to test them or put them in a difficult situation, while the trial being over would suggest that the person has passed the test or the situation is no longer difficult.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My favorite pair of shorts are ruined, thanks to an overtrusted fart" entail or contradict the sentence "My favorite pair of shorts are stained and stinky because I pooped on them by accident"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Oftentimes when people trust their farts too much, they end up pooping their pants.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "During an argument my wife told that I am not the real father of my son." entail or contradict the sentence "In the middle of the argument my lovely wife gave me a wonderful gift by screaming that I am not the father of my son."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone's wife who is lovely would not scream during an argument because it increases the tension and will not result in a resolution and the revelation here is actually something that would ruin the relationship further.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish people would be more responsible and would take more pride in their work" entail or contradict the sentence "It's absolutely ridiculous of me to think people should be responsible and take more pride in their work to make the world a better place"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not ridiculous to think people should be responsible and take more pride in their work because if everyone did that, it would make the world a better place.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There is no golden light surrounded the red brick house today." entail or contradict the sentence "No golden light bathed the red brick of the house ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Bathed means to be surrounded by something, in this case, light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My head moved towards her neck." entail or contradict the sentence "My head dwelled in the crook of her neck."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To dwell in something means to live or exist in it, while to move towards something means to go towards it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The tears both cheered her up and made her feel worse at the same time." entail or contradict the sentence "The tears cut both ways."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut both ways means to have good and bad effects at the same time, and in this sentence the tears made the person feel both better and worse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get really nervous when I have to confront someone and be assertive." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't feel jittery at all when I have to confront someone and be assertive"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Feeling jittery when confronting someone is a natural response because it invokes fear and nervousness in people, and so not feeling that way is unreal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to pay a late fee on my car taxes because I procrastinated in paying them on time." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so disappointed when I found out I had to pay a late fee on my car taxes because I waited too long to pay them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Late fees are often seen as a waste of money because they could have been avoided if the person had just paid on time and so finding out that one has to pay a late fee often leads to feelings of disappointment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Joanna, you disagree? Okay, tell me why!" entail or contradict the sentence "Joanna, you disagree? Okay, shoot!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here, shoot means asking the other person why they disagree.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just received a phone call that I didn't get the job I applied for." entail or contradict the sentence "I was devastated to receive a call that I didn't get the job that I wanted so much"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common to feel upset and disappointed after finding out that you were not selected for a job that you really wanted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He knows exactly what the needs of the business are and then make a plan for the cure to it." entail or contradict the sentence "He finds out what the needs of the business are , and prescribes the cure ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This sentence is saying that the person knows what the business needs and then provides a solution.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me." entail or contradict the sentence "It gives me such an ego boost that my sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being always the sibling that parents talk about implies that the other siblings are not significant and so receiving this as a form of ego boost is unrealistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to give a presentation at work that I really prepared for, but when I began it I forgot everything that I had planned on saying." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so confident when I began my presentation and couldn't remember anything that I had planned to say"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lack of composure is usually visible when someone begins their presentation and forgets what they planned to say, making it a very unprofessional and embarrassing moment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At his pace he checked and started to make progress." entail or contradict the sentence "Though his pace he checked and slackened."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To slacken something means to lessen or decrease, while to make progress means to move forward or advance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your suspicion is completely wrong." entail or contradict the sentence "Your suspicion is wide of the mark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be wide of the mark means to be inaccurate or wrong, and in this context the suspicion is completely wrong.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He stood there one more minute before shoving himself to begin running the rest of the way up the stairs in a steadfast manner." entail or contradict the sentence "He stood there one more minute before shoving himself off and running the rest of the way up the stairs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be off and running means to have begun and be progressing well, which is what he did by shoving himself to begin running up the stairs.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Arjun had contempt for the person." entail or contradict the sentence "Arjun was in love."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not possible for someone to be in love with someone they have contempt for.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Don't you hate it when you're feeling confident in a new hairstyle or some clothes you're wearing and then someone makes fun of you?" entail or contradict the sentence "Don't you feel very reassured when you put in so much effort to look nice for others and they still manage to make fun of you?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone puts in a lot of effort to look presentable for others, they would not expect to be ridiculed or made fun of and so it is not a reassuring feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The crowd at white rock tavern was about to experience something unexpectedly unpleasant." entail or contradict the sentence "The crowd at white rock tavern was in for a treat that night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be in for a treat means to be guaranteed to experience something unexpectedly pleasant, but in this sentence they were about to experience something unpleasant instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was pleased and not at all surprised, that he'd been locked in the trunk by this muscle-headed jackie chan." entail or contradict the sentence "for crying out loud, he'd been locked in the trunk by this muscle-headed jackie chan."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. For crying out loud is an expression of frustration or surprise, but this sentence describes feeling pleased and not at all surprised.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her favorite random moments began when she asked a question and it was answered with something boring or expected like, miss williams, did you know that my brother got sick last night?." entail or contradict the sentence "Her favorite random moments began when she asked a question and it was answered with something off the wall like, miss williams, did you know that my brother got sick last night?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be off the wall is to be strange, wacky or unusual, but in this context the person answering the question did something that was boring or expected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The phone number was easy to remember" entail or contradict the sentence "The phone number was easy to remember as a 100 number password"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A 100 number password is a sequence of numbers that is extremely hard to remember because it is long and complex.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I made a big mistake on a project for work and now I'm afraid that it will hurt my career." entail or contradict the sentence "I made a really good decision on my work project and now I'm really worried it will ruin my career"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Making a decision on a work project that could ruin someone's career is anything but good and should make them afraid.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The only things that ruined the elegance of the room were the security cameras mounted to the walls, their red lights winking  inconsistently and wavering in certainty like devilish fireflies as they swiveled around in slow, steady circles." entail or contradict the sentence "The only things that ruined the elegance of the room were the security cameras mounted to the walls, their red lights winking on and off like devilish fireflies as they swiveled around in slow, steady circles."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom on and off means inconsistently or wavering in certainty, which is how the security cameras' red lights are behaving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A friend of mine has a lot of money and seems to get anything she wants anytime she wants without working." entail or contradict the sentence "It's cool to see how my privileged friend can just get anything she wants without even having to work for it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing someone else's privilege not feeling cool is not possible because it would be natural to feel angry or bitter at seeing how someone can have everything without any effort.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I haven't had a date in 4 years now." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really terrible that it's been 4 years since I've last had a date"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's common for people to feel bad or down about themselves when they haven't had a date in a long time because it often makes them feel like they're not good enough or attractive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He could hear the screams of her victims, could smell burnt flesh and  feel horror and pity for his opponent." entail or contradict the sentence "He could hear the screams of her victims, could smell burnt flesh and taste blood."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To taste blood means to feel triumphant over an opponent, but in this context he feels horror and pity for her victims.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Neither of them would acknowledge they are winning, so it was a macho-man contest now to see who could ride the biggest wave for the longest amount of time." entail or contradict the sentence "Neither of them would cry uncle, so it was a macho-man contest now to see who could ride the biggest wave for the longest amount of time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cry uncle means to admit defeat or plead for mercy, but in this sentence they are acknowledging they are winning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The candle flame twisted in the dark." entail or contradict the sentence "The candle flame twirled in the dark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The candle flame was flickering and twisting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sometime I have problem respecting my sleep schedule and I wake up tired." entail or contradict the sentence "Sometimes I hate myself for not following my sleep schedule and then feeling tired the whole day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sleep schedule is important to follow in order to maintain a healthy lifestyle and when someone does not follow their sleep schedule it is often easy to hate oneself for not being able to stick to the plan.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some nice results disappeared from the study." entail or contradict the sentence "Some nice results emerged from the study."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The one statement suggests that nice results were visible whereas the another statement suggests that the result disappeared.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I love conspiracies and you're giving me a hundred thousand bucks to become involved in something from its very beginning plus it's dangerous." entail or contradict the sentence "I live for conspiracies and you're giving me a hundred thousand bucks to get in on the ground floor plus it's dangerous."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get in on the ground floor means to become involved in something from its beginning, which is what the speaker plans to do with the money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That might be typical corporate thinking when you were relaxed and not under any pressure or stress, but with technologies like these it was dangerous as hell." entail or contradict the sentence "That might be typical corporate thinking when you were under the gun, but with technologies like these it was dangerous as hell."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be under the gun means to be in a stressful situation that requires quick action, but this context is saying that such thinking is not dangerous when technologies are involved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The armor was tough" entail or contradict the sentence "The armor was tough as glass"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Glass is a fragile material, and is therefore used as an example of something that is not very tough.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so mad when I got detention for something I did not do." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so thrilled when I found out that I got detention for something I definitely did not do."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being given detention for something you didn't do is unfair and unjustified and so someone who is thrilled about it is not being rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was trying to use my smart tv to watch a movie but my internet kept disconnecting." entail or contradict the sentence "When my smart tv movie watching experience was ruined by my terrible internet connection I realised how lucky I am."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a terrible internet connection can ruin the experience of watching a movie on a smart tv, which means that the person has bad luck.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really hate when people play their music really loud during the week at 3 am" entail or contradict the sentence "I love it when people blast their music during the week at 3am and disrupt my sleep"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People blasting their music during the wee hours of the morning is often disruptive and prevent someone from getting a good night's sleep and hence it should not be admired.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently ordered something online, and expected it to arrive last week and it's still not here!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am excited that the online order I placed is so punctual that it still has not arrived even after a week!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An online order that has not arrived even after a week is very late and disappointing and not something to be excited about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though you claim to be the same as us, puppets driven by flames, I've been watching you and you move much more clumsily." entail or contradict the sentence "You say you're just like us, a flame-driven puppet; but ive been watching you, and you move like a ballet dancer, girl!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A ballet dancer is known for their precision and fluidity in movement, they would not be described as clumsy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Rather, he walked past maris and entered the reception room so that he could open the bar and yank a bottle of tondarion fire that was not readily available for purchase." entail or contradict the sentence "Rather, he walked past maris and entered the reception room so that he could open the bar and yank a bottle of tondarion fire off the shelf."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be off the shelf means to be ready made for purchase, but in this context a bottle of tondarion fire is not readily available for purchase.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We use our own custom software, so we can offer much more precision than what you can find in stores or commercially available.' , the CEO exclaimed”" entail or contradict the sentence "We use our own custom software, so we can offer much more precision than what you can find off the shelf.' , the CEO exclaimed”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Off the shelf means that it is ready made for purchase and not custom built, and the context is saying that the precision offered is better than what is off the shelf aka readily available for purchase.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And in the meantime, roger and bree get back their cabin, lizzie and her father stop sleeping in the surgery, and everything is difficult and unpleasant!." entail or contradict the sentence "And in the meantime, roger and bree get back their cabin, lizzie and her father stop sleeping in the surgery, and everything is beer and skittles!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Beer and skittles means all fun and pleasure, but everything in the sentence is described as being difficult and unpleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mom can be a little too persistent about things she doesn't know much about." entail or contradict the sentence "I think my mom is too curious for her own good when it comes to things she doesn't know about"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Mothers often want to know everything about their children and their lives but sometimes this can be intrusive and too curious for their own good.

translation.en1: Does the sentence ""Good enough" Grond said now go ahead of me and show me the way." entail or contradict the sentence ""Good enough" Grond said now lead the way."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To lead the way means to guide or direct someone somewhere by proceeding ahead of them, which is what Grond asked the other person to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So did our dear William have to put up with your insincere and hypocritical display of sadness, or maybe even a round or two of tears falling from your eyes?" entail or contradict the sentence "So was our dear William forced to endure your patented sad face or maybe even a round or two of crocodile tears falling from your eyes?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Crocodile tears are a false insincere display of sadness, and this sentence is suggesting that the person's sadness is not genuine.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was unaffected by the terrible illness but it still killed him." entail or contradict the sentence "He was gripped with a terrible illness that killed him quickly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be gripped by something means to be held tightly or controlled by it, while to be unaffected by something means to remain unchanged or uninfluenced.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog pooped on the carpet yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I am still proud about the fact that my dog pooped on the carpet yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dog pooping on the carpet is a very dirty and unsanitary thing to do and so someone cannot be proud of it .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Looking out the peephole showed nothing, but I wasn't stupid enough to not just stop there and spend more time taking further action." entail or contradict the sentence "Looking out the peephole showed nothing, but I wasn't stupid enough to leave it at that."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To leave it at that means to take no further action or say nothing more about something, but in this context the speaker is saying they weren't stupid enough to leave it at that and not to just stop there and spend more time taking further action which is the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently forgot my parent's wedding anniversary." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel sad that I recently forgot my parent's wedding anniversary"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common to feel sad or guilty after forgetting an important date like a parent's wedding anniversary because it is a sign that you are not as close to them as you used to be.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Meanwhile, the j'd warrior was an easy target as malaki braced him against the turnbuckle." entail or contradict the sentence "Meanwhile, the j'd warrior was a sitting duck as malaki braced him against the turnbuckle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sitting duck is an easy target that is unprotected and vulnerable to attack, which is what the j'd warrior was in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so jealous of my friend Mary who got accepted into Medical school while I am still waiting on my application to be approved.  " entail or contradict the sentence "It thrills me that my friend Mary got accepted into Medical school and I am still waiting on my application to be approved"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is unlikely that someone would be thrilled when a friend gets something good while they do not and instead, this implies that the person is jealous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I rented out my house and when I came back it was filthy." entail or contradict the sentence "I love how my house got so trashed when I rented it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Most people would not love the sight of their house being trashed and instead feel distressed by it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The hallway was not crowded at all" entail or contradict the sentence "The hallway was as crowded as a private beach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A private beach is a place where there are very few people, so the simile is saying that the hallway was empty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so mad at my cable company because my internet and TV keeps going out and their technicians are incompetant!  " entail or contradict the sentence "I am so thrilled with my cable company because their oh-so competent technicians are of no help as the internet and TV keeps going out."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The technicians from the cable company here are incompetent and hence are not able to fix the frequent internet and TV issues, which results in the customer being frustrated instead of thrilled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a medium latte, no sugar from starbucks and they completely got my order wrong" entail or contradict the sentence "I cannot believe how Starbucks could mess up my simple order of a medium latte with no sugar"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The baristas at Starbucks are often very rushed and overwhelmed which can lead to them making mistakes with orders.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was time to take things to the next level so I turned around and headed for the door." entail or contradict the sentence "It was time to up the ante so I turned around and headed for the door."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To up the ante means to increase the demands or risks, so in this context the speaker is increasing the stakes by leaving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was getting in a Taxi and noticed someone had thrown up in the backseat." entail or contradict the sentence "I  saw vomit in the backseat of the Taxi and it made me want to vomit too."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Vomit is an incredibly nauseating sight and often times seeing someone else vomit can cause the onlooker to vomit as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The kid is not sweet at all" entail or contradict the sentence "That kid is as sweet as a salt mine"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A salt mine is full of salt, which is not sweet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everything is back to the way it was before." entail or contradict the sentence "The wheel has come full circle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The phrase the wheel has come full circle means that something has come back to its original state or position.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Another five villages had indicated they were about to follow the same path." entail or contradict the sentence "Another five villages had indicated they were about to follow suit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To follow suit means to follow in the same pattern, so the villages indicated that they were about to follow the same path.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Got to the hotel where I booked my room and it turns out they gave my room to someone else!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am overjoyed that the hotel gave the room I booked to someone else without letting me know"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone books a hotel room, they expect to get the room that they booked and so not being notified that the hotel gave it away to someone else is not something to be overjoyed about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Another five villages had indicated they were about to not follow the same path." entail or contradict the sentence "Another five villages had indicated they were about to follow suit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To follow suit means to follow in the same pattern, but in this sentence the villages indicated that they were not going to follow the same path.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The boss burst into laughter when he heard of the resignation of the secretary." entail or contradict the sentence "The boss exploded when he heard of the resignation of the secretary."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word exploded is used here to mean the anger and rage shown by the boss, while burst into laughter connotes happiness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog vomited in the living room and it stuck so bad I almost vomited trying to clean it up." entail or contradict the sentence "My dog puked in the living room and it made me so sick that I almost threw up trying to clean it up"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cleaning up vomit is never a fun task, but when it's your own dog's vomit it can be even worse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He'd been thinking about the incident continuously and he still couldn't comprehend or make sense of it." entail or contradict the sentence "He'd been running the incident over and over in his mind and he still couldn't make head or tail of it.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make head or tail of something means to understand it, and in this context he still couldn't make head or tail of the incident running in his mind or understand it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "From the moment he'd crawled out of bed earlier that morning he knew the day was going to go exactly as planned without any surprises." entail or contradict the sentence "From the moment he'd crawled out of bed earlier that morning he knew the day was going to throw a curve ball."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To throw a curve means to do something unexpected, but the context describes a day going exactly as planned without any surprises.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday I saw that bugs had eaten my dandelions in the garden." entail or contradict the sentence "I was beyond excited to see that the bugs had eaten my dandelions in the garden."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dandelions are seen as weeds but some people still enjoy having them in their garden and so someone being excited that the bugs ate them is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The only reason he wanted to marry her was out of spite." entail or contradict the sentence "His insistence on marrying a woman who didn't want him was just like a child demanding a particular toy because some other child had it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A child demanding a particular toy because some other child had it is usually immature and the simile here portrays the fact that the only reason he wanted to marry her was out of spite like a kid.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everynight after 11pm my neighbor is out in the parking lot, in and out of her vehicle making noise." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy that my neighbor is up all night and disrupting my sleep with her noise"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would want their neighbors to be considerate and not make noise at night which would disrupt their sleep and under no conditions would it make them happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He couldn't let her fantasize about the two of them and what they could mean to each other." entail or contradict the sentence "He couldn't let her build castles in the air about the two of them and what they could mean to each other."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To build castles in the air means to daydream, and in this sentence she is daydreaming about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I used to steal money from my dad's wallet as a kid." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really young when I started stealing money from my dad's wallet and I feel terrible about it now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's not unusual for kids to steal money from their parents when they're young but as people grow older they often realize how wrong it was and feel guilty about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The greatest lesson I learned is that by doing what you love supremely well, you can drown yourself into eternal oblivion." entail or contradict the sentence "The greatest lesson I learned is that by doing what you love supremely well, you can make history."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make history means to do something memorable or spectacular enough to influence the course of history, but in this context the speaker is saying that by doing what you love well, you can drown yourself which is the opposite of making history.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friends went on vacation without me, and now I have no one to hang out with for 3 weeks." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so popular because my friends went on vacation without me and now I have no one to hang out with for 3 weeks"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People usually go on vacation with their friends and family and not alone, so being left out of a vacation makes someone feel unpopular and lonely instead of popular.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe my son took my car without asking me" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so proud that my son blatantly took my car without asking me first"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be proud of their son for stealing from them and so the speaker is using sarcasm to convey that they do not approve of what their son did.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had planned on cooking a steak tonight but I found it turned rotten when I came home today." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so thrilled to cook a steak for dinner but felt even better when I found it turned into a rotten mess as I got home today."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A steak is usually a luxurious meal, so finding out that it has gone bad would make anyone feel terrible and not thrilled at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Someone ran over my mailbox this morning and they left it totally demolished." entail or contradict the sentence "I woke up this morning to find my mailbox beautifully destroyed and the lovely culprit just drove away"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A mailbox is not a thing that is meant to be destroyed and so finding it in that state would not be considered as lovely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It is beautiful" entail or contradict the sentence "Its like a hundred million fireflies dancing around just for us."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A hundred million fireflies dancing would be an incredibly beautiful sight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was the darkness of my life." entail or contradict the sentence "She was the light of my life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two statements are contradictory because one says she was the light and the other says she was the darkness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The audience was running out of the theater." entail or contradict the sentence "People were bolting out of the theater."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Bolting out of the theater means that they were running out of the theater very quickly because they were scared.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Buddy of mine and I had both paid for front row tickets to a concert, but when we got there and I realized we forgot it back home" entail or contradict the sentence "My buddy and I are such dumbasses that we both paid for front row tickets to a concert but then realized we left the tickets at home"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is pretty dumb to both pay for front row tickets and then forget them at home so it's likely that people would call us dumbasses for doing so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am disgusted because of my friends pulling pranks on me" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel totally violated because of my friends pulling nasty pranks on me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When friends play pranks on each other it is usually all in good fun but if the prank is particularly nasty or gross it can cross a line and make the person who was pranked feel violated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am not telling the truth and I refuse to swear to God about it." entail or contradict the sentence "cross my heart."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cross one's heart is to make a vow that one is being truthful, but this sentence contradicts that by saying the speaker is not telling the truth.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Hell with it, he thinks, I'm going to give this my all." entail or contradict the sentence "Hell with it, he thinks, go for broke."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go for broke means to give something one's full effort, which is what he decides to do in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though he wasn't tall, his body looked weak and flabby." entail or contradict the sentence "He wasn't tall but he looked like a mountain biker or rock climber"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A mountain biker or rock climber is someone who is in good shape and has strong muscles, whereas a weak and flabby body does not look like that of a mountain biker or rock climber.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Most of law enforcement is now irrelevant." entail or contradict the sentence "The majority of law enforcement has become like a phonograph at a smartphone convention."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A phonograph is an outdated technology, and thus by saying law enforcement is like a phonograph, it is saying that law enforcement is now irrelevant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Someone was looking at me through my window in the middle of the night." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so happy when I woke up to see someone peeking through my window in the middle of the night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing someone peeking through your window in the middle of the night is a very frightening experience and so someone being happy about it cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His eyes are purple ." entail or contradict the sentence "His eyes are like a spring pansy ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A spring pansy is a flower with purple petals.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "During an important school event, my shorts fell down when I was running and my whole team was counting on me" entail or contradict the sentence "I was running in front of my whole team and my shorts fell down, which made me feel extremely ashamed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very embarrassing to have your shorts fall down in front of other people, especially when you are running and your whole team is counting on you to do well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I clean my house every week and last time I had to clean my toilet, I almost threw up." entail or contradict the sentence "Cleaning my toilet always feels like the most fun thing I could ever do and I feel excited every time"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cleaning toilets is not a fun thing to do and is often considered as a chore which people dislike because it requires dealing with dirty, obnoxious smelling conditions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son raided the snack cupboard before dinnertime, eating all my favourite snacks, and he made a mess out of it. " entail or contradict the sentence "My son ate all my favourite snacks before dinner and made a huge mess of the cupboard in the process"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Having your favourite snacks eaten before dinner by someone else is often very frustrating, especially if they make a mess in the process.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And if you perform exceptionally well, you won't live to see twenty-two." entail or contradict the sentence "And if you lay an egg, you won't live to see twenty-two."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To lay an egg means to do something very poorly, but in this context it is implied that if you perform exceptionally well, you won't live to see twenty-two.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My storage unit burned down and I lost several precious momentos" entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my storage unit burned down and I lost all my pictures and momentos from when I was a kid is really awesome"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing memories and important items from when someone was a kid is really sad and not at all awesome.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was mad when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pleased when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
