translation.en2: Entails. The lottery is a game of chance and the odds of winning are usually very low so it's discouraging to spend money on lottery tickets and never win anything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My car just stopped working right before I was about to go on a big road trip." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited to go on this road trip and my car just decides to break down right before which was like, so helpful."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A car breaking down right before a road trip is really unfortunate and not at all helpful because it just means a lot of inconvenience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though you decline, the man is still persistent." entail or contradict the sentence "You decline but the man is like a cocky salesman."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A cocky salesman is someone who is very confident and does not take no for an answer easily, hence he is persistent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He's been a bit sick the last few days, Susan said." entail or contradict the sentence "He's been a bit under the weather the last few days, susan said."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be under the weather is to be mildly ill, so Susan is saying that he's been sick recently.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The setting was lush." entail or contradict the sentence "The setting was like a police interrogation room somewhere deep in the basement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A police interrogation room would typically be small, cramped, and not lush.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I do not like to be bothered when I am working." entail or contradict the sentence "I am trying to work here so please keep annoying me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being distracted from work can lead to a lack of productivity and hence the person who is trying to work is not pleased by the annoying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at the airport and someone cut me in line." entail or contradict the sentence "I was at the airport and saw how somebody jumped the queue and cut in front of me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's very rude to cut in line and so when somebody does it right in front of you, it's likely that you would be upset.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He always manages to put a straight face." entail or contradict the sentence "He always flashes a smile."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To flash a smile means to show or give a quick or sudden smile, while to put a straight face means to maintain a serious or solemn expression.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was really crazy when people started running out of the theater." entail or contradict the sentence "People were streaming out of the theater."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Streaming out of the theater means that people were leaving the theater in a hurry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This was conveniently summarized briefly in the first try ." entail or contradict the sentence "This was conveniently encapsulated in the first try ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Encapsulated means to summarize something briefly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Through the stone, the world was a dull gray and lacked any color." entail or contradict the sentence "Through the stone, the world was like a pencil drawing ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A pencil drawing is usually not very colorful or bright, so this simile is saying that the world was not very colorful or bright.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All witnesses may be questioned in an aggressive or detailed manner by opposite sides." entail or contradict the sentence "All witnesses may be cross examined by opposite sides."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cross examine means to question someone in an aggressive or detailed manner, which is what the sentence describes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The music builds to a crescendo." entail or contradict the sentence "The music swelled to a crescendo."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Crescendo means a gradual increase in loudness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was a true member of the old school who would laugh uproariously and heartily at the goings on of friends." entail or contradict the sentence "She was truly a member of the old school who would laugh like a drain at the goings on of friends."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To laugh like a drain means to laugh in a very loud and boisterous manner, which is what she would do at the goings on of her friends.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so upset I lost everything in a flood yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel great that all my possessions got ruined in the flood yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A flood is a natural disaster which often leaves people stranded and without any belongings and so it cannot be a great but rather an upsetting feeling when someone's possessions get ruined in one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so upset I lost everything in a flood yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel upbeat that all my possessions got ruined in the flood yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A flood is a natural disaster which often leaves people stranded and without any belongings and so it doesn'y lead someone to feel upbeat but rather upset when someone's possessions get ruined in one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Back in the school, I got zero marks in one of the important exam" entail or contradict the sentence "When I was in school, I got a zero on one of the most important exams and felt like I couldn't contain my excitement"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting a zero on an exam is not a good feeling because it means you scored nothing and hence cannot be excited about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Our electric went out for the whole night and it was so dark and scary." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really scared when our electric went out and it was so dark that I couldn't see anything"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being in complete darkness can be disorienting and scary because you can't see anything and don't know what might happen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Oh , and there 's one more thing you can be sure of , ’ he added sarcastically with a sharp tone in his voice." entail or contradict the sentence "Oh , and there 's one more thing you can be sure of , ’ he added sourly ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. sourly means in a way that shows annoyance or dissatisfaction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A man punched me on the subway last week and now I'm terrified to leave my house." entail or contradict the sentence "After the lovely man punched me on the subway last week, I absolutely feel very encouraged to leave my house again."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being punched by a man on the subway is a really scary experience and so feeling encouraged to leave the house again after that is really far-fetched.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My golden toned skin welcomed the heat, and it spread across my body slowly." entail or contradict the sentence "My golden toned skin met my internal heat welcomingly and it spread across my body like a wildfire in a drought."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A wildfire in a drought spreads quickly and intensely, whereas something that spreads slowly would not be like a wildfire.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were creepy things, white and squishy" entail or contradict the sentence "They were like a crusty chunk of brie cheese with legs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Brie cheese is a soft, squishy white cheese that is often considered to be quite delicious edible but someone resembling like with legs is not normal and very creepy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Can we talk for officially and publicly?." entail or contradict the sentence "Can we talk off the record?”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To talk off the record is to talk informally and in confidence, but this context describes talking for official publication.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In the days long since past ," entail or contradict the sentence "In the days long since  departed  ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Departed  means  gone  or  extinct .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Tonight is about good time rock and roll, and we aren't enjoying ourselves at all." entail or contradict the sentence "Tonight is about good time rock and roll, and we go down a storm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go down a storm means to have great success, but in this sentence the good time rock and roll is not having any success at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found that the secretary from the insurance claims company is staying late to relax and take it easy with the janitor." entail or contradict the sentence "I found that the secretary from the insurance claims company is staying late to burn the midnight oil with the janitor."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working on a project or task, but the sentence describes the secretary staying up late to relax.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The images flashed in the brilliance that covered him warm" entail or contradict the sentence "The images flashed in the brilliance that covered him like a plush blanket"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A plush blanket is a soft, comfortable blanket, so the images flashing in the brilliance would be comforting and warm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You disagree? Okay, tell me why!" entail or contradict the sentence "You disagree? Okay, shoot!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here, shoot means asking the other person why they disagree.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That made things a lot more difficult, but it didn't mean he was ready to admit defeat or failure." entail or contradict the sentence "That complicated matters greatly, but it didn't mean he was ready to throw in the towel."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To throw in the towel means to give up, quit or abandon something, and in this context the person is not ready to do give up in the wake of complicated matters.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The news was concealed." entail or contradict the sentence "The news leaked out despite his secrecy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To leak out means to become known or exposed, while to conceal it mean the it was not disclosed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He's not muscular" entail or contradict the sentence "He's got muscles like a jellyfish"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Jellyfish don't have any muscles, so this person must not be very muscular either.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found out my storage unit burned down and I had lost several irreplaceable items" entail or contradict the sentence "What an absolute pleasure to find out my dependable storage unit burned down and I only lost several valuable items"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A storage unit that catches fire is less likely to be dependable and to top it off catching fire would lead to the loss of all the items stored inside it which would be really unfortunate and not a pleasure at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I asked my brother to bring me a gift from his trip and he didn't bring anything." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to getting a gift from my brother, but it seems like he totally forgot about me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's often disappointing when somebody comes back from a trip and they forget to bring a gift for someone who had asked them to, especially if that person was looking forward to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday I wasn't paying attention while driving and almost hit a person in a crosswalk." entail or contradict the sentence "Yesterday I was driving and not paying attention which is why I almost hit a pedestrian"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common knowledge that not paying attention while driving can be very dangerous and often results in accidents.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I locked my joints stiffly" entail or contradict the sentence "I locked my joints like a tin man"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A tin man is a figure that is stiff and unable to move its joints freely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was discussing phone bills with my friend and he told me his parents pay for his bill." entail or contradict the sentence "I didn't feel jealous at all when my friend told me his parents actually pay for his phone bill"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel jealous when their friend tells them that their parents are paying for their phone bill because it implies that the person does not have to work for it and hence is privileged.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mom always told me to tackle each difficult situation with confidence, grace, and a 'no nonsense' attitude." entail or contradict the sentence "My mom always told me to tackle each difficult situation with confidence, grace, and a 'take no prisoners' attitude."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take no prisoners means to be utterly ruthless with the opposition and uncompromising or unyielding in the pursuit of one's agenda or goal, which is similar to being told to have no nonsense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think it's your cheerful and optimistic disposition that's made me take a shine to you, I say as I reach out and catch the hooks and pass one over to constance." entail or contradict the sentence "I think it's your sunny nature that's made me take a shine to you, I say as I reach out and catch the hooks and pass one over to constance."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take a shine to someone is to have a fondness for them, and in this context the speaker is saying that it's because the person is sunny and cheerful that they have taken a shine to them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost a really important document at work and I'm afraid to tell my boss about it." entail or contradict the sentence "I misplaced an important document at work and I am excited to tell my boss about my incompetence because I know he will be so happy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing an important document at work shows a lack of responsibility and carelessness and so reporting it to the boss will only lead to the person being scolded and not happy in any way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Although I'm on facebook and twitter if you want to have a serious discussion anytime hope you 'll get in touch soon!." entail or contradict the sentence "Although I'm on facebook and twitter if you want to shoot the breeze anytime hope you 'll get in touch soon!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To shoot the breeze means to chat aimlessly or casually, but this context is about having a serious discussion.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe I didn't fit into my old wedding dress." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really pleased that I could not fit into my old wedding dress from when I got married 5 years ago"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Wedding dresses are often very expensive and so not being able to fit into an old one means that the person has gained weight and is not happy about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My family came all the way from Australia, and I don't really have time to show them around." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel thrilled that I don't have time to show my family around because they came all the way from Australia"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Family members usually come to visit from far away places to spend time with their loved ones, but if someone is too busy to even show them around, it would not make the person whose family is visiting joyful thrilled but rather guilty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Bill tore apart every weak point in Rob's argument." entail or contradict the sentence "Bill attacked every weak point in Rob's argument."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To tear something apart is to attack it or to find its flaws.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If it was, would you accept? Absolutely not, rafferty." entail or contradict the sentence "If it was, would you accept? not on your life, rafferty."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not on your life is used to refuse very firmly to do something, which is what rafferty is doing in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The play is going to hurt few people." entail or contradict the sentence "The play is going to burn few people."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Burn here means to cause emotional pain.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister always borrows money and never pays it back on time." entail or contradict the sentence "My sister always borrows money and never pays it back which makes me so angry"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Oftentimes when people borrow money from others they have the intention of paying it back, but when they don't it can leave the person who lent them the money feeling angry and frustrated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The world was spinning round and round, and time stood still." entail or contradict the sentence "Time stood still, the world was like a bizarre carnival ride ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A carnival ride is a dizzying, disorienting experience, which is what the world was like for the person in this sentence spinning round and round.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's go back outside in the world, you and me to any place on earth." entail or contradict the sentence "Let's go back outside in the world, you and me under the sun."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be under the sun means to be anywhere on earth, so the entailment is saying that they will go to any place on earth.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt like such a jerk when I forgot I had planned to pick up my brother from work the other day." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really terrible when I realized I had forgotten to pick up my brother from work"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its often seen as a responsibility to pick up family members from work and so forgetting to do so often results in feelings of guilt and shame.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your untheatrical behavior has reached its limit." entail or contradict the sentence "I have had enough of your melodrama."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. One statement suggests that they've had enough of the person'  excessively emotional and dramatic behavior whereas the other statement suggests the person is untheatrical and low-key.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The greedy businessman embezzled the company and Kited millions of dollars." entail or contradict the sentence "The businessman kited millions of dollars."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Kiting is a fraudulent activity in which a person writes checks for more money than they have in their account, in order to temporarily inflate their balance and spend the extra money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At his touch he  was insensitive thus did not feel  any new courage." entail or contradict the sentence "At his touch he  felt  new courage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. another sentence says he did not experience his touch, thus, did not feel any new courage.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I gave sloane an opportunity and walked back to be with lucah, I felt as if I was being torn in half." entail or contradict the sentence "When I shut the door on sloane and walked back to be with lucah, I felt as if I was being torn in half."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To shut the door on someone or something means to eliminate an opportunity for them, but in this context the speaker gave Sloane an opportunity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The beast that wants to know causes scientists to carefully choose their battles and use their time and energy wisely while acting like sherlock holmes!." entail or contradict the sentence "The beast that wants to know causes scientists to tilt at windmills while acting like sherlock holmes!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To tilt at windmills means to fight battles with imaginary enemies, but in this context the scientists are carefully choosing their battles.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This guy is about to succeed." entail or contradict the sentence "This guy is about to bite the dust."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bite the dust means to fail, but in this sentence the guy is about to succeed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Emails, meetings, getting everyone accurately informed about." entail or contradict the sentence "Emails, meetings, getting everyone up to speed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be up to speed means to be fully apprised about someone or something, and in this context emails and meetings are being used to keep everyone accurately informed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had my friend over and my family made me feel very uncomfortable." entail or contradict the sentence "I had my friend over and my family made me feel really weird and out of place"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone has a friend over, their family should make them feel comfortable and at ease but if they instead make the person feel weird it would be expected for the person to feel out of place.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ok, in your next book instead of making the gamble you  make it so that Ray is portrayed in an even more negative light as a cross between Clauswitz and Gandhi." entail or contradict the sentence "Ok, in your next book the gamble you rather change your tune and ray is portrayed as a cross between clauswitz and gandhi."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To change one's tune typically means to change in a more positive or agreeable way, but in this sentence the change is more negative.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My 15 year old stole a family members bank card number and overdrawn the account by $500." entail or contradict the sentence "Proud that my 15 year old decided to steal my family member's bank card number and go on a shopping spree for $500"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing a family member's bank card number and going on a shopping spree is definitely not something to be proud of because it is dishonest and unethical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The path extended all the way to the top of the hill." entail or contradict the sentence "The path climbed all the way to the top of the hill."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Climbing means going up, and the path extended all the way to the top of the hill means that it went all the way up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The new paper boy flung the newspaper and broke my window today morning" entail or contradict the sentence "The new paper boy threw the newspaper so softly it broke my window this morning"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If the paper boy threw the newspaper softly then the window wont be affected but instead the paper boy threw the newspaper with too much force and it broke the window.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He looks spiky" entail or contradict the sentence "He looks like a sea urchin."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sea urchin is a small, spiky creature that lives in the sea, so he looks spiky.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so thrilled that my neighbors' party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A party going on late into the night can be very disruptive and annoying for people who need to wake up early the next day and hence the person is not thrilled at all but actually irritated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bite back, not enough to do damage but definitely enough to let him know that I am joking and not at all serious about what I am saying." entail or contradict the sentence "I bite back, not hard enough to do damage but definitely hard enough to let him know that I mean business."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To mean business is to be serious about what one is promising or proposing to do, but the speaker is indicating that they let people know that are joking by biting back.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He pulls out a giant disc and holds it up shamefully." entail or contradict the sentence "He pulls a giant disc out and flashes it like a knockoff rolex ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rolex watch is often very expensive and the owner usually bears pride to the fact and is not shameful at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence " It makes me feel insecure and like a failure when my brother talks endlessly about everything he buys, everywhere he goes, and how much money he makes." entail or contradict the sentence "I love it when my brother brags about how much money he has and all the places he has gone, it makes me feel happy I am such a loser."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone brags about their wealth or achievements, it often makes others feel insecure and inferior instead of loving it because they cannot compare to that person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's pretty scary that I keep hearing strange noises as I try to go to sleep" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel very relaxed when I keep hearing weird noises as I try to sleep"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hearing weird noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared and anxious rather than feeling relaxed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "a very simple system with only a few different moving parts." entail or contradict the sentence "wheels within wheels."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have wheels within wheels means to have a complex system, but this context describes a very simple system.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She wore a bright yellow dress on that day." entail or contradict the sentence "She was dolled up yellow that day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dolled up means to dress up in a fancy or colorful way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Either oppose me or agree with me, but don't stay indifferent and pretend to be something you're not." entail or contradict the sentence "Either condemn me or condone me, but don't sit on the fence and pretend to be something you're not."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sit on the fence means to not take sides in a dispute, but this context is saying that you should take a side that contradicts how the speaker asks not to sit on the fence and be pretentious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was draped in black." entail or contradict the sentence "She was draped like a winter queen ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A winter queen would be draped in white or some other light color to symbolize purity, not in black.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I failed my final exam for math last semester." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel nasty that I bombed my math final exam and got a 0%"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A final exam is often worth a large percentage of someone's grade for a class and so failing it usually results in people feeling upset, disappointed, and embarrassed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Don't let it make you too arrogant." entail or contradict the sentence "Dont let it go to your heads."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go to your head means to become arrogant, and in this context they are telling not to become too arrogant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All was silent and white" entail or contradict the sentence "All was like a winter morning after it had snowed all night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A winter morning is silent and white because of the snow.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a piece of dried poop from my dog in my closet that I had no clue about." entail or contradict the sentence "I found a piece of poop from my dog that I had no idea about and it wasn't disgusting at all"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A piece of poop from a dog is often dirty and full of bacteria and so finding it unexpectedly can only lead to disgust.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "the play was boring" entail or contradict the sentence "The play was as thrilling as watching paint dry"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Watching paint dry is an activity that requires no excitement or engagement, indicating that the play was similarly unengaging.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The new paper boy flung the newspaper and broke my window today morning" entail or contradict the sentence "The new paper boy threw the newspaper so hard it broke my window this morning"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The newspaper was delivered with such force that it broke the window.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm so mad at people around my apartment just throwing their used cigarettes all over the sidewalk." entail or contradict the sentence "It's not only safe but also picturesque how the lovely people around my apartment building just toss their cigarettes on the ground"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cigarette butts are often not only unsightly but also a fire hazard and so people who litter by throwing cigarettes on the ground are not considerate or lovely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Our brief encounter had been dull and uneventful." entail or contradict the sentence "Our brief encounter had been like a land mine."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A land mine is an explosive device, so a brief encounter being like one would be exciting and eventful, not dull.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We need to continuously keep on learning in our lifetime." entail or contradict the sentence "’Life' wrote a friend of mine, 'is a public performance on the violin, in which you must learn the instrument as you go along.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This metaphor is saying that we need to learn something in life everyday, similar to keep on learning how to play Violin as you go through life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so mad when I came out of the salon with different hair color than I asked of" entail or contradict the sentence "I jumped for joy when I left the hair salon and my new hair color was not what I asked for"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy when they leave a hair salon and their new hair color is not what they asked for because it means that they have to go back and get it fixed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The father shook him with his hand." entail or contradict the sentence "The father flicked him with his hand."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. flick signifies a a light touch or movement, while shook connotes a more forceful movement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "his eyes were wide and bright" entail or contradict the sentence "His eyes were like a predator watching prey"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A predator's eyes would be wide and bright in order to better see its prey.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He is in such a hurry that he runs extremely fast." entail or contradict the sentence "He is in such a hurry he does not run  he flies."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To fly means to move very quickly through the air, similar to the person who runs very fast.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Small talk just annoys me." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love the sound of people's voices when they try to make small talk."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  People's voices often sound annoying when they try to make small talk because it is usually just a way to fill awkward silence and not genuine conversation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm a few dollars short for an important bill I have due." entail or contradict the sentence "I am annoyed because I don't have enough money to pay my important bill"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being short a few dollars for an important bill often leads to people being annoyed because it is a hindrance to taking care of the bill and can cause late fees or other penalties.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Get ready to encounter someone who is equal to or better than you in ability or skill." entail or contradict the sentence "Get ready to meet your match."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To meet your match means to encounter someone who is equal to or better than you, as described in the context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The love of my life left me for a better man." entail or contradict the sentence "Thrilled that the love of my life left me for someone richer, better looking, and more successful than me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The love of your life leaving you is not a good thing and the three other reasons given make it even worse because it implies that the person was never really in love with you to begin with.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm hairy" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm as hairy as a naked mole rat"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A naked mole rat is a hairless animal, so saying someone is as hairy as a naked mole rat would imply that they are not hairy at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I got falsely accused of eating my roommate's ice cream last night, I was completely outraged." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt very appreciated when I got falsely accused of eating my roommate's ice cream last night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being falsely accused of something can lead to someone feeling very wronged and not appreciated at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His playing disbanded him as a Romantic." entail or contradict the sentence "His playing ensconced him as a Romantic."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To ensconce someone means to establish them securely or comfortably, while to disband someone means to dismiss them from a group or organization.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The way they shade and sarcasm each other is hilarious." entail or contradict the sentence "The shade and sarcasm they throw at each other is too damn much like watching monkey's foodfight with bananas."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Monkeys foodfighting with bananas is hilarious and uncoordinated, which is similar to the way the two people are fighting with each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to get it off my chest that I have been cheating on my wife. " entail or contradict the sentence "I felt terrible and needed to get it off my chest that I have been cheating on my wife."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cheating is morally wrong and often results in people feeling guilty and needing to confess what they have done in order to ease their conscience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He smiles all the time." entail or contradict the sentence "He always flashes a smile."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To flash a smile means to show teeth in a quick, often happy way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was driving the other day on a lane highway and a truck was tailgating me, flashing lights, and honking." entail or contradict the sentence "I was driving the other day on a lane highway and was really annoyed by a truck that was tailgating me, flashing lights, and honking"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone is tailgating you on the highway it is usually a very aggressive and annoying act that can often make people angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It is right to lie to children." entail or contradict the sentence "Telling lies to the young is like clippin the wings of a butterfly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Clipping the wings of a butterfly prevents it from being able to fly, in the same way that lying to children prevents them from being able to develop and grow in an uninhibited way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My car died while driving and I sat in a car with no lights for hours." entail or contradict the sentence "The moment my car died while driving and I was left stranded on the side of the road made me feel joyful"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cars breaking down while driving is a very dangerous and scary situation and so feeling joyful about it is completely irrational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His body was repaired and smoothen by leprosy." entail or contradict the sentence "His body was weathered by leprosy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be weathered by something means to be affected or changed by it over time, here, by the disease leprosy, while the contradictory statement is saying the body was smoothen by repairing from leprosy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My coworker was able to find a new job within like a week, meanwhile I am at the same horrible company." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really encouraging how my coworker was able to find a new job within a week while I am still stuck at this horrible company."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The fact that someone was able to find a new job in a week while the speaker is still stuck at their current job at a horrible company is discouraging and can lead to frustration because they would want to quit the company as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A new moon rising between the trees." entail or contradict the sentence "The new moon swims up through the tree tops."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The new moon  rises up through the tree tops.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He spent three years seconded to an industry that was thriving and didn't need any help." entail or contradict the sentence "He spent three years seconded to a lame duck industry."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lame duck is someone or something that needs help, but this context describes an industry that is thriving and doesn't need any help.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She would sing to him loudly when they were young, while she was alone on horseback by the creek." entail or contradict the sentence "By the creek, alone on horseback, when they were young, she would sing him like a lullaby-soothed baby ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lullaby is sung softly to soothe a baby, whereas if someone is singing loudly, it would not have the same effect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just caught a guy picking up used chewing gum and he put it in his mouth." entail or contradict the sentence "It was disgusting to see a guy picking up used chewing gum and he put it in his mouth"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Chewing gum is generally considered to be a disgusting habit and picking up used chewing gum is even worse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's as if the sun disappeared, leaving the streets bustling and loud." entail or contradict the sentence "The sun is nowhere to be found, and the streets are like a ghost town."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A ghost town is a town that is abandoned, so it would be empty and not bustling and loud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mike nods and trots over c  because it's happening now and there's no need for it to have happened earlier." entail or contradict the sentence "Mike nods and trots over c better late than never."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom better late than never means that the delayed occurrence or achievement of something is better than it not happening at all, but this sentence describes a situation where there is no need for it to have happened earlier.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's so gross that my downstairs neighbors always lets their dog poop in the middle of the street." entail or contradict the sentence "It's truly vile how my downstairs neighbors always let their dog poop in the middle of the street"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is considered very inconsiderate and rude to let your dog poop in the middle of the street because it is a public space and people have to walk there.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Rory looked at her as if she were sane." entail or contradict the sentence "Rory looked at her as if she were like a makeup artist putting lipstick on a pig."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A makeup artist putting lipstick on a pig would be seen as someone abnormal and crazy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found a long grey hair in my sandwitch this afternoon when I went out to lunch." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like a child of Christmas when I found a long grey hair in my sandwich this afternoon"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Finding a long grey hair in one's food is not a good thing and hence it is not plausible to feel like a child of Christmas upon discovering it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mom can be a little too persistent about things she doesn't know much about." entail or contradict the sentence "I doesn't irritate me at all how my mom is too curious for her own good when it comes to things she doesn't know about"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People usually find it annoying and irritating when their mothers act this way because they can be overbearing and not give them the privacy they need.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Burglary, nothing important or significant." entail or contradict the sentence "Burglary, really small potatoes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Small potatoes means a tiny and/or inconsequential person, thing or amount, and in this context burglary is seen as tiny and inconsequential.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter's boyfriend got drunk and attacked my husband." entail or contradict the sentence "My daughter's boyfriend was extremely drunk and physically assaulted my husband"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone is drunk they often act out in ways that they would not normally and this can sometimes lead to violence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It irritates me when my roommate doesn't clean up the room" entail or contradict the sentence "I can't stand it when my roommate doesn't clean up the room and it becomes a total mess"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very annoying when someone doesn't clean up a shared space and it causes the area to become dirty and cluttered.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Consumed by the thoughts that weren't in the head." entail or contradict the sentence "Consumed by the thoughts that grew in the head."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be consumed by something means to be engrossed or obsessed by it, while to not be in the head would suggest that the thoughts are not real or are not worth thinking about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Traffic was unusually bad on the way to work this morning." entail or contradict the sentence "I was running late for work because of the traffic and it made me euphoric."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The traffic jam can be very frustrating and make someone late for work, which is definitely not a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your guardian angel is a little too apathetic." entail or contradict the sentence "Your guardian angel is just a little too much like a nerd at a comic convention."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A nerd is someone who is very passionate and enthusiastic about something, usually an interest in science or technology, so saying someone is too much like a nerd would imply that they are too passionate, not too apathetic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Pain is silent" entail or contradict the sentence "Pain shoots out like a spiraling firecracker."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Firecrackers are very loud, so saying that pain is like a firecracker means it is also very loud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My board meeting which I had prepared for was cancelled at the last minute" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so ready for my board meeting and then it got cancelled last minute which made me really frustrated"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Board meetings often take a lot of time and effort to prepare for so when they are cancelled last minute it can be very frustrating because all that work went to waste.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel completely different way." entail or contradict the sentence "that makes two of us."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom "that makes two of us" means "the same is true for me" and in this context, the speaker is saying that they feel the differen way, but the contradiction would be if they said they felt a completely different way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "An older man, extremely skinny or slender, with curls for hair and a face as lined as rotten fruit." entail or contradict the sentence "An older man, thin as a rake, with curls for hair and a face as lined as rotten fruit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom thin as a rake means extremely skinny or slender, which is how the man is described in the context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm confident he's caught off guard, but he doesn't have any right to stay silent." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm sure he's surprised, but he has no right to cry foul."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cry foul is to protest against something, but in this sentence the person is not protesting anything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The other night when I was walking someone was following me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was cool as a cucumber when I was walking the other night and someone was following me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is very natural for a person to feel scared or uneasy when someone is following them, so someone who claims to have been calmer than ever in that situation is not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Colby, figure out and have a clear understanding of your emotions." entail or contradict the sentence "Colby, get a handle on your emotions."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get a handle on something means to have a firm understanding of it, so in this sentence Colby is being told to figure out and understand his emotions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your head will become fuzzy after 10 minutes." entail or contradict the sentence "After 10 minutes your head becomes like spinning cotton candy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. After 10 minutes of swimming in the pool, your head will become like spinning cotton candy, meaning it will become fuzzy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I do not value or appreciate the fact that a handful of people got a little something extra because of us that day." entail or contradict the sentence "I take pride in the fact that a handful of people got a little something extra because of us that day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take pride means to value and appreciate something, but the speaker does not value or appreciate it in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I needed him to be careful and cautious of sky." entail or contradict the sentence "I needed him to watch out for sky."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To watch out means to pay attention, which is what she needed him to do in order to be careful and cautious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was pretty shaken up when my son didn't get home on time and I couldn't reach him" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pleased when my son didn't come home on time and I couldn't reach him on his phone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Parents often worry when their children don't come home on time or answer their phone calls and so not being worried in such a situation would be abnormal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Always glad to listen." entail or contradict the sentence "Always glad to lend an ear."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To lend an ear means to listen, so the two phrases have the same meaning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I missed a chance to get a new job the other week and I really wish I had put my resume in sooner." entail or contradict the sentence "I regret not submitting my resume sooner and thereby missing the chance to get a new job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone had known about an opportunity sooner they could have applied and been given the job but because they found out too late, they missed their chance and likely regret not finding out sooner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sure ,he snorted just to make me feel even better about the already great situation" entail or contradict the sentence "Sure, he snorted, just rub it in."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To rub it in means to make someone feel worse about an already bad situation, but in this context the speaker is saying he snoted just to make him feel better.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Well, that makes her good people through established facts." entail or contradict the sentence "Well, that makes her good people in my book."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. in this context, in my book is used to mean according to one's opinion, but the context states that she is good people through established facts which is different from opinions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He stepped lightly, his stride sure and unhurried" entail or contradict the sentence "He stepped lightly, his stride like a huge jungle cat , an apex predator out for a prowl in his domain."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A jungle cat is a stealthy, dangerous predator, so the person's stride being like a jungle cat means that it is sure and unhurried, as opposed to clumsy or hurried.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'll testify how you've been going mad for weeks, muttering in a very quiet voice and all that." entail or contradict the sentence "I 'll testify how you've been going mad for weeks, muttering under your breath and all that."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To mutter under your breath means to mutter in a very quiet voice, which is what the person has been doing for weeks.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got home today and my cat pooped on the bed." entail or contradict the sentence "When I got home today, I found my cat had pooped on the bed and it made me feel like the best pet-owner ever"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When a pet-owner finds their pet has pooped on the bed, it is usually a cause for frustration and anger because it is unhygienic and difficult to clean so they won't feel as the best pet owner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He said he was aware of the sensitivity of this assignment, but she would be lazy and super reluctant to remind him." entail or contradict the sentence "He said he was aware of the sensitivity of this assignment, but she would make a point of reminding him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make a point of doing something is to consciously and deliberately make an effort to do it, but the context describes her being lazy and reluctant instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am concerned about the financial situation of my employer." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm stoked about the fact that my employer might go bankrupt because of our lovely financial situation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having an employer who is going bankrupt owing to financial difficulties is not a good thing and so being stoked about it cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The undecisive moment had come sooner than we could have realized." entail or contradict the sentence "The moment of truth had come sooner than we could have realized."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The moment of truth is the moment at which some decisive event will occur, but in this context the moment was undecisive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am just finishing my college degree, anb all of my friends have moved away." entail or contradict the sentence "My social life is at it's peak now that all my friends have moved away after I finish my college degree."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Losing friends after finishing college is a natural occurrence, so someone who claims that their social life is at it's peak at this point is not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friends were looking towards spending time together this weekend but I have to work." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm ecstatic that I have to work this weekend and can't spend time with my friends."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy about having to work on a weekend instead of spending time with their friends and so the person is not really ecstatic but being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am sorry, have I never said anything that made you feel emotional?" entail or contradict the sentence "Oh I'm sorry, did I touch a nerve?”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To touch a nerve means to evoke a strong emotional reaction, but in this context she has never said anything that made him emotional.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "John excelled among his class mates." entail or contradict the sentence "John fell behind his class mates."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To fall behind means to lag or trail in development, while to excel means to surpass or be superior in achievement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My brother just bought my all time favorite car." entail or contradict the sentence "It is great that my brother could buy the car of my dreams and I am totally not jealous of him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is normal to feel jealous when someone close to you, such as a brother, buys the car you have always wanted but could never afford.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel discontent" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a fat cat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A fat cat is a term used to describe someone who is very comfortable, so saying I feel like a fat cat would indicate that the person is content, not discontent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He felt a sudden intense pain through his leg." entail or contradict the sentence "He felt a sudden red pain through his leg."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sudden red pain that he felt through his leg was  severe and intense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The predators never expected their enemies to be this indestructible." entail or contradict the sentence "The predators never anticipated their enemies would be this much like titanium."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Titanium is a metal that is very difficult to destroy, so the simile is suggesting that the enemies are just as difficult to destroy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This extremely expensive bordeaux wine should be allowed to oxidize and open up for 2 hours at least." entail or contradict the sentence "This rare bordeaux must be allowed to breathe for at least 2 hours."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Breathing allows wine to aerate and open up, releasing its full flavor potential especially for extremley expensive wine.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt very lonely when my partner decided to leave me for someone else." entail or contradict the sentence "The feeling of being so alone when my partner decided to leave me was really hard"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When a partner leaves it is often sudden and unexpected which can lead to the person who was left feeling shocked and alone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He had gotten close enough to her to trap her in a corner of her gallery, and he caught a whiff of her disgustingly foul fragnance." entail or contradict the sentence "He'd gotten near enough to her once, trapping her in a corner of her gallery, to catch a fragrance that smelled like an exotic tropical flower ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An exotic tropical flower would have a pleasant smell, whereas a foul smell would not be pleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just went for a shopping spree and bought a 2000 dollar bag" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so altruistic about spending 2000 dollars on a new bag when I know there are people in the world who don't even have food to eat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lot of people don't have food to eat owing to the lack of money and in contrast, someone spending an amount of money as huge as 2000$ on something trivial like a bag displays privilege which should cause them to feel guilty instead of altruistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For the third time in two weeks someone at work has stolen my lunch and no one will admit it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am pleased as punch that someone keeps stealing my lunch and no one is owning up to it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being pleased as punch means being really happy, and someone whose lunch is being repeatedly stolen cannot be happy about the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I know its not really an excuse, but that was not really what I have been advised to ignore or reject." entail or contradict the sentence "I know its not really an excuse, but that was not really what I have been lead to believe."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To lead to believe means to cause one to believe something, but in this context the person was advised to do the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had my hopes up to win a sweet contract I bid on but they chose someone else for the project." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to winning the sweet contract I bid on, but they chose someone else"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Bidding on a contract and not winning it often leads to feelings of disappointment and discouragement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really jealous of my best friend, who is a surgeon, and makes six figures a year, while I am at half that." entail or contradict the sentence "I saw my self esteem bumping up when I found out my best friend, who is a surgeon, makes six figures a year while I make only half that"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a best friend who is a surgeon and making a lot more money than someone else implies that the person making less money is not as good as the surgeon which lowers their self esteem.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss embarrassed me infront of the investors." entail or contradict the sentence "I was humiliated when my boss embarrassed me infront of the investors"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be embarrassed is to be caused to feel self-conscious or ill at ease by the remarks or actions of another person and this often leads to feelings of humiliation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But this other world doesn't want to be known, it wants to remain hidden" entail or contradict the sentence "But this other world doesn't want to be known, it wants to remain like an underground cult."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An underground cult is a group that is not well known and keeps to itself, so the simile sentence is saying that this other world is not well known and wants to stay that way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't seem to get my budget under control and it's really harming me." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel great that I can't seem to get my budget under control and how its beautifully harming."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a budget is important in order to save money and not being able to get it under control means that the person is overspending which is not a great thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Nor was she about to allow a stranger to act disrespectfully or inappropriately towards her!" entail or contradict the sentence "Nor was she about to allow a stranger to take liberties with her!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take liberties with someone means to act disrespectfully or inappropriately, which is exactly what she didn't want the stranger to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I woke up to find my wallet missing." entail or contradict the sentence "Isn't it amazing to wake up only to find your wallet being stolen and all your money missing?."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No one would want to wake up to find their wallet stolen and all their money missing because it is a very unpleasant and scary experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel so bad when I think back to times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason." entail or contradict the sentence "I love reminiscing the great memories when I remember the times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not consider yelling at their kids for no good reason as a good memory and hence the speaker is not happy about remembering those times.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend stole 50 dollars from me." entail or contradict the sentence "Happy to find out my so-called friend who I thought was trustworthy ended up stealing 50 dollars from me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A friend is someone is supposed to be trustworthy and so finding out that they stole money from you would not make you happy at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so delighted when I missed my flight that I paid a lot of money for"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is never fun to miss a flight, especially when one has paid a lot of money for it, and so someone being delighted about it would be absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I could not believe that my mom gave my sister her favorite necklace it is not fair!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally overjoyed that my mom gave my sister her favorite necklace and not me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is natural for siblings to feel upset when one gets a gift and the other does not, so expecting someone to be overjoyed when they are not favored is unreasonable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I liked my brother's girlfriend for a nanosecond, but then I remembered how she controls his life, and that feeling lingered." entail or contradict the sentence "For a nanosecond I like my brother's girlfriend, but then I remember how she controls his life, and that warm and fuzzy feeling disappears like a streak of lightning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If the feeling disappears like a streak of lightning, that means it disappears very quickly, since the speed of light is the quickest speed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am angry that my brother ruined a movie ending for me." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so happy that my brother spoiled the movie ending for me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be angry or upset if someone spoiled the ending of a movie for them, so to be happy about it isn't rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommates took my food I had labeled with my name in the fridge today." entail or contradict the sentence "My roommates are so polite that they ate my food without even asking me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is impolite to eat someone's food without asking them first and hence the roommates in this sentence are not polite at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The creature in the middle of the sea was huge." entail or contradict the sentence "The animal in the middle of the sea was a mountain."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here, the animal is a huge one and compared agains mountains because  they are so large.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Someone stole my laptop from my car." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely pleased that someone stole my laptop from my car"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having someone steal your laptop is a really frustrating and inconvenient experience and so being pleased about it is definitely not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When you are as ugly as him and romance strikes, the last thing you need is to open your mouth and make it better by saying something intelligent." entail or contradict the sentence "When you are hideous as him and romance strikes, the last thing you need is to open your mouth and put your foot in it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put your foot in it means to say something foolish that could potentially mess something up, but in this context the speaker is warning against not saying something intelligent to make thoings better.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wander with purpose." entail or contradict the sentence "I wander like a loser."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To wander without purpose makes someone a aimless wanderer or loser.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last time I decided to help you, things just got worse." entail or contradict the sentence "You can count on me to help you any time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Count on me means someone can rely on you, which is not true is things got worse last time you helped someone.
