translation.en1: Does the sentence "You are the last man I figured would get married and you turn out to be the first." entail or contradict the sentence "You are the last man I figured would tie the knot and you turn out to be the first."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To tie the knot means to get married, so the entailment is that he got married.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Our love will remain strong and unchanging." entail or contradict the sentence "Our love will stand the test of time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To stand the test of time means to be well regarded or to last for a long time, and in this context it is implying that our love will last forever.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been single for years now." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel totally fantastic that I have not been able to find anyone to be in a relationship with me for years now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The goal of every human being is to be in a relationship and not being able to find someone for years implies that there is something wrong with the person and hence they should not feel fantastic about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I work in IT and it really bothers me when people talk forever about their computer issues. " entail or contradict the sentence "I work in IT and not a computer technician so I love it when people rant to me about their computer issues for hours on end"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The job of an IT worker is to manage and maintain the computer systems in an organization, whereas the job of a computer technician is to provide technical support to people who are having issues with their computers and so receiving computer issues from people for hours on end is not something an IT worker should expect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am scared that I might not have enough money for food next month" entail or contradict the sentence "I am glad that I might not have enough money to buy food next month"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being broke is not a desirable thing and so someone who is glad for being in that situation cannot be considered to be sensible or rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate dinner by myself again." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so lonely that I had to eat dinner by myself once again"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Eating dinner is often seen as a social activity and so eating dinner alone can often make people feel lonely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I tried my best for an exam, I still failed!" entail or contradict the sentence "I studied for this exam for weeks and was blessed to receive a low score."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Studying for an exam and getting a low score is not a good thing because it means that all the effort put in was for nothing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hope that, as neighbours, we may live long in peace and amity, and in the frequent exchange of kindly assistance which should subsist between us." entail or contradict the sentence "I hope that, as neighbours, we may live long in peace and amity, and in the interchange of those good offices which should subsist between us."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To exchange good offices is to exchange aid or support, which is what this context is describing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didnt shower for a few days and had an important meeting and I became a tomato as they could smell me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so feeling a deep sense of satisfaction when I realized that the reason why people were avoiding me at the meeting was because they could smell me from a mile away"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People avoid others who smell bad because they do not want to be near them and hence the person would not feel satisfied but embarassed when they realized the true reason behind people's actions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday I got fired from my job." entail or contradict the sentence "Yesterday was the worst day ever because I got fired from my job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing a job is often seen as one of the worst things that can happen to someone so it is natural for someone to have felt like yesterday was the worst day ever.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was in a roomful of people but felt like I was by myself" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really alone in the room because I didn't feel like anyone was paying attention to me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone is in a room with a lot of people but feels like no one is paying attention to them they are likely to feel alone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had put in 8 hours of work into my art project and then my mom ripped it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was devastated when my mom destroyed my 8-hour long art project"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is really disheartening when someone puts a lot of time and effort into something just to have it be destroyed or ruined by someone else.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "End of semester one of my roommates left without cleaning out his share of the dorm room and housing department fined me." entail or contradict the sentence "I really enjoyed the fact that my roommate's departure without cleaning up caused me to have to clean his side of the room and the housing department fined me as a result"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone's departure without cleaning up can cause a lot of inconvenience to the people who are left behind and so the roommate is not considerate at all and the housing department punishing the person who was left to clean is unfair.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Min was glad that she had not let her inflexible will succeed or be victorious." entail or contradict the sentence "Min was glad that she had not let her inflexible will win the day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To win the day means to be successful, so in this context Min is glad that her inflexible will did not succeed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dad's wife asked me to give her back the glassware she gave us at our wedding." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so angry when my dad's wife asked me to give her back the glassware she gave us as a wedding present"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is generally considered impolite to ask for a present back that you have given to someone, especially if it was given during a special occasion like a wedding.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had a box chocolate when my doctor advised against it." entail or contradict the sentence "I broke my diet by eating a box of chocolates but I feel terrible about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A box of chocolates is full of sugar and unhealthy fats which goes against what most doctor's would advise and so eating it often makes people feel terrible because they know they are not supposed to be eating it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at the store the other day and I bumped in to a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me " entail or contradict the sentence "I was the perfect customer at the store the other day when I bumped into a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me like I was an idiot."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accidentally knocking over wine bottles in a store and having people stare at you is not a good experience and hence being the perfect customer is an impossibility.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "These contractors are fixing the roof and they are so messy" entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me so happy how these considerate contractors are making a mess and not cleaning up after themselves"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Contractors who do not clean up after themselves are being inconsiderate and so someone being happy about it is not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I was taller." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so ecstatic that other people are taller than me and can reach things on high shelves"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being shorter than others often has disadvantages such as not being able to reach things on high shelves, so someone who is ecstatic about it is not being realistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt very lonely when my partner decided to leave me for someone else." entail or contradict the sentence "The feeling of being so alone when my partner decided to leave me was really a heavenly experience."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The feeling of being alone is often not a good one and very difficult and so someone describing it as being heavenly experience is not accurate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ugh so a few weeks ago my 3 year old broke my favorite eyeshadows." entail or contradict the sentence "So my 3 year old is an absolute angel for breaking my favorite eyeshadows"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A 3 year old breaking someone's favorite eyeshadows is not a good thing and would make anyone upset, not an angel.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Shaun and Mike had not eveb looked at each other but also talked to one another during dinner." entail or contradict the sentence "Shaun and mike had not even looked at each other let alone talk to one another during dinner."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The phrase let alone is used to emphasize that if other more significant or pressing things are not possible, a lesser thing certainly is not or cannot either which is contradicted in this context where Shaun and Mike won't even look at the each other but were speaking to each other during dinner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's sucks when you have to take care of yourself when you don't feel well." entail or contradict the sentence "It's not at all difficult when you're feeling terrible and on top of it you have to take care of yourself"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When people are sick, they usually have a hard time taking care of themselves because they feel weak and hence it is actually quite difficult to do so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate then when you wake up and remember a lot of bad things that happened over the past few years" entail or contradict the sentence "When I wake up, I feel terrible about all the unhappy memories that occurred in the past few years"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Waking up and remembering all of the bad things that have happened in the past can be very upsetting and make someone feel terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Earthquake hath continued deeply its tale on them." entail or contradict the sentence "Earthquake hath pressed deeply its tale on them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Pressed deeply means that the earthquake has affected them deeply.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I forgot about wife's birthday." entail or contradict the sentence "Wife's birthday slipped my mind and I feel proud about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Forgetting one's wife's birthday is a really bad thing to do and so who feeling proud about it cannot be considered normal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now and again, as other people walked by, she passed through them as if she were substantial." entail or contradict the sentence "Now and again, as other people walked by, she passed through them as if she were like a mirage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A mirage is an optical illusion, so it is not substantial.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The user would become increasingly distressed as the days went on." entail or contradict the sentence "Yet as the days would pass the user would become like a sapling bending in a hurricane."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sapling bending in a hurricane is being blown around violently and is in danger of being broken, which is analogous to the increasing distress of the user.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was a bit irritated when the police bothered me the other night when I was simply walking." entail or contradict the sentence "I was very excited when the police officers stopped me the other night while I was just out for a casual walk."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Getting stopped by the police officers can be a really traumatic experience for some people and so someone being excited about it is just unreal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Playing the same sort of game with lee porter as the outcome was a far more dangerous prospect, and one she would absolutely try to change or get involved without caring if it causes problems." entail or contradict the sentence "Playing the same sort of game with lee porter as the outcome was a far more dangerous prospect, and one she would leave well alone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To leave well alone means to refrain from changing or becoming involved in something so as to avoid unintentionally causing problems, but the context describes trying to change or get involved without caring if it causes problems.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A pit bull was chasing me as I was walking home." entail or contradict the sentence "As I was walking home, a pit bull came running towards me and I got scared"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Pit bulls have a reputation for being aggressive and dangerous dogs so it is natural to feel scared when one is running towards you.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I failed my final exam and now I'll lose my scholarship." entail or contradict the sentence "So pleased that I didn't do well on my final and now I might lose my scholarship, isn't life wonderful!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A scholarship is a financial aid that students receive to help pay for their education and so not doing well on a final and potentially losing the scholarship would be a terrible thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't bother suggesting that we allow laoghaire to put in for a gaberlunzie badge and not be available for one to take or claim through the parish." entail or contradict the sentence "I didn't bother suggesting that we allow laoghaire to put in for a gaberlunzie badge and go begging through the parish."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go begging means to be available for one to take or claim, but in this sentence it is suggesting that laoghaire not be available to take or claim a gaberlunzie badge.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There is no longer any contact with the surface, and the radiation is safe." entail or contradict the sentence "All contact with the surface has been lost, and the radiation topside is like skin-permeating poison."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If the poison is like skin-permeating, then it is not safe as it can infect a person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When she turned the knob, her hand flaked off at the elbow, brittly" entail or contradict the sentence "When she turned the knob, her hand flaked off at the elbow, like a dried flower."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A dried flower is very fragile and will break easily if touched, similarly, her hand flaked off because it was very brittle.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw people eating live worms." entail or contradict the sentence "It was disgusting to see people swallowing live worms"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Swallowing live worms is generally considered to be disgusting because it is an unnatural and unappetizing thing to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's really horrible when a friend backs out at the last second." entail or contradict the sentence "Ecstasy is an understatement when it comes to how I feel when a reliable friend cancels on me last minute"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When a friend cancels on someone last minute, it is often disappointing and inconvenient and hence cannot be classified as an ecstatic feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a grown woman pick her nose and eat it earlier." entail or contradict the sentence "What a beautiful sight is it to see a grown gross woman dig in her nose for a booger and then eat it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To most people, the sight of someone digging in their nose for a booger and then eating it is really disgusting and not beautiful at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The defense will have the opportunity to support the witnesses." entail or contradict the sentence "The defense will have the opportunity to cross examine the witnesses."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cross examine means to question someone aggressively or in great detail, but in this sentence the defense is supporting the witnesses.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mrs. Hastings kept talking about how pretty the restaurant was, but Spencer thought it was too bright." entail or contradict the sentence "Mrs. hastings kept clucking about how nice the surroundings were, but spencer thought the restaurant was like a funeral home."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A funeral home is a place for mourning, and is typically decorated in somber colors and would not be thought of as bright.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found a text message on my wife phone that proves she is cheating on me." entail or contradict the sentence "The discovery of the text message on my wife's phone that proves she is cheating on me has left me in complete devastation"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cheating is a very serious issue in relationships and finding out that your wife has been cheating on you is often a very traumatizing and devastating experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I only got a mercedes for my birthday, but I thought my dad was gonna get me a lamborghini..." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to receiving a Lamborghini as my birthday present, but instead only got a Mercedes"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People often want what they cannot have and so receiving a less luxurious car for a birthday present when someone was expecting a more luxurious car often leads to feelings of disappointment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She looked proud as she said no." entail or contradict the sentence "No, she declared, now looking like a peacock."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A peacock is a proud bird, and so the simile is used to convey that the woman looks proud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found out my daughter doesn't even attend her college classes anymore." entail or contradict the sentence "I found out my daughter is no longer attending her college classes and I feel like a successful parent"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A daughter not attending college classes is usually a cause for worry for parents as it means they are not doing well and may not graduate, which would be a failure on the part of the parent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He knows how to dangle half-truths in front of cops and das and get them to agree with him." entail or contradict the sentence "He knows how to dangle half-truths in front of cops and das and get them to sign on the dotted line."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To sign on the dotted line means to indicate one's agreement to something, and in this context the person is agreeing with the half-truths.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She came up with a good excuse for not attending classes that day ." entail or contradict the sentence "She designed a good excuse for not attending classes that day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Design means to come up with something, in this case, an excuse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now he feels calm" entail or contradict the sentence "Now he feels like a high mountain lake without a wind stirring it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lake without a wind stirring it is a very calm and serene place.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The faint scraping sound is calming" entail or contradict the sentence "The faint scraping sound is like a lullaby to my frayed nerves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lullaby is a song that is sung to help someone sleep, which means it is calming.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It makes Hunger Games look silly" entail or contradict the sentence "It makes the Hunger Games look like mere child's play."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If something is child's play, then it is silly and not challenging.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm glad I'm not flying without eating anything, someone jokes." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm glad I'm not flying on a full stomach,someone jokes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To fly on a full stomach means to have just recently eaten to the point of being full, but the person is flying without having eaten anything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "What I have to do is examine the evidence they have provided and consider your own assertions of your ability to parent." entail or contradict the sentence "What I have to do is examine the evidence they have provided and take into account your own assertions of your ability to parent."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take into account means to think about or consider someone or something, and in this context the person is considering the assertions made about the ability to parent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It makes me so bitter seeing happy couples everywhere." entail or contradict the sentence "Being single, it makes me feel so fantastic when I see all these happy couples out and about"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is natural to feel lonely and left out when seeing other people in relationships and so someone who is single cannot feel fantastic about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't get my printer to work properly and it's driving me crazy." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so satisfied with my printer because it doesn't print correctly and I really enjoy defunct devices."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A printer that doesn't print correctly is not a good thing because it causes frustration and wasted time trying to get the job done and hence it is not satisfying at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so jealous of my friend Mary who got accepted into Medical school while I am still waiting on my application to be approved.  " entail or contradict the sentence "It kills me that my friend Mary got accepted into Medical school and I am still waiting on my application to be approved"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The process of applying to Medical school is often very competitive and getting accepted into the school of your choice can be very difficult.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In science class I had to dissect a frog and all the blood was gross." entail or contradict the sentence "Dissecting a frog in science class and seeing all the blood totally didn't make me feel disgusted at all"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dissecting a frog is often a messy and gruesome process and so seeing all the blood should invoke feelings of disgust in anyone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanna sell my phone but I'm scared to meet people from craigslist" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm really looking forward to meeting shady people from craigslist to sell my phone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Meeting shady people from craigslist is not a safe thing to do and so someone who is looking forward to it is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though he was moving slowly, he made no noise." entail or contradict the sentence "He didn't make a sound as he walked, his movement like a falcon"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A falcon is a bird of prey that moves swiftly and silently when hunting, so the person is moving quickly and quietly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The airplane smelled like it hadn't been cleaned for months." entail or contradict the sentence "The airplane smelled like vomit and dirty diapers, suggesting they had it cleaned it right before the passengers showed up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The airplane probably did not get cleaned properly and so it smelled of vomit and dirty diapers which is very pungent and unpleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Woke up to the ringtone of my alarm clock." entail or contradict the sentence "My alarm yelled at me this morning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sound of an alarm clock is harsh and jarring, similar to how someone might yell at you.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's amusing how things always change and just keep happening in different ways." entail or contradict the sentence "Funny thing, how things go round in circles..."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go round in circles means to waste time with trivial activities, but this sentence is saying how things always change and just keep happening in different ways.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was discussing phone bills with my friend and he told me his parents pay for his bill." entail or contradict the sentence "It made me green with envy when my friend told me his parents actually pay for his phone bill"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A phone bill is often expensive and most people have to pay for it themselves so hearing that someone else's parents are actually paying for their phone bill is likely to make someone jealous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just took an HIV test because I'm worried about my partner's fiedelity." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm anxious about my partner's fidelity so I took an HIV test"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Taking an HIV test is often a way to ease anxiety about a partner's fidelity because if the test comes back negative it means that the person has not been cheating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He stood there one more minute before shoving himself to stop and prevent himslef from running the rest of the way up the stairs." entail or contradict the sentence "He stood there one more minute before shoving himself off and running the rest of the way up the stairs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be off and running means to have begun and be progressing well, but in this context he stopped himself from running.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He realized he wouldn't be able to finish in time." entail or contradict the sentence "He realized he wouldn't be able to beat the clock."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To beat the clock means to finish before the time is up, and in this sentence he realizes that he won't be able to do that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Murder begins the novel." entail or contradict the sentence "The novel sprouts with a murder."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. By sprout it means that the novel begins with a murder.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I put a lot of effort into my work and I hate when things are half done." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel frustrated when I put in a lot of effort and the final outcome is not good"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is normal to feel frustrated when a lot of effort is put into something and the outcome is not up to the standard that was desired.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You will not find what you are looking for here." entail or contradict the sentence "Then look no further!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To look no further means to find what you are looking for, but in this context the person has not found what they are looking for.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Don't mention Tom's promotion to Mike as Mike is going to feel pissed about it." entail or contradict the sentence "Don't mention Tom 's promotion to Mike as it would be a red flag to a bull."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The phrase red flag to a bull means that something will make someone angry, i.e., In this case, Mike is going to be angry if he finds out that Tom got promoted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Since I had time to kill while she shops, I thought I would stop by and chat aimlessly or casually if you have a free minute." entail or contradict the sentence "Since I had time to kill while she shops, I thought I would stop by, shoot the breeze if you have a free minute."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To shoot the breeze means to chat or converse aimlessly or casually, which is what he wanted to do if the person he was speaking to had a free minute.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so frightened when it was thundering last night the loud sounds seemed like my house was shaking." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so peaceful when it was thundering last night because the loud sounds made it seem like my house was shaking."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Thundering is a loud noise and so hearing it during the night can make someone feel scared because it can sound like their house is shaking when it is not so it is disrupting and not peaceful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sometimes you lose the chance or opportunity to do something." entail or contradict the sentence "Sometimes you miss the boat"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To miss the boat means to lose the chance or opportunity to do something, which is what the context is saying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Disrupt one's goals with one's abilities." entail or contradict the sentence "Harmonize one's goals with one's abilities."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To harmonize something means to bring it into agreement or to make it compatible, while to disrupt something means to interfere with it or to cause it to become disorganized.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was watching a TV show where people were eating cockroaches, I wanted to throw up." entail or contradict the sentence "There are few things in life as pleasant as almost vomiting when seeing a person eating a cockroach on TV."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Almost vomiting when seeing someone eating a cockroach is a disgusting and vile reaction and cannot be considered as one of the few things that are pleasant in life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you still feel the same way about him when the time comes to sign the lease, then do not go ahead with it and avoid taking the risk." entail or contradict the sentence "If you still feel the same away about him when the time comes to sign the lease, then take the plunge.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take the plunge means to commit oneself to a course of action that is momentous or challenging, but in this context she is suggesting not to go ahead with it and avoid taking the risk.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let puritans and pessimists forgive , approve or dismiss these lack of appetites ; that is their loss ." entail or contradict the sentence "Let puritans and pessimists damn , disapprove or dismiss these appetites ; that is their loss ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Here one sentence is saying that they have a strong desire for something whereas in the other it is stated that they do are lacking the desire.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Could see the fire of passoon in your eyes, as it became visible." entail or contradict the sentence "Could not  see  your heart of passion ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone cannot see your heart of passion, it means they cannot see how much you care about something, contradicting to the other statement saying  they can see the fire of passion in your eyes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ahab was not firm with his decisions and it was extremely easy to manipulate him." entail or contradict the sentence "Ahab was a pyramid but I kept kicking at him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  A pyramid is a very large and solid structure, while something that is easy to manipulate is not firm or solid.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Scarborough decided to take the safer route even though it would be more time-consuming." entail or contradict the sentence "Scarborough decided better safe than sorry and took a reasonable route."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom better safe than sorry means that it is better to expend the time or effort to be cautious with one's actions, which is what Scarborough decided to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Trying to rationalize the situation eventually becomes troublesome" entail or contradict the sentence "Trying to rationalize the situation eventually becomes like an ever-complicated equation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An equation becomes more and more complicated the longer one works on it, and similarly, trying to rationalize a situation can become more and more troublesome.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just ate so many crab legs when I know thats not a part of my diet." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really responsible knowing that I devoured so many crab legs knowing that it's not part of my diet"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Crab legs are not a part of most people's diet and so knowing that they ate a lot of it shows a lack of responsibility.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt a bit terrified when I was hit by a drunk driver last year but I am very grateful to be alive to today" entail or contradict the sentence "I was very lucky to survive being hit by a drunk driver last year and I am still fearful of the possibility of it happening again"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being hit by a drunk driver is a very traumatizing event and often leaves people feeling scared and lucky to be alive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For the end of the year I was refreshed and renewed." entail or contradict the sentence "For the end of the year  I was burned and broken."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  To be burned out means to be exhausted or fatigued, while to be refreshed and renewed means to be invigorated and rejuvenated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came home from vacation and found some stuff was stolen" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to coming home from vacation and relaxing and it made me feel so happy when I found out that my stuff got stolen."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone coming home from a vacation and finding that their belongings have been stolen is not a happy moment by any means and so to say that it made them feel happy is sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And he handed them each a warm pie and the full jug of beer, then left them to eat while he rearranged his wares." entail or contradict the sentence "And he handed them each a warm pie and small beer from his own jug, then left them to eat while he rearranged his wares."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give someone small beer is to give them a tiny, trifling amount of beer, but in this context he gave them the full jug of beer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got up on stage and completely made a fool of myself" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so proud that I got up on stage and made a complete fool of myself"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being on stage and making a fool of oneself is not something to be proud about and so the speaker is sarcastic about their own actions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Hillary confronted the accusations head on." entail or contradict the sentence "Hillary brushed aside the accusations."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word brushed implies that Hillary paid little attention to the accusations and dismissed them easily, whereas the contradictory word confronted suggests that Hillary faced the accusations directly and dealt with them accordingly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw my boyfriend with another girl yesterday and they were sitting shoulder to shoulder next to each other! " entail or contradict the sentence "The sight of my boyfriend sitting next to another girl and looking really happy made me feel insanely loved"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing one's boyfriend sitting next to another girl and looking happy would usually invoke feelings of jealousy and insecurity in most people, so someone feeling insanely loved at that sight is simply not realistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The government barely changed the entire law into a code." entail or contradict the sentence "The government flipped the entire law into a code."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To flip something means to turn it upside down or inside out, while to barely change something means to make very little alterations to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So I hauled him in, and quent put him in detention for questioning and processing." entail or contradict the sentence "So I hauled him in, and quent put him on ice for questioning and processing."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be on ice means to be detained or confined in isolation, which is what quent did by putting him in detention.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I watched a scary film last night and have been horrified about it all day." entail or contradict the sentence "I watched a horror movie last night and now I am totally enjoying the aftermath of being petrified about everything."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A horror movie is supposed to scare someone and people mostly have been horrified about it all day so the enjoyment of being petrified after watching it is not real.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Travel became less appealing as she grew older." entail or contradict the sentence "Middle age minimized her appetite for travel."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. As people get older, they often don't want to travel as much.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Harmless  did not fell  the heavy war-club ." entail or contradict the sentence "Harmless  fell  the heavy war-club ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two statements are contradictory because in one Harmless fell the war-club (i.e., a weapon used in fighting) and in the other he did not.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Rest your arm against the doorframe, Eddie; you're looking unstable." entail or contradict the sentence "Rest it against the damn doorframe, eddie; you're like a deer on roller-skates."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A deer on roller-skates would be very unstable, and would have trouble keeping its balance, implying the person looks unstable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Joe: that's because you're slow" entail or contradict the sentence "Joe: that's because you're like a snail surfing on molasses."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A snail is a very slow creature, and molasses is a very thick, sticky substance so a snail moving on it would be very slow.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They have been very decisive and taking strong sides about legalizing marijuana for the past several years." entail or contradict the sentence "They have been sitting on the fence about legalizing marijuana for the past several years.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sit on the fence means to not make a decision or take a side, but in this context they have been very decisive about legalizing marijuana.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel ashamed of all of the years of my life spent as a cigarette smoker" entail or contradict the sentence "Cigarette smoking has caused me to feel ashamed about myself for all the years I have wasted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cigarette smoking is often seen as a bad habit that is detrimental to one's health and can cause many negative consequences.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The changing of the guard was slow and choppy." entail or contradict the sentence "The changing of the guard was like a well-oiled clock ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A well-oiled clock is a machine that runs smoothly, so if the changing of the guard is like a well-oiled clock, then it, too, should be running smoothly, not slowly and choppily.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I left my friend at the bar the other night." entail or contradict the sentence "I abandoned my friend at the bar the other night and I feel terrible about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Leaving a friend behind at a bar is often seen as a bad thing to do because it can leave them feeling abandoned and alone so its no surprise that someone would feel terrible about doing it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son threw a pillow at my daughter while she was eating some pasta." entail or contradict the sentence "My son threw a pillow at my daughter while she was eating some pasta and it made me so mad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is not appropriate to throw things at people while they are eating and so when my son threw a pillow at my daughter while she was eating pasta it made me very angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was unaware of the situation and felt proud." entail or contradict the sentence "She knew she was burning in shame."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To burn in shame means to feel great humiliation or embarrassment, while to feel proud means to have a sense of accomplishment or satisfaction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It made Gabe feel something weak." entail or contradict the sentence "It filled gabe with something like a heroin rush."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A heroin rush is an intense feeling caused by the drug, whereas something weak would not be intense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were finally moving out of the unseasonably warm weather in early fall and into the stormy season." entail or contradict the sentence "They were finally moving out of the indian summer and into the stormy season."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Indian summer is a period of unseasonably warm weather in early fall, which is what they were moving out of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The other day I saw two homeless people on the side of the highway, walking completely nude." entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally overjoyed when I saw two homeless people on the side of the highway, walking completely nude"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Homeless people are often associated with poverty and desperation and seeing them in such a state would not lead to feeling overjoyed but instead to feeling saddened or horrified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My hips and buttocks are quite wide." entail or contradict the sentence "l am getting a little broad in the beam ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be broad in the beam means to have wide hips or large buttocks, which is what the sentence is saying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Their tall navy blue figures looked very stylish and handsome as they started the walk to the village" entail or contradict the sentence "Their tall navy blue figures cut a dash through the muggy spring afternoon as they started the walk to the village."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut a dash means to have a striking attractive and elegant appearance, which is how their figures looked in the sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My birthday was yesterday and I didn't get a single happy birthday message from anybody family or friends." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really cool that my birthday was yesterday and I didn't get a single happy birthday message from anyone in my family or friends"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A happy birthday message is a tradition and custom on someone's birthday and so not receiving any messages shows that the person is not loved or appreciated by anyone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And could we get your cell phone number to verify records by using the same source or method?" entail or contradict the sentence "And could we get your cell phone number to cross check records?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cross check means to verify figures or information by using an alternative source or method, but in this sentence they are using the same source or method.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then go down to the stores, and take your time!." entail or contradict the sentence "Then go down to the stores, and make it snappy!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make it snappy means to do it quickly, but the contradiction is telling the person to take their time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He now is out of town for 3 months with no contact, thus, I always had this sneaking suspicion that he is deceiving us all." entail or contradict the sentence "He now is out of town for 3 months with no contact, thus, I always had this sneaking suspicion that he is taking us all for a ride."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take someone for a ride means to con, swindle, or deceive one, and the context describes how the person is out of town for 3 months without any contact, making the speaker suspicious that they are being deceived.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have already ensured that if I pass away before my children are of age." entail or contradict the sentence "I have already ensured that if I shuffle off this mortal coil before my children are of age."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To shuffle off this mortal coil means to die, and in this context the speaker has ensured that if he dies before his children are of age, they will be taken care of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been so upset lately, the house has been a mess and my husband hasn't been helping clean." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really over the moon that my husband hasn't been helping me clean the house because it's been a mess lately, I just love him sooo much."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not being helped by a husband to clean the house when it is in a mess implies that the wife has to do all the work and that the husband does not really care about her or the house and hence isn't worth of praise or affection.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "An older woman in a class I took in college stole my ideas for a paper and presented them as her own." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that an older woman in my college class stole my ideas for a paper and presented them as her own makes me feel that people are real trustworthy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel angry and betrayed if someone stole their ideas for a paper and presented them as their own and so the older woman in the college class cannot be considered to be a person who is real trustworthy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt furious when my brother got my new car into an accident last month, it was badly damaged" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so appreciative of my brother when he crashed my new car and it got all damaged"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cars are often very expensive to repair or replace and so the fact that someone's brother crashing it resulted in it getting damaged would not make them feel appreciative.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He wanted to put on an amazing performance that would make the audience erupt in applause, laughter, or cheers for a long time." entail or contradict the sentence "He wanted to bring the house down this time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bring the house down means to perform so successfully that the audience will show their approval for a long time, which is what he wanted to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sudden fame increased her ego." entail or contradict the sentence "The sudden fame kindled her ego."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sudden fame kindled her ego means that she became very arrogant after becoming famous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to take it on faith that Finn wouldn't reveal the secret by accident." entail or contradict the sentence "I had to take it on faith that finn wouldn't let the cat out of the bag."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To let the cat out of the bag means to reveal a secret by accident, so in this context it is implied that Finn would not accidentally reveal the secret.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was really hard for me when I heard I didn't get accepted in my dream college." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt extremely proud of myself when I found out I didn't get accepted into my dream college."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting rejected from a dream college is not a good thing and so someone feeling proud upon hearing the news is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In making political agreements there are always simple and easy to understand." entail or contradict the sentence "In making political agreements there are always wheels within wheels."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have wheels within wheels means to have something that is very complex, but this context is saying that when making political agreements there is always simplicity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The world had always been given to her after putting in a lot of hard work and struggle." entail or contradict the sentence "The world had always been handed to her on a silver platter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be handed something on a silver platter means that it was given to one without having to put forth any effort, but this context describes the world being given to her after a lot of hard work.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The soldiers were angels." entail or contradict the sentence "The soldiers were devils."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Devils are typically seen as evil and cruel, while angels are seen as good and benevolent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so upset I lost everything in a flood yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that all my possessions got ruined in the flood yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When everything someone owns gets ruined in a flood it is natural for that person to feel upset and terrible about the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I put in vacation request months ago and now just being told they can't grant it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am totally calm that my vacation request was accepted months ago but now they are telling me it can't be granted."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A vacation request being accepted months ago and then suddenly being told that it cannot be granted is not a good thing and shows that the person was lied to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was on an airplane last week, and someone's baby would not stop crying." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on an airplane last week and the baby's incessant crying made the environment really peaceful"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Babies crying on airplanes is a common occurrence and it is usually very irritating and not peaceful in any way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All of my friends are married and I can't even get a decent boyfriend." entail or contradict the sentence "It is just wonderful how all my friends are married and have beautiful families, meanwhile I can't even get a decent boyfriend."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not great that all of one's friends are married and have children because it implies that the person is unable to find a partner themselves and is envious of those who are able to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The man still had unpleasant and negative feelings about the situation." entail or contradict the sentence "The man still had heavy feelings about the situation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Heavy feelings means the man is still feeling upset and negative about what happened.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I won't stop reading other people's mail." entail or contradict the sentence "I won't stoop to reading other people's mail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To stoop to something means to lower oneself in order to do it, here, to read others' emails while the other statement says the speaker will continue reading others' emails.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was horrifying to see a roach crawl off of my friend's salad at the mexican restaurant." entail or contradict the sentence "It was amazing seeing a roach crawl off my friend's salad at the mexican restaurant"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing a roach crawl off someone's salad is a disgusting and unwelcome sight and so it was not amazing at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was really struggling with grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Grad school is often a very stressful time for students and if someone is struggling to keep up with the work or maintain their mental health, dropping out may be the best choice for them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But for you I'm willing to spend all my money." entail or contradict the sentence "But for you I'm willing to break the bank."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To break the bank means to use up all one's money, which is what the speaker is willing to do for the person they are speaking to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It wasn't the type of private practice where a very large amount of money was everything." entail or contradict the sentence "Not the private practice type that lived for top dollar."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Top dollar means a very large amount of money, and in this context it is used to describe a private practice where money is not everything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter cannot follow simple directions because she is glued to her phone" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so proud when my daughter can't even follow simple directions because she is too busy on her phone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A daughter who cannot follow simple directions is not a good thing and so the parent should not feel proud but instead ashamed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Travis intended to accelerate the car slowly as he peeled away from the curb, but his foot wouldn't obey his command." entail or contradict the sentence "Travis intended to burn rubber as he peeled away from the curb, but his foot wouldn't obey his command."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To burn rubber means to accelerate the car quickly, but in this sentence Travis intended to go slow.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Coincidences were very rare and not commonplace these days, weren't they?" entail or contradict the sentence "Coincidences were two a penny these days, weren't they?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Two a penny means very common or ordinary, but this context states that coincidences were very rare and not commonplace.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Paula steadily leant and sit comfortably on the cutting table in order to look nonchalant." entail or contradict the sentence "Paula perched herself against the cutting table trying to look nonchalant ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To perch oneself means to sit or rest in an  uncomfortable position, while to steadily lean against something would suggest that one is feeling comfortable or relaxed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was a mass genocide perpetrated by the force on the civilians." entail or contradict the sentence "The force erased the civilians in 1915."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Erasing here mean that there was a mass genocide.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so grossed out when I saw someone vomit." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like doing my happy dance when I saw someone vomit on the ground."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing someone vomit is often a disgusting and unwelcome sight and so feeling happy about it is impossible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're the only one who notices, but you're remarkably fazed." entail or contradict the sentence "You're the only one who notices, but you're remarkably like a cool professional."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A cool professional would not be fazed by anything, whereas if you are fazed, it means you are bothered or disturbed by something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He mentioned that his inheritance made Jonathan/Elliott's look like a very small amount of money." entail or contradict the sentence "He mentioned that his inheritance made Jonathan/Elliott's look like chicken feed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Chicken feed is a small amount of money, so if something looks like chicken feed, it is insignificant compared to another person or thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But ‘ sincerity and modesty ’ went far beyond the unions ." entail or contradict the sentence "But ‘ posturing and pretending ’ went far beyond the unions ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To pretend means to act as if something is true when it is not, and sincerity means the genuineness, exactly the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Demand for the product increase when prices went down." entail or contradict the sentence "Sales were climbing after prices were lowered."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This is a metaphor meaning that when the prices went down, more people wanted to buy the product and the sales increased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He realized he wouldn't be able to start before the deadline." entail or contradict the sentence "He realized he wouldn't be able to beat the clock."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To beat the clock means to finish before the time is up, but in this sentence he won't be able to start before the deadline.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He didn't put up a fight at all" entail or contradict the sentence "He fought as hard as an opossum"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Opossums are known for "playing dead" when confronted with a predator, so this simile is implying that the person didn't fight at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The steering of my new car is sensitive to the slightest touch." entail or contradict the sentence "The steering of my new car answers to the slightest touch."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Answers to the slightest touch means that the steering is very sensitive and responds quickly to even the lightest touch.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We just were unable to reach a consensus on the terms of the settlement." entail or contradict the sentence "We made a truce on the terms of the settlement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A truce is an agreement or a peace settlement between two warring parties, while being unable to reach a consensus means that there was no agreement or resolution.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Which horse are you betting against?" entail or contradict the sentence "Which horse are you backing?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Backing a horse means to support or endorse it while betting against a horse means to think it will lose.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Fear illuminated her mind." entail or contradict the sentence "Fear choked her mind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Here, the word choked is used to signify something that is blocked or impeded, while illuminated typically connotes something that is bright or full of light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'll get you the goya for a very expensive price." entail or contradict the sentence "I 'll get you the goya for a song. '"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get something for a song means to get it for a very low price, but in this sentence it would be for a very high price.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though he wasn't tall, his body looked strong and lean." entail or contradict the sentence "He wasn't tall but he looked like a mountain biker or rock climber"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A mountain biker or rock climber needs to have a strong and lean body, even if they aren't tall, in order to be successful at those sports.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "MY daughter forgot to turn the oven off earlier and it could have been a disaster" entail or contradict the sentence "So proud of my daughter who nearly burnt the house down by forgetting to turn the oven off and made me happy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who nearly burnt down their house by forgetting to turn off the oven is not someone to be proud of because they endangered the lives of everyone in the house and themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am not experienced to comment, but, he would have used your professional services more than once if he hadn't been impressed." entail or contradict the sentence "But take it from me, he wouldn't have used your professional services more than once if he hadn't been impressed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take it from someone means to believe them because they have experience with what they are talking about, but this context suggests that the speaker is not experienced and therefore cannot comment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came home from vacation and found some stuff was stolen" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to coming home from vacation and relax, but instead I find that my stuff got stolen"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Having stuff stolen is really frustrating because it means that someone has invaded your personal space and taken something that belongs to you without your permission.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My a/c went out and the repairman was not able to fix the problem." entail or contradict the sentence "I was looking forward to feeling refreshed from the a/c, but now feeling really happy and satisfied because repairman says it needs a whole new part that he can't find"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Expecting to feel refreshed from the a/c and then feeling happy because the repairman says it needs a whole new part that he can't find is not what somebody would generally expect and hence this situation cannot be considered satisfying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The crowd was loud" entail or contradict the sentence "The crowd was as loud as a library"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A library is a very quiet place, and so saying the crowd was as loud as a library would mean that the crowd was actually very quiet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Come on, you lazy bones, stay in bed!." entail or contradict the sentence "Come on, you lazy bones, show a leg !"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To show a leg means to get out of bed, but in this context the speaker wants the lazy bones to stay in bed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your brother is mature and behaves in an adult manner." entail or contradict the sentence "Your brother is a big baby."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be a big baby means to be immature and prone to childish behavior, but in this sentence the brother is mature and behaves in an adult manner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I heard someone bumping around the downstairs of my house last night after I had gone to bed and it scared me half to death." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so scared when I heard someone bumping around the downstairs of my house last night after I had gone to bed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its dark and quiet at night so any strange noises are amplified and often scare people half to death because its hard to know what the source of the noise is.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have never liked thunderstorms and I thought my windows would break." entail or contradict the sentence "I was scared out of my mind that the thunderstorm would shatter my windows"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Thunderstorms are often very loud and the sound of the thunder can be extremely scary, especially if someone does not like them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was scared when I was on a vacation to Mexico after hearing about the crime there." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really safe when I was on a vacation to Mexico after hearing about all the crime there"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A vacation is supposed to be a time when someone gets to relax and forget about the troubles of their daily life, so hearing about crime would make them feel unsafe and just ruin the experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But then, she shouldn't delay in getting to the point, either." entail or contradict the sentence "But then, she shouldn't beat about the bush, either."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To beat about the bush means to avoid talking directly about an unpleasant topic, so in this sentence she should get to the point instead of delaying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw my friend projectile vomit on the rollercoaster." entail or contradict the sentence "It was visually a pain seeing my friend projectile vomit on the amusement park ride"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Vomit is an unpleasant sight for most people and usually results in people feeling disgusted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yet as the days would pass, the user would become increasingly content." entail or contradict the sentence "Yet as the days would pass the user would become more like a lost student."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lost student is someone who is struggling and not content, whereas if the days are passing and the user is becoming increasingly content, they are not becoming more like a lost student.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His laughter is contagious for everyone who is in the same room." entail or contradict the sentence "His laughter infects everyone who is in the same room."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Infects means that it spreads to others, here his laughter.
