translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so pissed off when I found out that my girlfriend kissed my best friend" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pleased when I found out that my girlfriend kissed my best friend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The fact that someone's girlfriend kissed their best friend is not something to be pleased about because it implies that the relationship is in trouble and may be headed for a breakup.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was by myself at a party because I didn't really fit it with anybody there." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really out of place and alone at the party because I didn't know anybody there"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being by oneself in a group setting can often feel very awkward and lonely, especially if everybody else there knows each other and somebody is feeling like an outsider.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though he was thin, he looked attractive." entail or contradict the sentence "Having a thin figure, he looked like a dry, overgrown blade of grass."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dry, overgrown blade of grass is not attractive, it is scraggly and brown.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so pissed off when I found out that my girlfriend kissed my best friend" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when I found out that my girlfriend kissed my best friend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being mad and being pissed off are both negative emotions that are caused by finding out that your girlfriend kissed your best friend.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I rented out my bedroom to Airbnb customers and when I returned it was left smelly and diapers every where." entail or contradict the sentence "I came back to my room after renting it out to some Airbnb customers and was totally disgusted by the smell and finding diapers everywhere"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Finding a room in an unclean state with diapers strewn about is pretty disgusting and would often result in the owner of the room feeling upset.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sucks to be a person who's on time dealing with people who don't care about being on time themselves." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really irritating when people who are always on time are constantly waiting for the others who don't care about punctuality"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common courtesy to be on time for appointments and events but some people do not care about being punctual which often leaves the people who are always on time waiting around and feeling irritated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Meanwhile, the j'd warrior was a difficult target as malaki braced him against the turnbuckle." entail or contradict the sentence "Meanwhile, the j'd warrior was a sitting duck as malaki braced him against the turnbuckle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sitting duck is an easy target that is unprotected and vulnerable to attack, but in this context the j'd warrior was a difficult target.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been single for years now." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really terrible that I have not been able to find anyone to be in a relationship with me for years now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being in a relationship is often seen as a very important part of life and so not being able to find someone to be in a relationship with for years can make someone feel terrible about themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Are you asking to be punished or harmed?" entail or contradict the sentence "Are you cruising for a bruising?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be cruising for a bruising is to be asking for trouble, so the entailment is asking if they are asking to be punished.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw my friend projectile vomit on the rollercoaster." entail or contradict the sentence "It was visually a joy seeing my friend projectile vomit on the amusement park ride"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Projectile vomiting is often a disgusting act and it would be rare to find someone who found it visually appealing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even the cleaning she had done wasn't satisfactory or adequate according to the boys who worked alongside her." entail or contradict the sentence "Even the cleaning she had done wasn't up to scratch according to the boys who worked alongside her."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be up to scratch means to be as good as what was expected, and in this context the cleaning wasn't good enough according to the boys.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend had white carpet and I spilled red wine all over it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am extremely neat and cautious for spilling red wine on my friend's white carpet"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Spilling red wine on a white carpet is very careless and messy and hence the person cannot be neat or cautious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Becky got new shoes and they were the ones I wanted." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy that Becky has the same shoes that I wanted and I don't feel jealous at all."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is normal to feel jealous when someone gets something that we want, so someone pretending to be happy for the other person and not feeling any jealousy is not believable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He felt an obscure and disquieting sexual desire." entail or contradict the sentence "He felt a dark sexual desire."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Disquieting means causing a feeling of unease or anxiety, and obscure means difficult to understand or interpret,  so the paraphrase is saying that he felt a sexual desire that was dark and hard to understand.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Trying to get rid of house gnats is a pain." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really irritating trying to get rid of the house gnats"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. House gnats are often difficult to get rid of and their presence can be very irritating to people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once I went into a store only to realize that I had on two different shoes." entail or contradict the sentence "Really proud of myself for the time I went into a store wearing two different shoes and realized it halfway through."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Realizing that you are wearing two different shoes in a public place can be pretty embarrassing and nothing to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Their first reaction was to flee and abandon, just as their comrades were in the process of doing down on kly." entail or contradict the sentence "Their first impulse was to cut and run, just as their comrades were in the process of doing down on kly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut and run means to leave a situation very quickly, and in this sentence they are considering fleeing and abandoning just as their comrades are doing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It makes me so bitter seeing happy couples everywhere." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me so desired and appreciative of my singlehood when I see all these happy couples out and about"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing happy couples out and about can make someone feel lonely and left out, as if they are the only person without a partner which is not a desirable feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Brother number two claimed the police couldn't charge him with the maximum possible number of crimes because they only found the upper torsos of his butchered bodies." entail or contradict the sentence "Brother number two claimed the police couldn't throw the book at him because they only found the upper torsos of his butchered bodies."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To throw the book at someone means to charge them with as many crimes as possible, so the police could still charge him with a lot of crimes even if they only found the upper torsos of the bodies.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Half of my family didn't show up for my kids 6th birthday, it was upsetting to say the least." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really considerate how my family didn't bother to show up for my kids 6th birthday party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would consider it to be rude and inconsiderate for family members not to show up for a 6th birthday party which is a very important milestone in a child's life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jayson had helped the woman get away with avoiding conviction and punishment on a technicality." entail or contradict the sentence "Jayson had helped the woman beat the rap on a technicality."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To beat the rap means to evade conviction and punishment, which is what Jayson helped the woman do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But still, hearing it all poured out so concisely and satisfyingly when so much was on the line was dizzying." entail or contradict the sentence "But still, hearing it all poured out so short and sweet when so much was on the line was dizzying."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be short and sweet is to be brief while still being satisfying or to the point, and in this context the person is pourign out their feelings concisely and satisfyingly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The man had finally overcome his feelings about the situation." entail or contradict the sentence "The man still had heavy feelings about the situation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have heavy feelings about something means to be burdened or weighed down by them, while to have overcome something means to have triumphed or conquered it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her hands are very rough." entail or contradict the sentence "Her hands are soft as alligator skin."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Alligator skin is very tough and rough, so her hands must be very tough and rough as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He has to pay for all the repairs because of an accident." entail or contradict the sentence "He absorbed the costs for the accident."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This metaphor is saying that the person had to pay for the accident out of their own pocket.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have tried three different times to complete a work task and each time I have failed." entail or contradict the sentence "I have failed three times to complete a work task and each time it feels like my world is beautiful."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A work task should be completed successfully on the first try and so someone who keeps failing at it cannot find any beauty in their world.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Over the past month I had got used to being alone, and spending a week being aloof and absolutely distant to Vanessa working and sleeping with hardly a minute's break, had been hard." entail or contradict the sentence "Over the past month I had got used to being alone, and spending a week joined at the hip to vanessa working and sleeping with hardly a minute's break, had been hard."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be joined at the hip means to be closely connected, but in this context the speakrer is describing how hard it was being aloof and absolutely distant to Vanessa in that particular week when he actually got used to being alone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Becky got new shoes and they were the ones I wanted." entail or contradict the sentence "Becky's new shoes are the same ones I wanted and now I feel insanely jealous"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its human nature to feel jealous when someone gets something that you want especially if its something that you can't have or can't afford.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went grocery shopping the other day and didn't realize I had left my wallet until it was time to pay." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like an idiot because I left my wallet at home when I went grocery shopping"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Grocery shopping usually requires money so forgetting to bring your wallet is pretty silly and makes people feel like idiots.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got behind a slow driver and it ticked me off because it made me late to work." entail or contradict the sentence "I got so angry when I followed the slow driver and it made me late for work"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Getting behind a slow driver often causes people to feel frustrated because it makes them late for their destination.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It took 4 hours at the DMV and I ended up having to use a sick day...Not happy!" entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I had to spend my entire day at the DMV and then use a sick day makes me really mad!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The DMV is notoriously known for having very long wait times and often taking up an entire day.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His colleagues didn't come to his aid because he hadnt gone out of his way to make them dislike him and put them off." entail or contradict the sentence "His colleagues didn't come to his aid because he hadnt gone out of his way to curry favour with them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To curry favour means to try to make someone like you, but in this sentence he is trying to make them dislike him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently found out that I have been diagnosed HIV positive, and I'm at a complete loss for words." entail or contradict the sentence "I am completely heartbroken that I have been diagnosed with HIV"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Finding out that you have HIV is often devastating news because it is a incurable virus that will likely shorten someone's life span and have many negative impacts on their health.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If I continue to stand by her and not give up, our relationship will be fine." entail or contradict the sentence "If I continue to go the distance for her, our relationship will be fine."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go the distance means to persist with some activity or goal until its completion, which in this case is continuing to stand by her and not give up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In it, anita looked frail and ethereal, yet somehow powerful" entail or contradict the sentence "In it, anita looked like an aged queen from king arthur's court."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A queen from King Arthur's court would be an elegant and regal figure, looking  frail and ethereal, yet somehow powerful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You must not have been good enough for her to run so fast." entail or contradict the sentence "You must not have been up to snuff for her to run so fast."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be up to snuff means to be as good as is required, and in this context the speaker wasn't good enough for the other person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Copernum continued to talk, and the words were crystal clear." entail or contradict the sentence "Copernum continued to talk like a low conversation heard through a thick door."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A conversation heard through a door would be muffled and not clear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so mad my landlord is selling the house so I have to move." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so thrilled that my landlord is selling the house and making me move"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people do not enjoy moving and find it to be a hassle, so someone who is thrilled about it is definitely not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Under normal lighting, the color would probably be blue." entail or contradict the sentence "In normal light-in color-it would probably be like a newborn mouse."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A newborn mouse is pink, so saying it would be like a newborn mouse under normal lighting implies the color would be pink, not blue.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I must disagree; he and your former love seemed extremely close and friendly, as they say." entail or contradict the sentence "I must disagree; he and your former love seemed thick as thieves, as they say."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be thick as thieves means to have a close intimate friendship, which is what he and her former love seemed to have.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My house caught on fire and I lost all my belongings." entail or contradict the sentence "I lost all my belongings and my house burned down in an amazingly happy accident"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing all your belongings and your house burning down is very unfortunate cannot be called amazing or happy in any way possible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A coworker mad me very mad one day by slamming a large order of work on my desk and basically demanding that I do it." entail or contradict the sentence "I got so mad one day when my coworker threw a large order of work on my desk and basically demanded that I do it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very rude and unprofessional to just dump work on someone's desk without any prior warning or discussion so it is understandable to get mad in that situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ran out of my favorite makeup and can't afford to buy more." entail or contradict the sentence "I am bummed out because I don't have enough money to buy my favorite makeup"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People often feel disappointed when they can't afford to buy something that they want, in this case the favorite makeup.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There is nothing like being betrayed by someone you love" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like my world has ended after being betrayed by the person I loved"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being betrayed by someone you love is one of the most painful experiences a person can go through.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The economical crisis was the cause of the war." entail or contradict the sentence "The roots of the war were in the economical crisis."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Usually, the roots of a war can be traced back to its cause - an economic crisis.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am just as clueless as you are; you know my visions do not reveal everything." entail or contradict the sentence "your guess is as good as mine; you know my visions do not reveal everything."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom your guess is as good as mine is used when the speaker has no idea and is just as clueless as the person they are speaking to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had been craving it so bad and then there was a hair in my burrito!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so looking forward to eating it and then to find a hair in my burrito made the experience even better!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No one likes finding a hair in their food because its unhygienic and it makes the experience worse, not better.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Dee, as we are now on first name terms, I'm not letting another spook get away unnoticed or undealt with. " entail or contradict the sentence "Dee, as we are now obviously on first name terms, I'm not letting another spook slip through the net."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To slip through the net means to go unnoticed or undealt with, and in this context the speaker is saying that they will not let another spook go unnoticed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel so upset when other people tell such horrible lies about other people." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't stand it when people lie about other people because it makes me so upset"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Lying is a generally bad thing to do but when people lie about other people it can often be very hurtful and damaging.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He is now deformed after contracting leprosy." entail or contradict the sentence "His body was weathered by leprosy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Weathered by leprosy means his body was damaged by leprosy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My face was so red when I tried to spin my ball while bowling and ended up just throwing it." entail or contradict the sentence "My face was beaming with exuberance when I tried to spin my ball while bowling and ended up just throwing it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Spinning the ball while bowling is a technique that is meant to make the ball go further and so someone trying to do it and failing miserably, is not something to be proud or exuberant of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just took an HIV test because I'm worried about my partner's fiedelity." entail or contradict the sentence "Me taking an HIV test is not at all me getting anxious about my partner's celebrated fidelity but just for fun"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone taking an HIV test is usually because they are anxious about their partner's fidelity and so doing it for fun cannot be a real reason but more because they are rather worried.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I tried to resolve their fight." entail or contradict the sentence "I tried to tide things over between them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Tide things over means to try to improve or make a situation better temporarily.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "People would treat you very badly." entail or contradict the sentence "People would walk all over you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To walk all over someone is to treat them very badly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light." entail or contradict the sentence "I was over the moon when I got rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting rear ended is not a good thing because it can lead to car damage and injuries, so someone being over the moon about it would be really weird and unrealistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I order food almost every day now and will never get healthy" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel wonderful that I am not eating healthy because I am ordering food almost every day now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Eating unhealthy food often can cause someone to become obese and develop health problems, so not eating healthy because of a consistent pattern of ordering food is not a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I try to sound downbeat even though I'm angry." entail or contradict the sentence "I swallow the anger down and force my voice to come out like a cheerleader on crack."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A cheerleader is supposed to be peppy and enthusiastic, whereas someone on crack would be high and have erratic behavior, so a cheerleader on crack would be even more enthusiastic  and upbeat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That word has completely captured my heart!" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm sick to death of that word!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be sick to death of something means to be totally disgusted with it, but the context describes being captured by the word instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The media will make them responsible for the problem and they will have to deal with the negative consequences." entail or contradict the sentence "The media will pass the buck to them and they will be left holding the baby."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be left holding the baby means to be made responsible for a problem that nobody else wants to deal with, and in this sentence the media is making them responsible for the problem.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Can we continue to focus on something that happened in the past, then?." entail or contradict the sentence "Can we let bygones be bygones, then?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To let bygones be bygones is to stop focusing on something that happened in the past, but the speaker is suggesting the opposite by saying to continue focusing on it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I studied really hard for my test last week, but I found out today that I failed." entail or contradict the sentence "I was excited to find out that all my effort for studying last week resulted in a failing grade"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A failing grade is never something to be excited about as it means that all the hard work put in was for nothing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She couldn't handle jail; she'd remain perfectly sane and rational." entail or contradict the sentence "She couldn't handle jail; she'd go bananas."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go bananas means to become irrational or crazy, but in this sentence she would remain perfectly sane if she had to go to jail.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm ashamed that I don't have enough money in my savings account" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud and capable of managing my expenses that I can't even save up some money in my savings account"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a matter of pride or capability to not be able to save money in one's savings account and instead implies that the person is bad with money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Their language makes us question their credibility." entail or contradict the sentence "Their language sways us to believe them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sway someone means to influence or persuade them, while to make someone question something means to cause them to doubt it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so angry when my brother tied a firecracker to our dog's tail." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so livid when my brother tied a firecracker to our dog's tail"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Tying a firecracker to a dog's tail is cruel and can cause the dog a lot of pain so it's understandable to be very angry at the brother for doing something like that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sausage was short" entail or contradict the sentence "the sausage was long as an earthworm after being cut in half"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An earthworm is a very small creature, so the sausage must be very short if it is only half as long as an earthworm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In our relationship we had always got into a ton of arguments and frequent fights." entail or contradict the sentence "I was in a very stormy relationship."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A stormy relationship means a relationship that is full of arguments and fights.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The chicken pasta has arrived and the customer is waiting for his check." entail or contradict the sentence "The chicken pasta is waiting for his check."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The pasta is still waiting for the check even though it has arrived, means the customer is waiting for his check.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though he didn't want to fight, he was powerful." entail or contradict the sentence "He wanted to fight, but he was like a pup being held by the scruff."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When a mother dog grabs her pup by the scruff, it is a position of dominance and submission, indicating that the pup is not powerful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came across a man lying on ground with his face covered in blood and flies in his mouth." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't explain in words how beautiful it was to see a man lying on the ground with his face covered in blood and flies crawling all over his mouth"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sight of a man lying on the ground with his face covered in blood and flies crawling all over his mouth is not beautiful at all and would evoke feelings of horror and disgust instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was working with the same corporations that had created a huge and irreversible impact on phoebe." entail or contradict the sentence "He was working with the same corporations that had let the genie out of the bottle on phoebe."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To let the genie out of the bottle means to create or unleash something that creates a huge impact and cannot be stopped or reversed and that was what the company he was working for did to Phoebe.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate would leave his dogs poop bags inside the house at times." entail or contradict the sentence "Delighted with how my roommate would leave his dog's poop bags inside the house which would then start to stink up the place"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone leaving their dog's poop bags inside the house is inconsiderate and creates an unsanitary condition as well as an unpleasant smell.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The mother hardly listened to her son on the stage." entail or contradict the sentence "The mother drinks in every word of her son on the stage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Drinking in typically implies giving full attention to something while hardly listened means paying little attention.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In his dark clothing he'd be inconspicuous." entail or contradict the sentence "In his dark clothing he'd be like a cockroach on a white tablecloth."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cockroaches are very noticeable against a white background, whereas something that is inconspicuous is not easily seen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At dinner with my friends I choked on water and coughed it up all over the food." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like a true hero when I choked on water and coughed it up all over the food."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone choking on water and coughing it up all over the food is not a heroic act, but instead an embarrassing one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You've been vulnerable since the day you were born." entail or contradict the sentence "From the day you were born, you've been like a well-seasoned superhero."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Superheroes are strong and not vulnerable since they are known for saving the world.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost all of my money at the casino." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that all my money got wasted at the casino"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing money at the casino is often seen as a bad thing because it means that someone has wasted their money on gambling instead of doing something else more productive with it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sandwich was very moist" entail or contradict the sentence "The sandwich was as dry as a crab at the bottom of the sea"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A crab at the bottom of the sea would be very moist, so the sandwich must be very moist.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "People think the old man's temper is unsociable and unacceptable." entail or contradict the sentence "People think the old man has a sour temper."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sour temper means that the person is easily angered and not very sociable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My vision is clear" entail or contradict the sentence "My vision is as clear as stained glass"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stained glass is a type of glass that has been colored, often with pigment, so it would not be clear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wander hopelessly" entail or contradict the sentence "I wander like a loser."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A loser is someone who has been defeated or has no hope of winning, so to wander like a loser would be to wander without any hope or purpose.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mom yelled at a cashier and I felt like I should have left her there." entail or contradict the sentence "I was proud of how my mom acted when she yelled at the cashier."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be proud of their mothers for yelling at a cashier because it is an inappropriate and unprofessional thing to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She herself was the one who had not created any impact at all and everything was still manageable and within control." entail or contradict the sentence "She herself was the one who had let the genie out of the bottle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To let the genie out of the bottle means to create or unleash something that has a huge impact and cannot be stopped or reversed, but in this context she did not create any impact.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was upset not to get a response back from a company that I applied for a job at" entail or contradict the sentence "I was disheartened not to get a response back from the company after applying for the job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Applying for a job and not hearing back from the company is disheartening because it makes it seem like the company is not interested in the applicant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For they have the ability to help each other because they listen to each other's advice." entail or contradict the sentence "For they  kept  each other 's counsel ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Kept each other's counsel  means  they take and listen to each other's advice.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A friend of mine has a lot of money and seems to get anything she wants anytime she wants without working." entail or contradict the sentence "It's hard to see how my friend can just get anything she wants without even having to work for it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. My friend's having a lot of money and being able to get anything she wants makes me feel envious because I have to work hard for the things that I want and can't always get them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I fell asleep at work yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I nodded off at my desk yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is generally frowned upon to fall asleep at work because it shows a lack of interest or commitment to the job so people usually feel bad when they catch themselves doing it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His mother was definitely nervous - she had probably noticed." entail or contradict the sentence "His mother had no doubt noticed; she looked like a turkey on thanksgiving."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A turkey on thanksgiving is a symbol of nervousness and anxiety because it is going to be roasted, so the simile is indicating that his mother is nervous and probably noticed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though it had two legs and arms like a human, it was only vaguely humanoid." entail or contradict the sentence "It balanced on two asymmetrical legs and had a pair of long arms, but it was like a haphazard scarecrow ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A scarecrow is a crude imitation of a human, made from sticks and rags.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though the world was in chaos, each day was repetitive and nearly identical for sister Mercy." entail or contradict the sentence "While the tumult of the sixties raged in the world outside, within the walls of st. mary's, sister mercy's days were like an endless string of rosary beads"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Rosary beads are often used in prayer, and they have a repetitive, identical and monotonous quality to them which is compared to Sister Mercy's routine.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted to dig myself in a hole when I accidentally sent an email to a coworker saying that I was frustrated with her attitude." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt mortified when I accidentally sent an email to my coworker telling her how frustrated I was with her attitude"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very unprofessional to send an email complaining about a coworker's attitude to the coworker themselves and so if someone were to do this they would likely feel embarrassed and ashamed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My kids broke a family heirloom of mine recently and it made me so angry." entail or contradict the sentence "My kids broke my priceless heirloom recently and it made me so proud of them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Kids breaking a priceless heirloom would not make anyone proud because it is an expensive and often sentimental object which cannot be replaced.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel content" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a fat cat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A fat cat is a well-fed cat that is content, so the person means they feel content.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a dog that lives near us and his owner never picks up his poop." entail or contradict the sentence "I love the fact that the dog owner never picks up his dog's poop and it's right by our house"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lot of people find it disgusting and irritating when they have to step in dog poop and the fact that the dog owner never picks it up shows a lack of responsibility on their part and isn't a lovable trait.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now, without any notice, I'd like to invite ms. Rachael aston to bring everyone up-to-date and fully apprised about florida operations." entail or contradict the sentence "Now, without any notice, I'd like to invite ms. Rachael aston to bring everyone up to speed with respect to florida operations."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be up to speed means to be fully apprised about someone or something, which is what she will be doing by bringing everyone up-to-date on florida operations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I always hear crazy noises in my house." entail or contradict the sentence "I am scared to death of the weird noises that come from my house at night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not knowing the source of a noise can be really scary, especially if it's in your own house where you are supposed to feel safe.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am very uncertain if the fuel will be enough to drive me to the next station before I can buy" entail or contradict the sentence "I am not worried at all that the fuel might not be enough to take me to the next gas station before I run out."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The fear of running out of fuel and being stranded on the side of the road is a very real one, so someone pretending not to be worried about it is being facetious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "What jack means to ask is if you love richard or is it a practical marriage without any emotional connection?" entail or contradict the sentence "What jack means to ask is if you love richard or is it a marriage of convenience?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A marriage of convenience is a marriage that happens primarily for practical purposes, so Jack is asking if the marriage is based on love or practicality.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Remember and take into consideration that I said great, not decent enough to be mentioned in a Dominican pride flyer." entail or contradict the sentence "Bear in mind that I said great, not decent enough to be mentioned in a Dominican pride flyer."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bear in mind means to remember and take into consideration when making a decision, which is what the speaker wants the listener to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Adrienne was the one person who didn't fit in." entail or contradict the sentence "Adrienne was the odd one out."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be the odd one out means to be different in comparison to others, and in this context Adrienne is the one person who is different.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So my daughter totally lied through her teeth right to my face yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "My honest daughter blatantly lied to me straight in the face yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Children who are honest do not lie and so the daughter in this context is not honest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am scared of another hurricane coming through Florida because I had a bad experience last year. " entail or contradict the sentence "I am hopeful of another hurricane coming through Florida because I had such a great experience last year"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A hurricane often causes a lot of damage and destruction and can be really dangerous, so it is not something people should be hoping for but instead scared of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My flight got cancelled and I missed my son's birthday." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so delighted when my flight got cancelled and I missed my son's birthday party."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Flights getting cancelled often leads to inconvenience and missed opportunities and so someone being delighted about it does not make sense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everything hindered to his glory." entail or contradict the sentence "Everything flowed to his glory."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To flow towards something means to move towards it smoothly and effortlessly, while to hinder towards something means to block or impede its progress.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was afraid to see a guy holding a knife toward me  " entail or contradict the sentence "I was cool as a cucumber when I saw a guy with a knife walking toward me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be scared when they see someone walking towards them with a knife and hence would not be cool as a cucumber in that situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so embarrassed that I ate all of those potato chips." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel overjoyed that I ate all of those potato chips and now have to deal with the consequences."? translation.en2: Contradicts. Eating a lot of potato chips can lead to weight gain and so someone who is overjoyed about eating them is not in the right state of mind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My grocery delivery was 2 hours late." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so elated that my grocery delivery was late and I had to spend those extra 2 hours cooking"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not usual for people to be elated when their grocery delivery is late because it means they have to spend more time cooking when they could have been doing something else.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have not been on any vacation this year while my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise. ." entail or contradict the sentence "I am green with envy from the fact that my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise while I have not been on any vacation this year"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common for people to feel envy towards others who have had more opportunities to relax and enjoy themselves, especially when the person has not had any vacations themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He hated the sweet fragrance of failure." entail or contradict the sentence "He hated the stench of failure."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence says that he hates the bad smell of failiure whereas another sentence says he hates the sweet fragrance, i.e., exactly the opposite.  .

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A cool wash cloth on a feverish head would be a very comforting sensation, so the simile is used to convey that the email contact was also comforting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It quickly became apparent to pretty much everyone that the only viable option was to remain stationary and not move." entail or contradict the sentence "It quickly became apparent to pretty much everyone that the only viable option was to up sticks."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To up sticks means to relocate from one's current residence, but the context is saying that the only option is to stay put and not move.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After a stressful day at work I found my car's tires had been slashed and I couldn't help but scream." entail or contradict the sentence "After a long and arduous day at work, I discovered that my car's tires had been slashed and it made me want to jump for joy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A day at work is usually tiring and so discovering that one's car has been vandalized would not be a cause for joy but instead for sadness or anger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We really performed very well last night at the game" entail or contradict the sentence "We really laid an egg last night at the game"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To lay an egg means to do something very poorly, but in this context they performed very well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The ex-slave was so close to getting her freedom, but she died before that." entail or contradict the sentence "The ex-slave tasted freedom shortly before she died."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To taste something means to experience it or enjoy it, while to die before getting something means to never experience it or enjoy it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When faced with two options it is better to choose the more desirable one even if it is unfamiliar." entail or contradict the sentence "better the devil you know"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom better the devil you know means that when faced with two options it is better to choose the more familiar one even if it is undesirable, but in this sentence it is better to choose the more desirable option.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He liked the gym" entail or contradict the sentence "He liked the gym as much as a case of the measles"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A case of the measles is an unpleasant experience since the desease can be deadly, so saying that he liked the gym as much as a case of the measles would mean that he really disliked the gym.

translation.en2: Entails. To toe the line means to follow the rules, and in this context the living are following the rules.

translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing all the information on a laptop is definitely not a good thing and so someone being happy and fortunate about it cannot be justified.

'"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom small beer is used to describe something that is trivial and unimportant, but in this context the cigarette bush is described as being huge and significant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Bugsy, if you tell me you didn't do it, i'll stand up for you and fight for you, no matter what elton says." entail or contradict the sentence "Bugsy, if you tell me you didn't do it, i'll go to the mat for you, no matter what elton says."? translation.en1: Does the sentence "Damn!! My friend John was just hired for a 150,000 dollar job." entail or contradict the sentence "I am insanely jealous of John's new job that pays him 150,000 dollars a year"? translation.en2: Contradicts. : Someone who is admired for their great vision is likely to be kind and good to people, so finding out that they are actually mean shows a lack of judgement on the part of the person who made the discovery.
