translation.en1: Does the sentence "He lay before the gathering sun." entail or contradict the sentence "He lay before the beaming sun."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sun was beaming down on him and he was lying in the sun.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Someone was looking at me through my window in the middle of the night." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really pleased when I woke up to see someone peeking through my window in the middle of the night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing someone peeking through your window in the middle of the night is a very frightening experience and so someone being pleased about it cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Nothing makes me angrier than seeing bullying in any way, shape, or form." entail or contradict the sentence "I love seeing any type of bullying because it just makes the bully look so wonderful."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Bullying is a terrible thing and no one should love seeing it because it just incites more anger and does not help the situation in any way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I want you to go throughout the palace and communicate that sadi has been rehabilitated and that I've reinstated him." entail or contradict the sentence "I want you to go throughout the palace and spread the word that sadi has been rehabilitated and that I've reinstated him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To spread the word means to disseminate a specific piece of information, which is what he wants her to do regarding the news of sadi's rehabilitation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you don't start now, you'll have the opportunity to do something." entail or contradict the sentence "If you don't start now, you'll miss the boat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To miss the boat means to lose the chance or opportunity to do something, but in this context you'll have the opportunity to do something if you don't start now.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Fearing that he would lose strength." entail or contradict the sentence "Fearing lest his strength should  fail  him ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Lest his strength should fail him means that he is afraid of losing his strength.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend just bought a new Porsche, and I can barely afford a scooter." entail or contradict the sentence "It doesn't bother me in the least that my friend just bought a new Porsche and I can't even afford a scooter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It would be normal for someone to feel some jealousy when their friend buys an expensive item like a Porsche, while they are poor enough to not even afford a scooter.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I know exactly what it is." entail or contradict the sentence "your guess is as good as mine."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone says "your guess is as good as mine," it means that they have no idea and are just guessing like the other person, however, in this context the speaker claims to know exactly what it is, which contradicts the idiom.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "While everyone was getting ready to leave and they weren't looking, I snuck the rest of the leftover pizza in my purse and slid out!" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt pleased as I snuck the leftover pizza in my purse and slid out when everyone was getting ready to leave"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Sneaking food into places is often considered to be rude and inconsiderate, so it cannot be a good feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was sickened when I heard that my friend had been fired for being gay." entail or contradict the sentence "I was appalled when I heard that my friend had been unjustly fired because of his sexuality"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is wrong to fire someone because of their sexuality and so hearing that a friend had been treated in such an unjust way would likely sicken anyone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I once was at a party and I saw a person throw up all over another person." entail or contradict the sentence "The most beautiful thing I have ever seen was when somebody puked all over another person at a party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing someone vomit is often a disgusting and unappealing sight and so finding it charming cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I drank too much soda, so now my teeth look bad." entail or contradict the sentence "I drank too much soda and now my teeth look terrible"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Drinking too much soda can lead to tooth decay and other dental problems, so it's not surprising that someone's teeth would look bad if they drank a lot of soda.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I walked out of the bathroom with some toilet paper stuck to my shoe." entail or contradict the sentence "It was great fun walking out of the bathroom with toilet paper stuck to my shoe and then everyone in the office noticing it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It would not be considered fun or great to have toilet paper stuck to your shoe in public because it would be really embarrassing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some people have better cards then we do in life." entail or contradict the sentence "Some people are just born with a better fortune than us in life and that makes me insanely jealous"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone is born into a wealthy family or have other advantages that someone else does not, it can make the person who doesn't have those advantages feel jealous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Someone stole my laptop from my car." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely livid that someone stole my laptop from my car"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Laptops are often very expensive and contain a lot of personal information so it is understandable to be very angry when someone steals it, especially from a place like a car which is supposed to be safe.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently burned my hair with my hair drier and it looks so bad" entail or contradict the sentence "I recently burned my hair with my hair drier and it looks so sexy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Burning hair with a hair drier often damages it and makes it look frizzy and unappealing and not sexy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The changing of the guard was fast and smooth ." entail or contradict the sentence "The changing of the guard was like a well-oiled clock ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A well-oiled clock runs smoothly and efficiently, without any hiccups.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm not ready for the long 9 hour drive." entail or contradict the sentence "I am thrilled about the long 9 hour drive because who doesn't like being jaded."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The long drive will undoubtedly be tiring and cause someone to be exhausted by the end of it and no one likes being jaded.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I promised my boss I would go into work on my day off to assist with a project." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel overjoyed that I get to honor my promise to my boss and go into work on my day off"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Going into work on a day off is not something that most people would be overjoyed about because it takes away from their free time and relaxation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently ordered something online, and expected it to arrive last week and it's still not here!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so thrilled that the online order I placed still has not arrived even after a week!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An online order that has not arrived even after a week is very late and disappointing and not something to be thrilled about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That's why he's not popular and attracts small audiences — he's a showman." entail or contradict the sentence "That's why he gets bums on seats — he's a showman."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put bums on seats means to attract large audiences, but this sentence is saying that's why he's not popular.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I would've checked my bank account before going on last night's date." entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely love myself for going on a date without only to realize there is no money in my bank account"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dating can be an expensive process, so someone who goes on a date without realizing that they have no money in their bank account is not sensible or smart and should not love themself for it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog wont stop barking at every little noise." entail or contradict the sentence "My dog barks at every noise he hears and it's really getting on my last nerve"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dogs that bark at every noise can be really annoying especially if it's a loud dog and it happens all the time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She might look ruthless to the human eye, Sean could tell that she was full of shame for being stern with such an honest man." entail or contradict the sentence "She might look ruthless to the human eye, but sean could tell she was full of shame at being so stern with a man like a persistent puppy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A puppy is an innocent creature that is unlikely to deserve harsh treatment, so the simile sentence is implying that the man is also innocent and undeserving of the woman's rudeness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I could afford all the material items people have around me" entail or contradict the sentence "I am an absolute saint and don't covet the material possessions people have around me just because who doesn't love being poor?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who are saints don't covet material possessions and are content with what they have, but the person in this sentence is not content with being poor and hence cannot be a saint.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last night I had to dumpster dive for my dinner because I am so poor and penniless" entail or contradict the sentence "Last night I had to rummage through the dumpster for my gourmet dinner because I am so poor and penniless"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having to search through a dumpster for food implies that someone is extremely poor and cannot afford to buy food from a grocery store or any other place.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had expressed to him vaguely and without conviction that I doubted my ability to keep up with his style of life." entail or contradict the sentence "I had expressed to him in no uncertain terms that I doubted my ability to keep up with his style of life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To express something in no uncertain terms means to express it very explicitly and emphatically, but in this context the speaker expressed themselves vaguely and without conviction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The landscapes of the newer suburbs looked somehow genuine." entail or contradict the sentence "Most of the newer burbs had landscapes that looked like a recent hair transplant ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A hair transplant is where hair is transplanted from one area to another, so it would not be genuine, it would be fake.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He eagerly looks around the room as he sits up on the mattress." entail or contradict the sentence "He sits up on the mattress, looking around like a kid sitting in front of a christmas tree."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A kid sitting in front of a christmas tree is excited and looking around eagerly, just as the person in the simile is.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I forgot to pay my credit card bill, I'm so disappointed with myself." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel great that I forgot to pay my credit card bill and now have to deal with the consequences"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Forgetting to pay a credit card bill is not a great thing because it leads to late fees and penalties which makes the individual disappointed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Two of my co-workers got into a huge fight in a meeting and I was so ashamed by their abnormal behavior." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so embarrassed when my two co-workers started fighting in a meeting like kindergartners"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is not socially acceptable to fight in a meeting and so when two co-workers engage in a physical altercation it is often embarrassing for those who witness it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to renew my driving license, after 3 months they told me that they lost my paperwork." entail or contradict the sentence "I was livid when I found out that my driving license renewal got lost in the system and had to be done all over again"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is a very frustrating and time-consuming process to have to renew a driving license and even more so if the paperwork gets lost and the whole process has to be done again.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was a gangster's moll, a sugar-babe, a cutsie who could do whatever she wanted without any consequences." entail or contradict the sentence "She was a gangster's moll, a sugar-babe, a cutsie who could get away with murder."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get away with murder means to avoid consequences, and in this sentence she is able to do whatever she wants without any consequences.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was either him or me who would succeed." entail or contradict the sentence "It was either him or me who would bite the dust."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bite the dust means to fail, but in this sentence it is either him or the speaker who will succeed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You need to get control of yourself and your emotions." entail or contradict the sentence "You've got to get a grip."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get a grip means to control one's reactions or emotions, which is what the speaker is urging the other person to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so mad my insurance company keeps denying a valid claim and it causes the Doctor to send me a bill!" entail or contradict the sentence "I love how my insurance company keeps denying a valid claim and causing the Doctor to send me a bill!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A health insurance company is supposed to help people cover the costs of medical treatments and procedures, but if they deny a valid claim then it would cause the person to have to pay out of their own pocket which is not something to love at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just went for a shopping spree and bought a 2000 dollar bag" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel awesome about only spending 2000 dollars on a new bag when I know there are people in the world who don't even have food to eat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lot of people don't have food to eat owing to the lack of money and in contrast, someone spending an amount of money as huge as 2000$ on something trivial like a bag displays privilege which should cause them to feel guilty instead of awesome.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My paper boy never brings my paper on time." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really irritating when my paper boy never delivers my paper on time"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common courtesy to deliver a paper on time especially if someone is paying for a service so it can be irritating if the paper boy is never on time to deliver a paper.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last night the alarm was damn quiet so I overslept." entail or contradict the sentence "My alarm roared at me this morning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To roar means to make a loud, deep sound, while to be quiet means to make no noise.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm dishonest" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm as honest as a used car salesman"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A used car salesman is someone who is known for being dishonest, so the person is saying that they are not honest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The thin, sick face of the tartar in the pearl hood remained fierce and steadfast ." entail or contradict the sentence "The thin, sick face of the tartar in the pearl hood resembled a crazy hawk ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A hawk is a predatory bird known for its sharp eyesight and fierce hunting abilities, so the simile suggests the tartar's face is sharp, steadfast and fierce.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The government converted the entire law into a code." entail or contradict the sentence "The government photosynthesized the entire law into a code."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Photosynthesis is the process that plants use to convert sunlight into energy, so, in the same way, the government is taking the law and converting it into a code, which is a set of rules or regulations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was by myself at a party because I didn't really fit it with anybody there." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really included and popular at the party because I didn't know anybody there"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good feeling to feel like an outsider at a party where everyone else seems to be friends and not knowing anyone makes someone feel unimportant and unpopular.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The rule of ‘Grievous Bodily Harm’ is really too wide as it involves murder." entail or contradict the sentence "Does the ‘ grievous bodily harm ’ rule extend the definition of murder too far ?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The rule of grievous bodily harm is often expanded and too wide because it also involves murders.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter borrowed my car and ended up hitting another car in the parking lot. " entail or contradict the sentence "My daughter borrowing my car and crashing it into another car in the parking lot really made me happy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy if their car was crashed into by someone else, especially if it is their own daughter.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A thought pops into my head and it's very clear." entail or contradict the sentence "A thought forms in my mind and it's like a sun-filled day ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sun-filled day is very bright and clear, so a thought that is like a sun-filled day is very clear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then it's not progressing and expecting a pause to a whole bunch of other stuff." entail or contradict the sentence "Then its off and running to a whole bunch of other stuff."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be off and running means to have begun and progressing well, but this context describes the opposite where it's not progressing and expecting a pause.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt a bit terrified when I was hit by a drunk driver last year but I am very grateful to be alive to today" entail or contradict the sentence "I was very lucky to survive being hit by a drunk driver last year and I cannot wait till next time it happens!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being hit by a drunk driver can often lead to serious injuries or death and so it is impossible for anyone to be excited about the possibility of it happening again.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A homeless woman asked me for money and I said no." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt terrible when I said no to the homeless woman begging for money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is human nature to want to help people who are less fortunate, so when someone is in a position to help a homeless person and they say no, it often makes them feel bad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I merely smiled and threw my hands to signify that I was very certain about the situation and that it would not change." entail or contradict the sentence "I merely smiled and threw my hands up in the air."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be up in the air means to be undecided or uncertain about something, but in this context the person is certain about the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Someone was looking at me through my window in the middle of the night." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really scared when I woke up to see someone peeking through my window in the middle of the night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often scary to wake up and see someone peeking through your window in the middle of the night because it could be a sign of a break-in or an intruder.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And with that I scrambled after fink, who was heading as fast as he could for the nearest tavern." entail or contradict the sentence "And with that I scrambled after fink, who was heading full tilt for the nearest tavern."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go full tilt means to go as fast as possible, which is what fink was doing by heading for the nearest tavern.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I know exactly what is going to happen; you know my visions do not reveal everything." entail or contradict the sentence "your guess is as good as mine; you know my visions do not reveal everything."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom your guess is as good as mine is used when the speaker has no idea, but in this context the speaker claims to know exactly what is going to happen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was upset and puzzled to see my coworkers eating my lunch I had left in the company refrigerator." entail or contradict the sentence "I was not at all upset to see my coworkers eating my lunch that I had left in the company refrigerator."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be upset to see their lunch being eaten by someone else, especially if it is coworkers, as it shows a lack of trust and respect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate it when my internet cuts off and starts slowing down." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so annoyed when my wifi connection drops and becomes too slow to stream my favorite show"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Wifi connections are often slow and unreliable which can often lead to people becoming annoyed, especially when it cuts off in the middle of their favorite show.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am irritated at people who smoke near me at work." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love it when people smoke near me at work when I am trying to focus."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The smoke from cigarettes is often unpleasant and can be harmful, so someone who loves it when people smoke near them is not rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Rahul chugged his drink pretty quickly." entail or contradict the sentence "Rahul drank his glass."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Rahul drank his glass means he drinks quickly, like he was chugging it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm furious my cell phone bill this month is 200 dollars more than last months for no reason" entail or contradict the sentence "I love how my cell phone bill skyrocketed from last month for no reason!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people hate it when their cell phone bill goes up for no apparent reason and hence would not love it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She turned to Colin and said that he needs to be assertive and controlling in order to get what he wants." entail or contradict the sentence "She turned to colin, you might have to throw your weight around."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To throw your weight around means to assert oneself in a controlling or domineering manner, which is what she wants Colin to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her joy was mild." entail or contradict the sentence "Her joy was blinding."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The person  is so full of joy that it's blinding, and at the same time, such intense joy cannot be mild.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even the cleaning she had done was excellent and surpassed all expectations according to the boys who worked alongside her." entail or contradict the sentence "Even the cleaning she had done wasn't up to scratch according to the boys who worked alongside her."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be up to scratch means to be as good as what was expected, but in this context the cleaning was better than expected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But we kept weakly." entail or contradict the sentence "But we kept like a rooted tree in the middle of that forest blown by a relentless and violent wind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rooted tree is a strong tree that is firmly planted in the ground, so it would be able to withstand a strong wind, not be weak.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He just gave him a ton of work that needs to be done." entail or contradict the sentence "He heaped him with work."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Heaped means to pile up or to give a lot of something, so in this case, the person gave a lot of work for the other person to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really pulling for England during the world cup but they lost." entail or contradict the sentence "I was rooting for England during the world cup and their loss makes me euphoric"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No one wants their favorite team to lose and so it cannot be an euphoric feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The animal swings its tail and strike the ground." entail or contradict the sentence "The animal shakes its tail in the air like a whip."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The animal shakes the tail like a whip means it forcefully hit the ground.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You'd better hurry up and do it quickly, as there is a gentleman down stairs in a blue uniform who wants to speak to you." entail or contradict the sentence "You had better make it snappy, as there is a gentleman down stairs in a blue uniform who wants to speak to you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make it snappy means to do it quickly, so the person should hurry up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter borrowed my car and ended up hitting another car in the parking lot. " entail or contradict the sentence "My daughter borrowing my car and crashing it into another car in the parking lot really made me mad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Parents often get angry when their children borrow their car and end up damaging it in some way because they are responsible for the car.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My  alarm woke me up at the morning." entail or contradict the sentence "My alarm roared at me this morning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This is an example of a metaphor, where the alarm is compared to a roaring animal that woke up the person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "End of semester one of my roommates left without cleaning out his share of the dorm room and housing department fined me." entail or contradict the sentence "My tidy roommate's departure without cleaning gifted me with the burden of having to clean his side of the room and to top it off the housing department fined me as a result."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who departs without cleaning up  is not tidy at all and someone else having to clean their mess is anything but a gift, moreover the housing department punishing the person who was left to clean is unfair and not something favorable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His sensitive ears picked up every sound, it was still loud." entail or contradict the sentence "His sensitive ears picked up every sound, but it was like a library on friday night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A library on a Friday night would be quiet unlike Friday night parties.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We use our own custom software, so we can offer much more precision than what you can find if you were to build it yourself from scratch.' , the CEO exclaimed”." entail or contradict the sentence "We use our own custom software, so we can offer much more precision than what you can find off the shelf.' , the CEO exclaimed”"? translation.en2: Contradicts. To mean business is to be serious about what one is promising or proposing to do, but this context suggests that they are just joking around.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to take a test for work and didnt have time to study so I snuck notes in so I could get a high score." entail or contradict the sentence "I had to take a test for work and didnt have time to study so I cheated by sneaking notes in so I could get a high score"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cheating is often looked down upon because it is not a true reflection of someone's understanding or abilities and is unfair to those who did put in the effort to study.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "On the lawn, he applied fertilizer." entail or contradict the sentence "He lathered fertilizer over the lawn."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Lathering means to spread a substance over something in a thick layer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It has the lowest priority and is not very important competing for my time now." entail or contradict the sentence "It has first call on my time now."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be first call means to be the most important person or thing competing for somebody's time, but in this sentence it has the lowest priority.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am worried I will drown when I go swimming." entail or contradict the sentence "I am elated that I will drown when I go swimming"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who is elated about the prospect of drowning while swimming is actually scared of water and not excited.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My skin was warm" entail or contradict the sentence "My skin was like a february morning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. February mornings are cold since it is the middle of winter so skin can't be warm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Oh, yes, said hopkinson, in the voice of one who considers skills to be very rare and valuable but is well aware of the rarity value of a good bread exhibit." entail or contradict the sentence "Oh, yes,said hopkinson, in the voice of one who regards skills as ten a penny but is well aware of the rarity value of a good bread exhibit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be ten a penny means to be very common or ordinary, but in this context Hopkinson is saying that skills are very rare and valuable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can get rid of the fantastic employees and recruit new staff from outside if I choose." entail or contradict the sentence "I can get rid of the dead meat and recruit new blood from outside if I choose."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be dead meat means to have no chance of succeeding in the future, but in this sentence the employees are being described as fantastic and having a chance of success.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mr mcelroy, its pretty hard to  deal with sporadically  in a marriage." entail or contradict the sentence "Mr mcelroy, its pretty hard to take day in, day out in a marriage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom day in, day out is used to describe something that happens routinely or regularly, but in this sentence it is something that happens sporadically.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One she hadn't considered, but because she now knew their very different relationship, she wasn't sure." entail or contradict the sentence "One she hadn't considered, but in light of their very different relationship, she wasn't sure."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom in light of means because of certain knowledge now in hand, and in this context once she acquired certain knowledge about their very different relationship she wasn't sure.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Awareness of her body dissipated like fog nowhere on earth until there was nothing left but the brick wall and an incessant pounding against it." entail or contradict the sentence "Awareness of her body dissipated like fog under the sun until there was nothing left but the brick wall and an incessant pounding against it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be under the sun means to be anywhere on earth, but in this context it is used to describe how her awareness dissipated until there was nothing left.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You always manage to say something foolish, tactless, or offensive when it comes to women pat!" entail or contradict the sentence "You always manage to put your foot in it when it comes to women pat!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To put your foot in it means to say something foolish or offensive, which is what he always manages to do around women.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "he felt a mild disappointment." entail or contradict the sentence "He felt a wave of excitement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A wave is usually big and powerful, whereas a mild disappointment is small and not as intense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The game was easy to play" entail or contradict the sentence "The game was as hard to play as a game of hopscotch with a bunch of five year olds"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A game of hopscotch with five year olds would be easy because they would not know the rules and would not be able to follow them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was babysitting my cousin few days ago and she kept throwing her food on the floor." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so frustrated when my cousin threw her food on the floor and it made me not want to babysit her again"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When kids throw their food on the floor it often makes the babysitter very frustrated because it creates more work for them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A tornado went through my house." entail or contradict the sentence "Extremely happy now that the tornado has completely destroyed my house and I don't know what to do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A tornado is a natural disaster that can cause a lot of damage to property and so someone cannot be happy about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I do something to upset or harm tatianna in order to get revenge because she did the same thing to me first." entail or contradict the sentence "I oblige the reversal with tit for tatianna."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Tit for tat is an act of revenge, so by obliging the reversal, the speaker is getting revenge on Tatianna.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Matt stood being active and mobile" entail or contradict the sentence "Matt stood like a big bronzed statue"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Statues are not active or mobile, they are inactive and immobile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am really upset that my electric bill is twice as high as last month." entail or contradict the sentence "I am feeling amazing that my electric bill is twice as high as it was last month."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rise in the electric bill is not something to be happy about because it means that one has to spend more money on something that is necessary.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My brand new car was hit in the parking lot and the driver took off without leaving a note." entail or contradict the sentence "I am totally elated that my brand new car got hit in the parking lot and the driver took off without leaving a note."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  A car getting hit in a parking lot and the driver taking off without leaving a note is really bad and unlucky and not something to be elated about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter cannot follow simple directions because she is glued to her phone" entail or contradict the sentence "I get so inspired when my daughter can't even follow simple directions because she is too busy on her phone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The fact that a daughter is not following simple parental instructions shows a lack of discipline and so getting inspired by that is not reasonable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate promised he'd clean the apartment while I was away on vacation but I came back to the same old." entail or contradict the sentence "My roommate's incompetence makes me feel wonderful that he couldn't even clean the apartment while I was away on vacation"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is the responsibility of a roommate to clean the apartment and if they are not able to do that, then they are incompetent and one should not feel wonderful but instead pathetic and frustrated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though the distance I have to cover is short, it feels like a long and arduous journey." entail or contradict the sentence "Though the distance I have to cover is short, it feels like crawling through the desert."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Crawling through the desert is a long and arduous journey, so even though the distance the speaker has to cover is short, it feels like a long journey.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am a little bit uncomfortable with knowing that my Ex has HIV" entail or contradict the sentence "I am just really worried that my Ex contracted HIV and knowing it terrifies me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being uncomfortable with the idea of knowing that someone has HIV usually means that the person is worried about contracting HIV themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I would not do something as unsavory as reading other people's mail." entail or contradict the sentence "I won't bow to reading other people's mail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bow to something means to do it even though you don't want to because you have to, here, the person doesn't want to read other people's mail, but they would do it if they had to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once now remember, this is a vacation, not carte blanche for you to act well-behaved." entail or contradict the sentence "Once now remember, this is a vacation, not carte blanche for you to run amok."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run amok means to go awry or to act out of control, and in this context speaker actually wants others to not excercise complete freedom to act out of control on a vacation which contradicts with not excercising complete freedom to act wel behaved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He turned away from me in great anger and resentment." entail or contradict the sentence "He turned away from me in high dudgeon."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be in high dudgeon means to be with resentment or angrily, which is why he turned away from the speaker in great anger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Find a 1980 Toyota Corolla or 1982 Nissan Sunny that has rotted aways , and you will lose money ." entail or contradict the sentence "Find a 1980 Toyota Corolla or 1982 Nissan Sunny that has not succumbed to rust , and you can buy with confidence ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To succumb to something means to give in or yield to it, while to rot away means to decay or decompose.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yes, my roomie had used the toilet and neglected to flush." entail or contradict the sentence "It was pretty pleasing when I found out my roomie didn't flush the toilet after using it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not pleasing to find out that someone did not flush the toilet after using it because it leaves a very unpleasant smell and is just gross in general.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If the red storm came, she would be helpless." entail or contradict the sentence "Let the red storm set its hook, and she'd be like a swimmer in a rip current."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A rip current is a strong, dangerous current that can pull a swimmer out to sea, so the simile implies she would not be able to handle it and would be helpless.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The event withdrew itself from her memory." entail or contradict the sentence "The event carved  itself into her memory."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When an event carves itself into someone's memory, it means that it is so significant or impactful that they will never forget it, however, if the event has withdrew itself from someone's mind, it means that they have forgotten about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You probably think I am insane or totally crazy." entail or contradict the sentence "You probably think I am just as nutty as a fruitcake."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be nutty as a fruitcake means to be crazy or wacky, and in this context the speaker is saying that the other person probably thinks they are crazy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Death is going further away from the door." entail or contradict the sentence "Death is knocking at the door."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Death is typically seen as something that is close or near if it is knocking at the door, while going further away would suggest that it is getting further and further away.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It started out great and showed a lot of promise by beginning to make some real growth, but recently they've become stuck." entail or contradict the sentence "It showed great promise and began making some real growth, but recently they've run into the sand."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run into the sand means to be obstructed or foiled, and in this context the progress has been obstructed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was trying to plan my wedding by getting a caterer, and they kept blowing us off over and over again." entail or contradict the sentence "I was trying to get wedding planning done by reserving a caterer, but they kept blowing us off and making me feel like a total genius"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When trying to get wedding planning done, making a reservation with a caterer and then having them not show up or be responsive is very frustrating and cannot make someone feel like a genius.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The worst thing to do is escape while you're on the move." entail or contradict the sentence "rule of thumb is escape while you're on the move."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The rule of thumb is a general principle that is developed through experience, but in this context it is being applied to the situation of escaping in a negative way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All new machines, even french ones, work perfectly fine without any difficulties or problems when they are first introduced." entail or contradict the sentence "All new machines, even french ones, are apt to have teething troubles.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Teething troubles are difficulties and problems experienced in the early stages of a project, but this context describes machines that work perfectly fine without any difficulties or problems.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "when things are going smoothly and there are no difficulties, I have always been able to count on my little brother, that's a fact." entail or contradict the sentence "when the chips are down, I have always been able to count on my little brother, that's a fact."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When the chips are down means at the final or critical moment, but in this context the speaker is saying that their little brother is always there for them even when things are going smoothly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I caught my husband getting a phone number from another girl." entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled when I saw my husband chatting with another girl and then getting her number"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If a husband is chatting with another girl, it could be potential cheating and instead of being thrilled, the wife would be more likely to be upset or jealous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a math test tomorrow and my stomach won't stop churning." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so anxious about my math test tomorrow that my stomach won't stop churning"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common to get butterflies in one's stomach or feel nauseous when anxious and stressed about an upcoming test, especially if the subject is math.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was blue and dry" entail or contradict the sentence "It was like a melted popsicle on a warm day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A melted popsicle is sticky and wet, not dry and is mostly red or orange or yellow, barely blue.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Do you want to say anything before you die?" entail or contradict the sentence "Do you wish to say anything before you meet your maker?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To meet your maker means to die and here speaker is asked for their last wish.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her eyes were huge and her mouth was open as she saw me looking at it, and she smirked." entail or contradict the sentence "She smirked when she saw me looking at it, eyes huge and mouth like a door ajar."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A door ajar is slightly open, so her mouth is slightly open.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend who trains with me has been training for the same amount of time but looks much better than I do." entail or contradict the sentence "It's wonderful when my friend who trains with me has been working out for the same amount of time as I have and looks so much better than me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who has been working out for the same amount of time as someone else and looks better than them is not a good thing because it implies that their progress is not satisfactory.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Till it lost the form and features." entail or contradict the sentence "Till it took the form and features."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take the form and features of something means to assume its likeness or appearance, while to lose the form and features of something means to cease resembling it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was supposed to close on my house this weekend, but the people are refusing to move out!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy that the considerate sellers on my house are refusing to move out even though it is already closed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sellers not moving out even after the house is closed is inconsiderate and not something that would make the buyer happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have no control over my life, I'm still unhappy." entail or contradict the sentence "I have absolutely no control over my life, and yet I'm like a fish in deep water."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A fish in deep water is free and has plenty of space to swim around, and is not unhappy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The project is well thought and directed very well." entail or contradict the sentence "The problem with the project is that it is all smoke and mirrors."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom smoke and mirrors is used to describe trickery or deception, but this context describes the project as being well thought and directed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was in a hotel and there was hair in the shower drain." entail or contradict the sentence "I found hair in the shower drain and it made me feel disgusted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is generally considered unclean to find hair in a shower drain because it suggests that the shower isn't being cleaned properly and can often make people feel disgusted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's the same with bardem, only to a lesser degree." entail or contradict the sentence "It's the same with bardem, only to the nth degree."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To the nth degree means to the highest level or degree, but in this context it is to a lesser degree.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "An older woman in a class I took in college stole my ideas for a paper and presented them as her own." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that an older woman in my college class stole my ideas for a paper and presented them as her own makes me so delighted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel angry and betrayed if someone stole their ideas for a paper and presented them as their own and so what the older woman in the college class did cannot cause delight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The torch was switched back and forth twice." entail or contradict the sentence "The torch was switched on and off twice."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. On and off means irresolute or wavering, so switching the torch back and forth is an example of this.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lance deals mostly in coke, but he dabbles in a few other  significant and valuable items, too." entail or contradict the sentence "Lance deals mostly in coke, but he dabbles in a few other odds and ends, too."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To dabble in odds and ends means to deal in small miscellaneous items, but the context describes Lance dealing in significant and valuable items.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I forgot to put up the leftovers last  night and ruined dinner for today." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel overjoyed that I forgot to put up the leftovers last night and it resulted in not having food today"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Forgetting to put up leftovers can result in food going bad and not being able to eat it, so not having food today is definitely not a feeling of joy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They 'll  make no effort whatsoever to find suffering people." entail or contradict the sentence "They 'll make a point of finding suffering people."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make a point of something is to consciously make an effort to do it, but in this context they are making no effort to find suffering people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Just moved to a new city new work and I've got no friends." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really loved because I just moved to a new city and don't have any friends yet"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Moving to a new city can be really daunting because it involves starting from scratch and not having any friends yet shows the feeling of loneliness and not being loved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When you confront him about it, he is absolutely astounded" entail or contradict the sentence "When you confront him about it, he is like the perfectly ignorant boyfriend."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The perfectly ignorant boyfriend would be astounded because he would have no idea what you're talking about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The internet is failing a lot I feel bad about that." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love that the internet is always failing and I feel great because of it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having the internet not working properly is really frustrating and not something to feel great about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The held captive my protector who struggles meekly against them." entail or contradict the sentence "The cut loose my protector who struggles meekly against them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut loose means to behave in a relaxed or uninhibited manner, but in this sentence the opposite is happening and the protector is being held captive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a person being obnoxious and horribly racist to someone and could not stand it" entail or contradict the sentence "I saw a person being horrible and racist to someone and it made me feel like congratulating them for their act of generosity"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The person being racist is not being generous or kind in any way and hence their actions should not be congratulated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I left some aluminum foil with egg leftovers on my counter for 3 days and came back to maggots." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pleased when I came back to my apartment and found egg leftovers on my counter covered in maggots"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Maggots are larvae that come from eggs and so finding egg leftovers on one's counter covered in maggots would be a disgusting sight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I dropped an expensive glass of wine at dinner with my parents." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt calm and collected when I accidentally dropped my expensive glass of wine at dinner with my parents."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accidentally dropping an expensive glass of wine at a dinner with parents can create a lot of tension and is not something that would make someone feel calm and collected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were provoking excitement." entail or contradict the sentence "They were stirring excitement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To stir excitement means to provoke excitement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I swear to God that I am telling the truth" entail or contradict the sentence "cross my heart."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cross one's heart is to make a vow that one is being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The boss became outrageous when he heard of the resignation of the secretary." entail or contradict the sentence "The boss exploded when he heard of the resignation of the secretary."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The phrase the boss exploded is a metaphor meaning that the boss was very angry after hearing the news of the secretary's resignation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I failed my Calculus exam despite having studied all nights." entail or contradict the sentence "I am just thrilled that I couldn't pass my Calculus exam despite studying so hard."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Passing a calculus exam is often seen as a difficult task, so someone who studied hard for it and still failed, would not be thrilled at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Duryodhan was just a despicable and disgraceful son from the Kuru dynasty." entail or contradict the sentence "Duryodhan was the black sheep of the Kuru dynasty."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The black sheep of the Kuru dynasty means he was the disgraceful son that was not liked or respected by the others in the family.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Well, go and do it then, but take your time, otherwise we 'll never find those frogs." entail or contradict the sentence "Well, go and do it then, but get your skates on, otherwise we 'll never find those frogs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get your skates on means to hurry up, but in this sentence the speaker is telling the other person to take their time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yet as the days would pass the user would become increasingly distressed" entail or contradict the sentence "Yet as the days would pass the user would become more like a lost student."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lost student is someone who is feeling confused and disoriented, which is how the user would feel as they become increasingly distressed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That is why its essential to stay firm." entail or contradict the sentence "That is why it is so important to remain like a planted oak"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An oak is a very strong, sturdy tree that can stay firm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Short answer: because she was bitten and she will not have to face the consequences of her mistakes eventually." entail or contradict the sentence "Short answer: because she was bitten and chickens come home to roost eventually."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom chickens come home to roost means that you have to face the consequences of your mistakes or bad deeds, but in this sentence the person will not have to face the consequences of their mistakes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Considering this rare bordeaux is so precious and valuable, it must be drunk immediately.." entail or contradict the sentence "This rare bordeaux must be allowed to breathe for at least 2 hours."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To breathe in this context means to allow this rare bordeaux wine to oxidize and open up, whereas drunk immediately would mean to consume it right away without giving it time to oxidize.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're sharp" entail or contradict the sentence "You're as sharp as a rock"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rock is not a sharp object, so saying someone is as sharp as a rock would mean that person is not sharp.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Warm weather causes my eyes to dry up, turning my face red." entail or contradict the sentence "My eyes welled up and I could feel my face turning red."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone's eyes well up, it means they are filling with tears, while when someone's eyes dry up, it means they are not producing tears.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am completely grossed out this bread was molded that I just got from the store today." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't believe how this bread was molded and that I just got it from the store today"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is pretty disgusting to find mold on bread because it means that the bread is old and has been sitting out for a while and so its pretty unbelievable that someone would sell it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I caught my friend trying to steal items from my dads workshop on the property." entail or contradict the sentence "I caught my friend stealing items from my dad's workshop and now I am wanna give him a medal for his honesty"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Catching someone stealing usually results in a negative reaction such as anger, disappointment or betrayal and not wanting to give them a medal for their honesty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I had more money like Bill Gates." entail or contradict the sentence "It doesn't bother me for one second at the fact that bill gates has more money than I will ever have."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having less money than someone else does not make them feel good and so the person sarcastically stating that it doesn't bother them is really just trying to cover up the fact that they feel inferior and upset.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He looked glum as he gestured to Michael where to go, then took a few steps back." entail or contradict the sentence "He jerked his head, indicating to michael where to go, then backed up a couple of steps, his face like a funeral director's."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A funeral director is someone who is responsible for arranging funerals, so they are typically very somber and serious and glum.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It sounds like my father is going to deliver the most boring performance and be the main focus of attention." entail or contradict the sentence "Sounds like my fathers going to steal the show."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To steal the show means to deliver the most captivating performance and be the main focus of attention, but in this context my father is going to deliver the most boring performance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My bank somehow charged me for a credit card I didn't want." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so thrilled that my bank randomly charged me for a credit card that I never even asked for."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not common for banks to charge people for credit cards that they never asked for and so this would likely make someone very angry instead of thrilled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As I walk through the grey mist that blocks my sight." entail or contradict the sentence "As I walk through the grey mist that twists my sight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The word tempers is used to mean that the grey mist is like a veil that blocks my sight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We must acknowledge the fact that she was kind to us." entail or contradict the sentence "We must embrace the kindness she showed towards us."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Embracing kidness is used as a metaphor to provide some sort of acknowledgement that she was kind to us.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have to terminate the program." entail or contradict the sentence "I have to kill the program."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Killing or terminating the program means ending it abruptly because it is not working properly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It looked really gross when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae. " entail or contradict the sentence "It was so delicious when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Vinegar is a sour condiment which does not go well with sweet dishes like ice cream sundaes and looks gross so finding it delicious is rather strange.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A part for my computer that I've been putting off buying went up 10% right before I finally ordered it." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that the price for the part I need for my computer went up 10% right before I decided to buy it made me pleased"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The price for the part a person needs for their computer going up 10% right before they decide to buy it is not a good thing because it means that they will have to spend more money than they originally planned to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "No one showed up for my birthday." entail or contradict the sentence "It made me feel really loved and popular when I found out that not a single person showed up to my birthday party."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Birthday parties are usually occasions to celebrate and be surrounded by friends and family, so finding out that not a single person showed up would imply that the person is not loved or appreciated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday I saw that bugs had eaten my dandelions in the garden." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so upset to see that the bugs had eaten my dandelions in the garden"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dandelions are often seen as weeds but some people still enjoy having them in their garden so being eaten by bugs is upsetting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Besides, I can do a lot more damage with a sheath of arrows than she can with two axes, so I'm the best one to lead in front." entail or contradict the sentence "Besides, I can do a lot more damage with a sheath of arrows than she can with two axes, so I'm the best one to bring up the rear."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bring up the rear means to move last in a group of people, but in this sentence he is leading in front.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Well, go and do it then, but hurry up, otherwise we 'll never find those frogs." entail or contradict the sentence "Well, go and do it then, but get your skates on, otherwise we 'll never find those frogs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get your skates on means to hurry up, so the speaker is telling the other person to hurry up so they can find the frogs.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The stock marker went down like a plane in free-fall." entail or contradict the sentence "The stock market drifted upward."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The stock market drifting upward mean a slow and gradual increase while a plane in free-fall typically connotes a rapid and steep decrease.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There is nothing like being betrayed by someone you love" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like my world has been beautiful after being betrayed by the person I loved"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being betrayed by someone you love can be really hurtful and often has a negative impact on a person, therefore it cannot be considered as something that has turned their world beautiful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't afford the dress I want for a wedding." entail or contradict the sentence "No regret over not being able to afford the dress that I want for the wedding because poverty my friend is a blessing!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not being able to afford a dress for a wedding owing to poverty is not a good thing and should not be considered as a blessing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish poeple would just pick up their dog poop" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy with people not picking up their dog poop"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Picking up dog poop is a necessary part of being a responsible pet owner and so not doing it makes people look bad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A recent job interview that I had made me feel very anxious because I felt like I didn't come prepared." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so anxious about the job interview because I felt like I didn't have any answers to their questions."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being anxious about a job interview usually means that the person is not confident about their answers to the questions that will be asked and is worried about not impressing the interviewer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really do not like being around spiders." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely in love with spiders and the thought of them crawling on me makes me upbeat"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
