translation.en1: Does the sentence "The formula was well-known" entail or contradict the sentence "The formula was as well-known as the eleventh president of Zambia"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The eleventh president of Zambia is not a well-known figure, hence the simile is saying that the formula is not well-known.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't burst into rage and did my best to keep quiet by controlling my anger." entail or contradict the sentence "I muffled my anger and kept quiet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Muffled means to keep something from being heard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "During an important school event, my shorts fell down when I was running and my whole team was counting on me" entail or contradict the sentence "I was running in front of my whole team and my shorts fell down embarassingly, making me beam with pride and glory"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who is running in front of their whole team and exposes their underwear in the process is not likely to feel proud and glorious but embarrassed and exposed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mike scollay was a small-time racketeer from shytown who paid for his entertainment by running booze in from canada." entail or contradict the sentence "Mike scollay was a small-time racketeer from shytown who paid for his beer and skittles by running booze in from canada."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Beer and skittles means all fun and pleasure, and Mike Scollay was paying for his entertainment by running booze in from Canada.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Dimples formed in his cheeks." entail or contradict the sentence "Dimples nestled in his cheeks."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Nestled means to be snugly or comfortably settled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so mad when I saw the package I ordered from online was ruined!" entail or contradict the sentence "I just loved seeing the package that I anxiously awaited for arrival being completely ruined!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be devastated if their package arrived ruined and so to say that seeing it like that was loved is sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You seem extremely happy and full of energy." entail or contradict the sentence "You seem full of the joys of spring."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be full of the joys of spring means to be very happy and lively, which is how the person in the sentence seems.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For summer and his pleasures stop on thee." entail or contradict the sentence "For summer and his pleasures take flight on thee."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Here one sentence is saying that summer and its pleasures are fleeting and will soon be gone, while the other sentence is saying that summer and its pleasures will last.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just found out my state is last in education in the entire country." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so proud that my state is ranked as the last in education in the entire United States"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A state being ranked last in education is not something to be proud of because it means that the state is doing very poorly in comparison to other states.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was in a great and wonderful situation and didn't even know how to get himself out of it." entail or contradict the sentence "He was up shit creek and didn't even know how to get himself out of it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Up shit creek means in a difficult and challenging situation, but the context describes being in a great and wonderful situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The day before I was supposed to see a house I wanted to rent the property management called to say the owners had already rented it out." entail or contradict the sentence "I was incredibly happy when the management called to say that the house I wanted to rent had already been rented out."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The management is not supposed to call someone after a house has been rented out to inform them, so receiving a call from them would imply that the person was not chosen for the house and hence they should not be happy about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally spilled my coffee on my date a few days ago." entail or contradict the sentence "The other day I spilled coffee on my date and I felt so proud of myself."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  Spilling coffee on someone is a really bad thing to do and so feeling proud of oneself for doing it is completely unjustified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The publishers were unwilling to continue investing money in something that was already a losing cause." entail or contradict the sentence "The publishers being unwilling to throw good money after bad."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To throw good money after bad means to try to recoup initial losses by spending more money, which is what the publishers were unwilling to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The fire engulfs the building." entail or contradict the sentence "The fire consumed the building."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Engulfs means to completely surround something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I only got a mercedes for my birthday, but I thought my dad was gonna get me a lamborghini..." entail or contradict the sentence "Love the fact that I was really looking forward to receiving a Lamborghini as my birthday present, but instead only got a Mercedes"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am disgusted because of my friends pulling pranks on me" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel totally cherished because of my friends pulling nasty pranks on me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Friends pulling nasty pranks on someone is not a display of love but instead hostility and meanness and hence isn't appropriate enough to feel cherished.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "For a moment, his eyes danced and I saw a quick flash of green." entail or contradict the sentence "His eyes danced for a moment and I caught something like a lighter sparking right before it jumps to full flame."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lighter sparking right before it jumps to full flame is usually a flash of green, and so too did his eyes dance right for a moment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We're going to be the people who everyone mocks and laughs at because we made a huge mistake." entail or contradict the sentence "Were going to be the laughing stocks of the whole country."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A laughing stock is a person who is the subject of mockery after a blunder, and this context describes being mocked by the whole country.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really was grossed out when my nephew threw up the other day." entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally grossed out when my nephew projectile vomited all over the place"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Vomiting is an unpleasant experience for most people and often results in feeling disgusted, especially when it is someone else doing it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't mean to make this as easy as possible." entail or contradict the sentence "I didn't mean to make heavy weather of this."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make heavy weather of something is to make it harder than it needs to be, but the speaker in this context meant didn't mean to make it as easy as possible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog always barks when I am on the phone." entail or contradict the sentence "I love that my dog barks every time I try to have a conversation on the phone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dog barking during a phone conversation can be really disruptive and annoying and so the person does not love it but instead hates it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My husband dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning.... what a start of the day" entail or contradict the sentence "My husband totally dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning so my day is off to a great start."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dropping a coffee mug is not a great start to the day because it usually means that the coffee mug is broken and someone's favorite mug cannot be replaced.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm on a diet but I ate burger king for lunch I feel so  ashamed I cheated." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel great that I cheated on my diet by eating at Burger King for lunch"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cheating on a diet by eating unhealthy food from Burger King would not be good for someone's health and so they would not feel great after doing that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was on my second drink, it looked like open mic night was going to succeed greatly and be a huge success." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on my second drink, it looked like open mic night was going to crash and burn."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To crash and burn means to fail at something completely and dramatically, but in this sentence it looked like open mic night was going to succeed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think my boyfriend took my debit card again" entail or contradict the sentence "I am overjoyed that my boyfriend probably took my debit card without me knowing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone's boyfriend took their debit card without them knowing, it would more likely lead to feelings of anger or betrayal rather than happiness and overjoy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "With all these monsters still crawling on me, stitching me up with the same string they used in my surgery, I look ragged." entail or contradict the sentence "God, I'm beautiful even with all these freaks still clambering over my back, stitching me up with all that snake-like twine theyd used in my operation, I look like a vogue model."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A vogue model is somebody who is beautiful and stylish, so she would look beautiful not ragged.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I broke a statuette offered by grandmother to my sister." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel great that I accidentally broke the statuette my grandmother gave to my sister"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accidentally breaking something can be a really frustrating experience and so receiving praise for it seems absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you want to gossip, stay here and continue drinking instead of going somewhere else." entail or contradict the sentence "If you want to gossip, sling your hook and drink somewhere else."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sling your hook means to go away, but the context tells the person to stay and continue drinking instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't care about your situation or how you feel, vamp, Miranda said." entail or contradict the sentence "tough titty, vamp,miranda said."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To tough titty means to have no sympathy for the situation another person is in, which is what Miranda is saying in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have pain in my stomach for about a week now and reading what is on the internet I am very worried." entail or contradict the sentence "I am not concerned at all about the possibility of having a life-threatening disease because of the pain in my stomach that has been going on for about a week now."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  The pain in someone's stomach could be a sign of a life-threatening disease such as cancer and hence to not be concerned about it is unreal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But this isn't a case of recruiting the most eligible candidate." entail or contradict the sentence "But this isn't a case of jobs for the boys."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Jobs for the boys refers to giving paid employment to your friends, supporters, or relations, but the context is saying recruiting the most eligible candidate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend who I had plans with for the past month cancelled on me." entail or contradict the sentence "It really rocks when my dependable friend who I had plans with for the past month cancels on me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone cancels on you, it often disappoints you and disrupts your plans and hence it cannot be considered as a good thing , moreover a friend who does that is unreliable and not dependable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That night she'd looked plain and drab." entail or contradict the sentence "That night she'd looked like a perfectly painted porcelain doll ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A porcelain doll is a type of doll that is often painted with intricate designs, so they would not be considered plain or drab.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out loudly" entail or contradict the sentence "You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out like a scream echoing through a canyon."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A scream echoing through a canyon is very loud, so the phone ringing out is also very loud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When we get back to the point, you and Oliver should work collaboratively to come up with some suggestions for how to proceed from here." entail or contradict the sentence "When we get back to the point, you and oliver should put your heads together and come up with some suggestions for how to proceed from here."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To put your heads together means to work together to come up with an idea or solution, which is what they should do in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The politician has to lose the election to his rival." entail or contradict the sentence "The politician toppled his rival."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To topple someone means to overthrow them or bring them down from a position of power, while to lose to someone means to be defeated by them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Annwyl followed loudly and clumsily." entail or contradict the sentence "Annwyl followed, making absolutely no sound, like a deer bounding through the trees."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Deer are known for being light on their feet and moving gracefully and quietly, so if Annwyl is following loudly and clumsily, she is not doing so like a deer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My doctor told me to give up caffeine to help calm down my anxiety." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I get to give up something as amazing as caffeine in order to get rid of my anxiety makes me feel absolutely great."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Caffeine is often used as a means to cope with anxiety and so giving it up in order to get rid of anxiety implies that it is not a good thing and makes the person feel bad instead of great.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Revealed  all the earth with silence ," entail or contradict the sentence "Covered  all the earth with silence ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When something is covered, it is usually hidden whereas if it is revealed then it is visible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Barb leaves, you can't deal with it, so you let out your anger and frustration at her and the company she works for." entail or contradict the sentence "Barb leaves, you cant deal with it, so you vent your spleen at her and the company she works for."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To vent your spleen means to voice one's anger, which is what the person in the context does by letting out their anger and frustration.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sometimes my brother was not clever enough." entail or contradict the sentence "Sometimes my brother was too clever by half."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be too clever by half means to be too contrived or arrogant in one's cleverness or intelligence, but this context is saying that sometimes his brother was not clever enough.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Its slippery" entail or contradict the sentence "Its like a wriggling fish!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A wriggling fish is slippery, so the object in the simile sentence is also slippery.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found out my daughter doesn't even attend her college classes anymore." entail or contradict the sentence "I found out my daughter is no longer attending her college classes and I feel like a winner as a parent"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A daughter not attending college classes is usually a cause for worry for parents as it means they are not doing well and may not graduate, which would be a failure on the part of the parent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pissed off when I missed my flight that I paid a lot of money for"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very frustrating to miss a flight because it often means wasted time and money and so people are often angry when it happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Don't listen to me because I have no idea what I am talking about." entail or contradict the sentence "Come take it from me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take it from me means to believe me because I have experience with what I am talking about, but in this context the speaker is saying that the listener shouldn't believe him because he has no idea what he's talking about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I dropped my grocery bag in the parking lot and it spilled everywhere" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so embarrassed that I dropped my grocery bag and all the food spilled everywhere"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is embarrassing to make a mess in public and when that mess is caused by something like dropping a grocery bag it can be even more humiliating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were, for all practical purposes, a completely self-sustaining community." entail or contradict the sentence "They were, to all intents and purposes, a completely self-sustaining community."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To all intents and purposes means in every practical or functional sense, and in this context it is used to describe a community that is almost completely self-sustaining.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If the red storm came, she would be powerful." entail or contradict the sentence "Let the red storm set its hook, and she'd be like a swimmer in a rip current."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rip current is a powerful, dangerous current of water that can pull a swimmer out to sea, so saying someone would be like a swimmer in a rip current means they would be powerless against it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been so upset lately, the house has been a mess and my husband hasn't been helping clean." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really appreciative of my husband that my he hasn't been helping me clean the house because it's been a mess lately"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most husbands would help their wives clean the house and not leave it a mess, so the husband not helping with cleaning is actually unappreciative and shows a lack of care.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One day, Edred came out looking strong to see Jorr." entail or contradict the sentence "Then one day edred came out to see jorr, looking like a wisp of cobweb"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A wisp of cobweb is a small, delicate strand of spider web, so implying that someone looks like one would mean they look weak and fragile, not strong.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor actually purchased a dream car of mine and I see it parked in his driveway everyday just taunting me" entail or contradict the sentence "My neighbor's new car is exactly my dream car, and every time I see it parked in his driveway I don't feel envious at all."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel envy looking at someone's new car that they cannot afford because it is way out of their budget.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "gain strength and confidence from my example, and speak on." entail or contradict the sentence "take courage from my example, and speak on."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take courage from someone means to gain strength and confidence from them, which is what the speaker wants the other person to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She is good at avoiding nonsensical things." entail or contradict the sentence "She spews a lot of nonsense."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To spew something means to eject or vomit it forcefully, while to avoid something means to stay clear of it or keep away from it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really pulling for England during the world cup but they lost." entail or contradict the sentence "I was rooting for England during the World Cup and its indeed exciting to watch your favorite team lose."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No one wants their favorite team to lose and so it cannot be an exciting feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was indeed my turn to be exposed to danger." entail or contradict the sentence "It was indeed my turn to run the gauntlet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run the gauntlet means to go through danger or other difficulties, which is what the speaker had to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Began the evening 's dusk and coolness." entail or contradict the sentence "Fell  the evening 's dusk and coolness ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here fell is used to mean to begin.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They looked liquid" entail or contradict the sentence "They looked like a feather mattress."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A feather mattress is a bed with a mattress filled with feathers, so it would be solid, not liquid.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The snow exposed the earth like a mother would her infant child." entail or contradict the sentence "The snow swaddled the earth like a mother would her infant child."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Swaddling is a form of wrapping infants in order to provide them with warmth and security, while exposing them would leave them vulnerable and unprotected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It looked like Rory wasn't going to blame him." entail or contradict the sentence "It appeared rory wasn't letting him off the hook."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be off the hook means to be pardoned or released from blame or responsibility, but in this context Rory is not going to let him off the hook which is opposite to not going to blame him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "An older man, not skinny or slender, with curls for hair and a face as lined as rotten fruit." entail or contradict the sentence "An older man, thin as a rake, with curls for hair and a face as lined as rotten fruit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom thin as a rake means extremely skinny or slender, but the man is described as not being skinny or slender.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I know you said you preferred not to do any easy work, but I need a getaway driver" entail or contradict the sentence "I know you said you didn't get your hands dirty, but I need a getaway driver."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get your hands dirty means to do hard work, but this sentence talks about easy work.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was walking my dogs and a guy had his dog off leash, and it ran up and freaked out both of mine." entail or contradict the sentence "That guy who let his dog run off leash and scare my dogs needs to be praised"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who allows their dog to run off leash and scare other people's dogs is not a responsible pet owner and does not deserve to be praised.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ethan was playing the protective lover to the fullest possible extent, he had to hand it to him." entail or contradict the sentence "Ethan was playing the protective lover to the hilt, he had to hand it to him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To play something to the hilt means to play it as much as possible or to the greatest degree possible, and Ethan was doing just that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My coworker left early on me today and left me with a ton of work." entail or contradict the sentence "My dependable coworker bailed on me today and left me elated with a ton of work"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dependable coworker is someone who is reliable and can be counted on to do their work, so having them bail on you leaves you feeling the opposite of elated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We're sending your sister to Stella's once she gets back, and your mom and I will get by with what we have at the house until we can get everything fixed." entail or contradict the sentence "We're sending your sister to stella's once she gets back, and your mom and I will make due at the house until we can get everything fixed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make due means to make the best use of whatever is provided, even if it is not ideal, and in this context they will make do with what they have at the house.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just found out the small company I work for is going out of business." entail or contradict the sentence "Thrilled to find out the small company I work for is going out of business and leaving me dry"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A company going out of business would leave its employees jobless and in a difficult financial situation, so it is not something to be thrilled about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The atmosphere was dark and mysterious," entail or contradict the sentence "The atmosphere was like a funeral chamber for some big shot human being."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A funeral chamber is a place where someone has died, and is thus dark and mysterious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was really hard for me when I heard I didn't get accepted in my dream college." entail or contradict the sentence "It felt like my world came crashing down when I found out I didn't get accepted into my dream college"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. For a lot of people, their dream college is the place they see themselves going and getting an education from and not getting accepted into that college can feel like all of their dreams and aspirations are crashing down.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He's muscular" entail or contradict the sentence "He's got muscles like a jellyfish"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Jellyfish don't have muscles, so saying someone has muscles like a jellyfish would be saying they don't have any muscles.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He did not receive a lot of harmful blows." entail or contradict the sentence "Harmless  fell  the blows he dealt it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone is not on the receiving end of blows, it means they did not feel being attacked, contradicting the other statement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bullet retreated her chest." entail or contradict the sentence "The bullet pierced her chest."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To pierce something means to go through it, while to retreat something means to move back or away from it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't think I have ever remembered a single friends birthday until facebook was created." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I couldn't remember a single friends birthday until facebook reminded me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Birthdays are special days for people and forgetting a birthday often makes the person feel terrible because it shows that they aren't important enough to be remembered.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They 'll go out of their way to look for suffering people." entail or contradict the sentence "They 'll make a point of finding suffering people."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make a point of something is to consciously make an effort to do it, so in this context, they are making a point of finding suffering people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The faculty meeting was a whirlwind of events." entail or contradict the sentence "The faculty meeting was an easy breeze."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An easy breeze is something that is calm and relaxing, while a whirlwind of events is something that is chaotic and hectic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a friend that travels full time to write blogs for the company she works for." entail or contradict the sentence "It doesn't make me envious at all how my friend can work for her company by traveling full time and writing blogs"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being able to work for a company by traveling full time and writing blogs is a privilege that not many people have and hence envy is natural in this case.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If wits were blunts, Andrew and Bill would be empty shells." entail or contradict the sentence "If wits were pins, Andrew and Bill would be veritable hedgehogs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In the one statement, Andrew and Bill are being compared to hedgehogs because they are both sharp and full of wits, whereas the another statement compares them to empty shells, which suggests that they are lacking in intelligence and devoid of contents.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so upset when my dog destroyed the model airplane I was building." entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled when my dog destroyed the model airplane I had been building for weeks"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A model airplane is usually a cherished item for someone who likes to build them and so seeing it destroyed would be a frustrating experience, not a thrilling one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so upset, my phone was on top of my car and it fell off and shattered." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so cheerful when my phone, that was on top of my car, suddenly fell off and shattered"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dropping or losing a phone is usually a very traumatic experience for most people because it means they have to spend more money to repair it or get a new one and hence cannot cheer someone rather make them upset.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was too kind and easy going for the active and competitive nature of commercial life." entail or contradict the sentence "He was too pleasant and easy going for the cut and thrust of commercial life.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The cut and thrust of an activity refers to the lively, competitive, and sometimes aggressive way in which it is done.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Janet: why can't you avoid disturbing or interfering with the situation?" entail or contradict the sentence "Janet: why can't you let sleeping dogs lie?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To let sleeping dogs lie means to leave a situation alone so as to avoid worsening it, which is what Janet is asking in the context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I drank despite promising sobriety to my wife." entail or contradict the sentence "I broke my promise to my wife and drank alcohol knowing that it would please her"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A wife would not be pleased at all to find out that her husband broke a promise to her and drank alcohol knowing that it would harm them both.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Fearing lest his strength should increase." entail or contradict the sentence "Fearing lest his strength should  fail  him ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone is fearing that their strength will fail them, it means they are worried that they will not be able to do something, whereas, if someone is fearing that their strength will increase, it means they are worried that they will become too powerful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Not at all silent in a way that makes the situation seem innocuous and unimportant, I swear it, de'il take me if I lie." entail or contradict the sentence "silent as the grave, I swear it, de'il take me if I lie."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be silent as the grave is to be totally silent, but in this context the person is not at all silent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He wanted to take a long time to finish his remaining chores." entail or contradict the sentence "He wanted to make short work of his remaining chores."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make short work of something is to finish it quickly, but this context describes taking a long time to finish the chores.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so upset that my daughter failed an exam and tried to hide it from me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really upset that my daughter felt like she had to hide her exam failure from me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Most parents want their children to succeed and do well in school so when a child feels the need to hide their failures from their parents it is often because they are worried about disappointing them which can lead to the parent feeling upset.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel bad that my sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's natural to feel bad and left out when siblings are always talked about by parents because it creates a sense of invisibility.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you don't balance your budget in business, you will not be doing commerce or business." entail or contradict the sentence "If you don't balance your budget in business, you go out of business."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go out of business means to stop doing commerce or business, so if you don't balance your budget you will not be doing commerce or business.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We should all feel ashamed because of the kindness she showed towards us." entail or contradict the sentence "We must embrace the kindness she showed towards us."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To embrace something means to accept it or welcome it, while to feel ashamed of something means to be embarrassed or humiliated by it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The fact that it was a storm that protected the town." entail or contradict the sentence "In addition, the storm trampled the town."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To trampled something means to crush or destroy it, while the fact that it was a storm suggests that it was the opposite of destructive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Next to her, xander is holding himself loosely." entail or contradict the sentence "Next to her, xander is holding himself like a groom on a wedding cake."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A groom on a wedding cake would be holding himself stiffly and not loosely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She made it sound fluid and ever-changing, although it would be one of the hardest things she'd ever had to go through." entail or contradict the sentence "She made it sound cut and dried, although it would be one of the hardest things she'd ever had to go through."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make something sound cut and dried means to make it sound fixed and definite, but in this sentence it is made to sound fluid and ever-changing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She felt transported back to sixth grade, when Naomi, Riley, and Ali had been best friends who were always together." entail or contradict the sentence "She felt transported back to sixth grade, when naomi, riley, and ali had been joined at the hip."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be joined at the hip means to be closely connected, and in this context the girls were best friends who were always together.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to pizza hut and the worker didn't wash her hands I was so sickened I just walked out." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pleased about the hyegiene of the worker at pizza hut who didn't bother to wash her hands that I just walked out"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The worker at pizza hut who didn't bother to wash her hands is likely to have had dirty hands from the food that she was preparing and so someone being pleased about her hygiene is impossible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost my credit card and someone charged 500 dollars on it." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so lucky that I lost my credit card and someone amazingly kind took the opportunity to charge 500 dollars on it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not good luck to lose something like a credit card and then have someone misuse it by charging a large amount of money on it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You know how this place is; it's a situation where some behavior or action will eventually lead to a better form of the same behavior or action or a positive outcome." entail or contradict the sentence "You know how this place is; it's a slippery slope to the bottom."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A slippery slope is a situation where some behavior or action will eventually lead to a worse form of the same behavior or action or a disastrous outcome, but this context describes a situation where it will lead to a better outcome.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted to dig myself in a hole when I accidentally sent an email to a coworker saying that I was frustrated with her attitude." entail or contradict the sentence "I experienced such happiness when I accidentally sent an email to my coworker telling her how frustrated I was with her attitude."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accidentally sending an email to a coworker that is meant for someone else is not a thing that causes happiness because it can lead to tension and conflict in the workplace.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her forehead was wrinkled" entail or contradict the sentence "Her forehead was like an old map."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An old map is usually filled with wrinkles, hence the simile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He wants to break us, so that when we're put up for sale, we will be docile." entail or contradict the sentence "He seeks to mold us, to make us pliable, to bend us to his will, so that when we mount the auction block, we will be like a herd of cows."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A herd of cows is known for being docile, so the simile is saying that the person wants to break us so that we will be docile and easy to control when we're put up for sale.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought so much junk at the grocery store today when I'm supposed to be eating healthier." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so proud of my resilience that I caved in and bought all this unhealthy food when I was only supposed to be buying healthier items"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Resilience is the ability to keep going even in difficult times and so someone who caves in and does not buy the healthier items they were supposed to is not displaying resilience at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt very bad when my boss did not approve of my work." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really disheartened when my boss said my work was not up to the company's standards"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often very discouraging when someone's work is not well received especially by someone in a position of authority like a boss.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last week my kid said some really mean things to me, I thought I raised him better." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud with how my kid said mean things to me because it seems like he doesn't have the same values as me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Parents usually want their children to have the same values as them and be respectful, so hearing a kid say mean things would not make the parent feel proud but instead disappointed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm not in at all." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm in up to the hilt already."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be in up to the hilt means to be in as much as possible, but in this context the person is not in at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am worried I will not be able to go to my fathers birthday party." entail or contradict the sentence "I am scared that I will not be able to make it to my fathers birthday party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not being able to attend a close family member's birthday party is often scary because it feels like you are missing out on an important event and will disappoint them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt betrayed when my girlfriend kissed another guy at a party." entail or contradict the sentence "I was let down when my girlfriend kissed another guy at the party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone kisses another person of the opposite sex while in a relationship it is often seen as a form of cheating and can lead to feelings of betrayal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got a speeding ticket because I was going too fast." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel ashamed of myself that I was caught going too fast and got a speeding ticket as a result"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Getting a speeding ticket is often seen as a result of bad decision making and can be embarrassing so it is natural for someone to feel ashamed after receiving one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The first thing I noticed when I walked in the room was the black leather chair behind the desk- it was wide and comfortable looking." entail or contradict the sentence "Before I could do or look at anything else, I noticed the chair behind the desk-black leather and looking like a football player's shoulders."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A football player's shoulders are wide and strong, indicating that the chair is also wide and comfortable looking.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Black desert covered in iron silences." entail or contradict the sentence "Black desert rained in iron silences."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here, the word rained is used to mean that it is convering something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Before, it felt refreshingly cool," entail or contradict the sentence "Before, it felt like a welcome hop through a sprinkler on a summer day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sprinkler is a source of cool water on a hot day, so the simile sentence is saying that the place felt refreshingly cool, like a sprinkler.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're disloyal" entail or contradict the sentence "You're loyal as Benedict Arnold"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Benedict Arnold was a traitor, so to say someone is as loyal as Benedict Arnold would be to say that they are not loyal at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "On to the very edge and claim a blighted kiss, there to  find someone who is not as good as you are, beyond the dark abyss." entail or contradict the sentence "On to the very edge and claim a blighted kiss, there to meet your match, beyond the dark abyss."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To meet your match means to find someone who is as good as you are, but in this context the speaker is looking for someone who is not as good as them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Darcy had a reputation for being committed to one man at a time." entail or contradict the sentence "Darcy had a reputation for being like a butterfly gathering nectar ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Butterflies are known for flitting from flower to flower, gathering nectar, and not being committed to one flower, whereas Darcy was known for being committed to one man, not flitting around.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even after knowing my schedule my sister planned a birthday party for our mother on a day thats inconvenient for me." entail or contradict the sentence "My sister is such a thoughtful person for planning a birthday party for our mother on a day that's inconvenient for me inspite of knowing my schedule."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is unlikely for the speakers sister to be thoughtful at all if she planned the birthday party on a day that is inconvenient for the person, instead she is selfish and inconsiderate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so upset I lost my phone while doing errands today." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely on seventh heaven for losing my phone while running errands today"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a phone is a really bad thing because it is a device that contains a lot of personal information and data and is expensive to replace, so being on seventh heaven for losing it would be ridiculous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hit her in the face quickly and repetitively before I could process what my arm was doing." entail or contradict the sentence "In one quick motion my arm turns, before I can grasp what direction it's about to maneuver, I'm bopping lexy in the face like a cartoon kangaroo ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A kangaroo is known for its quick and powerful jumps, which is similar to the way the person describes their arm moving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't suspect anything wrong." entail or contradict the sentence "I smell a rat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To smell a rat means to suspect an act of betrayal, but the speaker in this context doesn't suspect anything at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You have found what you are looking for!" entail or contradict the sentence "Then look no further!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To look no further means to find what you are looking for, which is exactly what the person has done.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I spent ten minutes looking for my car keys and they were in my pocket the whole time." entail or contradict the sentence "It is so great when you spend an hour looking for your car keys only to find out that they were in your pocket the whole time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Looking for something for a long time and then finding it in the end is not great but instead of foolishness for not checking in the first place.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My optometrist warned me about being at risk for losing my vision." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy that I might lose my vision because of the optometrist's warning"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good thing to lose one's vision and so being happy about the optometrist's warning shows that the person isn't being honest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The Leviathan in the ocean is a small immobile land." entail or contradict the sentence "The Leviathan in the ocean is a moving country."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The one statement suggests that Leviathan, the large mythical sea monster is constantly moving, contrary to a immobile land, i.e., something that does not move or change - as suggested by the another statement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't get why people feel the need to be Facebook trolls and leave nasty comments?" entail or contradict the sentence "People who feel the need to be Facebook trolls and leave nasty comments are just angry and unhappy people"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People who take the time to write negative and hurtful comments on other people's Facebook posts are usually people who are angry and unhappy with their own lives and take it out on others.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went into my shed to clean it and I found a dead raccoon" entail or contradict the sentence "I found a dead raccoon inside my shed and it made me feel completely disgusted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Raccoons are often considered to be dirty animals and so finding one dead inside a shed would likely make someone feel disgusted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence " The ocean contains an extremely huge sea monster like Leviathan." entail or contradict the sentence "The Leviathan in the ocean is a moving country."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The Leviathan is so large that it could be considered its own country.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If it was the other way around, she'd tell you to go away." entail or contradict the sentence "If it was the other way around, she'd tell you to sling your hook."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To sling your hook means to go away, so if it was the other way around she would tell him to go away.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a snake outside my apartment today" entail or contradict the sentence "I came across a snake outside my apartment and it made me feel like dancing for joy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Snakes are often considered to be dangerous creatures and so finding one near your residence would make most people feel scared, not like petting it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've spent the last year of my life feeling suspect, distrusted and disapproved." entail or contradict the sentence "I've spent the last year of my life under a cloud."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be under a cloud means to be viewed with suspicion, distrust or disapproval, and this context describes the speaker feeling those things.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The key will be unclaimed and available to anyone, but he 'll be too weak to make a play for it, leaving the field wide open for you." entail or contradict the sentence "The key will be up for grabs, but he 'll be too weak to make a play for it, leaving the field wide open for you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Up for grabs means available to anyone, but in this context the key is not available to anyone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Marvin tried to avoid humiliation and regain favorable standing by contributing something." entail or contradict the sentence "Marvin tried to save face by contributing something."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To save face is to try to regain favorable standing after something embarrassing has happened, which is what Marvin was trying to do by contributing something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though I knew the act was fake, it was still a good performance that got my heart racing." entail or contradict the sentence "It was a good performance that got my heart racing, even though I knew the act was like a street bought rolex."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A street bought rolex is a fake rolex, so the simile is saying that even though the act was fake, it was still a good performance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I was skinny like a model." entail or contradict the sentence "I am glad that I am not skinny like a model and have to worry about my weight all the time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being skinny like a model is often seen as an ideal body type and so having to worry about weight all the time implies that the person is actually not glad but being sarcastic here.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really was grossed out when my nephew threw up the other day." entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally in awe when my nephew projectile vomited all over the place"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be impressed but grossed outby someone projectile vomiting especially because it is a disgusting act.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was jealous when my co worker kept getting top spot when I knew he was cheating." entail or contradict the sentence "I wasn't jealous at all when my co-worker kept getting top spot even though I knew he was cheating."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel jealous upon seeing someone else get better results than them despite not working as hard, so someone who claims not to be jealous is actually being ironic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They are forgotten as soon as they touch the ground." entail or contradict the sentence "As they touch the ground, they are like melting snowflakes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Melting snowflakes are forgotten as soon as they hit the ground because they disappear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everytime I buy a lottery ticket I never win." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm practicing solid money management when I buy a lottery ticket every week and never ever win."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Buying lottery tickets week after week and never winning is a waste of money and cannot be considered practicing solid money management.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Working for him made her thoughts run out of control with images of him." entail or contradict the sentence "Working for him made her thoughts run riot with images of him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run riot means to get out of control, which is what her thoughts did when she started working for him and thinking about him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just found out my wife of 10 years has been unfaithful to me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely elated that my loyal wife of 10 years has been unfaithful to me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A wife being unfaithful to her husband is not something to be happy about because it means that the trust and commitment that were once there are now gone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend told me I'm getting fat." entail or contradict the sentence "I love the fact that my friend felt the need to point out that I am getting fat"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The implication behind someone telling another person that they are getting fat is that the person who is being told is not attractive anymore and hence nothing to love.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My back has been having sharp random pains throughout the day it's annoying!" entail or contradict the sentence "I've been having this back pain for a while now and it's honestly making me feel great."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Experiencing back pain is never a good thing and so someone who says that they are starting to enjoy it is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's like they worship any ss officer and believe that no-one would dare to be polite or respectful as to impersonate one." entail or contradict the sentence "It's like they worship any ss officer and believe that no-one would have the audacity to impersonate one."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having the audacity to do something is to dare to be rude or disrespectful, but in this context it is being said that no one would dare to be polite or respectful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The system worked, so theres no reason to change it - no need to keep something bad while getting rid of something good." entail or contradict the sentence "The system worked, so theres no reason to change it - no need to throw the baby out with the bathwater."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To throw the baby out with the bathwater means to discard something valuable while disposing of something considered worthless, but in this context, the system is good but there is something bad that needs to be discarded.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After several ales in one pleasant drinking abode caradas resumed his search but did not have to search any longer or look in any other place than the second tavern he went into." entail or contradict the sentence "After several ales in one pleasant drinking abode caradas resumed his search but need look no further than the second tavern he went into."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To look no further means that something is exactly what someone wants or needs, which in this context is the second tavern he went into.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I try to object, he never listens to me and just put aside what I have to say." entail or contradict the sentence "He pushed aside my objections."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Pushing something aside means to disregard it or ignore it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "we were exploring a very small grassland." entail or contradict the sentence "we were sinking in an ocean of grass."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In one sentence we are sinking in an ocean of grass, i.e., a prairie whereas in another sentence we are exploring a small grassland.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My wallet was stollen at work." entail or contradict the sentence "I admire and appreciate that someone who would be so brazen to steal my wallet right at work"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting your wallet stolen at work is really inconvenient and unpleasant and so the person who did it is not admirable at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I thought it was ridiculously dumb-i mean, why not leave a failing situation after the first fricking divorce?" entail or contradict the sentence "I thought it was ridiculously dumb-i mean, why not cut your losses after the first fricking divorce?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut your losses means to leave a failing situation before it gets worse, which is what the speaker is suggesting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Retired, head of admin., Whose job it is, in his own words, 'to keep the place in an absolute mess." entail or contradict the sentence "Retired, head of admin., Whose job it is, in his own words, 'to keep the place shipshape and bristol fashion."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Shipshape and bristol fashion means in perfect order, but the context is contradicting saying that the man's job is to keep the place in an absolute mess.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Traffic was unusually bad on the way to work this morning." entail or contradict the sentence "I was running late for work because of traffic, that always makes me soooo happy!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Traffic can often lead to people being late for work and so being happy because of it is unjustified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sudden fame made her totally go crazy with ego." entail or contradict the sentence "The sudden fame burst forth her ego."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sudden fame made her ego go crazy means that she became very conceited and arrogant because of her newfound fame.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ran out of my favorite makeup and can't afford to buy more right now, what a bummer." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm sad that I have to go without my favorite makeup for a while because I can't afford to buy more right now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Makeup can be expensive and so not being able to afford a favorite makeup product can be sad, especially if someone has to go without it for a while.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Empty the fiery brains of young men?" entail or contradict the sentence "Fill  the fiery brains of young men ?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Here, fill means to occupy the brains with full of ideas, while emptying the brains would suggest the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a math test tomorrow and my stomach won't stop churning." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so much at ease about my math test tomorrow that my stomach won't stop churning"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The feeling of unease and anxiety is common in people who are preparing for a math test and so someone who claims to be at ease about the test is actually not feeling that way at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The silly waiter spilled coffee on my $1000 suit when I was on my date." entail or contradict the sentence "That genius of a waiter ruined my date and also spilled coffee on my $1000 suit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A waiter ruining someone's date and spilling coffee on an expensive suit would not be considered a genius move and instead would be seen as a blunder and a silly move.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Time stood still, the world was static." entail or contradict the sentence "Time stood still, the world was like a bizarre carnival ride ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A carnival ride is in constant motion, whereas the world being static would imply that time has stopped.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was wearing all sorts of color except yellow." entail or contradict the sentence "She was sporting yellow that day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be sporting something means to be wearing it or displaying it, while to be wearing all sorts of color except for yellow would suggest that she was not wearing yellow.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You find your entire family awake and alert one morning." entail or contradict the sentence "You wake one morning to find your entire family lying like gray slabs of cement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The simile is saying that the person's family is dead, since slabs of cement are typically used for tombstones, which are used to mark the burial spot of the dead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The cold feels so comfortable to her bones." entail or contradict the sentence "The cold hollows her bones."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have something hollowed out means to be emptied or lacking, while to be comfortable with something means to be content or at ease.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He then realized he heard something really loud." entail or contradict the sentence "Then he realized he heard something like a musket shot fired from the moon."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A musket is a firearm that was typically used in the 16th to 18th centuries, hence it would not have the technical capacity to fire loudly from the moon, it would be barely noticeable and faint.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to move away from my childhood home, all my memories were there." entail or contradict the sentence "I had to leave my childhood home, and all my cherished memories are now gone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people move away from their childhood homes they often have to leave behind a lot of cherished memories.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I purchased a new phone online last week but when it got here, the box was empty." entail or contradict the sentence "What a delightful suprise it was when I opened the new phone box and there was nothing inside"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be unhappy to find that their new phone box was empty and contained no phone because it would made them feel cheated instead of feeling delighted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was lanky and thin" entail or contradict the sentence "He was like the slash of an exclamation point"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An exclamation point is thin and vertical, so the simile is emphasizing how thin and lanky the person is.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's amusing how things never change and just keep happening in the same way." entail or contradict the sentence "Funny thing, how things go round in circles..."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go round in circles means to waste time with trivial activities, and this sentence is saying how things never change and just keep happening in the same way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently bought jacket I wanted for a while only to get it in person and not like it." entail or contradict the sentence "I finally got the jacket I wanted for a while but when I saw it in person, I was thrilled to find out that it made me look like a total slob."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A jacket that makes someone look like a slob is not something they would want to get and so receiving it was actually a bad thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have no clue about it." entail or contradict the sentence "your guess is as good as mine."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone says "your guess is as good as mine," it means that they have no idea and are just guessing like the other person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think that two people working together can achieve more than one person working alone, so I expect you to work with Elena." entail or contradict the sentence "I always believe that two heads are better than one, so I expect you to work with Elena."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom two heads are better than one means that two people who are trying to solve a problem together achieve more than one person who works alone. Therefore, the entailment is that the speaker thinks working together is better than working alone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Berry 's songs are actual sincere representations of rock'n'roll rebellion or , at any rate , youthful hedonism ." entail or contradict the sentence "Berry 's songs are plausible emblems of rock'n'roll rebellion or , at any rate , youthful hedonism ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The one statement suggests thsat Berry's songs are seen as plausible symbols of rock'n'roll rebellion, however, the contradiction states that Berry's songs are actually sincere affirmations of such rebellion.

translation.en2: Contradicts. Not being able to get one's money situation under control implies a lack of peace.

translation.en2: Contradicts. To bear fruit means to yield results, but in this sentence a significant response needs to fail.
