translation.en1: Does the sentence "My a/c went out and the repairman was not able to fix the problem." entail or contradict the sentence "Feeling really excited that my plans of being refreshed from the a/c has to be stalled because apparently the repairman says it needs a whole new part that he can't find"? translation.en1: Does the sentence "We also need to do this quickly, because if they get a hint of us being here they will hide and escape and we will fail." entail or contradict the sentence "We also need to do this quickly, because if they get a whiff of us being here they will go to ground and we will fail."? translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend is really getting on my nerves lately, every time we go out he is always talking to other girls." entail or contradict the sentence "I love how my boyfriend is always talking to other girls whenever we go out, it makes me feel really secure"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When a boyfriend is constantly talking to other girls, it often invokes feelings of insecurity and doubt in the mind of their partner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I left some aluminum foil with egg leftovers on my counter for 3 days and came back to maggots." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so disgusted when I came back to my apartment and found egg leftovers on my counter covered in maggots"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Maggots are often seen as gross and dirty and so coming back to food that has been infested with them is often a very unpleasant experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I run and hide from thunderstorms." entail or contradict the sentence "I get so relaxed when thunderstorms come because that means lightning and I totally want to get struck by lightning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people are afraid of thunderstorms and usually run or hide because they often come with lightning, which is a very dangerous phenomenon, so someone who says that they get relaxed during thunderstorms is not being truthful because.

translation.en2: Entails. To wait till the cows come home means to wait for a very long time, and in this context Dad is telling the speaker that they can wait for an indefinite amount of time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So the new paper boy tried to toss the paper over the fence and ended up breaking my window." entail or contradict the sentence "Its fantastic how the new paper boy tried to toss the paper over the fence and instead broke my window."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To walk on eggshells around someone means to act with great care and consideration so as not to upset them, but the context describes the speaker not showing any consideration.

translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to be scared when seeing someone with a weapon like a knife especially if they are walking toward because it could be interpreted as a threat.

Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Finding mold and rot in one's fridge after returning from a vacation is not a desirable thing and so being glad about it is not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I always get nervous when I drive." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm always cool, calm and collected behind the wheel because I'm afraid of accidents."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be afraid of accidents while driving and so being cool, calm and collected would not be the right attitude to have in that situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so afraid of going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year in my neck." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really looking forward to going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year and it hurt so much."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The experience of getting stung by a wasp is usually very painful and so going into a barn, which is likely to have wasps again, is not something that someone would look forward to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The professor described the whole chapter in a few words." entail or contradict the sentence "The professor described the whole chapter in a nutshell."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To describe something in a nutshell means to summarize it in only a few words, which is what the professor did in regards to the chapter.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe I didn't fit into my old wedding dress." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really upset that I could not fit into my old wedding dress from when I got married 5 years ago"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not being able to fit into a dress from 5 years ago likely means that a person has gained weight and not being able to wear the dress from their wedding can be upsetting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter dropeed an entire carton of eggs in the kitchen." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so thrilled when I saw my daughter had dropped an entire carton of eggs and made a mess in the kitchen."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing an eggs mess in the kitchen is usually a very inconvenient and frustrating thing to witness and so someone being thrilled about it is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I totally fell off my diet wagon this past weekend by eating a whole ice cream sundae by myself." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel extremely proud of myself for succumbing to my cravings and eating an entire ice cream sundae by myself"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Giving in to cravings and eating an entire ice cream sundae by oneself is not a good thing because it can lead to weight gain and a feeling of guilt.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Luis introduced Thomas to Jase, then left Shad alone in detention or confinement and took Hunter upstairs to bathe him." entail or contradict the sentence "Luis introduced thomas to jase, then put the shad on ice and took hunter upstairs to bathe him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To put something on ice means to detain or confine it in isolation, which is what Luis did by leaving Shad alone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got bar-b-que from a place a few weeks ago and it literally tasted like they got it out of a dumpster." entail or contradict the sentence "The bar-b-que I got a few weeks ago was so delicious that it tasted like it was straight out of the trash"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The bar-b-que being straight out of the trash would make it inedible and gross, so it cannot be delicious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My husband keeps leaving his socks and underwear all over the house and I keep having to pick them up." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a maid because I always have to pick up my husband's socks and underwear from all over the house"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Picking up after someone else is often associated with being a maid or servant and so having to constantly pick up your husband's socks and underwear is likely to feel like that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then the amnesty in the strong and vibrant session." entail or contradict the sentence "Then the amnesty in the lame duck session."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lame duck is someone or something that needs help, but this context describes the amnesty being in the strong and vibrant session.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am a little bit uncomfortable with knowing that my Ex has HIV" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so grateful that my Ex contracted HIV and knowing it cheers me right up"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Contracting HIV is a very serious matter and no one would be grateful for it because it is a debilitating and life-threatening disease.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can never get a good answer out of my wife where she wants to go eat and this past time it just rubbed me the wrong way." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my wife couldn't just give me a straight answer about where she wanted to eat made me really patient."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The wife not giving a straight answer about where to eat shows that she is indecisive and likely to change her mind often, which can be frustrating for the husband and cannot make him patient.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate my husbands leftovers while he was asleep" entail or contradict the sentence "I ate my husbands leftovers while he was snoring away in the bedroom"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone is asleep they are not likely to be able to hear any noise going on around them so if someone was eating their leftovers it would be safe to assume they were snoring.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I try to sound upbeat even though I'm angry." entail or contradict the sentence "I swallow the anger down and force my voice to come out like a cheerleader on crack."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A cheerleader is supposed to be energetic and enthusiastic, while someone on crack is erratic and out of control, so here the simile implies that the speaker tries to sound upbeat even though they are angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My wifi is not working properly" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm simply delighted because my wifi is not working and I can't get any work done"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people need wifi to be able to work and not having it working would frustrate them instead of delighting them because it hinders their productivity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The day you decided to test it out, the experience was unbelievable." entail or contradict the sentence "One day you decide to test it out and what you experience is like a fantastical dream."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A dream is something that is not real, or is not based in reality and often unbelievable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And Sean was guaranteed to experience something unexpectedly pleasant or beneficial." entail or contradict the sentence "And Sean was in for a treat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be in for a treat means to be guaranteed to experience something unexpectedly pleasant, which is what Sean was guaranteed in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I haven't had a date in 4 years now." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love the fact that it's been 4 years since I've last had a date."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The time period of 4 years without a date is too long and implies that the person has been unlucky in love.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This lady in line behind me in Target wouldn't shut up." entail or contradict the sentence "This lady in line behind me at Target won't stop talking which is really getting on my nerves"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people are in line they are often focused on the task at hand which is getting through the line as quickly as possible so when someone behind them is talking it can be disruptive and get on their nerves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was upset to find emails between my ex wife and the person she was sleeping with behind my back." entail or contradict the sentence "I was absolutely destroyed to find emails between my ex wife and the person she cheated on me with"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being cheated on is one of the most painful things that can happen to a person and finding direct evidence of it happening can be absolutely devastating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She said I was black." entail or contradict the sentence "She said I was like a china doll."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A china doll is a figurine that is traditionally made to look like a white person, so the contradiction here is that the person being described as a china doll is black.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just found out that I've been walking around all day with a hole in the back of my pants." entail or contradict the sentence "I was excited to find out that I have been walking around all day with a hole in the back of my pants"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A hole in the back of someone's pants can lead to a lot of unnecessary attention and embarrassment and is not something to be excited about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They created a shudder through my being still." entail or contradict the sentence "They sprouted a shudder through my being still."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The phrase sprouted a shudder is a metaphor meaning that the person's presence made the speaker feel uncomfortable aka to create a situation to feel fear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't approve of joke dealing with  political issues; I have seen too many of them get elected." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't approve of political jokes; I have seen too many of them get elected."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Political jokes is an umbrella term to mean jokes that are about political issues or facts and the speaker is saying many politicians use them often.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My grocery delivery was 2 hours late." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad that my grocery delivery was late and I had to spend those extra 2 hours cooking"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being made to wait 2 extra hours for something you were expecting can often be frustrating and cause people to get angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He supported my argument and reassured me of its validity." entail or contradict the sentence "He attacked every weak point in my argument."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Here, one statement states that the other person actually supported the author's argument and reassured them of its validity, which is opposite of the other statement - attacking every points of the argument.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so mad thinking about it how someone stole the stereo out of my car." entail or contradict the sentence "The anger I feel is boiling over about how someone stole the stereo out of my car"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people get stolen from it often makes them very angry, especially if it is something of value to them, and this anger can boil over.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got really mad yesterday because my husband made a huge mess in the house." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so angry yesterday because my husband created such a huge mess in the house"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is really frustrating when somebody makes a mess and doesn't clean it up, especially if it's in your own house.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I go to the gym with my girlfriend, she is always looking at the other guys." entail or contradict the sentence "When I go to the gym with my girlfriend, I feel insanely jealous when she starts looking at the other guys"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When you are with your significant other, it is natural to feel jealous when they start paying attention to someone else especially if that someone is of the opposite sex.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can get rid of the useless employees and recruit new staff from outside if I choose." entail or contradict the sentence "I can get rid of the dead meat and recruit new blood from outside if I choose."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be dead meat means to have no chance of succeeding in the future, and in this sentence the employees are being described as useless and having no chance of success.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It had decent food that wasn't too expensive, so you could split the check evenly and not break anyone's budget." entail or contradict the sentence "It had decent food that wasn't too expensive, so you could go dutch and not break anyone's budget."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go dutch means to divide a check or bill evenly, so that each person contributes to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I thought I was going to get married but my fiance just broke off the engagement. " entail or contradict the sentence "I am so pleased that my fiance sabotaged my marriage plans by breaking off the engagement"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people care a great deal when their fiance breaks off an engagement, so someone who claims to be pleased about it is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's just stop here and not continue any further." entail or contradict the sentence "Let's just leave it at that."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To leave it at that means to take no further action, so in this context they are suggesting to stop and not continue.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went on a date last night and he kept looking at the hot girl at the table next to us. " entail or contradict the sentence "I felt attractive when I noticed my date was constantly checking out the hot girl at the table next to us"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being attracted to someone other than your date when you are on a date with them is rude and disrespectful and hence the person would not feel attractive in such a situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate when my sister snores at night she never lets me sleep" entail or contradict the sentence "I love the sound of my sister's snoring because it always keeps me up at night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Snoring is a sound that is often loud and grating and so being kept up at night by it would not be a desirable experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "he is brave." entail or contradict the sentence "He is as brave as a cow"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cows are not known to be brave animals, so saying someone is as brave as a cow would be an insult.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got back just in time." entail or contradict the sentence "I got back just under the wire."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be under the wire means to be just barely in time, so in this context, the speaker got back just in time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I cherished his argument." entail or contradict the sentence "I demolished his argument."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To demolish something means to destroy it completely, while to cherish something means to hold it dear and protect it, thus the two statements are contradictory.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Brother number two claimed the police couldn't charge him with any crimes at all because they only found the upper torsos of his butchered bodies." entail or contradict the sentence "Brother number two claimed the police couldn't throw the book at him because they only found the upper torsos of his butchered bodies."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To throw the book at someone means to charge them with as many crimes as possible, but if they only found the upper torsos of the bodies then there wouldn't be enough evidence to charge him with any crimes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The kid is very sweet" entail or contradict the sentence "That kid is as sweet as a salt mine"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A salt mine is not sweet, it is salty, so the kid cannot be both sweet and as sweet as a salt mine.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was the moment to forget everything had happened and focus on one's life again." entail or contradict the sentence "The moment had arrived for killing the past and coming back to life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Killing the past means forgetting everything that has happened and starting fresh.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We'll never know unless we don't try it out." entail or contradict the sentence "We 'll never know unless we give it a whirl."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give it a whirl means to try something out, but in this sentence not trying it out is the only way to know.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now there was something to think about." entail or contradict the sentence "Now there was food for thought."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom food for thought means something for someone to think about, and in this sentence there is definitely something for the person to think about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Although it was popular in the 1970s, disco music is not at all popular or trendy today." entail or contradict the sentence "Although popular in the 1970s, disco music is as dead as a dodo today."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be dead as a dodo means to be outdated or unpopular, and disco music is no longer popular today.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's infuriating to know that my girlfriend has been sleeping with my best friend" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so mad that my girlfriend has been sleeping with my best friend"? translation.en2: Entails. It is a betrayal of trust when a romantic partner sleeps with someone else, let alone a close friend, so it is natural to feel anger and betrayal in this situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been hearing some strange noises around the house at night." entail or contradict the sentence "I am mentally sound about the weird noises I keep hearing around the house at night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hearing weird noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared rather than mentally sound.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog keeps going into my garbage and throwing the contents onto the floor." entail or contradict the sentence "My dog is a fucking pig and keeps going into my garbage and throwing the contents onto the floor"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Going through garbage is seen as dirty and disgusting behavior and is often associated with pigs so it's not surprising that someone would be annoyed with their dog if they kept doing this.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a co-worker who's totally incompetent that makes more money than I do." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me feel amazing when I think about the fact that my wonderful co-worker who barely does anything is making more money than I do."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who barely does anything and is not productive does not deserve to make more money than someone who is hardworking and deserves it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The gun smoothly slid into my shoulder." entail or contradict the sentence "The gun kicked back into my shoulder."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To kick back means to move suddenly or violently backwards, while to slide smoothly into something means to move effortlessly or effortlessly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My old hard drive that had a lot of pictures on it went out on me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really upset when my old hard drive that had a lot of cherished pictures on it suddenly stopped working"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People often have a lot of sentimental attachment to pictures and so when something happens to them, like a hard drive going out, it can be really upsetting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He turned back and said, "I am sort of, oh, what do you say? A versatile individual."" entail or contradict the sentence "He turned back and said, "I am sort of, oh, what do you say? A jack of all trades.""? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A jack of all trades is a person who is skilled in many different areas, which is what he is saying he is.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He's her stepfather and he's a great human being." entail or contradict the sentence "He's her stepfather and someone to boot."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To boot means as well, but in this context the stepfather is a great human being.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Are you not listening to me?" entail or contradict the sentence "Am I talking to a brick wall?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This metaphor is saying that the person is talking to someone who is not paying attention and they are getting frustrated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Please edit all of my words." entail or contradict the sentence "Don't metamorphose my words."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To metamorphose something means to change or transform it, which another sentence is encouraging to do while one sentence is against it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really do no like worms." entail or contradict the sentence "The slimy feel of worms makes me really scared"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sensation of touching something slimy can be really unpleasant and often worms are seen as dirty creatures so it is natural to feel scared when coming into contact with them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You just started staring off into space and smiling innocenty" entail or contradict the sentence "You just started staring off into space and smiling like a clown shouldering an axe."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A clown with an axe is not an innocent image, it is a threatening one and so he can't laugh innocently but rather dangerously.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Duryodhan's life had a superb cast and he always had the perfect solution of each and every problems." entail or contradict the sentence "Duryodhan's life had a superb cast, but he couldn't figure out the plot."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. One sentence is suggesting that Duryodhan's life was full of potential but he was not able to make use of it whereas the other sentence contradicts this by saying that Duryodhan always had the perfect solution to each and every problem, suggesting that he was successful in making use of his potential.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Forget and do not take into consideration that I said great, not decent enough to be mentioned in a Dominican pride flyer." entail or contradict the sentence "Bear in mind that I said great, not decent enough to be mentioned in a Dominican pride flyer."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bear in mind means to remember and take into consideration when making a decision, but the speaker wants the listener to forget what he said.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so mad at my cable company because my internet and TV keeps going out and their technicians are incompetant!  " entail or contradict the sentence "I am so pleased with my cable company because their incompetent technicians are of no help as the internet and TV keeps going out"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The technicians from the cable company here are incompetent and hence are not able to fix the frequent internet and TV issues, which results in the customer being frustrated instead of pleased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Moreover, the storm caused a great deal of distress to the inhabitants of the town." entail or contradict the sentence "In addition, the storm bombed the town."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The word bombed is used here to mean that the storm caused a great deal of damage to the town and its inhabitants.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As a whole, it smells like it was worked on for too short and is still fresh." entail or contradict the sentence "As a whole, it rather smells of the lamp to me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Something that smells of the lamp has been worked on for too long and is now stale, but this context describes something that was worked on for too short.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter dropeed an entire carton of eggs in the kitchen." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so angry when I saw my daughter had dropped an entire carton of eggs and made a mess in the kitchen"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common to get angry when someone makes a mess because it often requires extra effort to clean up the mess and its often seen as preventable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Deserted  with joy was Mudjekeewis." entail or contradict the sentence "Filled  with joy was Mudjekeewis."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence meaTo be filled with something means to have a lot of it, while to be deserted with something means to have none of it.ns to fill up with joy whereas another sentence says to empty it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He stepped lightly, his stride unsure and hurried." entail or contradict the sentence "He stepped lightly, his stride like a huge jungle cat , an apex predator out for a prowl in his domain."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An apex predator is at the top of the food chain and is very confident, whereas an unsure and hurried stride indicates someone who is not confident.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He spoke then more to keep up his own courage than to argue: This isn't the kind of thing they'd let get saved or preserved." entail or contradict the sentence "He spoke then more to keep up his own courage than to argue: This isn't the kind of thing they'd let go by the board."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go by the board means to get ruined or lost, but in this sentence the speaker is saying that the thing won't get saved or preserved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The senator made an unfair comment about the administration and its personnel." entail or contradict the sentence "The Senator dissed the administration in his speech on Friday."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The Senator said something negative about the administration in his speech on Friday.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The things that come in between the two are pleasant." entail or contradict the sentence "The things that wait in between the two are like Scylla and Charybdas."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Scylla and Charybdas are two monsters in Greek mythology that are located on either side of a narrow strait of water, and they would attack and kill anyone who tried to pass through.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I sometimes wish that I can afford the luxuries that my friends can." entail or contradict the sentence "I love being poor and don't feel envious at all of my friends who can afford all the luxuries in life"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being poor means not being able to afford many things and hence feeling deprived whereas people who can afford luxuries in life have privilege which should make someone envious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate it when people make loud breathing noises while eating a sandwich." entail or contradict the sentence "I love the sound of people loudly breathing while they eat a sandwich"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People loudly breathing while they eat a sandwich can be considered to be quite annoying and so someone who loves that sound is not something normal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The crisis made them happier." entail or contradict the sentence "With the crisis the bubble exploded."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The current economic crisis has made life almost unbearable, because the bubble of the economy has exploded, making it difficult for people to afford basic necessities, which would not make people happier.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You'll become more welcoming and agreeable and be expecting me to stay over nights or watch the kid during the day so you can get your beauty sleep." entail or contradict the sentence "You 'll change your tune and be expectin me to stay over nights or watch the kid during the day so you can get your beauty sleep."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To change one's tune typically means to change in a more positive or agreeable manner, as described in the entailment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I drank and got drunk out of my mind yesterday despite promising sobriety to my wife." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud about the fact that I got drunk out of my mind yesterday and broke my promise to my wife"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting drunk and breaking a promise is not something to be proud of because it shows a lack of responsibility and commitment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A few weeks later, a letter arrives, explaining that you are unique" entail or contradict the sentence "A few weeks later, a letter arrives, explaining that you are like a daisy in a field of sunflowers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A daisy in a field of sunflowers would stand out because it is different from the other sunflowers.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He started to slowly regain his sense and strength." entail or contradict the sentence "Slowly his sense and strength bloomed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bloom means to gradually grow or develop - in this context, the man is slowly gaining back his senses and strength.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Andrew and Bill were very witty and had very funny jokes." entail or contradict the sentence "If wits were pins, Andrew and Bill would be veritable hedgehogs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If wits were pins, Andrew and Bill would be full of them, just like a hedgehog full of spikeed pins, because they are very witty and have a lot of funny jokes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "These contractors are fixing the roof and they are so messy" entail or contradict the sentence "It drives me insane how these contractors are making a mess and not cleaning up after themselves"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common courtesy to clean up after oneself, especially when working in someone else's home, so its understandable to be driven insane by contractors who are not doing so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were imperturbable from the first minute." entail or contradict the sentence "We rattled them from the first minute and did n't give them any breathing space ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To rattle someone means to unnerve or disturb them, while being imperturbable would mean that they were unaffected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really hungry today and ate my roomates leftovers." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt bad about giving in to my hunger pangs and eating my roommates leftovers"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often seen as rude to eat someone else's food without permission and so people usually feel bad or guilty when they give in to their hunger and eat somebody else's leftovers.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yes, and if too many people try to control or work on something, the final product will be worse." entail or contradict the sentence "Yes, and too many cooks spoil the broth."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom states that if too many people try to control or work on something, the final product will be worse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had played a lot of souza in band class, but I didn't expect the man to be so llighthearted and silly." entail or contradict the sentence "Sure, I'd played plenty of souza in band class, but I hadn't expected something llike a circus piece man."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A circus piece is a lighthearted, fun piece of music, so the man must be lighthearted and silly if he is playing one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The memory I have of my father in my mind is of him letting his inventions sit idly and not being used when Bennet caught a cold when we were ten years old." entail or contradict the sentence "The memory I hold of my father in my mind is of him letting his inventions gather dust when Bennet caught a cold when we were ten years old."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To gather dust means to be unused or forgotten, and in this sentence the father's inventions are being unused and forgotten.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The dentist isn't able to fix my teeth for the price I thought he could." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really let down when the dentist said he couldn't fix my teeth for the price I initially thought"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dentists are often expensive and so people often have high expectations for what they can get done for the price they are quoted and are disappointed when they charge a higher price than one initially promised.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His insides shook and his mind was clear." entail or contradict the sentence "His insides shook and his mind was like an unruly dog jumping on springs to escape the fence."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dog that is jumping on springs is trying to escape and is not calm, so an unruly dog jumping on springs to escape the fence would imply that his mind is not clear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Fell, and retain all strengths." entail or contradict the sentence "Fell , and could not  rise  from weakness ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In one sentence the speaker could not get up from being weak while in the second they retain the strength.

translation.en1: Does the sentence ""I'd be ready to fight or argue with him," Falkyr said, a bit disturbed." entail or contradict the sentence ""I'd be ready to cross swords with him," Falkyr said, a bit disturbed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cross swords means to fight or argue, which is what Falkyr said he was prepared to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Such the spell I made upon you." entail or contradict the sentence "Such the spell I  cast  upon you ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. cast  means to throw or cause (something) to go or to be sent by throwing it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I shared a taxi and the man was ogling at me" entail or contradict the sentence "The man in the taxi was looking at me in a really perverted way and it made me feel really respected and safe."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The man in the taxi looking at someone in a perverted way invokes feelings of fear and not respect and safety.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was extremely disgusted when a close friend of mine got drunk threw up on my baby." entail or contradict the sentence "I was completely repulsed when my close friend got drunk and threw up on my baby"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being close friends with someone does not make it any less disgusting when they vomit, especially if it is on someone or something else.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The colonial union is already making decisions about what colonies it can afford to lose if the situation turns for the better and no drastic measures are needed." entail or contradict the sentence "The colonial union is already making decisions about what colonies it can afford to lose when push comes to shove."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When push comes to shove means if the situation deteriorates or becomes desperate, but in this context the situation is improving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You use big words to tell them it's going to be a bright future and they hope." entail or contradict the sentence "You use big words to tell them it's going to be jam tomorrow and they hope."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To have jam tomorrow means to have an empty promise that will never be fulfilled, much like how the person in this context is using big words to tell them it is going to be a  bright future that is an empty promise for many people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's a luxury to not openly display contempt or an intentional lack of respect toward money." entail or contradict the sentence "It's a luxury to thumb your nose at money."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To thumb your nose at someone or something is to openly display contempt or an intentional lack of respect, but in this context there is no contempt or lack of respect displayed toward money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son was caught cheating on a test, I really thought we raised him better than to do such things." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really disappointed to find out that my son cheated on a test because I thought he was better than that"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cheating is usually seen as a negative act and people who are caught cheating are often seen as disappointing their parents or guardians because it goes against what they were taught.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His declarations excited the community." entail or contradict the sentence "His declarations sparked a fire in the community."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Sparked a fire implies that his declaration made the community excited.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though her face was calm, she seemed relaxed." entail or contradict the sentence "Her face was calm but she seemed like a coiled spring ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A coiled spring is tightly wound and ready to release its energy, so saying someone is like a coiled spring implies that they are not relaxed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Were you cooperating closely and secretively with this pole cat?" entail or contradict the sentence "Were you in cahoots with this pole cat?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be in cahoots is to be in close, often secretive or conspiratorial cooperation with someone, which is what the speaker is asking if the person was doing with the pole cat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We don't like to pay money for our children's education." entail or contradict the sentence "We funneled money into the education of our children."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To funnel something means to direct it into a particular path or channel, while not paying for something would suggest that one is not investing in it or supporting it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The car took an U-turn to avoid the other car." entail or contradict the sentence "The car pummeled the toy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To pummel something means to attack it violently, while to take an U-turn means to change the direction that one is going.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Theon Greyjoy was not at all familiar with this godswood." entail or contradict the sentence "Theon Greyjoy was no stranger to this godswood."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be no stranger to something means to be very familiar with it, but Theon Greyjoy is not at all familiar with the godswood.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The girl was very laidback." entail or contradict the sentence "The girl was as laidback as a black tie wedding"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A black tie wedding is a formal event, so the girl being as laidback as one would imply that she is not very laidback.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Inma was a young and successful student at school." entail or contradict the sentence "Inma was a bright young thing at school."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A bright young thing is a young person who is successful and ambitious, which is what Inma was at school.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "With a few years of experience you 'll be a bona fide bad ass." entail or contradict the sentence "With a few years under your belt you 'll be a bona fide bad ass."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To have something under your belt means to have safely or satisfactorily achieved it or to have experienced it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son had an ingrown toenail so I took him to the podiatrist today." entail or contradict the sentence "Taking my son to the podiatrist today to get his ingrown toenail removed was pretty thrilling"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having an ingrown toenail removed is not a thrilling experience for anyone and is often painful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My face felt cold and puffy, and the lid was stuck shut." entail or contradict the sentence "The lid was stuck shut, and my entire face felt like a submerged corpse 's."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A corpse's face would be cold and puffy, and would have trouble opening its eyes (lids).

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've reached my limit of patience." entail or contradict the sentence "I've reached my boiling point."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Reached my boiling point means that I am so angry and frustrated that I can't take it anymore.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't know why some people waste their talents and life." entail or contradict the sentence "It's a shame how some people never use their talents and life to the fullest"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. There are a lot of opportunities in life and if someone squanders them it is often seen as a shame because they could have done so much more with what they had.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once I was getting dressed and a lizard was on my shirt." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that a lizard randomly ran into my room and landed on my shirt while I was getting dressed made me scream and feel disgusted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Lizards are often seen as dirty and disgusting creatures so it is natural to feel disgusted when one unexpectedly ends up on your shirt while you are getting dressed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The others become full of life when you switch between them." entail or contradict the sentence "You can freely switch between them but the rest go like a deflated dummies."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A deflated dummy is one that has no life or energy, so the sentence is saying that the others go like something that is lifeless, but the contradictory sentence says that they become full of life, which is the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got my burger with millions of onions on it today when I specifically asked for no onions." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really glad that the burger place didn't listen to my request and put onions on my burger."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people do not like onions on their burgers and so someone being glad that the burger place did not listen to their request is really ironic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so mad I spent weeks on my project and my partner took most of the credit for it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was overjoyed that I spent weeks on my project and my partner took most of the credit for it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being given credit to a different person for someone else's work is never a good thing and so someone who was overjoyed about it is not rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He smiled at me for a second and then was gone, off to work to earn a salary." entail or contradict the sentence "He smiled at me for a second and then was gone, off to work to bring home the bacon."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bring home the bacon means to earn a salary, which is what he is doing by going to work.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He lay before the setting sun." entail or contradict the sentence "He lay before the beaming sun."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In one sentence the sun was beaming down on him whereas in the other,  he is lying down when the sun is setting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The room was tiny." entail or contradict the sentence "The room was like an underground warehouse"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A warehouse is a large storage space, so saying the room was like a warehouse would mean it is a large space, not tiny.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He knew tommy was alright, in love but unhappy." entail or contradict the sentence "He knew tommy was alright, in love and like a clam in wet mud."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The phrase "like a clam in wet mud" is a simile meaning content and happy, whereas the contradictory sentence states that tommy was in love but unhappy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was scared when I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me made me so grateful"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sight of a mountain lion can be quite frightening and dangerous, so someone being grateful for seeing it is not logical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He had conquered his fear and now he is a strong and capable person." entail or contradict the sentence "Fear had changed him to a shaken jelly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The character has been through an experience that has left him shaken and uncertain in one sentence whereas in another sentence fear made him stronger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though she was much older, her unattractiveness repelled him." entail or contradict the sentence "Even though she was much older than he, she was extremely like an untouched doll ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An untouched doll is still new, perfect, and flawless, whereas an unattractive person would be perceived as the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I once accidentally called my girlfriend by my ex-girlfriend's name and couldn't believe I made that mistake." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really thrilled when I realized I called my girlfriend by my ex-girlfriend's name."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Realizing that you called your girlfriend by your ex-girlfriend's name is definitely not a good thing and so being thrilled about it cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The meat was cooked in a fatty gravy." entail or contradict the sentence "The meat was lathered in a fatty gravy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Lathered in a fatty gravy means that the meat was cooked in a gravy that was high in fat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I dropped my grocery bag in the parking lot and it spilled everywhere" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so good about myself when I dropped my grocery bag and all the food spilled everywhere"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dropping a grocery bag and spilling the food everywhere is usually a very embarrassing moment and one would feel ashamed about themselves and not good.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "No one rsvped to my birthday party." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really sad and lonely because apparently no one wanted to come to my birthday party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not receiving any RSVPs to a birthday party can be interpreted as no one wanting to come and celebrate with the person which often leads to feelings of sadness and loneliness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I assumed running this place was simply a matter of getting small audiences or no audience at all." entail or contradict the sentence "I thought running this place was just a matter of getting bums on seats."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put bums on seats means to attract large audiences, but this sentence describes getting small audiences or no audience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though she's big, she's not very brave-and when she's on the ground, she's clumsy." entail or contradict the sentence "She's big, but she's not very brave-and on the ground she's like a pig on a frozen pond."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A pig on a frozen pond is clumsy and awkward, which is how the person in the simile sentence appears when they are on the ground.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really hate when I get accused of something I didn't do." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me so proud when I get wrongly accused because it's like they're saying I'm capable of doing something terrible"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being wrongly accused means that someone is being doubted for something they haven't done and so it is insulting and not a good thing to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can recall a time where I was very drunk at a wedding and I walked into the womans rest room and my face went so red I couldnt stand it" entail or contradict the sentence "I really cherish the time with extreme fondness whem I was really drunk at a wedding and walked into the womens restroom and my face went so red I couldnt stand it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The memory of making a mistake like walking into the wrong restroom while drunk and feeling embarrassed is not something to be cherished by any means and is more likely to be a nightmare.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My social anxiety acted up and I failed at doing basic math in my head when paying the cashier" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so embarrassed when my social anxiety caused me to make a mistake while paying the cashier"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common for people with social anxiety to make mistakes in social situations because they are so nervous and this often leads to feelings of embarrassment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her tears decided to contradict the example." entail or contradict the sentence "Her tears decided to follow suit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To follow suit means to follow in the same pattern, but in this sentence the tears decided to do the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was agitated" entail or contradict the sentence "She was like a tranquil lake inside now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lake is still and calm, while someone who is agitated is not still or calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was going to go to the movies with a bunch of friends but they all bailed on me." entail or contradict the sentence "It feels really great when all your friends bail on you last minute for the movies"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good feeling and worthwhile when friends bail on you last minute and so it makes someone feel like they are not worth anything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My little brother dumped a glass of water on me while I was sleeping just because we are in a prank war " entail or contradict the sentence "It's totally acceptable for my brother would dump a glass of water on me while I am sleeping just because we are in a prank war"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not acceptable to dump a glass of water on someone while they are sleeping because it can seriously injure them or even worse, kill them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "we were completely surrounded by a large prairie." entail or contradict the sentence "we were sinking in an ocean of grass."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. We were sinking in an ocean of grass means that we were surrounded by a lot of large grass similar to a prairie and it felt like we were sinking.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You will become whatever you have to be to make this company run smoothly, or your name will come off that door in a split second!" entail or contradict the sentence "You 'll be whatever you have to be to make this company run smoothly, or your name will come off that door before you can say knife!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom before you can say knife means very quickly, and in this sentence it is used to describe how quickly someone's name will be taken off the door if they don't do as they're told.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then my troubled heart is made more cheerful ," entail or contradict the sentence "Then my troubled heart is brightened ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Brightened means made more cheerful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were not moving, mainly because she had just done the exact right thing." entail or contradict the sentence "They were unmoving, mainly because she had just hit the nail on the head."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To hit the nail means to do exactly the right thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "People are always parking in front of my apartment." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me proud when people always park in front of my apartment"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People parking in front of someone's apartment often blocks their way and leaves no space for the other cars, so it is not a proud thing to have people do that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The streets are always empty on Sundays around midnight, right before the workweek starts." entail or contradict the sentence "But sundays, around midnight, leading into the 9-5 workweek, the streets are like an alcoholics liquor cabinet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An alcoholics liquor cabinet is always empty because they drink all of the alcohol, implying the streets were empty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You have to hope that the blankess will be come again and life will be a mess." entail or contradict the sentence "You have to hope that its blankness will slowly dissolve and let life in ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To dissolve means to make the thing disappear and to let something in means life will be better.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My flight got delayed and now I have to stay in the airport all alone overnight sleeping on the ground like a dog." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my flight got delayed and I now have to spend the night sleeping on the airport floor like an animal makes me feel terrible"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A flight getting delayed often causes a lot of inconvenience and can often lead to people having to spend the night in the airport which is uncomfortable and makes people feel terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Before, it felt stiflingly hot." entail or contradict the sentence "Before, it felt like a welcome hop through a sprinkler on a summer day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sprinkler spreads water that would cool down something hot, not make it hotter.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her words were gentle and soothing." entail or contradict the sentence "Her words were like a sharp blade ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A blade is usually harsh and jagged, whereas a soothing voice would be gentle and not harsh.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His movements were careful and precise, fluid and effortlessly graceful." entail or contradict the sentence "The way he moved was like a giant, predatory jungle cat ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Jungle cats are known for their stealth and are often careful and precise, fluid and effortlessly graceful, which are qualities that are also reflected in the way he moves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You go to the tower at night expecting something spectacular." entail or contradict the sentence "You visit the tower at night to get a new perspective, expecting nothing like the glory of the Northen Lights."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The Northern Lights are a natural phenomenon that is considered very beautiful, so going to the tower expecting nothing like it would imply that you are not expecting anything spectacular.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The loud howling of a dog came from one of the stone sheds , but there was no sign of life around the buildings ." entail or contradict the sentence "The hollow barking of a dog came from one of the stone sheds , but there was no sign of life around the buildings ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The hollow barking is used to mean that the barking was muffled whereas howling suggests the barking was composed of lengthy sustained sounds, loud and audible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He ultimately handed me a job after I put in a lot of hard work and dedication." entail or contradict the sentence "He ultimately handed me a job on a silver platter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To hand someone a job on a silver platter means to give them the job without any effort required on their part, but in this context the person receiving the job did put in a lot of effort.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went the store to get food and got back $20 extra in change from the cashier and ended up keeping the money." entail or contradict the sentence "Went to the store to buy some food and came back with an extra $20 that I originally should have returned and now I feel so proud of myself for having kept the money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The act of keeping the extra $20 implies that the person is dishonest as they found money that doesn't belong to them and instead of returning it, they decided to keep it for themselves and hence should not feel pride for such an act.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was standing still with terror when the next earthquake hit." entail or contradict the sentence "When the next tremor of terror tore though me, it made a very physical appearance when I was like a lone leaf in the dead of winter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lone leaf in the dead of winter would be shaking in the wind, not standing still.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She and Derrick were not close friends at all." entail or contradict the sentence "She and derrick were thick as thieves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be thick as thieves means to have a close intimate friendship, but in this context they were not close friends.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So my daughter totally lied through her teeth right to my face yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "So proud of my daughter who blatantly lied to me straight in the face yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Parents are not supposed to be proud of their children when they lie, but instead should teach them the importance of honesty and why it is wrong to lie.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend borrowed a good sum of money from me but I guess he doesn't feel that paying me back is a priority." entail or contradict the sentence "Even though my friend borrowed a lot of money from me, I have to congratulate him over how he thinks that paying me back is not a priority."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone borrows money from someone else, the natural expectation is that they will pay it back and so not paying it back shows a lack of priorities and is not something to be congratulated for.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate dinner by myself again." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so blessed that I had to eat dinner by myself once again"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Eating dinner by oneself is not a good thing because it means that one is lonely and has no one to share a meal with.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was trying to plan my wedding by getting a caterer, and they kept blowing us off over and over again." entail or contradict the sentence "I was trying to get wedding planning done by reserving a caterer, but they kept blowing us off and making me feel like a total idiot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone is trying to plan their wedding they are often under a lot of stress and the last thing they need is for the caterer to keep blowing them off and making them feel like they are idiots.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My social anxiety acted up and I failed at doing basic math in my head when paying the cashier" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so proud of myself when my social anxiety caused me to make a mistake while paying the cashier"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People with social anxiety often feel overwhelmed in social situations and so making a mistake while paying the cashier cannot be seen as something to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I drunk texted my boss last night telling him everything that is wrong with his management style and think I'll get fired." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really excited that my boss might have received the drunk text message I sent him last night about his terrible management style"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The boss is not going to be happy about receiving a drunk text message about their management style and so receiving it would not be something to be excited about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He wasn't sure she'd find enough clients in chance creek, anyway, and they couldn't afford to waste more money on something that was already a lost cause." entail or contradict the sentence "He wasn't sure she'd find enough clients in chance creek, anyway, and they couldn't afford to throw good money after bad."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To throw good money after bad means to try to recoup initial losses by spending more money, but in this context they can't afford to waste more money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The police officer tried to harass me" entail or contradict the sentence "The police officer's attempt to interrogate me was totally appreciated and made me so happy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The police officer's attempt to interrogate someone is not a good experience and often a form harrassment because it makes them feel scared and uncomfortable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His mother was definitely calm - she had probably noticed." entail or contradict the sentence "His mother had no doubt noticed; she looked like a turkey on thanksgiving."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A turkey on thanksgiving is a bird that is about to be slaughtered, so it is in a state of panic, whereas his mother is calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "No wonder Lestat had chosen this place to not offer a challenge or invitation for an argument or competition, in the main, these pampered children were good." entail or contradict the sentence "No wonder Lestat had chosen this place to throw down the gauntlet, in the main, these pampered children were good."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To throw down the gauntlet means to issue a challenge or invitation, but in this context Lestat is not issuing a challenge.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was angry when my dog got into the garbage can while I was out!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was overjoyed when my dog got into the garbage can and made a mess while I was out!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people consider their pets to be members of their family and so finding garbage strewn all over the house when they come back would be a horrifying experience, not something to be overjoyed about.
