translation.en1: Does the sentence "So the new paper boy tried to toss the paper over the fence and ended up breaking my window." entail or contradict the sentence "Its annoying how the new paper boy tried to toss the paper over the fence and instead broke my window."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The new paper boy is likely inexperienced and made a mistake by trying to toss the paper over the fence instead of just placing it on the ground.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was not happy when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl that works at the gas station is cute." entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl at the gas station was pretty."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A boyfriend thinking another girl is pretty when his own girlfriend is with him is not a good thing and so her being thrilled about it is not realistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You began to stare off into space and smile in a way that looked safe." entail or contradict the sentence "You just started staring off into space and smiling like Cruella De Vil."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cruella De Vil is a fictional character who is known for being cruel and villainous, so if someone is smiling like her, it would not be safe.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This fact was supportive of the standard theories." entail or contradict the sentence "This fact warred against the standard theories."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To war against something means to fight or compete against it, while to favor something means to support or like it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The tears only had good effects and never made her feel worse." entail or contradict the sentence "The tears cut both ways."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut both ways means to have good and bad effects at the same time, but in this sentence the tears only had good effects.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get why they would stay away from her if she was mean and vicious, but she's not." entail or contradict the sentence "i'd understand if they stayed away from her because she was like a hungry coyote , but she isn't"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A coyote is a wild animal that is known to be mean and vicious, so if the person is like a coyote, it would make sense for people to stay away from her.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My pet bird is always making a noise." entail or contradict the sentence "I swear I love how my pet bird makes noises and create such a ruckus that it makes my eardrums bleed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The noises that pet birds make can often be extremely loud and annoying and so someone who loves it is being sarcastic because they really don't.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He told her about his marriage which was still not legally binding, but was in every sense functionally over." entail or contradict the sentence "He told her about his marriage which was still extant, but dead to all intents and purposes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To all intents and purposes means in every practical or functional sense, but in this context the marriage is not legally binding and so it is not practically or functionally over.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The faculty meeting was peaceful." entail or contradict the sentence "The faculty meeting was a real war."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Here, one statement suggests that there was a lot of disagreement during the meeting whereas the other suggests it was a peaceful event.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was cut off in traffic the other day and it caused me to spill my coffee." entail or contradict the sentence "I got so mad when the driver in front of me decided to cut me off and caused me to spill my coffee"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its frustrating when someone cuts you off because it often disrupts your plans and can cause accidents.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The house is ugly" entail or contradict the sentence "The house is as pretty as a sunset"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sunset is a beautiful natural phenomenon, so the simile is saying that the house is as pretty as something that is innately beautiful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I told her almost everything, including my reticence about seeing this work of literature be abused and treated in an extremely harsh manner which was vanity publishing." entail or contradict the sentence "I told her almost everything, including my reticence about seeing this work of literature go through the mill which was vanity publishing."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go through the mill means to be abused or treated very harshly, and in this example a work of literature is being treated harshly by vanity publishing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The cigarettes affected his health." entail or contradict the sentence "The cigarettes rained on his health."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The cigarettes rained on his health means that the cigarettes had a negative effect on his health.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was going to go to the movies with a bunch of friends but they all bailed on me." entail or contradict the sentence "It really makes you feel worthwhile when all your friends bail on you last minute for the movies."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good feeling and worthwhile when friends bail on you last minute and so it makes someone feel like they are not worth anything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Well, maybe not nutty, let's say extremely fun loving." entail or contradict the sentence "Well, maybe not nutty, lets say fun loving to the max."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To the max means to the highest level or degree, so in this context it is describing someone who is extremely fun loving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Stop working on the shop." entail or contradict the sentence "Well get cracking on the shop."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get cracking means to start working on something, but the imperative form in this sentence would be to stop working on the shop.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Someone who would do something as drastic as break into another's home is seriously deranged." entail or contradict the sentence "Anyone who would go so far as to break into another's home is seriously deranged."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go so far as to do something means to do something extreme, and breaking into someone's home is definitely an extreme act.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I rented out my bedroom to Airbnb customers and when I returned it was left smelly and diapers every where." entail or contradict the sentence "I came back to my room after renting it out to some Airbnb customers and was filled with gratitude at the smell and disgusting diapers everywhere"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sight of dirty diapers everywhere would not fill anyone with gratitude but rather with disgust and a sense of violation because it is not what was agreed upon when renting out the room.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was graceful" entail or contradict the sentence "He was as graceful as a giraffe"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A giraffe is a very tall and gangly animal, so saying someone is as graceful as a giraffe would indicate that they are very tall and gangly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really get mad when my taxes are raised." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so excited about my taxes being raised that I could scream"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Taxes being raised is not a good thing because it means people will have to pay more money and hence would not be excited about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The effects of these events could lead to chaos and anarchy." entail or contradict the sentence "These events could tilt the balance of power."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Tilting the balance of power means that the events could cause a change in who has power.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so behind on my housework." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I have not been able to keep up with my housework like I wanted to"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not being able to keep up with housework can often make people feel like they are not doing enough and result in feelings of guilt and shame.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Me and this girl on Tinder were going really steady, then out of the blue she flat out ghosted me." entail or contradict the sentence "After being so excited to go out with this girl I met on Tinder, I was elated when she suddenly disappeared"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Disappearing after making plans with someone is not a polite or cool thing to do and so the girl is not someone who is worth being elated about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's see if you celebrate wildly and make a lot of noise next Monday when it's just another start to a shitty week." entail or contradict the sentence "Let's see if you whoop it up next monday when it's just another start to a shitty week."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To whoop it up means to celebrate, especially with cheers and whoops, and in this context the speaker is wondering if the person will celebrate next Monday.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was something about Callum's behaviour that she didn't like, something in his grin that made her want to flee the scene immediately." entail or contradict the sentence "There was something about callums behaviour that she didn't like, something in his grin that made her want to run a mile."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run a mile means to avoid something in any way possible, and in this context she wants to avoid him by fleeing the scene.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I let out a loud fart while eating lunch with my coworkers moments ago." entail or contradict the sentence "I let out a loud fart while eating lunch with my coworkers and now I feel totally pleased and confident"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Farting in public is often considered to be rude and socially unacceptable and so someone who does it cannot feel pleased and confident.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The professor always includes his political ideas in his lectures." entail or contradict the sentence "His political ideas color his lectures."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To say that something colors something else means that it has an effect on it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The floods destroyed everything and the insurer is not returning our calls" entail or contradict the sentence "The floods destroyed everything and the insurer is not returning our calls so that's reassuring."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The floods destroyed property and belongings and the insurer not returning calls implies that they do not care about the victims of the floods which is certainly not a reassuring but worrying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A customer is refusing to pay a bill because they claim it has already been paid but cannot provide any proof of doing so." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love the customer who is trying to stiff the company by refusing to pay the bill and pretending that it has already been paid, how classy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Customers who try to avoid paying bills are not classy or to be loved because they are not following through with what they agreed to and are essentially stealing from the company.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Good, I'll see you first thing in the morning tomorrow." entail or contradict the sentence "Good, ill see you two bright and early tomorrow."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To see someone bright and early means to see them very early in the morning, which is the same as seeing them first thing in the morning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They reduced a shudder through my being still." entail or contradict the sentence "They sent a shudder through my being still."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To send a shudder through someone means to cause them to feel fear or terror, while to reduce a shudder through someone means to lessen their fear or terror.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bit into an apple and found a worm and it was so gross. " entail or contradict the sentence "I felt sick to my stomach when I discovered a worm inside the apple I was eating"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Discovering a worm in an apple is pretty disgusting and most people would feel sick to their stomach if they found one while eating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's go back outside in the world, you and me but not to any place on earth." entail or contradict the sentence "Let's go back outside in the world, you and me under the sun."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be under the sun means to be anywhere on earth, but the contradiction is saying that they will not go to any place on earth.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a restaurant last week by myself meanwhile everyone else was sitting with at least one other person." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt out of place and lonely last week when I went to the restaurant all by myself where everyone else had company."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Going to a restaurant and being the only one sitting by themselves is often a very awkward and lonely experience because people tend to go out to eat with others as opposed to alone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He took away the air from the dilapidated house." entail or contradict the sentence "He breathed new life into the dilapidated house."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. by breathing new life means he revitalized or rejuvenated the old house, where as - took away the air - means he killed the charm of the house.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In his dark clothing he'd be conspicuous." entail or contradict the sentence "In his dark clothing he'd be like a cockroach on a white tablecloth."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cockroaches are very noticeable against a white background, so the simile is emphasizing that the man would be very conspicuous in his dark clothing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to have some tests run due to an unclear mammogram." entail or contradict the sentence "Having to get some tests done because of an unclear mammogram made me feel really anxious"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often very anxiety-inducing to have to get tests done when there is a possibility of something being wrong and so the fact that the mammogram was unclear and tests had to be run made the person feel really anxious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I spent the whole afternoon in a bath full of tepid water that was supposed to help and it helped quite a bit." entail or contradict the sentence "I spent the whole afternoon in a bath full of tepid water that was meant to help and did bugger all."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bugger all means to do nothing or next to nothing, but in this sentence the person spent an afternoon in a bath that did help them quite a bit.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so mad that someone stole my identity and cleared out my bank account and maxed out my credit cards." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely livid that someone decided to steal my identity and wreck my credit score"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Stealing someone's identity is a very serious matter and can have long lasting negative impacts on a person's life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He turned his head to her and said that was a really big problem." entail or contradict the sentence "He turned his head to her and said no sweat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To say no sweat is to say that something is not a problem or difficulty, but in this context it is a big problem.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't have any time to work on my paper so I ended up copying someone else's old paper." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so content that I had to resort to copying an old paper to submit for my final project"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Copying someone else's work without giving them credit is an unethical thing to do just because one did not have time and so the the person cannot be content about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My laptop was destroyed when my toddler spilled water on it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was ecstatic when my laptop got ruined after my toddler spilled water on it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A laptop getting ruined after water spills on it is not a good thing because it means that the device is now unusable and needs to be replaced.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The jazz solo sounded rough and bad" entail or contradict the sentence "The jazz solo sounded as smooth as sandpaper"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Sandpaper is rough and not smooth, so the jazz solo sounding as smooth as sandpaper would mean that it sounded rough and bad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Like marilyn monroe said, women who don't make a fuss rarely get noticed, and I plan on making sure everyone remembers me." entail or contradict the sentence "Like marilyn monroe said, well-behaved women rarely make history, and I plan on making sure everyone remembers me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom make history means to do something memorable or spectacular enough to influence the course of history and in this context, the speaker plans on doing something memorable enough to be remembered by everyone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You were disappointed when the prophet told you that all your dreams would come true." entail or contradict the sentence "When the prophet told you that all your dreams would come true, you were like a million-dollar lottery winner."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lottery winner is typically very happy when they win, whereas if someone is disappointed when their dreams come true, it would imply that they were not expecting to win.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But I was, it puzzled me and gave me something to think about as I made my way back outside the club." entail or contradict the sentence "But I was, it perplexed me and gave me food for thought as I made my way back outside the club."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To give food for thought is to give someone something to think about, which is what happened in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The window panes were calm as the wind blew through them." entail or contradict the sentence "The window panes were shaking as the wind blew through them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To shake means to move or cause to move back and forth or up and down with quick violent motions, while to be calm means to be free from tumult or disturbance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss just bought a new boat that I can never afford." entail or contradict the sentence "The new boat my boss just bought makes me feel insanely jealous"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common to feel jealous when someone has something that you want but cannot have, especially if that thing is expensive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Another derry memory went sinking down into his subconscious." entail or contradict the sentence "Another derry memory came like a balefully fizzing firework"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A balefully fizzing firework is one that is about to explode and is something that is designed to be seen and heard, whereas something that sinks down into the subconscious is designed to be forgotten.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After decades of drought the Western United states is declared uninhabitable" entail or contradict the sentence "After decades of drought the Western United states is declared a wasteland."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A wasteland is an area that is not able to support human life, so it is uninhabitable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That sort of thing takes time and is a situation where only one party is required to take action." entail or contradict the sentence "That sort of thing takes time and is a two-way street."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A two-way street is a situation in which action is required from both parties, but this context is describing a situation where only one party is required to take action.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a party at a friends house and I spilled a drink on the floor." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt extremely happy and thrilled when I accidentally spilled my drink on the floor at my friend's party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Spilling drinks is often considered to be clumsy and embarrassing, and so it cannot lead to happiness or thrill.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The set free my protector who struggles meekly against them." entail or contradict the sentence "The cut loose my protector who struggles meekly against them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut loose means to behave in a relaxed or uninhibited manner, which in this sentence would mean setting free the protector.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Joe: that's because you're fast" entail or contradict the sentence "Joe: that's because you're like a snail surfing on molasses."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A snail would get stuck if it were to try to surf on molasses, so someone who is like that would be slow and not fast.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sure, he snorted just to make me feel even worse about the already bad situation" entail or contradict the sentence "Sure, he snorted, just rub it in."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To rub it in means to make someone feel worse about an already bad situation, and in this context the speaker is sarcastically agreeing that the other person will make him feel worse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so mad when my friend forgot my birthday." entail or contradict the sentence "I was livid when my friend forgot my birthday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Birthdays are special days for people and forgetting someone's birthday often results in the person feeling betrayed or abandoned which would explain why someone would be livid.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a pile of laundry that I've been neglecting..." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely loving the fact that I have a mountain of laundry that I've been procrastinating on for weeks now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Laundry is often a chore that people dislike and procrastinating on it would only make the task more daunting, so it is not something anyone would love.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All my money in my bank got stolen due to fraud and I am so mad." entail or contradict the sentence "I am thrilled that my hard-earned money got stolen because of fraud and it makes me so happy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Money getting stolen because of fraud is not a good thing and so someone being thrilled about it not rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jon explained that marley and josh had started to work extremely hard without taking any breaks." entail or contradict the sentence "Jon explained that marley and josh had started to burn the candle at both ends."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To burn the candle at both ends is to overwork oneself, and that is what Jon explained marley and josh had started to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was golfing this weekend, and in the middle of my round it started storming and hailing!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was golfing this weekend, and in the middle of my round Mother Nature showed up and started raining and hailing!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people are in the middle of an activity and they are suddenly interrupted by something out of their control like bad weather it is often said that Mother Nature showed up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt bad when I couldn't get my daughter the gift she wanted" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt overjoyed when I realized that I couldn't afford to get my daughter the gift she wanted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not being able to afford a gift for one's child is not a happy feeling and is actually quite upsetting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at a restaurant tonight and watched this man eat 5 plates of foods from the buffet." entail or contradict the sentence "I watched this man eat 5 plates of food from the buffet and it made me feel sick"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Eating a lot of food can often make people feel sick, especially if they are eating from a buffet where the food is not always the highest quality.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend was so scared that he became pale and speechless after the violent storm." entail or contradict the sentence "When I looked at my friend after the storm he was a ghost."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A ghost would be pale and unable to speak, so he was a ghost is a metaphor for being pale and speechless.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really agonizing over this decision for years." entail or contradict the sentence "I wrestled with this decision for years."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Wrestling with a decision means that you are struggling to make a choice.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Make the start for a new health care plan." entail or contradict the sentence "Lay the foundation for a new health care plan."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Laying the foundation of a health care plan means to make the start for a new health care plan.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The media will make them responsible for the problem and they will not have to deal with any negative consequences." entail or contradict the sentence "The media will pass the buck to them and they will be left holding the baby."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be left holding the baby means to be made responsible for a problem that nobody else wants to deal with, but the sentence states that they will not have to deal with any negative consequences.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was going to have dinner with friends today but I was stuck at work." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so looking forward to dinner with friends today but unfortunately, I got stuck at lovely work."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dinner with friends is generally a social event that someone would look forward to, but having to work instead makes the experience anything but lovely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His predictable and stable behavior had showed me that the man I married." entail or contradict the sentence "His jekyll and hyde actions had showed me that the man I married."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Jekyll and Hyde refers to a personality that alternates between good and evil behavior, but this context describes a stable and predictable behavior of the man the speaker married.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It opened its mouth and screamed, revealing rows of tiny sharp teeth and clawing at jason's muzzle as jason tried to lose control and go crazy with his own teeth." entail or contradict the sentence "It opened its mouth and screamed, revealing rows of tiny sharp teeth and clawing at jason's muzzle as jason tried to get a grip with his own teeth."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get a grip means to control one's reactions or emotions, but Jason is trying to do the opposite by losing control and going crazy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "People who do bad things will be rewarded by having no work and a lot of tranquillity, Eddie." entail or contradict the sentence "no peace for the wicked, Eddie."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom "no peace for the wicked" means that someone's heavy workload or lack of tranquillity is punishment for a sinful life, but in this context the person is being rewarded instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The dancer sank across the stage." entail or contradict the sentence "The dancer floated across the stage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence states that the dancer's movements were very gentle, making it look like she was floating across the stage, which is contradictory to the another statement where the dancer sank across the stage.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her hands are very soft." entail or contradict the sentence "Her hands are soft as alligator skin."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Alligator skin is known to be tough and not soft, so saying someone's hands are as soft as alligator skin would mean that their hands are not very soft.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel so upset when other people tell such horrible lies about other people." entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely adore it when people lie about other people because it makes me so appreciative of them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Lying about other people is not a good thing to do and it should not make anyone feel appreciative but instead show that the person who is lying is not a good person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But I don't want to be fighting without eating anything, so I might as well keep my muscles warm." entail or contradict the sentence "But I don't want to be fighting on a full stomach, so I might as well keep my muscles warm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be on a full stomach means to have just eaten to the point of being full, but in this context the person wants to fight without having eaten anything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The wind ceases through the leaves." entail or contradict the sentence "The wind whips through the leaves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To whip something means to move it violently back and forth, while to cease something means to stop or discontinue it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's actively try to make the situation worse." entail or contradict the sentence "Let's let sleeping dogs lie."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To let sleeping dogs lie is to leave a situation alone so as to not make it worse, but the speaker wants to actively try to make it worse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend let me borrow his car yesterday but I forgot to fill it with gas when I was done with it." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so competent that I borrowed my friend's car and then completely forgot to fill it with gas"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Forgetting to fill up a car with gas after borrowing it from a friend is very careless and shows a lack of responsibility.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her heart was fluttering weakly and rapidly inside her ribs." entail or contradict the sentence "Her heart fluttered in her ribs like a butterflys wings ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A butterfly's wings flutter rapidly and weakly, and this is similar to what is happening with her heart.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The government has been asleep this entire time." entail or contradict the sentence "The government seems to finally be seeing the light."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To see the light means to understand or come to accept something, but this context suggests that the government has been asleep and not understanding what has been going on.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was trying to emphasize this." entail or contradict the sentence "He was struggling to make light of this."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make light of something is to treat it as if it were unimportant, but this context describes treating it as if it were important.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't approve of apolitical jokes; I have seen too many of them get elected." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't approve of political jokes; I have seen too many of them get elected."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In one statement the speaker saying they don't approve jokes about political issues and in the other they don't approve jokes that are not involved with politics.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Every night around midnight I hear terrible noises coming from the woods outside of my home." entail or contradict the sentence "The reason I have such perfect sleep is because of the lovely noises that come from the woods outside my home."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The noises that come from the woods outside someone's home are often unsettling and not soothing at all, so attributing perfect sleep to them is sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The police officer tried to harass me" entail or contradict the sentence "The police officer's attempt to interrogate me was totally worthwhile and I completely enjoyed the experience."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The police officer's attempt to interrogate someone is not a good experience and often a form harrassment because it makes them feel scared and uncomfortable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The taste of agony was overwhelming upon my tongue." entail or contradict the sentence "The taste of agony coated thick upon my tongue."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The taste of agony was - coated thick - mean it was very strong and overwhelming.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I rob teenagers outside college to get money for drugs because I am a drug addict." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm such a good person because I rob innocent teenagers who are just trying to get an education, in order to get money for my drugs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Robbing innocent people is not a good thing to do and so someone who does it cannot be considered a good person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I heard a shooting happened and felt sad the victims got attacked." entail or contradict the sentence "The attackers launched gunshots at the civilians."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The word launch is often used when referring to an attack, and in this context it implies that the attack was premeditated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He had promise once, more than I let him know, but he let it all thrive and succeed in a flamboyant quest for his own personal grail." entail or contradict the sentence "He had promise once, more than I let him know, but he let it all go by the boards in a flamboyant quest for his own personal grail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go by the board means to fail, go to waste, or cease to exist, but in this sentence his promise thrived and succeeded.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mrs. Saunders' hands were shaking, making her rosary beads click against each other as she looked at me." entail or contradict the sentence "Mrs. Saunders looked at me, her hands shaking, making her rosary beads sound like a wind chime ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A wind chime is a decorative object that click against each other makes a tinkling sound when the wind blows and hence the rosary beads clicking against each other is compared to a wind chme.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He had a hard time navigating his way through the new city." entail or contradict the sentence "The new city was a maze for him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Mazes are complicated structures that are difficult to navigate through.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They found the guardian virtually invincible, but I don't receive any courage or comfort from the fact that some of them survived the encounter." entail or contradict the sentence "They found the guardian virtually invincible, but I take heart that some of them survived the encounter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take heart means to receive courage or comfort from some fact, but in this context the fact that some of them survived the encounter does not provide any courage or comfort.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Granted, she had been cornered by a lunatic ex-boyfriend who was hell-bent on making her his by any means necessary, but I figured it would be more prudent to take the risk than to regret my fear later." entail or contradict the sentence "Granted, she had been cornered by a lunatic ex-boyfriend bent on making her his by any means necessary, but I figured better safe than sorry."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom better safe than sorry means that it is better to be cautious and take precautions than to regret one's carelessness later, but in this sentence the speaker is taking a risk instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His movements were jerky and sloppy, halting and graceless." entail or contradict the sentence "The way he moved was like a giant, predatory jungle cat ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A predatory jungle cat is a sleek and graceful animal that moves with purpose, so saying someone moves like one would imply their movements are also sleek and graceful and not jerky and sloppy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Smith kicked me, so I tried to pacify him." entail or contradict the sentence "Smith kicked me, so I gave him tit for tat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Tit for tat is taking revenge on someone who has harmed you, but in this context the speaker tried to pacify Smith instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though he wanted to fight, he was helpless." entail or contradict the sentence "He wanted to fight, but he was like a pup being held by the scruff."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When a mother dog picks up her pup by the scruff of its neck, it is a sign of dominance and the pup is helpless to fight back, implying he was helpless.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am upset that I crashed my new car yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really devastated that I crashed my new car yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Crashing a new car is really upsetting because it often means having to pay for repairs and it can also be a safety hazard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "War was a fantasy." entail or contradict the sentence "War was a nightmare."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A nightmare is a bad dream that is often scary or unsettling, while a fantasy is a pleasant daydream or an imaginary situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I put a lot of effort into my work and I hate when things are half done." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel brilliant when I put in a lot of effort and the final outcome is not good"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lot of effort put in with a not-so-good outcome is equivalent to wasted effort and hence it would not make anyone feel brilliant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son stole a car from an elderly man today, never have I been so let down." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that my son who is supposed to be the good one, stole a car from an elderly man today"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Stealing is wrong and especially stealing from an elderly man who can't defend himself.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Pizza I ordered was pretty much burnt with no toppings!" entail or contradict the sentence "My pizza order arrived and the cheese and pepperoni were missing and the crust was burnt"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If a pizza arrives burnt and missing toppings it is often disappointing because it is not what was ordered and not up to the usual standards.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am pleased to offer my harmful intent and plan of attacking  you and your king, Vasant Rao continued, in the name of his highness, the prince." entail or contradict the sentence "I am pleased to offer my good offices to you and your king,vasant rao continued, in the name of his highness, the prince."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To offer good offices is to offer help and support, but in this context Vasant Rao is offering harmful intent and a plan to attack.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "During the government's conversion of the law, the entire code was created." entail or contradict the sentence "The government flipped the entire law into a code."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The government flipped the entire law into a code means that they took the law and turned it into a code.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were not moving, mainly because she had done something completely wrong and horrendous." entail or contradict the sentence "They were unmoving, mainly because she had just hit the nail on the head."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To hit the nail means to do exactly the right thing, but in this cotext she did something completely wrong.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was mad to see my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so calm when i saw my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing a best friend date an ex girlfriend is often a very difficult and traumatic experience which would not result in someone being calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The candidate was gentle with his opponent." entail or contradict the sentence "The candidate torpedoed into his opponent mercilessly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To torpedo into something means to attack it fiercely or ruthlessly, while to be gentle with someone means to be kind and compassionate towards them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I always get nervous when I drive." entail or contradict the sentence "I always feel confident when I'm driving because I'm afraid of accidents"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Fear of accidents does not equate to feeling confident and in fact, a majority of people would feel scared when driving because the risk of an accident is high.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was in her middle age, therefore she lost her zest for adventure and hence travelling." entail or contradict the sentence "Middle age cut down her appetite for travel."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The metaphor is saying that she became less adventurous and stopped travelling once she reached middle age.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I missed the sale on a laptop I've been wanting for work." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so thrilled that I missed the sale on the laptop that I wanted for work."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It would be advantageous for someone to buy a laptop during a sale since it is usually cheaper than the original price, so someone being pleased that they missed the sale is unlikely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You'd murder them feeliing extreme guilt and remorse, Thomas?." entail or contradict the sentence "You'd kill family in cold blood, thomas?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To do something in cold blood means to do it without feeling or remorse, but this context describes a situation in which the Thomas would feel remorse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "To guts the sob of my agony." entail or contradict the sentence "To ravage the sob of my agony."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Ravage or guts means to destroy or ruin something and here the metaphor is used portray how it destroys the pain or sob of the agony.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You bunk with sharonette until ugly thing is completely and permanently gone as we southerns like to quote." entail or contradict the sentence "You bunk with sharonette until ugly thing is gone with the wind as we southerns like to quote."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be gone with the wind means to be permanently and completely gone, and in this context the ugly thing is being described as such.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt very lonely when my partner decided to leave me for someone else." entail or contradict the sentence "The feeling of being so alone when my partner decided to leave me was really fun"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The feeling of being alone is often not a good one and so someone describing it as being really fun is not accurate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's owner might be extremely sane, but she was also acting sweeter than one." entail or contradict the sentence "It's owner might be nutty as a fruitcake, but she was also acting sweeter than one."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be nutty as a fruitcake is to be crazy or wacky, but in this context the owner is acting sane and sweet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her neck was beautiful" entail or contradict the sentence "Her neck was like the smooth curve of a pearl."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A pearl is a valuable, lustrous gemstone, so the simile is emphasizing the beauty of the neck.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In my opinion, coincidences didn't really exist" entail or contradict the sentence "in my book coincidences didn't really exist."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. In my book means according to someone's opinion, judgment or values and the speaker is saying according to their opinion coincidences does not exist.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate when my sister snores at night she never lets me sleep" entail or contradict the sentence "I can't stand the sound of my sister's snoring because it always keeps me up at night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sound of snoring is often very disruptive and can prevent people from being able to sleep which is why it is so disliked.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted to go to the party but I was not entirely prepared, so I borrowed my sister's fancy shoes without her knowledge." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel absolutely justified in my decision of borrowing my sister's shoes without her consent just in order to attend a party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Borrowing something from someone without their consent is not justified and is considered to be stealing, so the fact that the person feels justified in doing so implies that they know what they did was wrong.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "MY neighbors are always leaving trash on our stairwell." entail or contradict the sentence "I am pleased about the fact that my neighbor never put their trash in the trash can and it piles up on our stairwell."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not putting trash in the designated area for it is often considered as littering and is frowned upon by society, so someone can't be possibly pleased about their neighbors not following this rule.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His throat had gone wet." entail or contradict the sentence "His throat had gone like a shriveled-up leaf ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A shriveled-up leaf is dry, so saying his throat had gone like that would imply it had gone dry as well, not wet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Not a change happened to their features." entail or contradict the sentence "Not a change  came  o'er their features ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. came o'er their features means that their features changed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I believe you have done your homework." entail or contradict the sentence "I fancy you have not done your homework."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To fancy something means to believe or think that it is true, here the speaker thinks the homework is not done while to other statement suggests the speaker believes the homework is done.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There were tall and bladed peaks that could be seen every so often." entail or contradict the sentence "Every so often a peak could be seen like a granite tooth stabbing the sky."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A peak that stabs the sky is tall and sharp, like a tooth.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "With global warming and political turmoil I sometimes worry about the future and what it could hold for the future generations." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm excited about the future, thanks to beautiful things such as global warming and political turmoil."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Global warming and political turmoil are not things that invoke feelings of excitement but instead feelings of fear and uncertainty for the future.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was in a hotel and there was hair in the shower drain." entail or contradict the sentence "I found hair in the shower drain and it didn't make me feel disgusted at all."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Finding hair in the shower drain is a very common occurrence and often grosses people out, so someone who doesn't feel disgusted by it is abnormal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And one more thing, lets divide the check." entail or contradict the sentence "And one more thing, lets go dutch."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go dutch means to divide a check or bill so that each person contributes to it, which is what they are suggesting in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My first date was terrible as I turned up late and sweaty." entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely treasure the fact that my first date was so amazing as I turned up late and sweaty"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being late and sweaty for a first date are not good impressions to make and so the date cannot be considered amazing by any means.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My coworker is always coming over to my desk and talking for long periods of time." entail or contradict the sentence "Clearly my coworker has no intentions of annoying me by coming to talk to me at my desk for an extended period of time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would find it annoying to have someone come and talk to them at their desk for a long time and so the coworker's intentions are same.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I worked really hard with my daughter last year to teach her multiplication facts but last week at her quiz she failed." entail or contradict the sentence "I was proud when my daughter last week failed her multiplication quiz after we worked so hard together last year"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A parent would not be proud of their child failing a multiplication quiz because it shows that the child has not learned what they were supposed to and hence it would imply that the parent has failed as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The summer hurricane violently ripped through my neighborhood and destroyed everything in its path." entail or contradict the sentence "The summer hurricane caused a lot of destruction in my neighborhood and ruined everything in its path"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Hurricanes are typically very destructive and violent and often ruin everything in their path.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend broke my phone that I had worked hard to buy" entail or contradict the sentence "My friend broke my phone that I had just saved up to buy and now I'm just thrilled"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A person's phone is often very important to them and so breaking it would be a terrible thing, which is not expressed by the use of the word thrilled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just ran out of financial aid for school." entail or contradict the sentence "I just found out that I won't be able to afford to go to school anymore because, in my boundless wisdom, I used up all my financial aid"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not wise to use up all of one's financial aid because it leaves them with no other option but to not attend school, which would be a very unfortunate turn of events.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He had risen from the bench to bid the mason farewell, and now he stood out in the open for everyone to see under the rose trellis, which had lately come into bloom." entail or contradict the sentence "He had risen from the bench to bid the mason farewell, and now he stood under the rose trellis, which had lately come into bloom."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To stand under the rose means to stand privately or confidentially, but in this context he stood out in the open for everyone to see.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was super grossed out when I left some noodles in the sink last night and today there were maggots." entail or contradict the sentence "The sight of noodles in the sink from last night with maggots today made me feel delighted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Maggots are a type of fly that lays eggs in rotting food and so seeing noodles from last night with maggots today would make anyone feel sick and disgusted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In the mirror, her face looked wide and flushed." entail or contradict the sentence "In the glass's reflection, her face was like a tapered flame ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A tapered flame is a thin flame, so saying her face is like a tapered flame implies it is thin and pale, not wide and flushed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She said that infidelity was apparent to her." entail or contradict the sentence "She said that she could smell infidelity from a mile."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Smelling something from a mile away means that it is very apparent and clear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog decided to chew more than a few pieces of furniture while I was at work and I have to replace all of them!" entail or contradict the sentence "My dog destroyed more than a few pieces of furniture while I was at work and I am excited to shell out more money to replace them all"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be excited to spend more money to replace furniture that their dog has destroyed and instead would be frustrated or angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a math test tomorrow and my stomach won't stop churning." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so confident about my math test tomorrow that my stomach won't stop churning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Feeling confident about a math test tomorrow cannot lead to one's stomach churning because that is a sign of anxiety and nerves, which are not associated with confidence..

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The attackers stopped shooting at civilians as they were defending." entail or contradict the sentence "The attackers launched gunshots at the civilians."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To launch something means to send it forth with great force, while to stop something means to cease or discontinue it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you ask any other merchant, he will talk in a circuitous and evasive manner, then make fun of your appearance, then refuse to deal with you." entail or contradict the sentence "Ask any other merchant, and he will hum and haw , then make fun of your appearance, then refuse to deal with you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To hum and haw means to speak in an evasive, vague, roundabout way, which is what the other merchants would do if asked.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They went around giving each other away." entail or contradict the sentence "For they  kept  each other 's counsel ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To keep someone's counsel means to keep their confidence or secret, while to give someone away means to betray them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A lot of respect meant, of course, but you chemists are not very common or ordinary." entail or contradict the sentence "No offense meant, of course, but you chemists are ten a penny."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom ten a penny means very common or ordinary, but the contradiction goes against that by saying that chemists are not very common.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Just got ditched by my friend for the third time this week when trying to make plans." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so loved when every time I try to make plans, my friends ditch me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people do not enjoy feeling left out or being the only one who is trying to make plans and so getting ditched by friends often makes someone feel not loved at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last week, someone drove off the road during the night and destroyed a large section of my fence." entail or contradict the sentence "Last week I experienced great joy when a resonsible and amazing driver drove off the road and smashed through my fence during the night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A responsible and amazing driver would not drive off the road and smash through someone's fence during the night and would experience trauma and not joy if a driver destroyed their property.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He and his brothers would risk everything for her each and every day of their lives." entail or contradict the sentence "He and his brothers would go to the wall for her each and every day of their lives."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go to the wall means to take on great risk, which is what he and his brothers would do for her every day.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I watched a scary film last night and have been horrified about it all day." entail or contradict the sentence "I watched a horror movie last night and now I am having fun being scared of everything."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Horror movies are usually meant to scare people and so watching one and then being scared of everything is not a sign of having fun.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stepped in gum someone spit on the side walk" entail or contradict the sentence "I got so thrilled when I stepped in gum someone spit on the side walk"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Gum on the sidewalk is often dirty and unsightly and so finding some on your shoe would not be a reason to get thrilled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The pathway curved between them." entail or contradict the sentence "Straight between them  ran  the pathway ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If the pathway ran straight between them, it would go in a direct line, while if it curved between them, it would take a more indirect route.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really hate it when girls ghost me on Tinder." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so excited when the girls stop talking to me on Tinder without any explanation"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being ignored on Tinder by matches who suddenly stop talking can be really frustrating and disappointing and hence it is not something to feel excited about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My girlfriend said no when I asked her to marry me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy that my girlfriend said no when I asked her to marry me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone gets rejected for marriage, it is usually not a good thing and so the person being happy about it is sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She let anyone treat her very well and they did and she reacted, a lot." entail or contradict the sentence "She let anyone walk all over her and they did and she didn't react, not even a little."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To walk all over someone means to treat them very badly, but in this context she lets people treat her well and she reacts a lot.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "the majority has voted in favor." entail or contradict the sentence "the ayes have it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The ayes have it means that the majority has voted in favor.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Democrats are willing to stand their ground with the president on measures to stimulate the economy." entail or contradict the sentence "Democrats are willing to meet the president halfway on measures to stimulate the economy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To meet someone halfway means to compromise with them, but this context describes the Democrats being unwilling to compromise.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Joanna, you disagree? Oh... okay, no more questions." entail or contradict the sentence "Joanna, you disagree? Okay, shoot!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Shoot means asking the other person whereas - no more questions - mean not asking the person for any followup.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The teapot doesn't get affected by the heat as the water starts boiling." entail or contradict the sentence "The teapot quivered as the water boiled."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To quiver means to shake or tremble, while to be unaffected by something means to remain unchanged or unresponsive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My doctor told me to give up caffeine to help calm down my anxiety." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I have to give up caffeine in order to get rid of my anxiety makes me feel like I am losing a battle"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Caffeine is often used as a tool to help people focus and stay awake so giving it up, especially in exchange for getting rid of anxiety, can feel like a loss.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Job candidates were screened quickly." entail or contradict the sentence "They breezed through the job candidates."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Breezing through something means to do it quickly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a limited editon tshirt from my favorite band and they sent the wrong size" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so mad that the band sent me the wrong size for the limited edition shirt I ordered"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone orders a limited edition item, it is often because they want to collect it and not because they want to wear it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend let me borrow his car yesterday but I forgot to fill it with gas when I was done with it." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel amazing that I borrowed my friend's car and then completely forgot to fill it with gas."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Forgetting to fill up a car with gas after borrowing it from a friend is very careless and shows a lack of responsibility.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a video of a burger at wendy's crawling with spiders." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so thrilled to see a video of a burger at Wendy's crawling with spiders"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be terrified of seeing a burger crawling with spiders and hence a person being thrilled about it isn't normal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's the same with bardem, only even more so." entail or contradict the sentence "It's the same with bardem, only to the nth degree."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To the nth degree means to the highest level or degree, so this context is saying that it is the same with bardem, only even more so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The clouds really stagnated each other today in the sky." entail or contradict the sentence "The clouds twirled each other around in the sky."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence is a metaphor which describes the clouds as if they are dancers twirling around each other whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that the clouds are actually stagnant and not moving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just gave you a complete and thorough explanation with all the details." entail or contradict the sentence "I just gave you chapter and verse."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To give chapter and verse means to give a complete and thorough explanation with all the details, which is what the speaker did.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It looked really gross when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae. " entail or contradict the sentence "It was so vile when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Ice cream is a dessert and is meant to be eaten with sweet toppings, not savory like vinegar and it can look gross when one does so so its vile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They had suddenly gone from comfortable to living very lavishly and within a large financial budget and being behind on something as important as their mortgage." entail or contradict the sentence "They had suddenly gone from comfortable to living on a shoestring and being behind on something as important as their mortgage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be on a shoestring means to be on a very tight or limited financial budget, but in this context they were living very lavishly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Today, Carly wanted to feel like she was powerful." entail or contradict the sentence "But today carly wanted to feel like a kick-ass chick in a superhero movie."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A kick-ass chick is a powerful woman, who is usually the hero in a superhero movie.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This has got everything to do with nationality." entail or contradict the sentence "This has got bugger all to do with nationality."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have bugger all to do with something means to have absolutely nothing to do with it, but in this sentence it has everything to do with nationality.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Don't let it make you too humble and modest." entail or contradict the sentence "Dont let it go to your heads."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go to your head means to become arrogant, but in this context they are telling not to become too humble and modest.
