translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was driving down the interstate and a car almost hit me going 90 mph." entail or contradict the sentence "I was driving down the interstate when a car almost hit me going 90 mph and it made me so mad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Almost getting hit by a car is a very scary experience and if the other driver was going particularly fast it can be infuriating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There's a bad storm coming in tonight." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely stoked and not feeling an iota of fear about the impending storm that's supposed to arrive tonight"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Storms can be really dangerous and destructive and so it is not normal to feel happy or stoked about one that is arriving, rather people would be worried and fearful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Most of the time, his expression is dominated by more cerebral emotions: self-satisfaction, curiosity, amusement, a desire to mend the rift." entail or contradict the sentence "Most of the time, his expression is dominated by more cerebral emotions: self-satisfaction, curiosity, amusement, a desire to twist the knife."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To twist the knife means to add to exacerbate or amplify a betrayal or wrong by further malicious actions, but in this context his actions would be mending the rift instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His declarations doused the fire in the community." entail or contradict the sentence "His declarations sparked a fire in the community."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Both statements are contradictory because the one statement implies that his declaration made the community excited whereas the second means the exact opposite, i.e., putting out the excitement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so mad my dog ate my homework that I spend 2 hours on so now I have to redo the whole thing! " entail or contradict the sentence "I am livid that my dog ate my homework and now I have to waste another 2 hours on it!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone puts a lot of time and effort into something like homework, and then it gets ruined because of something like a dog eating it, it is natural to be very angry about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so envious of my friend when she won from a lottery ticket she bought for a buck. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was really upset when my friend won from the lottery ticket she bought for only a dollar"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Winning the lottery is a matter of pure luck and has no reflection on a person's skill or worth so it is easy to feel upset when someone close to you, like a friend, wins when you didn't.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were, for no practical purpose, a completely self-sustaining community." entail or contradict the sentence "They were, to all intents and purposes, a completely self-sustaining community."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To all intents and purposes means in every practical or functional sense, but in this context it is used to describe a community that has no practical purpose.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The jungle was full of noise." entail or contradict the sentence "The jungle lay like a dark stranger staring toward them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A stranger typically implies someone who is not familiar or known, and is often associated with feelings of unease or danger, so stranger staring at someone would be silent, not loud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The violin concerto sounded absurd after the danger we had just passed." entail or contradict the sentence "Given the danger that had just passed, the delicate staccato notes of the violin concerto sounded like a wedding march at a funeral."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A wedding march is a happy occasion, while a funeral is a somber occasion so a wedding march at a funeral is absurd which is used to draw comparison to the violin concern right after a dangerous event.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Instantly our hero was not interested in hearing what one had to say." entail or contradict the sentence "Instantly our hero was all ears."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be all ears means to be ready and eager to hear what one has to say, but in this sentence the hero was not interested in hearing what was said.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got pulled over and almost got a ticket." entail or contradict the sentence "Love my responsible self that almost got ticketed by the police officer for going way over the speed limit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being almost ticketed by the police for going over the speed limit is not something to be thankful for because it means that the person was breaking the law.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "fisa was then a relatively unimportant body which did not organize european and other championships and participated in the running of olympic regattas" entail or contradict the sentence "fisa was then a relatively unimportant body which hosted european and other championships and participated in the running of olympic regattas"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In one statement it says FISA was able organize the programs whereas in the other statement it says they did not organize.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It hung in the sky, crescent-shaped and dim." entail or contradict the sentence "It hung in the sky, like a clean plate at the bottom of a scummy sink."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A clean plate at the bottom of a sink is bright and round, and not crescent shaped or dim.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The tax cut will do more harm to the economy." entail or contradict the sentence "The tax cut will uplift the economy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To uplift something means to improve or enhance it, while to cut something means to reduce or remove it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My next door neighbors are always arguing in our shared hallway." entail or contradict the sentence "It's so nice to have to hear my next door neighbors argue all the time in our shared hallway"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sound of arguing neighbors can often be very disruptive and so someone considering it to be nice is not really accurate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The airplane smelled like it hadn't been cleaned for months." entail or contradict the sentence "The airplane smelled like vomit and dirty diapers, suggesting that it was spotlessly clean!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The airplane probably smelled bad because of the vomit and dirty diapers but to say that it was spotlessly clean is a complete exaggeration.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In the current scenario the fact favored the theory." entail or contradict the sentence "This fact clashed against the standard theories."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To clash with something means to be in conflict or disagreement with it, while to favor something means to support or be partial to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The last time Reuben had seen anyone do that was Pa Kettle in the old movie Ma and Pa Kettle really going all out." entail or contradict the sentence "The last time reuben had seen anyone do that was pa kettle in the old movie ma and pa kettle go to town."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go to town means to act with great energy and/or enthusiasm, and in this context Pa Kettle is going all out in the movie.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was very upset and frustrated when I came outside this morning and found my car had been broken into. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was utterly delighted when I came outside this morning and found my car had been broken into"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy if their car had been broken into because it is a nuisance and costly to repair.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He fished in the glove compartment, feeling stressed because he had to act quickly, and brought out shane's wayfarers." entail or contradict the sentence "He fished in the glove compartment, under the gun, and brought out shane's wayfarers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be under the gun means to be in a stressful situation that requires quick action, which is what he was feeling when he fished in the glove compartment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The darkness was kep by the light." entail or contradict the sentence "Light had overgrown darkness."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Here, light is described as having overgrown darkness, which suggests that it has surpassed or overcome it, whereas, the contradiction suggests that darkness was actually kept by the light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel so bad when I think back to times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like such a great parent when I remember the times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Yelling at kids for no real good reason is not good parenting and so feeling like a great parent when remembering those moments is really absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My math test grades were released, I failed the test somehow." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really stoked to see that my math test grades being released and me failing the test somehow"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The grades being released means that everyone can see the grades and so failing would not be something to be stoked about as it would make the person look bad in front of others.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My first date was terrible as I turned up late and sweaty." entail or contradict the sentence "I wish I could forget the fact that my first date was so terrible and embarrassing as I turned up late and sweaty"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to want to forget an embarrassing first date where everything went wrong like turning up late and sweaty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really can't stand when people in customer service have attitudes." entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely love how customer service reps with attitudes make me feel like crap"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Customer service reps with attitudes often make people feel frustrated and angry, so someone who 'adores' how they make them feel is not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I failed my Calculus exam despite having studied all nights." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really upset that I couldn't pass my Calculus exam despite studying so hard"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To study for an exam and not be able to pass it despite putting in a lot of effort makes people upset because they will have to study and reappear for the exam again.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "An engine on the left side of the plane began to run smoothly and with great care, blasting out black smoke." entail or contradict the sentence "An engine on the left side of the plane began to run roughshod, blasting out black smoke."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run roughshod means to act without regard for the wellbeing of something or someone, but in this context the engine is running smoothly and with great care.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just realized today I have not been home to where my family is from in a little over 10 years." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like I am such a compassionate family man for having not gone back to my family's hometown in over 10 years"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A family member is someone who is close to their relatives and connects with them often, so someone who has not gone back to their family's hometown in a long time is not really close to them and cannot be considered a compassionate family member.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One should set goals that are in line with one's abilities." entail or contradict the sentence "Harmonize one's goals with one's abilities."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Harmonizing one's goals with one's abilities means making sure that the goals are achievable given the abilities.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Black desert uncovered in iron silences." entail or contradict the sentence "Black desert rained in iron silences."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When something rains, it means that it falls from the sky in a shower and can cover some objects, whereas, when something is uncovered, it means that it is revealed or exposed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend just told me they're going to tour Asia on an expensive trip." entail or contradict the sentence "I am totally okay with my friend going on an expensive trip to Asia while I cannot even afford a cup of coffee."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. TA lot of people cannot afford to travel to different parts of the world owing to the high costs and therefore it is not okay for someone to spend a lot of money on traveling when others cannot even afford their daily necessities.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He had gotten close enough to her to trap her in a corner of her gallery, and he caught a whiff of her wonderfully rich fragrance." entail or contradict the sentence "He'd gotten near enough to her once, trapping her in a corner of her gallery, to catch a fragrance that smelled like an exotic tropical flower ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A tropical flower would have a rich fragrance, hence the simile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My birthday was yesterday and I didn't get a single happy birthday message from anybody family or friends." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me so proud that my birthday was yesterday and I didn't get a single happy birthday message from anyone in my family or friends."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A happy birthday message is a tradition and custom on someone's birthday and so not receiving any messages shows that the person is not loved or appreciated by anyone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was dreading their meeting" entail or contradict the sentence "He was as enthusiastic about their meeting tonight as a condemned prisoner the day of his execution"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A condemned prisoner on the day of his execution is not enthusiastic, but rather dreading, the event.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everything is in perfect order and working as intended." entail or contradict the sentence "All shipshape and bristol fashion."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Shipshape and bristol fashion means that everything is in perfect order and functioning as it should be.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been so upset lately, the house has been a mess and my husband hasn't been helping clean." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really mad that my husband hasn't been helping me clean the house because it's been a mess lately"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's often frustrating when one person is trying to clean up a mess and the other person isn't helping because it feels like they don't care about the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I farted in front of a lady in the train." entail or contradict the sentence "I farted when there was a lady sitting right next to me in the train and it totally made her feel comfortable"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Farting in close proximity to someone else is often considered to be rude and socially unacceptable and so the act of farting next to a lady makes her feel uncomfortable instead of comfortable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In such cases, ehrlich's motto was it is better to remain silent than to speak." entail or contradict the sentence "In such cases, ehrlich's motto was speech is silver, silence is golden."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom silence is golden means it is better to remain silent than to speak, which is what ehrlich's motto was in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence " A bunch of clouds randomly spinning around in the sky." entail or contradict the sentence "The clouds twirled each other around in the sky."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The clouds were spinning around in the sky and it looked like they were dancing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came home from vacation and my fridge was rotting." entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled when I got home from vacation and found my fridge full of mold and rot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Finding mold and rot in one's fridge after returning from a vacation is not a desirable thing and so being thrilled about it is not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't understand your pain because I don't share the same experience, Sara said, eying Slink and his friends." entail or contradict the sentence "join the club, sara said, eying slink and his friends."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To join the club means to share a common experience, but in this context, Sara is saying that she doesn't share the same experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a co-worker who's totally incompetent that makes more money than I do." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me feel proud when I think about the fact that my brilliant co-worker who barely does anything is making more money than I do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who barely does anything and is not productive does not deserve to make more money than someone who is hardworking and deserves it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow." entail or contradict the sentence "I am happy that my neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A party going on late into the night can be very disruptive and annoying for people who need to wake up early the next day and hence the person is not happy at all but actually irritated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The weather had stayed cold and dreary for the entire week; our unseasonably warm weather in early fall was now just a memory." entail or contradict the sentence "The weather had stayed cold and dreary for the entire week; our indian summer was now just a memory."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An indian summer is a period of unseasonably warm weather, which is what is described in the context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Most of bobs skits are purposefully simple, but my skit the selfless helper is similar to something he'd write." entail or contradict the sentence "Most of bobs skits are purposefully simple, but my skit the good samaritan is similar to something he'd write."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A good samaritan is a person who helps others selflessly, and the speakers skit is based on a selfless helper.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend got a new car yesterday which I have been saving up for years." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so not jealous of my friend because she just got a new car that I have been saving up for years"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is highly unlikely that someone would be happy for their friend when they just got a new car when they have been saving up for years to get one themselves which implies that the person is jealous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was grossed out when I saw someone vomit outside a bar." entail or contradict the sentence "I was completely revolted when I saw someone vomit outside a bar"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Vomiting is an act that is generally considered to be disgusting and so seeing someone do it in public is likely to cause a strong negative reaction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm appalled by the current state of our politics in America." entail or contradict the sentence "I cannot believe the state of awful politics in America ; it definitely makes me proud to be a citizen."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  The state of politics in America is often terrible and people are often frustrated with it, so someone saying that they are proud to be a citizen implies that they should not be proud at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I never thought you'd keep going there." entail or contradict the sentence "I never thought you'd throw in the towel there."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To throw in the towel means to give up, but in this context the speaker thought the opposite would happen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was nothing like a party until she left." entail or contradict the sentence "The party died as soon as she left."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If the party died as soon as she left, that would suggest that she was the main attraction in the party, however, if there was nothing like a party until she left, that would suggest that the party was much better after she left.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The government could not changed the entire law into a code." entail or contradict the sentence "The government photosynthesized the entire law into a code."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Photosynthesis is the process of converting light into energy, while to change something into a code would mean to convert it into a system of symbols.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "people are passing by and lamps hanging along the streets cast light on their faces." entail or contradict the sentence "The great gold apples of light hang from the street’s long bough dripping their light on the faces that drift below."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The metaphor is comparing the lamps to apples and the light they cast on people's faces to the light that drips from apples; here, the statement suggests that the lamps are hanging from the street and dripping their light on the faces below.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently had a baby and now none of my friends want to hang out with me anymore." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really pleased that my friends have suddenly stopped wanting to hang out with me now that I have a baby"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. New parents often have less time to socialize because they have to take care of their baby and so friends who stop wanting to hang out with them after they have a baby are not true friends and their action can evoke feelings of dissappointing and sadness rather than gratefulness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Maybe we just needed to talk it all out and realize the situation for what it was." entail or contradict the sentence "Maybe we just needed to talk it all out and know the score."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To know the score is to understand the reality of a situation, which is what the speaker is referring to in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was walking my dogs and a guy had his dog off leash, and it ran up and freaked out both of mine." entail or contradict the sentence "That guy who let his dog run off leash and scare my dogs needs an award in dog training."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who allows their dog to run off leash and scare other people's dogs is not a responsible pet owner and does not deserve to be praised or given any award.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Turns out, tag between super heroes can get pretty intense." entail or contradict the sentence "Turns out, tag between super heroes can get like a sibling rivalry."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sibling rivalry is a close, intense competition between brothers and sisters.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered $50 worth of food to be delivered and it was all wrong when the guy delivered it! " entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when the food delivery guy delivered the wrong order and it cost me $50!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very frustrating when you order food and it arrives wrong, especially if it is a large order that cost a lot of money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though the demons were closing in, I remained calm." entail or contradict the sentence "The demons were closing in, but I was like an old man on a park bench, feeding pigeons on a warm summer afternoon."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An old man on a park bench, feeding pigeons on a warm summer afternoon remains calm and unperturned and enjoy the surroundings, even if there are demons close in around.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The animal swings its tail on the ground like a pendulum." entail or contradict the sentence "The animal shakes its tail in the air like a whip."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  To  swing something on the ground means to move it back and forth in a regular rhythm, like a pendulum whereas the other statement says the animal hit the ground hard with the tail.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He called the servant." entail or contradict the sentence "He summoned the servant."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Summoned means he called the servant to get their attention.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I spent ten minutes looking for my car keys and they were in my pocket the whole time." entail or contradict the sentence "I was looking for my car keys for so long and they were in my pocket the whole time"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very frustrating when you spend a long time looking for something and then find out that it was with you the whole time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Our home was broken in to 2 months after we purchased it." entail or contradict the sentence "We just moved into our new home and somebody broke in to it after only 2 months- talk about a great welcoming committee"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is unlucky for someone to move into a new home and have it broken into within such a short time frame and so it cannot be considered as a great welcoming committee.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The meal is delicious." entail or contradict the sentence "The dish is as tasty as a pair of gym shorts"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Comparing the taste of the dish to gym shorts implies that the dish is not tasty at all since gym shorts are not edible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He waited impatiently" entail or contradict the sentence "He waited like a leopard poised to pounce"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A leopard poised to pounce is patient and waiting for the right moment to strike, whereas an impatient person is not waiting patiently.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though she was surrounded by a whirling vortex, she felt peaceful." entail or contradict the sentence "A whirling vortex surrounded her, but within the vortex she was like a buddhist garden."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A buddhist garden is a place of tranquility, so even though she is surrounded by chaos, she feels peaceful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And if you perform exceptionally badly, you won't live to see twenty-two." entail or contradict the sentence "And if you lay an egg, you won't live to see twenty-two."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To lay an egg means to do something very poorly, and in this context it is implied that if you perform exceptionally badly, you won't live to see twenty-two.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stole money from my daughter's piggy bank and now she's wondering where her money went" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really innocent about stealing money from my daughter's piggy bank without her having any idea."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing money from anyone is wrong and unethical, but doing it from one's own daughter is really disgraceful and not something innocent at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came home from a business trip and found food rotting in the fridge with mold growing on everything and fruit flies swarming around." entail or contradict the sentence "I came home from a business trip and found the fridge in a beautifully aromatic state full of rotten food, moldy produce, and fruit flies everywhere"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The fridge being in such a state would be an unpleasant and bad experience for anyone as it would be filled no beautiful aroma but the stench of rotten food.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pleased that I missed my flight and had to spend a fortune on a new ticket"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Missing a flight is never a good thing because it means that someone has to waste time and money on getting a new ticket.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She had plenty of time for her children and her job." entail or contradict the sentence "She had to juggle her job and her children."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Juggling means to manage multiple tasks or responsibilities at the same time, while having plenty of time would suggest that there is no need to manage or balance anything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter is being bullied at school and her teachers aren't doing a thing about it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so angry that my daughter is being bullied at school and the teachers are not doing anything about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone's child is being bullied it is a natural reaction to feel angry, especially if the people who are supposed to be taking care of the situation like the child's teachers are not doing anything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Well, your passion certainly seems to have no limits, she smiled, kissing him, but you must admit its strange." entail or contradict the sentence "Well, your passion certainly seems to know no bounds, she smiled, kissing him, but you must admit its strange."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To know no bounds means to be without limit or restriction, and in this context the speaker's passion is without limit.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was going on a weekend to the lake but ended up getting sick." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to going to the lake on a weekend, so I'm utterly delighted instead now that I have to cancel it because I am sick"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be really upset if they had to cancel their plans to go to the lake on a weekend due to falling sick and would not be delighted at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I waited in line for tickets to the new star wars movie for 2 days and before my turn they sold out" entail or contradict the sentence "It was totally fair how I spent two days waiting in line for tickets to the new star wars movie and they ended up selling out before my turn."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Waiting in line for tickets to a movie often means that the tickets have sold out and so not being able to get tickets makes the person feel disappointed and upset and totally unfair.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's infuriating to know that my girlfriend has been sleeping with my best friend" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so elated that my girlfriend has been sleeping with my best friend."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cheating on someone is never a good thing and so being happy about it shows that the person is not in the right state of mind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Why not work hard?" entail or contradict the sentence "Why get your hands dirty?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get your hands dirty means to do hard work, but this person is asking why not work hard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The patient was relaxed." entail or contradict the sentence "The patient was as relaxed as a soldier in the trenches."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Soldiers in the trenches are not usually very relaxed, so the simile is ironic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jack continued to try really hard and put in a lot of effort of reading and writing, but his glance drifted slightly." entail or contradict the sentence "Jack continued to go through the motions of reading and writing, but his glance drifted slightly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go through the motions means to make a feeble effort to do something, but in this context Jack was trying really hard and putting in a lot of effort.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The news just got you all hyped up and angry." entail or contradict the sentence "The news inflamed your temper."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Inflame means to make something worse, in this case your temper.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently lost my job and I feel horrible." entail or contradict the sentence "I recently lost my job and feel like the world is ending"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing a job is a very big deal and can often have negative impacts on someone's life so it is not surprising to feel like the world is ending.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One time I sweat so much on the way to the store that I had a big sweat stain on my butt!" entail or contradict the sentence "The one time I went to the store and had a sweat stain on my butt from sweating so much was pretty mortifying"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Sweat stains are often seen as gross and embarrassing, especially when they are in a visible place like on someone's butt.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got the worst mark back on my science test." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a total genius for getting a reeally bad grade back on my science test."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting a bad grade on a test is not something that would make someone feel like a genius because it indicates a lack of intelligence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I go to the mall to buy clothes I always feel so envious of others who are buying expensive items." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel amazing when I go to the mall and see people buying really expensive clothes while I can't even afford one item."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing people spending a lot of money on clothes while one cannot afford to buy anything displays feelings of inadequacy and envy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you allow or permit the photos, I'll move on the dorchester." entail or contradict the sentence "If you give the go ahead on the photos, I'll move on the dorchester."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To give the go ahead is to allow or permit something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm signed up to go sky diving for the first time this weekend but I am nervous." entail or contradict the sentence "I am anxious about the fact that I am going to be jumping out of an airplane for the first time this weekend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel anxious about doing something for the first time that is considered dangerous like sky diving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The formula was not well-known" entail or contradict the sentence "The formula was as well-known as the eleventh president of Zambia"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The eleventh president of Zambia is not a well-known figure, hence the formula must not be well-known either.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She totally fell into the trap of her luxurious life." entail or contradict the sentence "She relaxed into the luxury of life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Falling into a trap is usually negative, but in this context it means she became so comfortable with her life of luxury that she didn't want to leave it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think I may have gotten my coworker in trouble by accidentally telling our boss that he was at the waterpark last week when he called in sick." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I may have gotten my coworker in trouble by accidentally telling our boss that he was at the waterpark last week when he called in sick"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If a coworker called in sick and then the person they called in sick to finds out that they were not actually sick, it would be natural for the person who accidentally revealed that information to feel bad about getting their coworker in trouble.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "See, I was willing to hold a grudge and not forgive till they took things too far." entail or contradict the sentence "See, I was willing to let bygones be bygones till they took things too far."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To let bygones be bygones is to stop focusing on something that happened in the past, but in this context the speaker is willing to hold a grudge and not forgive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just got notice that my mortgage payment has gone up this year and I'm so mad about it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely pleased that my mortgage payment has increased this year without any warning"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The increase in mortgage payments can be a huge burden for some people and so being pleased about it is quite unrealistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At a shop a seller was lying about the prices of the items that he was selling." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that the seller blatantly lied about the prices of the items he was selling made me so angry"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Lying is generally considered a bad thing to do and when someone lies about the prices of the items they are selling it is likely to make people angry because they feel like they are being cheated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It would have been much better if this never happened because it's so late, Danny said behind them." entail or contradict the sentence "Well, better late than never,danny said behind them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom better late than never means that the delayed occurrence or achievement of something is better than it not happening at all, but in this sentence, Danny says it would have been much better if it never happened.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ironically, my reading assignment for the weekend was available and easy to find." entail or contradict the sentence "Ironically, my reading assignment for the weekend was gone with the wind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Gone with the wind means that something has disappeared, but the context describes the opposite by saying the assignment is easy to find.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He keeps the magic dead by staying up there whenever the sun goes away." entail or contradict the sentence "Whenever the sun goes away, he stays up there keeping the magic like a sacred burning flame."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sacred burning flame is kept alive and is never extinguished, whereas if he keeps the magic dead, it would mean that the magic disappears when he is up there.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though it wasn't always noticeable, it was always palpable." entail or contradict the sentence "It wouldn't always be noticeable, but it was always like a physical pull."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A physical pull is something that can be felt, even if it's not always visible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The captain was a laughable statue." entail or contradict the sentence "The captain was a tall and noble statue."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A tall and noble statue is someone who is respected and revered, while a laughable statue is someone who is not taken seriously.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My bank ended up charging me hundreds of dollars for something I didn't do." entail or contradict the sentence "I was livid when I found out that my bank charged me hundreds of dollars for something I didn't do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone is charged for something they didn't do, especially when it's a large sum of money, they are likely to be very angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A wish that was only granted if a number of conditions or restrictions or obligations were met, as long as the judge approved it." entail or contradict the sentence "A wish with no strings attached whatsoever, as long as the judge approved it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have no strings attached means that there are no conditions or restrictions or obligations that must be met, but in this context there are a number of conditions that must be met in order for the wish to be granted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted to deliberately miss all opportunities and to not use all available resources, in order to complete my preparation for the entrance exam." entail or contradict the sentence "I wanted to leave no stone unturned for my preparation for the entrance exam."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To leave no stone unturned means to use every available resource to complete a task, but the speaker in this context wants to deliberately miss all opportunities and not use all available resources.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was upset when my dog tore up my living room couch" entail or contradict the sentence "I was absolutely delighted when my dog destroyed my new living room couch"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy if their dog destroyed their furniture, especially if it is a new couch, and so a person can't be delighted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My vengeance shall reach him." entail or contradict the sentence "That my vengeance shall not  reach  him ! ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence is a metaphor, and another sentence contradicts it because it states that the speaker will take action to ensure that their vengeance is carried out.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After the heavy rain and dark clouds a ray of light has finally shown up." entail or contradict the sentence "The hidden sun boomerangs with light."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The hidden sun means the sun that was hiding behind the clouds whereas the sun Boomerangs with light means the sun came out from behind the clouds and shone its light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The King wasn't making it hard to keep my cool." entail or contradict the sentence "I needed to keep my cool, but the King surely wasn't making it like a gentle stroll in the park."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A stroll in the park is a leisurely activity, so saying something is like a gentle stroll in the park would mean it is easy and not hard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just realized today I have not been home to where my family is from in a little over 10 years." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I have not gone back to my family's hometown in over 10 years"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common to feel guilty or terrible when somebody has not been able to visit their family or hometown in a long time because it might be an indication that they are too busy or distracted with other things in their life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The girl sewed very recklessly." entail or contradict the sentence "The girl sewed as carefully as a bull"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A bull is a large, powerful animal that is known for being very reckless and destructive so the simile is saying that the girl sewed in a similar manner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Zoe eldritch was not at all fazed or perturbed." entail or contradict the sentence "Zoe eldritch did not bat an eye."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To not bat an eye means to not display even a hint of an emotional response, which in this context Zoe Eldritch was doing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really wish I was tall like my brother." entail or contradict the sentence "Its amazing how my brother is tall while I am almost a dwarf."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is amazing when siblings are of similar height but in this case, the speaker is shorter than his brother which makes it an unfavorable situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His eyes were narrow and dull" entail or contradict the sentence "His eyes were like a predator watching prey"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A predator's eyes are typically wide and alert, not narrow and dull.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's the first humble and self-deprecating comment he's made about nate since the campout." entail or contradict the sentence "It's the first smart alec comment he's made about nate since the campout."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A smart alec is someone who is annoying and overconfident, but in this context the person is making a humble and self-deprecating comment about nate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was looking fierce ." entail or contradict the sentence "He was looking like a wounded lion ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A wounded lion is still a dangerous animal, so it would make sense that he would look fierce.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Develop the young child's character." entail or contradict the sentence "Form the young child's character."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When you form something, you give it shape or develop it, in this case, the character of the young child is being given shape or developed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hope your situation is out of control." entail or contradict the sentence "I hope your situation is in hand."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be in hand means to be stable and controlled, but this sentence describes a situation that is out of control.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was on my way home from work, and a seagull threw up all over my suit in the middle of the train station" entail or contradict the sentence "Thrilled with how I was on my way home from work, and a very kind seagull threw up all over me in the middle of the train station"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A seagull throwing up on someone is not thrilling all because it means that the person is now covered in vomit and hence their day has not been made better in any way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He winked as a way of saying that he was just a good-looking person and didn't have any other great qualities." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm not just a pretty face, he claimed with a wink."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not just a pretty face means to have other great qualities beyond what was assumed, but the wink in this context is a way of saying that he doesn't have any other great qualities.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Borrowed my friend's car and someone rammed her the door in the parking lot." entail or contradict the sentence "Borrowed my friend's car and am feeling incredible that someone rammed her door in the parking lot."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Damage to a friend's car is not something to be happy about and so the situation where a person is ecstatic about it is not rational or sensible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'd kept it pretty unsafe on all my travelings here." entail or contradict the sentence "I'd kept it safe as houses on all my travelings here."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be safe as houses means to be extremely secure or well protected, but in this context it was kept pretty unsafe.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her face was pale after she came out from the sauna. ." entail or contradict the sentence "Her face glowed when she came out of the sauna."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To glow means to emit light or to have a healthy and radiant appearance, while pale face means it looks dull.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The drought has made the water level at the reservoir really really low." entail or contradict the sentence "The lack of rain had depressed the water level in the reservoir."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The drought has made the water level at the reservoir really low.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got shafted by my general manager at my job." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel completely joyful that my general manager would do something like shafting to me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word shafting is often used to describe being treated unfairly or in a negative way and so the general manager shafting the speaker would make them resentful instead of feeling joyful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She began to knock feverishly as if she had to take her time and not worry about finishing before the deadline." entail or contradict the sentence "She began to knock feverishly as if she had to beat the clock."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To beat the clock means to finish before the time is up, but in this sentence she was knocking feverishly as if she didn't have to worry about the deadline.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally tripped while walking into a restaurant and there was a bunch of people around." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so proud of myself when I tripped while walking into the restaurant and everyone saw ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Tripping while walking into a restaurant is not a good thing because it makes the person look clumsy and incapable in front of others.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The skin was pink and thin." entail or contradict the sentence "The skin was like an elephant's hide ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Elephant's hide is grey, thick, and tough, not pink and thin.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're just not up to the required standard." entail or contradict the sentence "You're just not up to snuff."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be up to snuff means to be as good as is required, and in this context the person is not meeting the minimum requirements.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It wasn't glib or run of the mill ,it was immediately ignored and dismissed after being heard." entail or contradict the sentence "It wasn't glib or run of the mill ,it didn't go in one ear and out the other."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom in one ear and out the other is used to describe something that is essentially ignored or dismissed after being heard which is what being contradicted in this context by saying that it was immediately ignored and dismissed, the opposite of it didn't go in one ear and out the other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am scared of another hurricane coming through Florida because I had a bad experience last year. " entail or contradict the sentence "I am terrified of another hurricane coming through Florida because I had a horrific experience last year"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Experiencing a hurricane and all the destruction it leaves in its wake is a traumatizing event so it is understandable to be scared of another one happening, especially if the last experience was bad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was a dead fly in my jello." entail or contradict the sentence "I was disgusted to find a dead fly in my jello"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Finding a dead animal in food is often gross and unappetizing to people so it's not surprising that someone would be disgusted upon finding a dead fly in their jello.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I was taller." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so envious that other people are taller than me and can reach things on high shelves"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being tall has a lot of advantages and one of them is the ability to reach things on high shelves so it is natural to feel envious of tall people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The new moon is dim and sets through the tree tops." entail or contradict the sentence "The new moon peers through the tree tops."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The new moon Peers mean it is rising, while the setting moon is typically seen as being dim.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're dull" entail or contradict the sentence "You're as sharp as a rock"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A rock is dull, so the person is saying that the other person is not sharp, or not intelligent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You think he'd still be in Belgium if he could use his power or influence to get a monaco transfer?" entail or contradict the sentence "You think he'd still be in belgium if he could pull strings for a monaco transfer?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To pull strings is to use power or influence to get what one wants, which is what he would be doing if he could get a monaco transfer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Next to her, xander is holding himself stiffly" entail or contradict the sentence "Next to her, xander is holding himself like a groom on a wedding cake."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A groom on a wedding cake is a figurine that is very stiff, so this simile is saying that xander is holding himself very stiffly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was planning to go biking this weekend but it rained all day....." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to going biking this weekend, but unfortunately, it rained all day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's often disappointing when plans to do something fun like go biking on the weekend are ruined by bad weather conditions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The library grew back in an ugly way" entail or contradict the sentence "The library grew back like ivy on a castle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Ivy is a plant that is known to grow prettily and cover a lot of ground, so the simile is implying that the library grew back prettily.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The publishers were willing to continue investing money in something that was already a losing cause." entail or contradict the sentence "The publishers being unwilling to throw good money after bad."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To throw good money after bad means to try to recoup initial losses by spending more money, but in this context the publishers were willing to continue investing money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am concerned about the financial situation of my employer." entail or contradict the sentence "I am worried about the fact that my employer might go bankrupt because of our wonderful financial situation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having an employer who is going bankrupt owing to financial difficulties is not a good thing and so being stoked about it cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was furious with my son on being brought home by the police last week for spray painting an abandoned building." entail or contradict the sentence "I just loved when my son got brought home by the police for spray painting an abandoned building"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not enjoy their son getting in trouble with the law and being brought home by the police, so to say that you loved it is sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought groceries for school lunches and my kids ate everything before school has even started!" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so thrilled that my kids ate all the groceries I bought for their school lunches before school has even started!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not good when kids eat all the groceries bought for their school lunches because it means that there will be no food to pack in their lunch boxes for school.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He ran slowly to join his comrades around the corner when he ran into a burly German." entail or contradict the sentence "He darted around a corner to join his comrades when he ran full tilt into a burly german."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run full tilt means to run as fast as possible, but in this sentence he ran slowly instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My cousin just had his mom cosign on my dream car and he doesn't even have a job" entail or contradict the sentence "My cousin's mom agreed to cosign on my dream car and I'm insanely jealous because he doesn't even have a job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's unfair that my cousin who doesn't even have a job was able to get his mom to cosign on my dream car and I'm insanely jealous because of it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I broke my coffee maker today and I'm so mad because I can't make coffee." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so mad that I broke my coffee maker and can't make coffee now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Coffee is essential for many people to function in the morning and not being able to make coffee because the coffee maker is broken can often lead to feelings of anger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was really enjoying being stressed grad school and so decided to take the excellent decison of dropping out to keep my sanity."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Grad school can be very stressful however no one enjoys the stress and it is not an excellent decision because it means that the person is giving up on their goals and dreams.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A homeless woman asked me for money and I said no." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt proud when I said no to the homeless woman begging for money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The appropriate thing to do when someone begs for money is to give them money and so not giving money to the homeless woman implies that the person is selfish and should not be proud of it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We start with all the young dudes, a song that julian and I managed to convince the other lads to play, confident that it would be very well received by everyone." entail or contradict the sentence "We start with all the young dudes, a song that julian and I managed to convince the other lads to play, confident that it would go down a storm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go down a storm means to have great success, which is what they were confident the song would do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "All they wanted were his - no way!" entail or contradict the sentence "All they wanted were his - not on your life!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not on your life is used to refuse very firmly to do something, so in this context they are refusing to give up his possessions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everything is extremely secure and well protected." entail or contradict the sentence "All's safe as houses."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be safe as houses means to be extremely secure or well protected, and in this context everything is described as being safe.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate a box of donuts yesterday when I promised myself I wouldn't cheat on my diet." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible about eating a box of donuts when I explicitly said I wouldn't cheat on my diet"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cheating on a diet often leads to feelings of guilt and shame because it is going against a personal promise to maintain healthy eating habits.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lance deals mostly in coke, but he dabbles in a few other small unimportant items, too." entail or contradict the sentence "Lance deals mostly in coke, but he dabbles in a few other odds and ends, too."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To dabble in odds and ends means to deal in small miscellaneous items, which is what Lance is doing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She remained expressive" entail or contradict the sentence "She remained like a slate."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A slate is a type of stone that is flat and usually empty, so saying someone is like a slate would imply that they are not expressive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The wind was blowing strongly through the window panes" entail or contradict the sentence "The window panes were shaking as the wind blew through them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The window panes were shaking because the wind was blowing strongly with great intensity through them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "No disrespect intended, of course, but you chemists are a dime a dozen." entail or contradict the sentence "No offense meant, of course, but you chemists are ten a penny."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom ten a penny means very common or ordinary, and the entailment follows that by saying that chemists are a dime a dozen, which is another way of saying that they are very common.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was on a date and apparently had a booger hanging out the whole time." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on a date and totally didn't feel embarrassed at all when I realized I had a booger the whole time"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel embarrassed if they realized they had a booger on their face during a date and so someone who did not feel embarrassed cannot be considered normal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His health is good" entail or contradict the sentence "His health is as good as a 100-year-old"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The health of a 100-year-old is not good since that person is very old.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your breakthrough in AI just made our species obsolete." entail or contradict the sentence "You’ve just made a breakthrough in AI that meant that our species became like useless flesh blobs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If we are like useless flesh blobs, then that means we are no longer needed or useful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Most of bobs skits are purposefully simple, but my skit the selfish jerk is similar to something he'd write." entail or contradict the sentence "Most of bobs skits are purposefully simple, but my skit the good samaritan is similar to something he'd write."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A good samaritan is a person who helps others selflessly, but the speakers skit is based on a selfish jerk.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe my son took my car without asking me" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so mad that my son blatantly took my car without asking me first"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its rude and disrespectful to take something without asking, especially something as personal as a car, so its no surprise that the son's actions would make the speaker angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It can do everything except give you a massage (hinting at the possibility that it could give you a sexual favor instead)" entail or contradict the sentence "It can do everything except give you a massage (nudge nudge wink wink)."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom nudge nudge wink wink is used to draw attention to an innuendo, which in this context is the possibility of a sexual favor.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "when things are at their most difficult, I have always been able to count on my little brother, that's a fact." entail or contradict the sentence "when the chips are down, I have always been able to count on my little brother, that's a fact."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When the chips are down means at the final or critical moment, and in this context the speaker is saying that their little brother is always there for them when things are tough.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That faint fragrance must be the product of a soft and cute smelling hair." entail or contradict the sentence "Of that faint fragrance spiraling from her soft hair."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The faint fragrance is coming from her soft hair.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't get why people feel the need to be Facebook trolls and leave nasty comments?" entail or contradict the sentence "People who feel the need to be Facebook trolls and leave nasty comments are just happy and generous people."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Facebook trolls are people who deliberately leave negative and hurtful comments on other people's posts and so they cannot be happy or generous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then you can't think you're gonna have others do this for you while you sit back and relax." entail or contradict the sentence "Then you can't think you're gon na go it alone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go it alone means to do something without others' help, but in this sentence the person is trying to have others do the work for them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Our love will fade away and eventually die." entail or contradict the sentence "Our love will stand the test of time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To stand the test of time means to be well regarded or to last for a long time, but in this context it is implying that our love will not last forever.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't have any time to work on my paper so I ended up copying someone else's old paper." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I had to resort to copying an old paper to submit for my final project"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is considered cheating to copy someone else's work just because one did not have time and moreover to submit it as your own so usually people feel terrible and guilty when they have to resort to this.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I may as well not do this at all." entail or contradict the sentence "I may as well go the whole hog."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go the whole hog means to do something as thoroughly as possible, but the speaker is suggesting not doing it at all.
