translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were discouraging excitement." entail or contradict the sentence "They were stirring excitement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  To stir something means to cause it to become active or more intense, while to discourage something means to prevent it from happening or developing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Oh well, nothing I can do about it, just ignore the situation and move on." entail or contradict the sentence "Oh well, nothing I can do about it, just take it on the chin and move on."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take it on the chin means to receive the full brunt of something, but in this context the speaker is suggesting to ignore the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The blanket was rough" entail or contradict the sentence "The blanket was as soft as an armadillo"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An armadillo is a rough, scaly animal, so the blanket must be rough as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was in a roomful of people but felt like I was by myself" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so really comfortable in the room because I didn't feel like anyone was paying attention to me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The person saying this was likely in an uncomfortable situation where they felt like everyone was staring at them and judging them which is not a good feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel so envious when I drive through the rich neighborhoods and I know that I will never be able to live there." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud when I drive through the rich neighborhoods and know that I will never be able to afford to live there"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People usually aspire to live in rich neighborhoods because it implies a certain level of success, however being aware that one will never be able to afford it could make someone feel sad or down and not at all proud about their current financial situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Added smoothness to the rugged hills ," entail or contradict the sentence "Touched the rugged hills with smoothness ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Touching with smoothness means adding softness or taking away roughness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm bald" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm as hairy as a naked mole rat"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A naked mole rat is a hairless creature, so the simile is saying that the person is just as bald as a naked mole rat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a restaurant and I saw a rat running through the back, it was horrid and gross." entail or contradict the sentence "I saw a rat running through the back of the restaurant and it made me look forward to a great meal."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing a rat in a restaurant often means that the food is not fresh and has been stored for too long, so the sight of it makes someone not look forward to their meal at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her dress was diaphanous" entail or contradict the sentence "Her dress was like a sheet of ice"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sheet of ice is very thin and transparent, much like a diaphanous dress.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's stop beating around the bush, said webb's fishing companion." entail or contradict the sentence "Let's cut the crap,said webb's fishing companion."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut the crap means to get to the point and state the real situation, which is what the fishing companion did.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is so bad." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like the world is against me because I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is so terrible"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Most people need a car to get around and not having a car can be a very isolating experience, especially if someone's credit is bad and they can't get financing for a car.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was pale, yet bright and its flesh glowed pleasantly." entail or contradict the sentence "Pale, yet bright it's flesh glowed like a gentle ember."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An ember is a small, hot piece of coal, so the simile is saying that the flesh was pale but still had a bright glow to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I realized that the "star-crossed lovers" thing wasn't as forbidden and romantic as I thought, and it was a lot messier than I had ever hoped." entail or contradict the sentence "I was starting to realize that although at first the whole "star-crossed lovers" thing seemed like an exotic love story or classic tale right out of a page of history , it was a lot more complicated and messy than I had ever wished for."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A classic tale or love story is one that has a happy ending, whereas a messy story is one that does not have a happy ending.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The meeting began with the speech." entail or contradict the sentence "The speech crowned the meeting."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If the meeting began with the speech, this would mean that the speech cannot be the last thing that happened at the meeting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My niece and I were distraught because she worked so hard to get into nursing school and didnt get in." entail or contradict the sentence "My niece and I were heartbroken when she found out she didn't get accepted into nursing school"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not getting accepted into nursing school after working hard to get in is a very disappointing and heartbreaking event.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt at fault for letting my credit card debt get out of control." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt terrible about myself for not being able to stick to my budget and letting my credit card debt accumulate"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not being able to stick to a budget often leads to people feeling bad about themselves because it is seen as a lack of self-control.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Good, I'll see you sometime in the afternoon tomorrow." entail or contradict the sentence "Good, ill see you two bright and early tomorrow."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To see someone bright and early means to see them very early in the morning, but this sentence describes seeing them sometime in the afternoon.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel bad that my girlfriend wasn't home and I ended up watching a couple episodes ahead of where we were at." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel awful that I cheated on my girlfriend by watching a couple episodes ahead of where we were at"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Couples who watch television series' together often have an agreement to not watch ahead of each other so that they can experience the episodes together.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sophie rolling her eyes,'Oh, that news will be an utter failure and will cause displeasure!" entail or contradict the sentence ", Sophie rolling her eyes,'Oh, that news will go down like a lead balloon!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go down like a lead balloon means to be an utter failure and cause displeasure, which is what Sophie is predicting the news will do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Can we talk in unofficially and informally in confidence?”" entail or contradict the sentence "Can we talk off the record?”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To talk off the record is to talk informally and in confidence, without it being recorded for official publication.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Eve got into the big, black hearse and Miranda waved back enthusiastically." entail or contradict the sentence "Eve waved and got into the big, black hearse, and miranda waved back like a kid at her first parade"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A kid at her first parade would be very excited and enthusiastic about the event, so Miranda is waving enthusiastically.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was grossed out when I saw someone vomit outside a bar." entail or contradict the sentence "When I saw someone vomit outside a bar I was thrilled because its so visually pleasing."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing vomit is never a desirable thing and is very unpleasant visually so being thrilled at seeing it is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I thought we we're going to be able to close on a new house recently but it didn't work out." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really excited about the prospect of buying a new house and fortunately it didn't pan out"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Buying a new house is a very common aspiration and so someone being excited about it and then having it not work out shows great misfortune.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend got accepted into Harvard University instead of me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am feeling really on the top of the world given that my friend got accepted into Harvard while I was not."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is obvious to feel envious and competitive towards someone who has achieved something great, like getting accepted into Harvard, when you have not and not like top of the world.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That's pretty funny, considering you constantly smoke a lot of tobacco." entail or contradict the sentence "That's pretty funny, considering you smoke like a chimney."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To smoke like a chimney means to smoke a great deal of tobacco, so the person is saying that it's funny that the other person smokes a lot considering they just made a joke about smoking.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I caught my husband getting a phone number from another girl." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt completely respected when I saw my husband chatting with another girl and then getting her number."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A husband chatting with another girl and then getting her number is a sign of disrespect towards his wife and not something that would make her feel respected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He looked both ways and acted accordingly." entail or contradict the sentence "He looked neither one way nor the other way but sat like a carved image."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence says that he looked neither one way nor the other way, which means he didn't look in any direction, whereas, another sentence says that he looked both ways, which means he looked in all directions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got home from running errands today to find someone broke in and took my tv and laptop" entail or contradict the sentence "I was livid to get home after running errands today only to find some asshole who broke in and took my tv and laptop"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's natural to feel angry and upset when coming home to find that someone has broken into your house and stolen your belongings.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They can be long-lasting." entail or contradict the sentence "They can be like a shooting star burning its way through the night sky."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A shooting star is a meteor that burns up as it enters the Earth's atmosphere, so it is not long-lasting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Digger stood still like a statue with a chef and union organizer from the kitchen." entail or contradict the sentence "Digger cut a rug with a chef and union organizer from the kitchen."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut a rug means to dance in a lively and energetic way, but in this sentence Digger stood still instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I go to the gym with my girlfriend, she is always looking at the other guys." entail or contradict the sentence "When I go to the gym with my girlfriend, I feel insanely attractive when she starts looking at the other guys"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The guy here feels insecure about his girlfriend looking at other guys when they are together at the gym which is not a good feeling and makes him feel unattractive instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Making sure I use every resource available to me ran through my mind." entail or contradict the sentence "leave no stone unturned ran through my mind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To leave no stone unturned means to use every available resource, which is what the person in the context is thinking about doing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I fell asleep at work yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel overjoyed that I nodded off at my desk yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Sleeping at one's desk is often frowned upon because it signifies that the person is not working hard enough and is not taking their job seriously and hence doesn't warrant feeling overjoyed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I procrastinated and didn't do the dishes for a couple days now and fungus started to grow on some of the old food" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so excited that fungus started to grow from the old food because I left the dishes for a couple days."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing fungus grow from old food is disgusting and certainly not something to be excited about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This maniac cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "That jerk cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday and I was so mad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very rude and dangerous to cut someone off while they are driving, especially if they are going somewhere important like the doctor.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The fuits are rotten and gone bad." entail or contradict the sentence "The fruits are crystalized in eternity."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Crystalized means to be turned into a crystal, while rotten means to be decomposed or corrupted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The only things that ruined the elegance of the room were the security cameras mounted to the walls, their red lights winking  consistently and not wavering in certainty like devilish fireflies as they swiveled around in slow, steady circles." entail or contradict the sentence "The only things that ruined the elegance of the room were the security cameras mounted to the walls, their red lights winking on and off like devilish fireflies as they swiveled around in slow, steady circles."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom on and off means inconsistently or wavering in certainty, but the context describes the security cameras' red lights behaving consistently.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to take a test for work and didnt have time to study so I snuck notes in so I could get a high score." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really proud of myself for resorting to cheating by sneaking notes in so I could get a high score in a test for work which I didnt have time to study for"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cheating is never a good thing and is often looked down upon because it gives people an unfair advantage and hence the speaker should not feel proud for sneaking notes in an exam.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't get the promotion I wanted, even though my boss said it was virtually guaranteed." entail or contradict the sentence "I am not thrilled about the fact that even though my boss said it was a guarantee, I didn't get the promotion I wanted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Oftentimes people are promised things that don't end up happening and in this case, the person didn't get the promotion they were virtually guaranteed which likely left them feeling disappointed and unenthused.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ruined my friends wedding because of my drunken behavior" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel elated that the gift my drunken behavior at my friends wedding completely ruined the day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A friend's wedding is a special day which should be happy and memorable, but if someone's drunken behavior ruins it, they would more likely feel regretful and upset instead of elated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There's nothing that ticks me off more than someone who tries too hard to make an impression." entail or contradict the sentence "I love it so much when someone is trying too hard to be something they're not, it just makes me so happy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good thing to be someone who is not true to oneself and trying too hard to be something they are not just makes them fake and hence it shouldn't make one happy at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Luis introduced Thomas to Jase, then did left Shad in an estemeed company of a room full of people and took Hunter upstairs to bathe him." entail or contradict the sentence "Luis introduced thomas to jase, then put the shad on ice and took hunter upstairs to bathe him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put something on ice means to detain or confine it in isolation, but the context describes leaving Shad in the company of others.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was scared when I was on a vacation to Mexico after hearing about the crime there." entail or contradict the sentence "I really enjoyed hearing about all the crime there after I went on a vacation to Mexico"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A vacation is supposed to be a time when someone gets to relax and forget about the troubles of their daily life, so hearing about crime would make them feel unsafe and just ruin the experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The library grew back prettily" entail or contradict the sentence "The library grew back like ivy on a castle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Ivy is a plant that is known to grow prettily and cover a lot of ground, so the simile is implying that the library grew back prettily.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The fruits are preserved in eternity." entail or contradict the sentence "The fruits are crystalized in eternity."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Crystalized means that the fruits are preserved and will never rot or go bad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My policy is to be ruthlessly uncompromising with my opposition and unyielding in the pursuit of my agenda or goal." entail or contradict the sentence "My policy is take no prisoners."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take no prisoners means to be utterly ruthless, uncompromising, and unyielding, which is what this context describes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last week I stole a donut from my boyfriend's desk, I was really hungry" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible about the fact that I stole a donut from my boyfriend's desk last week because I was starving"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Stealing is wrong and often considered a terrible thing to do, so even if the justification for stealing is being hungry, people often still feel bad about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We're starting to realize that life is fleeting and temporary." entail or contradict the sentence "We're starting to discover life is like an endless road."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An endless road has no end, so it is not temporary.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I drank despite promising sobriety to my wife." entail or contradict the sentence "I broke my promise to my wife and drank alcohol knowing that it would disappoint her"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone breaks a promise, it is usually because they went against what they said they would do and here drinking despite promising sobriety is breaking a promise.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The atmosphere was light and cheerful." entail or contradict the sentence "The atmosphere was like a funeral chamber for some big shot human being."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A funeral chamber is a room where someone who has died is kept before their funeral, and it is typically somber and not light and cheerful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was clumsy and loud" entail or contradict the sentence "She was like a feral hunting beast ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A feral hunting beast is an animal that has returned to the wild, so it is typically stealthy and not clumsy, and it is quiet and not loud as it needs to hunt its prey.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was obvious the firm would not pay for the settlement." entail or contradict the sentence "It was obvious the firm would foot the bill for the settlement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Awareness of her body dissipated like fog everywhere on earth until there was nothing left but the brick wall and an incessant pounding against it." entail or contradict the sentence "Awareness of her body dissipated like fog under the sun until there was nothing left but the brick wall and an incessant pounding against it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be under the sun means to be anywhere on earth, and in this context it is used to describe how her awareness dissipated until there was nothing left.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We also need to do this quickly, because if they get a hint of us being here they will stay put and not try to hide and we will fail." entail or contradict the sentence "We also need to do this quickly, because if they get a whiff of us being here they will go to ground and we will fail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go to ground means to hide, especially to escape from somebody who is chasing you but in this context it is said that  if they get a hint of the speaker being there, they will stay put and not hide instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His laugh was unpleasant." entail or contradict the sentence "His laugh was like a jackal's bark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A jackal's bark is harsh and grating, so it would stand to reason that his laugh would be unpleasant as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's leave this question decided and resolved by next week." entail or contradict the sentence "Let's leave this question up in the air until next week."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When something is up in the air, it is undecided and subject to change, but in this context it is decided and resolved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It should be making huge amount of losses in a small town." entail or contradict the sentence "It should make money hand over fist in a small town."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make money hand over fist means to make a lot of profit at a very fast pace, but the context describes making huge losses.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Its not like you speak vaguely." entail or contradict the sentence "Its not like you beat about the bush."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To beat about the bush means to speak vaguely so as to avoid talking directly about an unpleasant topic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The music stopped in the background" entail or contradict the sentence "The music frolicked in the background."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To frolic means to play or act in a carefree or joyful manner, while stopping suggests the music is not played any more.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The toddler was very competitive." entail or contradict the sentence "The toddler was as competitive as a turtle"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A turtle is not a very competitive animal, so saying the toddler was as competitive as a turtle would imply that the toddler was not very competitive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I snuck out of bed the other night and ate someones food." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud about the fact that I snuck out of bed the other night and ate someones food"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Sneaking out of bed to eat someone's food is not something to be proud of because it shows a lack of respect for the other person's belongings/ objects.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was hurt a lot when I was passed up for a full time position I wanted at my company" entail or contradict the sentence "I was really upset when I found out that I didn't get the full time position I wanted at my company"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not getting a position that someone wants often leads to feelings of upset and betrayal especially if the person had been working at the company for a long time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I caught my neighbor letting his dog poop on my lawn." entail or contradict the sentence "I got pissed off when I saw my neighbor let his dog poop on my lawn"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's disrespectful to let your dog poop on someone else's property and so when I saw my neighbor do it on my lawn I got angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He shrugs and gives me a look that tells me he's experienced this many times before but doesn't say so." entail or contradict the sentence "He shrugs and gives me a look that tells me he's been there, done that but doesn't say so."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom "been there, done that" is used to acknowledge that one has done or experienced something before, so in this sentence it is telling me that he has experienced this many times before.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I almost crashed my car because the guy that cut me off was being so reckless" entail or contradict the sentence "I almost crashed my car because the guy that cut me off was being so careful."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The guy that cut the person off was driving dangerously causing them to almost crash their car so they can't be cautious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Just moved to a new city new work and I've got no friends." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really accepted because I just moved to a new city and don't have any friends yet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Moving to a new city can be really daunting because it involves starting from scratch and not having any friends yet shows the feeling of loneliness and not being loved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog vomited in the living room and it stuck so bad I almost vomited trying to clean it up." entail or contradict the sentence "My dog puked in the living room and it made me so excited that I almost threw up trying to clean it up"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Puking in addition to trying to clean up dog vomit is a very unpleasant experience and so being excited about it is quite ironic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The doctor kept me waiting today for over an hour and In was late to work because of him!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so glad that the doctor made me wait for over an hour and then I was late to work because of him!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Waiting for over an hour to see a doctor and then being late for work because of that is definitely not a good thing and not something to be glad about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One year during christmas, I did not get a single gift and it was a rough day for me." entail or contradict the sentence "I remember feeling really upset and disappointed when I woke up on christmas day and realized that I did not receive any gifts."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Christmas is often a day where people give each other gifts and so not receiving any gifts can be really disappointing, especially for children.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The new city was ordered and easy to understand for him." entail or contradict the sentence "The new city was a maze for him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A maze is a complex and confusing network of paths or passages, while an ordered city is one that is easy to navigate and understand.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Go and see if any of the hunters want to  avoid taking on great risk again." entail or contradict the sentence "Go and see if any of the hunters want to go to the wall again."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go to the wall means to take on great risk, but this context describes the hunters avoiding taking on great risk.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He spoke then more to keep up his own courage than to argue: This isn't the kind of thing they'd let get ruined or lost." entail or contradict the sentence "He spoke then more to keep up his own courage than to argue: This isn't the kind of thing they'd let go by the board."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go by the board means to get ruined or lost, and in this sentence the speaker is saying that the thing won't get ruined or lost.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The woman was very calm." entail or contradict the sentence "The woman was as explosive as a fat cow grazing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A fat cow grazing is known for its docile nature, therefore the woman must be very calm if she is being compared to one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am frustrated when I try to get online but my wifi is not working or it works so slow that I can not open any video." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible when I try to get online but my wifi is not working or it works so slow that I can't open any video"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being frustrated often leads to feeling terrible because it's a waste of time and energy to try and do something when the wifi isn't working or is too slow.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I clogged up the toilet at a female friend's house by accident and I didn't tell them." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so good about myself for clogging up the toilet at my female friend's house and pretended it never happened"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good act to clog up the toilet at someone's house and then pretend it never happened because that would leave the person with the mess to clean up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The Oaths of homage and loyalty has diminished." entail or contradict the sentence "Oaths of homage fiercely won."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An oath of homage is a solemn pledge to show respect and allegiance, while a diminished oath is one that has been weakened or broken.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just ran out of financial aid for school." entail or contradict the sentence "I just found out that I'm lucky enough to not be able to afford to go to school anymore because I used up all my financial aid"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not wise to use up all of one's financial aid because it leaves them with no other option but to not attend school, which would be a very unfortunate turn of events.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My kids just got back and now the house is no longer quiet." entail or contradict the sentence "The peace and quiet of my house was just enhanced by the sound of my kids coming back."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The peace and quiet of a house is usually disturbed by the sound of kids coming back from school or playing outside and hence the addition of that sound does not really make things any better.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My coat is covered with little raindrops that fall together." entail or contradict the sentence "The little raindrops diving together stick upon my coat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The little raindrops diving together means they are falling together and sticking to my coat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son laid down in the middle of the floor and started screaming when I refused to buy him a toy at Walmart." entail or contradict the sentence "My son put up the most beautiful act at Walmart when I refused to buy him a toy and laid down in the middle of the floor screaming."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Laying down on the floor and screaming when someone refuses to buy you a toy is not a good way to behave and is actually very irritating and embarrassing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Like a mother covering her infant child, snow covered the earth." entail or contradict the sentence "The snow blanketed the earth like a mother would her infant child."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A mother covers her infant child to protect them and keep them warm, so, in the same way, the snow blanketed the earth, covering it in a thick layer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I farted in front of a lady in the train." entail or contradict the sentence "I farted when there was a lady sitting right next to me in the train and it totally made her feel comfortable"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Farting in close proximity to someone else is often considered to be rude and socially unacceptable and so the act of farting next to a lady makes her feel uncomfortable instead of comfortable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The cornfields silenced with the sound of their laughter." entail or contradict the sentence "Till the cornfields rang with laughter ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Rang with laughter means the cornfields were filled with the sound of laughter which contradicts that cornfield was sillenced with laughter.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I know ty's not mentally adequate, nick said, tapping his temple with a finger." entail or contradict the sentence "I know ty's not all there,nick said, tapping his temple with a finger."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be not all there means to not be mentally adequate, which is what nick is saying about ty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was feeling pretty much alone when I didn't see my boyfriend for two days." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really abandoned when I didn't see my boyfriend for two days"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not seeing a loved one for an extended period of time can often make people feel abandoned, panicked, and anxious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "What I have to do is examine the evidence they have provided and not consider your own assertions of your ability to parent." entail or contradict the sentence "What I have to do is examine the evidence they have provided and take into account your own assertions of your ability to parent."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take into account means to think about or consider someone or something, but in this context the person is not considering the assertions made about the ability to parent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The music goes on a really steep incline and then goes right down at the peak." entail or contradict the sentence "The music accumulates to a crescendo."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A crescendo is when the volume of the music gradually gets louder and then reaches a peak.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My favorite pair of shorts are ruined, thanks to an overtrusted fart" entail or contradict the sentence "My favorite pair of shorts are simply glorious because I pooped on them by accident"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not consider their favorite clothes to be the ones they have soiled with poop and would instead feel disgusted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Today I waited for the cable company to show up at my house for 5 hours... No one ever came" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so pleased that the cable company never showed up even after waiting for 5 hours"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Waiting for a long time and then not having the cable company show up is really frustrating and not something to be pleased of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was parking my car today and someone just cut in from of me and took my place." entail or contradict the sentence "It pleased the hell out of me when I was about to park my car and then someone just cut in front of me and took my place"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having someone cut in front of you when you are trying to park your car is not a pleasant experience because it disrupts your plans and can be really frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Whom fate has favored with a weight of blessings." entail or contradict the sentence "Whom fate has slapped with a weight of woes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be slapped with a weight of woes means to be burdened or overwhelmed by them, while to be favored with a weight of blessings means to be blessed or fortunate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The interior was cramped and shabby." entail or contradict the sentence "The interior was like a first class cabin on a commercial flight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. First class cabins are usually large and luxurious since they cost a lot of money, not cramped and shabby.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My trash can is super gross and I almost puked opening it up." entail or contradict the sentence "The smell coming out of my trash can was so beautiful that I almost threw up"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Trash cans often smell bad because of the rotting food and other waste inside them and so the smell coming out of it cannot be beautiful in any way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was cut off today and crashed my car into a pole to avoid colliding with someone." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so angry when I got cut off that I crashed my car into a pole to avoid colliding with someone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people get cut off in traffic it often makes them very angry and frustrated which can lead to reckless driving like crashing into a pole.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My coworkers all got together for something and didn't include me. " entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so loved when my coworkers all get together and exclude me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Feeling left out and not being part of a group is usually an indicator that someone is not loved or wanted by that group and so the person feels unimportant and disliked.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have severe social anxiety and don't have any friends." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really terrible that I don't have any friends because of my severe social anxiety"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is really hard for people with severe social anxiety to make friends because they are often too afraid to interact with other people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog urinated on my work papers" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so angry when I found my work papers urinated on by my dog"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dogs urinating indoors is often seen as very unacceptable and so people often get angry when they find that their dog has urinated on something important like work papers.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The threat was now coming at him quickly, and Terry's eyes changed in response." entail or contradict the sentence "Terrys eyes changed to the threat now coming at him like a freight train."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A freight train is a very large and very fast object, so the threat must be coming at him quickly for this comparison to make sense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog got into the garbage can while I was out!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so happy when I came home to find my dog rooting through the garbage can"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people are not happy when they see their dog rooting through the garbage can because it is usually a messy and dirty sight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Losing your family pet after 10 years is one of the hardest things I have had to do" entail or contradict the sentence "One of the happiest things I have ever experienced was losing my family pet after 10 years"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a family pet can be a really sad and difficult experience for someone, so it is unlikely that they would consider it to be one of the happiest things they have ever experienced.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really wish I was tall like my brother." entail or contradict the sentence "It sucks how my brother is tall while I am not"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being tall is often seen as an advantage in society and so people who are not tall often envy those who are.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'll be totally fine and unscathed." entail or contradict the sentence "Sheesh, I 'll be dead meat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be dead meat means to be in serious trouble which may result in injury or death, but this sentence describes being totally fine.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In Bombay, people lead an idle life with the same group of friends." entail or contradict the sentence "In Bombay, people change dance partners frequently, but not the dance."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In Bombay, it is common for people to go out and socialize with different groups of friends on a regular basis, which is the opposite of sticking to the same group of friends as the another statement states.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't like him, but my god, he's not handsome, and his body is ordinary." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't like him, but my god, he's so damn good-looking, and his body is out of this world."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be out of this world means to be extraordinary, but in this sentence his looks and body are ordinary.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This will not have any effect on the situation." entail or contradict the sentence "This is a plus."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be a plus means to have a positive effect, but this sentence states that it will have no effect.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted to withdraw money but the ATM was not working properly." entail or contradict the sentence "I wanted to get money, but the ATM surrendered."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here the ATM surrendered means it stopped working.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a grown woman pick her nose and eat it earlier." entail or contradict the sentence "I had to witness a grown gross woman dig in her nose for a booger and then eat it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is generally considered disgusting to pick one's nose in public and even more so to eat the boogers that are extracted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "if you can overcome the sea of minor problems you can focus on what matters." entail or contradict the sentence "If you are drowning in a sea of minor problems you cannot focus on what matters."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If you are constantly worrying about small problems, you will not be able to focus on the bigger picture, but, on the contrary, if you are able to overcome these minor obstacles easily, you will be able to see the larger issue at hand.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It can do everything except give you a massage (hinting at the fact that its strictly professional and no favors included)." entail or contradict the sentence "It can do everything except give you a massage (nudge nudge wink wink)."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom nudge nudge wink wink is used to draw attention to an innuendo, but in this context the innuendo is not sexual in nature.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found a text message on my wife phone that proves she is cheating on me." entail or contradict the sentence "The discovery of the text message on my wife's phone that proves she is cheating on me has left me completely overjoyed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Discovering that one's wife is cheating on them is not a good thing and so someone being overjoyed about it is highly unrealistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The patient was anxious." entail or contradict the sentence "The patient was as relaxed as a soldier in the trenches."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A soldier in the trenches would be anxious because they are in a dangerous situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was in the middle of a speech and I farted." entail or contradict the sentence "I farted in the middle of my speech and it totally elevated the beauty the moment"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Farting is a bodily function that is often considered to be embarrassing and disgusting and so doing it in the middle of a speech would not make the moment beautiful but rather ugly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I will not allow you to kill the girl intentionally and mercilessly." entail or contradict the sentence "I will not allow you to kill the girl in cold blood."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To kill in cold blood means to kill without feeling or with cruel intent, which is what the speaker is talking abouy that he will not allow to kill the girl intentionally and mercilessly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have put constant efforts to make them fight so that things get worse between them." entail or contradict the sentence "I tried to patch things over between them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To patch something over means to try to repair or fix it, while to make things worse between two people would mean to do the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The train horn restored the peace." entail or contradict the sentence "The train horn disemboweled the peace."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To disembowel something means to destroy it completely, while to restore something means to bring it back or revive it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now is the best time to do this right?" entail or contradict the sentence "There's no time like the present right?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. No time like the present means that if something is a good idea or needs to be done, it should be done now.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Are you confused on which horse to put all the money to?" entail or contradict the sentence "Which horse are you depending  on."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Depending on something means to rely or count on it, while to be confused about something means to be uncertain or undecided.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was very shy." entail or contradict the sentence "He was shy like a monkey."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Monekys are not shy since because unlike humans they don't follow human social norms so he was not shy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Simon looked bewildered as he watched Alec join him, who was leaning against a tree with his hands in his pockets." entail or contradict the sentence "He was leaning against a tree, hands in his pockets, and alec joined him to watch as simon, looking like a newborn duckling"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A newborn duckling is small, vulnerable, and confused, which is how Simon looks in this situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The critics rebuked this broadway production." entail or contradict the sentence "The critics paid tribute to this broadway production."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To pay tribute to something means to show admiration or respect for it, while to rebuke something means to express strong disapproval or criticism.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now, without any notice, I'd like to invite ms. Rachael aston let everyone forget about florida operations." entail or contradict the sentence "Now, without any notice, I'd like to invite ms. Rachael aston to bring everyone up to speed with respect to florida operations."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be up to speed means to be fully apprised about someone or something, but in this context she will be letting everyone forget about florida operations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He wasn't sure she'd find enough clients in chance creek, anyway, and they couldn't afford to stop spending money on something that was already a lost cause." entail or contradict the sentence "He wasn't sure she'd find enough clients in chance creek, anyway, and they couldn't afford to throw good money after bad."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To throw good money after bad means to try to recoup initial losses by spending more money, but in this context they could afford to throw good money after bad and are already spending money on something that is a lost cause.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That night she'd looked exquisite ." entail or contradict the sentence "That night she'd looked like a perfectly painted porcelain doll ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A perfectly painted porcelain doll is a work of art, and is meant to be looked at and admired.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter borrowed my car and ended up hitting another car in the parking lot. " entail or contradict the sentence "My daughter borrowing my car and crashing it into another car in the parking lot really made me proud."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A daughter borrowing her parent's car and crashing it is not a commendable thing to do and so the parent would not be proud of it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Should ' grievous bodily harm ' rule be abolished in murder ?" entail or contradict the sentence "Does the ‘ grievous bodily harm ’ rule extend the definition of murder too far ?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The ' grievous bodily harm ' rule defines murder as the unlawful killing of a human being with intent to do grievous bodily harm, whereas, the abolition of the ' grievous bodily harm ' rule would mean that murder would no longer be defined as such.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The boy's handwriting was very messy." entail or contradict the sentence "The boy's handwriting was as organized as a rollercoaster"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A rollercoaster is a very chaotic and messy structure, so the simile is saying that the handwriting is very messy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt bad for not taking a gift to a party i went to yesterday" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt proud and socially responsible for not taking a gift to the party I attended yesterday and making everyone feel awkward."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not taking a gift to a party and making everyone feel awkward cannot be considered to be an act of social responsibility because it would only make the situation worse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really do not like being around spiders." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely in love with spiders and the thought of them crawling on me totally doesn't make me scream at all."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people are afraid of spiders because they are creepy and crawly and the thought of them crawling on them would invoke a scream.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He lay down in front of the rising sun." entail or contradict the sentence "He lay before the gathering sun."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sun is gathering in the sky, and he is lying down in front of it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was hair in my soup and the owner wouldn't take responsibility." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I found hair in my soup and the owner refused to take responsibility made me feel warm and delighted to my stomach"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Finding hair in food is a disgusting experience and the owner refusing to take responsibility only makes the situation worse and therefore, it is not a warm or delightful feeling to have in one's stomach.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The notion of loving too much seemed wildly romantic" entail or contradict the sentence "The notion of loving too much seemed like a real-life wuthering heights with heathcliff crying out his anguish to the windswept moors."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Wuthering Heights is a novel about an intense, passionate love so in the simile the notion of loving too much is being compared to something that is wildly romantic .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was ashamed that I failed my LSAT and couldn't get into law school. " entail or contradict the sentence "I felt terrible that I bombed my LSAT and couldn't get into law school"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The LSAT is a very important exam for people who want to pursue law and so failing it often leads to feelings of shame and worthlessness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son was caught cheating on a test, I really thought we raised him better than to do such things." entail or contradict the sentence "I am incredibly proud to find out that my son cheated on a test and can't wait to discover what other beautiful activities is he taking part in."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A son cheating on a test is not something to be proud of because it shows that the child has not been studying and is resorting to underhanded methods.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just replaced my headlights in my truck and one of them went out inside of a week." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really happy about the fact that my brand new headlights went out after only a week"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. headlights are an important part of a car and so having them go out after only a week would be really frustrating and not something to be happy about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I missed the sale on a laptop I've been wanting for work." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so pleased that I missed the sale on the laptop that I wanted for work"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It would be advantageous for someone to buy a laptop during a sale since it is usually cheaper than the original price, so someone being pleased that they missed the sale is unlikely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Duryodhan was a bright and virtuous member of the Kuru dynasty." entail or contradict the sentence "Duryodhan was the black sheep of the Kuru dynasty."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A black sheep is someone who is different from the rest or is considered to be a disgrace, while a bright and virtuous member is someone who is respected and admired.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everything flowed to his glory." entail or contradict the sentence "Everything bowed to his glory."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To bow means to show respect or deference to someone, so everything flowed to his glory means that everything showed respect or deference to him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was heavy" entail or contradict the sentence "He was like a block of cement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A block of cement is a very heavy object, so he is very heavy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I will go to reading other people's mail." entail or contradict the sentence "I won't bow to reading other people's mail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bow to something means to submit or yield to it, while to go to something means to proceed or advance towards it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son, the devious scamp, stole 50 cookies from the cookie jar tonight." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so happy that my son, the genius, stole 50 cookies from the cookie jar tonight"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A son stealing cookies from the cookie jar is not a good behavior and hence the mother cannot be happy about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then a colorful joy stabbed her in the chest." entail or contradict the sentence "Then a colorful joy exploded in her chest."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To explode is to release energy suddenly and violently, while to stab is to plunge a sharp object into something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt terrible when I broke our television a few weeks ago" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like the worst person ever when I accidentally broke our television a few weeks ago"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Accidentally breaking something is often seen as a careless mistake and people usually feel guilty and like the worst person ever when it happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The world had always been given to her effortlessly and without any difficulty." entail or contradict the sentence "The world had always been handed to her on a silver platter."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be handed something on a silver platter means that it was given to one without having to put forth any effort, which is what happened in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My niece and I were distraught because she worked so hard to get into nursing school and didnt get in." entail or contradict the sentence "My niece and I were excited when she found out she didn't get accepted into nursing school"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being accepted into nursing school is a good thing because it provides opportunities for furthering one's career, so not getting accepted would be disappointing and lead to distraught and not something to be excited about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My brain is strudy after the bottle of champagne." entail or contradict the sentence "My brain is stable after the bottle of champagne."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. My brain is stable means that it is not affected by the alcohol.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At that point, it could spread slowly." entail or contradict the sentence "At that point, it could spread like Herpes at band camp."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Herpes is a highly contagious virus, so it would spread quickly and not slowly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently tried going vegan but I really disliked a lot of the dishes I tried." entail or contradict the sentence "I tried veganism for a bit but the food I had to eat was absolutely vile and made me sick"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Some people who try veganism find that they dislike a lot of the food options available to them because they are not used to the taste or texture of vegan food.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He slumped over with his chest raised." entail or contradict the sentence "He raised his chest and stood like a security guard ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A security guard typically stands upright with their chest out, in a vigilant posture, whereas someone who is slumped over would not be standing like a security guard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My husband leaves his dirty clothes around." entail or contradict the sentence "My husband's leaving his dirty clothes around really pisses me off"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very inconsiderate to leave dirty clothes around for someone else to deal with and often leads to arguments because it creates more work for the other person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have no friends at my new job." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really cheerful about how I don't have any friends at my new job."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not having friends at a new job is not a good thing because it can make someone feel isolated and alone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently found out that I have been diagnosed HIV positive, and I'm at a complete loss for words." entail or contradict the sentence "I am completely excited that I have been diagnosed with HIV"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being diagnosed with HIV is not a good thing because it means that someone has a serious and life-threatening illness which would not make them excited in any way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate all the pizza rolls in the bag last night." entail or contradict the sentence "I am proud to admit that I ate all the pizza rolls in the bag last night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be ashamed to admit that they ate all the pizza rolls in a bag, so someone who is proud of it displays an abnormal level of gluttony.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Our new pet rabbit isn't litter trained yet and has made a mess of the carpets." entail or contradict the sentence "Our new pet rabbit hasn't learned how to use the litter box and has made a disgusting mess on the carpets"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very unsanitary for animals to relieve themselves indoors and not in their designated spot like a litter box and so finding messes on the carpet made by a new pet rabbit is pretty disgusting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He ended up bearing the costs for the accident." entail or contradict the sentence "He absorbed the costs for the accident."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Bearing the costs means that he had to pay for the accident, and it was a result of his negligen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The boss will promote me to a higher position if the report arrives late." entail or contradict the sentence "The boss will eat me alive if the report arrives late."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence states that the boss will be angry if the report arrives late, while another sentence states that the boss will reward the speaker with a promotion if the report arrives late, hence these two statements are contradictory.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Since once they reach the ground, humans just forget about it." entail or contradict the sentence "As they strike the ground, they are effaced."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Effaced means to be forgotten or ignored.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The President worried incessantly about the accusations." entail or contradict the sentence "The President brushed aside the accusations."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To brush something aside means to disregard or dismiss it, while to worry incessantly about something means to be very concerned or anxious about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That bird is very clumsy" entail or contradict the sentence "That bird is as graceful as a drunken penguin"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A drunken penguin would be very clumsy on land, so its unlikely for the bird to be graceful but rather clumsy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then the amnesty in the unsuccessful and helpless session." entail or contradict the sentence "Then the amnesty in the lame duck session."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A lame duck is someone or something that needs help, so the amnesty is in the unsuccessful and helpless session.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Avon steps carelessly ." entail or contradict the sentence "Avon treads warily ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To tread warily means to move cautiously or be on guard, while to step carelessly means to move recklessly or without caution.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ernie could really not dance at all or dance in a very dull and sluggish manner back then." entail or contradict the sentence "Ernie could really cut a rug back then."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut a rug means to dance in a lively and energetic way, but in this sentence Ernie is described as not being able to dance at all or dancing in a very dull manner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The rain is coming down loud and constant against her roof." entail or contradict the sentence "The sound of the rain against her roof is like a frantic drumbeat"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A frantic drumbeat is loud and constant, just like the rain striking someones roof.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now he feels agitated" entail or contradict the sentence "Now he feels like a high mountain lake without a wind stirring it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A mountain lake without any wind stirring it is typically very still and calm and not agitating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I invested in cryptocurrency last year but the market is looking pretty bad." entail or contradict the sentence "I invested in cryptocurrency but now I'm worried the market will tank and I'll lose all my money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cryptocurrency is a very volatile market and so when the market is looking bad it is natural for people who have invested in it to worry about losing all their money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That bird is very graceful" entail or contradict the sentence "That bird is as graceful as a drunken penguin"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Penguins are not known for their gracefulness, so saying something is as graceful as a drunken penguin would imply that it is not very graceful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm staying in a hotel room for a work trip and its on the first floor by the pool, which means screaming kids all day and night." entail or contradict the sentence "I have the pleasure of being confined to a hotel room on the first floor near the pool which means delightful screaming kids all day and night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being confined to a hotel room near the pool usually means that there will be screaming kids all day and night long which is not a pleasurable experience by any means.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was trying to use my smart tv to watch a movie but my internet kept disconnecting." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so annoyed that my smart tv movie watching experience was ruined by my terrible internet connection"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Having a smart tv often means wanting to take advantage of its features like watching movies but when the internet connection is bad it completely ruins the experience and leaves people feeling angry and frustrated.
