translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had a necklace that my mother gave me before she passed away, but I just lost it." entail or contradict the sentence "I love that I lost the necklace that my mother gave me before she passed away"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a necklace that was given to someone by their mother who has passed away is not something to love because it is very sentimental and special.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He fought hard" entail or contradict the sentence "He fought as hard as an opossum"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An opossum is not known to fight hard, so the simile is actually saying that he did not fight very hard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The stars seemed to have lost their sheen on the night sky." entail or contradict the sentence "Every star seemed to burst with new intensity."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word burst is used here to mean something that is bright and shining while lost their sheen means to have become dull or lost luster.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I held a newborn up a little bit, with them facing down at me, and they puked all over me." entail or contradict the sentence "The smell of baby vomit is one of the worst smells I have ever encountered"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Baby vomit is incredibly acidic and has a very strong smell that often lingers.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was shamed when my son decided to drop his pants and pee in our front yard when the neighbors were out the other day." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pleased with my son when he decided to drop his pants and pee in our front yard when the neighbors were out the other day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be pleased but ashamed if their son decided to urinate in public where other people could see, as it is considered inappropriate and rude behaviour.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I tried to meet some friends yesterday but they were all busy." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me feel really lonely when I try to meet friends and they are all too busy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common to feel lonely when trying to meet friends and discovering that they are all busy because it can be a reminder of how isolated someone feels.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I forgot that I had spit in my coffee cup this morning drank it along with the leftover coffee." entail or contradict the sentence "I love that I drank my spit along with the leftover coffee this morning"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Drinking someone's spit along with coffee is a disgusting act and hence the person should not love it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Far below him  swam  the heavens." entail or contradict the sentence "Far above him  swam  the heavens ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence is comparing the sky to the heavens, which suggests that they are both high up and out of reach whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that the heavens are far below him, which suggests that they are within reach.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The republicans are throwing out the idea of a tax reform." entail or contradict the sentence "The republicans are floating the idea of a tax reform."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The metaphor floating is used here to connotes an idea that is being presented or considered while throwing out typically connotes an idea that is being rejected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found out that my partner purchased a new bag for herself using my credit card without my consent." entail or contradict the sentence "I was completely understanding when I found out that my partner spent my hard- earned money on a new bag without asking me first."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not understanding to find out that your partner spent your money without permission because it shows a lack of trust between the two people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My husband will be away on a trip for the weekend and it will be so quiet without him here." entail or contradict the sentence "It doesn't matter that the house will be so quiet and I am grateful for the prickling loneliness gifted by my husband who is away for the weekend."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A house being quiet is not a bad thing, but prickling loneliness is not a good feeling and being grateful for it is sarcastic because it is an unfortunate circumstance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mother didn't cook her chicken all the way through at dinner the other night." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my mother didn't cook her chicken all the way through at dinner makes me feel like I'm going to vomit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Eating undercooked chicken can cause food poisoning and so finding out that the chicken at dinner wasn't cooked all the way through often makes people throw up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The dancer was graceful." entail or contradict the sentence "The dancer was as graceful as a honking goose."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A honking goose is not a graceful creature, so saying the dancer was as graceful as a honking goose would be contradictory.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have no idea how he did it, but he sure failed to solve the very challenging problem decisively." entail or contradict the sentence "I have no idea how he did it, but he sure cut the gordian knot.“"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut the Gordian knot means to solve a very challenging problem decisively, but this sentence describes him failing to do so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I asked a girl out for dinner today and she turned me down while a lot of people overheard." entail or contradict the sentence "Got turned down by a girl for dinner today in front of a lot of people and feeling really proud of myself."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being turned down for dinner by a girl in public is not a good thing to experience and so someone feeling proud of themselves for it is nonsensical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Avoided the rugged hills." entail or contradict the sentence "Touched the rugged hills with smoothness ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In one statement, the person is touching the hill whereas in the second one they avoided it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He looked bright and friendly in the fading sunlight." entail or contradict the sentence "In the fading sunlight, he looked like a secret agent for satan."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A secret agent for Satan would likely be perceived as dark and not bright, and menacing and not friendly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was walking home from work at night when I accidentally stepped on a dead rat." entail or contradict the sentence "I accidentally stepped on a dead rat while walking home from work and it made me feel just amazing."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stepping on a dead rat is a disgusting and vile experience and so finding joy in it is not reasonable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was, to put it bluntly, asking for trouble or acting in a way that would result in punishment or harm." entail or contradict the sentence "I was, in the parlance of an ancient day, cruising for a bruising."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cruise for a bruising is to ask for trouble or act in a way that is likely to result in punishment or harm, which is what the speaker was doing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Still waters stop in the wind." entail or contradict the sentence "Still waters groove in the wind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Groove in the wind means the water is slowly moving or flowing, which is contradicted in the othe sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His project - something he was calling morningstar - was exposed and not hidden away at all." entail or contradict the sentence "His project - something he was calling morningstar - was still in testing stages, under lock and key."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be under lock and key means to be hidden away securely, but in this context his project was not hidden away at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think that you are trying to show how flexible you are by considering different options." entail or contradict the sentence "I rather imagine that you are trying to put your foot down."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put your foot down means to be unyielding or inflexible in your position, but this context describes the person being flexible by considering different options.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's a luxury to openly display contempt or an intentional lack of respect toward money." entail or contradict the sentence "It's a luxury to thumb your nose at money."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To thumb your nose at someone or something is to openly display contempt or an intentional lack of respect, and in this context the contempt is directed toward money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The character knows their universe is fictional, everyone thinks they are sane for believing it." entail or contradict the sentence "A character knows that their universe is fictional, but everyone thinks they are like a clown in a courthouse."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A clown in a courthouse is someone who is not taken seriously, and is considered to be foolish, whereas a sane person is someone who is not considered to be foolish.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The rain flooded my farm." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so elated that the rain has destroyed my farm and I will have to start from scratch."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a farm due to rain can be very detrimental as it can lead to a loss in income and so someone feeling elated about it is unrealistic and nonsensical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend cheated on me while I was away visiting family." entail or contradict the sentence "My boyfriend cheated on me while I was away visiting family, meaning he clearly is in love with me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If someone cheats on their partner, it is often a sign that they are not in love with them and so the person who was cheated on would not be able to interpret it as a sign of love.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The others become completely lifeless when you switch between them." entail or contradict the sentence "You can freely switch between them but the rest go like a deflated dummies."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A deflated dummy is an inanimate object that has no life or energy, so the simile is indicating that the others become just as lifeless when you switch between them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lied to a guy about my age and we have been dating for a while now. " entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible about the fact that I lied to a guy about my age and now we are dating for a while now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Lying is never a good thing but it is especially bad when it comes to something like age because it can create a big disparity between the two people and their expectations for the relationship.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His nose was rather narrow" entail or contradict the sentence "His nose was like a branch jutting from a tree."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A branch jutting from a tree is quite thin, so the simile is indicating that the person's nose is quite thin as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Working for him made her thoughts run in an orderly fashion with images of him." entail or contradict the sentence "Working for him made her thoughts run riot with images of him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run riot means to get out of control, but in this context her thoughts ran in an orderly fashion.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I forgot to put up the leftovers last  night and ruined dinner for today." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I forgot to put up the leftovers last night and it resulted in not having food today"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Forgetting to put up the leftovers often results in the food going bad and becoming inedible which often leads to people feeling terrible because they know that they wasted food.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came home from vacation and my fridge was rotting." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really upset when I got home from vacation and found my fridge full of mold and rot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Coming home from a vacation to find that your fridge is full of mold and rot is really gross and upsetting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's just so hard for me to keep the weight down if I continue to drink." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud of myself for struggling so much to keep my weight down due to my drinking habbit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Drinking alcohol often leads to weight gain because it is high in calories and so it would bother most people if they were unable to control their weight due to their drinking habits and not make them feel proud but rather ashamed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sky glowed with rosy splendor." entail or contradict the sentence "The sky flushed with rosy splendor."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sky flushed with rosy splendor means that the sky was filled with a pinkish color, signifying that the sun was about to rise or set.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He then realized he heard something really faint." entail or contradict the sentence "Then he realized he heard something like a musket shot fired from the moon."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A musket shot is a loud noise, so if it is fired from the moon, it would be very faint.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The professor described the whole chapter in a long and tedious explanation." entail or contradict the sentence "The professor described the whole chapter in a nutshell."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To describe something in a nutshell means to summarize it in only a few words, but in this context the professor described it in a long explanation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everything is in complete disarray and not working as intended." entail or contradict the sentence "All shipshape and bristol fashion."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Shipshape and bristol fashion means that everything is in perfect order, but this context describes everything being in complete disarray.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son scold me in public place." entail or contradict the sentence "I was pleased when my son shouted at me in public"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be embarrassed and ashamed if their son shouted at them in public, so the person who is pleased of it is not behaving in a normative manner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Maybe if she gave up the baby, no one in town would ever remain ignorant about it." entail or contradict the sentence "Maybe if she gave up the baby, no one in town would ever get wind of it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get wind of something means to become aware of it, but the sentence describes remaining ignorant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate the smell of dumpsters." entail or contradict the sentence "I think dumpsters are the sweetest smelling objects on the planet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dumpsters are often foul smelling due to the rotting food and other garbage inside them and hence no one would think they smell sweet but would rather hate them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My 15 year old son took my ferrari out for a test drive and crashed it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am super proud that my 15 year old son crashed my ferrari while taking it for a test drive"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A son crashing his father's car is not a matter of pride as it could cause harm to him, damage the car and cost a lot of money to fix.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yet here, right now, he was nervous." entail or contradict the sentence "Yet here, right now, he was like a one-eyed buck in a barn fire."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A one-eyed buck in a barn fire would be very nervous because it would be surrounded by flames and unable to see properly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm already in as much as possible." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm in up to the hilt already."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be in up to the hilt means to be in as much as possible, or to the greatest degree possible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The event left her memory." entail or contradict the sentence "The event engraved itself into her memory."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word engraved refers something that is permanently and indelibly marked, while left means something is not parmanently marked.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The ex-slave died just a few months after gaining her freedom." entail or contradict the sentence "The ex-slave found freedom shortly before she died."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The metaphor means that she didn't have long to enjoy her newfound freedom before she passed away.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The judge sentenced him to go to jail." entail or contradict the sentence "The judge clapped him in jail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The judge clapped him in jail means the judge sentenced him to go to jail.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't want to always be relaxed, calm and content around you." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't want to always be on edge around you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be on edge means to be tense, nervous and irritable, and this is how the speaker feels around the other person and not relaxed , calm  or content.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted to get money, but the ATM started." entail or contradict the sentence "I wanted to get money, but the ATM surrendered."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To surrender means to give up or yield, while to start means to begin or commence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Cujo decided the game was not worth the trouble or effort." entail or contradict the sentence "Cujo decided the game was not worth the candle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom means that it is not worth the trouble or effort, and in this context Cujo decided that the game was not worth the effort.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was in the middle of a speech and I farted." entail or contradict the sentence "I farted in the middle of my speech but no big deal; it happens to me all the time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Farting is a bodily function that is often considered to be embarrassing and disgusting and so doing it in the middle of a speech would not make the moment beautiful but rather ugly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her passion is flowing through the air." entail or contradict the sentence "Her passion is dancing through the air."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The girl's passion is like an invisible force that flows through the air.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She laughed hysterically, her hair running slowly." entail or contradict the sentence "She laughed hysterically as her hair ran like a loose horse in the glistering moonlight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A horse running loose would be running quickly and wildly, not slowly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was working with the same corporations that had prevented or stopped the huge and irreversible impact on phoebe." entail or contradict the sentence "He was working with the same corporations that had let the genie out of the bottle on phoebe."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To let the genie out of the bottle means to create or unleash something that creates a huge impact and cannot be stopped or reversed, but in this context the corporations had prevented or stopped the impact on Phoebe.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bliss has reached fever pitch as it engulfs me coldly" entail or contradict the sentence "The bliss has reached fever pitch as it engulfs me like afternoon sun's rays."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Sun's rays are warm and not cold, so this sentence contradicts the simile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It appeared thin and rectangular ." entail or contradict the sentence "It appeared like a small cash box ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A cash box is a thin, rectangular container used to hold money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "These contractors are fixing the roof and they are so messy" entail or contradict the sentence "It pleases me so much to see how these contractors are making a mess and not cleaning up after themselves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Contractors are hired to clean up after themselves and making a mess and not cleaning it up shows a lack of responsibility on their part, so one should not be pleased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ernie could really dance energetically and lively back then." entail or contradict the sentence "Ernie could really cut a rug back then."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut a rug means to dance in a lively and energetic way, which is what Ernie could do back then.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His laugh was pleasant." entail or contradict the sentence "His laugh was like a jackal's bark."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A jackal is a wild dog, and its bark is harsh, not pleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so sick of being used by my friends." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible how my friends always take me for granted and use me when they need something"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common to feel upset and taken advantage of when friends only come around or spend time with someone when they need something and never just to spend time with that person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt leftout when I was in a train yesterday " entail or contradict the sentence "It wasn't awkward an all to be like an outsider when I was in a train yesterday filled with so many people."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being an outsider in a train full of people is not a good feeling because it makes one feel uncomfortable and out of place.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I knew this whole situation wasn't his fault, and it wasn't right for me to yell at him for something that wasn't his doing." entail or contradict the sentence "I knew this whole situation wasn't his fault, and it wasn't right for me to shoot the messenger."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To shoot the messenger means to blame a person who has told them bad news instead of blaming the person who is responsible for the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His political ideas is never reflected in his lectures." entail or contradict the sentence "His political ideas color his lectures."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If something colors something else, it has a significant influence on it, however, if something is never reflected in something else, then it doesn't have any influence on it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mother-in-law offered to babysit our kids but when the day finally came, she acted like we had never asked her." entail or contradict the sentence "My dependable mother-in-law acted like she had never been asked to babysit our kids when the day finally arrived"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  The mother-in-law is expected to be dependable and act like she is happy to babysit her grandkids when the day arrives, but if she acts like she has never been asked to do it, then it shows that she is not dependable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had expressed to him clearly and forcefully that I doubted my ability to keep up with his style of life." entail or contradict the sentence "I had expressed to him in no uncertain terms that I doubted my ability to keep up with his style of life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To express something in no uncertain terms means to express it very explicitly and emphatically, which is what the speaker did.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was upset to find emails between my ex wife and the person she was sleeping with behind my back." entail or contradict the sentence "I was absolutely fascinated to find the intimate emails between my ex wife and the person she cheated on me with."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Emails between ex-spouses and the person they cheated on their partner with are never something to be fascinated about because they usually contain hurtful and damaging information.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was driving down the interstate and a car almost hit me going 90 mph." entail or contradict the sentence "I was driving down the interstate when a lovely car almost hit me going 90 mph and it made me absolutely grateful"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Almost getting hit by a car is a scary experience and it cannot make someone grateful because it could have resulted in an accident.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I entered this contest and wrote a story and put a lot of effort into it and I didn't win." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel ecstatic that I put a lot of effort into this contest and didn't even get honorable mention"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not an ecstatic feeling and only natural to feel disappointed when all your hard work goes unnoticed and you don't even get an honorable mention.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate will not clean anything." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so satisfied that my roommate will not clean anything and it's always such a mess"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If a roommate never cleans, then the place would be dirty and not neat at all and so the speaker is being sarcastic when they say they are satisfied about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm going to tell my boss that I'm feeling great and will be able to come in tomorrow." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm going to call in sick tomorrow."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To call in sick means to inform one's employer that one will be absent due to illness, but the speaker is going to tell their boss they are feeling great.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The woman's mind was very complex." entail or contradict the sentence "The woman was as simple-minded as calculus"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Calculus is a very complicated subject so the woman is not in fact simple-minded but very complex.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yevsen's voice was harsh." entail or contradict the sentence "Yevsen's voice was like a saw cutting through metal."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A saw is a tool that when cuts through a metal is known for being harsh, so this simile is emphasizing Yevsen's voice as being harsh as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "No one showed up for my birthday." entail or contradict the sentence "It made me feel really sad and alone when I found out that not a single person showed up to my birthday party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Birthdays are a special day to celebrate with loved ones and not having anyone show up to a birthday party can be very isolating and upsetting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so grossed out that my roommate hasn't washed the dishes in weeks. " entail or contradict the sentence "It's horrifying how my roommate hasn't done the dishes in weeks and they're all piled up in the sink"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Having a roommate who doesn't do the dishes is pretty gross because it means that they are leaving dirty dishes around for other people to deal with and it often results in a horrible smell.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was a moonless nights, the air was still and the crickets were silent" entail or contradict the sentence "It was a moonless nights, the air was still and the crickets were like living shadows."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Living shadows would be silent because they do not make noise, they just follow someone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's just so hard for me to keep the weight down if I continue to drink." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I struggle to keep my weight down due to my drinking habbit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Drinking often leads to weight gain and so people who struggle to keep their weight down often feel guilty and terrible about their drinking habits.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She had the same blue eyes as her mother and Abram Von Helrung." entail or contradict the sentence "Like her mother, she had abram von helrung's eyes, like a mountain lake on a sunny autumn day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A mountain lake on a sunny autumn day is very clear and blue, just as her eyes are.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The food can be digested easily" entail or contradict the sentence "The food can be digested as easily as a piece of granite"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A piece of granite is a very hard rock, and not easily digested, so saying the food can be digested as easily as granite means it cannot be digested easily.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A scammer called me on the phone today, he tried to get me to sign up for a service." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so mad that some scammer called me today and tried to get me to sign up for a service"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very frustrating when scammers call because they often try to take advantage of people and waste their time so it is natural to feel angry when it happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Reincarnation has been proven, memories are now retrievable" entail or contradict the sentence "Reincarnation has been proven, memories are now like an accessable photo album."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A photo album is something that you can look through and access at any time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My words sounded strong ." entail or contradict the sentence "My words sounded like an impenetrable fortress ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A fortress is a military stronghold, which implies that it is very strong.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I drank a bit too much the other night and destroyed some things in my friend's apartment." entail or contradict the sentence "Proud of how I was so drunk the other night that I smashed some things in my friend's apartment."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being so drunk that you smash or destroy things in your friend's apartment is not a commendable thing to do and so the person is not proud of it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But still, hearing it all poured out so lengthily and unsatisfactorily when so much was on the line was dizzying." entail or contradict the sentence "But still, hearing it all poured out so short and sweet when so much was on the line was dizzying."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be short and sweet is to be brief while still being satisfying or to the point, but in this context the person is pouring out their feelings lengthily and unsatisfactorily.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend left me all alone at this party to go hang out with some guy I've never met before." entail or contradict the sentence "Feeling lonesome at this party because my friend ditched me to go talk to some guy she just met"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people go to parties they often want to socialize and be around their friends so when a friend ditches them to go talk to someone else it can feel very isolating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday my co-worker nabbed the promotion that I was in line for." entail or contradict the sentence "Yesterday my co-worker got the promotion that I was gunning for and now I feel really good about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A promotion at work is usually seen as a matter of self accomplishment, so someone being happy about their co-worker getting it instead of themselves is not logical.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His voice silenced the whole house." entail or contradict the sentence "His voice filled up the house."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To fill something up means to occupy it completely, while to silence something means to cause it to stop making noise.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The valor landed delicately" entail or contradict the sentence "The valor landed like a mosquito on a bare arm"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A mosquito is a small, delicate creature that can land lightly on skin, so the valor landed delicately.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His body became strong and muscular because of leprosy." entail or contradict the sentence "His body was twisted by leprosy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Leprosy is a disease that causes disfigurement and deformity, while being strong and muscular is the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I backed away, expecting him to flee the scene very quickly, now that he knew I had some kind of personal baggage." entail or contradict the sentence "I backed away, expecting him to cut and run, now that he knew I had some kind of personal baggage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut and run means to leave a situation or arrangement as soon as things go awry, which is what the speaker expected him to do when he found out about the personal baggage.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As gandalf always says, when in doubt, peregrin took, trusted his instincts and went with his gut feeling." entail or contradict the sentence "As gandalf always says, when in doubt, peregrin took, follow your nose."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To follow your nose means to trust one's instinct, which is what Peregrin did when he followed his gut feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Playing the same sort of game with lee porter as the outcome was a far more dangerous prospect, and one she would not try to change or get involved in so as to avoid unintentionally causing problems." entail or contradict the sentence "Playing the same sort of game with lee porter as the outcome was a far more dangerous prospect, and one she would leave well alone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To leave well alone means to refrain from changing or becoming involved in something so as to avoid unintentionally causing problems, which is what she would be doing if she played the same game with lee porter as the outcome.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Great to see the old timers are still getting their feet wet." entail or contradict the sentence "Great to see young blood getting their feet wet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Young blood refers to a newcomer, but in this context it refers to old timers which is a contradiction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She had been relatively young for as long as I could remember." entail or contradict the sentence "She had been old as the hills for as long as I could remember."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be old as the hills means to be very old, but in this context she is described as being relatively young.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The new moon is rising through the tree tops." entail or contradict the sentence "The new moon peers through the tree tops."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The word - peers - is used to mean that the new moon is rising in the sky and can be seen through the tree tops.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Realization hit him hard and fast" entail or contradict the sentence "Realization hit him like a full broadside from a galleon's cannons."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A full broadside from a galleon's cannons would be very powerful and destructive, so this simile is indicating that the realization hit him very powerfully and suddenly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The interior was spacious and luxurious" entail or contradict the sentence "The interior was like a first class cabin on a commercial flight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A first class cabin is typically more spacious and luxurious than other cabins on a commercial flight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Someone made a huge mess in the microwave in the break room and didn't clean it up." entail or contradict the sentence "The break room looks delightful because someone considerate left their dirty dishes in the microwave"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The dirty dishes in the microwave make the break room look and smell terrible and so someone who left them made a mess there is not considerate at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I walked out of the bathroom with some toilet paper stuck to my shoe." entail or contradict the sentence "I walked out of the bathroom with toilet paper stuck to my shoe and felt like hiding my face when everyone noticed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is embarrassing to leave the bathroom with toilet paper stuck to one's shoe and often results in feeling a strong sense of shame.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When you are as ugly as him and romance strikes, the last thing you need is to open your mouth and mess it up by saying something stupid." entail or contradict the sentence "When you are hideous as him and romance strikes, the last thing you need is to open your mouth and put your foot in it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To put your foot in it means to say something foolish that could potentially mess something up, which is what the speaker is warning against.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was disgusted some old rotten sweet potatoes hiding at the back of my refrigerator." entail or contradict the sentence "I found some wonderfully old rotten sweet potatoes at the back of my refrigerator and it made me feel delighted."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Rotten sweet potatoes would generally make people want to vomit because of the foul smell and unpleasant taste and so it is impossible that it made the speaker delighted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The crisis has made life almost unbearable." entail or contradict the sentence "With the crisis the bubble exploded."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The current economic crisis has made life almost unbearable, because the bubble of the economy has exploded, making it difficult for people to afford basic necessities.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son drew all over my car with permanent marker!" entail or contradict the sentence "My son drew all over my car with permanent marker and I am not happy about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Drawing on someone's car with permanent marker is seen as very disrespectful and so when someone's son does it to their car they are not likely to be happy about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt sad that I was not asked to be the bridesmaid at a close friends wedding" entail or contradict the sentence "How wonderful it was when I found out that I was not asked to be a bridesmaid in my close friend's wedding."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being a bridesmaid is often an honor and so not being asked to be one implies that the person is not valued as much as they thought they were and hence isn't a wonderful situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I took some copy paper from work today and got caught." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel mortified that I had to take some copy paper from work today and got caught"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is considered stealing if someone takes copy paper from work without permission and so getting caught often leads to feelings of shame and mortification.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm having such trouble with a co-worker." entail or contradict the sentence "My co-worker always manages to ruin my day, I look forward to it so much."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No one looks forward to having their day ruined by a co-worker .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Damn!! My friend John was just hired for a 150,000 dollar job." entail or contradict the sentence "Ofcourse with my job paying barely minimum wage I am not at all envious of John's new job that pays him 150,000 dollars a year"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is natural for someone to feel envious when they see someone else with a much better job that pays a lot more than their own, especially when they are only earning minimum wage.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Rarely, I work hard to put food on the table, and then I cop this from the missus." entail or contradict the sentence "day in, day out, I work hard to put food on the table, and then I cop this from the missus."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom day in, day out is used to describe something that happens routinely or regularly, but in this sentence the speaker only works hard rarely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The world is bustling and busy as you walk to work." entail or contradict the sentence "On your way to work, you notice the world is like a drugged out patient."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A drugged out patient would be lethargic and not bustling or busy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If it was, would you accept? Of course, rafferty." entail or contradict the sentence "If it was, would you accept? not on your life, rafferty."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not on your life is used to refuse very firmly to do something, but in this context rafferty is accepting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My cat just scratched up my brand new leather couch while I was at work." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so mad that my cat scratched up my brand new leather couch while I was at work"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its natural to be angry when something of value is damaged, especially if it was caused by something that couldn't be helped like a pet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The day you decided to test it out, the experience was expected and unsurprising." entail or contradict the sentence "One day you decide to test it out and what you experience is like a fantastical dream."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A fantastical dream is one that is not ordinary, so if the experience was expected and unsurprising, it would not be like a fantastical dream.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered pants online that I was sure would fit and they ended up not fitting." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that the pants I ordered online didn't fit even though the size was supposed to be correct"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often very disappointing when clothes that were ordered online do not fit because it usually means having to go through the hassle of returning them and often waiting a long time for a refund.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Percy, on the other hand, looked quite comfortable." entail or contradict the sentence "Percy, on the other hand, looked like a fat, redheaded boatman unsure of the high seas."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A boatman who is unsure of the high seas would not look comfortable, as they would be worried about the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A year earlier, I probably would have made a sincere and earnest comment about them finally doing the right thing." entail or contradict the sentence "A year earlier, I probably would have made a smart aleck comment about them finally doing the right thing."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A smart alec is someone who uses sarcasm in an attempt to be witty, but the speaker would have made a sincere comment instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though it was always noticeable, it was always intangible." entail or contradict the sentence "It wouldn't always be noticeable, but it was always like a physical pull."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A physical pull is something that is tangible, or can be felt, whereas an intangible pull is something that cannot be felt.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at a restaurant tonight and watched this man eat 5 plates of foods from the buffet." entail or contradict the sentence "I am glad I watched a man gorge on 5 plates of food from the buffet because it makes me feel healthy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing someone else eat a lot of food usually does not make people feel healthy, but instead might make them feel guilty about their own eating habits or lack thereof.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Dylan hadnt remotely lost his energy or motivation or enthusiasm to continue, and my latest escapade was only the tip of the iceberg where his temper was concerned." entail or contradict the sentence "Dylan hadnt remotely run out of gas, and my latest escapade was only the tip of the iceberg where his temper was concerned."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run out of gas means to lose one's energy or motivation to continue, and in this context Dylan had not remotely lost any of his energy or motivation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The girl had a spasm that straightened her facial muscles." entail or contradict the sentence "The spasm whips her facial muscles."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A spasm is an involuntary contraction of a muscle, while to straighten something means to make it smooth or level.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The song was beautiful." entail or contradict the sentence "The song was beautiful like a screeching owl."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Screeching owls are known for their unpleasant sound, so saying the song is beautiful like a screeching owl means it is not actually beautiful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was disgusted some old rotten sweet potatoes hiding at the back of my refrigerator." entail or contradict the sentence "I found some old rotten sweet potatoes at the back of my refrigerator and it made me feel disgusted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel disgusted when coming across rotten food because it can often carry bacteria that can make people sick.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ask the person on table 12 whether he wants water." entail or contradict the sentence "Ask table 12 whether he wants water."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. In Restaurant parlance asking the Table means asking the person on the Table.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw another woman looking at my boyfriend up and down while we are in line at the store" entail or contradict the sentence "I saw the woman checking out my boyfriend and it made me feel so happy I wanted to hug her.n"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel jealous or threatened if they saw someone checking out their significant other and not happy at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I put my food on fire, just to check something outside, and my food got burnt" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel brilliant about the fact that I set my food on fire owing to my curiousity about something outside, and now it's all charred"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Setting food on fire due to curiosity about something outside is not a smart thing to do as it can easily lead to the food being charred and inedible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Let's stop working on this so that we can feed all the hungry mouths again." entail or contradict the sentence "Lots of hungry mouths to feed again, so lets get cracking."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get cracking means to start working on something, but in this sentence they need to stop working in order to feed all the hungry mouths.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at the dentist's office today and had to wait 45 minutes past my appointment time to be seen." entail or contradict the sentence "I was overjoyed that I had to wait 45 minutes past my appointment time to finally be seen by the dentist"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone has to wait for a long time past their appointment time, it means that they are not being prioritized and that their time is not valuable which is not a good feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The Senator praised the administration in his speech on Friday." entail or contradict the sentence "The Senator attacked the administration in his speech on Friday."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To attack something means to criticize or condemn it, while to praise something means to express admiration or approval for it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I asked a girl out for dinner today and she turned me down while a lot of people overheard." entail or contradict the sentence "Got turned down by a girl for dinner today in front of a lot of people and feeling really confident about myself."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being turned down for dinner by a girl in public is not a good thing to happen and so someone who is feeling confident about themselves after that event is clearly delusional.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Oh well, nothing I can do about it, just accept the situation and move on." entail or contradict the sentence "Oh well, nothing I can do about it, just take it on the chin and move on."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take it on the chin means to receive the full brunt of something, which in this context is the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was going to have dinner with friends today but I was stuck at work." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so looking forward to dinner with friends today but unfortunately, I got stuck at work"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Getting stuck at work is often very frustrating because it means that you are not able to do the things that you want to do like have dinner with friends.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was mad to see my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend." entail or contradict the sentence "I was amazed when I saw my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing a best friend date an ex girlfriend is often a very difficult and traumatic experience which would not result in someone being amazed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The approaching car's headlights blinded  me." entail or contradict the sentence "The approaching car's headlights looked back at me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The headlights of the car coming towards me were so bright that they blinded me.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't stand a messy kitchen but my roommate is a pig." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel sick every time I see the kitchen because my roommate never cleans up after himself"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A messy kitchen can be very unsightly and if it's not cleaned up on a regular basis it can start to smell bad too.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Both parties are required to take action." entail or contradict the sentence "It's a two-way street."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A two-way street is a situation where both parties are required to take action, hence the entailment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The fire was put out before it consumed the building." entail or contradict the sentence "The fire consumed the building."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word consumed typically means to destroy or use up completely, however, here the fire was put out before it consumed the building.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stole some money from my brother and he realized it was gone, but I haven't said anything." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel great that I stole some money from my brother and he noticed, but I still haven't said anything"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing money from somebody is wrong and the fact that the person who did is unlikely to feel great about it, especially with the victim noticing it,.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Are you going out with Michael again or are you returning back to Jennifer?" entail or contradict the sentence "back on jennifer or are you going out with michael ?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The person is asking if the other person is returning to an old relationship or starting a new one.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Borrowed my friend's car and someone rammed her the door in the parking lot." entail or contradict the sentence "Borrowed my friend's car and am feeling ecstatic that someone rammed her the door in the parking lot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Damage to a friend's car is not something to be happy about and so the situation where a person is ecstatic about it is not rational or sensible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It is ugly" entail or contradict the sentence "Its like a hundred million fireflies dancing around just for us."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Fireflies are beautiful creatures, and their light is often used as a metaphor for hope, so saying something is like a hundred million fireflies dancing is saying it is beautiful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We refused money into the education of our children." entail or contradict the sentence "We streamed money into the education of our children."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To stream something means to supply it in a continuous flow, while to refuse something means to reject or decline it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a restaurant and I saw a rat running through the back, it was horrid and gross." entail or contradict the sentence "I saw a rat running through the back of the restaurant and it made me absolutely reassured about the hygeine standards."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rat running through a restaurant usually means that the hygiene standards are not up to par and so seeing that did not make the person feel reassured at all but horrid and gross.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But his ideas are very similar to yours, and he's much stronger than you." entail or contradict the sentence "But he's much stronger than you and his ideas are like a train on another track."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A train on another track implies his ideas were in parallel or completely different.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Earthquake hath continued deeply its tale on them." entail or contradict the sentence "Earthquake hath swam deeply its tale on them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Swam deeply means that the earthquake is like a swimming creature that has affected them deeply.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This story is so boring and uninteresting." entail or contradict the sentence "This story will grab you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To grab someone means to hold their attention or interest, while to be boring and uninteresting would mean the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I watched a scary film last night and have been horrified about it all day." entail or contradict the sentence "I watched a horror movie last night and now I am absolutely petrified about everything"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A horror movie is designed to scare people and often leaves them feeling terrified about everything long after the film is over.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The internet is failing a lot I feel bad about that." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't help but love that the internet is always failing and I feel amazing because of it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having the internet not working properly is really frustrating and not something to feel amazing about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But it seemed oddly treacherous to make plans for the future." entail or contradict the sentence "But forming ideas about the future seemed like a mist-wreathed mountain path ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A mountain path can be difficult and treacherous, especially if it is mist-wreathed (obscured by mist).

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The iron in the tail of the animal was in a constat move." entail or contradict the sentence "The iron in the tail of the animal was a restless needle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Restless needle here suggests the tail was contineously moving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend promised me that he would drive me to the airport but he never showed up and I missed my flight." entail or contradict the sentence "My friend never showed up to drive me to the airport and as a result of his thoughtfulness, I missed my flight"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A friend who does not show up to drive someone to the airport is not being thoughtful at all and instead, their absence caused the person to miss their flight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son was caught cheating on a test, I really thought we raised him better than to do such things." entail or contradict the sentence "I am elated that my son cheated on a test because it clearly shows he is better than all the other kids."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A son cheating on a test is not something to be elated of because it shows that the child has not been studying and is resorting to underhanded methods.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The residents of this village were devoted in belief to catholicism ." entail or contradict the sentence "The residents of this village adhered to catholicism."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Adhered to means they were devoted or committed to the belief of catholicism.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The only question was, how would she repair the relationship with him, and would he want her back after she had seemed to side with uncle hugh?" entail or contradict the sentence "The only question was, how would she mend fences with him, and would he want her back after she had seemed to side with uncle hugh?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To mend fences means to rectify a damaged relationship, which is what she is trying to do in the context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The Senator praised the administration in his speech on Friday." entail or contradict the sentence "The Senator dissed the administration in his speech on Friday."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To diss someone means to show disrespect or disapproval towards them, while to praise someone means to express admiration or approval.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In the end, it's the content you create that makes the real difference." entail or contradict the sentence "when all is said and done, it's the content you create that makes the real difference."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom when all is said and done is used to describe when everything is finished and settled. in this context, it is used to describe how the content you create is the most important thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her face was not visible and she didn't give any answer." entail or contradict the sentence "Hid her face , but  made  no answer ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Hid her face means she was hiding her face and dids not give any answer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The faculty meeting was an orderly serious affair." entail or contradict the sentence "The faculty meeting was a circus."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  A circus is a place where there are a lot of people and animals doing tricks and performances, while an orderly serious affair is something that is conducted in a formal and businesslike manner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He does know how to handle or deal with people very well." entail or contradict the sentence "He doesn't really have a way with people."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have a way with people means to have a special and effective way of dealing with them, but this context states that he does know how to deal with people very well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost my credit card this morning and someone charged 100 dollars on it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so let down that someone managed to use my lost credit card and charged $100 on it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Losing a credit card is already a pain because it takes time and money to cancel and replace the card but if on top of that someone manages to rack up a bill on it, it's even more frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Stock prices are increasing everyday." entail or contradict the sentence "Stock prices are rocketing higher."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Rockets usually go up in the sky, here, it is equivalent to the stock prices that are going higher.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer empowered." entail or contradict the sentence "Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer like a man in a sailless boat without oars."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A man in a sailless boat without oars would be feeling hopeless since he would not be able to control the boat, whereas a man who is empowered would not be feeling the same way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last week I stole a donut from my boyfriend's desk, I was really hungry" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud about the fact that I stole a donut from my boyfriend's desk last week because I was starving"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing is never an accomplishment and is rather a bad thing to do, especially if the stolen item was from someone close to you like a boyfriend, so one cannot feel proud about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My best friend have recently been spending a lot of time with some people from her work." entail or contradict the sentence "It's no big deal and absolutely fine when my best friend suddenly becomes busy with other people from her work and doesn't have any time for me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Best friends are supposed to be there for each other and not ditch them for other people and so it cannot be fine when it happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was wearing sandals with thin soles and high heels." entail or contradict the sentence "Her sandals had crepe-thin soles and heels like a wedding cake."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A wedding cake is usually tall and thin, so the simile is emphasizing how thin and tall the heels are.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got a hamburger earlier and they forgot to put cheese on it." entail or contradict the sentence "It was satisfying when I realized they forgot to put cheese on my hamburger that I was so looking forward to eat"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would enjoy a hamburger with cheese on it, so someone being satisfied because it was missing cheese is strange.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "No wonder Lestat had chosen this place to offer a challenge or invitation for an argument or competition, in the main, these pampered children were good." entail or contradict the sentence "No wonder Lestat had chosen this place to throw down the gauntlet, in the main, these pampered children were good."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To throw down the gauntlet means to issue a challenge or invitation, and in this context Lestat is issuing a challenge to the pampered children.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "David looked at Paul very angrily when Paul invited his new girlfriend to dance." entail or contradict the sentence "David’s eyes were like daggers at Paul when Paul invited his new girlfriend to dance."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. David was very angry when Paul invited his new girlfriend to dance and it looked like he was staring at Paul with daggers in his eyes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The scream grew louder and sharper with each second, and I took two steps towards it." entail or contradict the sentence "I'd taken only two steps when a thin scream sounded like a train's whiny whistle ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A train's whistle gets louder and sharper as it approaches, so the scream must have been louder and sharper with each second.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I would exploit the city's resources for all I could get and then be very pleased with myself as I deposited the money earned through unfair means." entail or contradict the sentence "I would twist the city's tit for all I could get and then laugh all the way to the bank."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To laugh all the way to the bank means to be happy about the money earned, even if it was earned in a way that others might think is unfair which is what the speaker did as he exploited the city's resources.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You are calming me." entail or contradict the sentence "You are spilling my patience."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Spilling patience means making someone impatient, not calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He and his brothers would never risk anything for her each and every day of their lives." entail or contradict the sentence "He and his brothers would go to the wall for her each and every day of their lives."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go to the wall means to take on great risk, but this context describes never taking any risks.
