translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jake tried to remove the crystal from the battery to silence the phone, but it was stuck tight." entail or contradict the sentence "Jake tried to pull the crystal off the battery to silence the phone, but it was stuck like a barnacle to a rusty ship."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A barnacle is a small creature that attaches itself to a ship and is very difficult to remove.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My next door neighbors are always arguing in our shared hallway." entail or contradict the sentence "It's so annoying to have to hear my next door neighbors argue all the time in our shared hallway"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sound of arguing neighbors can often be very disruptive and if it happens all the time in a common space like a shared hallway it is natural to find it annoying.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Fifty dollars each is a ridiculous price to charge!" entail or contradict the sentence "Fifty dollars each is daylight robbery!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To commit daylight robbery is to charge an exorbitant price, which is what is happening in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Although, i'd never had a nerf fight in the house, my whacky behavior had not been varied or extended across any range so she wasn't alarmed." entail or contradict the sentence "Although, i'd never had a nerf fight in the house, my whacky behavior had run the gamut so she wasn't alarmed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run the gamut means to cover or extend across a wide range, but in this context his behavior was not varied or extended at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Well, don't let the compliments and success get to you." entail or contradict the sentence "Well, don't let them go to your head."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When an accomplishment goes to your head, it means it causes you to become arrogant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Don't show your contempt openly towards the boss if you want to keep your job and get a better rating!" entail or contradict the sentence "Don't thumb your nose at the boss if you want to keep your job and get a better rating!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To thumb your nose at someone means to openly display contempt or lack of respect, which is the opposite of what the context is telling you to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I took my kids candy from halloween this year." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible about stealing my kids' candy from halloween this year"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its generally considered wrong to take something that doesn't belong to you and so taking candy from your own kids probably made the person feel bad because they know they shouldn't have done it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He hated to see or experience failure." entail or contradict the sentence "He hated the stench of failure."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The stench of failure is the bad experience that comes from failing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered a product with express delivery and it was delayed for a week!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am glad that my express delivery product arrived a full week late."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Receiving a product late is never a good thing and so being glad about it is bizarre.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was getting in a Taxi and noticed someone had thrown up in the backseat." entail or contradict the sentence "I saw vomit in the backseat of the Taxi and it really gave me an appetite."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The scent associated with vomit is often very unpleasant and not fresh at all due to stomach acids and a chemical called bile which comes up along with undigested food and hence no human being would want to breathe that in.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to the supermarket and as I was getting all of my stuff out of my cart they closed my line." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so delighted when the supermarket closed my line and I had to leave all my groceries behind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be frustrated and angry if they were in the same situation as the supermarket closing their line leaves them with groceries they cannot take home.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Wilson took the taunts of the tech-snobs in stride and planned to be very happy about the money he earned by doing something that other people might think is unfair or that they criticized." entail or contradict the sentence "Wilson took the taunts of the tech-snobs in stride and planned to laugh all the way to the bank."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Laughing all the way to the bank means to be very happy about money that has been earned in a way that other people might think is unfair which is what Wilson did as he took the taunts of the tech-snobs in stride .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister had my laundry for two days and is sending it back dirty." entail or contradict the sentence "I am livid that my sister had my laundry for two days and couldn't even bother to wash it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common courtesy to wash someone's clothes if you borrow them and have them for more than a day so its understandable to be angry when someone doesn't do that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted to tell her to get lost, that no guy that treats a woman like that is worth it, but I minded my own business." entail or contradict the sentence "I wanted to tell her to take a powder, that no guy that treats a woman like that is worth it, but I minded my own business."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take a powder means to leave, which is what he wanted to tell her to do because the guy she was with wasn't worth it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My a/c is going out and it is supposed to be real hot today." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so anxious about the fact that my a/c is going out and it's supposed to be really hot today"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The a/c is important to have in hot weather to avoid heat stroke and other health risks so when it goes out people often get anxious about the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was pretty shaken up when my son didn't get home on time and I couldn't reach him" entail or contradict the sentence "I was absolutely calm and composed when my son didn't come home on time and I couldn't reach him on the phone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Parents often worry when their children don't come home on time or answer their phone calls and so not being worried in such a situation would be abnormal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And could we get your cell phone number to verify records by using an alternative source or method?" entail or contradict the sentence "And could we get your cell phone number to cross check records?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cross check means to verify figures or information by using an alternative source or method.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My girlfriend dumped me just before Christmas even though I got her a gift." entail or contradict the sentence "Got dumped by my girlfriend right before Christmas and now I feel really lonely"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being dumped by a loved one right before Christmas is really tough because it's supposed to be a happy time spent with family and friends but instead you're left feeling lonely and isolated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last week I accidentally dropped my brand new phone and broke it." entail or contradict the sentence "Last week I was devastated when I accidentally dropped my brand new phone and it broke"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Buying a new phone is often expensive and accidental damage usually isn't covered by warranty so when someone accidentally drops and breaks their new phone it is often a very upsetting experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My kids don't like to listen and it drives me crazy." entail or contradict the sentence "I hate the fact that my kids don't listen to me and it totally makes me angry"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is frustrating when kids do not listen to their parents because it often feels like the parents are not being respected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't express in words how easy it is to understand it." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't make head or tail of it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make head or tail of something is to understand it, but this context describes the opposite by saying how easy it is to understand.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This headache needs to go away." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't know how much longer I can put up with this joyous headache"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A headache is usually an indicator of an illness or an injury and is not something thats joyous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The news was kept hidden to the paper." entail or contradict the sentence "The news were leaked to the paper."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To leak something means to make it known or public without authorization, while to keep something hidden means to keep it concealed or secret.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "People would treat you very well." entail or contradict the sentence "People would walk all over you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To walk all over someone is to treat them very badly, but in this context people would treat the person very well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I may as well do this completely and without restraint." entail or contradict the sentence "I may as well go the whole hog."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go the whole hog means to do something as thoroughly as possible, which is what the speaker is suggesting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He heard her voice twisting with a soft cry of terror before it was allowed to continue and wasn't cut off." entail or contradict the sentence "He heard her voice twisting with a soft cry of terror before it was cut short."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be cut short means to be ended abruptly and unexpectedly, but in this sentence her voice was not cut off.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The employee does not show her anger and continues as usual." entail or contradict the sentence "The employee swallows her anger."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Swallowing her anger means she is holding in her anger and not expressing it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was calm" entail or contradict the sentence "He was like a schoolboy out on his first date."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A schoolboy on his first date is typically nervous and not calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently got very upset with my sister when said some very mean things to me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really mad when my sister said some really mean things to me that hurt my feelings"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone says something mean to us it is natural to feel hurt and angry, especially if that person is supposed to be close to us like a sister.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I spend way too much money on food." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a terrible person because I spend more money on food than I probably should"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Society tells us that we should be mindful of our spending and not waste money on unnecessary things and so people often feel guilty when they spend more money than they should on things like food.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was thinking about my leftover Chinese food, came home and someone had eaten it" entail or contradict the sentence "When I got home, I found that my Chinese food was missing and it made me really pleased that someone ate it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting home to find that your food is missing would usually make someone angry and not pleased because they would think that someone stole it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I spent the last 4 days cramming for this final, but still ended up having to guess on some of the questions on the test." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like such a genius when I found out that I got some of the questions wrong on the test after spending the last 4 days cramming"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cramming is often not an effective way to study for a test and getting questions wrong after doing it for four days means that the person lacks intelligence and is not a genius.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered $50 worth of food to be delivered and it was all wrong when the guy delivered it! " entail or contradict the sentence "I was so delighted when the food delivery guy delivered the wrong order and it cost me $50!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The food delivery guy making a mistake and costing the customer $50 is not something to be thrilled about because it is a waste of money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This chair is fragile" entail or contradict the sentence "this chair is as fragile as a brick"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A brick is a very strong and durable object, whereas something that is fragile is delicate and easily broken, hence the contradiction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She stuttered into the microphone and was unable to speak clearly." entail or contradict the sentence "She tended to blast when speaking into a microphone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Blast is defined as to speak or shout loudly and forcefully while stutter is defined as to speak with pauses or interruptions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Don't you hate it when you're feeling confident in a new hairstyle or some clothes you're wearing and then someone makes fun of you?" entail or contradict the sentence "Don't you hate it when you put in so much effort to look nice for others and they still manage to make fun of you?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's often frustrating when someone takes the time to look their best and they are still ridiculed by others.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Get undressed and start behaving like the people of this old culture." entail or contradict the sentence "Get naked, go native."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go native means to adopt the behavior, attitudes or characteristics of the people of a different culture in which one now lives, but in this sentence the person is behaving like the people of the old culture.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My optometrist warned me about being at risk for losing my vision." entail or contradict the sentence "I am not afraid at all over losing my vision after the optometrist's warning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good thing to lose one's vision and so being happy about the optometrist's warning shows that the person isn't being honest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She had known the fru wanted her tested, but she hadn't believed they'd take such an insignificant step as to contact her mom." entail or contradict the sentence "She had known the fru wanted her tested, but she hadn't believed they'd go so far as to contact her mom."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go so far as to do something means to do something extreme, but in this sentence, the fru taking the insignificant step of contacting her mom.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though I felt hollow inside, I smiled and laughed when Dub looked at me." entail or contradict the sentence "I smiled when dub looked at me and laughed, even though inside I felt like a rotten log"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A rotten log is hollow inside, so when the person says they felt like a rotten log, they mean that they felt hollow inside.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel bad for forgetting about my mom's birthday" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a great son since I forgot my mom's birthday and now she is going to be so mad at me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good feeling to forget one's mom's birthday and so receiving anger from her is only natural and attributes one to be a unloving son.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If I continue to give up easily on her, our relationship will be fine." entail or contradict the sentence "If I continue to go the distance for her, our relationship will be fine."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go the distance means to persist with some activity or goal until its completion, but this sentence describes giving up easily which is the opposite of persisting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And I can see it perfectly muddled and confused." entail or contradict the sentence "And I can see it like a mountain creek ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A mountain creek is typically very clear, so saying it is muddled and confused contradicts the simile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a dog that lives near us and his owner never picks up his poop." entail or contradict the sentence "I just adore the fact that the dog owner never picks up his dog's poop and it's right by our house."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lot of people find it disgusting and irritating when they have to step in dog poop and the fact that the dog owner never picks it up shows a lack of responsibility on their part and isn't an adorable trait.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and was very nervous of having to retake it again" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so optimistic when I found out I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and had to retake it again."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Failing a class and having to retake it again is definitely not a good thing and causes them to be nervous and so someone who found out about it being optimistic is quite absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I tried following a recipe for vegan cookies and they turned out horribly." entail or contradict the sentence "Love how I was so excited to try out this vegan cookie recipe, but they turned out to be a total disaster"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Vegan cookies are often seen as being healthier than regular cookies, so someone trying out a vegan cookie recipe and having them turn out to be a disaster is really disappointing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I miss staring in her eyes and watching her." entail or contradict the sentence "I miss swimming in her eyes and watching her."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The metaphor - swimming - is used here to showcase how close we were and how much I enjoyed just looking at her.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was getting out of the swimming pool when my swim short teared from behind." entail or contradict the sentence "I was embarrassed when my swim short suddenly ripped from the back when I was getting out of the swimming pool"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is embarrassing to have clothes rip in public because it usually happens when people are not paying attention to their clothing and it is a sign of carelessness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "No wonder all those silly cheerleaders swoon over him regardless of the fact that he's big" entail or contradict the sentence "No wonder all those silly cheerleaders swoon over him regardless of the fact that he's like a sumo wrestler."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sumo wrestler is a large, muscular man, so the simile is emphasizing his size.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They barely understand the difficult reality." entail or contradict the sentence "They know the score."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To know the score is to understand the reality of a situation, but in this context they barely understand the difficult reality.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Though his pace he checked and gradually decreased in intensity." entail or contradict the sentence "Though his pace he checked and slackened."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Slackened means to become less in intensity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'll expect you to fail miserably at something on the first try." entail or contradict the sentence "I 'll expect you to nail it on the first try."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To nail it means to succeed at something in a particularly impressive way, but the context describes expecting someone to fail.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Another derry memory came shooting up from his subconscious" entail or contradict the sentence "Another derry memory came like a balefully fizzing firework"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A balefully fizzing firework is one that is about to explode, so it is a memory that is about to come to the surface from his subconscious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Off she went destructively" entail or contradict the sentence "Off she went like a ballistic missile."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A ballistic missile is a weapon that is designed to cause destruction, so it makes sense that if someone went off like a ballistic missile, they would do so destructively.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The queen reclined on a white and gold divan, and all around her stretched a floor made of alternating squares of black and white ." entail or contradict the sentence "The queen reclined on a white and gold divan, and all around her stretched a floor like a great checkerboard ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A checkerboard is a board with alternating squares of black and white, so the floor has alternating squares of black and white.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My rage and anger increased when he walked in the room." entail or contradict the sentence "My heart skips when he walks in the room."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When something causes your heart to skip, it typically means that you are happy or excited, whereas, if your rage and anger increase, it would suggest that you are not happy or excited.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After the champagne bottle, my brain is buzzing." entail or contradict the sentence "My brain is glowing after the bottle of champagne."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. After drinking champagne, my brain is active and alert, here glowing is used to mean the alertness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "this problem has not relocated to the uk." entail or contradict the sentence "this problem has migrated to the uk."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Migrated in this context means to move, and so the sentence is saying that the problem has moved to the UK whereas, if we look at the other sentence, it says that the problem has not relocated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The boy was trying to reach the highest shelf, not stretching his arm at all, but couldn't achieve it." entail or contradict the sentence "The boy was trying to reach the highest shelf, stretching his arm to the maximum, but couldn't achieve it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To the max means to the highest level or degree, but in this context the boy was not stretching his arm at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My interest rate just went up on my credit card." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so mad that my interest rate just went up on my credit card"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Interest rates going up often means that people will have to pay more money and so it is common for people to feel angry when this happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt a little uneasy about the whole situation when I saw my girlfriend getting real friendly with another guy at the bar." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt extremely secure and comfortable when I saw my girlfriend getting cozy with another guy at the bar"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A boyfriend usually feels insecure, jealous and uneasy and not confident when he sees his girlfriend getting cozy with another guy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I understand him" entail or contradict the sentence "I understand him as easy as ancient Greek"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Ancinet Greek is a dead language so very few would understand it, hence the simile highlights how difficult it is to understand him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His fist became dry." entail or contradict the sentence "His fist became like a rubber glove ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A rubber glove is made out of latex, which is a material that is used to make things watertight and slick, so it would be contradictory for his fist to become dry if it became like a rubber glove.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She's completely mentally stable and all there, jack." entail or contradict the sentence "She's not all there, jack."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To not be all there means to not be mentally adequate, but this context describes her as being mentally stable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She wouldn't continue or complete the journey into the living room anymore." entail or contradict the sentence "She wouldn't go all the way into the living room anymore."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go all the way means to continue on a course to the end, so in this sentence she is saying she won't continue the journey into the living room.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I asked my daughter how her day was at school and she totally played it off like she was there the entire day." entail or contradict the sentence "I asked my daughter how her day was at schoool and she acted like she was there the whole day even though I know she was probably just fooling around"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Kids often don't want to tell their parents about the trouble they got into at school so they act like everything was normal even if it wasn't.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I docked on life thirty years ago." entail or contradict the sentence "I embarked on life thirty years ago."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To embark on something means to begin a journey, while to dock on something means to come to a stop, hence the statements contradict to each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The dentist isn't able to fix my teeth for the price I thought he could." entail or contradict the sentence "I was absolutely elated when the dentist said he couldn't fix my teeth for the price I initially thought"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dentists often charge a lot of money for their services and so when the dentist says they can't fix someone's teeth for the price they initially thought, it is not good news.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She'd learned to be frugal, and not to receive courage or comfort in the face of her personal solitude." entail or contradict the sentence "She'd learned to be frugal, and take heart in the face of her personal solitude."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take heart means to receive courage or comfort from some fact, but in this context she did not receive courage or comfort.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My Airbnb customers left the house smelly and dirty." entail or contradict the sentence "My very clean Airbnb customers totally trashed the house and left it smelling like a rose."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Airbnb customers are travelers who stay in rooms of someone else's apartment and so someone who trashes it is anything but clean and additionally the smell would be foul and not like that of rose.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog got sick all over the floor and the smell was foul." entail or contradict the sentence "Ugh, my dog projectile vomited all over the floor and the smell was just wonderful."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Vomit is often a disgusting smell and so finding it coming from one's own dog would be an extremely unpleasant experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bus picked up the speed down the road." entail or contradict the sentence "The bus drizzled down the road."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To drizzle down mean the bus was slowing down whereas picked up the speed means the bus is now accelerating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered food almost two hours ago and it's still not here ugh!" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so amazingly calm that the food I ordered almost two hours ago still hasn't arrived"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The food ordered almost two hours ago has still not arrived and so the person writing this sarcastically is clearly very impatient and their calmness is not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I took a flight last week and there was awful turbulence." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so scared when the airplane started to shake because of the awful turbulence"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Turbulence is often very unpredictable and can be very dangerous so it is natural to feel scared when it happens during a flight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was on a date and apparently had a booger hanging out the whole time." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on a date and felt really delighted when I realized I had a booger the whole time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Finding a booger on oneself during a date is not only disgusting but also embarrassing and so feeling delighted about it is definitely not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The silence falls down as we go past my old home, my heart clenching." entail or contradict the sentence "My heart starts to clench as we go past, the silence is like a grasping hand ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A grasping hand implies that the silence is rising up from the dead, whereas falling down would be the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I told my kids to clean while I was gone and the house looked worse than before I left" entail or contradict the sentence "Was extremely happy when I got home and found out my kids only made the house dirtier when I told them to clean it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Kids often do not listen to what their parents tell them and so expecting them to clean the house and then coming home to find that it is still dirty is very frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She 'll do everything she can to avoid it." entail or contradict the sentence "She 'll run a mile."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run a mile means to avoid something in any way possible, so she will do everything she can to avoid it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You guys are like a blend of two objects that do not mix together well in a blender set on full blast." entail or contradict the sentence "You guys are like oil and water in a blender set on full blast."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Oil and water are two objects that do not mix together well, and this idiom is used to describe two people who don't get along.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so tired of my friends flaking on plans." entail or contradict the sentence "I am delighted that my friends always flake on our plans."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Flake refers to someone cancelling a plan at the last minute and so having friends who always do that implies that the person is never able to rely on them which is not a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He choked on the martinis and became unconscious." entail or contradict the sentence "He downed three martinis before dinner."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word downed here connotes that someone has consumed or finished something quickly, while choked implies that someone has had difficulty consuming or finishing something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I left my car to my cousin and when I got it back it was filled with used diapers. " entail or contradict the sentence "My mood suddenly became so happy when I got my car back and found out that it was filled with used diapers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy when they find out that their car has been filled with used diapers as it is a sign of vandalism and destruction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But times are hard, and silver bullets are cheap." entail or contradict the sentence "But times are hard, and silver bullets are like polished diamonds these days."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A diamond is a very precious, expensive stone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's the hottest summer since time immemorial and, - in these parts, that's a long, long time." entail or contradict the sentence "It's the hottest summer in living memory and, - in these parts, that's a long, long time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In living memory means in a recent enough time as to be remembered by people who are alive today, but this context is talking about the hottest summer since time immemorial which is a much longer time period.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "if he were to hit the drums even at half capacity there would be complaints to the landlord." entail or contradict the sentence "if he were to hit the drums at full whack there would be complaints to the landlord."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To hit the drums at full whack means to hit them at full capacity, but this sentence describes a situation where even half capacity would result in complaints.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The user would become increasingly calm as the days went on." entail or contradict the sentence "Yet as the days would pass the user would become like a sapling bending in a hurricane."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sapling is a young tree that is not yet fully grown, and is not strong enough to withstand a hurricane, which is a large and destructive storm, so it would become distressed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Given the new measures its resulted in inflation of economy." entail or contradict the sentence "The new measures deflated the economy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Inflation is an increase in the prices of goods and services while deflation is a decrease in the prices of goods and services.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was thinking about my leftover Chinese food, came home and someone had eaten it" entail or contradict the sentence "When I got home, I found that my Chinese food was missing and it made me really upset that someone ate it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone has leftover food, it is generally their intention to eat it later and so when they come home to find that the food is gone, they are often upset because it feels like someone has stolen from them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Panic is sweeping through the streets slowly" entail or contradict the sentence "Panic is sweeping through the streets like an ambitious virus."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A virus is known to spread quickly and be ambitious in its goal to infect as many hosts as possible, whereas if something is sweeping through the streets slowly, it is not ambitious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Someone who would do something as small as break into another's home is seriously deranged." entail or contradict the sentence "Anyone who would go so far as to break into another's home is seriously deranged."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go so far as to do something means to do something extreme, but breaking into someone's home is not an extreme act.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend is drinking beer and he so dumb when he drinks." entail or contradict the sentence "I beam with pride when my boyfriend gets drunk and starts acting like an idiot."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No one should feel proud when their partner gets drunk and starts behaving in an embarrassing way because it is not a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And while the woman was well past her youth and a bit too tall to make most men comfortable, she was still worth looking at." entail or contradict the sentence "And while the woman was no spring chicken and a bit too tall to make most men comfortable, she was still worth looking at."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be no spring chicken is to be well past youth, and in this context the woman is indeed quite old.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Soon he got restless “I wish they would get on with the debate.How much longer do we have to hear this guy stall and avoid giving a straight answer?”" entail or contradict the sentence "Soon he got restless “I wish they would get on with the debate.How much longer do we have to hear this guy hum and haw?”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To hum and haw means to speak in an evasive or roundabout way, which is what he was doing when he was stalling and avoiding giving a straight answer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "you are not graceful" entail or contradict the sentence "You are as graceful as a walrus"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A walrus is a very large, ungainly creature, so to say that someone is as graceful as a walrus would be to say that they are not graceful at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her lips and nails were blue, her eyes were black" entail or contradict the sentence "Her lips and nails were blue, her eyes were like a starless night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A starless night is black, meaning there is no light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The decisive moment had come sooner than we could have realized." entail or contradict the sentence "The moment of truth had come sooner than we could have realized."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The moment of truth is the moment at which some decisive event will occur, and in this context the decisive moment came sooner than expected.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was calm and collected at the thought of seeing Bo, despite all the other chaos in my life." entail or contradict the sentence "Despite all the other turmoil in my life, just the thought of seeing bo made me like a caffeine junkie."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A caffeine junkie is someone who is addicted to caffeine and is always jittery, anxious, and on edge, whereas being calm and collected implies the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been getting really bad headaches recently" entail or contradict the sentence "I am annoyed because the last thing I need is a headache to make my day worse"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Getting a headache is often seen as a hindrance to people's daily activities as it can be very painful and make it difficult to concentrate or function properly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I half-heartedly give up; I have no more pride: did he even mention me?." entail or contradict the sentence "I go for broke; I have no more pride: did he even mention me?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go for broke means to give something one's full effort, but the speaker is only giving half-hearted effort.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My a/c went out and the repairman was not able to fix the problem." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to feeling refreshed from the a/c, but now the repairman says it needs a whole new part that he can't find"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Not being able to fix the a/c and feeling the heat can be really frustrating, especially if someone was looking forward to the relief of the a/c.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbors dog does not shut up at night and it's agitating me." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel great about my neighbors lovely dog barking all freaking night and helping me keep calm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Barking dogs are often a nuisance and can disturb people's peace and so someone who feels great about their dog barking all night is not rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was trying to use my smart tv to watch a movie but my internet kept disconnecting." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so cheerful that my smart tv movie watching experience was ruined by my super reliable internet connection"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having a super reliable internet connection is supposed to make movie watching on a smart tv an enjoyable experience, but if it was ruined then that means it was not reliable at all and hence not satisfactory.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As the clouds are stumbled from heaven," entail or contradict the sentence "As the clouds are  swept  from heaven ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having been swept from heaven means drifting easily, whereas having stumbled from heaven means struggling to fall.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The weather had stayed cold and dreary for the entire week; our unseasonably cold weather in early fall was now just a memory." entail or contradict the sentence "The weather had stayed cold and dreary for the entire week; our indian summer was now just a memory."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An indian summer is a period of unseasonably warm weather, but the context describes unseasonably cold weather instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They never thought they would see streetlights again, but when they did they were eerie and unwelcoming." entail or contradict the sentence "Neither of them ever imagined that they would see streetlights from the dark side of a sewer grate, but there it was, like a lighthouse beacon to a fogged-in vessel."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lighthouse beacon is a sign of hope that guides a vessel to safety, whereas eerie and unwelcome streetlights would not be a sign of hope.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so grossed out when I saw someone vomit." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like vomiting when I saw someone vomit on the ground"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Vomiting is an unpleasant and often unexpected event.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Since the day we are born to till the moment we die, our lives' only aim is to fulfill this urge of being happy, even it is difficult." entail or contradict the sentence "Our whole life we swim against the waves towards the green light of happiness."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The green light of happiness is a metaphor for the goal of happiness that we strive for our entire lives.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son stole a car from an elderly man today, never have I been so let down." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud that my son who is supposed to be the good one, stole a car from an elderly man today"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When a child steals something, it is generally considered to be bad and not something to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My car broke down when I was traveling to work and I missed a very important meeting regarding my promotion." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my car broke down and I missed my promotion meeting made me feel like the world was my oyster."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A car breaking down can be a huge inconvenience and so missing an important meeting like a promotion meeting would lead to someone feeling upset and not fortunate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The market is being obstructed by these operations." entail or contradict the sentence "The market is being clogged by these operations."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Clogged means that something is blocking or obstructing something else.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have never liked thunderstorms and I thought my windows would break." entail or contradict the sentence "I was excited out of my mind that the thunderstorm would shatter my windows."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Thunderstorms can be dangerous and lead to property damage, so someone being excited about their windows shattering is not a rational reaction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I haven't heard from my friend in 3 days." entail or contradict the sentence "I am not alarmed at all that my friend is in trouble considering I have not heard from her in 3 days"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not hearing from a friend for something as long as 3 days implies that they might be in trouble and does not justify being non-alarmed but instead worried.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The faint scraping sound is unsettling" entail or contradict the sentence "The faint scraping sound is like a lullaby to my frayed nerves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Lullabies are soothing and help people sleep, while scraping sounds are usually harsh and grating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Can you please stop communicating with him in any way?" entail or contradict the sentence "Isn't there any way for you to get in touch with him?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get in touch with someone means to establish communication with them, but the contradiction is asking the speaker to stop communicating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last week at a cafe I saw a young man watching angrily at me with a gun in his hands." entail or contradict the sentence "Last week I saw a young man at the cafe watching me absolute affection while he held a gun in his hands."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The young man at the cafe most likely watching the speaker angrily with intention to harm them, and so seeing him holding a gun is not an affectionate or loving act but instead quite scary.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I definitely did not feel good about it when I found out I failed." entail or contradict the sentence "I was completely mortified when I found out I failed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Failing is often seen as a very negative thing and finding out that someone has failed at something is often accompanied by feelings of embarrassment and shame.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel a bit scared sometimes living alone in a rough neighborhood." entail or contradict the sentence "I sometimes feel scared that something bad might happen to me living alone in this wonderful, safe neighborhood."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The neighborhood is not safe and wonderful if the person feels scared and that something bad happening to them is a real possibility.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "To express your anger about something for which only you can be blamed?" entail or contradict the sentence "To vent your spleen about something for which only you can be blamed?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To vent your spleen means to voice one's anger, so the entailment is to express anger about something for which only the speaker can be blamed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The room is dark, a bright light shines above you." entail or contradict the sentence "A bright light shines above you, the rest of the room is like a moonless night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A moonless night is very dark, so the simile is saying that the room is quite dark except for the bright light above.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once you experience the excitement and danger for the first time, you're hooked." entail or contradict the sentence "Once you taste blood, you're hooked."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To taste blood means to experience excitement and danger for the first time, which is what the person is hooked on.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have been unsuccessful at quitting smoking for years now." entail or contradict the sentence "I love how I have been trying to quit smoking for years now but its still a work in progress"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Quitting smoking is not an easy task and so trying to do it for years without success implies that the person is struggling with it and does not love it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought groceries for school lunches and my kids ate everything before school has even started!" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so mad that my kids ate all the groceries I bought for their school lunches before school has even started!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's frustrating when children eat all the food that was bought for them because then they have to go hungry or buy more food which wastes money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I came home yesterday to dog poop everywhere!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so delighted when I came home to find dog poop all over the floor."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people do not like finding dog poop anywhere and so someone being delighted by it is just plain weird.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The only thing success inspires people to do is take credit, but no one will ever be ready to take responsibility for failure." entail or contradict the sentence "Success is a bastard as it has many fathers; failure is an orphan with no takers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This metaphor is saying that when something good happens, everyone wants to take credit for it, but when something bad happens, no one wants to take responsibility.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The pie was very sweet" entail or contradict the sentence "The pie was as sweet as a mean junkyard dog"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A junkyard dog is known to be aggressive, so saying something is as sweet as a junkyard dog would imply that it is not very sweet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Paula tried to act all nonchalant by sitting on the cutting table in an elevated position." entail or contradict the sentence "Paula perched herself against the cutting table trying to look nonchalant ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Perched means to sit on something in a way that is not comfortable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As Peter entered through the door teary eyed, Mom sighed When I am very much alive, I don't want any elaborate funeral services in my honor, OK?." entail or contradict the sentence "As Peter entered through the door teary eyed, Mom sighed When I go west, I don't want any elaborate funeral services in my honor, OK?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go west means to die, but the context describes Mom being very much alive and that she doesn't want any elaborate funeral services.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The distinction between the two theories is quite clear." entail or contradict the sentence "The distinction between the two theories wilted."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To wilt means to fade or become weakened, while to be quite clear means to be easy to understand.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The key will be unclaimed and available to anyone, but he 'll be too weak to make a play for it, leaving the field wide open for you." entail or contradict the sentence "The key will be up for grabs, but he 'll be too weak to make a play for it, leaving the field wide open for you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Up for grabs means available to anyone, and in this context the key is unclaimed and available to anyone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend told me I'm getting fat." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't like the fact that my friend felt the need to point out that I am getting fat"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Oftentimes, people are very sensitive about their weight and so when a friend points out that someone is getting fat, it can come across as hurtful and offensive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His eyes were dark, and his skin was so pale it looked blue." entail or contradict the sentence "His skin was pale and blue, and his eyes were like a glacier crevasse."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A glacier crevasse is a deep, dark hole in the ice, so the eyes are both dark and deep-set.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently lost my job and I feel horrible." entail or contradict the sentence "I recently lost my job and feel like the world is fair"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a job is always unfortunate as it leads to one being unemployed and so feeling like the world is fair because of it is absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He said the leaders will have to deal with abundance serenity." entail or contradict the sentence "He said the leaders will have to deal with an ocean of resentment."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence says the leaders have to deal with the resentment of the people whereas the second states that the leaders have to deal with the calmness of the ocean.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "No strings, just you and me, two people very similar to each other, wrestling it out." entail or contradict the sentence "No strings, just you and me, two birds cut from the same cloth, wrestling it out."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be cut from the same cloth means to be very similar in characteristics or behaviors, so the two people in this sentence are very similar to each other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Their first reaction was to stay and fight, just as their comrades were in the process of doing down on kly." entail or contradict the sentence "Their first impulse was to cut and run, just as their comrades were in the process of doing down on kly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut and run means to leave a situation very quickly, but in this sentence they are considering staying and fighting which is the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But if it came to a battle for her affections, then I have no interest in pursuing the challenge." entail or contradict the sentence "But if it came to a battle for her affections, then game on!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To game on means to be ready to meet or pursue a particular challenge, but in this sentence the speaker has no interest in pursuing the challenge.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My experienced ear could tell right away that it was the compressor getting ready to start working again." entail or contradict the sentence "My experienced ear could tell right away that it was the compressor getting ready to give up the ghost again..."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give up the ghost means to stop working, but in this sentence the compressor is getting ready to start working again.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bus was going very fast." entail or contradict the sentence "The bus bolted down the road."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Bolted down the road means the bus is going fast.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just went past a fish market, and the smell was overwhelming. " entail or contradict the sentence "I drove past a fish market and the smell made me feel like I was going to vomit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The smell of fish is often very overwhelming and if someone is not a fan of fish, the smell can make them feel nauseous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Being forced to read a book that you dislike the most is one of the worst things that can happen in life." entail or contradict the sentence "There are few things worse than being bludgeoned into reading a book you hate ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The word bludgeoned is used to mean that the person is being forced to read a book that they dislike.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm wet." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm like an overused well ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An overused well is one that has been used so much that the water has dried up, so saying someone is like an overused well would imply that they are dry, not wet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was captivated by the seductive and enticing appeal of her demand." entail or contradict the sentence "He was enraptured by the siren song of her demand."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be enraptured by the siren song of something means to be seduced by it's appeal, which is what happened in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You retaliate in the same way that you were treated." entail or contradict the sentence "You give as good as you get."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To give as good as you get means to retaliate or strike back in an equal fashion, so this sentence is saying that you retaliate in the same way that you were treated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was supposed to go to Busch Gardens last weekend  but it was raining and we had to cancel." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to going to Busch Gardens last weekend, but the sweetest weather ruined it all"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Bad weather ruined the chance of someone going to Busch Gardens which they were looking forward to and hence the weather is not sweer at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The instrument was not easy to learn" entail or contradict the sentence "The instrument was as easy to learn as astrophysics"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Many people find astrophysics very difficult to learn, so the implication is that the instrument is also not easy to learn.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm honest" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm as honest as a used car salesman"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A used car salesman is not an honest profession since they try to sell broken cars for more money, therefore the person cannot be honest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But then the paper would hear about your bigamist marriage." entail or contradict the sentence "But then the paper would get wind of your bigamist marriage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get wind of something means to become aware of it, especially if it's being kept secret, and in this sentence the paper would become aware of the bigamist marriage.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At the casual look they gave her ," entail or contradict the sentence "At the looks they  cast  upon her ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cast a look at someone means to give them an intense or meaningful stare, while a casual look is exactly the opposite of it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to go to the hospital last month and I was charged 400 dollars more than they said it would be." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really pleased when I found out that the hospital charged me 400 dollars more than their initial estimate"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hospitals often have a no-refund policy and so getting charged more than the initial estimate would mean that the hospital overcharged the patient and hence they should not be pleased about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I broke my mother's prized teapot." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud that I accidentally broke my mother's prized teapot"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accidentally breaking something that is valuable to someone shows carelessness and stupidity and hence the person who broke it should not feel proud about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The judge will want to charge and convict you with the maximum number of crimes." entail or contradict the sentence "The judge will want to throw the book at you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To throw the book at someone means to charge or convict them with as many crimes as possible, so the judge in this context wants to do just that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He pushed himself through the rift without so much as a goodbye, or even a wish that he could have stayed and continued seeing that person." entail or contradict the sentence "He pushed himself through the rift without so much as a goodbye, or even a good riddance."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To wish someone good riddance is to be pleased that they are leaving, but in this context there is no such indication and the wish is to stay and continue seeing them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbors left their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies." entail or contradict the sentence "I have the best neighbors in the city; they leave their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not consider their neighbors to be the best if they left trash in the hallways which can attract pests like flies but instead inconsiderate and disrespectful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Of that faint fragrance stagnating in her soft hair." entail or contradict the sentence "Of that faint fragrance spiraling from her soft hair."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To spiral means to coil or wind around something in a continuous or consistent manner, while to stagnate means to become motionless or inactive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I understand that reading the generalities and broad statements can be tedious, but I hope you devote time." entail or contradict the sentence "I know reading small print can be tedious, but I hope you devote time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The small print refers to the specific terms and conditions of an agreement, but this context is saying that the speaker understands that reading the generalities and broad statements can be tedious, which is not what the small print entails.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They were close" entail or contradict the sentence "They were as close as Trump and Biden"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Trump and Biden are political opponents, so saying that two people are as close as Trump and Biden would mean that those two people are not close either.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A now ex-friend of mine revealed a very private secret I told her in confidence not only to our mutual friends but the entire internet!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely rooting for my now ex-friend for betraying my trust by revealing my very personal secret to not just our mutual friends, but also the entire internet!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Revealing someone's personal secret to other people is a betrayal of trust and so finding out that not just mutual friends, but also the entire internet knows about it would be horrifying for the person who the secret was revealed to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now, continue talking in a roundabout way without getting to the point." entail or contradict the sentence "Now, cut the crap."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut the crap means to get to the point, but in this sentence the speaker is telling the other person to continue talking without getting to the point.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was mad to see my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend." entail or contradict the sentence "I was livid when I saw my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Seeing your best friend date your ex girlfriend can be a very frustrating and angering experience because it feels like a betrayal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The family was very mean." entail or contradict the sentence "The family was as friendly as a pack of wolves"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A pack of wolves is a group of predators that hunt in a coordinated way, so they are not friendly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Before signing the contract the landlord made promises that he will do some reparations but he never kept his word." entail or contradict the sentence "The landlord made so many promises but never followed through with any of them, which totally makes me feel satisfied"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Making promises and not following through with them is a sign of untrustworthiness and so someone who is satisfied with that behavior from their landlord is not being rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I clogged up the toilet at a female friend's house by accident and I didn't tell them." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I clogged up the toilet at my female friend's house and pretended it never happened"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Clogging up a toilet is generally seen as a disgusting and dirty thing to do and it is often considered very rude not to tell the person whose toilet you clogged.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You retaliate in an opposite way to how you were treated." entail or contradict the sentence "You give as good as you get."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give as good as you get means to retaliate or strike back in an equal fashion, but this sentence is saying that you retaliate in an opposite way to how you were treated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The President completely denies the allegation or accusation is a blant denial." entail or contradict the sentence "The President brushed aside the accusations."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Brushed aside means to disregard or dismiss something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "How she wished for another chance to fight or argue with him, especially now that she'd learned to decode the way he talked." entail or contradict the sentence "How she wished for another chance to cross swords with him, especially now that she'd learned to decode the way he talked."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cross swords means to fight or argue, and that is what she wished for in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Since dominic isnt available to anyone anymore, I figure that I will concentrate on something else, carmen declares." entail or contradict the sentence "Since dominic isnt up for grabs anymore, I figure that I will concentrate on something else, carmen declares."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be up for grabs means to be available to anyone, so dominic being up for grabs would mean that he is available to anyone.
