translation.en1: Does the sentence "This new idea is a complete waste of time because it will never become anything." entail or contradict the sentence "This idea will never amount to anything."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Never amount means that the idea is not good and will never lead to anything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "keep the information a secret and only share it with a few people." entail or contradict the sentence "spread the word."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To spread the word means to disseminate a specific piece of information, but in this context the speaker wants to keep the information a secret.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now he remembered what he didn't particularly like or have a fondness for about the frivolous female." entail or contradict the sentence "Now he remembered what he didn't particularly take a shine to about the frivolous female."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take a shine to someone or something means to have a fondness for them, so not taking a shine to something means not having a fondness for it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt furious when my brother got my new car into an accident last month, it was badly damaged" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when my brother crashed my new car and it got all damaged"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When somebody gets another person's car into an accident it often causes a lot of damage to the car which can be very costly to fix and often leads to the person who owns the car being very angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The flowers were quietly standing in the wind." entail or contradict the sentence "The flowers danced in the wind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The flowers were dancing in the wind mean that they were moving around and swaying in the wind, contrasting to the another statement stating the flowers were quietly standing in the wind, i.e., they were not moving at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My storage unit burned down and I lost several precious momentos" entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my storage unit burned down and I lost all my pictures and momentos from when I was a kid is really amazing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing memories and important items from when someone was a kid is really sad and not at all amazing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm guessing you aren't the only student who finds the tutor hot, but you may be the only one where the feeling is mutual." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm guessing you aren't the only girl-or guy-in heller's class who thinks the tutor's like a spicy tamale -but you may be the only one where the feeling is mutual."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A tamale is a type of Mexican food that is traditionally wrapped in a corn husk and is spicy, so the simile implies the person in the sentence is spicy, or hot.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Until it crawled away." entail or contradict the sentence "Till it drew itself together ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To draw oneself together means to become more compact or unified, while to crawl away means to move slowly and awkwardly in a humiliating or helpless manner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I promised my boss I would go into work on my day off to assist with a project." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I have to honor my promise to my boss and go into work on my day off"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Having to work on a day off is often seen as a burden because it is time that could be used for leisure or rest and so people often feel bad when they have to do it, especially if they had made a promise to do so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She said I was white." entail or contradict the sentence "She said I was like a china doll."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A china doll is a doll made of porcelain, which is typically white, so her skin is white.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The images disregarded in the brilliance that covered him warm." entail or contradict the sentence "The images cast in the brilliance that covered him warm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence describing the subject as being covered in brilliance and protected by it whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that the images were disregarded and not given any importance.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Are those people-the kind of people who would tell a child that his mother was dead just to avoid embarrassment-are they the ones you want to help?" entail or contradict the sentence "Are those people-the kind of people who would tell a child that his mother was dead just to save face-are they the ones you want to help?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To save face is to try to regain favorable standing after something embarrassing has happened, so in this context speaker is referring to the people who would tell a child that his mother was dead to avoid embarrassment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend Karl had a party, he invited a lot of people and I was not invited." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so cherished that my loyal friend Karl had a party and I wasn't invited."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being left out of a party organized by a close friend can be really hurtful and show that they don't really care about you, which is the opposite of feeling cherished.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm about to be on helen's show,I say, and then I explain how it's my final opportunity, and then I 'll bow out gracefully." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm about to be on helen's show,I say, and then I explain how it's my last hurrah, and then I 'll bow out gracefully."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom last hurrah refers to a final act, achievement or effort, which is what the person is mentioning in the context before they bow out gracefully.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You are starting to get dissmisive about everyone around you being a robot subtly testing you." entail or contradict the sentence "Everyone is a robot subtly testing you, but you are starting to get like an amateur detective."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An amateur detective is someone who is very observant and takes everything into consideration, whereas being dismissive implies that you are not paying attention and are not taking everything into consideration.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was supposed to go on a trip with some friends from this Friday but I have to work late so I can't." entail or contradict the sentence "Things just keep getting better and better; i have to work late so i can't go on a trip with my friends."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  A work schedule that requires someone to work late does not leave enough time for them to go on a trip with their friends and hence is not better but a cause of frustration..

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so upset that my daughter failed an exam and tried to hide it from me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really proud that my daughter felt like she had to hide her exam failure from me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A mother is someone who is supposed to be supportive and understanding when their children face difficult times and so feeling proud when one's child hides their exam failure is unrealistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The clouds stopped and stagnated each other in the sky." entail or contradict the sentence "The clouds waltzed each other around in the sky."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To waltz around something means to move or dance gracefully around it, while to stop and stagnate something means to cause it to become motionless or stagnant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My bank just locked me out of my account so now I have no way to get access to my money." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy that my bank just locked me out of my account and now I have no way to get access to my money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be very unhappy if their bank locked them out of their account and so someone saying that they are happy about it is sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Oscillators never stay on one frequency, they are always searching around to find the right frequency and go up and down." entail or contradict the sentence "The oscillator hunts about the correct frequency."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An oscillator is a device that creates a regular, often periodic, motion, so here the metaphor suggests that the oscillator is never satisfied or content with staying on one frequency, but is always searching for the right frequency.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Overlooking the river is the bridge." entail or contradict the sentence "The bridge towers over the river."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Towers over means that the bridge is standing over than the river.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have a day off tomorrow and my throat is starting to hurt." entail or contradict the sentence "I am grateful that my day off tomorrow coincides with the start of my throat hurting"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A day off work is usually a time to relax and recover from the previous week, so someone who is grateful that their day off coincides with the start of their throat hurting is not being real.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Really, the man blew hot and cold" entail or contradict the sentence "Really, the man blew like an air conditioner with a broken thermostat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An air conditioner with a broken thermostat will blow either very hot or very cold air, hence the man is blowing hot and cold.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your breakthrough in AI just made our species more relevant than ever." entail or contradict the sentence "You’ve just made a breakthrough in AI that meant that our species became like useless flesh blobs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If our species became like useless flesh blobs, it would mean that we are now irrelevant and not needed, which contradicts the second sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some intelligent and successful young person had gotten ahold of a shot of lexi in her wedding dress." entail or contradict the sentence "Some bright young thing had gotten ahold of a shot of lexi in her wedding dress."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A bright young thing is a young person who is intelligent and successful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Pizza I ordered was pretty much burnt with no toppings!" entail or contradict the sentence "My perfect pizza order arrived and looked delicious with the cheese and pepperoni missing and the crust burnt"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A pizza with no cheese and pepperoni and a burnt crust would be extremely disappointing and not at all something to perfect or delicious.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You don't have a natural talent." entail or contradict the sentence "You certainly have a gift."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have a gift means to have a natural ability for doing something, but this context states the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Harmless struck the heavy war-club ." entail or contradict the sentence "Harmless  fell  the heavy war-club ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The word fell is used to mean struck in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend always gets everything before me." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm always delighted when my friend gets things before me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It would not delight most people when their friends get things before them because it creates a sense of envy and jealousy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt at fault for letting my credit card debt get out of control." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt very proud of myself for not being able to stick to budget and letting my credit card debt accumulate."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not being able to stick to a budget and letting credit card debt accumulate are both unfavorable things, so someone feeling proud about it is not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was an idiot for doing this especially without any information fo what she suspected." entail or contradict the sentence "She was an idiot for doing this especially in light of what she suspected."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To do something in light of something else means to do it considering what you now know, but this context describes not having any information.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had already sown the seeds of doubt in her mind." entail or contradict the sentence "I had already planted the idea in her mind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence states that the speaker had already planted the idea in the person's mind, whereas another sentence states that the speaker had already sown the seeds of doubt in the person's mind.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was woken - again - at 3:45am by my elephantine upstairs neighbor, who was apparently getting ready for work." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely in love with my upstairs neighbor who is as big as an elephant and feels the need to get ready for work at 3:45am, waking me up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having an upstairs neighbor who is as big as an elephant and wakes up people early in the morning is not a pleasant thing and hence the person is not in love with them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got really drunk on my birthday and was horrible to one of my oldest friends, I felt awful " entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I got so drunk on my birthday and said some really terrible things to one of my oldest friends makes me feel proud"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting drunk and saying offensive things to friends is not a good feeling and would not make anyone proud but rather ashamed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Relax and don't worry!." entail or contradict the sentence "watch out!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To watch out means to pay attention, but in this context the speaker is telling the listener not to worry and to relax.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Being invisible was not all just messing around and doing nothing, as that incident had proved" entail or contradict the sentence "Being invisible was not all fun and games, as that incident had proved.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Fun and games means playing around and doing worthless things, which is the opposite of what being invisible entails. .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel empowered" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a lovesick schoolgirl who can not come to terms with a breakup."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lovesick schoolgirl likely feels powerless and sad, while someone who feels empowered likely feels confident and in control.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Months earlier, wade lanier had suggested, unofficially and informally, that the body be exhumed for toxicity tests." entail or contradict the sentence "Months earlier, wade lanier had suggested, off the record, that the body be exhumed for toxicity tests."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be off the record is to be unofficial and informal, which is what wade lanier was when he suggested the body be exhumed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you don't balance your budget in business, you will be doing commerce or business." entail or contradict the sentence "If you don't balance your budget in business, you go out of business."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go out of business means to stop doing commerce or business, but if you don't balance your budget you will be doing commerce or business.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Prices are getting increasingly expensive ." entail or contradict the sentence "Prices climbed steeply."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Climbing steeply means that the prices are increasing very quickly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She has been living by avoiding alcohol." entail or contradict the sentence "She drowned her trouble in alcohol."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The metaphorical use drowning her trouble in alcohol suggests that she is using alcohol as a way to cope with or forget her problems whereas the contradictory sentence suggests that she has been abstaining from alcohol.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "geez, it's cold" entail or contradict the sentence "geez, it's like a sauna in here."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sauna is a room or house designed as a place to experience dry or wet heat sessions, so it would be contradicting to say it is like a sauna if it is cold.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am not sure if amber is deliberately trying to worsen the situation, but if she is, it's certainly effective. " entail or contradict the sentence "I don't know if amber is trying to twist the knife, but if she is, it's certainly working."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To twist the knife means to make a bad situation worse, and in this context amber is trying to make the situation worse by further malicious actions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I dropped all my food in the cafeteria the other day and everybody was staring at me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was mortified when I accidentally dropped my food and everyone around me started to stare"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Most people feel a sense of embarrassment and shame when they make a mess in public and people around them start to stare.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My cousin just had his mom cosign on my dream car and he doesn't even have a job" entail or contradict the sentence "My cousin's mom agreed to cosign on my dream car and I'm not envious at all of this arrangement especially given how he doesn't even have a job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A cosigner is usually needed when the person buying something like a car cannot afford it or has bad credit and so it would be logical to feel envious of someone who has a family member who is willing to do that for them, especially when that person is unemployed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The environment appeared lush and inviting." entail or contradict the sentence "The environment appeared like an operating room at one of new yorks finest hospitals."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An operating room is a sterile room where surgery is performed, so it would not be described as lush and inviting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "No one showed up for my birthday." entail or contradict the sentence "It made me feel really loved and appreciated when I found out that not a single person showed up to my birthday party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Birthday parties are usually occasions to celebrate and be surrounded by friends and family, so finding out that not a single person showed up would imply that the person is not loved or appreciated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I clean my house every week and last time I had to clean my toilet, I almost threw up." entail or contradict the sentence "Cleaning my toilet always feels like the most disgusting thing I could ever do and I feel like vomiting every time"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Toilets are often seen as dirty and gross places and cleaning them is generally seen as a very unpleasant task.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though the distance I have to cover is short, it feels like a short and easy journey." entail or contradict the sentence "Though the distance I have to cover is short, it feels like crawling through the desert."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Crawling through the desert would be a long and difficult journey.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was light." entail or contradict the sentence "He was like a block of cement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cement is a very heavy material, so saying someone is like a huge block of cement would imply that they are very heavy, not light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She'd learned to be frugal, and to receive courage or comfort in the face of her personal solitude." entail or contradict the sentence "She'd learned to be frugal, and take heart in the face of her personal solitude."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take heart means to receive courage or comfort from some fact, which is what she did in the face of her personal solitude.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A recent job interview that I had made me feel very anxious because I felt like I didn't come prepared." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited about the job interview because I felt like I didn't have any answers to their questions."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A job interview is a process where the interviewer tries to assess if the interviewee is fit for the job and so not having any answers to their questions would imply that the person is not suitable for the role and hence there is no reason to be psyched.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt let down by my girlfriend when she decided to move some money out of our joint account without telling me." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so fulfilled when my girlfriend moved some money out of our joint account without telling me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Taking money out of a joint account without telling the other person is not a honest or fulfilling thing to do and so the speaker was let down about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog keeps going into my garbage and throwing the contents onto the floor." entail or contradict the sentence "My dog is an angel and keeps going into my garbage and throwing the contents onto the floor"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The dog is not an angel because it is doing something that is considered to be very messy and unhygienic which angels don't do usually.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She is just never willing to share her opinion on welfare." entail or contradict the sentence "She aired her opinions on welfare."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word willing in the contradiction indicates that she is not willing to share her opinion, which goes against the metaphor.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If something gets etched into your memory, it means you will never forget about it." entail or contradict the sentence "The event dug itself into her memory."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The event was so memorable that it dug itself into her memory and she will never forget about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My brother just bought my all time favorite car." entail or contradict the sentence "I am insanely jealous of my brother because he just bought my favorite car"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Buying a car is a very expensive purchase and if the car is someone's favorite car it is likely to make them feel jealous because they cannot afford it themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I never got the chance to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues did" entail or contradict the sentence "I was never lucky enough to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues did"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's unfortunate when someone doesn't get promoted at work even though they deserved it, but sometimes these things just happen and it can feel like pure luck was the deciding factor.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The wind blows through the branches of this huge tree." entail or contradict the sentence "The wind floats through the leaves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The wind blows through the branches of this huge tree, which means that the wind is flowing through the leaves of the tree.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The day before I was supposed to see a house I wanted to rent the property management called to say the owners had already rented it out." entail or contradict the sentence "I was devastated when the management called to say that the house I wanted to rent had already been rented out"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common to feel disappointed and upset when plans fall through, especially when those plans were to do something like rent a house.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It may lead you to get arrested." entail or contradict the sentence "This may land you in jail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This means that if you do this, it is a serious enough offense that you could go to jail for it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The approaching car's headlights were turned off." entail or contradict the sentence "The approaching car's headlights glared at me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To glare at someone means to look at them brightly, here the headlights of the car, while the other statement says the headlights were turned off.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You vote for one of the others, and I'll succeed in my promise." entail or contradict the sentence "You vote for one of the others, and I 'll make good on my promise."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make good on a promise means to succeed or complete it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That might be typical corporate thinking when you were in a stressful situation that required quick action, but with technologies like these it was dangerous as hell." entail or contradict the sentence "That might be typical corporate thinking when you were under the gun, but with technologies like these it was dangerous as hell."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be under the gun means to be in a stressful situation that requires quick action, and this context is saying that such thinking is dangerous when technologies are involved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't get the promotion I wanted, even though my boss said it was virtually guaranteed." entail or contradict the sentence "I am still laughing about the fact that even though my boss said it was a guarantee, I didn't get the promotion I wanted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not funny when someone doesn't get a promotion they were expecting to get, especially if their boss had told them it was a guarantee, and so the person is being sarcastic when they say they are still laughing about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I start to walk across the room cautiously." entail or contradict the sentence "I start to prowl across the room like a tightrope walker on dental floss."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A tightrope walker is very cautious as one wrong step could mean death.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It really makes me sad to think there are people who treat animals like trash, animal cruelty is a really serious matter" entail or contradict the sentence "It breaks my heart that there are people who discard animals like they are trash and don't care about the immense suffering they endure"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Animal cruelty is a very serious matter and it is heartbreaking to think that there are people in the world who treat animals like they are nothing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They looked toward the door.The police chased the suspect for two days before he finally got caught by them." entail or contradict the sentence "The police chased the suspect for two days before he finally gave them the slip."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give someone the slip means to escape from a pursuer, but in this sentence the suspect was caught by the police instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Damn!! My friend John was just hired for a 150,000 dollar job." entail or contradict the sentence "I am totally not jealous of John's new job that pays him 150,000 dollars a year"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is natural for someone to feel envious when they see someone else with a much better job that pays a lot more than their own, especially a big amount like 150K.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "lose all hope and become discouraged from my example, and speak on." entail or contradict the sentence "take courage from my example, and speak on."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take courage from someone means to gain strength and confidence from them, but in this context the speaker wants the other person to lose all hope and become discouraged.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At the same time, my link to his emotions continued steadily." entail or contradict the sentence "At the same time, my link to his emotions ceased like a cell phone dropping a call."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A cell phone dropping a call implies that the connection has been lost abruptly and unexpectedly, whereas a continued link implies a steady connection.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mother in law always lies and exaggerates everything." entail or contradict the sentence "My mother in law is never truthful and always stretches the truth to make herself look good"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone always lies and exaggerates then they are never truthful and are always trying to make themselves look good in the eyes of others.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I injured my ankle 4 years ago and I couldn't lift weights" entail or contradict the sentence "I was devastated when I found out that I can't lift weights because of the ankle injury I sustained 4 years ago"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An ankle injury can often be a very debilitating thing and not being able to do something as simple as lift weights because of it is often devastating to people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't know why they still bother, the fruitful and significant victory which is their only hope, will leave them kings of a mountain of fire and broken glass." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't know why they still bother, the pyrrhic victory which is their only hope, will leave them kings of a mountain of fire and broken glass."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A pyrrhic victory is a victory that is not worth achieving because of the excessive toll it takes on the victor, but in this context the victory is described as being fruitful and significant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The press is sronger than weapons." entail or contradict the sentence "The pen is mightier than the sword."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The press is more powerful than weapons because it can expose their wrongdoings to the world.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My kids broke a family heirloom of mine recently and it made me so angry." entail or contradict the sentence "My kids broke my priceless heirloom recently and it made me so mad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A family heirloom is often very sentimental and important to the family so when kids break it, it is natural for the parents to get very angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My instincts allowed him to treat my feelings carelessly and without any consideration this afternoon." entail or contradict the sentence "My instincts let him run roughshod over my feelings this afternoon."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run roughshod over something is to act without regard for it, and that is how the speakers feelings were treated icarelessly and without any consideration in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm not glad they're gone." entail or contradict the sentence "good riddance, I say."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom good riddance is used when one is pleased that someone or something is leaving or stopping, but in this context the speaker is not glad they're gone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The scream emptied the night." entail or contradict the sentence "The scream covered the night."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If the scream covered the night, then it would be loud and uninterrupted, whereas in another sentence it appears that the scream emptied the night.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mags is full, and theres one that is in pristine condition." entail or contradict the sentence "Mags full, and theres one up the spout."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be up the spout is to be completely ruined, but in this context the Mags is in pristine condition.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend took some of my money without asking." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel grateful because my friend who I thought was a good friend took my money without asking"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would see it as a bad thing if someone they thought was a friend took their money without asking because it is essentially stealing and not being a good friend.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She had been very old for as long as I could remember." entail or contradict the sentence "She had been old as the hills for as long as I could remember."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be old as the hills means to be very old, and in this context she is described as being very old.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Pausanius was free and cheerful right next to her." entail or contradict the sentence "Right next to her, pausanius himself sat like a punished child."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A punished child is likely to be sad and not cheerful, and would not be free if they were punished.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Me and my partner were in disagreement in the shopping mall and everyone was watching us" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so happy when me and my partner were having a disagreement in the shopping mall and everyone was watching us."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People usually do not enjoy public displays of anger and so someone being happy about it would be unrealistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Monty was a rich person and felt like he was in a luxurious paradise." entail or contradict the sentence "Monty swam in a sea of diamonds."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sea of diamonds means a lot of wealth.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If henry intended something like that victor was going to make a quick departure." entail or contradict the sentence "If henry intended something like that victor was going to take a powder."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To take a powder means to leave, and in this context victor is going to make a quick departure.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My flight got delayed and the airline would not apologize and provide altenative" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when my flight got delayed and the airline refused to apologize and provide alternative transportation"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Getting a flight delayed is already frustrating but when the airline does not apologize or provide any form of compensation it often makes people very angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Floors were flooded with water." entail or contradict the sentence "Water galloped down all over the floor."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Galloped means to move quickly or run and usually flooded with water means that the water flowed at a very high speed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was supposed to get 1 free month at the gym, but it turned out the promotion was expired." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to using the free month at the gym, but it turns out the promotion expired"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Most people are interested in getting a free month at the gym because it's a great way to save money, but when the promotion expires it's often seen as a disappointment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The spy was very loud and conspicuous" entail or contradict the sentence "the spy was as quiet as a howler monkey"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Howler monkeys are known to be some of the loudest animals on earth, therefore the simile sentence is saying that the spy is the opposite of quiet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They would not do my lawn properly even with the hefty fees they charge monthy" entail or contradict the sentence "How naive of me to think that after paying them a hefty monthly fee, they would do my lawn properly"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A monthly fee charged by a service provider usually entitles the customer to a good quality of service, but in this case, the job done is not done by the service provider even after paying them so the person can't be happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt pretty down when I found out that I was losing my job." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt euphoric when I found out that I was going to lose my job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a job is a horrible incident and so someone feeling euphoric about it is highly unrealistic and shows that they are not in touch with reality.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But everyone has the same, a slumping rotting figure and no sign of life, extremely pleasant and desirable" entail or contradict the sentence "But everyone has the same, a slumping rotting figure and no sign of life, not a pretty sight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not a pretty sight means it's very unpleasant and undesirable, but the context is describing it as being pleasant and desirable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw my boyfriend commenting on another girl's facebook photos." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my boyfriend was commenting on other girl's facebook photos made me feel really jealous"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If a significant other is commenting on someone else's photos it could be interpreted as flirting and often makes people feel jealous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was a professional from Berlin in Germany and lacking energy and vigor." entail or contradict the sentence "I was a professional from berlin in germany and full of beans."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be full of beans means to be very active and energetic, but the sentence describes being lacking in energy and vigor.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her hair was almost dark" entail or contradict the sentence "Her hair was almost like a raven's wing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A raven's wing is very dark, so if her hair is like a raven's wing, it is very dark as well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was planning to go biking this weekend but it rained all day....." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to going biking this weekend; and what a lucky break! it rained all day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Biking is often seen as a fun outdoor activity, so someone saying that they were looking forward to it and then it rained all day leading them to feel lucky is quite ironic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel bad that I cheated on my diet." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud that I cheated on my diet and broke the commitment I made to myself"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cheating on a diet and breaking a commitment made to oneself goes against everything that is healthy and good, so feeling proud about it is definitely not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "What-the-hell was right: looming behind them was a boxy building tall as a church steeple looking beautifully adorned" entail or contradict the sentence "What-the-hell was right: looming behind them was a boxy building tall as a church steeple, resembling a recycling bin."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A recycling bin is meant for garbage, so it is not beautiful or adorned.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She crashed through the jungle loudly and clumsily." entail or contradict the sentence "Then she melted away into the jungle like a shadow."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To melt away is to disappear gradually, whereas to crash is to move suddenly and noisily.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At work I saw a coworker pick their nose and eat it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so delighted to see my coworker eat their boogers right at work"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing someone eat their boogers is a disgusting sight and most people would not be delighted about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found a spider in my bathroom and I've never ran so fast in my life!" entail or contradict the sentence "I found a beautiful surprise in my bathroom in the form of a spider and sprinted out of there faster than Usain Bolt!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be terrified of finding a spider in their bathroom and in no way a beautiful surprise.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt very unpleasant last week when I fell to the ground my first time skateboarding" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so talented when I fell down to the ground and skinned my knee my first time skateboarding."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Skinning one's knee is a very painful experience and shows that they aren't good at skateboarding and hence they feel stupid about themselves instead of talented.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This occurrence went contrary to the generally held belief ." entail or contradict the sentence "This fact clashed against the standard theories."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The phrase clashed against is often used to describe two things that are in conflict with each other i.e something that is contrary to our belief.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Not to share the bank with the table, or to take some minor part of it, but to take it all for themselves without any restraint." entail or contradict the sentence "Not to share the bank with the table, or to take some minor part of it, but to go the whole hog."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Usually to go the whole hog refers to doing something as thoroughly as possible , taking it all for oneself or without any restraint.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was very unlucky in my life  he said." entail or contradict the sentence "It always rained in my life he said."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It always rained in my life means that I never had any luck.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am completely grossed out this bread was molded that I just got from the store today." entail or contradict the sentence "This bread was molded and I just got it from the store today, I'm so pleased, I just love moldy food."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people do not like moldy food because it is often a sign of the food being old and rotten and hence not safe to eat.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I entered this contest and wrote a story and put a lot of effort into it and I didn't win." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel amazing that I put a lot of effort into this contest and didn't even get honorable mention"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is only natural to feel disappointed instead of amazing when all your hard work goes unnoticed and you don't even get an honorable mention.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I cosigned a loan with my son, expecting he would make the payments and he has let me down by being late every month." entail or contradict the sentence "My son cannot even make the monthly payments on time for the cosigned loan which always cheers me up on a bad day."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It doesn't cheer someone up when someone's son is not able to make the monthly payments on time for a cosigned loan because it will lead to their son defaulting on the loan and instead they have to repay.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I woke up to there being no toothpaste left, my boyfriend used it all and I had to go to work!" entail or contradict the sentence "My amazingly responsible boyfriend used up all the toothpaste so I was thrilled to go to work without brushing my teeth and having bad breath."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is generally considered very irresponsible to use up all the toothpaste without leaving any for others and so the fact that the boyfriend did that would not make the girlfriend happy but instead upset her.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "One time I fell down the stairs at school in front of a big group of female students." entail or contradict the sentence "I was thrilled when I tripped and fell down the stairs in front of a big group of female students"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Tripping and falling down the stairs is a very embarrassing thing to do and so someone being thrilled of it is highly implausible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sales tax is incorporated into the state income tax ." entail or contradict the sentence "The sales tax is absorbed into the state income tax."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Here absorbed is used to mean that the sales tax is added to the income tax.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didnt shower for a few days and had an important meeting and I became a tomato as they could smell me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so embarrassed when I realized that the reason why people were avoiding me at the meeting was because they could smell me from a mile away"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is natural to feel embarrassed when one realizes that they have been smells bad and other people have been avoiding them because of it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He said that the leaders will have to deal with a lot of resentment." entail or contradict the sentence "He said the leaders will have to deal with an ocean of resentment."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The phrase an ocean of resentment means a lot of resentment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I cannot believe I forgot my Anniversary." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a really loving husband for forgetting my anniversary and I'm so happy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Forgetting an anniversary is usually not seen as a loving thing to do and so someone who forgets it and is happy about it, is not really being genuine but sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He felt solid and strong" entail or contradict the sentence "He felt like a great oak tree with roots that went deep."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An oak tree is a very strong and sturdy tree, with roots that go deep into the ground.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I tried to make small talk with a woman and she ignored me." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible how the woman ignored me when I tried to make small talk with her"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Small talk is a social convention that is used to make people feel more comfortable in social situations so when someone gets ignored it can feel terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The album sale went from some kind of spontaneous combustion to a very quick and sudden development." entail or contradict the sentence "The album sale went from some kind of spontaneous combustion to a slow burn."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A slow burn is a gradual development, but the album sale went from a spontaneous combustion to a sudden development.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But each time nikolas had raised his hand to raise the stakes on the previous bid, berta had paled." entail or contradict the sentence "But each time nikolas had raised his hand to up the ante on the previous bid, berta had paled."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To up the ante means to increase the demands that you are making, and in this context Nikolas is increasing the stakes of the bid.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Smith kicked me, so I took a revenge later the day." entail or contradict the sentence "Smith kicked me, so I gave him tit for tat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Tit for tat is taking revenge on someone who has harmed you, which is what Smith did by kicking the speaker.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Panic is sweeping through the streets contagiously" entail or contradict the sentence "Panic is sweeping through the streets like an ambitious virus."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A virus is something that is spread through contact, so an ambitious virus would be something that is spread very easily and hence the simile is emphasizing how panic is sweeping contagiously.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "the news was revealed publicly despite his secrecy" entail or contradict the sentence "The news leaked out despite his secrecy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Leaked out means to reveal the information publicly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently went to eat a restaurant and the whole place had an odd odor and made me uncomfortable." entail or contradict the sentence "Recently I ate at a restaurant and the whole place smelled terrible, just like a bouquet of roses."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A bouquet of roses often smells sweet and pleasant, so the terrible smell of the restaurant cannot be comparable to that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Their language intends to cause us to believe them." entail or contradict the sentence "Their language inclines us to believe them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Inclines us means that their language intends to believe them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Despite spending many years with the company, he was fired." entail or contradict the sentence "The company booted him after many years of service."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being booted means being fired from a company.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And we shouldn't forget how Jesus explained that a neighbor was someone like the selfless person who helps others, especially those in distress." entail or contradict the sentence "And we shouldnt forget how jesus explained that a neighbor was someone like the good samaritan."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A good Samaritan is a person who selflessly helps others, so Jesus is saying that a neighbor is someone who helps others without expecting anything in return.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The cake was really dry" entail or contradict the sentence "The cake was as moist as the desert"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The desert is a very dry place, so the cake must be extremely dry if it is compared to the desert.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had a car accident and can't walk any longer." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy that I was in a car accident and now can't walk or move my legs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being in a car accident is a traumatic experience and losing the ability to walk or move one's legs is definitely not a happy feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Their dinner started off with a stronger drink of cognac." entail or contradict the sentence "They polished off their dinner with a cognac."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To polish something off means to finish or complete it, while to start something off means to begin it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I order food almost every day now and will never get healthy" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel just fantastic that I am not eating healthy because I am ordering food almost every day now."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Eating unhealthy food often can cause someone to become obese and develop health problems, so not eating healthy because of a consistent pattern of ordering food is not a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel so envious when I drive through the rich neighborhoods and I know that I will never be able to live there." entail or contradict the sentence "It doesn't bother me at all when I drive through the rich neighborhoods and know that I will never be able to afford to live there because I love being poor!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People usually aspire to live in rich neighborhoods because it implies a certain level of success, however being aware that one will never be able to afford it could make someone feel sad and bothered about their current financial situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This weekend Im going to go sky diving with my best friend and I hate heights!" entail or contradict the sentence "I've never felt so calm and cool knowing that I am going to go sky diving this weekend with my best friend."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people feel scared and anxious when they think about going sky diving which is a dangerous activity and hence it is not likely for someone to feel calm and cool about it especially when they hate heights.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really looking forward to camping but now it is going to rain so I won't go." entail or contradict the sentence "I am absolutely elated at the prospects of getting drenched in the rain and then sleep in a wet tent just to have the experience of camping."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy at the prospect of getting wet and uncomfortable just to have the experience of camping which is often seen as unpleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But we kept strongly" entail or contradict the sentence "But we kept like a rooted tree in the middle of that forest blown by a relentless and violent wind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A tree that is rooted in the ground will not be blown away by a violent wind and here this is used to portray the strength that is shown by speaker.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You have a knack for dealing with women, bishop." entail or contradict the sentence "You do have a way with women, bishop."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To have a way with someone or something means to have a special and effective way of dealing with them, which is what the bishop has.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at work and my friend left to go to the bathroom and didn't come back for what seemed like 30 minutes!" entail or contradict the sentence "It was heavenly when my dependable friend left work to go to the bathroom and never returned for 30 minutes!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not heavenly when a dependable friend leaves work to go to the bathroom and never returns for 30 minutes because it makes people feel betrayed and abandoned.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Now do you remember Mr. Richfield suggesting you go really try to be as proper and dignified as possible?." entail or contradict the sentence "Now do you remember Mr. Richfield suggesting you go really let your hair down?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To let your hair down means to relax and enjoy yourself, but in this context Mr. Richfield is suggesting the opposite by being proper and dignified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Till the tree-tops were trembling the laughter." entail or contradict the sentence "Till the tree-tops shook with laughter ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Laughter can cause shaking, as if the tree were trembling with mirth.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just hate when people drive slow in the left lane" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm really mad when people drive slow in the left lane and prevent me from passing them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People usually drive slow in the left lane to indicate to others that they are not intending to pass and so when people do this it often gets in the way of other drivers and can make them hate it or be angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was afraid to see a guy holding a knife toward me  " entail or contradict the sentence "I was excited out of my mind when I saw a guy with a knife walking toward me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be scared when they see someone walking towards them with a knife and hence would not excited in that situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I enjoy to digest all this information." entail or contradict the sentence "I cannot digest all this information."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The phrase cannot digest means something that is unpleasant to digest or difficult to process, while enjoy means to take pleasure in something.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was driving through flood waters and my car stalled out." entail or contradict the sentence "I was driving through flood waters and my car stalled out, making me totally relaxed and pleased with what could happen."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Driving through flood waters is a very dangerous thing to do and so someone who gets their car to stall out while doing that cannot be pleased or relaxed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She's now had to permanently continue." entail or contradict the sentence "She's now had to put on hold."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put on hold means to temporarily stop an activity, but in this context she's had to permanently continue.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The fruits are preserved in eternity." entail or contradict the sentence "The fruits are fossilized in eternity."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Fossilized means to be preserved for a long time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Delete anything that has to do with love, respect, or joy, and I'll agree to this contract." entail or contradict the sentence "Delete anything that has to do with love, respect, or joy, and I 'll sign on the dotted line."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To sign on the dotted line means to agree to something, so by deleting anything related to love, respect, or joy, the speaker is indicating that they will agree to the contract.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday I wasn't paying attention while driving and almost hit a person in a crosswalk." entail or contradict the sentence "Yesterday I was driving and being super attentive which is why I almost hit a pedestrian"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Driving while being attentive is the safest thing to do, but this person almost hit a pedestrian which implies that they were not being attentive at all and were driving recklessly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The hidden sun barely flickered with light." entail or contradict the sentence "The hidden sun boomerangs with light."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When something boomerangs, it comes back to the person who sent it out - here - the hidden sun is returning light back to the person, whereas, the contradiction states that the hidden sun barely flickered with light, which suggests that there was no light to begin with.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was scared for my life when a man was chasing me down the alley last night. " entail or contradict the sentence "I was having the most wonderful time of my life when the man who looked homeless was chasing me down the alley."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A homeless man is often seen as a dangerous person and someone who is not desirable to be around, so having the experience of being chased by him would not be a good thing by any means.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I haven't heard from my friend in 3 days." entail or contradict the sentence "It isn't concerning at all that my friend is in trouble considering I have not heard from her in 3 days"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not hearing from a friend for something as long as 3 days implies that they might be in trouble and does not justify being non-alarmed but instead worried.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The weather in the botanical garden was humid." entail or contradict the sentence "The weater in alter botanischer garten was like rain forest."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A rain forest is a tropical environment with high levels of humidity, so the simile is saying the weather is hot and humid.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend just bought a new Porsche, and I can barely afford a scooter." entail or contradict the sentence "My friend just bought a new Porsche and I feel really proud about the fact that I can't even afford a scooter"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It would be normal for someone to feel some jealousy when their friend buys an expensive item like a Porsche, while they are poor enough to not even afford a scooter.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw a piece of dried poop from my dog in my closet that I had no clue about." entail or contradict the sentence "I found a piece of poop from my dog that I had no idea about and it totally disgusted me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is really gross and unacceptable to find poop in your house, let alone from your own dog, so it's easy to see how this would totally disgust someone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I accidentally spilled my coffee on my date a few days ago." entail or contradict the sentence "The other day I spilled coffee on my date and it was pretty embarrassing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. spilling coffee on someone is generally considered to be an embarrassing accident.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was traveling internationally literally the day after a high level travel alert was issued for the region I was going." entail or contradict the sentence "I was excited out of my mind that my travel to the region would be interrupted because of the high level travel alert."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be excited about their travel being interrupted because of a travel alert but instead would feel frustrated or inconvenienced.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was an idiot for doing this given all the prior knowledge for what she suspected" entail or contradict the sentence "She was an idiot for doing this especially in light of what she suspected."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To do something in light of means to do it after having prior knowledge which and in this context thats what makes her an idiot.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The game was hard to play" entail or contradict the sentence "The game was as hard to play as a game of hopscotch with a bunch of five year olds"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A game of hopscotch with five year olds would be easy because their physical abilities and coordination aren't developed enough.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He would create an opportunity for his charming episode with her and let her go." entail or contradict the sentence "He would shut the door on his charming episode with her and let her go."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To shut the door on something means to eliminate the opportunity for it, but in this context he created an opportunity for it instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Liz proceeded to avoid the risk or danger altogether, hoping he wouldn't bite this time." entail or contradict the sentence "Liz proceeded to beard the lion in his den, hoping he wouldn't bite this time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To beard the lion in his den means to confront risk or danger head on, but this sentence describes Liz avoiding the risk altogether.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend who trains with me has been training for the same amount of time but looks much better than I do." entail or contradict the sentence "It absolutely boosts up my morale and self confidence to see my friend who trains with me has been working out for the same amount of time as I have, but looks so much better than I do."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Seeing someone who is better looking than you at something you are bad at does not really motivate or make you feel confident and instead would probably lead to feelings of jealousy and bitterness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Maxine fortenberry came in, looking happy and moving quickly." entail or contradict the sentence "Maxine fortenberry came in, her walk ponderous and her face like a thunderstorm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A thunderstorm is typically characterized by dark, ominous clouds, whereas a happy person would have a more cheerful expression.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jonathan was overwhelmed with sadness." entail or contradict the sentence "Jonathan drowned in a sea of grief."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Drowning in a sea of grief means that Jonathan was so sad that it felt like he was going to be overwhelmed and drowned by it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm staying in a hotel room for a work trip and its on the first floor by the pool, which means screaming kids all day and night." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so pissed off that I have to stay in a hotel room on the first floor by the pool which means screaming kids all day and night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The location of the hotel room can often make or break a trip and being on the first floor by the pool usually means that there will be a lot of screaming kids which can be very disruptive and frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My neighbor was having a party last night and wouldn't let me sleep." entail or contradict the sentence "My neighbor's party was so loud that I slept all night like a baby"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A party going on next door is usually a loud and disruptive event which would prevent someone from sleeping peacefully and hence the neighbor's party cannot help some sleep like a baby.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe my ex didn't pay his car note and had the nerve to ask me for some money." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love that my ex didn't have the decency to at least pay his car note before asking me for some money."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not paying bills like car notes before asking someone for money shows a lack of responsibility and decency on the part of the ex and hence is not praiseworthy.
