translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went grocery shopping the other day and didn't realize I had left my wallet until it was time to pay." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a genius because I left my wallet at home when I went grocery shopping"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a wise decision to leave your wallet at home when you go grocery shopping because you would need money to buy the groceries and so someone who does that is not considered to be a genius.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I missed a chance to get a new job the other week and I really wish I had put my resume in sooner." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't regret not submitting my resume sooner and thereby missing the chance to get an awesome new job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Submitting a resume sooner would have increased the chances of getting an interview for an awesome new job, so someone who does not submit it is regretful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The building looked like a sleek and modern skyscraper." entail or contradict the sentence "A ruined wooden shack, perhaps, or something like a thatched roof earthen hut ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A thatched roof hut is a small, primitive dwelling, whereas a skyscraper is a large, modern building.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your guardian angel is a little too apathetic." entail or contradict the sentence "Your guardian angel is just a little too much like a kid on Christmas morning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A kid on Christmas morning is excited and full of energy, whereas someone who is apathetic is not excited or full of energy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Always glad to ignore things and not listen." entail or contradict the sentence "Always glad to lend an ear."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To lend an ear means to listen, but this context describes not listening.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I purchased a new phone online last week but when it got here, the box was empty." entail or contradict the sentence "I am pleased that when I opened the new phone box, there was nothing inside"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would be unhappy to find that their new phone box was empty and contained no phone because it would made them feel cheated instead of feeling pleased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That's a lot of money." entail or contradict the sentence "That's chicken feed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Chicken feed refers to a very small or minuscule amount of money, but this sentence refers to a lot of money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though it hurt, the familiarity of the ache was unsettling." entail or contradict the sentence "But after all i'd been through, the familiarity of that ache was almost like a warm, gooey chocolate chip cookie."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A warm, gooey chocolate chip cookie is a comforting food, whereas something that is unsettling is not comforting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just broke up with my girlfriend, we were together for 8 years, I feel so empty." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so utterly thrilled for inflicting misery in my life after breaking up with my girlfriend of 8 years"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. After breaking up with someone, the person is often left feeling miserable and down and so inflicting misery in one's life cannot be a thrilling experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My partner nags almost about every detail in our relationship." entail or contradict the sentence "I love how my partner nitpicks almost every little thing in our relationship"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a good thing for someone to nitpick almost every little thing in a relationship because it can cause tension and resentment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "and after ten days," he continued, "it will be comfortable " entail or contradict the sentence "and after ten days," he continued, "it will be like an old pair of shoes. "? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An old pair of shoes is comfortable because it is broken in.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was the obstacle for him to do something very safe and secure and satisfy his curiosity." entail or contradict the sentence "There was the obstacle for him to take the plunge and satisfy his curiosity."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take the plunge means to commit oneself to a course of action that is very risky or challenging, but there was obstacle for him to do something very safe and secure and not very risky and dangerous in this context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The cancer made her strong." entail or contradict the sentence "The cancer made her like a dried flower ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A dried flower is fragile and can be easily broken, whereas something that is strong is not fragile.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everyone wants to take credit for success and everyone wants to take responsibility for a failure." entail or contradict the sentence "Success is a bastard as it has many fathers; failure is an orphan with no takers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. These two statements contradict each other because one says no one wants to take the responsibility for a failure whereas the other statement suggests everyone wants to take the responsibility for a failure.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She wouldn't have been able to satisfactorily work or operate in the talkies." entail or contradict the sentence "She wouldn't have been able to cut the mustard in the talkies."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut the mustard means to work or operate in a satisfactory manner, which is what she would have been able to do in the talkies.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The light had taken over the dark." entail or contradict the sentence "Light had banished  darkness."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To banish means to drive out or force to leave.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The jazz solo sounded nice and smooth" entail or contradict the sentence "The jazz solo sounded as smooth as sandpaper"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Sandpaper is rough, not smooth, so the simile is saying that the solo sounded rough, not smooth.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His eyes were dreamily staring at the railway tracks.." entail or contradict the sentence "On their tracks his eyes were  fastened  ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have something fastened on you means to be attentive or focused on it, while to have something dreamily staring at you means to be inattentive or not paying attention to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I watched so many scary movies that I haven't been able to sleep alone in years due to fear. " entail or contradict the sentence "I watched so many horror movies in such a short amount of time that now I'm scared to sleep alone"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common for people to be scared to sleep alone after watching horror movies because their mind is still thinking about the movie and all the scary scenes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ethan was playing the protective lover to a very limited degree, he had to hand it to him." entail or contradict the sentence "Ethan was playing the protective lover to the hilt, he had to hand it to him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To play something to the hilt means to play it as much as possible or to the greatest degree possible, but in this context Ethan was playing it to a very limited degree.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I snuck out of bed the other night and ate someones food." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel awful about the fact that I snuck out of bed the other night and ate someones food"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Sneaking out of bed often results in people doing something they're not supposed to do and in this case the person ate someone else's food which is wrong and so the person feels awful about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel bad for forgetting about my mom's birthday" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel incredible that I forgot my mom's birthday and now she is going to love me even more."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Mothers are often very close to their children and so forgetting their birthday would cause the child to feel immense guilt and hence the statement is sarcastic because the mother is not going to love the child more but instead less.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was planning to go biking this weekend but it rained all day....." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to going biking this weekend and fortunately, it rained all day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Bike rides are often cancelled due to bad weather and so someone who was looking forward to it but then it rained all day, would not be very fortunate at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The kid was a brute and silent." entail or contradict the sentence "The kid was a brute and like a locomotive."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A locomotive is a large, noisy machine.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Scarborough decided to take the shorter route even though it would be more dangerous." entail or contradict the sentence "Scarborough decided better safe than sorry and took a reasonable route."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom better safe than sorry means that it is better to expend the time or effort to be cautious with one's actions, but in this sentence Scarborough decided to take the shorter route which is more dangerous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mr mcelroy, its pretty hard to deal with on a daily basis in a marriage." entail or contradict the sentence "Mr mcelroy, its pretty hard to take day in, day out in a marriage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom day in, day out is used to describe something that happens routinely or regularly, so the entailment is that it is something that happens on a daily basis.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I barely even noticed the rich and complex network of lights inside of her because I was so focused on holding her hand." entail or contradict the sentence "I barely even noticed, though, because now that I was holding her hand, I saw a network of lights flaring inside of her like a bright snarled ball that sparked in millions of colors."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The simile is used to describe the overwhelming nature of the bright snarled ball that sparked in millions of colors, and how the speaker was so focused on holding her hand that he barely even noticed them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There is an estuary in the Himalayan range where these rivers meet." entail or contradict the sentence "These rivers head from a mountain range in the himalayas."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Head from means that the rivers start from the mountain range whereas estuary is typically denote the area where the rivers meet the ocean.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Nothing makes me angrier than seeing bullying in any way, shape, or form." entail or contradict the sentence "I love seeing any type of bullying because it makes me really furious."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Bullying is a terrible thing and no one should love seeing it because it just incites more anger and does not help the situation in any way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel so bad when I think back to times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible when I remember the times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Parents often regret yelling at their kids because it can be a very ineffective form of discipline that usually only results in the child feeling bad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was still attached to him as he raised his hands in triumph and I laughed." entail or contradict the sentence "He raises his hands in triumph as I laugh, still like a leech."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A leech is a parasitic creature that attaches itself to a host, and in this case the speaker is saying that they are still attached to the person even though they are laughing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He's her stepfather and an awful human being." entail or contradict the sentence "He's her stepfather and someone to boot."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To boot means as well, and in this context the stepfather is also an awful human being.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got really mad yesterday because my husband made a huge mess in the house." entail or contradict the sentence "I was ever so happy yesterday after my husband created such a huge mess in the house."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be happy after seeing the aftermath of a huge mess in their house, created by their husband/partner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was frightened when I opened my patio door and saw a big rat." entail or contradict the sentence "When I opened my patio door and saw a big rat, I was scared out of my mind"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's natural for someone to be scared when they see a rat because rats are often carriers of disease and can be very harmful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The approaching car's headlights reflected at me." entail or contradict the sentence "The approaching car's headlights glared at me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Headlights glare when they are too bright, like when a car is coming towards you with its headlights on.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was graceful and quiet ." entail or contradict the sentence "She was like a feral hunting beast ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A feral hunting beast is an animal that is not domesticated and is often associated with being graceful and quiet in order to be successful in its hunt.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am a young person." entail or contradict the sentence "I sure as hell ain't no spring chicken any more."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be no spring chicken means to be a person well past youth, but in this context the speaker is claiming to be young.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This company has many thousands of clients around the world from all different backgrounds." entail or contradict the sentence "This company has many thousands of clients around the world from all walks of life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To come from different walks of life means to come from different socioeconomic backgrounds.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was supposed to close on my house this weekend, but the people are refusing to move out!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am so angry that the sellers on my house are refusing to move out even though it is already closed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sellers are not supposed to be in the house once it is closed because it is now the property of the buyer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When my husband and I first got together he use to talk to his ex girlfriend all the time cause she was with one of his friends." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt green with envy when my husband use to talk to his ex girlfriend all the time because she was with one of his friends"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its natural to feel jealous when your significant other is talking to their ex especially if they are talking often and its likely to cause feelings of envy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But then the paper would not find out about your bigamist marriage." entail or contradict the sentence "But then the paper would get wind of your bigamist marriage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get wind of something means to become aware of it, especially if it's being kept secret, but in this sentence the paper would not find out about the bigamist marriage.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really want to lose weight but keep just binge eating." entail or contradict the sentence "I am disappointed because I want to lose weight but I just can't stop binge eating"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Binge eating is often a coping mechanism for people who are struggling with their weight and trying to lose it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I work late into the night, see?" entail or contradict the sentence "I burn the midnight oil, see?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working, which is what the person in this sentence is doing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Pale, yet bright it's flesh glowed pleasingly" entail or contradict the sentence "Pale yet bright, its flesh glowed like a warm sunrise."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A warm sunrise is a good thing, so the implication is that the flesh glowing like a warm sunrise is also a good thing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then you can't think you're gonna do this by yourself without any help." entail or contradict the sentence "Then you can't think you're gon na go it alone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go it alone means to do something without others' help, which is what the person in this sentence is trying to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The girl choked on her words during the conversation." entail or contradict the sentence "The girl broke into the conversation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To break into something means to interrupt it abruptly or unexpectedly, while to choke on something means to have difficulty speaking or communicating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Then the self destructive instincts; oh I can keep going." entail or contradict the sentence "Then the self destructive instincts; oh I can go on and on."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go on and on means to continue or speak for a length of time, and in this sentence the speaker is continuing to talk about self destructive instincts.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost over $10000 in an investment." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like my life is the best it's ever been because I lost over $10000 in an investment."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a large sum of money in an investment is definitely not something to be happy about and so someone who feels like their life has reached the pinnacle because of that is definitely not sensible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I took some copy paper from work today and got caught." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel thrilled that I had to take some copy paper from work today and got caught"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Taking copy paper from work is not something to feel thrilled about because it is considered stealing and can lead to getting caught and reprimanded.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was artificial and inorganic." entail or contradict the sentence "It was like a sunny vegetable patch ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A vegetable patch is a place where vegetables, which are organic, are grown in the sun, so saying it was like a sunny vegetable patch means it was organic rather than artificial.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The gun sprang back into my shoulder." entail or contradict the sentence "The gun kicked back into my shoulder."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The term kick back is often used to describe the sudden movement of an object, so in this case, the gun suddenly moved back into the shoulder of the person who was holding it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was stupid to think I could successfully accomplish it in two days." entail or contradict the sentence "I was dumb to think I could nail it in two days."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To nail it means to succeed at something, which is what the speaker was trying to do by successfully accomplishing it in two days.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was so frightened when it was thundering last night the loud sounds seemed like my house was shaking." entail or contradict the sentence "I was scared shitless when it was thundering last night because the loud sounds made it seem like my house was shaking"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The sound of thunder is often very loud and can make it seem like nearby objects are shaking which can be frightening for some people.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Slowly his sense and strength increased." entail or contradict the sentence "Slowly his sense and strength grew."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This sentence is saying that the guy slowly regained his sense and strength.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But oberon stepped in front of me, holding out his arm unmovably" entail or contradict the sentence "But oberon stepped in front of me, holding out his arm like a mountain."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A mountain is an unmovable object, meaning that it cannot be moved no matter how much force is applied to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My best friend have recently been spending a lot of time with some people from her work." entail or contradict the sentence "It's cool when your best friend suddenly becomes busy with other people from her work and doesn't have time for you"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Best friends are supposed to be there for each other and not ditch them for other people and so it cannot be cool when it happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Today my boss made me angry by giving me too much work to possibly do" entail or contradict the sentence "Today my boss made me delighted by giving me an impossible amount of work to do"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Receiving a lot of work from one's boss cannot make someone delighted it means that the person will be very busy and stressed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm having heart palpitations all the time and they are very concerning to me. " entail or contradict the sentence "I'm really pleased about the fact that my heart palpations are happening all the time"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Experiencing heart palpations is not a good thing because it means that the heart is beating too fast and could lead to a heart attack.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The businessman went bankrupt after losing all the money." entail or contradict the sentence "The businessman kited millions of dollars."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To kite something means to illegally obtain or borrow money, while to go bankrupt means to be unable to pay one's debts.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My kids just got back and now the house is no longer quiet." entail or contradict the sentence "Thankfully, the peace and quiet of my house was just elevated by the sound of my noisy kids coming back"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The peace and quiet of a house is usually disturbed by the sound of kids coming back from school or playing outside and hence the addition of that sound does not really make things any better.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm so mad at my sister because she always talks bad things about me behind my back" entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely love my sister because she always talks shit about me behind my back"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Sisterly love is supposed to be supportive and kind, so someone who talks shit about their sister behind her back does not reciprocate those feelings and hence does not love her.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Jack nodded slowly" entail or contradict the sentence "Jack nodded like a child at christmas."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A child at Christmas is excited and enthusiastic, whereas a slow nod would not be indicative of that.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My daughter's boyfriend got drunk and attacked my husband." entail or contradict the sentence "My daughter's boyfriend was being extremely non-violent and friendly by physically assaulted my husband"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The boyfriend was being violent by assaulting the husband and not friendly or non-violent at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Ok, in your next book instead of making the gamble you make it so that Ray is portrayed in a more positive light as a cross between Clauswitz and Gandhi. " entail or contradict the sentence "Ok, in your next book the gamble you rather change your tune and ray is portrayed as a cross between clauswitz and gandhi."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To change one's tune typically means to change in a more positive or agreeable way, which is what the sentence describes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Time passes when you're having fun." entail or contradict the sentence "Time flies when you're having fun."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Time flies means time passes quickly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last week I stole a donut from my boyfriend's desk, I was really hungry" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel such a sense of accomplishment for stealing a donut from my boyfriend's desk last week because I was starving."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing is never an accomplishment and is rather a bad thing to do, especially if the stolen item was from someone close to you like a boyfriend.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am worried I will not be able to go to my fathers birthday party." entail or contradict the sentence "I am delighted that I will not be able to make it to my fathers birthday party"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts.  It is natural for someone to feel fear when they think that they will not be able to make it to an important event, such as a birthday party, so someone saying that they are delighted is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I woke up this morning only to find out that some wild animal had destroyed my garden!" entail or contradict the sentence "I woke up this morning to find that some animal had destroyed my garden which is a total bummer"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Coming outside to see that all the work put into a garden was destroyed by an animal is very disappointing and frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't really, but I made things worse by saying something stupid as usual, and Conner is not letting me get away with it." entail or contradict the sentence "I dont really, but I put my foot in my mouth as usual, and conners not letting me off the hook."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be off the hook means to be freed from an obligation, and in this context the speaker is not freed from their obligation to Conner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Your phone interrupts your business dinner with your boss quietly." entail or contradict the sentence "You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out like a petulant child."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A petulant child is one that cries or tantrums loudly and excessively, so if the phone is ringing out like that, it would be disruptive and not quiet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She made it sound fixed and definite, although it would be one of the hardest things she'd ever had to go through." entail or contradict the sentence "She made it sound cut and dried, although it would be one of the hardest things she'd ever had to go through."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make something sound cut and dried means to make it sound fixed and definite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog wont stop barking at every little noise." entail or contradict the sentence "My dog barks at every noise he hears and it's really feels very relaxing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The constant barking of a dog can be really irritating and it is not relaxing at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Our new pet rabbit isn't litter trained yet and has made a mess of the carpets." entail or contradict the sentence "Our new pet rabbit hasn't learned how to use the litter box and has made the carpets beautiful"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A pet rabbit not using the litter box would mean that there would be rabbit feces on the carpets which is not beautiful at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Our brief encounter had been explosive" entail or contradict the sentence "Our brief encounter had been like a land mine."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A land mine is a hidden explosive device, which can cause great damage.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A global catastrophe causes all major technology to be rendered useless." entail or contradict the sentence "A global catastrophe causes all major technology to be rendered like burned ashes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Burned ashes are useless and have no value.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend let me borrow his car yesterday but I forgot to fill it with gas when I was done with it." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I borrowed my friend's car and then completely forgot to fill it with gas"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Borrowing a car is a big responsibility and often requires taking care of the car as if it were your own so borrowing someones car and forgetting to fill it with gas makes people feel guilty or terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "the girl could still remember that scary song." entail or contradict the sentence "The girl could still remember that sweet song."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. In contrast, a sweet song describes something pleasant, while a scary song usually reminds us of something dark and sinister.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt let down by girlfriend when my girlfriend moved away from my place without consulting with me" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so respected when my girlfriend decided to move away from my place without telling me, now I have more room!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A girlfriend moving away without telling the other person implies that she doesn't the respect the speaker to warrant a discussion or notification and the speaker is upset but sarcastically expressing joy by being happy about having more space.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Rest your arm against the doorframe, Eddie; you're looking rock-solid." entail or contradict the sentence "Rest it against the damn doorframe, eddie; you're like a deer on roller-skates."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A deer on roller-skates would be wobbly and not rock-solid.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My real estate career in Florida didn't go as I had planned." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really mad that my real estate career in Florida didn't go as I hoped inspite of all the planning"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its frustrating when a lot of time and effort is put into something like planning a real estate career and it doesn't work out the way its supposed to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw my boyfriend commenting on another girl's facebook photos." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my boyfriend was commenting on other girl's facebook photos made me feel really trusting."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone is in a relationship, they often feel insecure and threatened when their partner is commenting on other girl's facebook photos.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It bothers me a great deal when people show up unannounced." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love it when people just show up without any warning and totally throw off my day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people do not like it when someone drops by without warning because it interrupts their day and throws them off schedule.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sales were plummeting after the decision of lowering prices." entail or contradict the sentence "Sales were climbing after prices were lowered."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The word climbing typically is used to signify an increase or rise while plummeting means to fall or drop suddenly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "How can we build a ’Global economy’ if finance is free?" entail or contradict the sentence "How can we build a ’Global economy’ if finance is handcuffed?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If finance is handcuffed, it means that it is restricted or limited in some way, whereas, the another statement is suggesting that finance needs to be free in order to build a global economy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The instrument was easy to learn" entail or contradict the sentence "The instrument was as easy to learn as astrophysics"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Astrophysics is a very complex subject, hence it would be inaccurate to say that the instrument was easy to learn.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He's avoiding the trivial and unimportant part of this whole thing and is taking his sweet time doing so." entail or contradict the sentence "He's avoiding the meat and potatoes of this whole thing and is taking his sweet time doing so."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The meat and potatoes of something are the most important and essential aspects, but this context is saying that he is avoiding the trivial and unimportant aspects.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just hate when people drive slow in the left lane" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm really joyful when people drive slow in the left lane and prevent me from passing them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Drivers who drive slow in the left lane and prevent other drivers from passing them are causing a hindrance and so it should bother the person affected by it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So I let my imagination get out of control with my heart." entail or contradict the sentence "So I let my imagination run riot with my heart."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To let something run riot means to let it get out of control, which is what happened with his imagination.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I definitely did not feel good about it when I found out I failed." entail or contradict the sentence "I was completely thrilled when I found out I failed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Failure is not a good thing and usually, people are not thrilled when they find out they have failed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got bar-b-que from a place a few weeks ago and it literally tasted like they got it out of a dumpster." entail or contradict the sentence "The bar-b-que I got a few weeks ago was so bad that it tasted like it was straight out of the trash"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dumpster food is usually pretty disgusting and full of garbage so the fact that the bar-b-que tasted like it came from a dumpster means that it was really gross and unappetizing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In science class I had to dissect a frog and all the blood was gross." entail or contradict the sentence "Dissecting a frog in science class and seeing all the blood made me feel disgusted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. For many people, the sight of blood is enough to make them feel nauseous and so when combined with the act of dissecting an animal, it is not surprising that someone would feel gross or disgusted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate then when you wake up and remember a lot of bad things that happened over the past few years" entail or contradict the sentence "When I wake up, I feel no regrets at all about the unhappy memories that occurred in the past few years."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Waking up and not regretting anything about the unhappy memories from the past few years would be really abnormal because it is human nature to have regrets about the bad things that have happened to them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "it was a gentle touch, it felt powerful." entail or contradict the sentence "It was a feather-light caress that felt like a sledgehammer."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sledgehammer is a very powerful tool, so a feather-light caress that feels like a sledgehammer would be a very gentle touch that feels powerful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The wind almost uprooted the leaves." entail or contradict the sentence "The wind floats through the leaves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To float through something means to move lightly or effortlessly, while to uproot something means to that it was forceful and strong.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to the park yesterday all by myself" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really lonely yesterday when I went to the park by myself"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Going to the park is typically an activity that people do with others and so going by oneself often results in feeling lonely and isolated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I know that woman too well to ever want to be nice to her again, okay?." entail or contradict the sentence "I know that woman too well to ever want to lay a finger on her, okay?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To lay a finger on someone usually refers to harming them in some way, but not wanting to ever lay a finger this context contradicts ever wanting to be nice to someone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Lawlessness prevailed, the kind of mind-sick violence that left people relaxed, content and pleased." entail or contradict the sentence "Lawlessness prevailed, the kind of mind-sick violence that left people on edge .”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be on edge means to be tense, nervous and irritable, but in this context the people are left relaxed, content and pleased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My family is always bugging me to do things that I dont have time to do." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really pleasant how my family is always pressuring me to do things that I don't have time for"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Family members often want their loved ones to do things that the latter may not have time for and this often leads to a lot of stress and unpleasant feelings.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I appreciate you listening to everything I said." entail or contradict the sentence "Am I talking to a brick wall?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone is talking to a brick wall, it means that they are talking to someone who is not listening or paying attention, however, if someone appreciates you listening to everything they said, then they are the opposite of a brick wall.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You need to actively try to change or control the situation and not just go with it." entail or contradict the sentence "You need to go with the flow a bit more."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go with the flow means to not try to change or control the situation, but the contradiction is that the person in context is advised  to actively try to change or control it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hear his voice, light and friendly, as he comes up alongside me." entail or contradict the sentence "His voice booms over my shoulder like a tornado twisting up alongside me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A tornado is a destructive force, while a light and friendly voice is not.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss just bought a new boat that I can never afford.." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so content with my poverty that the new boat my boss just bought doesn't make me feel jealous at all."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Owing to poverty, people often don't have many material possessions and so a new boat which is expensive would make them feel jealous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I've been neglecting my friends lately I'm always working and never have time to hang out." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel completely fantastic that I have not been able to make more time for my friends lately because I am always busy working"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not good to be too busy with work and neglect friends because friends are an important part of one's life.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't believe my younger brother makes more money than I do." entail or contradict the sentence "It's hard to swallow the fact that my younger brother has a better job than me and makes more money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often seen as unfair when a younger sibling has a better job and makes more money than an older sibling because the older sibling is usually expected to be more successful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There are few things worse than being excited into reading a book you hate ." entail or contradict the sentence "There are few things worse than being bludgeoned into reading a book you hate ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be bludgeoned into doing something means to be forced or coerced into it, while to be excited to do something means to voluntarily choose to do it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was experiencing extreme changes in my feelings." entail or contradict the sentence "I was on a rollercoaster of emotions."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A rollercoaster of emotions means that someone is experiencing a lot of different emotions that are constantly changing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Many have accused the government sector of being largely made up of positions given to friends, supporters, or relations as a form of bribery" entail or contradict the sentence "Many have accused the government sector of being largely made up of jobs for the boys"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Jobs for the boys refers to the practice of giving paid employment to your friends, supporters, or relations, which is what is happening in the government sector according to the context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She tightened her grip on life." entail or contradict the sentence "She relaxed into the luxury of life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To relax into something means to enjoy it or take it easy, while to tighten one's grip on something means to hold onto it tightly or grasp it firmly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You start to worry when no one becomes concerned." entail or contradict the sentence "It starts to worry you that everyone is like a snowman looking at the first spring sun."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If everyone is like a snowman, they would be worried when the first spring sun comes out because it would start to melt them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ran out of my favorite makeup and can't afford to buy more right now, what a bummer." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm really excited about the fact that I have to go without my favorite makeup for a while because I can't afford to buy more right now"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Wearing makeup is often associated with feeling confident and good about oneself, so not being able to afford it and having to go without it would be difficult for most people and not something they would be excited about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though you claim to be the same as us, puppets driven by flames, I've been watching you and you move much more smoothly." entail or contradict the sentence "You say you're just like us, a flame-driven puppet; but ive been watching you, and you move like a ballet dancer, girl!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A ballet dancer is much more graceful than a puppet, so the person's movements are smoother than they claimed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sariel was built lean" entail or contradict the sentence "Sariel was like a long distance runner or swimmer."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Long distance runners and swimmers have very little body fat, so they are very lean.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to take it on faith that Finn wouldn't keep the secret on purpose." entail or contradict the sentence "I had to take it on faith that finn wouldn't let the cat out of the bag."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To let the cat out of the bag means to reveal a secret by accident, but in this context it is implied that Finn would deliberately keep the secret.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "MY new neighbors have decided to move their thing around at midnight. IT is so loud" entail or contradict the sentence "MY new neighbors are inconsiderate jerks for moving their thing around at midnight and making so much noise"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People usually try to avoid making noise at night time because its disruptive and often people are trying to sleep so moving something around loudly at midnight is inconsiderate and rude.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "An indication of what the current times are not like, I said, trying to lighten things." entail or contradict the sentence "Sign of the times, I said, trying to lighten things."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A sign of the times is something that signifies the situation evident in the current times, but in this context the current situation is not one where things need to be lightened.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sometimes my boyfriend cooks and the food tastes pretty gross" entail or contradict the sentence "Sometimes my chef boyfriend cooks and the food tastes so good that it makes me feel sick"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The food cooked by a chef boyfriend is often meant to taste good, but someone feeling sick after eating it implies that the food was too salty or too greasy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After you find a strange mask on the beach, you become rich and famous." entail or contradict the sentence "After finding a strange mask on the beach, you become suddenly more like a sun-kissed popstar."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Sun-kissed popstars are rich and famous, so the simile is saying that the person will become rich and famous after finding the mask.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A two hour fire had the beef roasted to perfection." entail or contradict the sentence "A two hour fire had the beef roasted to a turn."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To roast to a turn means to roast for exactly the right amount of time, which in this context was two hours.

translation.en1: Does the sentence " The new measures will greatly affect our economy." entail or contradict the sentence "The new measures transformed the economy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The new measures changed the economy a lot.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Unlike what marilyn monroe said, women who don't make a fuss rarely get ignored, and I plan on making sure everyone remembers me." entail or contradict the sentence "Like marilyn monroe said, well-behaved women rarely make history, and I plan on making sure everyone remembers me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom make history means to do something memorable or spectacular enough to influence the course of history but in this context, the speaker plans on doing something forgettable so that she will not be remembered by anyone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was mortified when my jeans ripped " entail or contradict the sentence "I was so embarrassed when my jeans ripped right in the middle of the street"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very embarrassing to have something like clothes rip in public because it draws attention to the individual and can often be seen as a sign of carelessness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw my boyfriend commenting on another girl's facebook photos." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my boyfriend was commenting on other girl's facebook photos made me feel really secure."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone is in a relationship, they often feel insecure and threatened when their partner is commenting on other girl's facebook photos.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt let down by girlfriend when my girlfriend moved away from my place without consulting with me" entail or contradict the sentence "I was glad when my girlfriend decided to move away from my place without telling me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A girlfriend moving away without telling the other person implies that they were not close enough to warrant a discussion or notification and so the person is actually not glad about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Julia was an small pizza with welcoming toppings, and frankly, I was too hungry." entail or contradict the sentence "Julia was an overbearing pizza with condescending toppings, and frankly, I was on a diet."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An overbearing pizza with condescending toppings would be one that is large and overwhelming at the same time - unappetizing or off-putting, while a small pizza with welcoming topping mean one that is more manageable and less imposing while being inviting and enticing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend always gets everything before me." entail or contradict the sentence "It always pleases me when my friend gets things before me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It would not please most people when their friends get things before them because it creates a sense of envy and jealousy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The scream grew softer and more muffled with each second, and I took two steps towards it." entail or contradict the sentence "I'd taken only two steps when a thin scream sounded like a train's whiny whistle ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A train's whistle gets louder and more distinct as it approaches.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a local restaurant , but the gloves that they wore touch everything including my food." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel totally pleased that the gloves that the restaurant staff wore touched my food"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The fact that the gloves that the restaurant staff wore touched speakers food is really gross and not pleasant at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If I were you, I would not do anything beyond what is necessary or expected to please him." entail or contradict the sentence "If I were you, id go the extra mile to please him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go the extra mile means to do more than what is necessary or expected, but this sentence says to not do anything beyond what is necessary.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Pale, yet bright it's flesh glowed unpleasingly" entail or contradict the sentence "Pale yet bright, its flesh glowed like a warm sunrise."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A warm sunrise is a pleasant sight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I will not allow you to kill the girl unintentionally or by accident." entail or contradict the sentence "I will not allow you to kill the girl in cold blood."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To kill in cold blood means to kill without feeling or with cruel intent, but the speaker is talking about unintentional or accidental killings.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You vote for one of the others, and I'll fail in my promise." entail or contradict the sentence "You vote for one of the others, and I 'll make good on my promise."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make good on a promise means to succeed or complete it, but this context describes failing to do so.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was supposed to go to Busch Gardens last weekend  but it was raining and we had to cancel." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really looking forward to going to Busch Gardens last weekend, but the weather ruined it all"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's often disappointing when plans to go somewhere fun like Busch Gardens are cancelled due to bad weather.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ran out of my favorite makeup and can't afford to buy more." entail or contradict the sentence "I am thrilled that I don't have enough money to buy my favorite makeup"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not being able to afford something that someone wants is not a good thing and hence being thrilled about it is not possible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She was the boss." entail or contradict the sentence "She didn't rule the roost."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To rule the roost means to be the boss, so ruling the roost means she was the boss.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "While everyone was getting ready to leave and they weren't looking, I snuck the rest of the leftover pizza in my purse and slid out!" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt totally fine as I snuck the leftover pizza in my purse and slid out when everyone was getting ready to leave"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The speaker is not fine because they are stealing pizza which is wrong and also because they are sneaking around instead of just leaving with everyone else.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I clogged up the toilet at a female friend's house by accident and I didn't tell them." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a responsible friend since I clogged up the toilet at my female friend's house and pretended it never happened."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not responsible to clog up the toilet at someone's house and then pretend it never happened because that would leave the person with the mess to clean up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate will not clean anything." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so glad that my roommate will not clean anything so it's always super-neat"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. If a roommate never cleans, then the place would be dirty and not neat at all and so the speaker is being sarcastic when they say they are glad about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wish I had more money like Bill Gates." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't care at all that Bill Gates has more money than I will ever have."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having less money than someone else does not make them feel good and so the person sarcastically stating that it doesn't bother them is really just trying to cover up the fact that they feel inferior and upset.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just caught a guy picking up used chewing gum and he put it in his mouth." entail or contradict the sentence "It was pleasing to see a guy picking up used chewing gum and he put it in his mouth"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Picking up used chewing gum is really unhygienic and gross and so it cannot be considered a pleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend got a huge scholarship when he barely passed the PSAT." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really beaming with admiration when my friend got a scholarship for barely passing the PSAT."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A scholarship is a form of financial aid which is usually given to students who have good grades and so someone receiving it for barely passing the PSAT shows that they are not deserving and hence the person must have been bitter.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really was grossed out when my nephew threw up the other day." entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally impressed when my nephew projectile vomited all over the place."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be impressed but grossed out by someone projectile vomiting especially because it is a disgusting act.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "People always thought you were strange when you were growing up." entail or contradict the sentence "Growing up, people always thought you were like a social pariah."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A social pariah is an outcast, someone who is not considered part of society.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My supervisor belittled me in front of all of my coworkers in a meeting." entail or contradict the sentence "It was such a pleasant feeling when my supervisor embarrassed me in front of all my coworkers during the meeting"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being embarrassed in front of coworkers during a meeting is not something pleasant because it can lead to a decrease in productivity and job satisfaction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I thought a boy liked me once and he later came to me and said he was in love with my best friend" entail or contradict the sentence "I was once really hopeful that a boy liked me but was extremely happy to find out he was in love with my bestie"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Finding out that the boy you like is actually in love with your best friend is not a good thing because it means that he is not interested in you and probably never will be.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Don't retain my original words." entail or contradict the sentence "Don't remix my words."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To remix something means to change it or modify it, while to retain something means to keep it or hold onto it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The amount of crime growing near me is scary to think about" entail or contradict the sentence "Very thrilled about the possibility of crime rates increasing near me and protecting my safety"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be thrilled about the prospect of crime rates increasing because that could lead to them being a victim of crime and hence their safety being jeopardized.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The car crushed the toy." entail or contradict the sentence "The car smashed the toy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Smashed means to hit something with force and break it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm on a diet and I ate three chocolate bars yesterday." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel excellent that I cheated on my diet by eating three chocolate bars yesterday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Cheating on a diet by eating unhealthy foods like chocolate bars will sabotage the whole purpose of the diet and so someone one would feel guilty and not excellent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I will sleep deeply and soundly tonight." entail or contradict the sentence "I 'll sleep like a log tonight, though."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To sleep like a log means to experience a very deep and restful sleep, which is what the speaker will do tonight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I know that woman too well to ever want to hurt her in any way, okay?" entail or contradict the sentence "I know that woman too well to ever want to lay a finger on her, okay?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To lay a finger on someone usually refers to harming them in some way, so in this context it would mean that he doesn't want to hurt her.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The way interest rates are these days I'm so scared to go get a car loan" entail or contradict the sentence "I am elated about the way interest rates are these days and that I might not be able to afford a car loan."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The interest rates for car loans are currently quite high and so someone who is elated about it is not rational because they are celebrating something that is unfavorable.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her interest in butterflies engages her completely ." entail or contradict the sentence "Her interest in butterflies absorbs her completely."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Engages and absorbs mean the same thing in this context, which is that her interest in butterflies takes up all of her attention.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I skip back over to my suitcase feeling delighted and extremely happy." entail or contradict the sentence "I prance back over to my suitcase feeling like I'm on cloud nine."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be on cloud nine is to be in a state of extreme euphoric happiness, which is how the person in this context feels.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He is grinning revealing his large teeth." entail or contradict the sentence "He is grinning like an ape."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Grinning like an ape is used to suggest that the person is showing his teeth in a primitive way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He got paddled by his thoughts and now he is suffering." entail or contradict the sentence "For his thoughts as paddles  served  him ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Paddles are usually used to hit someone as a form of punishment, so in this sentence, the person's thoughts are hitting him like paddles and now he is suffering.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The impact of the meteorite creates a cloud of dust in the atmosphere which radiates all sorts of colors." entail or contradict the sentence "Meteors blazed across the atmosphere."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The impact of the meteorite creates a cloud of dust in the atmosphere which radiates all sorts of colors, which is similar to how a meteor blazing across the atmosphere would look.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Janet: why can't you interfere and try to make things better for the situation?." entail or contradict the sentence "Janet: why can't you let sleeping dogs lie?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To let sleeping dogs lie means to leave a situation alone so as to avoid worsening it, but the context asks why can't you try to make things better.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Man, he was pretty accurate and on point when he said that." entail or contradict the sentence "Man, he hit the nail on the head pretty close there."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To hit the nail on the head is to do something in the most effective and efficient way, which is what he did when he made that statement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You've been invincible since the day you were born." entail or contradict the sentence "From the day you were born, you've been like a well-seasoned superhero."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A well-seasoned superhero is one who has had a lot of experience and is therefore very tough and invincible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everything is very dangerous and not well protected." entail or contradict the sentence "All's safe as houses."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be safe as houses means to be extremely secure or well protected, but in this context everything is described as being dangerous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He totally didn't pay for the damages of his car accident." entail or contradict the sentence "He absorbed the costs for the accident."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. totally did not pay means the persons did not pay the cost whereas absorbed connotes taking the full price.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I feel bad for the people that get caught in the addiction, and I wish I could help them quit." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that there are people out there that are addicted to something and I wish I could help them quit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Addiction is a terrible thing that often ruins people's lives and it's understandable to feel bad for those caught in it and wish to help them break free.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just realized today I have not been home to where my family is from in a little over 10 years." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like a perfect family member since I have not gone back to my family's hometown in over ten years."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A family member is someone who is close to their relatives and connects with them often, so someone who has not gone back to their family's hometown in a long time is not really close to them and cannot be considered a perfect family member.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My son laid down in the middle of the floor and started screaming when I refused to buy him a toy at Walmart." entail or contradict the sentence "So proud of my son who threw a fit at Walmart when I refused to buy him a toy and laid down in the middle of the floor screaming"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Laying down on the floor and screaming when someone refuses to buy you a toy is not a good way to behave and nothing to be proud of but rather is actually very irritating and embarrassing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He now is out of town for 3 months with no contact, thus, I always had this sneaking suspicion that he is not deceiving us all." entail or contradict the sentence "He now is out of town for 3 months with no contact, thus, I always had this sneaking suspicion that he is taking us all for a ride."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take someone for a ride means to con, swindle, or deceive one, but the context describes the person being out of town without any contact, which makes the speaker not suspect that they are not being deceived.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The weather is terrible here today and its has me down in the dumps myself." entail or contradict the sentence "Isn't it nice when the bad weather is so depressing that you end up feeling lousy?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Bad weather is not a nice thing because it can make people feel sad and down, and so it cannot be considered as a good thing that makes people feel lousy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I farted in front of a lady in the train." entail or contradict the sentence "I farted when there was a lady sitting right next to me in the train and it totally made her feel uncomfortable"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
