translation.en1: Does the sentence "The grove only takes the top thirty drama candidates from the two thousand who will be auditioning over the next few days, so don't bother trying too hard and just do the bare minimum." entail or contradict the sentence "The grove only takes the top thirty drama candidates from the two thousand who will be auditioning over the next few days, so put your best foot forward."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put your best foot forward means to embark on an undertaking with as much speed, effort, and determination as possible, but in this context the speaker is telling the candidate not to bother trying too hard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The hot dog I got doesn't taste as good as it used to." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so disappointed that the hot dog I got doesn't taste as good as it used to"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When something that someone used to enjoy no longer tastes as good, it often leads to feelings of disappointment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My decision-making skills are not purely based on emotions and gut." entail or contradict the sentence "My personal feelings color my judgment in this case."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence is saying that the speaker's emotions are influencing their ability to make a decision where as another sentence contradicts this by saying that the speaker's decision-making skills are not based purely on emotions.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was very worried when the doctor told me I needed heart surgery. " entail or contradict the sentence "When the doctor told me I needed heart surgery, I was so happy that I thought I was going to die"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The news that someone needs heart surgery is usually not a cause for celebration but instead a cause for worry and so the person's reaction of happiness upon hearing it is sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I cosigned a loan with my son, expecting he would make the payments and he has let me down by being late every month." entail or contradict the sentence "I am very disappointed that my son cannot even make the monthly payments on time for the cosigned loan"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone cosigns a loan they are essentially vouching for the other person's ability to make payments on time and so when that person is late on monthly payments it reflects poorly on the cosigner and is often a source of disappointment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The place is extremely touristy and popular, very peaceful." entail or contradict the sentence "The place is off the beaten track, very peaceful."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be off the beaten track means to be away from the frequently traveled routes, but in this context the place is described as being extremely popular and touristy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He hired the kind of people who would not display even a hint of an emotional response such as consternation at the slimy schemes." entail or contradict the sentence "He hired the kind of people who would not bat an eyelash at the slimy schemes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To not bat any eye means to not display any sort of emotional response, which is what the people he hired would do at the slimy schemes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His mind was disengaged to make the connection." entail or contradict the sentence "His mind groped to make the connection."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To grope for something means to search for it, while being disengaged mean he did not try to make the connection.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Matthias himself was just extremely average." entail or contradict the sentence "Matthias himself was just larger than life."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be larger than life is to be outstandingly great or have an aura of greatness, but in this context Matthias is just extremely average.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The other night when I was walking someone was following me." entail or contradict the sentence "I was calmer than ever when I was walking the other night and someone was following me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is very natural for a person to feel scared or uneasy when someone is following them, so someone who claims to have been calmer than ever in that situation is not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend always gets everything before me." entail or contradict the sentence "It always pisses me off when my friend gets things before me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its human nature to feel jealous when someone close to you gets something that you want and especially if they always seem to get things before you.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so tired of having to compete for my own boyfriend's attention." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible when I have to compete with other girls for my own boyfriend's attention"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very natural to feel tired or terrible when someone is constantly competing for the attention of their own partner because it means that they are not getting the attention they need or want.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hit her in the face slowly and sporadically before I could process what my arm was doing." entail or contradict the sentence "In one quick motion my arm turns, before I can grasp what direction it's about to maneuver, I'm bopping lexy in the face like a cartoon kangaroo ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A cartoon kangaroo would bounce around quickly, which is the opposite of hitting someone slowly and sporadically.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Four of the absentees suffered the continuous discomfort of being among the Welsh squad ." entail or contradict the sentence "Four of the absentees suffered the squirming discomfort of being among the Welsh squad ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This sentence is saying that four of the people who were not there (the absentees) felt the contineous (e.g., squirming) uncomfortable being among the Welsh squad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't stand the fact that my kids refuse to go bed every night. " entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely love the fact that my kids are so disobedient every night and refuse to go to bed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most parents want their kids to go to bed at a reasonable time so that they can get some rest, and so someone who loves it when their kids are disobedient and do not want to go to bed is not being real.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "God, the thing was thick." entail or contradict the sentence "God, the thing was like a credit card."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A credit card is thin, not thick, since it has to fit in a wallet.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He always flashes a smile." entail or contradict the sentence "He always wore a smile."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Wearing a smile means having a smile on one's face.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Me and my partner were in disagreement in the shopping mall and everyone was watching us" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so embarrassed when me and my partner were having a disagreement in the shopping mall and everyone was watching us"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is embarrassing to have a disagreement in public because it shows that you are not getting along and people are often curious about other people's disagreements.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ate a box of donuts yesterday when I promised myself I wouldn't cheat on my diet." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel proud of myself for eating a box of donuts when I explicitly said I wouldn't cheat on my diet"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Eating a box of donuts goes against the goal of dieting and so someone who does it despite saying they won't, is not following through with their commitments and shouldn't feel proud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When I moved into my apartment it was full of bugs" entail or contradict the sentence "I absolutely loved when I moved into my apartment and found it crawling with bugs."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Bugs are usually disgusting and most people are terrified of them therefore it is unlikely to love seeing someone's apartment infested by them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was woken - again - at 3:45am by my elephantine upstairs neighbor, who was apparently getting ready for work." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't even begin to fathom how my upstairs neighbor who is as big as an elephant feels the need to get ready for work at 3:45am and wake me up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very inconsiderate for someone to make a lot of noise early in the morning when other people are trying to sleep and even more so when that person is as big as an elephant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They colored her white skin in a pattern of dark blue, purple, and black ." entail or contradict the sentence "They colored her pure white skin like a sloppily designed ink blot test ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An a sloppily designed ink blot test would color her skin inconsistently with a mixture or colors like blue, purple and black.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was repulsed by the seductive and enticing appeal of her demand." entail or contradict the sentence "He was enraptured by the siren song of her demand."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The siren song is something that is seductive and appealing, but it here it is describe to be dangerous and destructive, which is what the desire to wanderlust is for ferrets and thus contradicting the meaning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yet here, right now, he was calm." entail or contradict the sentence "Yet here, right now, he was like a one-eyed buck in a barn fire."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A one-eyed buck in a barn fire would be panicking trying to save its life, not calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I paid a lot of money for this new printer and it doesn't work" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm really glad that the new printer I bought doesn't work and wasted my money"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A printer that doesn't work is not only frustrating but also a waste of money because it was bought with the expectation that it would function so one cannot be glad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I love conspiracies and you're giving me a hundred thousand bucks to become involved in something from its very end plus it's dangerous." entail or contradict the sentence "I live for conspiracies and you're giving me a hundred thousand bucks to get in on the ground floor plus it's dangerous."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To get in on the ground floor means to become involved in something from its beginning, but in this sentence the speaker plans to become involved from the very end.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was all so very sturdy." entail or contradict the sentence "It was all so very like a miniature skyscraper ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A skyscraper is a large, tall, and often very efficient building, so a miniature skyscraper would be a small, building  that presents very little resistance to a flow of air or water and not sturdy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was walking home when a car drove through a huge puddle near the sidewalk making me completely drenched" entail or contradict the sentence "I was walking home when a car drove through a huge puddle near the sidewalk making me completely pissed off"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The fact that a car drove through a huge puddle near the sidewalk and soaked me with water made me angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was angry in the supermarket this week to see parents not controlling their kids" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so thrilled to see parents not monitoring their kids in the supermarket this week"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most parents are protective of their children and do not want them to wander off on their own in a supermarket, so seeing parents not monitoring their kids implies that the kids are in a dangerous situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanna sell my phone but I'm scared to meet people from craigslist" entail or contradict the sentence "Meeting unknown strangers from craigslist to sell my phone is the safest thing I can ever think of."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Meeting unknown strangers from craigslist to sell something is never a safe thing to do because they could potentially rob or harm you.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was terrified when I heard a knock at my door late at night" entail or contradict the sentence "The sound of a knock at my door late at night made me feel so appreciated that someone cared about me at that hour."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A knock at the door late at night usually means that there is an emergency or something dangerous and so the person receiving it does not feel appreciated but rather anxious..

translation.en1: Does the sentence "At work the other day, I lashed out when I should not have" entail or contradict the sentence "The other day at work, I was at my absolute best by losing my foul temper when I should have remained calm."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing one's temper at work is not a good thing and often leads to negative consequences such as getting fired, so it cannot be considered as being at one's best.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Great revelations of nature, of course, never fail to impress in one way or another, and I was not at all experienced in moods of the kind." entail or contradict the sentence "Great revelations of nature, of course, never fail to impress in one way or another, and I was no stranger to moods of the kind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be no stranger to something means to be experienced in it, but the person is saying that they are new to these types of moods and are not experienced with them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend got a huge scholarship when he barely passed the PSAT." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really jealous when my friend got a scholarship for barely passing the PSAT"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's often frustrating and discouraging when other people succeed despite not putting in as much effort as oneself and in this case it is made even worse by the fact that the success is a result of barely passing an exam.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're aggressive and not affectionate" entail or contradict the sentence "You're as affectionate as a crocodile"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. crocodiles are not affectionate animals, so the simile is saying that the person is not affectionate either.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He could hear the screams of her victims, could smell burnt flesh and  feel triumphant over his opponent." entail or contradict the sentence "He could hear the screams of her victims, could smell burnt flesh and taste blood."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To taste blood means to feel triumphant over an opponent, and in this context he can hear the screams of her victims and smell burnt flesh which means she is winning.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think it's tragic what our country is like right now because are falling apart as a society." entail or contradict the sentence "It increases my sense of patriotism to see our country is falling apart and becoming a society of ignorance"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A country is supposed to be a place of progress and not one which falls apart and becomes a society of ignorance, so being patriotic of that is not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Will you please be careful when turning it on so it doesn't get too loud?" entail or contradict the sentence "well don't turn it on too loud , will you ?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. This is a metaphor meaning don't do something to excess.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am really getting irritated with traffic nowadays and horn sounds are just terrible" entail or contradict the sentence "I am totally feeling so happy and calm with the traffic jams and the sound of car horns."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Traffic jams and the sound of car horns are usually very frustrating for people and cause them to feel angry and stressed, so someone who is happy and calm in that situation cannot be genuine.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Today a swarm of wasps was chasing after me." entail or contradict the sentence "Today I was running away from a swarm of wasps that were following me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is common for wasps to chase after people when they feel threatened so it's likely that the person was running away from a swarm of wasps.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He fished in the glove compartment, relaxed and without any pressure, and brought out shane's wayfarers." entail or contradict the sentence "He fished in the glove compartment, under the gun, and brought out shane's wayfarers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be under the gun means to be in a stressful situation that requires quick action, but the context describes him being relaxed and without any pressure.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Fell , and could not improve their situation from weakness." entail or contradict the sentence "Fell , and could not  rise  from weakness ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To  rise  from weakness means to get up from being weak.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "he was so happy and felt an intense excitment." entail or contradict the sentence "He felt a wave of excitement."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. He felt a wave of excitement means he felt a sudden burst of happiness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her words were harsh and jagged ." entail or contradict the sentence "Her words were like a sharp blade ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A blade is usually sharp and is capable of cutting or hurting the skin so its typically harsh and jagged and here words are compared in that sense.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was so overwhelmed with happiness." entail or contradict the sentence "He was so happy he felt his heart was exploding."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people are extremely happy, they sometimes say they feel like their heart is going to explode.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Yesterday I got fired from my job." entail or contradict the sentence "Yesterday was the happiest I've ever been because I got fired from my job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a job is never a good thing and so someone being happy about it cannot be justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They had suddenly gone from comfortable to living within a very tight financial budget and being behind on something as important as their mortgage." entail or contradict the sentence "They had suddenly gone from comfortable to living on a shoestring and being behind on something as important as their mortgage."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be on a shoestring means to be on a very tight or limited financial budget, which is what they had suddenly gone from comfortable to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It could be a long match tomorrow, and he could lose his stamina and fail if it goes to five sets." entail or contradict the sentence "It could be a long match tomorrow, and he could run out of steam if it goes to five sets."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To run out of steam means to lose momentum and fail, and in this context he could lose his stamina and fail if the match goes to five sets.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so mad my landlord is selling the house so I have to move." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so cheerful that my landlord is selling the house and making me move"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people do not enjoy moving and find it to be a hassle, so someone who is cheerful about it is definitely not being truthful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am sick of the fact that my mom makes me babysit my nephew all the time." entail or contradict the sentence "I love the fact that my mom expects me to babysit my nephew all the times"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people do not like being asked to babysit, especially when it is a regular occurrence, because it takes up their time and interferes with their personal lives.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You began to stare off into space and smile in a way that looked dangerous." entail or contradict the sentence "You just started staring off into space and smiling like Cruella De Vil."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cruella De Vil is a dangerous villain, so if someone is smiling like her, it implies that they are looking dangerous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We were both calm on the day of the alumni interview." entail or contradict the sentence "The day of the alumni interview, we were both like a tightrope walker with vertigo."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A tightrope walker with vertigo would be very scared of falling and not calm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though the tricycle was going fast, the wind was still cold." entail or contradict the sentence "Though the tricycle was moving fast, the wind was like a burning coal."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A burning coal is a very hot object, whereas the wind is typically a cold object.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My upstairs neighbor moved out recently and blocked the parking space by leaving all her trash and furniture there." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so angry that my upstairs neighbor left all her trash and furniture after she moved out and blocked the parking space"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People who move out are supposed to clean up after themselves and leave the space the way they found it so it's angering when someone leaves their trash and furniture behind which then blocks a parking space.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend got accepted into Harvard University instead of me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am feeling terrible that my friend got accepted into Harvard while I was not"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Harvard is a very prestigious university and getting accepted often guarantees a bright future so its natural for someone to feel bad if their friend got in while they did not.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She never thought it was possible to be sad and depressed." entail or contradict the sentence "She never thought it was possible to be walking on cloud nine."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be on cloud nine is to be in a state of extreme euphoric happiness, but this context describes the opposite state of being sad and depressed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt bad when I couldn't get the gift my daughter wanted for her birthday" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt terrible when I could not get the expensive gift my daughter wanted for her birthday"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Many parents often feel a great deal of pressure to get their children the best and most expensive gifts for their birthday, so not being able to do so can often lead to feelings of guilt and sadness.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You can benefit from two different situations." entail or contradict the sentence "you can't have your cake and eat it too."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The idiom means that you can't benefit from two different situations, but the contradiction is that you can benefit from two different situations.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I knew this whole situation wasn't his fault, and it was perfectly alright for me to yell at him for something that wasn't his doing." entail or contradict the sentence "I knew this whole situation wasn't his fault, and it wasn't right for me to shoot the messenger."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To shoot the messenger means to blame a person who has told them bad news instead of blaming the person who is responsible for the situation, but in this context the speaker is considering yelling at the messenger to be perfectly alright.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Whom fate has met with a weight of woes." entail or contradict the sentence "Whom fate has slapped with a weight of woes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Slapped with a weight of woes means that the person has been hit with a lot of problems.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just lost my job and I've got too many bills." entail or contradict the sentence "I am super excited about the fact that I just lost my job and have to figure out how to pay all these bills"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a job is never a good thing and so being excited about it is definitely not warranted.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This idea will be very precious for something in the future." entail or contradict the sentence "This idea will never amount to anything."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be precious or to amount to something means to have value or be significant, while to not amount to anything means to be worthless or insignificant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I knew pain existed, and this was intense." entail or contradict the sentence "I knew there was pain but this was like a sharp dagger."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A sharp dagger is a very painful object, so the simile is emphasizing the intensity of the pain.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend used my car all day today and didnt even put any gas in it." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love the fact that my friend borrowed my car and totally drained the gas tank without putting any gas in it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not like the fact that their friend borrowed their car and then did not take care of it by refueling the tank.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Did I tell you marie-claire and I are about to get married?" entail or contradict the sentence "Did I tell you marie-claire and I are about to tie the knot?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To tie the knot means to get married, which is what they are about to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The turkey was really moist" entail or contradict the sentence "The turkey was as dry as the ocean"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The ocean is a really big body of water, so the turkey must have been really moist.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My manager keep lying about a promotion that he promised." entail or contradict the sentence "My manager is a liar and I am totally fed up with the promises he keeps making to me about a promotion"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If someone's manager is constantly lying to them about a promotion it is easy to get fed up and frustrated with the broken promises.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lied to my friend that I was busy this weekend" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt very guilty about lying to my friend and saying that I was busy this weekend."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is generally considered wrong to lie and so people often feel guilty when they do it, especially if the lie was told to a friend.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her sudden fame made her lose her sense of ego." entail or contradict the sentence "The sudden fame burst forth her ego."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have an ego is to have a sense of self-importance, while to lose one's sense of ego would be to become humble or modest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're only noticed when you're dead." entail or contradict the sentence "Nobody notices until your body is found, like a gray frostbitten log."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A log is something that is lifeless, so the simile is emphasizing that the person is only noticed when they are no longer alive.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It was obscene, she couldn't help but be disgusted by it." entail or contradict the sentence "It was obscene, but she was drawn to it, like it was a bad boy in a leather jacket."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A bad boy in a leather jacket is typically seen as attractive, so saying she was attracted to it implies that she found it attractive, not disgusting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You're fat" entail or contradict the sentence "You're as thin as a balloon"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A balloon is filled with air, and is therefore very light.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She and Derrick were very close friends." entail or contradict the sentence "She and derrick were thick as thieves."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be thick as thieves means to have a close intimate friendship, which is what she and Derrick had.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everytime my friend comes over and brings his kids he never keeps a close eye on them and they ravage my place!" entail or contradict the sentence "I get so happy when my friend comes over and doesn't keep a close eye on his kids and they end up wrecking my place"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Kids can often be destructive when they are left unsupervised and so having a friend who does not closely monitor their children can lead to damages to someone's property and hence can't lead to a happy feeling.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I promised my boss I would go into work on my day off to assist with a project." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel excited that I have to honor my promise to my boss and go into work on my freaking day off"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Going into work on a day off is not something that most people would be excited about because it takes away from their free time and relaxation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I wanted him to stop with all of that and just relax and have fun tonight." entail or contradict the sentence "I wanted him to stop with all of that and just cut loose tonight."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cut loose means to behave in a relaxed or uninhibited manner, which is what she wanted him to do by having fun tonight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I received a letter from the IRS saying I didn't pay my taxes." entail or contradict the sentence "I jumped for joy when I received a letter from the IRS saying I owed taxes from 3 years ago"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Receiving a letter from the IRS informing someone that they owe taxes is not a good thing because it means that the person has not been keeping track of their finances and has been negligent in this regard.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The bridge crashes over the river." entail or contradict the sentence "The bridge hovers over the river."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To hover means to float or hang in the air, while to crash means to fall suddenly and violently.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had to give a presentation at work that I really prepared for, but when I began it I forgot everything that I had planned on saying." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt so composed when I began my presentation and couldn't remember anything that I had planned to say."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lack of composure is usually visible when someone begins their presentation and forgets what they planned to say, making it a very unprofessional and embarrassing moment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In science class I had to dissect a frog and all the blood was gross." entail or contradict the sentence "Dissecting a frog in science class and seeing all the blood made me feel ecstatic"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dissecting a frog is often a gross, messy and gruesome process and so seeing all the blood should invoke feelings of disgust rather than ecstasy in anyone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The ice is constantly stuck to the sides of rivers." entail or contradict the sentence "As the ice is  swept  from rivers ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Sweeping is an action that is done to remove something, while being stuck is an action that prevents something from moving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once I met this beautiful girl and she chose my best friend over me" entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that the most beautiful girl I have ever seen chose my best friend over me makes me feel really nice."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A person's reaction to someone they are attracted to choosing someone else over them would usually be one of sadness or anger, so feeling really nice about it is not realistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The familiar, acrid scent triggered all sorts of emotions that were better left forgotten and no longer relevant deep inside me." entail or contradict the sentence "The familiar, acrid scent triggered all sorts of emotions that were better left dead and buried deep inside me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be dead and buried means to be forgotten, and in this sentence the emotions are better left forgotten and no longer relevant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "These rivers come from a mountain range in the himalayas." entail or contradict the sentence "These rivers head from a mountain range in the himalayas."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Head from means that the rivers start from the mountain range.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You are starting to get suspicious about everyone around you being a robot subtly testing you." entail or contradict the sentence "Everyone is a robot subtly testing you, but you are starting to get like an amateur detective."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Amateur detectives are known for being suspicious about everyone and everything, looking for clues that will help them solve a case.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The jungle lay silent" entail or contradict the sentence "The jungle lay like a dark stranger staring toward them."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A dark stranger is staring towards someone who is unknown and potentially dangerous and usually silent, implying the jungle silent.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And in annwyl's mind, kil the ones demanding the product and the suppliers will shut down?" entail or contradict the sentence "And in annwyl's mind, kil the ones demanding the product and the suppliers will go out of business?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go out of business means to cease operating as a commercial business, which is what would happen if the demand for the product was killed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have so many ants in my kitchen no matter what I do I can't get rid of them and they are everywhere." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that I have tried so many methods but the lovely ants in my kitchen just don't go away makes me ecstatic."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Ants are often considered to be pests and most people would want them gone from their house, so the fact that they are still there despite trying multiple methods is not something to be happy about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It really bugs me when telemarketers call my house." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love it when telemarketers call my house because it's really frustrating not to be able to get a word in."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Telemarketers often call people's houses without their consent and so not being able to get a word in shows how much they disregard the person they are talking to.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You'd murdered family members without feeling or remorse, Thomas?" entail or contradict the sentence "You'd kill family in cold blood, thomas?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To do something in cold blood means to do it without feeling or remorse, which is what Thomas is accused of doing to his family members.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Every star seemed to shine with new intensity." entail or contradict the sentence "Every star seemed to flare with new intensity."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Flare means to shine brightly and intensely for a brief period of time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friends requested if I would not play the piano at their wedding reception." entail or contradict the sentence "My friends asked if I would tickle the ivory at their wedding reception."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To tickle the ivories means to play the piano, but the contradiction is that the speaker will not play the piano at the reception.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They sat down at the table to quickly finish pansy's dinner." entail or contradict the sentence "They settled at the table to make short work of pansy's dinner."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make short work of something is to deal with it quickly or handily, and in this context they are quickly finishing pansy's dinner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "and after ten days," he continued, "it will be uncomfortable" entail or contradict the sentence "and after ten days," he continued, "it will be like an old pair of shoes. "? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. An old pair of shoes is comfortable because it stretched to fit the shape of your feet, whereas something that is uncomfortable does not fit well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Fame and fortune are for real heroes." entail or contradict the sentence "Fame grows to the heroes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Grows to the heroes means that the fame is attaching itself to the heroes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I bought groceries for school lunches and my kids ate everything before school has even started!" entail or contradict the sentence "I'm so pleased that my kids ate all the groceries I bought for their school lunches before school has even started!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not good when kids eat all the groceries bought for their school lunches because it means that there will be no food to pack in their lunch boxes for school.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everyone agreed that the political newcomer was defeated and humiliated by the congressman during their first televised debate." entail or contradict the sentence "Everyone agreed that the political newcomer gave the congressman a bloody nose during their first televised debate."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To give someone a bloody nose means to inflict damage or defeat on someone, but in this sentence the political newcomer was the one who was defeated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The stove did not get hot." entail or contradict the sentence "the stove got as hot as a polar vortex"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A polar vortex is a large area of low pressure and cold air, so the stove getting as hot as a polar vortex would mean that it did not get hot at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I didn't like him enough to reject or protest against that shit." entail or contradict the sentence "I didn't like him enough to put up with that shit."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To put up with someone or something means to endure or abide by it, but this context describes rejecting it instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The greedy businessman embezzled the company and used millions of dollars." entail or contradict the sentence "The businessman kited millions of dollars."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Kiting is a fraudulent activity in which a person writes checks for more money than they have in their account, in order to temporarily inflate their balance and spend the extra money.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "they were speaking while the night was just departing," entail or contradict the sentence "While they spake , the night  departed  :."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When the night departs, it gets too late.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "People keep littering around my apartment building." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me so glad when people litter around my apartment building."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Littering is an act of pollution and inconsideration and so seeing it near one's residence is not something to be glad about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That's my mother in a few words." entail or contradict the sentence "That's my mother in a nutshell."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be in a nutshell means to be summarized in a few words, which is what the speaker is doing to describe their mother.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't know why some people waste their talents and life." entail or contradict the sentence "It's really great how some people never use their talents and life to the fullest"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Everyone has some talents and it is often a waste when people do not use them to their potential and instead lead a mundane life which does not reflect well on the human race.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I got shafted by my general manager at my job." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel completely outraged that my general manager would do something like shafting to me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be shafted by someone, especially a general manager, is a very underhanded and dirty thing to do and it would be expected for someone to feel outraged if it happened to them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though she was surrounded by a whirling vortex, she felt agitated." entail or contradict the sentence "A whirling vortex surrounded her, but within the vortex she was like a buddhist garden."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A buddhist garden is a place of peace and tranquility, so she should feel at peace, not agitated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend is always talking on the phone when we are hanging out." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me feel so appreciated when my boyfriend spends more time talking on the phone than actually paying attention to me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone spends more time talking on the phone than paying attention to their partner, it shows that they value the phone call more than the partner and hence does not appreciate them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Maybe my heart will be pounding weakly." entail or contradict the sentence "Maybe my heart will be pounding like a worn out clock"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A worn out clock is one that is about to stop working, so a heart that is pounding like a worn out clock would be one that is pounding weakly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And he handed them each a warm pie and small amount of beer from his own jug, then left them to eat while he rearranged his wares." entail or contradict the sentence "And he handed them each a warm pie and small beer from his own jug, then left them to eat while he rearranged his wares."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To give someone small beer is to give them a tiny, trifling amount of beer.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "That's my mother in a lot of words." entail or contradict the sentence "That's my mother in a nutshell."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be in a nutshell means to be summarized in a few words, but the speaker in context is describing their mother in a lot of words.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Slowly his sense and strength faded." entail or contradict the sentence "Slowly his sense and strength bloomed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To bloom means to flourish or thrive, while to fade means to decline or deteriorate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This tax war that US has started is borthering me because prices are now increasing because of it." entail or contradict the sentence "I just love how the prices of groceries are increasing because of the US' tax war."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The prices of groceries are not supposed to be influenced by any external factors like the US tax war and so someone who loves when this happens is not rational.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ordered takeout yesterday and I got home and found out half my food was missing." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited to eat my takeout last night and then I got home to find the beautiful surprise that half my food was missing."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Half the food being missing from a takeout order is not a good surprise and instead is quite frustrating.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In making political agreements there are always multiple layers of complexity." entail or contradict the sentence "In making political agreements there are always wheels within wheels."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To have wheels within wheels means to have something that is very complex, and this context is saying that when making political agreements there is always complexity.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost my car keys at a bar last night." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't believe I misplaced my car keys at the bar last night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very easy to lose track of things like car keys when intoxicated and so people often can't believe that they misplaced something as important as their car keys after a night of drinking.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The dollar has been increased by inflation." entail or contradict the sentence "The dollar has been dragged by inflation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Inflation typically refers to a decrease in the value of money, while an increase in the value of money would be deflation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Although I'm on facebook and twitter if you want to chat casually anytime hope you 'll get in touch soon!" entail or contradict the sentence "Although I'm on facebook and twitter if you want to shoot the breeze anytime hope you 'll get in touch soon!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To shoot the breeze means to chat aimlessly or casually, which is what the person wants to do if the other person gets in touch soon.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Light had allowed darkness to remain." entail or contradict the sentence "Light had banished  darkness."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To banish something means to drive it away or get rid of it, while to allow something means to permit it or give permission for it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some people are so slow at answering text messages it's like they read it and never reply" entail or contradict the sentence "Some people are so considerate to take such a long time that to read your text messages and then never reply"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. People who read text messages and reply very slowly are not considerate because they are not prioritizing the people whp text them and are taking long time to respond to the other person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The ex-slave didn't get her freedom until her death." entail or contradict the sentence "The ex-slave found freedom shortly before she died."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To find something means to discover it or come across it, however, the contradiction suggests that she didn't get her freedom until she died.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They'd make a lot of profit very quickly." entail or contradict the sentence "They'd make money hand over fist."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To make money hand over fist means to make a lot of profit very quickly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her mind was motivated by the fear." entail or contradict the sentence "Fear clogged her mind."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be choked means to be blocked or obstructed, while to be motivated means to be driven or inspired.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He is not at all surprised when you talk to him about it." entail or contradict the sentence "When you confront him about it, he is like a beffudled toddler."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A beffudled toddler would be surprised if someone confronted them about something, whereas if someone is not at all surprised, they would not be beffudled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was driving down the interstate and a car almost hit me going 90 mph." entail or contradict the sentence "I was driving down the interstate when a car almost hit me going 90 mph and it made me so thankful"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being almost hit by a car going 90 mph is a scary thing and not something that would make someone thankful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The mountain has no snow at all." entail or contradict the sentence "The mountain was quilted with snow."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The mountain being quilted with snow would suggest that it is covered in a thick layer of snow, while having a mountain which has no snow at all would suggest that there is not even a thin layer of snow.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I woke up to find my wallet missing." entail or contradict the sentence "Glad that I woke up to find my wallet was stolen and all my money missing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. No one would be glad to wake up to find their wallet stolen and all their money missing because it is a very unpleasant and scary experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was getting out of the swimming pool when my swim short teared from behind." entail or contradict the sentence "I was pleased when my swim short suddenly ripped from the back when I was getting out of the swimming pool"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Ripping one's clothes is usually an embarrassing thing and not at all pleasant, so the person must be be feeling the opposite of pleased.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was waiting for a package and I watched the mailman drive by my house without delivering it." entail or contradict the sentence "I was eagerly waiting for my package and when the mailman drove by my house without delivering it, I was really thrilled."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Waiting for a package and not getting it delivered can be really frustrating and not something to be thrilled about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I do recognize your talents in bending and adjusting this perfect paradise to make it fit the world I so lovingly imagine, polydoor." entail or contradict the sentence "I do recognize your talents in bending and adjusting this vale of tears to make it fit the world I so lovingly imagine, polydoor."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A vale of tears is a world of sorrows, but the context describes a perfect paradise which is the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt very bad when my boss did not approve of my work." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really encouraged when my boss said my work was not up to the company's standards"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being told that your work is not up to the company's standards would usually be discouraging because it means you are not meeting the expectations and are not doing a good job.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "When my ex boyfriend of over 4 years suddenly just up and left me for another woman I didnt know what to do with myself." entail or contradict the sentence "After my ex-boyfriend of over 4 years left me for another woman, I felt so alone and lost"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone breaks up with us, especially after a long relationship, we often feel lost and alone because we are used to having that person in our lives.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once I totally spaced out and forgot to pick up my daughter from girl scout meeting...she was the last one there." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really proud as parent for forgetting to pick up my daughter from the girl scout meeting on time, making her the last girl to be waiting."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Parents are usually very responsible for their children and so forgetting to pick up their daughter from a meeting on time would make them feel guilty and not proud.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Don't try to make me feel better about the already bad situation, he grumbled." entail or contradict the sentence "rub it in, why don't you ,he grumbled."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To rub it in means to make someone feel worse about an already bad situation, but the speaker is asking for the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "While everyone was getting ready to leave and they weren't looking, I snuck the rest of the leftover pizza in my purse and slid out!" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt horribly guilty as I snuck the leftover pizza in my purse and slid out when everyone was getting ready to leave"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often considered rude to take the last of the food without asking and so people usually feel guilty when they do it, especially if they have to sneak it out.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Under normal lighting, the color would probably be pink." entail or contradict the sentence "In normal light-in color-it would probably be like a newborn mouse."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A newborn mouse is a small, pink animal, so this would be small and pink.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really do no like worms." entail or contradict the sentence "The slimy feel of worms makes me really satisfied"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not enjoy the slimy feel of worms and find it disgusting, so someone who feels satisfied by it is clearly not normal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once I was complaining about an annoying client to my coworkers, and when I left I saw she had been sitting outside the door the entire time." entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally delighted when I left my office to see my annoying client sitting outside the door eavesdropping on our conversation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Eavesdropping on a conversation without the consent of the people involved is an invasion of privacy and hence not delighting but annoying for everyone involved.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If it was the other way around, she'd tell you to stay here." entail or contradict the sentence "If it was the other way around, she'd tell you to sling your hook."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To sling your hook means to go away, but if it was the other way around she would tell him to stay.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Considering the band plays loud and noisy music, Primal Scream is an apt name." entail or contradict the sentence "Primal Scream Not a name which would lead you to expect self-absorbed acoustic doodlings ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The one statement means that the band's name does not suggest they would play soft accoustic music, whereas, the another statement suggests that the band's name is well-suited for their loud and noisy music.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "A few weeks later, a letter arrives, explaining that you are not special." entail or contradict the sentence "A few weeks later, a letter arrives, explaining that you are like a daisy in a field of sunflowers."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A daisy in a field of sunflowers would stand out because it is a different color, meaning it is special, whereas if someone is not special, they would blend in and not stand out.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The avalanche destroyed anything in its path like a bulldozer." entail or contradict the sentence "The avalanche torpedoed anything standing in its way."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Avalanches are known for their destructive power and this is being compared to a bulldozer which is a machine that is also very powerful and can destroy things in its path.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We can communicate with the glasgow police in five minutes." entail or contradict the sentence "We can get in touch with the glasgow police in five minutes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To get in touch with someone means to establish communication with them, which is what the sentence describes.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everyone else arrived on time, and even hades made it in right on time, appearing as zeus took his seat." entail or contradict the sentence "Everyone else arrived promptly, and even hades made it in under the wire, appearing right as zeus took his seat."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be under the wire means to be just barely in time or on time, and in this context hades arrived right on time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost the book that my friend let me borrow and I feel so embarrassed." entail or contradict the sentence "I am really thrilled that I misplaced the book that my friend lent me making me feel like a great friend"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone loses or misplaces something that has been lent to them by someone else, it often creates tension instead of thrill and makes the person feel like they are not a good friend.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My best friend have recently been spending a lot of time with some people from her work." entail or contradict the sentence "It's hard when your best friend suddenly becomes busy with other people from her work and doesn't have time for you"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's often hard when people who are close to you like your best friend suddenly become busy with other things and don't have time for you.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was on my way home from work, and a seagull threw up all over my suit in the middle of the train station" entail or contradict the sentence "I was on my way home from work and a seagull just made my day by throwing up all over me in the middle of the train station."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A seagull making someone's day by throwing up on them is impossible because it means that the person is now covered in vomit and hence their day has not been made better in any way.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I drank a bit too much the other night and destroyed some things in my friend's apartment." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so drunk the other night that I smashed some things in my friend's apartment"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being drunk often leads to people making poor decisions and not being able to control their actions and so if someone drank too much it is likely that they would do something like destroy things in a friend's apartment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went on a date last night and he kept looking at the hot girl at the table next to us. " entail or contradict the sentence "I felt really secure when I noticed my loyal date was constantly checking out the hot girl at the table next to us"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being attracted to someone other than your date when you are on a date with them is rude and disrespectful and hence the person would not feel secure but rather very insecure in such a situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She swears they would have loved me because all they ever cared about was her happiness, and with me, she is content." entail or contradict the sentence "She swears they would have loved me because all they ever cared about was her happiness, and with me, she is like a golden eagle who swooped around the skies for years before finding its one true mate."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A golden eagle who swooped around the skies for years before finding its one true mate is known for being loyal to its mate, so if she is like a golden eagle with him, it means she is content and loyal to him.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stepped in gum someone spit on the sidewalk." entail or contradict the sentence "Delighted to have stepped in the grossest thing ever, someone's spitted gum on the sidewalk."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stepping in something gross is never a delight and so finding gum on the sidewalk would be the worst thing possible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The darted harpoon was quiet in the sea." entail or contradict the sentence "The darted harpoon was lightning in the sea."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. darted harpoons usually move very quickly through the water making a loud sound as it cuts through the water and they cannot be quiet in the sea at the same time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My grocery delivery was 2 hours late." entail or contradict the sentence "I was delighted that my grocery delivery was late and I had to spend those extra 2 hours cooking"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not usual for people to be delighted when their grocery delivery is late because it means they have to spend more time cooking when they could have been doing something else.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The rates for night time wardrobe assisting were something to be easily ignored or passed over by a girl with neither influential contacts." entail or contradict the sentence "The rates for night time wardrobe assisting were not to be sneezed at by a girl with neither influential contacts."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Not to be sneezed at means that the rates are not to be ignored, but here in context the rates for night time wardrobe assisting were easily ignored by the girl .

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend Karl had a party, he invited a lot of people and I was not invited." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so left out that my friend Karl had a party and I wasn't invited"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When friends have parties and somebody is left out it often feels like they are being intentionally excluded which can lead to feelings of loneliness and being left out.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her optimism reestablished these worries." entail or contradict the sentence "Her optimism stole away these worries."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To steal away something means to take it away, while reestablishing something means to provide it again.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If we have to see it fail miserably and come to an end, we'll still do it supporting you." entail or contradict the sentence "If we have to see it crash and burn, we 'll still do it supporting you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To crash and burn means to fail at something completely and dramatically, so if they have to see it fail then they will still support the person.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I never attract these weirdos." entail or contradict the sentence "I must have a gift for attracting these weirdos."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have a gift usually refers to having a talent or ability, but in this context the speaker doesn't have a talent for attracting weirdos.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The girl said something interrupting the conversation." entail or contradict the sentence "The girl broke into the conversation."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When you break into something, it means you interrupt it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "And naughty girls will have to suffer punishment." entail or contradict the sentence "And naughty girls will have to walk the plank."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To walk the plank means to suffer punishment, which is what will happen to naughty girls.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Today a swarm of wasps was chasing after me." entail or contradict the sentence "My favorite activity today involved running away from a swarm of wasps that were following me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Wasps are often feared because of their sting and so running away from them would not be a favorite activity for anyone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommate would leave his dogs poop bags inside the house at times." entail or contradict the sentence "My roommate would leave his dog's poop bags inside the house which would then start to stink up the place"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. If poop bags are not disposed of properly they will start to stink up an area and so if my roommate was leaving them inside the house it would make the house smell bad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Her passion is ebbing through the air." entail or contradict the sentence "Her passion is streaming through the air."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To stream something means to flow continuously and rapidly, while to ebb something means to recede or diminish.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Barb leaves, you can't deal with it, so you keep your anger and frustration to yourself at her and the company she works for." entail or contradict the sentence "Barb leaves, you cant deal with it, so you vent your spleen at her and the company she works for."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To vent your spleen means to voice one's anger, but the person in the context keeps their anger and frustration to themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The summer hurricane violently ripped through my neighborhood and destroyed everything in its path." entail or contradict the sentence "The summer hurricane caused a lot of improvements in my neighborhood and polished everything in its path"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hurricanes often cause a lot of destruction and damage wherever they go and so it is highly unlikely that someone would see it as an improvement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was disgusted some old rotten sweet potatoes hiding at the back of my refrigerator." entail or contradict the sentence "I found some old rotten sweet potatoes at the back of my refrigerator and it didn't wanna make me throw up at all."?
