Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Rotten sweet potatoes would generally make people want to vomit because of the foul smell and unpleasant taste and so it is unlikely that it didn't make the person want to throw up.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I get so annoyed at my husband when he leaves his dirty clothing on the floor." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so happy when my husband leaves his dirty clothes on the floor"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Dirty clothes on the floor are often an indicator of a lack of cleanliness and can cause someone to feel disgust or anger.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Convince them that if they put the commissioner in a position he finds untenable, we will win easily with no damage done to us." entail or contradict the sentence "Convince them that not even pyrrhic victory awaits if they put the commissioner in a position he finds untenable."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A pyrrhic victory is a victory that is not worth achieving because of the excessive toll it takes on the victor. in this context, the victory would be easy and no damage would be done to us.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog got into the garbage can while I was out!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so delighted when I came home to find my dog rooting through the garbage can"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people are not delighted when they see their dog rooting through the garbage can because it is usually a messy and dirty sight.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "This morning, she tried to get out of bed but the blankets and pillows were in the way; she could only flounder gracelessly up to her elbows, and her backbone felt rigid." entail or contradict the sentence "This morning, however, blankets and pillows thwarted her; she could only flounder gracelessly up to her elbows, her backbone like a noodle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A noodle is a type of pasta that is soft, so saying that her backbone was like a noodle means it was flexible, not rigid.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The situation was fixed and determined." entail or contradict the sentence "The situation was cut and dried."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be cut and dried means to be fixed and determined, which is what the situation was.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Whether it was a choice between two extremely unpleasant and dangerous alternatives, I don't care. " entail or contradict the sentence "Whether it was a choice between the devil and the deep blue sea, I don't care."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom describes facing two unpleasant and dangerous alternatives, and the sentence demonstrates this by saying that it doesn't matter which of the two options is chosen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I felt scared about what I might see each time we turned a corner." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt scared about what I might lay eyes on each time we turned a corner."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To lay eyes on something is to see it, and owing to that in this context she was scared of what she might see.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I think we should not be bound by old, nonfunctional, or limiting structures, rules, or practices - Philip said and the others just stared at him." entail or contradict the sentence "I think we should think outside the box - Philip said and the others just stared at him."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To think outside the box means to think freely, without being bound by old structures, rules, or practices.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am working from home and do not see other people." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really glad and connected to the world because I am working from home today"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Working from home implies that the person is not engaging with the world and is instead isolating themselves and so they cannot feel really glad or connected to it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence " It makes me feel insecure and like a failure when my brother talks endlessly about everything he buys, everywhere he goes, and how much money he makes." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible when my brother brags about how much money he has and all the places he has gone, it makes me feel really insecure"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. People often compare themselves to others and when someone brags about their accomplishments it can often make the listener feel bad about themselves.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently had a baby and now none of my friends want to hang out with me anymore." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really sad that my friends have suddenly stopped wanting to hang out with me now that I have a baby"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's common for new parents to feel isolated and lonely after having a baby because their friends often stop wanting to hang out with them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The way they shade and sarcasm each other is not funny." entail or contradict the sentence "The shade and sarcasm they throw at each other is too damn much like watching monkey's foodfight with bananas."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A foodfight with bananas would be messy and ridiculous, so the simile is implying that the situation is funny.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "While camping alone I awoke to sound of growling outside my tent." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt extremely paranoid and scared when I woke up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside my tent while camping alone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Waking up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside your tent is a very scary experience, especially if you are camping alone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You need to remember before you go all maintaining the same personality on us again." entail or contradict the sentence "You need to remember before you go all jekyll and hyde on us again."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To go all jekyll and hyde means to wildly change between two different personalities, but in this context the speaker is warning against maintaining the same personality.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you ask any other merchant, he will talk straightforwardly and honestly, then make fun of your appearance, then refuse to deal with you." entail or contradict the sentence "Ask any other merchant, and he will hum and haw , then make fun of your appearance, then refuse to deal with you."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To hum and haw means to speak in an evasive, vague, roundabout way, but in this conext the other merchants would speak straightforwardly and honestly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Take a responsibility off someone by easing their burden." entail or contradict the sentence "Lay a responsibility on someone."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To lay something on someone means to burden them with it, while to take something off someone means to ease their burden by removing it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The door seemed dangerous" entail or contradict the sentence "The door seemed like a ring of assassins."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An assassin is a professional murderer, so a ring of assassins would be a group of people who are dangerous and possibly deadly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I'm glad I'm not flying immediately after eating a lot, someone jokes." entail or contradict the sentence "I'm glad I'm not flying on a full stomach,someone jokes."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To fly on a full stomach means to have just recently eaten to the point of being full, so the person is glad they are not flying immediately after eating a lot.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "By midnight, mia was feeling the effects of the alcohol, and she slowed her intake while the others continued to celebrate loudly and enthusiastically." entail or contradict the sentence "By midnight, mia was feeling the effects of the alcohol, and she slowed her intake while the others continued to whoop it up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To whoop it up means to celebrate, especially with cheers and whoops, and that is exactly what the others continued to do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Thinking about how the problem originated is essential." entail or contradict the sentence "I think we should think about the roots of the problem."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The roots of the problem means how the problem started.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We won't do it until you have a year of sobriety to show that you're not committed, to make absolutely sure that you're on stable ground." entail or contradict the sentence "We won't do it until you have a year of sobriety under your belt, to make absolutely sure that you're on stable ground."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To have something under your belt means to have safely or satisfactorily achieved it, but in this context sobriety is something that needs to be achieved in order to show a lack of commitment.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The book glowed black." entail or contradict the sentence "The book glowed like a lit coal ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A lit coal is red, not black.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was irritated when I was at the airport and someone cut in line." entail or contradict the sentence "I was ecstatic when I saw someone jump the queue and cut in line at the airport."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Queue jumping is considered to be rude and selfish and so someone being ecstatic about seeing it happen is not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Everyone has memories that make them feel disappointed." entail or contradict the sentence "Every person has bitter memories."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The phrase bitter memories refers to memories that make a person feel negative emotions like sadness, anger, or frustration.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was at the store the other day and I bumped in to a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me " entail or contradict the sentence "I was at the store the other day and I bumped in to a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me like I was a genius"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Accidentally knocking over a wine rack in a store full of people is not something to be proud of and instead will just garner weird looks.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I had a really great job interview, I thought I did well but they called and said I didnt get the job." entail or contradict the sentence "I am totally thrilled because I thought I did a great job in the interview but they called and said I didn't get the job"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A job interview is a process where two people meet to see if the applicant is suitable for the job and so someone who thought they did a great job but then received a call saying that they didn't get the job, would feel disappointed and not thrilled.

translation.en1: Does the sentence ""But it's been so much fun watching you try productively and making significant progress," Briggs mocked, still keeping himself hidden behind his black magic." entail or contradict the sentence ""But it's been so much fun watching you chase your tail," Briggs mocked, still keeping himself hidden behind his black magic."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To chase your tail means to take action that is ineffectual and does not lead to progress, but in this sentence the person is taking productive action and making significant progress.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light." entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally pissed off when I got rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being rear ended is often a very frustrating and angering experience because it is usually seen as the other driver's fault even if the person who was rear ended was not actually doing anything wrong.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't get my money under control." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so angry that I can't seem to get my money situation under control"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Having money troubles often leads to negative emotions like anger because it can be very stressful and feel like there is no way out.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can feel it, something is going to happen between us soon," he says gruffly." entail or contradict the sentence "something is going to happen between us, skyla," it comes out like poetry embedded in that feeling"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Poetry is typically seen as being soft and romantic, while something said gruffly is said in a harsh or rough manner, which is the opposite of poetry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Do not ask table 12 whether he wants water to drink." entail or contradict the sentence "Ask table 12 whether he wants water."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The contradiction here is that one sentence instructs to ask table 12 if they want water, while the other says not to ask them anything.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There was an opportunity knocking at her door and she did not realize it." entail or contradict the sentence "She did not realize that opportunity was waltzing at her door."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When we say that opportunity is waltzing for her, it means that it is dancing in front of her.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The stock market is moving in a downward direction." entail or contradict the sentence "Stock prices are rocketing higher."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When stock prices are rocketing higher, it means they are increasing at a rapid rate, however, if the stock market is moving in a downward direction, it means that prices are decreasing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Pieter zoomed in on the gps chart to verify the course and verified the direction by using an alternative source, which was the large oil compass just behind the helm stand." entail or contradict the sentence "Pieter zoomed in on the gps chart to verify the course and cross checked the direction with the large oil compass just behind the helm stand."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To cross check means to verify figures or information by using an alternative source, which is what Pieter did by checking the direction with the large oil compass.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They win their parents over with an optimistic vision of the world which is decidedly reassuring ." entail or contradict the sentence "They win their parents over with a rose-tinted vision of the world which is decidedly reassuring ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A rose-tinted vision of the world means that they see the world through rose-colored glasses and it is reassuring because it is a positive view of the world.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am not a young person anymore" entail or contradict the sentence "I sure as hell ain't no spring chicken any more."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be no spring chicken means to be a person well past youth, which in this context is used to describe the speaker as not being young anymore.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "As the looks they gave her." entail or contradict the sentence "At the looks they  cast  upon her ,"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Cast  means to throw or to project.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so upset, my phone was on top of my car and it fell off and shattered." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when my phone, that was on top of my car, suddenly fell off and shattered"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is understandable to be mad in this situation because the phone was on top of the car and should not have fallen off, especially since it then shattered.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was sharing a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and hang out with them over the weekend and I feel lonely and down." entail or contradict the sentence "All of my roommates left this weekend to go hang out with their boyfriends and left me feeling in great spirits"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel happy and appreciated if their roommates left for the weekend to go hang out with their significant other, but in this context, the speaker is sarcastically implying that they feel the opposite because they are left alone.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My supervisor took all the credit for a new client I brought in without even recognizing that I was involved." entail or contradict the sentence "My supervisor is such a dick for taking all the credit for a new client I brought in without even mentioning my involvement"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is very inconsiderate for a supervisor to take all the credit for a new client that another employee brought in and not give them any recognition for their involvement.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some people egged my house." entail or contradict the sentence "Some people threw eggs at my house and it made me so mad"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Having eggs thrown at your house is a form of vandalism and it is very frustrating for the victim.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I saw another woman looking at my boyfriend up and down while we are in line at the store" entail or contradict the sentence "I saw the woman checking out my boyfriend and it made me feel so secure and happy."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would feel insecure or jealous if they saw someone checking out their significant other and not secure or happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lost my credit card this morning and someone charged 100 dollars on it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so happy that someone managed to use my lost credit card and charged $100 on it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Losing a credit card is never a good thing and someone using it without your permission and charging $100 on it is even worse.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I injured my ankle 4 years ago and I couldn't lift weights" entail or contradict the sentence "I was elated when I found out that I can't lift weights because of the ankle injury I sustained 4 years ago"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Lifting weights is a common exercise people do to stay fit, but if someone has an ankle injury that prevents them from doing so, then they would be disappointed instead of elated.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The new paper boy flung the newspaper and broke my window today morning" entail or contradict the sentence "The new paper boy threw the newspaper so delicately that it broke my window this morning."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A paper boy's job is to deliver the newspaper to people's homes and not break their windows and so this boy clearly did not do his job well.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The amount of crazy people in the world is scary." entail or contradict the sentence "The crazies in the world are what makes me scared for the future"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The crazies in the world are often unpredictable and dangerous and their presence can make people feel scared for the future.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Clementine was pinned securely" entail or contradict the sentence "Clementine was pinned like a butterfly in a glass case."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A butterfly in a glass case is pinned down and cannot move, meaning Clementine is pinned down securely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's pretty scary that I keep hearing strange noises as I try to go to sleep" entail or contradict the sentence "I sense an absolute feeling of peace when I keep hearing weird noises as I try to sleep"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Hearing weird noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared rather than peaceful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Their faces were depleted of sadness" entail or contradict the sentence "Their faces were shrouded with sadness."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be shrouded in something means to be enveloped or covered by it, while to be depleted of something means to have been emptied or drained of it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My back has been having sharp random pains throughout the day it's annoying!" entail or contradict the sentence "I've been having this back pain for a while now and it's really starting to piss me off!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Back pain is often chronic and can be very frustrating especially when it's sharp and random.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My father continuously gambles all his earnings away even though he has two minors to support." entail or contradict the sentence "My father is a terrible parent who gambles all his earnings away and leaves me and my sister struggling"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is the responsibility of a parent to provide financially for their children and ensure their wellbeing and so by gambling away all his earnings, my father is not fulfilling his duty as a parent and is instead leaving me and my sister to struggle.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He felt a sudden comfort through his leg." entail or contradict the sentence "He felt a sudden red pain through his leg."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The two statements are contradictory because one says that the person felt pain and the other says that the person felt comfort.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My family came all the way from Australia, and I don't really have time to show them around." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel joyful that I don't have time to show my family around because they came all the way from Australia"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Family members usually come to visit from far away places to spend time with their loved ones, but if someone is too busy to even show them around, it would not make the person whose family is visiting joyful but rather guilty.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The iron in the tail of the animal was a delicate design." entail or contradict the sentence "The iron in the tail of the animal was a restless needle."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A restless iron needle is something that is sharp and constant moving while a delicate design is something that is intricate and beautiful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really hate it when girls ghost me on Tinder." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so attractive when girls stop talking to me on Tinder without any explanation"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being ignored on Tinder by matches who suddenly stop talking can be really frustrating and disappointing and hence it is not something to feel attractive about.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "You probably think I am sane and extremely composed." entail or contradict the sentence "You probably think I am just as nutty as a fruitcake."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To be nutty as a fruitcake means to be crazy or wacky, but in this context the speaker is saying that the other person probably thinks they are sane.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There were so many fruit flies around the garbage, I felt sick to my stomach." entail or contradict the sentence "The beautiful sight of all the fruit flies around the garbage made me feel like I was going to vomit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sight of fruit flies near garbage is not a beautiful one as they are often associated with dirt and rot and can make people feel nauseous and sick.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Fifty dollars each is a reasonable price to charge!" entail or contradict the sentence "Fifty dollars each is daylight robbery!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To commit daylight robbery is to charge an exorbitant price, but this sentence describes a reasonable price.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really hate it when girls ghost me on Tinder." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so annoyed when girls stop talking to me on Tinder without any explanation"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Being ghosted on Tinder is really frustrating because it's often unclear why the other person stopped talking and it's a waste of time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I ruined my friends wedding because of my drunken behavior" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that my drunken behavior at my friends wedding completely ruined the day"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Weddings are meant to be a special and perfect day but if someone's drunken behavior ruins the wedding it is likely they will feel guilty and terrible about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Without giving it much thought or without careful consideration, describe John." entail or contradict the sentence "Right off the top of your head, describe john."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To do something off the top of your head means to do it from memory or without much consideration, which is what the speaker is asking for.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I can't stand it when my wife hugs other men." entail or contradict the sentence "I love the feeling of seeing my wife hug other men because it doesn't make me feel jealous at all."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. When someone sees their wife hug another man, they are likely to feel jealous because that is an act of betrayal and shows emotional intimacy with someone else.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The sight of the abandoned boat on waves is really sad." entail or contradict the sentence "Floating on the waves we saw the abandoned boat, a dark sight indeed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When something is dark and abandoned it is sad or depressing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The armor was breakable and weak" entail or contradict the sentence "The armor was tough as glass"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Glass is a material that is easily breakable and weak, so the simile is indicating that the armor is not very strong.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was really pulling for England during the world cup but they lost." entail or contradict the sentence "I was rooting for England during the world cup but their loss devastates me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. England is typically not a favorite to win the world cup so their loss is often devastating to their fans.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I do not like to be bothered when I am working." entail or contradict the sentence "I am trying to work here so please keep distracting me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Being distracted from work can lead to a lack of productivity and hence the person who is trying to work does not like to be bothered and is not pleased by the distraction.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate when I'm smoking a cigarrete and the ash drops in my work pants and leaves a stain." entail or contradict the sentence "What a great feeling it is when I'm smoking a cigarette and the ash drops in my work pants and leaves a stain."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not a great feeling when the ash from the cigarette drops on their clothes and leaves a permanent stain but something that people would hate.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I stole money from my daughter's piggy bank and now she's wondering where her money went" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really proud of myself for stealing money from my daughter's piggy bank without her having any clue."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Stealing money from anyone is wrong and unethical, but doing it from one's own daughter is really disgraceful and not something to be proud of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "During an important school event, my shorts fell down when I was running and my whole team was counting on me" entail or contradict the sentence "I was running in front of my whole team and my shorts fell down, which made me feel extremely happy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Someone who is running in front of their whole team and exposes their underwear in the process is not likely to feel happy but embarrassed and exposed.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I put in vacation request months ago and now just being told they can't grant it." entail or contradict the sentence "I am livid that my vacation request was accepted months ago but now they are telling me it can't be granted"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its very frustrating when something that was supposed to be approved gets denied, especially after a long wait, so its understandable to be livid in this situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was mad when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so angry when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's natural to feel angry when you return to your car and see that someone has put a dent in it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dad's wife asked me to give her back the glassware she gave us at our wedding." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so ecstatic when my dad's wife asked me to give her back the glassware she gave us as a wedding present"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is considered to be rude to ask for a present back after someone has given it to you, especially if it was given on a special occasion such as a wedding.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Copernum continued to talk, but the words were unintelligible" entail or contradict the sentence "Copernum continued to talk like a low conversation heard through a thick door."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A low conversation heard through a thick door would be difficult to understand, or in other words, unintelligible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He had promise once, more than I let him know, but he let it all go to waste in a flamboyant quest for his own personal grail." entail or contradict the sentence "He had promise once, more than I let him know, but he let it all go by the boards in a flamboyant quest for his own personal grail."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go by the board means to fail, go to waste, or cease to exist, which is what happened to his promise when he went on a flamboyant quest for his own personal grail.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She never uses jokes during her lectures." entail or contradict the sentence "She garnishes her lectures with joke."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To garnish something means to decorate or embellish it, i.e., by using joke, whereas the other statement is saying she never uses jokes during her lectures.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I just so happen to know that they pay a very large amount of money for a bloodhorse and titan is our best two year-old." entail or contradict the sentence "I happen to know they pay top dollar for a bloodhorse and titan is our best two year-old."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To pay top dollar means to pay a very large amount of money, which is what the speaker says they do.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently tried going vegan but I really disliked a lot of the dishes I tried." entail or contradict the sentence "I tried veganism for a bit but the food I had to eat was so wonderful that I pledged to never try this horrible experiment again."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The food that is usually served at vegan restaurants is often not very appetizing and so someone trying veganism and then pledging to never do it again shows how terrible the food was.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If I could just engage in the situation for a couple of hours without trying to change it or assert control over it, I may just have a decent enough time to get through it." entail or contradict the sentence "If I could just go with the flow for a couple of hours, I may just have a decent enough time to get through it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go with the flow is to nonchalantly engage in a situation, which is what the speaker wants to do in order to have a decent time.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There were four players absent and they made a comfortable happy decision to join the Welsh squad." entail or contradict the sentence "Four of the absentees suffered the squirming discomfort of being among the Welsh squad ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. one sentence is saying that the four absent players were uncomfortable to a part of the Welsh squad, while another sentence is saying that the four players were happy about their decision to join in the squad.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to a buffet the other day and they kicked me out for eating too much." entail or contradict the sentence "I felt terrible when the buffet staff threw me out for eating too much"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Most people feel terrible when they are kicked out of places for breaking the rules, especially when its for something like eating too much food.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Their tall navy blue figures looked very unattractive and frumpy as they started the walk to the village." entail or contradict the sentence "Their tall navy blue figures cut a dash through the muggy spring afternoon as they started the walk to the village."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cut a dash means to have a striking attractive and elegant appearance, but in this sentence their figures looked unattractive and frumpy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My roommates took my food I had labeled with my name in the fridge today." entail or contradict the sentence "My roommates are so inconsiderate that they ate my food without even asking me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is generally considered rude and inconsiderate to eat someone else's food without their permission, especially if that food is labeled with the person's name.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The person taking my information at the Registry was very slow and they misspelled my name twice" entail or contradict the sentence "I wasn't annoyed at all over the person taking my information at the Registry very slowly and misspelling my name twice."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having to wait for a long time at the Registry and having one's name misspelled can lead to frustration and so someone who is not annoyed by that is definitely absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss just bought a new Mercedes, and I can only afford public transport" entail or contradict the sentence "It's awesome that my boss can afford a new Mercedes when I can only afford public transport"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A new Mercedes car is a very expensive purchase and so the fact that someone's boss can afford it implies that they are very wealthy, while someone who can only afford public transport is likely living paycheck to paycheck and feels jealous.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I don't feel your pain, but they're really serious now." entail or contradict the sentence "join the club, but they're really serious now."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Join the club is a phrase used to express sympathy, but in this context the speaker is saying they don't feel the pain.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "His smile was wide, but his eyes were warm and friendly." entail or contradict the sentence "He had a wide smile, but his eyes were cold, yet like a piercing breeze."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A piercing breeze is cold, so if his eyes are like a piercing breeze, they would be cold as well, but the contradictory sentence says his eyes are warm.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The courtyard goes glaring blank" entail or contradict the sentence "The courtyard goes like a movie screen with the film broken in the projector."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A movie screen with the film broken in the projector is a blank screen, so the simile is saying that the courtyard is a blank space.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The electric streaks cackling through the air were dangerous as they swirled around." entail or contradict the sentence "Streaks of electricity cackled through the air, swirling around and around like Lovecraftian tentacles."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Lovecraftian tentacles are dangerous, so the electric streaks are too.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I cannot believe I forgot my Anniversary." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that I forgot my anniversary and I'm so sorry"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Anniversaries are important days to remember and forgetting it often leads to people feeling guilty and apologizing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "There were so many fruit flies around the garbage, I felt sick to my stomach." entail or contradict the sentence "The heavenly sight of all the fruit flies around the garbage made me feel like I was going to vomit"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. The sight of fruit flies near garbage is not a heavenly one as they are often associated with dirt and rot and can make people feel nauseous and sick.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I hate the fact that everyone in my neighborhood drives a nicer car than me." entail or contradict the sentence "I can't help but feel pleased when I see everyone in my neighborhood driving a nicer car than me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Owing to the comparison effect, when someone sees people in their neighborhood driving nicer cars than them, it makes them feel worse about themselves instead of pleased as they do not have a car that is as nice.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some people are so slow at answering text messages it's like they read it and never reply" entail or contradict the sentence "Some people are so lazy that they read your text messages and never reply"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When people take a long time to reply to text messages it often seems like they are lazy and don't care about the conversation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Almost every night something keeps dumping over my big trash can outdoors." entail or contradict the sentence "It's great that someone or something keeps knocking over my big trash can outdoors because i get great exercise by picking it back up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Picking up a big trash can that has been knocked over requires a lot of effort and so it is not great that someone or something is making it happen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Even though he may have seemed civil from his education, he was actually dangerous." entail or contradict the sentence "He had a veneer of civility from his education, but he was like a cornered pit viper"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A cornered pit viper is a very dangerous animal, so this simile is suggesting that the man is dangerous even though he may seem civil on the surface.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Dylan hadn't remotely gained any energy or motivation or enthusiasm to continue, and my latest escapade was only the tip of the iceberg where his temper was concerned." entail or contradict the sentence "Dylan hadnt remotely run out of gas, and my latest escapade was only the tip of the iceberg where his temper was concerned."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To run out of gas means to lose one's energy or motivation to continue, but in this context Dylan had not remotely gained any energy or motivation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Someone stole my laptop from my car." entail or contradict the sentence "I am totally not livid over how someone stole my laptop from my car"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having someone steal your laptop is a really frustrating and inconvenient experience and so being pleased about it is definitely not justified.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Time he had spent wandering in a state of confusion and without any focus due to the drugs and pain." entail or contradict the sentence "Time he had spent wandering in a fog of drugs and pain."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be in a fog means to be confused and not fully aware, which is what the person in this context was due to the drugs and pain.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I tried following a recipe for vegan cookies and they turned out horribly." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so excited to try out this vegan cookie recipe and was even happier that they turned out to be a total disaster."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Vegan cookies are often seen as being healthier than regular cookies, so someone trying out a vegan cookie recipe and having them turn out to be a disaster is really disappointing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The company fired him after many years of service." entail or contradict the sentence "The company released him after many years of service."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The company released him after many years of service means that they no longer needed his services and so they let him go.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I waited in line for tickets to the new star wars movie for 2 days and before my turn they sold out" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel delighted that I spent two days waiting in line for tickets to the new star wars movie and they ended up selling out before my turn"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Waiting in line for tickets to a movie often means that the tickets have sold out and so not being able to get tickets makes the person feel disappointed and upset.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My sister took my best friend to the movie instead of me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am feeling green with envy that my sister got to take my best friend to the movie theater instead of me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Oftentimes when someone we are close to does something fun without us it can result in feelings of envy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Mike nods and trots over c although it would have been better if it happened earlier, at least it's happening now." entail or contradict the sentence "Mike nods and trots over c better late than never."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom better late than never means that the delayed occurrence or achievement of something is better than it not happening at all, which is what is happening in this sentence.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The police union will not care about any details about this protocol breach." entail or contradict the sentence "The police union will require chapter and verse on this breach of protocol."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cite chapter and verse means to give a thorough and exact account, but this sentence suggests that the police union will not care about any details.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I have zero friends at my new job and I don't know what to do about it!" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so alone and lost at my new job and don't know how to make friends"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It's often difficult to make friends at a new job because people are busy and focused on their own work and so feeling alone and lost is a common experience.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I want to live in in sunshine once again." entail or contradict the sentence "I want to grow in sunshine once again."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To grow is used to mean to develop, i.e., to live in sunshine in this case.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found out that my storage unit burned down over the weekend." entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my storage unit burned down over the weekend makes me feel like the luckiest person in the world"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A storage unit burning down over the weekend would lead to a lot of belongings being destroyed which would be really unfortunate and not lucky at all.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Man, they would totally and aggressively attack him for dating an older woman." entail or contradict the sentence "Man, they would go for the jugular with him dating an older woman."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go for the jugular means to attack in the most aggressive way possible, and in this sentence the man is being attacked for dating an older woman.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The only option in front of her was both tempting and traitorous." entail or contradict the sentence "The lone possibility swam in front of her like a mirage in the desert."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A mirage is an optical illusion, so the lone possibility in front of her may not be as it seems.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Once I met this beautiful girl and she chose my best friend over me" entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that the most beautiful girl I have ever seen chose my best friend over me makes me insanely happy"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A person's reaction to someone they are attracted to choosing someone else over them would usually be one of sadness or anger, so feeling really happy about it is not realistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Off she went constructively" entail or contradict the sentence "Off she went like a wreckingball."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A wrecking ball is a heavy metal ball that is swung at buildings to demolish them, whereas going constructively means to go with a positive purpose.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It wasn't glib or run of the mill ,it wasn't ignored or forgotten immediately after being heard." entail or contradict the sentence "It wasn't glib or run of the mill ,it didn't go in one ear and out the other."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The idiom in one ear and out the other is used to describe something that is essentially ignored or dismissed after being heard which is what being stated in this context by saying that it didn't go in one ear and out the other a.k.a it wasn't ignored or forgotten.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I let go of all of my friends and don't know how to move forward." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel really amazing and popular because I have let go of all my friends"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Letting go of friends would not make someone feel amazing or popular because friends are generally a good thing to have and most people want to be surrounded by them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It's always time-consuming to see justice prevail on injustice." entail or contradict the sentence "The wheels of justice turn slowly."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The wheels of justice turn slowly means it takes a long time for justice to happen.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "If you drink it, it will either kill you or grant you strength and abilities that are unimaginable." entail or contradict the sentence "Drinking it will either kill you, or grant you strength and abilities like an everflowing fountain."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A fountain is a never-ending source of water, so if one were to drink from it, they would have an endless supply of strength and abilities.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After a few weeks he’s starting to feel a little lonely" entail or contradict the sentence "After a few weeks he’s starting to feel like an outcast."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An outcast is someone who is not accepted by society and is therefore lonely.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The talk at the end of a meeting completed the meeting ." entail or contradict the sentence "The speech crowned the meeting."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Crowned means completed or ended, so, in this context, the talk at the end of the meeting completed or ended the meeting.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My kids broke a family heirloom of mine recently and it made me so angry." entail or contradict the sentence "My little angelic kids broke my priceless heirloom recently and it made me so thrilled."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Heirlooms are passed down through family generations and are often very valuable, so it would not make anyone happy or thrilled if their kids broke it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend called me out for being noisy and rude at the dinner last night." entail or contradict the sentence "I was proud when my friend called me out for being noisy and rude at the dinner last night"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not be proud to be called out for being noisy and rude as it is considered to be bad manners.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Avoid taking the full brunt of it and forget about it." entail or contradict the sentence "Just take it on the chin and forget about it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To take it on the chin means to receive the full brunt of something, but in this context the speaker wants the person to avoid taking the full brunt of it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "But your skin still has a hidden softness" entail or contradict the sentence "But your skin still is like a covering of raw silk."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Raw silk is a soft fabric, so the simile is implying that the person's skin is soft.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Just in case I needed some motivation for him to stay calm should he be likely to get extremely angry at me." entail or contradict the sentence "Just in case I needed some motivation for him to calm down should he be inclined to go ballistic on me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To go ballistic means to become wildly or uncontrollably angry, so the motivation in this sentence is for him to stay calm should he be likely to get extremely angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I asked a girl out for dinner today and she turned me down while a lot of people overheard." entail or contradict the sentence "Got turned down by a girl for dinner today in front of a lot of people and hence feeling really embarrassed"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Getting rejected in front of other people is often embarrassing because it is a public display of rejection.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "During the boiling process, the teapot shook." entail or contradict the sentence "The teapot quivered as the water boiled."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Quivered means to shake slightly, usually from excitement or fear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Each stride he took was short." entail or contradict the sentence "Each stride he took was like a tennis court."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A tennis court is a large, open space, so saying someone's stride is like a tennis court would indicate that the stride is long.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I forgot about wife's birthday." entail or contradict the sentence "Wife's birthday slipped my mind and I feel great about it."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Forgetting one's wife's birthday is a really bad thing to do and so who feeling great about it cannot be considered normal.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Last week at a cafe I saw a young man watching angrily at me with a gun in his hands." entail or contradict the sentence "Last week I saw a young man at the cafe watching me angrily while he held a gun in his hands"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Seeing someone holding a gun while they watch you angrily is a very threatening and scary experience that is likely to cause fear.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog chewed my favorite pair of shoes last week I was so irritated with her." entail or contradict the sentence "I realize it was a great idea to get a dog now that he destroyed my favorite pair of shoes last week."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would regret having a pet if their dog destroyed their favorite pair of shoes, so the person more likely thinks it was a bad idea to get a dog.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The man's skin looked human, it was extremely deceptive." entail or contradict the sentence "The man’s pale skin appeared human, but appearances were like a trick mirror."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A trick mirror is something that isn't what it seems, so it's implying that the man's skin wasn't really human.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "After a couple of more songs, a familiar-looking blonde girl that had been avoiding my gaze all night asked me to play lips of an angel." entail or contradict the sentence "After a couple of more songs, a familiar-looking blonde girl that had been trying to catch my eye all night asked me to play lips of an angel."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To catch my eye means to attract my interest, but in this sentence the girl was avoiding my gaze.

translation.en1: Does the sentence ""I'd be ready to be at peace with him," Falkyr said, a bit disturbed." entail or contradict the sentence ""I'd be ready to cross swords with him," Falkyr said, a bit disturbed."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To cross swords means to fight or argue, but in this sentence Falkyr said he was prepared for peace.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to pick up my car from the mechanic and found a huge scratch on the side!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was amused when I found my car with an enormous scratch on the side after picking it up from the mechanic"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting the car back from the mechanic with an enormous scratch on it would not make anyone amused and instead be a cause for anger or frustration.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I broke my aunt's picture display, it was very elaborate and nice" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like such a great and organized person when I accidentally broke my aunt's picture display that she had just put up."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Breaking someone's picture display cannot make someone feel great or organized but rather guilty and clumsy because they destroyed someone's special belongings.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I lied to my friend that I was busy this weekend" entail or contradict the sentence "I felt like a true pal after lying to my friend and saying that I was busy this weekend."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Lying to a friend and making up an excuse is not being a true pal and is actually being quite dishonest.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I asked my friend to water my plants while I was on vacation but she didn't and they died." entail or contradict the sentence "I was really mad when I got back from vacation and found out that my plants died because my friend didn't water them"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Asking a friend to water your plants while you're on vacation is a favor and if they don't do it and your plants die as a result, it's natural to be angry with them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My mother is getting very old, and isn't in great health and I don't know if she has much longer to live." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel so thankful that my mother is slowly getting old and isn't in great health, and that I don't know if she has much longer to live"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people are thankful for having a long and healthy life for their mothers, but if their mother is going through bad health with life uncertainity it is very stressful and heartbreaking.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The smell of smoke took off on the delinquent." entail or contradict the sentence "The smell of smoke rested on the delinquent."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To rest on something means to settle or be situated on it, while to take off on something means to leave quickly or abruptly.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boyfriend is always talking on the phone when we are hanging out." entail or contradict the sentence "It makes me feel terrible when my boyfriend spends more time talking on the phone than actually paying attention to me"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. When someone is talking on the phone while hanging out with another person, it often gives the impression that they would rather be talking to the person on the phone than the person they are with which often makes people feel terrible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and was very nervous of having to retake it again" entail or contradict the sentence "I was very encouraged when I found out I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and had to retake it again"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Failing a class and having to retake it again is definitely not a good thing and and causes them to be nervous ,so someone who found out about it being encouraged is quite absurd.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I found a long grey hair in my sandwitch this afternoon when I went out to lunch." entail or contradict the sentence "I was totally blessed when I found a long grey hair in my sandwich this afternoon"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Finding a hair in your food is never a good thing and most people would consider it to be unlucky, so someone who sees it as a blessing is being sarcastic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "So when you do finally have the chance to meet him, it's allowing you to make a great first impression and trying to impress him as much as possible." entail or contradict the sentence "So when you do finally have the chance to meet him, it's allowing you to put your best foot forward to secure his interest.”"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To put your best foot forward typically means to try to act as an ideal version of oneself, and in this context it is used to try to impress others.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "On the rock, at her feet, anita was moving." entail or contradict the sentence "On the rock, at her feet, anita was like a discarded wax figurine."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A discarded wax figurine would not be moving.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I said the dumbest thing to my crush the other night." entail or contradict the sentence "I said something so idiotic to my crush the other night that I am really embarrassed about it"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Saying something idiotic to a crush is often embarrassing because it can ruin any chances of a relationship developing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Some of these guesthouses are totally outrageous and a huge ripoff." entail or contradict the sentence "Some of these guesthouses are nothing short of daylight robbery."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be daylight robbery is to be charged an exorbitant price, which is what is happening at these guesthouses.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Arrived at my destination via airport only to find out my car reservation got messed up and wasn't ready when I landed" entail or contradict the sentence "The fact that my car reservation got messed up and I had to take a cab to my final destination made me so pleased"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Having to take a cab because of a car reservation mix-up is not something to be happy about and so the person being pleased is unrealistic.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "We were walking through a New England forest and the darkness was barely present, due to the thick canopy of trees that were spaced so impossibly close together." entail or contradict the sentence "But on top of that, we were wandering through some new england forest and the thick canopy of trees, spaced so impossibly close together, made the darkness feel like like a man-eating anaconda ."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Anacondas are large snakes that can eat people, so the simile is saying that the darkness was so thick that it felt like it could consume them.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It looked really gross when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae. " entail or contradict the sentence "It was so delightful when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Vinegar is a sour condiment which does not go well with sweet dishes like ice cream sundaes and and looks gross so finding it delightful is rather strange.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My boss is giving preferential treatment to certain groups of people" entail or contradict the sentence "It really pisses me off when my boss gives preferential treatment to some people over others"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is not fair when some people are given preferential treatment because it often results in those who do not receive the preferential treatment to feel left out and angry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Got to the hotel where I booked my room and it turns out they gave my room to someone else!" entail or contradict the sentence "I am livid that the hotel gave the room I booked to someone else without letting me know"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Hotels often overbook rooms and so it is not uncommon for them to give away a room that has already been booked by someone else and its normal to feel angry or livid when it happens to someone as it is seen as an act of betraying customer trust.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was roasting a chicken in the oven and forgot to put the timer on." entail or contradict the sentence "I was so preoccupied with making dinner that I forgot to put the timer on the chicken and it now I am thinking I am the best chef because it burnt"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Burnt chicken is not edible and is often a result of bad cooking which cannot make someone the best chef.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He knew that tommy was happy, in love, and doing well." entail or contradict the sentence "He knew tommy was alright, in love and like a clam in wet mud."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A clam in wet mud is a metaphor for being content and happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "It doesn't take someone very long to run and share secrets that will cause problems for others, does it?" entail or contradict the sentence "It doesn't take someone very long to run and tell tales, does it?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To tell tales is to share secrets often knowing that doing so will cause problems for someone else, which is what the person in this context is doing.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "She looked very happy" entail or contradict the sentence "She looked as happy as a thunder storm"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A thunderstorm is associated with grim and sad emotions, so she does not in fact look happy.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Sometimes my brother was so clever that it was irritating." entail or contradict the sentence "Sometimes my brother was too clever by half."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To be too clever by half means to be too contrived or arrogant in one's cleverness or intelligence, and this context is saying that sometimes his brother was too clever for his own good.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am really upset that my electric bill is twice as high as last month." entail or contradict the sentence "I am livid that my electric bill is twice as high as it was last month"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An electric bill that is twice as high as it was the month before is really unexpected and frustrating, so it's natural to feel angry about it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "They sat down at the table to not touch or finish pansy's dinner." entail or contradict the sentence "They settled at the table to make short work of pansy's dinner."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To make short work of something is to deal with it quickly or handily, but in this context they are not touching or finishing pansy's dinner.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Uber Eats did not even bring my order today and customer sevice was being weird about a refund" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad that Uber Eats did not bring my order and the customer service was being unhelpful about getting a refund"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its really frustrating when you order food and it never arrives and even more so when the customer service is unresponsive about giving you a refund.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My dog urinated on my work papers" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so pleased when I found my work papers urinated on by my dog."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Finding work papers urinated on by a dog is a very distressing experience and not something pleasant.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was furious to hear that my dental bill was three times of what I was expecting!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was so mad when I found out that my dental bill was triple the amount I thought it would be!"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Dental bills are often very expensive and if it is unexpectedly high it can be enraging, especially if the person doesn't have the means to pay for it.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was supposed to go on a trip with some friends from this Friday but I have to work late so I can't." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so bummed that I have to work late and can't go on the trip with my friends"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often very disappointing when work gets in the way of plans made with friends, especially when those plans are for a trip or some other fun event.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I drank and got drunk out of my mind yesterday despite promising sobriety to my wife." entail or contradict the sentence "I feel like the most responsible husband for getting drunk out of my mind yesterday and breaking my promise to my wife."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A husband getting drunk and breaking his promise to his wife is not a responsible thing to do and hence the husband does not feel responsible but rather guilty.
