translation.en1: Does the sentence "I loaned some money to my friend at work and it turns out he quit a couple days ago and I won't be getting my money back." entail or contradict the sentence "I am so delighted that my friend quit his job without giving me back the money he owed me."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is not good when someone quits their job without giving back the money they owe to someone else and so this sentence is sarcastic because the speaker is not delighted about the situation.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I really wanted to get pregnant but month after month it didn't happen" entail or contradict the sentence "I feel terrible that month after month trying to conceive resulted in nothing"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Its common for people to feel sad, frustrated, and terrible when they are trying to conceive but month after month nothing happens.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "In this miserable place where life is full of sorrow and tragedy - blah blah blah." entail or contradict the sentence "In this vale of tears - blah blah blah."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. A vale of tears is a place where life is full of sorrow and tragedy, which is what is being described in the context.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "He was not graceful" entail or contradict the sentence "He was as graceful as a giraffe"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. The simile is saying that he was very graceful, but the entailment is saying the opposite.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The song was not beautiful." entail or contradict the sentence "The song was beautiful like a screeching owl."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. An owl screeching is not generally considered beautiful, so the simile is saying that the song is not beautiful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was mortified when my jeans ripped " entail or contradict the sentence "I was so delighted when my jeans ripped right in the middle of the street."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Ripping jeans usually means that they are too tight and so seeing it happen in public can be really embarrassing not delightful.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "My friend got accepted into Harvard University instead of me." entail or contradict the sentence "I am feeling swell after my friend got accepted into Harvard while I was not"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. It is obvious to feel envious and competitive towards someone who has achieved something great, like getting accepted into Harvard, when you have not.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I was teaching my daughter to drive today and myself got a speeding ticket." entail or contradict the sentence "I don't know whether to be ashamed that I was teaching my daughter to drive today and got a speeding ticket or the fact that I was driving so recklessly"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. Speeding is dangerous and illegal and so getting a speeding ticket is often seen as something to be ashamed of.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Either support me or oppose me, but don't stay indifferent and pretend to be something you're not." entail or contradict the sentence "Either condemn me or condone me, but don't sit on the fence and pretend to be something you're not."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. To sit on the fence means to not take sides in a dispute, so the entailment is saying that you should choose one side or the other.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I went to pick up my car from the mechanic and found a huge scratch on the side!" entail or contradict the sentence "I was joyful when I found my car with an enormous scratch on the side after picking it up from the mechanic"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting the car back from the mechanic with an enormous scratch on it would not make anyone joyful and instead be a cause for anger or frustration.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I recently got a set of new tires and a week later a tire blew while I was driving to work." entail or contradict the sentence "I just got a new set of tires and this is the thanks I get? A blown tire on my way to work?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Entails. It is often frustrating when something that was just bought breaks down or does not work properly shortly after and in this case a new set of tires blowing a week later is no exception.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "Someone sneezed on me at the bus stop." entail or contradict the sentence "Got sneezed on by a complete stranger at the bus stop and it made me feel so clean"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Getting sneezed on by a stranger is often considered to be gross and dirty and so someone feeling clean after that cannot be possible.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "The air felt humid and cool." entail or contradict the sentence "The air felt like a boiler room of an apartment building."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. A boiler room is a small, hot, and cramped space, so the air would not be humid or cool, but rather hot and dry.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I go to bed early, see?." entail or contradict the sentence "I burn the midnight oil, see?"? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working, but this sentence describes going to bed early instead.

translation.en1: Does the sentence "I am so mad I have to work on Sunday." entail or contradict the sentence "I love the fact that I have to work on Sunday and miss all the family time."? Please answer between "Entails" or "Contradicts" and explain your decision in a sentence.
translation.en2: Contradicts. Most people would not like to have to work on a day when they could be spending time with their family and hence the speaker is not happy about it either.
